Definition: A is the first letter of the English alphabet.
Example: A waiter entered with a tray.

Definition:
If you abandon a place, thing, or person, you leave the place, thing, or person permanently or for
a long time, especially when you should not do so.
Example: He claimed that his parents had abandoned him.

Definition: Your ability to do something is the fact that you can do it.
Example: The public never had faith in his ability to handle the job.

Definition: Someone who is able is very clever or very good at doing something.
Example: ...one of the brightest and ablest members of the government.

Definition: If a woman has an abortion, she ends her pregnancy deliberately so that the baby is not born alive.
Example: His girlfriend had an abortion.

Definition: You use about to introduce who or what something relates to or concerns.
Example: She came in for a coffee, and told me about her friend Shona.

Definition: If one thing is above another one, it is directly over it or higher than it.
Example: He lifted his hands above his head.

Definition:
If you go abroad, you go to a foreign country, usually one which is separated from the country where
you live by an ocean or a sea.
Example: I would love to go abroad this year, perhaps to the South of France.

Definition: Someone's absence from a place is the fact that they are not there.
Example: ...a bundle of letters which had arrived for me in my absence.

Definition: Absolute means total and complete.
Example: It's not really suited to absolute beginners.

Definition: Absolutely means totally and completely.
Example: Jill is absolutely right.

Definition: If something absorbs a liquid, gas, or other substance, it soaks it up or takes it in.
Example: Plants absorb carbon dioxide from the air and moisture from the soil.

Definition: Abuse of someone is cruel and violent treatment of them.
Example: ...investigation of alleged child abuse.

Definition: Academic is used to describe things that relate to the work done in schools, colleges, and universities, especially work which involves studying and reasoning rather than practical or technical skills.
Example: Their academic standards are high.

Definition: If you accept something that you have been offered, you say yes to it or agree to take it.
Example: Eventually Sam persuaded her to accept an offer of marriage.

Definition: If you have access to a building or other place, you are able or allowed to go into it.
Example: The facilities have been adapted to give access to wheelchair users.

Definition: An accident happens when a vehicle hits a person, an object, or another vehicle, causing injury or damage.
Example: She was involved in a serious car accident last week.

Definition: If you accompany someone, you go somewhere with them.
Example: Ken agreed to accompany me on a trip to Africa.

Definition: If you accomplish something, you succeed in doing it.
Example: If we'd all work together, I think we could accomplish our goal.

Definition: in proportion; in relation
Example: Moira Xaviera Pollock was thirty-two years old, a Pisces with Cancer rising and a Sagittarius moon, according to Jett.

Definition:
If you have an account with a bank or a similar organization, you have an arrangement to leave your money
there and take some out when you need it.
Example: Some banks make it difficult to open an account.

Definition: Accurate information, measurements, and statistics are correct to a very detailed level. An accurate instrument is able to give you information of this kind.
Example:
Police have stressed that this is the most accurate description of the killer to
date.

Definition: If you accuse someone of doing something wrong or dishonest, you say or tell them that you believe that they did it.
Example: He was accusing my mum of having an affair with another man.

Definition: If you achieve a particular aim or effect, you succeed in doing it or causing it to happen, usually after a lot of effort.
Example: There are many who will work hard to achieve these goals.

Definition: An achievement is something which someone has succeeded in doing, especially after a lot of effort.
Example: Reaching this agreement so quickly was a great achievement.

Definition: An acid is a chemical substance, usually a liquid, which contains hydrogen and can react with other substances to form salts. Some acids burn or dissolve other substances that they come into contact with.
Example: ...citric acid.

Definition: If you acknowledge a fact or a situation, you accept or admit that it is true or that it exists.
Example: We have to acknowledge that something is wrong with the system.

Definition: If you acquire something, you buy or obtain it for yourself, or someone gives it to you.
Example: He yesterday revealed he had acquired a 2.98 per cent stake in the company.

Definition: If someone or something goes across a place or a boundary, they go from one side of it to the other.
Example: She walked across the floor and lay down on the bed.

Definition: When you act, you do something for a particular purpose.
Example: The deaths occurred when police acted to stop widespread looting and vandalism.

Definition: Action is doing something for a particular purpose.
Example: The government is taking emergency action to deal with a housing crisis.

Definition: Someone who is active moves around a lot or does a lot of things.
Example: Having an active youngster about the house can be quite wearing.

Definition: An activist is a person who works to bring about political or social changes by campaigning in public or working for an organization.
Example: 55 Arctic foxes were released from a fur farm by animal rights activists.

Definition: Activity is a situation in which a lot of things are happening or being done.
Example: ...an extraordinary level of activity in the government bonds market.

Definition: An actor is someone whose job is acting in plays or films. 'Actor' in the singular usually refers to a man, but some women who act prefer to be called 'actors' rather than ' actresses'.
Example: His father was an actor in the Cantonese Opera Company.

Definition: An actress is a woman whose job is acting in plays or films. Some women who act prefer to be called ' actors' rather than 'actresses'.
Example: She's a very great dramatic actress.

Definition: You use actual to emphasize that you are referring to something real or genuine.
Example: The segments are filmed using either local actors or the actual people involved.

Definition: You use actually to indicate that a situation exists or happened, or to emphasize that it is true.
Example: One afternoon, I grew bored and actually fell asleep for a few minutes.

Definition: An ad is an advertisement.
Example: She replied to a lonely hearts ad.

Definition: If you adapt to a new situation or adapt yourself to it, you change your ideas or behaviour in order to deal with it successfully.
Example: The world will be different, and we will have to be prepared to adapt to the change.

Definition: If you add one thing to another, you put it in or on the other thing, to increase, complete, or improve it.
Example: Add the grated cheese to the sauce.

Definition: An addition to something is a thing which is added to it.
Example:
Most would agree that this particular use of technology is a worthy addition to
the game.

Definition: Additional things are extra things apart from the ones already present.
Example: The U.S. is sending additional troops to the region.

Definition: Your address is the number of the house, flat, or apartment and the name of the street and the town where you live or work.
Example: The address is 2025 M Street, Northwest, Washington, DC, 20036.

Definition: If something is adequate, there is enough of it or it is good enough to be used or accepted.
Example: One in four people worldwide are without adequate homes.

Definition: When you adjust to a new situation, you get used to it by changing your behaviour or your ideas.
Example: We have been preparing our fighters to adjust themselves to civil society.

Definition: An adjustment is a small change that is made to something such as a machine or a way of doing something.
Example: Compensation could be made by adjustments to taxation.

Definition: Administration is the range of activities connected with organizing and supervising the way that an organization or institution functions.
Example: Too much time is spent on administration.

Definition: An administrator is a person whose job involves helping to organize and supervise the way that an organization or institution functions.
Example: The school administrator would often scoff four bags of crisps driving home from work.

Definition: If you admire someone or something, you like and respect them very much.
Example: I admired her when I first met her and I still think she's marvellous.

Definition: Admission is permission given to a person to enter a place, or permission given to a country to enter an organization. Admission is also the act of entering a place.
Example: Students apply for admission to a particular college.

Definition: If you admit that something bad, unpleasant, or embarrassing is true, you agree, often unwillingly, that it is true.
Example: I am willing to admit that I do make mistakes.

Definition: Adolescent is used to describe young people who are no longer children but who have not yet become adults. It also refers to their behaviour.
Example: It is important that an adolescent boy should have an adult in whom he can confide.

Definition: If you adopt a new attitude, plan, or way of behaving, you begin to have it.
Example: Parliament adopted a resolution calling for the complete withdrawal of troops.

Definition:
An adult is a mature, fully developed person. An adult has reached the age when they are legally
responsible for their actions.
Example: Becoming a father signified that he was now an adult.

Definition: To advance means to move forward, often in order to attack someone.
Example: The Allies began advancing on the city in 1943.

Definition: An advanced system, method, or design is modern and has been developed from an earlier version of the same thing.
Example: Without more training or advanced technical skills, they'll lose their jobs.

Definition: An advantage is something that puts you in a better position than other people.
Example:
They are deliberately flouting the law in order to obtain an advantage over their
competitors.

Definition: If someone has an adventure, they become involved in an unusual, exciting, and rather dangerous journey or series of events.
Example: I set off for a new adventure in the United States.

Definition: Advertising is the activity of creating advertisements and making sure people see them.
Example: Advertising agency services are an industrial supply.

Definition: If you give someone advice, you tell them what you think they should do in a particular situation.
Example: Don't be afraid to ask for advice about ordering the meal.

Definition: If you advise someone to do something, you tell them what you think they should do.
Example: The minister advised him to leave as soon as possible.

Definition: An adviser is an expert whose job is to give advice to another person or to a group of people.
Example: In Washington, the President and his advisers spent the day in meetings.

Definition: If you advocate a particular action or plan, you recommend it publicly.
Example: Mr Williams is a conservative who advocates fewer government controls on business.

Definition: If an event or a series of events has been mentioned and you want to talk about it again, you can refer to it as the affair.
Example: The government has mishandled the whole affair.

Definition: If something affects a person or thing, it influences them or causes them to change in some way.
Example: Nicotine adversely affects the functioning of the heart and arteries.

Definition: If you cannot afford something, you do not have enough money to pay for it.
Example: My parents can't even afford a new refrigerator.

Definition: If you are afraid of someone or afraid to do something, you are frightened because you think that something very unpleasant is going to happen to you.
Example: She did not seem at all afraid.

Definition: African means belonging or relating to the continent of Africa, or to its countries or people.
Example: ...the African continent.

Definition: African-Americans are Black people living in the United States who are descended from families that originally came from Africa.
Example: Today African-Americans are 12 percent of the population.

Definition: If something happens after a particular date or event, it happens during the period of time that follows that date or event.
Example: After 19 May, strikes were occurring on a daily basis.

Definition: The afternoon is the part of each day which begins at lunchtime and ends at about six o'clock.
Example: He's arriving in the afternoon.

Definition: You use again to indicate that something happens a second time, or after it has already happened before.
Example: He kissed her again.

Definition: If one thing is leaning or pressing against another, it is touching it.
Example: She leaned against him.

Definition: Your age is the number of years that you have lived.
Example: She has a nephew who is just ten years of age.

Definition: An agency is a business which provides a service on behalf of other businesses.
Example: We had to hire maids through an agency.

Definition: You can refer to the political issues which are important at a particular time as an agenda.
Example: Does television set the agenda on foreign policy?

Definition: An agent is a person who looks after someone else's business affairs or does business on their behalf.
Example: You are buying direct, rather than through an agent.

Definition: An aggressive person or animal has a quality of anger and determination that makes them ready to attack other people.
Example: Some children are much more aggressive than others.

Definition: You use ago when you are referring to past time. For example, if something happened one year ago, it is one year since it happened. If it happened a long time ago, it is a long time since it happened.
Example: He was killed a few days ago in a skiing accident.

Definition: If people agree with each other about something, they have the same opinion about it or say that they have the same opinion.
Example: If we agreed all the time it would be a bit boring, wouldn't it?

Definition: An agreement is a formal decision about future action which is made by two or more countries, groups, or people.
Example: It looks as though a compromise agreement has now been reached.

Definition: Agricultural means involving or relating to agriculture.
Example: ...agricultural land.

Definition: Ah is used in writing to represent a noise that people make in conversation, for example to acknowledge or draw attention to something, or to express surprise or disappointment.
Example: I'm meeting Anna Langenbach. Ah, this seems to be the train now.

Definition: Something that is ahead is in front of you. If you look ahead, you look directly in front of you.
Example: Brett looked straight ahead.

Definition: Aid is money, equipment, or services that are provided for people, countries, or organizations who need them but cannot provide them for themselves.
Example: ...convoys delivering humanitarian aid to besieged or isolated communities.

Definition: An aide is an assistant to someone who has an important job, especially in government or in the armed forces.
Example: ...a close aide to the Prime Minister.

Definition: AIDS is a disease which destroys the natural system of protection that the body has against other diseases. AIDS is an abbreviation for 'acquired immune deficiency syndrome'.
If you aim for something or aim to do something, you plan or hope to achieve it.
Example: He is aiming for the 100 metres world record.

Definition: Air is the mixture of gases which forms the Earth's atmosphere and which we breathe.
Example: Draughts help to circulate air.

Definition: An aircraft is a vehicle which can fly, for example an aeroplane or a helicopter.
Example: The return flight of the aircraft was delayed.

Definition: An airline is a company which provides regular services carrying people or goods in aeroplanes.
Example: ...the Dutch national airline KLM.

Definition:
An airport is a place where aircraft land and take off, which has buildings and facilities for
passengers.
Example: Ministers are also considering tougher penalties for flying near airports and prisons.

Definition: An album is a collection of songs that is available for download, or as a CD or record. You can also refer to the CD or record as an album.
Example: Chris likes music and has a large collection of albums.

Definition: Drinks that can make people drunk, such as beer, wine, and whisky, can be referred to as alcohol.
Example: Do either of you smoke cigarettes or drink alcohol?

Definition: If people or animals are alive, they are not dead.
Example: She does not know if he is alive or dead.

Definition: You use all to indicate that you are referring to the whole of a particular group or thing or to everyone or everything of a particular kind.
Example: ...the restaurant that Hugh and all his friends go to.

Definition: An alliance is a group of countries or political parties that are formally united and working together because they have similar aims.
Example: The two parties were still too much apart to form an alliance.

Definition: If someone is allowed to do something, it is all right for them to do it and they will not get into trouble.
Example: The children are not allowed to watch violent TV programmes.

Definition: A country's ally is another country that has an agreement to support it, especially in war.
Example: Washington would not take such a step without its allies' approval.

Definition: You use almost to indicate that something is not completely the case but is nearly the case.
Example: The couple had been dating for almost three years.

Definition: When you are alone, you are not with any other people.
Example: There is nothing so frightening as to be alone in a combat situation.

Definition: If you move or look along something such as a road, you move or look towards one end of it.
Example: Newman walked along the street alone.

Definition: You use already to show that something has happened, or that something had happened before the moment you are referring to. Speakers of British English use already with a verb in a perfect tense, putting it after 'have', 'has', or 'had', or at the end of a clause. Some speakers of American English use already with the simple past tense of the verb instead of a perfect tense.
Example: They had already voted for him at the first ballot.

Definition: You can use also to give more information about a person or thing, or to add another relevant fact.
Example:
It is the work of Ivor Roberts-Jones, who also produced the statue of Churchill in
Parliament Square.

Definition: If something alters or if you alter it, it changes.
Example: Little had altered in the village.

Definition: If one thing is an alternative to another, the first can be found, used, or done instead of the second.
Example: New ways to treat arthritis may provide an alternative to painkillers.

Definition: You use although to introduce a subordinate clause which contains a statement which contrasts with the statement in the main clause.
Example: Although he is known to only a few, his reputation among them is very great.

Definition: If you always do something, you do it whenever a particular situation occurs. If you always did something, you did it whenever a particular situation occurred.
Example: Whenever I get into a relationship, I always fall madly in love.

Definition: Am is the first person singular of the present tense of be1. Am is often shortened to 'm in spoken English. The negative forms are 'I am not' and 'I'm not'. In questions and tags in spoken English, these are usually changed to 'aren't I'.
Example: The program starts at 9 a.m.

Definition: You say that something is amazing when it is very surprising and makes you feel pleasure, approval, or wonder.
Example: It's amazing what we can remember with a little prompting.

Definition: American means belonging or relating to the United States of America, or to its people or culture.
Example: ...the American Ambassador at the United Nations.

Definition: Someone or something that is situated or moving among a group of things or people is surrounded by them.
Example: ...youths in their late teens sitting among adults.

Definition: The amount of something is how much there is, or how much you have, need, or get.
Example: He needs that amount of money to survive.

Definition: Analysis is the process of considering something carefully or using statistical methods in order to understand it or explain it.
Example: Her criteria defy analysis.

Definition: An analyst is a person whose job is to analyse a subject and give opinions about it.
Example: ...a political analyst.

Definition: to separate (a thing, idea, etc.) into its parts so as to find out their nature, proportion, function, interrelationship, etc.
Example: He liked to think he had inherited this quality from her, this ability to analyze a problem.

Definition: Ancient means belonging to the distant past, especially to the period in history before the end of the Roman Empire.
Example: They believed ancient Greece and Rome were vital sources of learning.

Definition: You use and to link two or more words, groups, or clauses.
Example: When he returned, she and Simon had already gone.

Definition: Anger is the strong emotion that you feel when you think that someone has behaved in an unfair, cruel, or unacceptable way.
Example: He cried with anger and frustration.

Definition: An angle is the difference in direction between two lines or surfaces. Angles are measured in degrees.
Example: The boat is now leaning at a 30 degree angle.

Definition: When you are angry, you feel strong dislike or impatience about something.
Example: She had been very angry at the person who stole her new bike.

Definition: An animal is a living creature such as a dog, lion, or rabbit, rather than a bird, fish, insect, or human being.
Example: He was attacked by wild animals.

Definition: An anniversary is a date which is remembered or celebrated because a special event happened on that date in a previous year.
Example: ...the celebrations of the anniversary of Christopher Columbus's discovery of America.

Definition: If you announce something, you tell people about it publicly or officially.
Example: He will announce tonight that he is resigning from office.

Definition: Annual events happen once every year.
Example: ...the annual conference of Britain's trade union movement.

Definition: Another thing or person means an additional thing or person of the same type as one that already exists.
Example: Mrs. Madrigal buttered another piece of toast.

Definition: When you answer someone who has asked you something, you say something back to them.
Example: I knew Ben was lying when he answered me.

Definition: If you anticipate an event, you realize in advance that it may happen and you are prepared for it.
Example: At the time we couldn't have anticipated the result of our campaigning.

Definition: Anxiety is a feeling of nervousness or worry.
Example: Her voice was full of anxiety.

Definition: You use any in statements with negative meaning to indicate that no thing or person of a particular type exists, is present, or is involved in a situation.
Example: I never make any big decisions.

Definition: Anybody means the same as anyone.
Example: no one who was anybody missed the party

Definition: If something does not happen or is not true anymore, it has stopped happening or is no longer true.
Example: I don't ride my motorbike much anymore.

Definition: You use anyone or anybody in statements with negative meaning to indicate in a general way that nobody is present or involved in an action.
Example: I won't tell anyone I saw you here.

Definition: You use anything in statements with negative meaning to indicate in a general way that nothing is present or that an action or event does not or cannot happen.
Example: We can't do anything.

Definition: You use anyway or anyhow to indicate that a statement explains or supports a previous point.
Example:
I'm certain David's told you his business troubles. Anyway, it's no secret that he
owes money.

Definition: You use anywhere in statements with negative meaning to indicate that a place does not exist.
Example: I haven't got anywhere to live.

Definition: When people or things are apart, they are some distance from each other.
Example: He was standing a bit apart from the rest of us, watching us.

Definition: An apartment is a set of rooms for living in, usually on one floor of a large building.
Example: Christina has her own apartment, with her own car.

Definition: An apparent situation, quality, or feeling seems to exist, although you cannot be certain that it does exist.
Example: I was a bit depressed by our apparent lack of progress.

Definition: You use apparently to indicate that the information you are giving is something that you have heard, but you are not certain that it is true.
Example: Oil prices fell this week, apparently because of over-production.

Definition: If you appeal to someone to do something, you make a serious and urgent request to them.
Example: The Prime Minister appealed to young people to use their vote.

Definition: If you say that something appears to be the way you describe it, you are reporting what you believe or what you have been told, though you cannot be sure it is true.
Example:
There appears to be increasing support for the leadership to take a more aggressive
stance.

Definition: When someone makes an appearance at a public event or in a broadcast, they take part in it.
Example: It was the president's second public appearance to date.

Definition: An apple is a round fruit with smooth green, yellow, or red skin and firm white flesh.
Example: I want an apple.

Definition: An application for something such as a job or membership of an organization is a formal written request for it.
Example: His application for membership of the organisation was rejected.

Definition: If you apply for something such as a job or membership of an organization, you write a letter or email, or fill in a form in order to ask formally for it.
Example: I am continuing to apply for jobs.

Definition: If you appoint someone to a job or official position, you formally choose them for it.
Example: It made sense to appoint a banker to this job.

Definition: The appointment of a person to a particular job is the choice of that person to do it.
Example: His appointment to the Cabinet would please the right-wing.

Definition: If you appreciate something, for example a piece of music or good food, you like it because you recognize its good qualities.
Example: Anyone can appreciate our music.

Definition: When you approach something, you get closer to it.
Example: He didn't approach the front door at once.

Definition: Something that is appropriate is suitable or acceptable for a particular situation.
Example: It is appropriate that Irish names dominate the list.

Definition: If you win someone's approval for something that you ask for or suggest, they agree to it.
Example: ...efforts to win congressional approval for an aid package for Moscow.

Definition: If you approve of an action, event, or suggestion, you like it or are pleased about it.
Example: Not everyone approves of the festival.

Definition: close to; around; roughly or in the region of
Example: Number two is twenty-seven meters down, approximately six meters to go.

Definition: Arabs are people who speak Arabic and who come from the Middle East and parts of North Africa.
Example: The Arab world is particularly keen on the use of cardamom with tea.

Definition: An architect is a person who designs buildings.
Example: ...the landscape architect for Hampshire county council.

Definition: An area is a particular part of a town, a country, a region, or the world.
Example: ...the large number of community groups in the area.

Definition: If one person argues with another, they speak angrily to each other about something that they disagree about. You can also say that two people argue.
Example: The committee is concerned about players' behaviour, especially arguing with referees.

Definition: An argument is a statement or set of statements that you use in order to try to convince people that your opinion about something is correct.
Example: There's a strong argument for lowering the price.

Definition: If a situation or problem arises, it begins to exist or people start to become aware of it.
Example: ...if a problem arises later in the pregnancy.

Definition:
Your arms are the two long parts of your body that are attached to your shoulders and that
have your hands at the end.
Example: She stretched her arms out.

Definition: Someone who is armed is carrying a weapon, usually a gun.
Example: City police said the man was armed with a revolver.

Definition: An army is a large organized group of people who are armed and trained to fight on land in a war. Most armies are organized and controlled by governments.
Example: After returning from France, he joined the army.

Definition: To be positioned around a place or object means to surround it or be on all sides of it. To move around a place means to go along its edge, back to your starting point.
Example: She looked at the papers around her.

Definition: If you arrange an event or meeting, you make plans for it to happen.
Example: She arranged an appointment for Friday afternoon at four-fifteen.

Definition: Arrangements are plans and preparations which you make so that something will happen or be possible.
Example: The staff is working frantically on final arrangements for the summit.

Definition: If the police arrest you, they take charge of you and take you to a police station, because they believe you may have committed a crime.
Example: Police arrested five young men in connection with one of the attacks.

Definition: When a person or vehicle arrives at a place, you can refer to their arrival.
Example: ...the day after his arrival in England.

Definition: When a person or vehicle arrives at a place, they come to it at the end of a journey.
Example: Fresh groups of guests arrived.

Definition: Art consists of paintings, sculpture, and other pictures or objects which are created for people to look at and admire or think deeply about.
Example: ...the first exhibition of such art in the West.

Definition: An article is a piece of writing that is published in a newspaper or magazine.
Example: ...a newspaper article.

Definition: An artist is someone who draws or paints pictures or creates sculptures as a job or a hobby.
Example: ...the studio of a great artist.

Definition: Someone who is artistic is good at drawing or painting, or arranging things in a beautiful way.
Example: They encourage boys to be sensitive and artistic.

Definition: If something happens as something else happens, it happens at the same time.
Example: Another police officer has been injured as fighting continued this morning.

Definition: Asian means belonging to or relating to Asia. British people use this term especially to refer to India, Pakistan, and Bangladesh. Americans use this term especially to refer to China, Korea, Thailand, Japan, or Vietnam.
Example: ...Asian music.

Definition: If you move something aside, you move it to one side of you.
Example: Sarah closed the book and laid it aside.

Definition: If you ask someone something, you say something to them in the form of a question because you want to know the answer.
Example: 'How is Frank?' he asked.

Definition: Someone who is asleep is sleeping.
Example: My four-year-old daughter was asleep on the sofa.

Definition: An aspect of something is one of the parts of its character or nature.
Example: Climate and weather affect every aspect of our lives.

Definition: An assault by an army is a strong attack made on an area held by the enemy.
Example: The rebels are poised for a new assault on the government garrisons.

Definition: If someone asserts a fact or belief, they state it firmly.
Example: Mr. Helm plans to assert that the bill violates the First Amendment.

Definition: When you assess a person, thing, or situation, you consider them in order to make a judgment about them.
Example: Our correspondent has been assessing the impact of the sanctions.

Definition: An assessment is a consideration of someone or something and a judgment about them.
Example: There is little assessment of the damage to the natural environment.

Definition: Something or someone that is an asset is considered useful or helps a person or organization to be successful.
Example: He considered that the greatest asset of a bank was its reputation for probity.

Definition: If you assign a piece of work to someone, you give them the work to do.
Example: When I taught, I would assign a topic to children which they would write about.

Definition: An assignment is a task or piece of work that you are given to do, especially as part of your job or studies.
Example: The assessment for the course involves written assignments and practical tests.

Definition: If you assist someone, you help them to do a job or task by doing part of the work for them.
Example: Julia was assisting him to prepare his speech.

Definition: If you give someone assistance, you help them do a job or task by doing part of the work for them.
Example: Since 1976 he has been operating the shop with the assistance of volunteers.

Definition: Assistant is used in front of titles or jobs to indicate a slightly lower rank. For example, an assistant director is one rank lower than a director in an organization.
Example: ...the Assistant Secretary of Defense.

Definition: If you associate someone or something with another thing, the two are connected in your mind.
Example: Through science we've got the idea of associating progress with the future.

Definition: An association is an official group of people who have the same job, aim, or interest.
Example: ...the Association of British Travel Agents.

Definition: If you assume that something is true, you imagine that it is true, sometimes wrongly.
Example: It is a misconception to assume that the two continents are similar.

Definition: If you make an assumption that something is true or will happen, you accept that it is true or will happen, often without any real proof.
Example:
They have taken a wrong turning in their assumption that all men and women think
alike.

Definition: If you assure someone that something is true or will happen, you tell them that it is definitely true or will definitely happen, often in order to make them less worried.
Example: He hastened to assure me that there was nothing traumatic to report.

Definition: You use at to indicate the place or event where something happens or is situated.
Example: We had dinner at a restaurant in Attleborough.

Definition: An athlete is a person who does a sport, especially athletics, or track and field events.
Example: Many top athletes find it hard, if not impossible to find real life again after retiring.

Definition: Athletic means relating to athletes and athletics.
Example: They have been given college scholarships purely on athletic ability.

Definition: A planet's atmosphere is the layer of air or other gases around it.
Example: ...dangerous levels of pollution in the Earth's atmosphere.

Definition: If you attach something to an object, you join it or fasten it to the object.
Example: We attach labels to things before we file them away.

Definition: To attack a person or place means to try to hurt or damage them using physical violence.
Example: Fifty civilians were killed when government planes attacked the town.

Definition: If you attempt to do something, especially something difficult, you try to do it.
Example: The only time that we attempted to do something like that was in the city of Philadelphia.

Definition: If you attend a meeting or other event, you are present at it.
Example: Thousands of people attended the funeral.

Definition: If you give someone or something your attention, you look at it, listen to it, or think about it carefully.
Example: You have my undivided attention.

Definition: Your attitude to something is the way that you think and feel about it, especially when this shows in the way you behave.
Example: ...the general change in attitude towards people with disabilities.

Definition: In the United States, an attorney or attorney at law is a lawyer.
Example: ...a prosecuting attorney.

Definition: If something attracts people or animals, it has features that cause them to come to it.
Example: The Cardiff Bay project is attracting many visitors.

Definition: A person who is attractive is pleasant to look at.
Example: She's a very attractive woman.

Definition: If you attribute something to an event or situation, you think that it was caused by that event or situation.
Example: The striker attributes the team's success to a positive ethos at the club.

Definition: The audience at a play, concert, film, or public meeting is the group of people watching or listening to it.
Example: The entire audience broke into loud applause.

Definition: The author of a piece of writing is the person who wrote it.
Example: She is the joint author of a booklet on Integrated Education.

Definition: The authorities are the people who have the power to make decisions and to make sure that laws are obeyed.
Example: This provided a pretext for the authorities to cancel the elections.

Definition: An auto is a car.
Example: ...the auto industry.

Definition: If something you want or need is available, you can find it or obtain it.
Example: The amount of money available to buy books has fallen by 17%.

Definition:
An average is the result that you get when you add two or more numbers together and divide the total by the number of numbers you added
together.
Example: Take the average of those ratios and multiply by a hundred.

Definition: If you avoid something unpleasant that might happen, you take action in order to prevent it from happening.
Example: The pilots had to take emergency action to avoid a disaster.

Definition: An award is a prize or certificate that a person is given for doing something well.
Example: ...the Booker prize, Britain's top award for fiction.

Definition: If you are aware of something, you know about it.
Example: Smokers are well aware of the dangers to their own health.

Definition: You can use acute to indicate that an undesirable situation or feeling is very severe or intense. [...]

If someone or something moves or is moved away from a place, they move or are moved so that they are no longer there. If you are away from a place, you are not in the place where people expect you to be.
Example: An injured police officer was led away by colleagues.

Definition: If you say that someone or something is awful, you dislike that person or thing or you think that they are not very good.
Example: We met and I thought he was awful.

Definition: A baby is a very young child, especially one that cannot yet walk or talk.
Example: She used to take care of me when I was a baby.

Definition:
If you move back, you move in the opposite direction to the one in which you are facing or in which
you were moving before.
Example: She stepped back from the door expectantly.

Definition: Your background is the kind of family you come from and the kind of education you have had. It can also refer to such things as your social and racial origins, your financial status, or the type of work experience that you have.
Example: She came from a working-class background.

Definition: Something that is bad is unpleasant, harmful, or undesirable.
Example: The bad weather conditions prevented the plane from landing.

Definition: If something is done badly or goes badly, it is not very successful or effective.
Example: I was angry because I played so badly.

Definition: A bag is a container made of thin paper or plastic, for example one that is used in shops to put things in that a customer has bought.
Example: She left the hotel carrying a shopping bag.

Definition: If you bake, you spend some time preparing and mixing together ingredients to make bread, cakes, pies, or other food which is cooked in the oven.
Example: I love to bake.

Definition: If you balance something somewhere, or if it balances there, it remains steady and does not fall.
Example: I balanced on the ledge.

Definition: A ball is a round object that is used in games such as tennis, baseball, football, basketball, and cricket.
Example: ...a golf ball.

Definition: To ban something means to state officially that it must not be done, shown, or used.
Example: It was decided to ban smoking in all offices later this year.

Definition: A band is a small group of musicians who play popular music such as jazz, rock, or pop.
Example: He was a drummer in a rock band.

Definition: A bank is an institution where people or businesses can keep their money.
Example: Which bank offers you the service that best suits your financial needs?

Definition: A bar is a place where you can buy and drink alcoholic drinks.
Example: ...Devil's Herd, the city's most popular country-western bar.

Definition: You use barely to say that something is only just true or only just the case.
Example: Anastasia could barely remember the ride to the hospital.

Definition: A barrel is a large, round container for liquids or food.
Example: The wine is aged for almost a year in oak barrels.

Definition: A barrier is something such as a rule, law, or policy that makes it difficult or impossible for something to happen or be achieved.
Example: Duties and taxes are the most obvious barrier to free trade.

Definition: The base of something is its lowest edge or part.
Example: There was a cycle path running along this side of the wall, right at its base.

Definition: In America, baseball is a game played by two teams of nine players. Each player from one team hits a ball with a bat and then tries to run around three bases and get to the home base before the other team can get the ball back.
Example: The baseball bat seemed to speak to me.

Definition: You use basic to describe things, activities, and principles that are very important or necessary, and on which others depend.
Example: One of the most basic requirements for any form of angling is a sharp hook.

Definition: You use basically for emphasis when you are stating an opinion, or when you are making an important statement about something.
Example: This gun is designed for one purposeit's basically to kill people.

Definition: If something is done on a particular basis, it is done according to that method, system, or principle.
Example: We're going to be meeting there on a regular basis.

Definition: A basket is a stiff container that is used for carrying or storing objects. Baskets are made from thin strips of materials such as straw, plastic, or wire woven together.
Example: ...big wicker picnic baskets filled with sandwiches.

Definition: Basketball is a game in which two teams of five players each try to score goals by throwing a large ball through a circular net fixed to a metal ring at each end of the court.
Example: It was like a basketball game at one stage with people coming on and off.

Definition: A bathroom is a room in a house that contains a bath or shower, a washbasin, and sometimes a toilet.
Example: She had gone in to use the bathroom.

Definition: Batteries are small devices that provide the power for electrical items such as torches and children's toys.
Example: The shavers come complete with batteries.

Definition: A battle is a violent fight between groups of people, especially one between military forces during a war.
Example: ...the victory of King William III at the Battle of the Boyne.

Definition: You use be with a present participle to form the continuous tenses of verbs.
Example: This is happening in every school throughout the country.

Definition: A beach is an area of sand or stones beside the sea.
Example: ...a beautiful sandy beach.

Definition: Beans such as green beans, French beans, or broad beans are the seeds of a climbing plant or the long thin cases which contain those seeds.
Example: ...sausage and beans.

Definition: If you bear something somewhere, you carry it there or take it there.
Example: They bore the oblong hardwood box into the kitchen and put it on the table.

Definition: If you beat someone or something, you hit them very hard.
Example: My sister tried to stop them and they beat her.

Definition: A beautiful person is very attractive to look at.
Example: She was a very beautiful woman.

Definition: Beauty is the state or quality of being beautiful.
Example: ...an area of outstanding natural beauty.

Definition: You use because when stating the reason for something.
Example: He is called Mitch, because his name is Mitchell.

Definition: If someone or something becomes a particular thing, they start to change and develop into that thing, or start to develop the characteristics mentioned.
Example: I first became interested in yoga while I was doing my nursing training.

Definition: A bed is a piece of furniture that you lie on when you sleep.
Example: She went into her bedroom and lay down on the bed.

Definition: A bedroom is a room used for sleeping in.
Example: ...the spare bedroom.

Definition: Beer is a bitter alcoholic drink made from grain.
Example: He sat in the kitchen drinking beer.

Definition: If something happens before a particular date, time, or event, it happens earlier than that date, time, or event.
Example: Annie was born a few weeks before Christmas.

Definition: To begin to do something means to start doing it.
Example: He stood up and began to move around the room.

Definition: The beginning of an event or process is the first part of it.
Example: This was also the beginning of her recording career.

Definition: People's or animals' behavior is the way that they behave. You can refer to a typical and repeated way of behaving as a behavior.
Example: Make sure that good behavior is rewarded.

Definition:
If something is behind a thing or person, it is on the other side of them from you, or nearer their back
rather than their front.
Example: I put one of the cushions behind his head.

Definition: Being is the present participle of be1.
Example: It being a Sunday, the old men had the day off.

Definition: Belief is a feeling of certainty that something exists, is true, or is good.
Example: ... a traditional eastern belief in reincarnation.

Definition: If you believe that something is true, you think that it is true, but you are not sure.
Example: Experts believe that the coming drought will be extensive.

Definition: A bell is a device that makes a ringing sound and is used to give a signal or to attract people's attention.
Example:
I had just enough time to finish eating before the bell rang and I was off to my
first class.

Definition: If something belongs to you, you own it.
Example: The house had belonged to her family for three or four generations.

Definition: If something is below something else, it is in a lower position.
Example: He appeared from the apartment directly below Leonard's.

Definition: A belt is a strip of leather or cloth that you fasten round your waist.
Example: He wore a belt with a large brass buckle.

Definition: A bench is a long seat of wood or metal that two or more people can sit on.
Example: He sat down on a park bench.

Definition: When you bend, you move the top part of your body downwards and forwards. Plants and trees also bend.
Example: I bent over and kissed her cheek.

Definition: Something that is beneath another thing is under the other thing.
Example: She could see the muscles of his shoulders beneath his T-shirt.

Definition: The benefit of something is the help that you get from it or the advantage that results from it.
Example: Each family farms individually and reaps the benefit of its labor.

Definition: Something that is beside something else is at the side of it or next to it.
Example: On the table beside an empty plate was a pile of books.

Definition: Besides something or beside something means in addition to it.
Example: I think she has many good qualities besides being very beautiful.

Definition: Best is the superlative of well2.
Example: He was best known as a writer on mystical subjects.

Definition: If you bet on the result of a horse race, football game, or other event, you give someone a sum of money which they give you back with extra money if the result is what you predicted, or which they keep if it is not.
Example: Jockeys are forbidden to bet on the outcome of races.

Definition: Better is the comparative of good.
Example: I like your interpretation better than the one I was taught.

Definition:
If something is between two things or is in between them, it has one of the things on one side of it and the other thing on the other
side.
Example: She left the table to stand between the two men.

Definition: If something is beyond a place or barrier, it is on the other side of it.
Example: They heard footsteps in the main room, beyond a door.

Definition: The Bible is the holy book on which the Jewish and Christian religions are based.
Example: the Koran is the Muslim Bible

Definition: A big person or thing is large in physical size.
Example: Australia's a big country.

Definition: A bike is a bicycle or a motorcycle.
Example: I biked home from the beach.

Definition: A bill is a written statement of money that you owe for goods or services.
Example: They couldn't afford to pay the bills.

Definition: A billion is a thousand million.
Example: ...3 billion dollars.

Definition:
If something binds people together, it makes them feel as if they are all part of the same group or have something in
common.
Example: It is the memory and threat of persecution that binds them together.

Definition: Biological is used to describe processes and states that occur in the bodies and cells of living things.
Example: The living organisms somehow concentrated the minerals by biological processes.

Definition: A bird is a creature with feathers and wings. Female birds lay eggs. Most birds can fly.
Example: The white part is quite conspicuous when the bird is flying away from you.

Definition: When a baby is born, you refer to this event as his or her birth.
Example: It was the birth of his grandchildren which gave him greatest pleasure.

Definition: Your birthday is the anniversary of the date on which you were born.
Example: He only saw one of her birthdays.

Definition: A bit of something is a small part or section of it.
Example: That's the bit of the meeting that I missed.

Definition:
If you bite something, you use your teeth to cut into it, for example in order to eat it or break
it. If an animal or person bites you, they use their teeth to hurt or injure you.
Example: Both sisters bit their nails as children.

Definition: Something that is black is of the darkest colour that there is, the colour of the sky at night when there is no light at all.
Example: She was wearing a black coat with a white collar.

Definition: The blade of a knife, axe, or saw is the flat sharp part that is used for cutting.
Example: Many of these tools have sharp blades, so be careful.

Definition: If you blame a person or thing for something bad, you believe or say that they are responsible for it or that they caused it.
Example: The commission is expected to blame the army for many of the atrocities.

Definition: A blanket is a large square or rectangular piece of thick cloth, especially one which you put on a bed to keep you warm.
Example: The mud disappeared under a blanket of snow.

Definition: Someone who is blind is unable to see because their eyes are damaged.
Example: I started helping him run the business when he went blind.

Definition: A block of flats or offices is a large building containing them.
Example: ...blocks of council flats.

Definition: Blood is the red liquid that flows inside your body, which you can see if you cut yourself.
Example: There was Greek blood in his veins.

Definition: When a wind or breeze blows, the air moves.
Example: A chill wind blew at the top of the hill.

Definition: Something that is blue is the colour of the sky on a sunny day.
Example: There were swallows in the cloudless blue sky.

Definition:
A board is a flat, thin, rectangular piece of wood or plastic which is used for a particular
purpose.
Example: ...a chopping board.

Definition: A boat is something in which people can travel across water.
Example: One of the best ways to see the area is in a small boat.

Definition: Your body is all your physical parts, including your head, arms, and legs.
Example: The largest solid internal organ in the body is the liver.

Definition: A bomb is a device which explodes and damages or destroys a large area.
Example: Bombs went off at two London train stations.

Definition: a concerted and persistent use of bombs against a target
A bond between people is a strong feeling of friendship, love, or shared beliefs and experiences that unites them.
Example: The experience created a very special bond between us.

Definition: Your bones are the hard parts inside your body which together form your skeleton.
Example: Many passengers suffered broken bones.

Definition:
A book is a number of pieces of paper, usually with words printed on them, which are fastened
together and fixed inside a cover of stronger paper or cardboard. Books contain information, stories, or poetry, for example.
Example: His eighth book came out earlier this year and was an instant bestseller.

Definition:
If there is a boom in the economy, there is an increase in economic activity, for example in the amount of things that
are being bought and sold.
Example: An economic boom followed, especially in housing and construction.

Definition: Boots are shoes that cover your whole foot and the lower part of your leg.
Example: He booted the ball 40 yards back up field.

Definition: The border between two countries or regions is the dividing line between them. Sometimes the border also refers to the land close to this line.
Example: They fled across the border.

Definition: When a baby is born, it comes out of its mother's body at the beginning of its life. In formal English, if you say that someone is born of someone or to someone, you mean that person is their parent.
Example: My mother was 40 when I was born.

Definition:
If you borrow something that belongs to someone else, you take it or use it for a period of time,
usually with their permission.
Example: Can I borrow a pen please?

Definition: Your boss is the person in charge of the organization or department where you work.
Example: He cannot stand his boss.

Definition: You use both when you are referring to two people or things and saying that something is true about each of them.
Example: She cried out in fear and flung both arms up to protect her face.

Definition: If you do not bother to do something or if you do not bother with it, you do not do it, consider it, or use it because you think it is unnecessary or because you are too lazy.
Example: Lots of people don't bother to go through a marriage ceremony these days.

Definition: A bottle is a glass or plastic container in which drinks and other liquids are kept. Bottles are usually round with straight sides and a narrow top.
Example: There were two empty bottles on the table.

Definition: The bottom of something is the lowest or deepest part of it.
Example: He sat at the bottom of the stairs.

Definition: The boundary of an area of land is an imaginary line that separates it from other areas.
Example: ...the Bow Brook which forms the western boundary of the wood.

Definition:
A bowl is a round container with a wide uncovered top. Some kinds of bowl are used, for example, for serving or eating food from, or
in cooking, while other larger kinds are used for washing or cleaning.
Example: Put all the ingredients into a large bowl.

Definition: A box is a square or rectangular container with hard or stiff sides. Boxes often have lids.
Example: He reached into the cardboard box beside him.

Definition: A boy is a child who will grow up to be a man.
Example: I knew him when he was a little boy.

Definition: Someone's boyfriend is a man or boy with whom they are having a romantic or sexual relationship.
Example: ...Brenda and her boyfriend Anthony.

Definition: Your brain is the organ inside your head that controls your body's activities and enables you to think and to feel things such as heat and pain.
Example: Her father died of a brain tumour.

Definition:
The branches of a tree are the parts that grow out from its trunk and have leaves, flowers, or
fruit growing on them.
Example: The local branch of Bank of America is handling the accounts.

Definition: A brand of a product is the version of it that is made by one particular manufacturer.
Example: This is my favourite brand of shampoo.

Definition: Bread is a very common food made from flour, water, and yeast.
Example: ...a loaf of bread.

Definition:
When an object breaks or when you break it, it suddenly separates into two or more pieces, often because it has been hit
or dropped.
Example: He fell through the window, breaking the glass.

Definition: Breakfast is the first meal of the day. It is usually eaten in the early part of the morning.
Example: What's for breakfast?

Definition: A woman's breasts are the two soft, round parts on her chest that can produce milk to feed a baby.
Example: She wears a low-cut dress which reveals her breasts.

Definition: Your breath is the air that you let out through your mouth when you breathe. If someone has  bad breath, their breath smells unpleasant.
Example: I could smell the whisky on his breath.

Definition: When people or animals breathe, they take air into their lungs and let it out again. When they breathe smoke or a particular kind of air, they take it into their lungs and let it out again as they breathe.
Example: He stood there breathing deeply and evenly.

Definition: Bricks are rectangular blocks of baked clay used for building walls, which are usually red or brown. Brick is the material made up of these blocks.
Example: She built bookshelves out of bricks and planks.

Definition:
A bridge is a structure that is built over a railway, river, or road so that people or vehicles
can cross from one side to the other.
Example: He walked back over the railway bridge.

Definition: Something that is brief lasts for only a short time.
Example: She once made a brief appearance on television.

Definition: Something that happens or is done briefly happens or is done for a very short period of time.
Example: He smiled briefly.

Definition: A bright colour is strong and noticeable, and not dark.
Example: ...a bright red dress.

Definition: A brilliant person, idea, or performance is extremely clever or skilful.
Example: She had a brilliant mind.

Definition:
If you bring someone or something with you when you come to a place, they come with you or you
have them with you.
Example: Remember to bring an apron or an old shirt to protect your clothes.

Definition: British means belonging or relating to the United Kingdom, or to its people or culture.
Example: ...the British government.

Definition: Something that is broad is wide.
Example: His shoulders were broad and his waist narrow.

Definition: Broken is the past participle of break.
Example: A broken blue line means the course of a waterless valley.

Definition: Your brother is a boy or a man who has the same parents as you.
Example: Oh, so you're Peter's younger brother.

Definition: Something that is brown is the colour of earth or of wood.
Example: ...her deep brown eyes.

Definition:
A brush is an object which has a large number of bristles or hairs fixed to it. You use brushes
for painting, for cleaning things, and for tidying your hair.
Example: We gave him paint and brushes.

Definition: A buck is a US or Australian dollar.
Example: That would probably cost you about fifty bucks.

Definition:
Your budget is the amount of money that you have available to spend. The budget for something is the amount of money that a person, organization, or country has
available to spend on it.
Example: She will design a fantastic new kitchen for youand all within your budget.

Definition: If you build something, you make it by joining things together.
Example: Developers are now proposing to build a hotel on the site.

Definition: A building is a structure that has a roof and walls, for example a house or a factory.
Example: They were on the upper floor of the building.

Definition: A bullet is a small piece of metal with a pointed or rounded end, which is fired out of a gun.
Example: A bullet grazed my cheek.

Definition: A bunch of people is a group of people who share one or more characteristics or who are doing something together.
Example: My neighbours are a bunch of busybodies.

Definition: If you describe a problem or a responsibility as a burden, you mean that it causes someone a lot of difficulty, worry, or hard work.
Example: The developing countries bear the burden of an enormous external debt.

Definition: If there is a fire or a flame somewhere, you say that there is a fire or flame burning there.
Example: Fires were burning out of control in the center of the city.

Definition: To bury something means to put it into a hole in the ground and cover it up with earth.
Example: They make the charcoal by burying wood in the ground and then slowly burning it.

Definition: A bus is a large motor vehicle which carries passengers from one place to another. Buses drive along particular routes, and you have to pay to travel in them.
Example: He missed his last bus home.

Definition: Business is work relating to the production, buying, and selling of goods or services.
Example: ...young people seeking a career in business.

Definition: When you are busy, you are working hard or concentrating on a task, so that you are not free to do anything else.
Example: What is it? I'm busy.

Definition: You use but to introduce something which contrasts with what you have just said, or to introduce something which adds to what you have just said.
Example:
'You said you'd stay till tomorrow.''I know, Bel, but I think I would rather go
back.'

Definition: Butter is a soft yellow substance made from cream. You spread it on bread or use it in cooking.
Example: ...bread and butter.

Definition:
Buttons are small hard objects sewn on to shirts, coats, or other pieces of clothing. You fasten the clothing by pushing the buttons
through holes called buttonholes.
Example: ...a coat with brass buttons.

Definition: If you buy something, you obtain it by paying money for it.
Example: He could not afford to buy a house.

Definition: A buyer is a person who is buying something or who intends to buy it.
Example: Car buyers are more interested in safety and reliability than speed.

Definition: If something is done by a person or thing, that person or thing does it.
Example: The feast was served by his mother and sisters.

Definition: A cabin is a small room in a ship or boat.
Example: He showed her to a small cabin.

Definition: A cabinet is a cupboard used for storing things such as medicine or alcoholic drinks or for displaying decorative things in.
Example: The star of my medicine cabinet is the humble aspirin.

Definition: A cable is a thick wire, or a group of wires inside a rubber or plastic covering, which is used to carry electricity or electronic signals.
Example: ...overhead power cables.

Definition: A cake is a sweet food made by baking a mixture of flour, eggs, sugar, and fat in an oven. Cakes may be large and cut into slices or small and intended for one person only.
Example: ...a piece of cake.

Definition: If you calculate a number or amount, you discover it from information that you already have, by using arithmetic, mathematics, or a special machine.
Example: From this you can calculate the total mass in the Galaxy.

Definition: If you call someone or something by a particular name or title, you give them that name or title.
Example: I always wanted to call the dog Mufty for some reason.

Definition: A camera is a piece of equipment that is used for taking photographs, making films, or producing television pictures. Many cameras are now included as part of other digital devices such as phones and tablets.
Example: Her gran lent her a camera for a school trip to Venice and Egypt.

Definition: A camp is a collection of huts and other buildings that is provided for a particular group of people, such as refugees, prisoners, or soldiers, as a place to live or stay.
Example: ...a refugee camp.

Definition: A campaign is a planned set of activities that people carry out over a period of time in order to achieve something such as social or political change.
Example: ...the campaign against public smoking.

Definition: A campus is an area of land that contains the main buildings of a university or college.
Example: ...during a rally at the campus.

Definition: You use can when you are mentioning a quality or fact about something which people may make use of if they want to.
Example: Chicken is also the most versatile of meats. It can be roasted whole or in pieces.

Definition: Canadian means belonging or relating to Canada, or to its people or culture.
Example: ...the Canadian government.

Definition: Cancer is a serious disease in which cells in a person's body increase rapidly in an uncontrolled way, producing abnormal growths.
Example: Her mother died of breast cancer.

Definition: A candidate is someone who is being considered for a position, for example someone who is running in an election or applying for a job.
Example: The Democratic candidate is still leading in the polls.

Definition: A cap is a soft, flat hat with a curved part at the front which is called a peak.
Example: ...a dark-blue baseball cap.

Definition: If you have the capability or the capabilities to do something, you have the ability or the qualities that are necessary to do it.
Example:
People experience differences in physical and mental capability depending on the
time of day.

Definition: If a person or thing is capable of doing something, they have the ability to do it.
Example: He appeared hardly capable of conducting a coherent conversation.

Definition: Your capacity for something is your ability to do it, or the amount of it that you are able to do.
Example: Our capacity for giving care, love and attention is limited.

Definition: Capital is a large sum of money which you use to start a business, or which you invest in order to make more money.
Example: Companies are having difficulty in raising capital.

Definition: In the army, navy, and some other armed forces, a captain is an officer of middle rank.
Example: ...Captain Mark Phillips.

Definition: If you capture someone or something, you catch them, especially in a war.
Example: The guerrillas shot down one aeroplane and captured the pilot.

Definition: A car is a motor vehicle with room for a small number of passengers.
Example: He had left his tickets in his car.

Definition: Carbon is a chemical element that diamonds and coal are made up of.
Example: He inserted the paper and two carbons.

Definition: A card is a piece of stiff paper or thin cardboard on which something is written or printed.
Example: Check the numbers below against the numbers on your card.

Definition: If you care about something, you feel that it is important and are concerned about it.
Example: ...a company that cares about the environment.

Definition: A career is the job or profession that someone does for a long period of their life.
Example: She is now concentrating on a career as a fashion designer.

Definition: If you are careful, you give serious attention to what you are doing, in order to avoid harm, damage, or mistakes. If you are careful to do something, you make sure that you do it.
Example: Be very careful with this stuff, it can be dangerous if it isn't handled properly.

Definition: When you assess a person, thing, or situation, you consider them in order to make a judgment about them. [...]
A carrier is a vehicle that is used for carrying people, especially soldiers, or things.
Example: There were armoured personnel carriers and tanks on the streets.

Definition: If you carry something, you take it with you, holding it so that it does not touch the ground.
Example: He was carrying a briefcase.

Definition: A particular case is a particular situation or incident, especially one that you are using as an individual example or instance of something.
Example: Surgical training takes at least nine years, or 11 in the case of obstetrics.

Definition: Cash is money in the form of notes and coins rather than cheques.
Example: ...two thousand pounds in cash.

Definition: The cast of a play or film is all the people who act in it.
Example: The show is very amusing and the cast are very good.

Definition: A cat is a furry animal that has a long tail and sharp claws. Cats are often kept as pets.
Example: There is always something nice about having a cat.

Definition: If you catch a person or animal, you capture them after chasing them, or by using a trap, net, or other device.
Example: Police say they are confident of catching the gunman.

Definition:
If people or things are divided into categories, they are divided into groups in such a way that the members of each group are similar
to each other in some way.
Example: This book clearly falls into the category of fictionalised autobiography.

Definition: The Catholic Church is the branch of the Christian Church that accepts the Pope as its leader and is based in the Vatican in Rome.
Example: ...the Catholic Church.

Definition: The cause of an event, usually a bad event, is the thing that makes it happen.
Example: Smoking is the biggest preventable cause of death and disease.

Definition: A ceiling is the horizontal surface that forms the top part or roof inside a room.
Example: The rooms were spacious, with tall windows and high ceilings.

Definition: If you celebrate, you do something enjoyable because of a special occasion or to mark someone's success.
Example: I was in a mood to celebrate.

Definition: A celebration is a special enjoyable event that people organize because something pleasant has happened or because it is someone's birthday or anniversary.
Example: I can tell you, there was a celebration in our house that night.

Definition: A celebrity is someone who is famous, especially in areas of entertainment such as films, music, writing, or sport.
Example:
He signed his first contract with Universal, changed his name and became a celebrity
almost overnight.

Definition:
A cell is the smallest part of an animal or plant that is able to function independently.
Every animal or plant is made up of millions of cells.
Example: Those cells divide and give many other different types of cells.

Definition: a point equally distant from all points on the circumference of a circle or surface of a sphere
Example: a shopping center

Definition: Something that is central is in the middle of a place or area.
Example: ...Central America's Caribbean coast.

Definition: A century is a period of a hundred years that is used when stating a date. For example, the 19th century was the period from 1801 to 1900.
Example: ...celebrated figures of the late eighteenth century.

Definition: CEO is an abbreviation for chief executive officer.
Example: Oh yes - the CEO 's presentation, and after that, the games!

Definition: A ceremony is a formal event such as a wedding.
Example: ...his grandmother's funeral, a private ceremony attended only by the family.

Definition: If you are certain about something, you firmly believe it is true and have no doubt about it. If you are not certain about something, you do not have definite knowledge about it.
Example: She's absolutely certain she's going to make it in the world.

Definition: You use certainly to emphasize what you are saying when you are making a statement.
Example: The public is certainly getting tired of hearing about it.

Definition: A chain consists of metal rings connected together in a line.
Example: His open shirt revealed a fat gold chain.

Definition: A chair is a piece of furniture for one person to sit on. Chairs have a back and four legs.
Example: He rose from his chair and walked to the window.

Definition: The chairman of a committee, organization, or company is the head of it.
Example: Glyn Ford is chairman of the Committee which produced the report.

Definition: A challenge is something new and difficult which requires great effort and determination.
Example: I like a big challenge and they don't come much bigger than this.

Definition: A chamber is a large room, especially one that is used for formal meetings.
Example: We are going to make sure we are in the council chamber every time he speaks.

Definition: A champion is someone who has won the first prize in a competition, contest, or fight.
Example: ...a former Commonwealth champion.

Definition: A championship is a competition to find the best player or team in a particular sport.
Example: ...the world chess championship.

Definition: If there is a chance of something happening, it is possible that it will happen.
Example: Do you think they have a chance of beating Australia?

Definition: If there is a change in something, it becomes different.
Example: The ambassador appealed for a change in U.S. policy.

Definition: not remaining the same; transient
Example: Changing faces Same character - different actor.

Definition: A channel is a television station.
Example: ...the only serious current affairs programme on either channel.

Definition: A chapter is one of the parts that a book is divided into. Each chapter has a number, and sometimes a title.
Example: As we shall see in Chapter 9, there is a totally different explanation.

Definition: The character of a person or place consists of all the qualities they have that make them distinct from other people or places.
Example: Perhaps there is a negative side to his character that you haven't seen yet.

Definition: The characteristics of a person or thing are the qualities or features that belong to them and make them recognizable.
Example: Genes determine the characteristics of every living thing.

Definition: If something is characterized by a particular feature or quality, that feature or quality is an obvious part of it.
Example: This election campaign has been characterized by violence.

Definition: If you charge someone an amount of money, you ask them to pay that amount for something that you have sold to them or done for them.
Example: Even local nurseries charge 100 a week.

Definition: A charity is an organization which raises money in order to help people who are sick or very poor, or who have a disability.
Example: The National Trust is a registered charity.

Definition: A chart is a diagram, picture, or graph which is intended to make information easier to understand.
Example: Male unemployment was 14.2%, compared with 5.8% for women (see chart on next page).

Definition: If you chase someone, or chase after them, you run after them or follow them quickly in order to catch or reach them.
Example: She chased the thief for 100 yards.

Definition: Goods or services that are cheap cost less money than usual or than you expected.
Example: I'm going to live off campus if I can find somewhere cheap enough.

Definition: If you check something such as a piece of information or a document, you make sure that it is correct or satisfactory.
Example: Check the accuracy of everything in your CV.

Definition: Your cheeks are the sides of your face below your eyes.
Example: Tears were running down her cheeks.

Definition: Cheese is a solid food made from milk. It is usually white or yellow.
Example: ...bread and cheese.

Definition: A chef is a cook in a restaurant or hotel.
Example: Some celebrity chefs are beginning to take the problem seriously.

Definition:
Chemical means involving or resulting from a reaction between two or more substances, or relating
to the substances that something consists of.
Example: ...chemical reactions that cause ozone destruction.

Definition: Your chest is the top part of the front of your body where your ribs, lungs, and heart are.
Example: He crossed his arms over his chest.

Definition: Chickens are birds which are kept on a farm for their eggs and for their meat.
Example:
Lionel built a coop so that they could raise chickens and have a supply of fresh
eggs.

Definition: The chief of an organization is the person who is in charge of it.
Example: ...a commission appointed by the police chief.

Definition: A child is a human being who is not yet an adult.
Example: When I was a child I lived in a country village.

Definition: A person's childhood is the period of their life when they are a child.
Example: She had a happy childhood.

Definition: Chinese means relating to or belonging to China, or its people, languages, or culture.
Chips are long, thin pieces of potato fried in oil or fat and eaten hot, usually with a meal.
Example: I had fish and chips in a cafe.

Definition: Chocolate is a sweet hard food made from cocoa beans. It is usually brown in colour and is eaten as a sweet.
Example: ...a bar of chocolate.

Definition: If there is a choice of things, there are several of them and you can choose the one you want.
Example: It's available in a choice of colours.

Definition:
Cholesterol is a substance that exists in the fat, tissues, and blood of all animals. Too much cholesterol in a person's
blood can cause heart disease.
Example: ...a dangerously high cholesterol level.

Definition: If you choose someone or something from several people or things that are available, you decide which person or thing you want to have.
Example: They will be able to choose their own leaders in democratic elections.

Definition: A Christian is someone who follows the teachings of Jesus Christ.
Example: He was a devout Christian.

Definition: Christmas is a Christian festival when the birth of Jesus Christ is celebrated. Christmas is celebrated on the 25th of December.
Example: The day after Christmas is generally a busy one for retailers.

Definition: A church is a building in which Christians worship. You usually refer to this place as church when you are talking about the time that people spend there.
Example: ...one of Britain's most historic churches.

Definition: Cigarettes are small tubes of paper containing tobacco which people smoke.
Example: He went out to buy a packet of cigarettes.

Definition:
A circle is a shape consisting of a curved line completely surrounding an area. Every part
of the line is the same distance from the centre of the area.
Example: The flag was red, with a large white circle in the centre.

Definition: The circumstances of a particular situation are the conditions which affect what happens.
Example: Recent opinion polls show that 60 percent favor abortion under certain circumstances.

Definition: If you cite something, you quote it or mention it, especially as an example or proof of what you are saying.
Example: She cites a favourite poem by George Herbert.
