Definition: Someone who is a citizen of a particular country is legally accepted as belonging to that country.
Example: ...American citizens.

Definition: A city is a large town.
Example: ...the city of Bologna.

Definition: You use civil to describe events that happen within a country and that involve the different groups of people in it.
Example: ...civil unrest.

Definition: In a military situation, a civilian is anyone who is not a member of the armed forces.
Example: The safety of civilians caught up in the fighting must be guaranteed.

Definition: If you say that someone claims that something is true, you mean they say that it is true but you are not sure whether or not they are telling the truth.
Example: He claimed that it was all a conspiracy against him.

Definition: A class is a group of pupils or students who are taught together.
Example: He had to spend about six months in a class with younger students.

Definition: A classic example of a thing or situation has all the features which you expect such a thing or situation to have.
Example: The debate in the mainstream press has been a classic example of British hypocrisy.

Definition: A classroom is a room in a school where lessons take place.
Example: Learn to speak Spanish Forget stuffy language schools in boring classrooms.

Definition: Something that is clean is free from dirt or unwanted marks.
Example: He wore his cleanest slacks, a clean shirt and a navy blazer.

Definition: Something that is clear is easy to understand, see, or hear.
Example: It is important to be clear about what Chomsky is doing here.

Definition: in a clear, distinct, or obvious manner
Example: You can think clearly and act decisively now the sun has gone deeper into your personality chart.

Definition:
A client of a professional person or organization is a person or company that receives a service
from them in return for payment.
Example: ...a solicitor and his client.

Definition: The climate of a place is the general weather conditions that are typical of it.
Example: ...the hot and humid climate of Cyprus.

Definition: If you climb something such as a tree, mountain, or ladder, or climb up it, you move towards the top of it. If you climb down it, you move towards the bottom of it.
Example: Climbing the first hill took half an hour.

Definition: A clinic is a building where people go to receive medical advice or treatment.
Example: ...a family planning clinic.

Definition: Clinical means involving or relating to the direct medical treatment or testing of patients.
Example: The first clinical trials were expected to begin next year.

Definition: A clock is an instrument, for example in a room or on the outside of a building, that shows what time of day it is.
Example: He was conscious of a clock ticking.

Definition: When you close something such as a door or lid or when it closes, it moves so that a hole, gap, or opening is covered.
Example: If you are cold, close the window.

Definition: If you adhere to a rule or agreement, you act in the way that it says you should. [...]
someone or something that closes
Example: Her family had shipped her across to Spain in 1942 with the explanation that the war was getting closer.

Definition: Clothes are the things that people wear, such as shirts, coats, trousers, and dresses.
Example: Moira walked upstairs to change her clothes.

Definition: Clothing is the things that people wear.
Example: Some locals offered food and clothing to the refugees.

Definition: A cloud is a mass of water vapour that floats in the sky. Clouds are usually white or grey in colour.
Example: ...the varied shapes of the clouds.

Definition:
A club is an organization of people interested in a particular activity or subject who usually
meet on a regular basis.
Example: ...the Chorlton Conservative Club.

Definition: A clue to a problem or mystery is something that helps you to find the answer to it.
Example:
Geneticists in Canada have discovered a clue to the puzzle of why our cells get old
and die.

Definition: A cluster of people or things is a small group of them close together.
Example: ...clusters of men in formal clothes.

Definition: A coach is someone who trains a person or team of people in a particular sport.
Example: Tony Woodcock has joined German amateur team SC Brueck as coach.

Definition: Coal is a hard black substance that is extracted from the ground and burned as fuel.
Example: Gas-fired electricity is cheaper than coal.

Definition: A coalition is a government consisting of people from two or more political parties.
Example: Since June the country has had a coalition government.

Definition: The coast is an area of land that is next to the sea.
Example: Campsites are usually situated along the coast, close to beaches.

Definition: A coat is a piece of clothing with long sleeves which you wear over your other clothes when you go outside.
Example: He turned off the television, put on his coat and walked out.

Definition: A code is a set of rules about how people should behave or about how something must be done.
Example: ...Article 159 of the Turkish Penal Code.

Definition: Coffee is a hot drink made with water and ground or powdered coffee beans.
Example: Would you like some coffee?

Definition: Cognitive means relating to the mental process involved in knowing, learning, and understanding things.
Example: As children grow older, their cognitive processes become sharper.

Definition: Something that is cold has a very low temperature or a lower temperature than is normal or acceptable.
Example: Rinse the vegetables under cold running water.

Definition: If a building or other structure collapses, it falls down very suddenly.
Example: A section of the Bay Bridge had collapsed.
synonyms: fall,give way,subside,fail,fold,founder,break down,faint,break down,pass out,black out,

Definition: Your colleagues are the people you work with, especially in a professional job.
Example: Without consulting his colleagues he flew from Lisbon to Split.

Definition: If you collect a number of things, you bring them together from several places or from several people.
Example: Two young girls were collecting firewood.

Definition: A collection of things is a group of similar things that you have deliberately acquired, usually over a period of time.
Example: Robert's collection of prints and paintings has been bought over the years.

Definition: Collective actions, situations, or feelings involve or are shared by every member of a group of people.
Example: It was a collective decision.

Definition: A college is an institution where students study after they have left school.
Example: Their daughter Joanna is doing business studies at a local college.

Definition: Colonial means relating to countries that are colonies, or to colonialism.
Example: ...the 31st anniversary of Jamaica's independence from British colonial rule.

Definition: the sensation resulting from stimulation of the retina of the eye by light waves of certain lengths
Example: to serve with the colors

Definition: A column is a tall, often decorated cylinder of stone which is built to honour someone or forms part of a building.
Example: ...a London landmark, Nelson's Column in Trafalgar Square.

Definition: A combination of things is a mixture of them.
Example: ...a fantastic combination of colours.

Definition: If you combine two or more things or if they combine, they exist together.
Example: The Church has something to say on how to combine freedom with responsibility.

Definition: When a person or thing comes to a particular place, especially to a place where you are, they move there.
Example: Two police officers came into the hall.

Definition: Comedy consists of types of entertainment, such as plays and films, or particular scenes in them, that are intended to make people laugh.
Example: He dropped out of university in Manchester to pursue a career in comedy.

Definition: If you are doing something in comfort, you are physically relaxed and contented, and are not feeling any pain or other unpleasant sensations.
Example: This will enable the audience to sit in comfort while watching the shows.

Definition: If a piece of furniture or an item of clothing is comfortable, it makes you feel physically relaxed when you use it, for example because it is soft.
Example: ...a comfortable fireside chair.

Definition: If someone in authority commands you to do something, they tell you that you must do it.
Example: He commanded his troops to attack.

Definition: A commander is an officer in charge of a military operation or organization.
Example: The commander and some of the men had been released.

Definition: If you comment on something, you give your opinion about it or you give an explanation for it.
Example: So far, Mr Cook has not commented on these reports.

Definition: Commercial means involving or relating to the buying and selling of goods.
Example: Docklands in its heyday was a major centre of industrial and commercial activity.

Definition: If you commission something or commission someone to do something, you formally arrange for someone to do a piece of work for you.
Example: The Ministry of Agriculture commissioned a study into low-input farming.

Definition: If someone commits a crime or a sin, they do something illegal or bad.
Example: I have never committed any crime.

Definition: Commitment is a strong belief in an idea or system.
Example: ...commitment to the ideals of Bolshevism.

Definition: A committee is a group of people who meet to make decisions or plans for a larger group or organization that they represent.
Example: ...a committee of ministers.

Definition: If something is common, it is found in large numbers or it happens often.
Example: His name was Hansen, a common name in Norway.

Definition: If you communicate with someone, you share or exchange information with them, for example by speaking, writing, or using equipment. You can also say that two people communicate.
Example: My natural mother has never communicated with me.

Definition: Communications are the systems and processes that are used to communicate or broadcast information, especially by means of electricity or radio waves.
Example: ...a communications satellite.

Definition: The community is all the people who live in a particular area or place.
Example: He's well liked by people in the community.

Definition: A company is a business organization that makes money by selling goods or services.
Example: Sheila found some work as a secretary in an insurance company.

Definition: When you compare things, you consider them and discover the differences or similarities between them.
Example: Compare the two illustrations in Fig 60.

Definition: When you make a comparison, you consider two or more things and discover the differences between them.
Example: ...a comparison of the British and German economies.

Definition: When one firm or country competes with another, it tries to get people to buy its own goods in preference to those of the other firm or country. You can also say that two firms or countries compete.
Example: Its products compete with own-label desserts in most supermarkets.

Definition: Competition is a situation in which two or more people or groups are trying to get something which not everyone can have.
Example: There's been some fierce competition for the title.

Definition: Competitive is used to describe situations or activities in which people or firms compete with each other.
Example:
Only by keeping down costs will America maintain its competitive advantage over other
countries.

Definition: A company's competitors are companies who are trying to sell similar goods or services to the same people.
Example: The bank isn't performing as well as some of its competitors.

Definition: If you complain about a situation, you say that you are not satisfied with it.
Example: Miners have complained bitterly that the government did not fulfill their promises.

Definition: A complaint is a statement in which you express your dissatisfaction with a particular situation.
Example:
There's been a record number of complaints about the standard of service on Britain's
railways.

Definition: You use complete to emphasize that something is as great in extent, degree, or amount as it possibly can be.
Example: The rebels had taken complete control.

Definition: To ban something means to state officially that it must not be done, shown, or used. [...]
Something that is complex has many different parts, and is therefore often difficult to understand.
Example: ...in-depth coverage of today's complex issues.

Definition: If you say that something is complicated, you mean it has so many parts or aspects that it is difficult to understand or deal with.
Example: The situation in Lebanon is very complicated.

Definition: The components of something are the parts that it is made of.
Example: Enriched uranium is a key component of a nuclear weapon.

Definition: The things that something is composed of are its parts or members. The separate things that compose something are the parts or members that form it.
Example: The force would be composed of troops from NATO countries.

Definition: When you talk about the composition of something, you are referring to the way in which its various parts are put together and arranged.
Example: Television has transformed the size and composition of audiences.

Definition: Something that is comprehensive includes everything that is needed or relevant.
Example: The Rough Guide to Nepal is a comprehensive guide to the region.

Definition: A computer is an electronic machine that can store and deal with large amounts of information.
Example: The data are then fed into a computer.

Definition: If you concentrate on something, or concentrate your mind on it, you give all your attention to it.
Example: It was up to him to concentrate on his studies and make something of himself.

Definition: Concentration on something involves giving all your attention to it.
Example: Neal kept interrupting, breaking my concentration.

Definition: A concept is an idea or abstract principle.
Example: She added that the concept of arranged marriages is misunderstood in the west.

Definition: Concern is worry about a situation.
Example: The group has expressed concern about reports of political violence.

Definition: If you are concerned to do something, you want to do it because you think it is important.
Example: We were very concerned to keep the staff informed about what we were doing.

Definition: A concert is a performance of music.
Example: ...a short concert of piano music.

Definition: If you conclude that something is true, you decide that it is true using the facts you know as a basis.
Example: Larry had concluded that he had no choice but to accept Paul's words as the truth.

Definition: When you come to a conclusion, you decide that something is true after you have thought about it carefully and have considered all the relevant facts.
Example: Over the years I've come to the conclusion that she's a very great musician.

Definition: Concrete is a substance used for building which is made by mixing together cement, sand, small stones, and water.
Example: The posts have to be set in concrete.

Definition: If you talk about the condition of a person or thing, you are talking about the state that they are in, especially how good or bad their physical state is.
Example: ...economic targets set as a condition for loan payments.

Definition: When you conduct an activity or task, you organize it and carry it out.
Example: I decided to conduct an experiment.

Definition: A conference is a meeting, often lasting a few days, which is organized on a particular subject or to bring together people who have a common interest.
Example: The President summoned all the state governors to a conference on education.

Definition: If you have confidence in someone, you feel that you can trust them.
Example: I have every confidence in you.

Definition: If you are confident about something, you are certain that it will happen in the way you want it to.
Example: I am confident that everything will come out right in time.

Definition: If something confirms what you believe, suspect, or fear, it shows that it is definitely true.
Example: X-rays have confirmed that he has not broken any bones.

Definition: Conflict is serious disagreement and argument about something important. If two people or groups are in conflict, they have had a serious disagreement or argument and have not yet reached agreement.
Example: Try to keep any conflict between you and your ex-partner to a minimum.

Definition: If you are confronted with a problem, task, or difficulty, you have to deal with it.
Example: She was confronted with severe money problems.

Definition: If there is confusion about something, it is not clear what the true situation is, especially because people believe different things.
Example: There's still confusion about the number of casualties.

Definition: A congress is a large meeting that is held to discuss ideas and policies.
Example: A lot has changed after the party congress.

Definition: A congressional policy, action, or person relates to the United States Congress.
Example: The president explained his plans to congressional leaders.

Definition: If something or someone connects one thing to another, or if one thing connects to another, the two things are joined together.
Example: You can connect the machine to your hi-fi.

Definition: A connection is a relationship between two things, people, or groups.
Example:
There was no evidence of a connection between BSE and the brain diseases recently
confirmed in cats.

Definition: Your consciousness is your mind and your thoughts.
Example: That idea has been creeping into our consciousness for some time.

Definition: A consensus is general agreement among a group of people.
Example:
The consensus amongst scientists is that the world will warm up over the next few
decades.

Definition: The consequences of something are the results or effects of it.
Example:
Her lawyer said she understood the consequences of her actions and was prepared to
go to jail.

Definition: A Conservative politician or voter is a member of or votes for the Conservative Party in Britain.
Example: Most Conservative MPs appear happy with the government's reassurances.

Definition: If you consider a person or thing to be something, you have the opinion that this is what they are.
Example:
We don't consider our customers to be mere consumers; we consider them to be our
friends.

Definition: Considerable means great in amount or degree.
Example: To be without Pearce would be a considerable blow.

Definition: Consideration is careful thought about something.
Example: He said there should be careful consideration of the future role of the BBC.

Definition: Something that consists of particular things or people is formed from them.
Example: Breakfast consisted of porridge served with butter.

Definition: Someone who is consistent always behaves in the same way, has the same attitudes towards people or things, or achieves the same level of success in something.
Example: He has never been the most consistent of players anyway.

Definition: You use constant to describe something that happens all the time or is always there.
Example: Inflation is a constant threat.

Definition: You use almost to indicate that something is not completely the case but is nearly the case. [...]
Example: In the past six months bases in the port have come under almost constant bombardment by rebels.

Definition: If something constitutes a particular thing, it can be regarded as being that thing.
Example:
Testing patients without their consent would constitute a professional and legal
offence.

Definition: Constitutional means relating to the constitution of a particular country or organization.
Example: ...efforts to resolve the country's constitutional crisis.

Definition: If you construct something such as a building, road, or machine, you build it or make it.
Example: The company is constructing 70 homes and a 130-room hotel on the land.

Definition: Construction is the building of things such as houses, factories, roads, and bridges.
Example: He'd already started construction on a hunting lodge.

Definition: A consultant is an experienced doctor with a high position, who specializes in one area of medicine.
Example: Shirley's brother is now a consultant heart surgeon in Sweden.

Definition: If you consume something, you eat or drink it.
Example:
Many people experienced a drop in their cholesterol levels when they consumed oat
bran.

Definition: A consumer is a person who buys things or uses services.
Example: ...claims that tobacco companies failed to warn consumers about the dangers of smoking.

Definition: The consumption of fuel or natural resources is the amount of them that is used or the act of using them.
Example: The laws have led to a reduction in fuel consumption in the U.S.

Definition: Contact involves meeting or communicating with someone, especially regularly.
Example: Opposition leaders are denying any contact with the rebels.

Definition: If something such as a box, bag, room, or place contains things, those things are inside it.
Example: The bag contained a Christmas card.

Definition: A container is something such as a box or bottle that is used to hold or store things in.
Example: ...the plastic containers in which fish are stored and sold.

Definition: Contemporary things are modern and relate to the present time.
Example: They wanted traditional music; he felt more contemporary music would aid outreach.

Definition: The contents of a container such as a bottle, box, or room are the things that are inside it.
Example: Empty the contents of the pan into the sieve.

Definition: A contest is a competition or game in which people try to win.
Example: Few contests in the recent history of British boxing have been as thrilling.

Definition: The context of an idea or event is the general situation that relates to it, and which helps it to be understood.
Example:
We are doing this work in the context of reforms in the economic, social and cultural
spheres.

Definition: If someone or something continues to do something, they keep doing it and do not stop.
Example: I hope they continue to fight for equal justice after I'm gone.

Definition: continuing; not having stopped
Example: So too the Lords if they value their continued existence as an unelected chamber.

Definition: A contract is a legal agreement, usually between two companies or between an employer and employee, which involves doing work for a stated sum of money.
Example: The company won a prestigious contract for work on Europe's tallest building.

Definition: A contrast is a great difference between two or more things which is clear when you compare them.
Example: ...the contrast between town and country.

Definition: If you contribute to something, you say or do things to help to make it successful.
Example: The three sons also contribute to the family business.

Definition: If you make a contribution to something, you do something to help make it successful or to produce it.
Example: The study made important contributions to the field of corporate economics.

Definition: Control of an organization, place, or system is the power to make all the important decisions about the way that it is run.
Example: The restructuring involves Mr Ronson giving up control of the company.

Definition: If you describe something or someone as controversial, you mean that they are the subject of intense public argument, disagreement, or disapproval.
Example: Immigration is a controversial issue in many countries.

Definition: Controversy is a lot of discussion and argument about something, often involving strong feelings of anger or disapproval.
Example: The proposed cuts have caused considerable controversy.

Definition: A convention is a way of behaving that is considered to be correct or polite by most people in a society.
Example: It's just a social convention that men don't wear skirts.

Definition: Someone who is conventional has behaviour or opinions that are ordinary and normal.
Example: ...a respectable married woman with conventional opinions.

Definition: If you have a conversation with someone, you talk with them, usually in an informal situation.
Example: He's a talkative guy, and I struck up a conversation with him.

Definition: If one thing is converted or converts into another, it is changed into a different form.
Example: The signal will be converted into digital code.

Definition: A conviction is a strong belief or opinion.
Example: It is our firm conviction that a step forward has been taken.

Definition: If someone or something convinces you of something, they make you believe that it is true or that it exists.
Example: I soon convinced the jury of my innocence.

Definition: When you cook a meal, you prepare food for eating by heating it.
Example: I have to go and cook the dinner.

Definition: A cookie is a sweet biscuit.
Example: a tough cookie

Definition: Cooking is food which has been cooked.
Example: The menu is based on classic French cooking.

Definition: Something that is cool has a temperature which is low but not very low.
Example: I felt a current of cool air.

Definition: joint operation or action
Example: He urged closer cooperation between all parties.

Definition: A cop is a police officer.
Example: Frank didn't like having the cops know where to find him.

Definition: If you cope with a problem or task, you deal with it successfully.
Example: It was amazing how my mother coped with bringing up eight children.

Definition: If you make a copy of something, you produce something that looks like the original thing.
Example: The reporter apparently obtained a copy of Steve's resignation letter.

Definition: The core of a fruit is the central part of it. It contains seeds or pips.
Example: Someone threw an apple core.

Definition: Corn is used to refer to crops such as wheat and barley. It can also be used to refer to the seeds from these plants.
Example: ...fields of corn.

Definition: A corner is a point or an area where two or more edges, sides, or surfaces of something join.
Example: He saw the corner of a magazine sticking out from under the blanket.

Definition: Corporate means relating to business corporations or to a particular business corporation.
Example: ...top U.S. corporate executives.

Definition: A corporation is a large business or company.
Example: ...multi-national corporations.

Definition: If something is correct, it is in accordance with the facts and has no mistakes.
Example: The correct answers can be found at the bottom of page 8.

Definition: A correspondent is a newspaper or television journalist, especially one who specializes in a particular type of news.
Example: ...The Times Diplomatic Correspondent.

Definition: The cost of something is the amount of money that is needed in order to buy, do, or make it.
Example: The cost of a loaf of bread has increased five-fold.

Definition: Cotton is a type of cloth made from soft fibres from a particular plant.
Example: ...a cotton shirt.

Definition: A couch is a long, comfortable seat for two or three people.
Example:
The new centre-right government's radical objectives are often couched in moderate
terms.

Definition: You use could to indicate that someone had the ability to do something. You use could not or couldn't to say that someone was unable to do something.
Example: For my return journey, I felt I could afford the extra and travel first class.

Definition: A council is a group of people who are elected to govern a local area such as a city or, in Britain, a county.
Example: ...Cheshire County Council.

Definition: A counselor is a person whose job is to give advice to people who need it, especially advice on their personal problems.
Example: Children who have suffered like this should see a counselor experienced in bereavement.

Definition: When you count, you say all the numbers one after another up to a particular number.
Example: He was counting slowly under his breath.

Definition: In a place such as a shop or caf, a counter is a long narrow table or flat surface at which customers are served.
Example: ...a woman serving behind the counter at a bakery.

Definition: A country is one of the political units which the world is divided into, covering a particular area of land.
Example: ...that disputed boundary between the two countries.

Definition: A county is a region of Britain, Ireland, or the USA which has its own local government.
Example: He is living now in his mother's home county of Oxfordshire.

Definition: If you refer to a couple of people or things, you mean two or approximately two of them, although the exact number is not important or you are not sure of it.
Example: Across the street from me there are a couple of police officers standing guard.

Definition: Courage is the quality shown by someone who decides to do something difficult or dangerous, even though they may be afraid.
Example: He has impressed everyone with his authority and personal courage.

Definition: Course is often used in the expression 'of course', or instead of 'of course' in informal spoken English. See of course.
Example: The pilot requested clearance to alter course to avoid the storm.

Definition: A court is a place where legal matters are decided by a judge and jury or by a magistrate.
Example: At this rate, we could find ourselves in the divorce courts!

Definition: Your cousin is the child of your uncle or aunt.
Example: My cousin Mark helped me.

Definition:
If you cover something, you place something else over it in order to protect it, hide it, or close
it.
Example: Cover the casserole with a tight-fitting lid.

Definition: The coverage of something in the news is the reporting of it.
Example: Now a special TV network gives live coverage of most races.

Definition: A cow is a large female animal that is kept on farms for its milk. People sometimes refer to male and female animals of this species as cows.
Example: He kept a few dairy cows.

Definition: If something hard cracks, or if you crack it, it becomes slightly damaged, with lines appearing on its surface.
Example: A gas main had cracked under my neighbour's garage and gas had seeped into our homes.

Definition: You can refer to a boat, a spacecraft, or an aircraft as a craft.
Example: With great difficulty, the fisherman manoeuvred his small craft close to the reef.

Definition: A crash is an accident in which a moving vehicle hits something and is damaged or destroyed.
Example: His elder son was killed in a car crash a few years ago.

Definition: If you describe someone or something as crazy, you think they are very foolish or strange.
Example: People thought they were all crazy to try to make money from manufacturing.

Definition:
Cream is a thick yellowish-white liquid taken from milk. You can use it in cooking or put
it on fruit or desserts.
Example: ...strawberries and cream.

Definition: To create something means to cause it to happen or exist.
Example: We set business free to create more jobs in Britain.

Definition: You can refer to something that someone has made as a creation, especially if it shows skill, imagination, or artistic ability.
Example: The bathroom is entirely my own creation.

Definition: A creative person has the ability to invent and develop original ideas, especially in the arts.
Example: Like so many creative people, he was never satisfied.

Definition: You can refer to any living thing that is not a plant as a creature, especially when it is of an unknown or unfamiliar kind. People also refer to imaginary animals and beings as creatures.
Example: The Inuit of Alaska believe that every living creature possesses a spirit.

Definition: If you are allowed credit, you are allowed to pay for goods or services several weeks or months after you have received them.
Example: The group can't get credit to buy farming machinery.

Definition: The crew of a ship, an aircraft, or a spacecraft is the people who work on and operate it.
Example: The mission for the crew of the space shuttle is essentially over.

Definition: A crime is an illegal action or activity for which a person can be punished by law.
Example: He and Lieutenant Cassidy were checking the scene of the crime.

Definition: A criminal is a person who regularly commits crimes.
Example: A group of gunmen attacked a prison and set free nine criminals in Moroto.

Definition: A crisis is a situation in which something or someone is affected by one or more very serious problems.
Example: Natural disasters have obviously contributed to the continent's economic crisis.

Definition: a standard by which something can be judged or decided
Example: Talent is at the bottom of the list of criteria needed to become a pop star.

Definition: A critic is a person who writes about and expresses opinions about things such as books, films, music, or art.
Example: The New York critics had praised her performance.

Definition: A critical time, factor, or situation is extremely important.
Example: The incident happened at a critical point in the campaign.

Definition: Criticism is the action of expressing disapproval of something or someone. A criticism is a statement that expresses disapproval.
Example: This policy had repeatedly come under strong criticism on Capitol Hill.

Definition: If you criticize someone or something, you express your disapproval of them by saying what you think is wrong with them.
Example: His mother had rarely criticized him or any of her children.

Definition: Crops are plants such as wheat and potatoes that are grown in large quantities for food.
Example: Rice farmers here still plant and harvest their crops by hand.

Definition:
If you cross something such as a room, a road, or an area of land or water, you move or travel
to the other side of it. If you cross to a place, you move or travel over a room, road, or area of land or water in order
to reach that place.
Example: She was partly to blame for failing to look as she crossed the road.

Definition: A crowd is a large group of people who have gathered together, for example to watch or listen to something interesting, or to protest about something.
Example: A huge crowd gathered in a square outside the Kremlin walls.

Definition: If you describe something as crucial, you mean it is extremely important.
Example: He had administrators under him but took the crucial decisions himself.

Definition: When you cry, tears come from your eyes, usually because you are unhappy or hurt.
Example: I hung up the phone and started to cry.

Definition: Cultural means relating to a particular society and its ideas, customs, and art.
Example: ...a deep sense of personal honour which was part of his cultural heritage.

Definition:
Culture consists of activities such as the arts and philosophy, which are considered to be important for the development of civilization and of
people's minds.
Example: There is just not enough fun and frivolity in culture today.

Definition:
A cup is a small round container that you drink from. Cups usually have handles and are
made from china or plastic.
Example: ...cups and saucers.

Definition: If you are curious about something, you are interested in it and want to know more about it.
Example: Steve was intensely curious about the world I came from.

Definition: A current is a steady and continuous flowing movement of some of the water in a river, lake, or sea.
Example:
Under normal conditions, the ocean currents of the tropical Pacific travel from east
to west.

Definition: at the present time; now
Example: And, before you ask, we don't know what cases he was currently investigating.

Definition: A curriculum is all the different courses of study that are taught in a school, college, or university.
Example: There should be a broader curriculum in schools for post-16-year-old pupils.

Definition: A custom is an activity, a way of behaving, or an event which is usual or traditional in a particular society or in particular circumstances.
Example: The custom of lighting the famous flame goes back centuries.

Definition: A customer is someone who buys goods or services, especially from a shop.
Example: Our customers have very tight budgets.

Definition:
If you cut something, you use a knife or a similar tool to divide it into pieces, or to mark
it or damage it. If you cut a shape or a hole in something, you make the shape or hole by using a knife or similar
tool.
Example: Mrs. Haines stood nearby, holding scissors to cut a ribbon.

Definition: If you cycle, you ride a bicycle.
Example: He cycled to Ambleside.

Definition: Your dad is your father. You can call your dad 'Dad'.
Example: How do you feel, Dad?

Definition: If something happens daily, it happens every day.
Example: Cathay Pacific flies daily non-stop to Hong Kong from Heathrow.

Definition: To damage an object means to break it, spoil it physically, or stop it from working properly.
Example: He maliciously damaged a car with a baseball bat.

Definition: When you dance, you move your body and feet in a way which follows a rhythm, usually in time to music.
Example: Polly had never learned to dance.

Definition: Danger is the possibility that someone may be harmed or killed.
Example: My friends endured tremendous danger in order to help me.

Definition: If something is dangerous, it is able or likely to hurt or harm you.
Example: It's a dangerous stretch of road.

Definition: If you do not dare to do something, you do not have enough courage to do it, or you do not want to do it because you fear the consequences. If you dare to do something, you do something which requires a lot of courage.
Example: Since he was stuck in a lift a year ago he hasn't dared to get back into one.

Definition: When it is dark, there is not enough light to see properly, for example because it is night.
Example: When she awoke it was evening and already dark.

Definition: You use complete to emphasize that something is as great in extent, degree, or amount as it possibly can be. [...]

You can refer to information as data, especially when it is in the form of facts or statistics that you can analyse. In American English, data is usually a plural noun. In technical or formal British English, data is sometimes a plural noun, but at other times, it is an uncount noun.
Example: The study was based on data from 2,100 women.

Definition: A date is a specific time that can be named, for example a particular day or a particular year.
Example: What's the date today?

Definition: Someone's daughter is their female child.
Example: ...Flora and her daughter Catherine.

Definition: A day is one of the seven twenty-four hour periods of time in a week.
Example: The weather did not help; hot by day, cold at night.

Definition: A person, animal, or plant that is dead is no longer living.
Example: Her husband's been dead a year now.

Definition: If you say that you need or have a great deal of or a good deal of a particular thing, you are emphasizing that you need or have a lot of it.
Example: ...a great deal of money.

Definition: A dealer is a person whose business involves buying and selling things.
Example: ...an antique dealer.

Definition: You use dear to describe someone or something that you feel affection for.
Example: Mrs Cavendish is a dear friend of mine.

Definition: Death is the permanent end of the life of a person or animal.
Example: 1.5 million people are in immediate danger of death from starvation.

Definition: A debate is a discussion about a subject on which people have different views.
Example: An intense debate is going on within the Israeli government.

Definition: A debt is a sum of money that you owe someone.
Example: Three years later, he is still paying off his debts.

Definition: A decade is a period of ten years, especially one that begins with a year ending in 0, for example 1980 to 1989.
Example: ...the last decade of the nineteenth century.

Definition: If you decide to do something, you choose to do it, usually after you have thought carefully about the other possibilities.
Example: She decided to do a secretarial course.

Definition: When you make a decision, you choose what should be done or which is the best of various possible actions.
Example: A decision was taken to discipline Marshall.

Definition: A deck on a vehicle such as a bus or ship is a lower or upper area of it.
Example: ...sitting on the top deck of the number 13 bus.

Definition: If you declare that something is true, you say that it is true in a firm, deliberate way. You can also declare an attitude or intention.
Example: Speaking outside Ten Downing Street, she declared that she would fight on.

Definition: If something declines, it becomes less in quantity, importance, or strength.
Example: The number of staff has declined from 217,000 to 114,000.

Definition: When something decreases or when you decrease it, it becomes less in quantity, size, or intensity.
Example: Population growth is decreasing by 1.4% each year.

Definition: If something is deep, it extends a long way down from the ground or from the top surface of something.
Example: The water is very deep and mysterious-looking.

Definition: at or to a considerable extent downward; well within or beneath a surface
Example: Instead, I tried to fight my nausea by breathing in deeply.

Definition: A deer is a large wild animal that eats grass and leaves. A male deer usually has large, branching horns.
Example: Wild boar and deer could eat his livelihood.

Definition: If you defeat someone, you win a victory over them in a battle, game, or contest.
Example: His guerrillas defeated the colonial army in 1954.

Definition: If you defend someone or something, you take action in order to protect them.
Example: Every man who could fight was now committed to defend the ridge.

Definition: A defendant is a person who has been accused of breaking the law and is being tried in court.
Example: In court, both defendants apologised.

Definition: the act or power of defending, or guarding against attack, harm, or danger
Example: Sharon, unable to rise and run, could only hold up her hands in helpless defense.

Definition: You use defensive to describe things that are intended to protect someone or something.
Example: The Government hastily organized defensive measures against the raids.

Definition: A deficit is the amount by which something is less than what is required or expected, especially the amount by which the total money received is less than the total money spent.
Example: They're ready to cut the federal budget deficit for the next fiscal year.

Definition: If you define something, you show, describe, or state clearly what it is and what its limits are, or what it is like.
Example: We were unable to define what exactly was wrong with him.

Definition: You use definitely to emphasize that something is the case, or to emphasize the strength of your intention or opinion.
Example: I'm definitely going to get in touch with these people.

Definition: A definition is a statement giving the meaning of a word or expression, especially in a dictionary.
Example: There is no general agreement on a standard definition of intelligence.

Definition: You use degree to indicate the extent to which something happens or is the case, or the amount which something is felt.
Example: These man-made barriers will ensure a very high degree of protection.

Definition: If you delay doing something, you do not do it immediately or at the planned or expected time, but you leave it until later.
Example: For sentimental reasons I wanted to delay my departure until June.

Definition: If you deliver something somewhere, you take it there.
Example: The Canadians plan to deliver more food to southern Somalia.

Definition: Delivery or a delivery is the bringing of letters, parcels, or other goods to someone's house or to another place where they want them.
Example: Please allow 28 days for delivery.

Definition: If you demand something such as information or action, you ask for it in a very forceful way.
Example: Mr Byers last night demanded an immediate explanation from the Education Secretary.

Definition: Democracy is a system of government in which people choose their rulers by voting for them in elections.
Example: ...the pro-democracy movement.

Definition: A Democrat is a member or supporter of a particular political party which has the word 'democrat' or 'democratic' in its title, for example the Democratic Party in the United States.
Example: ...a senior Christian Democrat.

Definition: A democratic country, government, or political system is governed by representatives who are elected by the people.
Example: The country returned to democratic rule after a series of military governments.

Definition: To demonstrate a fact means to make it clear to people.
Example: The study also demonstrated a direct link between obesity and mortality.

Definition: A demonstration is a march or gathering which people take part in to show their opposition to something or their support for something.
Example: Riot police broke up a demonstration by students.

Definition: When you deny something, you state that it is not true.
Example: She denied both accusations.

Definition:
A department is one of the sections in an organization such as a government, business, or university.
A department is also one of the sections in a large shop.
Example: ...the U.S. Department of Agriculture.

Definition: If you say that one thing depends on another, you mean that the first thing will be affected or determined by the second.
Example: The cooking time needed depends on the size of the potato.

Definition: To be dependent on something or someone means to need them in order to succeed or be able to survive.
Example: The local economy is overwhelmingly dependent on oil and gas extraction.

Definition: If you say that one thing depends on another, you mean that the first thing will be affected or determined by the second.
Example: The cooking time needed depends on the size of the potato.

Definition: To depict someone or something means to show or represent them in a work of art such as a drawing or painting.
Example: ...a gallery of pictures depicting Nelson's most famous battles.

Definition: Depression is a mental state in which you are sad and feel that you cannot enjoy anything, because your situation is so difficult and unpleasant.
Example: Mr Thomas was suffering from depression.

Definition: The depth of something such as a river or hole is the distance downwards from its top surface, or between its upper and lower surfaces.
Example: The smaller lake ranges from five to fourteen feet in depth.

Definition: A deputy is the second most important person in an organization such as a business or government department. Someone's deputy often acts on their behalf when they are not there.
Example: ...France's minister for culture and his deputy.

Definition: If you derive something such as pleasure or benefit from a person or from something, you get it from them.
Example: Mr Ying is one of those happy people who derive pleasure from helping others.

Definition: If you describe a person, object, event, or situation, you say what they are like or what happened.
Example: We asked her to describe what kind of things she did in her spare time.

Definition: A description of someone or something is an account which explains what they are or what they look like.
Example: Police have issued a description of the man who was aged between fifty and sixty.

Definition: A desert is a large area of land, usually in a hot region, where there is almost no water, rain, trees, or plants.
Example: ...the Sahara Desert.

Definition: If you say that a person or thing deserves something, you mean that they should have it or receive it because of their actions or qualities.
Example: Government officials clearly deserve some of the blame as well.

Definition: When someone designs a garment, building, machine, or other object, they plan it and make a detailed drawing of it from which it can be built or made.
Example: They wanted to design a machine that was both attractive and practical.

Definition: A designer is a person whose job is to design things by making drawings of them.
Example: Carolyne is a fashion designer.

Definition: A desire is a strong wish to do or have something.
Example: I had a strong desire to help and care for people.

Definition: A desk is a table, often with drawers, which you sit at to write or work.
Example: I spoke to the girl on the reception desk.

Definition: If you are desperate, you are in such a bad situation that you are willing to try anything to change it.
Example: Troops are needed to help get food to the people in desperate need.

Definition: You use despite to introduce a fact which makes the other part of the sentence surprising.
Example: It is possible to lead happy and productive lives despite their loss.

Definition: To destroy something means to cause so much damage to it that it is completely ruined or does not exist any more.
Example: That's a sure recipe for destroying the economy and creating chaos.

Definition: Destruction is the act of destroying something, or the state of being destroyed.
Example: ...an international agreement aimed at halting the destruction of the ozone layer.

Definition: The details of something are its individual features or elements.
Example: The details of the plan are still being worked out.

Definition: A detailed report or plan contains a lot of details.
Example: Yesterday's letter contains a detailed account of the decisions.

Definition: To detect something means to find it or discover that it is present somewhere by using equipment or making an investigation.
Example: ...a sensitive piece of equipment used to detect radiation.

Definition: If a particular factor determines the nature of a thing or event, it causes it to be of a particular kind.
Example: The size of the chicken pieces will determine the cooking time.

Definition: When something develops, it grows or changes over a period of time and usually becomes more advanced, complete, or severe.
Example: There have been huge advances in our understanding of how children develop.

Definition: If you talk about developing countries or the developing world, you mean the countries or the parts of the world that are poor and have few industries.
Example: Birth rates are starting to fall in the developing world.

Definition: Development is the gradual growth or formation of something.
Example: ...an ideal system for studying the development of the embryo.

Definition: A device is an object that has been invented for a particular purpose, for example for recording or measuring something.
Example: ...an electronic device that protects your vehicle 24 hours a day.

Definition: If you devote yourself, your time, or your energy to something, you spend all or most of your time or energy on it.
Example: He decided to devote the rest of his life to scientific investigation.

Definition:
Dialogue is communication or discussion between people or groups of people such as governments or political
parties.
Example: People of all social standings should be given equal opportunities for dialogue.

Definition: When people, animals, and plants die, they stop living.
Example: A year later my dog died.

Definition: Your diet is the type and range of food that you regularly eat.
Example: It's never too late to improve your diet.

Definition: If two or more things differ, they are unlike each other in some way.
Example: The story he told police differed from the one he told his mother.

Definition: The difference between two things is the way in which they are unlike each other.
Example: That is the fundamental difference between the two societies.

Definition: If two people or things are different, they are not like each other in one or more ways. In British English, people sometimes say that one thing is different to another. Some people consider this use to be incorrect. People sometimes say that one thing is different than another. This use is often considered incorrect in British English, but it is acceptable in American English.
Example: We have totally different views.

Definition: If two people or things are different, they are not like each other in one or more ways. In British English, people sometimes say that one thing is different to another. Some people consider this use to be incorrect. People sometimes say that one thing is different than another. This use is often considered incorrect in British English, but it is acceptable in American English. [...]
Something that is difficult is not easy to do, understand, or deal with.
Example: Hobart found it difficult to get her first book published.

Definition: A difficulty is a problem.
Example: ...the difficulty of getting accurate information.

Definition: If people or animals dig, they make a hole in the ground or in a pile of earth, stones, or rubbish.
Example: They tried digging in a patch just below the cave.

Definition: Digital systems record or transmit information in the form of thousands of very small signals.
Example: Digital technology allowed a rapid expansion in the number of TV channels.

Definition: A particular dimension of something is a particular aspect of it.
Example: There is a political dimension to the accusations.

Definition: When you dine, you have dinner.
Example: He dines alone most nights.

Definition: Dinner is the main meal of the day, usually served in the early part of the evening.
Example: She invited us to her house for dinner.

Definition: Direct means moving towards a place or object, without changing direction and without stopping, for example in a journey.
Example: I directed the extinguisher at the fire without effect.

Definition: A direction is the general line that someone or something is moving or pointing in.
Example: St Andrews was ten miles in the opposite direction.

Definition: If something is directly above, below, or in front of something, it is in exactly that position.
Example: The second rainbow will be bigger than the first, and directly above it.

Definition: The director of a play, film, or television programme is the person who decides how it will appear on stage or screen, and who tells the actors and technical staff what to do.
Example: ...the director of the intensive care unit at Guy's Hospital.

Definition: If there is dirt on something, there is dust, mud, or a stain on it.
Example: I started to scrub off the dirt.

Definition: If something is dirty, it is marked or covered with stains, spots, or mud, and needs to be cleaned.
Example: She still did not like the woman who had dirty fingernails.

Definition: A disability is a permanent injury, illness, or physical or mental condition that tends to restrict the way that someone can live their life.
Example: Facilities for people with disabilities are still insufficient.

Definition: If you disagree with someone or disagree with what they say, you do not accept that what they say is true or correct. You can also say that two people disagree.
Example: You must continue to see them no matter how much you may disagree with them.

Definition: If you say that someone or something disappears, you mean that you can no longer see them, usually because you or they have changed position.
Example: The black car drove away from them and disappeared.

Definition: A disaster is a very bad accident such as an earthquake or a plane crash, especially one in which a lot of people are killed.
Example: It was the second air disaster in the region in less than two months.

Definition: Discipline is the practice of making people obey rules or standards of behaviour, and punishing them when they do not.
Example: Order and discipline have been placed in the hands of headmasters and governing bodies.

Definition: Discourse is spoken or written communication between people, especially serious discussion of a particular subject.
Example: ...a tradition of political discourse.

Definition: If you discover something that you did not know about before, you become aware of it or learn of it.
Example: She discovered that they'd escaped.

Definition: If someone makes a discovery, they become aware of something that they did not know about before.
Example: I felt I'd made an incredible discovery.

Definition: Discrimination is the practice of treating one person or group of people less fairly or less well than other people or groups.
Example: She is exempt from sex discrimination laws.

Definition: If people discuss something, they talk about it, often in order to reach a decision.
Example: I will be discussing the situation with colleagues tomorrow.

Definition: If there is discussion about something, people talk about it, often in order to reach a decision.
Example: There was a lot of discussion about the wording of the report.

Definition: A disease is an illness which affects people, animals, or plants, for example one which is caused by bacteria or infection.
Example: ...the rapid spread of disease in the area.

Definition: A dish is a shallow container with a wide uncovered top. You eat and serve food from dishes and cook food in them.
Example: ...plastic bowls and dishes.

Definition: If you dismiss something, you decide or say that it is not important enough for you to think about or consider.
Example: Mr Wakeham dismissed the reports as speculation.

Definition: A disorder is a problem or illness which affects someone's mind or body.
Example: ...a rare nerve disorder that can cause paralysis of the arms.

Definition: If you display something that you want people to see, you put it in a particular place, so that people can see it easily.
Example: Among the war veterans proudly displaying their medals was Aubrey Rose.

Definition: A dispute is an argument or disagreement between people or groups.
Example: They have won previous pay disputes with the government.

Definition: The distance between two points or places is the amount of space between them.
Example: ...the distance between the island and the nearby shore.

Definition: Distant means very far away.
Example: The mountains rolled away to a distant horizon.

Definition: If something is distinct from something else of the same type, it is different or separate from it.
Example: Engineering and technology are disciplines distinct from one another and from science.

Definition: A distinction between similar things is a difference.
Example: There are obvious distinctions between the two wine-making areas.

Definition: If you can distinguish one thing from another or distinguish between two things, you can see or understand how they are different.
Example: Could he distinguish right from wrong?

Definition: If you distribute things, you hand them or deliver them to a number of people.
Example: Students shouted slogans and distributed leaflets.

Definition: The distribution of things involves giving or delivering them to a number of people or places.
Example: ...the council which controls the distribution of foreign aid.

Definition: A district is a particular area of a town or country.
Example: I drove around the business district.

Definition: If a group or range of things is diverse, it is made up of a wide variety of things.
Example: ...shops selling a diverse range of gifts.

Definition: The diversity of something is the fact that it contains many very different elements.
Example: ...the cultural diversity of British society.

Definition: When people or things are divided or divide into smaller groups or parts, they become separated into smaller parts.
Example: The physical benefits of exercise can be divided into three factors.

Definition: The division of a large unit into two or more distinct parts is the act of separating it into these parts.
Example: ...Czechoslovakia's division into the Czech Republic and Slovakia.

Definition: A divorc is a man who is divorced.
Example: Numerous marriages now end in divorce.

Definition:
DNA is an acid in the chromosomes in the centre of the cells of living things. DNA determines the particular structure and functions of every cell and is responsible for characteristics
being passed on from parents to their children. DNA is an abbreviation for 'deoxyribonucleic acid'.
Example: We can get a DNA identification from a single hair from that nice thatch you've got on your head.

Definition: Do is used to form the negative of main verbs, by putting 'not' after 'do' and before the main verb in its infinitive form, that is the form without 'to'.
Example: They don't want to work.

Definition: A doctor is someone who is qualified in medicine and treats people who are ill.
Example: Do not discontinue the treatment without consulting your doctor.

Definition: A document is one or more official pieces of paper with writing on them.
Example: The foreign ministers of the two countries signed the documents today.

Definition: A dog is a very common four-legged animal that is often kept by people as a pet or to guard or hunt. There are many different breeds of dog.
Example: Outside, a dog was barking.

Definition: Domestic political activities, events, and situations happen or exist within one particular country.
Example: ...over 100 domestic flights a day to 15 U.K. destinations.

Definition: Someone or something that is dominant is more powerful, successful, influential, or noticeable than other people or things.
Example: ...a change which would maintain his party's dominant position in Scotland.

Definition: To dominate a situation means to be the most powerful or important person or thing in it.
Example: The book is expected to dominate the best-seller lists.

Definition: A door is a piece of wood, glass, or metal, which is moved to open and close the entrance to a building, room, cupboard, or vehicle.
Example: I knocked at the front door, but there was no answer.

Definition: You use double to indicate that something includes or is made of two things of the same kind.
Example: The number of managers must double to 100 within 3 years.

Definition: If you have doubt or doubts about something, you feel uncertain about it and do not know whether it is true or possible. If you say you have no doubt about it, you mean that you are certain it is true.
Example: This raises doubts about the point of advertising.

Definition: To go down something such as a slope or a pipe means to go towards the ground or to a lower level.
Example: We're going down a mountain.

Definition: Downtown places are in or towards the centre of a large town or city, where the shops and places of business are.
Example: ...an office in downtown Chicago.

Definition: If you have a dozen things, you have twelve of them.
Example: ...a dozen eggs.

Definition: A draft is an early version of a letter, email, book, or speech.
Example: He drafted a standard letter to the editors.

Definition: If you drag something, you pull it along the ground, often with difficulty.
Example: He got up and dragged his chair towards the table.

Definition: A drama is a serious play for the theatre, television, or radio.
Example: He acted in radio dramas.

Definition: A dramatic change or event happens suddenly and is very noticeable and surprising.
Example: Changes in sea level could have a dramatic effect.

Definition: If the process or rate of something accelerates or if something accelerates it, it gets faster and faster. [...]
When you draw, or when you draw something, you use a pencil or pen to produce a picture, pattern, or diagram.
Example: She would sit there drawing with the pencil stub.

Definition: A drawing is a picture made with a pencil or pen.
Example: She did a drawing of me.

Definition: A dream is an imaginary series of events that you experience in your mind while you are asleep.
Example: Ivor dreamed that he was on a bus.

Definition: A dress is a piece of clothing for a woman or girl that covers the body and part or all of the legs.
Example: He told Sarah to wait while he dressed.

Definition: When you drink a liquid, you take it into your mouth and swallow it.
Example: He drank his cup of tea.

Definition: When you drive somewhere, you operate a car or other vehicle and control its movement and direction.
Example: I drove into town and went to a restaurant for dinner.

Definition: The driver of a vehicle is the person who is driving it.
Example: The driver got out of his van.

Definition: If a level or amount drops or if someone or something drops it, it quickly becomes less.
Example: Temperatures can drop to freezing at night.

Definition: A drug is a chemical which is given to people in order to treat or prevent an illness or disease.
Example: The drug will be useful to hundreds of thousands of infected people.

Definition: If something is dry, there is no water or moisture on it or in it.
Example: Clean the metal with a soft dry cloth.

Definition: If an event is due to something, it happens or exists as a direct result of that thing.
Example: The country's economic problems are largely due to the weakness of the recovery.

Definition:
If something happens during a period of time or an event, it happens continuously, or happens several times between
the beginning and end of that period or event.
Example: Sandstorms are common during the Saudi Arabian winter.

Definition: Dust is very small dry particles of earth or sand.
Example: Tanks raise huge trails of dust when they move.

Definition: Duty is work that you have to do for your job.
Example: Staff must report for duty at their normal place of work.

Definition:
If you refer to each thing or each person in a group, you are referring to every member of the group and considering
them as individuals.
Example: Each book is beautifully illustrated.

Definition: If you are eager to do or have something, you want to do or have it very much.
Example: Robert was eager to talk about life in the Army.

Definition: Your ears are the two parts of your body, one on each side of your head, with which you hear sounds.
Example: He whispered something in her ear.

Definition: Early means before the usual time that a particular event or activity happens.
Example: I knew I had to get up early.

Definition: If you earn money, you receive money in return for work that you do.
Example: Charlie was earning eight pounds, I was earning five.

Definition: Your earnings are the sums of money that you earn by working.
Example: Average weekly earnings rose by 1.5% in July.

Definition: Earth or the Earth is the planet on which we live. People usually say Earth when they are referring to the planet as part of the universe, and the Earth when they are talking about the planet as the place where we live.
Example: The space shuttle returned safely to Earth.

Definition: If you talk about the ease of a particular activity, you are referring to the way that it has been made easier to do, or to the fact that it is already easy to do.
Example: For ease of reference, only the relevant extracts of the regulations are included.

Definition: You use easily to emphasize that something is very likely to happen, or is very likely to be true.
Example: It could easily be another year before the economy starts to show some improvement.

Definition: The east is the direction which you look towards in the morning in order to see the sun rise.
Example: ...the vast swamps which lie to the east of the River Nile.

Definition: Eastern means in or from the east of a region, state, or country.
Example: ...Eastern Europe.

Definition: If a job or action is easy, you can do it without difficulty or effort, because it is not complicated and causes no problems.
Example: The shower is easy to install.

Definition: When you eat something, you put it into your mouth, chew it, and swallow it.
Example: She was eating a sandwich.

Definition: Economic means concerned with the organization of the money, industry, and trade of a country, region, or society.
Example: ...Poland's radical economic reforms.

Definition: Economics is the study of the way in which money, industry, and trade are organized in a society.
Example: He gained a first class Honours degree in economics.

Definition: An economist is a person who studies, teaches, or writes about economics.
Example: Economists warn against giving too much weight to monthly figures because they can be volatile.

Definition:
An economy is the system according to which the money, industry, and trade of a country or region
are organized.
Example: The Japanese economy grew at an annual rate of more than 10 per cent.

Definition: The edge of something is the place or line where it stops, or the part of it that is furthest from the middle.
Example: We were on a hill, right on the edge of town.

Definition: An edition is a particular version of a book, magazine, or newspaper that is printed at one time.
Example: A paperback edition is now available at bookshops.

Definition: An editor is the person who is in charge of a newspaper or magazine and who decides what will be published in each edition of it.
Example: Cookery Editor Moyra Fraser takes you behind the scenes.

Definition: When someone, especially a child, is educated, he or she is taught at a school or college.
Example: He was educated at Haslingden Grammar School.

Definition: Education involves teaching people various subjects, usually at a school or college, or being taught.
Example: They're cutting funds for education.

Definition: Educational matters or institutions are concerned with or relate to education.
Example: ...the British educational system.

Definition: An educator is a person who educates people.
Example: This task may then be fulfilled by a school health educator.

Definition: The effect of one thing on another is the change that the first thing causes in the second thing.
Example: Parents worry about the effect of music on their adolescent's behavior.

Definition: Something that is effective works well and produces the results that were intended.
Example: Homoeopathic treatment can be effective in treating virtually any illness.

Definition: You use effectively with a statement or opinion to indicate that it is not accurate in every detail, but that you feel it is a reasonable description or summary of a particular situation.
Example: This effectively means that the government does not agree with the proposals.

Definition: Efficiency is the quality of being able to do a task successfully, without wasting time or energy.
Example:
There are many ways to increase agricultural efficiency in the poorer areas of the
world.

Definition: If something or someone is efficient, they are able to do tasks successfully, without wasting time or energy.
Example: With today's more efficient contraception women can plan their families and careers.

Definition: If you make an effort to do something, you try very hard to do it.
Example: He made no effort to hide his disappointment.

Definition: An egg is an oval object that is produced by a female bird and which contains a baby bird. Other animals such as reptiles and fish also lay eggs.
Example: ...a baby bird hatching from its egg.

Definition: Eight is the number 8.
Example: So far eight workers have been killed.

Definition: You use either in front of the first of two or more alternatives, when you are stating the only possibilities or choices that there are. The last of the other alternatives is introduced by 'or'.
Example: They gave money to the Conservative Party either personally or through their companies.

Definition: You use elderly as a polite way of saying that someone is old.
Example: ...an elderly couple.

Definition: When people elect someone, they choose that person to represent them, by voting for them.
Example: The people of the Philippines have voted to elect a new president.

Definition: An election is a process in which people vote to choose a person or group of people to hold an official position.
Example: ...the first fully free elections for more than fifty years.

Definition: An electric device or machine works by means of electricity, rather than using some other source of power.
Example: ...her electric guitar.

Definition: Electricity is a form of energy that can be carried by wires and is used for heating and lighting, and to provide power for machines.
Example: We moved into a cabin with electricity but no running water.

Definition: An electronic device has transistors or silicon chips which control and change the electric current passing through the device.
Example: ...expensive electronic equipment.

Definition: The different elements of something are the different parts it contains.
Example:
The exchange of prisoners of war was one of the key elements of the U.N.'s peace
plan.

Definition: Something that is elementary is very simple and basic.
Example: ...elementary computer skills.

Definition: To eliminate something, especially something you do not want or need, means to remove it completely.
Example: The priority should be to eliminate child poverty.

Definition:
You can refer to the most powerful, rich, or talented people within a particular group, place,
or society as the elite.
Example: ...a government comprised mainly of the elite.

Definition: You use else after words such as ' anywhere', 'someone', and 'what', to refer in a vague way to another person, place, or thing.
Example: If I can't make a living at painting, at least I can teach someone else to paint.

Definition: Elsewhere means in other places or to another place.
Example: Almost 80 percent of the state's residents were born elsewhere.

Definition: a system for sending messages, as by telephone line, from one computer or terminal to a receiving computer or terminal and for storing such messages
Example: She gave him an e-mail address instead.

Definition: If you embrace someone, you put your arms around them and hold them tightly, usually in order to show your love or affection for them. You can also say that two people embrace.
Example: Penelope came forward and embraced her sister.

Definition: To emerge means to come out from an enclosed or dark space such as a room or a vehicle, or from a position where you could not be seen.
Example: Richard was waiting outside the door as she emerged.

Definition: An emergency is an unexpected and difficult or dangerous situation, especially an accident, which happens suddenly and which requires quick action to deal with it.
Example: He deals with emergencies promptly.

Definition: An emission of something such as gas or radiation is the release of it into the atmosphere.
Example:
The emission of gases such as carbon dioxide should be stabilised at their present
level.

Definition: An emotion is a feeling such as happiness, love, fear, anger, or hatred, which can be caused by the situation that you are in or the people you are with.
Example: Happiness was an emotion that Reynolds was having to relearn.

Definition: Emotional means concerned with emotions and feelings.
Example: I needed this man's love, and the emotional support he was giving me.

Definition: Emphasis is special or extra importance that is given to an activity or to a part or aspect of something.
Example: Too much emphasis is placed on research.

Definition: To emphasize something means to indicate that it is particularly important or true, or to draw special attention to it.
Example: It's been emphasized that no major policy changes can be expected.

Definition: If a person or company employs you, they pay you to work for them.
Example: The company employs 18 staff.

Definition: An employee is a person who is paid to work for an organization or for another person.
Example: He is an employee of Fuji Bank.

Definition: Your employer is the person or organization that you work for.
Example: He had been sent to Rome by his employer.

Definition: Employment is the fact of having a paid job.
Example: She was unable to find employment.

Definition: An empty place, vehicle, or container is one that has no people or things in it.
Example: The room was bare and empty.

Definition: If someone or something enables you to do a particular thing, they give you the opportunity to do it.
Example: The new test should enable doctors to detect the disease early.

Definition: If you encounter problems or difficulties, you experience them.
Example: Every day of our lives we encounter stresses of one kind or another.

Definition: If you encourage someone, you give them confidence, for example by letting them know that what they are doing is good and telling them that they should continue to do it.
Example: When things aren't going well, he encourages me, telling me not to give up.

Definition:
The end of something such as a period of time, an event, a book, or a film is the last part
of it or the final point in it.
Example: The 5 banknote was first issued at the end of the 18th century.

Definition: If someone is your enemy, they hate you or want to harm you.
Example: The Government's political enemies were quick to pick up on this series of disasters.

Definition: Energy is the ability and strength to do active physical things and the feeling that you are full of physical power and life.
Example: He was saving his energy for next week's race in Belgium.

Definition: If someone carries out the enforcement of an act or rule, they enforce it.
Example: ... improved driver training, and stricter enforcement of road traffic law.

Definition: If you engage in an activity, you do it or are actively involved with it.
Example: It is important for children to have time to engage in family activities.

Definition: The engine of a car or other vehicle is the part that produces the power which makes the vehicle move.
Example: He got into the driving seat and started the engine.

Definition: An engineer is a person who uses scientific knowledge to design, construct, and maintain engines and machines or structures such as roads, railways, and bridges.
Example: Many of Kuwait's spacious freeways were engineered by W S Atkins.

Definition: Engineering is the work involved in designing and constructing engines and machinery, or structures such as roads and bridges. Engineering is also the subject studied by people who want to do this work.
Example: ...the design and engineering of aircraft and space vehicles.

Definition: English means belonging or relating to England, or to its people, language, or culture. It is also often used to mean belonging or relating to Great Britain, although many people object to this.
Example: ...the English way of life.

Definition: To enhance something means to improve its value, quality, or attractiveness.
Example: They'll be keen to enhance their reputation abroad.

Definition: If you enjoy something, you find pleasure and satisfaction in doing it or experiencing it.
Example: Ross had always enjoyed the company of women.

Definition: Something that is enormous is extremely large in size or amount.
Example: The main bedroom is enormous.

Definition: Enough means as much as you need or as much as is necessary.
Example: They had enough cash for a one-way ticket.

Definition: To ensure something, or to ensure that something happens, means to make certain that it happens.
Example: Negotiators ensured that the treaty was a significant change in direction.

Definition: When you enter a place such as a room or building, you go into it or come into it.
Example: He entered the room briskly and stood near the door.

Definition: An enterprise is a company or business, often a small one.
Example: There are plenty of small industrial enterprises.
