Definition: Entertainment consists of performances of plays and films, and activities such as reading and watching television, that give people pleasure.
Example: ...the world of entertainment and international stardom.

Definition: You use entire when you want to emphasize that you are referring to the whole of something, for example, the whole of a place, time, or population.
Example: He had spent his entire life in China as a doctor.

Definition: Entirely means completely and not just partly.
Example: ...an entirely new approach.

Definition: The entrance to a place is the way into it, for example a door or gate.
Example: Beside the entrance to the church, turn right.

Definition: If you gain entry to a particular place, you are able to go in.
Example:
Bill was among the first to gain entry to Buckingham Palace when it opened to the
public recently.

Definition: Someone's environment is all the circumstances, people, things, and events around them that influence their life.
Example: Pupils in our schools are taught in a safe, secure environment.

Definition: Environmental means concerned with the protection of the natural world of land, sea, air, plants, and animals.
Example: ...economic and environmental legislation.

Definition: You can refer to an event or a short period of time as an episode if you want to suggest that it is important or unusual, or has some particular quality.
Example: This episode is bound to be a deep embarrassment for Washington.

Definition: If two things are equal or if one thing is equal to another, they are the same in size, number, standard, or value.
Example: Investors can borrow an amount equal to the property's purchase price.

Definition: Equally means in sections, amounts, or spaces that are the same size as each other.
Example: He asked that his property be divided equally between his sons.

Definition: Equipment consists of the things which are used for a particular purpose, for example a hobby or job.
Example: ...computers, electronic equipment and machine tools.

Definition: You can refer to a period of history or a long period of time as an era when you want to draw attention to a particular feature or quality that it has.
Example: ...the nuclear era.

Definition:
An error is something you have done which is considered to be incorrect or wrong, or which
should not have been done.
Example: NASA discovered a mathematical error in its calculations.

Definition: If you escape from a place, you succeed in getting away from it.
Example: A prisoner has escaped from a jail in northern England.

Definition: You use especially to emphasize that what you are saying applies more to one person, thing, or area than to any others.
Example: Millions of wild flowers colour the valleys, especially in April and May.

Definition: An essay is a short piece of writing on one particular subject written by a student.
Example: We asked Jason to write an essay about his hometown and about his place in it.

Definition: Something that is essential is extremely important or absolutely necessary to a particular subject, situation, or activity.
Example:
It was absolutely essential to separate crops from the areas that animals used as
pasture.

Definition: You use essentially to emphasize a quality that someone or something has, and to say that it is their most important or basic quality.
Example:
Great writers, composers and scientists are essentially quite different from ordinary
people.

Definition: If someone establishes something such as an organization, a type of activity, or a set of rules, they create it or introduce it in such a way that it is likely to last for a long time.
Example: The U.N. has established detailed criteria for who should be allowed to vote.

Definition: The establishment of an organization or system is the act of creating it or beginning it.
Example:
His ideas influenced the establishment of National Portrait Galleries in London and
Edinburgh.

Definition: An estate is a large area of land in the country which is owned by a person, family, or organization.
Example: ...a shooting party on Lord Wyville's estate in Yorkshire.

Definition: If you estimate a quantity or value, you make an approximate judgment or calculation of it.
Example: Try to estimate how many steps it will take to get to a close object.

Definition: etc is used at the end of a list to indicate that you have mentioned only some of the items involved and have not given a full list. etc is a written abbreviation for 'et cetera'.
Example: She knew all about my schoolwork, my hospital work etc.

Definition: the philosophical study of the moral value of human conduct and of the rules and principles that ought to govern it; moral philosophy
Example: He lent me a book about art and ethics by the British philosopher Hume.

Definition: Ethnic means connected with or relating to different racial or cultural groups of people.
Example: ...a survey of Britain's ethnic minorities.

Definition: European means belonging or relating to, or coming from Europe.
Example: ...in some other European countries.

Definition: If you evaluate something or someone, you consider them in order to make a judgment about them, for example about how good or bad they are.
Example: They will first send in trained nurses to evaluate the needs of the individual situation.

Definition: the process of evaluating something or an instance of this
Example: This evaluation has been discussed with Mr Smith, who indicates an unwillingness to alter his work habits.

Definition: You use even to suggest that what comes just after or just before it in the sentence is rather surprising.
Example: He kept calling me for years, even after he got married.

Definition: The evening is the part of each day between the end of the afternoon and the time when you go to bed.
Example: All he did that evening was sit around the flat.

Definition: An event is something that happens, especially when it is unusual or important. You can use events to describe all the things that are happening in a particular situation.
Example: ...the events of Black Wednesday.

Definition: Eventually means in the end, especially after a lot of delays, problems, or arguments.
Example: Eventually, the army caught up with him in Latvia.

Definition: Ever means at any time. It is used in questions and negative statements.
Example: I'm not sure I'll ever trust people again.

Definition:
You use every to indicate that you are referring to all the members of a group or all the parts of something and not only some of
them.
Example: Every village has a green, a church, a pub and a manor house.

Definition: Everybody means the same as everyone.
Example: You expect it out of doors at a craft fair, mebbe, somewhere open to everybody.

Definition: You use everyday to describe something which happens or is used every day, or forms a regular and basic part of your life, so it is not especially interesting or unusual.
Example: In the course of my everyday life, I had very little contact with teenagers.

Definition: You use everyone or everybody to refer to all the people in a particular group.
Example: Everyone in the street was shocked when they heard the news.

Definition: You use everything to refer to all the objects, actions, activities, or facts in a particular situation.
Example: He'd gone to Seattle long after everything else in his life had changed.

Definition: You use everywhere to refer to a whole area or to all the places in a particular area.
Example: Working people everywhere object to paying taxes.

Definition: Evidence is anything that you see, experience, read, or are told that causes you to believe that something is true or has really happened.
Example: Ganley said he'd seen no evidence of widespread fraud.

Definition:
Evolution is a process of gradual change that takes place over many generations, during which
species of animals, plants, or insects slowly change some of their physical characteristics.
Example: ...the evolution of plants and animals.

Definition: When animals or plants evolve, they gradually change and develop into different forms.
Example: The bright plumage of many male birds has evolved to attract females.

Definition: Exact means correct in every detail. For example, an exact copy is the same in every detail as the thing it is copied from.
Example: I don't remember the exact words.

Definition: You use exactly before an amount, number, or position to emphasize that it is no more, no less, or no different from what you are stating.
Example: Each corner had a guard tower, each of which was exactly ten meters in height.

Definition: An examination is a formal test that you take to show your knowledge or ability in a particular subject, or to obtain a qualification.
Example: Then I waited another half an hour for my medical examination in the fourth cabin.

Definition: If you examine something, you look at it carefully.
Example: He examined her passport and stamped it.

Definition: An example of something is a particular situation, object, or person which shows that what is being claimed is true.
Example: The doctors gave numerous examples of patients being expelled from hospital.

Definition: If something exceeds a particular amount or number, it is greater or larger than that amount or number.
Example: Its research budget exceeds $700 million a year.

Definition: Something that is excellent is very good indeed.
Example: The recording quality is excellent.

Definition:
You use except to introduce the only thing or person that a statement does not apply to, or a fact that prevents
a statement from being completely true.
Example: I wouldn't have accepted anything except a job in Europe.

Definition: An exception is a particular thing, person, or situation that is not included in a general statement, judgment, or rule.
Example: Few guitarists can sing as well as they can play; Eddie, however, is an exception.

Definition: If two or more people exchange things of a particular kind, they give them to each other at the same time.
Example: We exchanged addresses and Christmas cards.

Definition: If something is exciting, it makes you feel very happy or enthusiastic.
Example: The race itself is very exciting.

Definition: An executive is someone who is employed by a business at a senior level. Executives decide what the business should do, and ensure that it is done.
Example: ...an advertising executive.

Definition:
If you exercise something such as your authority, your rights, or a good quality, you use it or put
it into effect.
Example: They are merely exercising their right to free speech.

Definition: If someone or something shows a particular quality, feeling, or type of behaviour, you can say that they exhibit it.
Example: He has exhibited symptoms of anxiety and overwhelming worry.

Definition: An exhibition is a public event at which pictures, sculptures, or other objects of interest are displayed, for example at a museum or art gallery.
Example: ...an exhibition of expressionist art.

Definition: If something exists, it is present in the world as a real thing.
Example: He thought that if he couldn't see something, it didn't exist.

Definition: The existence of something is the fact that it is present in the world as a real thing.
Example: ...the existence of other galaxies.

Definition: Existing is used to describe something which is now present, available, or in operation, especially when you are contrasting it with something which is planned for the future.
Example: ...the need to improve existing products and develop new lines.

Definition: If something expands or is expanded, it becomes larger.
Example: Engineers noticed that the pipes were not expanding as expected.

Definition: Expansion is the process of becoming greater in size, number, or amount.
Example: ...the rapid expansion of private health insurance.

Definition: If you expect something to happen, you believe that it will happen.
Example: ...a council workman who expects to lose his job in the next few weeks.

Definition: Your expectations are your strong hopes or beliefs that something will happen or that you will get something that you want.
Example: Students' expectations were as varied as their expertise.

Definition: Expense is the money that something costs you or that you need to spend in order to do something.
Example: Most of the marble had been imported at vast expense from Italy.

Definition: If something is expensive, it costs a lot of money.
Example: Fuel's so expensive in this country.

Definition: Experience is knowledge or skill in a particular job or activity, which you have gained because you have done that job or activity for a long time.
Example: He has also had managerial experience on every level.

Definition: An experiment is a scientific test which is done in order to discover what happens to something in particular conditions.
Example: He carried out a series of experiments on the properties of plants.

Definition: An expert is a person who is very skilled at doing something or who knows a lot about a particular subject.
Example:
Our team of experts will be on hand to offer help and advice between 12 noon and
7pm daily.

Definition: If you explain something, you give details about it or describe it so that it can be understood.
Example: Not every judge, however, has the ability to explain the law in simple terms.

Definition: If you give an explanation of something that has happened, you give people reasons for it, especially in an attempt to justify it.
Example:
She told the court she would give a full explanation of the prosecution's decision
on Monday.

Definition: If an object such as a bomb explodes or if someone or something explodes it, it bursts loudly and with great force, often causing damage or injury.
Example: They were clearing up when the second bomb exploded.

Definition: If you explore a place, you travel around it to find out what it is like.
Example: I just wanted to explore Paris, read Sartre, listen to Sidney Bechet.

Definition: An explosion is a sudden, violent burst of energy, for example one caused by a bomb.
Example: A second explosion came minutes later and we were enveloped in a dust cloud.

Definition: An expos is a film or piece of writing which reveals the truth about a situation or person, especially something involving shocking facts.
Example: The movie is an expos of prison conditions in the South.

Definition: Exposure to something dangerous means being in a situation where it might affect you.
Example: Exposure to lead is known to damage the brains of young children.

Definition: When you express an idea or feeling, or express yourself, you show what you think or feel.
Example: He expressed grave concern at American attitudes.

Definition: The expression of ideas or feelings is the showing of them through words, actions, or artistic activities.
Example: Laughter is one of the most infectious expressions of emotion.

Definition: If you say that something, usually something large, extends for a particular distance or extends from one place to another, you are indicating its size or position.
Example: The caves extend for some 18 kilometres.

Definition: An extension is a new room or building which is added to an existing building or group of buildings.
Example: ...the Jubilee Line extension.

Definition: Something that is extensive covers or includes a large physical area.
Example: ...an extensive tour of Latin America.

Definition: If you are talking about how great, important, or serious a difficulty or situation is, you can refer to the extent of it.
Example: The government itself has little information on the extent of industrial pollution.

Definition: External is used to indicate that something is on the outside of a surface or body, or that it exists, happens, or comes from outside.
Example: ...a much reduced heat loss through external walls.

Definition: You use extra to describe an amount, person, or thing that is added to others of the same kind, or that can be added to others of the same kind.
Example: Police warned motorists to allow extra time to get to work.

Definition: If you describe something or someone as extraordinary, you mean that they have some extremely good or special quality.
Example: We've made extraordinary progress as a society in that regard.

Definition: Extreme means very great in degree or intensity.
Example: The girls were afraid of snakes and picked their way along with extreme caution.

Definition: You use extremely in front of adjectives and adverbs to emphasize that the specified quality is present to a very great degree.
Example: My mobile phone is extremely useful.

Definition: Your eyes are the parts of your body with which you see.
Example: I opened my eyes and looked.

Definition: Fabric is cloth or other material produced by weaving together cotton, nylon, wool, silk, or other threads. Fabrics are used for making things such as clothes, curtains, and sheets.
Example: ...small squares of red cotton fabric.

Definition: Your face is the front part of your head from your chin to the top of your forehead, where your mouth, eyes, nose, and other features are.
Example: He rolled down his window and stuck his face out.

Definition:
Facilities are buildings, pieces of equipment, or services that are provided for a particular
purpose.
Example: What recreational facilities are now available?

Definition: When you refer to something as a fact or as fact, you mean that you think it is true or correct.
Example: ...a statement of verifiable historical fact.

Definition: A factor is one of the things that affects an event, decision, or situation.
Example: Physical activity is an important factor in maintaining fitness.

Definition: A factory is a large building where machines are used to make large quantities of goods.
Example: He owned furniture factories in New York State.

Definition: Your faculties are your physical and mental abilities.
Example: He was drunk and not in control of his faculties.

Definition: When a coloured object fades or when the light fades it, it gradually becomes paler.
Example: All colour fadesespecially under the impact of direct sunlight.

Definition: If you fail to do something that you were trying to do, you are unable to do it or do not succeed in doing it.
Example: The Workers' Party failed to win a single governorship.

Definition: Failure is a lack of success in doing or achieving something, especially in relation to a particular activity.
Example: This policy is doomed to failure.

Definition: Something or someone that is fair is reasonable, right, and just.
Example: It didn't seem fair to leave out her father.

Definition: Fairly means to quite a large degree. For example, if you say that something is fairly old, you mean that it is old but not very old.
Example: Both ships are fairly new.

Definition: If you have faith in someone or something, you feel confident about their ability or goodness.
Example: She had placed a great deal of faith in Mr Penleigh.

Definition: If someone or something falls, they move quickly downwards onto or towards the ground, by accident or because of a natural force.
Example: Her father fell into the sea after a massive heart attack.

Definition: If something is false, it is incorrect, untrue, or mistaken.
Example:
It was quite clear the President was being given false information by those around
him.

Definition: If someone or something is familiar to you, you recognize them or know them well.
Example: He talked of other cultures as if they were more familiar to him than his own.

Definition: A family is a group of people who are related to each other, especially parents and their children.
Example: There's room in there for a family of five.

Definition: Someone or something that is famous is very well known.
Example: New Orleans is famous for its cuisine.

Definition: If you are a fan of someone or something, especially a famous person or a sport, you like them very much and are very interested in them.
Example: They are both ardent Elvis fans.

Definition: A fantasy is a pleasant situation or event that you think about and that you want to happen, especially one that is unlikely to happen.
Example: ...fantasies of romance and true love.

Definition: If one place, thing, or person is far away from another, there is a great distance between them.
Example: I know a nice little Italian restaurant not far from here.

Definition: A farm is an area of land, together with the buildings on it, that is used for growing crops or raising animals, usually in order to sell them.
Example: Farms in France are much smaller than those in the United States or even Britain.

Definition: A farmer is a person who owns or manages a farm.
Example: She came from a family of dairy farmers.

Definition: Fashion is the area of activity that involves styles of clothing and appearance.
Example: There are 20 full-colour pages of fashion for men.

Definition: Fast means happening, moving, or doing something at great speed. You also use fast in questions or statements about speed.
Example: ...fast cars with flashing lights and sirens.

Definition: If you say that a person or animal is fat, you mean that they have a lot of flesh on their body and that they weigh too much. You usually use the word fat when you think that this is a bad thing.
Example: I could eat what I liked without getting fat.

Definition: Fate is a power that some people believe controls and decides everything that happens, in a way that cannot be prevented or changed. You can also refer to the fates.
Example: I see no use quarrelling with fate.

Definition: Your father is your male parent. You can also call someone your father if he brings you up as if he was this man. You can call your father 'Father'.
Example: His father was a painter.

Definition: If a bad or undesirable situation is your fault, you caused it or are responsible for it.
Example: There was no escaping the fact: it was all his fault.

Definition: If you regard something or someone with favor, you like or support them.
Example: It remains to be seen if the show will find favor with an audience.

Definition: Your favorite thing or person of a particular type is the one you like most.
Example: He celebrated by opening a bottle of his favorite champagne.

Definition: Fear is the unpleasant feeling you have when you think that you are in danger.
Example: I was sitting on the floor shivering with fear.

Definition: A feature of something is an interesting or important part or characteristic of it.
Example: Patriotic songs have long been a feature of Kuwaiti life.

Definition:
A federal country or system of government is one in which the different states or provinces
of the country have important powers to make their own laws and decisions.
Example: The provinces are to become autonomous regions in the new federal system.

Definition: A fee is a sum of money that you pay to be allowed to do something.
Example: He hadn't paid his television licence fee.

Definition: If you feed a person or animal, you give them food to eat and sometimes actually put it in their mouths.
Example: We brought along pieces of old bread and fed the birds.

Definition: If you feel a particular emotion or physical sensation, you experience it.
Example: I am feeling very depressed.

Definition: A feeling is an emotion, such as anger or happiness.
Example: It gave me a feeling of satisfaction.

Definition: You use fellow to describe people who are in the same situation as you, or people you feel you have something in common with.
Example: She discovered, to her pleasure, a talent for making her fellow guests laugh.

Definition: Someone who is female is a woman or a girl.
Example: ...a sixteen-piece dance band with a female singer.

Definition: A fence is a barrier between two areas of land, made of wood or wire supported by posts.
Example: Villagers say the fence would restrict public access to the hills.

Definition: You use a few to indicate that you are talking about a small number of people or things. You can also say a very few.
Example: I gave a dinner party for a few close friends.

Definition: of a smaller number
Example: It claims 250,000 people attended (others say far fewer).

Definition: A fiber is a thin thread of a natural or artificial substance, especially one that is used to make cloth or rope.
Example: If you look at the paper under a microscope you will see the fibers.

Definition: Fiction refers to books and stories about imaginary people and events, rather than books about real people or events.
Example: Immigrant tales have always been popular themes in fiction.

Definition: A field is an area of grass, for example in a park or on a farm. A field is also an area of land on which a crop is grown.
Example: ...a field of wheat.

Definition: Fifteen is the number 15.
Example: It expects to open ten to fifteen pubs for the full year.

Definition: The fifth item in a series is the one that you count as number five.
Example: Joe has recently returned from his fifth trip to Australia.

Definition: Fifty is the number 50.
Example: Fifty years is a long time in journalism.

Definition: If you fight something unpleasant, you try in a determined way to prevent it or stop it happening.
Example: More units to fight forest fires are planned.

Definition: A fighter or a fighter plane is a fast military aircraft that is used for destroying other aircraft.
Example: From the start it was clear this tiny girl was a real fighter.

Definition: If you fight something unpleasant, you try in a determined way to prevent it or stop it happening.
Example: More units to fight forest fires are planned.

Definition: A figure is a particular amount expressed as a number, especially a statistic.
Example: We need a true figure of how many people in this country haven't got a job.

Definition: A file is a box or a folded piece of heavy paper or plastic in which letters or documents are kept.
Example: He sat behind a table on which were half a dozen files.

Definition: If you fill a container or area, or if it fills, an amount of something enters it that is enough to make it full.
Example: Fill a saucepan with water and bring to a slow boil.

Definition:
A film consists of moving pictures that have been recorded so that they can be shown at the cinema or on television.
A film tells a story, or shows a real situation.
Example: Everything about the film was good. Good acting, good story, good fun.

Definition: In a series of events, things, or people, the final one is the last one.
Example: They will hold a meeting in a final attempt to agree a common position.

Definition: You use finally to suggest that something happens after a long period of time, usually later than you wanted or expected it to happen.
Example: The word was finally given for us to get on board.

Definition: When someone finances something such as a project or a purchase, they provide the money that is needed to pay for them.
Example: The fund has been used largely to finance the construction of federal prisons.

Definition: Financial means relating to or involving money.
Example: The company is in financial difficulties.

Definition: If you find someone or something, you see them or learn where they are.
Example: The police also found a pistol.

Definition: Someone's findings are the information they get or the conclusions they come to as the result of an investigation or some research.
Example:
One of the main findings of the survey was the confusion about the facilities already
in place.

Definition: You use fine to describe something that you admire and think is very good.
Example: There is a fine view of the countryside.

Definition: Your fingers are the four long thin parts at the end of each hand.
Example: She suddenly held up a small, bony finger and pointed across the room.

Definition: When you finish doing or dealing with something, you do or deal with the last part of it, so that there is no more for you to do or deal with.
Example: As soon as he'd finished eating, he excused himself.

Definition: Fire is the hot, bright flames produced by things that are burning.
Example: They saw a big flash and a huge ball of fire reaching hundreds of feet into the sky.

Definition:
A firm is an organization which sells or produces something or which provides a service
which people pay for.
Example: The firm's employees were expecting large bonuses.

Definition: The first thing, person, event, or period of time is the one that happens or comes before all the others of the same kind.
Example: She lost 16 pounds in the first month of her diet.

Definition: A fish is a creature that lives in water and has a tail and fins. There are many different kinds of fish.
Example: I was chatting to an islander who had just caught a fish.

Definition: Fishing is the sport, hobby, or business of catching fish.
Example: Despite the poor weather the fishing has been pretty good.

Definition: If something fits, it is the right size and shape to go onto a person's body or onto a particular object.
Example: The sash, kimono, and other garments were made to fit a child.

Definition: the state of being fit
Example: Are you into your health and fitness?

Definition: Five is the number 5.
Example: Eric Edward Bullus was born in Peterborough, the second of five children.

Definition: If something is fixed somewhere, it is attached there firmly or securely.
Example: It is fixed on the wall.

Definition:
A flag is a piece of cloth which can be attached to a pole and which is used as a sign,
signal, or symbol of something, especially of a particular country.
Example: The Marines raised the American flag.

Definition: A flame is a hot bright stream of burning gas that comes from something that is burning.
Example: The heat from the flames was so intense that roads melted.

Definition:
A flat is a set of rooms for living in, usually on one floor and part of a larger building.
A flat usually includes a kitchen and bathroom.
Example: Sara lives with her partner and children in a flat in central London.

Definition: The flavor of a food or drink is its taste.
Example: I always add some paprika for extra flavor.

Definition: If you flee from something or someone, or flee a person or thing, you escape from them.
Example: He slammed the bedroom door behind him and fled.

Definition: Flesh is the soft part of a person's or animal's body between the bones and the skin.
Example: ...maggots which eat away dead flesh.

Definition: A flight is a journey made by flying, usually in an aeroplane.
Example: The flight will take four hours.

Definition:
If something or someone is floating in a liquid, they are in the liquid, on or just below the surface, and are being
supported by it. You can also float something on a liquid.
Example: They noticed fifty and twenty dollar bills floating in the water.

Definition: The floor of a room is the part of it that you walk on.
Example: Jack's sitting on the floor watching TV.

Definition: If a liquid, gas, or electrical current flows somewhere, it moves there steadily and continuously.
Example: A stream flowed gently down into the valley.

Definition:
A flower is the part of a plant which is often brightly coloured, grows at the end of a stem,
and only survives for a short time.
Example: Each individual flower is tiny.

Definition:
A fly is a small insect with two wings. There are many kinds of flies, and the most common
are black in colour.
Example: The planes flew through the clouds.

Definition: If you focus on a particular topic or if your attention is focused on it, you concentrate on it and think about it, discuss it, or deal with it, rather than dealing with other topics.
Example:
The research effort has focused on tracing the effects of growing levels of five
compounds.

Definition: You can refer to people as folk or folks.
Example: Country folk can tell you that there are certain places which animals avoid.

Definition: If you follow someone who is going somewhere, you move along behind them because you want to go to the same place.
Example: We followed him up the steps into a large hall.

Definition: Following a particular event means after that event.
Example:
In the centuries following Christ's death, Christians genuinely believed the world
was about to end.

Definition: Food is what people and animals eat.
Example: Enjoy your food.

Definition: Your feet are the parts of your body that are at the ends of your legs, and that you stand on.
Example: She stamped her foot again.

Definition: Football is a game played by two teams of eleven players using a round ball. Players kick the ball to each other and try to score goals by kicking the ball into a large net.
Example: Several boys were still playing football on the waste ground.

Definition: If something is for someone, they are intended to have it or benefit from it.
Example: Isn't that enough for you?

Definition: If someone forces you to do something, they make you do it even though you do not want to, for example by threatening you.
Example: The gunman forced a woman to drive him across the city, stopping to shoot at bystanders.

Definition: Something or someone that is foreign comes from or relates to a country that is not your own.
Example: ...a huge attraction for foreign visitors.

Definition: A forest is a large area where trees grow close together.
Example: Parts of the forest are still dense and inaccessible.

Definition: If you say that something will happen or continue forever, you mean that it will always happen or continue.
Example: I think that we will live together forever.

Definition: If you forget something or forget how to do something, you cannot think of it or think how to do it, although you knew it or knew how to do it in the past.
Example: Sometimes I improvise and change the words because I forget them.

Definition: A form of something is a type or kind of it.
Example: He contracted a rare form of cancer.

Definition: Formal speech or behaviour is very correct and serious rather than relaxed and friendly, and is used especially in official situations.
Example: He wrote a very formal letter of apology to Douglas.

Definition: The formation of something is the starting or creation of it.
Example: ...the formation of a new government.

Definition: Former is used to describe someone who used to have a particular job, position, or role, but no longer has it.
Example: The unemployed executives include former sales managers, directors and accountants.

Definition: A formula is a plan that is invented in order to deal with a particular problem.
Example:
It is difficult to imagine how the North and South could ever agree on a formula
to unify the divided peninsula.

Definition: When someone goes forth from a place, they leave it.
Example: Go forth into the desert.

Definition: You can refer to a large sum of money as a fortune or a small fortune to emphasize how large it is.
Example: We had to eat out all the time. It ended up costing a fortune.

Definition:
If you move or look forward, you move or look in a direction that is in front of you. In British English, you
can also move or look forwards.
Example: The music is used to forward the plot, not simply to keep the toes tapping.

Definition: Found is the past tense and past participle of find.
Example: The Independent Labour Party was founded in Bradford on January 13, 1893.

Definition: The foundation of something such as a belief or way of life is the things on which it is based.
Example: Best friends are the foundation of my life.

Definition: The founder of an institution, organization, or building is the person who got it started or caused it to be built, often by providing the necessary money.
Example: He was one of the founders of the university's medical faculty.

Definition: Four is the number 4.
Example: Judith is married with four children.

Definition: The fourth item in a series is the one that you count as number four.
Example: He ended up just outside the medals in fourth place.

Definition: The frame of a picture or mirror is the wood, metal, or plastic that is fitted around it, especially when it is displayed or hung on a wall.
Example: Estelle kept a photograph of her mother in a silver frame on the kitchen mantelpiece.

Definition: A framework is a particular set of rules, ideas, or beliefs which you use in order to deal with problems or to decide what to do.
Example: ... within the framework of federal regulations.

Definition: If something is free, you can have it or use it without paying for it.
Example: The seminars are free, with lunch provided.

Definition: Freedom is the state of being allowed to do what you want to do. Freedoms are instances of this.
Example: ...freedom of speech.

Definition: If a liquid or a substance containing a liquid freezes, or if something freezes it, it becomes solid because of low temperatures.
Example: If the temperature drops below 0C, water freezes.

Definition: French means belonging or relating to France, or to its people, language, or culture.
Example: ...the French parliament.

Definition: The frequency of an event is the number of times it happens during a particular period.
Example: The frequency of Kara's phone calls increased rapidly.

Definition: If something is frequent, it happens often.
Example: Bordeaux is on the main Paris-Madrid line so there are frequent trains.

Definition: at frequent or brief intervals; often
Example: He wrote frequently: long, affectionate, amusing letters recounting the latest gossip from the set.

Definition: A fresh thing or amount replaces or is added to a previous thing or amount.
Example:
He asked Strathclyde police, which carried out the original investigation, to make
fresh inquiries.

Definition: A friend is someone who you know well and like, but who is not related to you.
Example: I had a long talk about this with my best friend.

Definition: If someone is friendly, they behave in a pleasant, kind way, and like to be with other people.
Example: Godfrey had been friendly to me.

Definition: A friendship is a relationship between two or more friends.
Example: Giving advice when it's not called for is the quickest way to end a good friendship.

Definition: If something comes from a particular person or thing, or if you get something from them, they give it to you or they are the source of it.
Example: He appealed for information from anyone who saw the attackers.

Definition: The front of something is the part of it that faces you, or that faces forward, or that you normally see or use.
Example: One man sat in an armchair, and the other sat on the front of the desk.

Definition: Fruit or a fruit is something which grows on a tree or bush and which contains seeds or a stone covered by a substance that you can eat.
Example: Fresh fruit and vegetables provide fibre and vitamins.

Definition: the condition of being frustrated
Example: Moments of anger or frustration would spill out and it rarely helped me win.

Definition: Fuel is a substance such as coal, oil, or petrol that is burned to provide heat or power.
Example: They ran out of fuel.

Definition: If something is full, it contains as much of a substance or as many objects as it can.
Example: Once the container is full, it stays shut until you turn it clockwise.

Definition: Fully means to the greatest degree or extent possible.
Example: She was fully aware of my thoughts.

Definition: You refer to an activity or situation as fun if you think it is pleasant and enjoyable and it causes you to feel happy.
Example: This year promises to be terrifically good fun.

Definition: The function of something or someone is the useful thing that they do or are intended to do.
Example: The main function of the merchant banks is to raise capital for industry.

Definition: Funds are amounts of money that are available to be spent, especially money that is given to an organization or person for a particular purpose.
Example: The charity raises funds for research into Duchenne muscular dystrophy.

Definition: You use fundamental to describe things, activities, and principles that are very important or essential. They affect the basic nature of other things or are the most important element upon which other things depend.
Example: Our constitution embodies all the fundamental principles of democracy.

Definition: Funding is money which a government or organization provides for a particular purpose.
Example: They hope for government funding for the scheme.

Definition: A funeral is the ceremony that is held when the body of someone who has died is buried or cremated.
Example: His funeral will be on Thursday at Blackburn Cathedral.

Definition: Someone or something that is funny is amusing and likely to make you smile or laugh.
Example: Wade was smart and not bad-looking, and he could be funny when he wanted to.

Definition: Furniture consists of large objects such as tables, chairs, or beds that are used in a room for sitting or lying on or for putting things on or in.
Example: Each piece of furniture in their home suited the style of the house.

Definition: Furthermore is used to introduce a piece of information or opinion that adds to or supports the previous one.
Example: Furthermore, they claim that any such interference is completely ineffective.

Definition: The future is the period of time that will come after the present, or the things that will happen then.
Example: The spokesman said no decision on the proposal was likely in the immediate future.

Definition: If a person or place gains something such as an ability or quality, they gradually get more of it.
Example: Students can gain valuable experience by working on the campus radio or magazine.

Definition: A galaxy is an extremely large group of stars and planets that extends over many billions of light years.
Example: Astronomers have discovered a distant galaxy.

Definition: A gallery is a place that has permanent exhibitions of works of art in it.
Example: ...an art gallery.

Definition:
A game is an activity or sport usually involving skill, knowledge, or chance, in which you
follow fixed rules and try to win against an opponent or to solve a puzzle.
Example: ...the wonderful game of football.

Definition: A gang is a group of people, especially young people, who go around together and often deliberately cause trouble.
Example: During the fight with a rival gang he lashed out with his flick knife.

Definition: A gap is a space between two things or a hole in the middle of something solid.
Example: He pulled the thick curtains together, leaving just a narrow gap.

Definition: A garage is a building in which you keep a car. A garage is often built next to or as part of a house.
Example: Nancy took her car to a local garage for a check-up.

Definition:
In British English, a garden is a piece of land next to a house, with flowers, vegetables, other plants, and often grass. In American
English, the usual word is yard, and a garden refers only to land which is used for growing flowers and vegetables.
Example: ...the most beautiful garden on Earth.

Definition: Garlic is the small, white, round bulb of a plant that is related to the onion plant. Garlic has a very strong smell and taste and is used in cooking.
Example: ...a clove of garlic.

Definition: Gas is a substance like air that is neither liquid nor solid and burns easily. It is used as a fuel for cooking and heating.
Example: Coal is actually cheaper than gas.

Definition: A gate is a structure like a door which is used at the entrance to a field, a garden, or the grounds of a building.
Example: He opened the gate and started walking up to the house.

Definition: If people gather somewhere or if someone gathers people somewhere, they come together in a group.
Example: In the evenings, we gathered around the fireplace and talked.

Definition: A gay person is homosexual.
Example: ...the gay community.

Definition: If you gaze at someone or something, you look steadily at them for a long time, for example because you find them attractive or interesting, or because you are thinking about something else.
Example: She stood gazing at herself in the mirror.

Definition:
The gears on a machine or vehicle are a device for changing the rate at which energy is changed
into motion.
Example: Colleges are not always geared to the needs of mature students.

Definition: Gender is the state of being male or female in relation to the social and cultural roles that are considered appropriate for men and women.
Example: It is illegal to discriminate on the grounds of race, gender or sexual orientation.

Definition: A gene is the part of a cell in a living thing which controls its physical characteristics, growth, and development.
Example: Perhaps because the search for more efficient egg production now involves jellyfish genes.

Definition: A general is a senior officer in the armed forces, usually in the army.
Example: He rose through the ranks to become a general.

Definition: You use generally to give a summary of a situation, activity, or idea without referring to the particular details of it.
Example: University teachers generally have admitted a lack of enthusiasm about their subjects.

Definition: To generate something means to cause it to begin and develop.
Example: The Employment Minister said the reforms would generate new jobs.

Definition: A generation is all the people in a group or country who are of a similar age, especially when they are considered as having the same experiences or attitudes.
Example: ...the younger generation of Party members.

Definition: You use genetic to describe something that is concerned with genetics or with genes.
Example: Cystic fibrosis is the most common fatal genetic disease in the United States.

Definition: A gentleman is a man who comes from a family of high social standing.
Example: ...this wonderful portrait of English gentleman Joseph Greenway.

Definition: in a gentle manner or to a gentle degree
Example: Adrina rolled her eyes, but she put her arms around him and hugged him gently.

Definition: German means belonging or relating to Germany, or to its people, language, or culture.
Example: Shares in both German carmakers fell.

Definition: A gesture is a movement that you make with a part of your body, especially your hands, to express emotion or information.
Example: Sarah made a menacing gesture with her fist.

Definition: You use get with adjectives to mean 'become'. For example, if someone gets cold, they become cold, and if they get angry, they become angry.
Example: The boys were getting bored.

Definition: A ghost is the spirit of a dead person that someone believes they can see or feel.
Example: ...the ghost of Marie Antoinette.

Definition: Something that is described as giant is much larger or more important than most others of its kind.
Example: ...Italy's giant car maker, Fiat.

Definition: A gift is something that you give someone as a present.
Example: ...a gift of $50.00.

Definition: Someone who is gifted has a natural ability to do something well.
Example: ...one of the most gifted players in the world.

Definition: A girl is a female child.
Example: ...an eleven year old girl.

Definition: Someone's girlfriend is a girl or woman with whom they are having a romantic or sexual relationship.
Example: He had been going out with his girlfriend for seven months.

Definition: You can use give with nouns that refer to physical actions. The whole expression refers to the performing of the action. For example, She gave a smile means almost the same as 'She smiled'.
Example: She stretched her arms out and gave a great yawn.

Definition: Given is the past participle of give1.
Example: In chess there are typically about 36 legal moves from any given board position.

Definition: If you are glad about something, you are happy and pleased about it.
Example: I'm glad I relented in the end.

Definition: If you glance at something or someone, you look at them very quickly and then look away again immediately.
Example: He glanced at his watch.

Definition: Glass is a hard transparent substance that is used to make things such as windows and bottles.
Example: ...a pane of glass.

Definition: You can use global to describe something that happens in all parts of the world or affects all parts of the world.
Example: ...a global ban on nuclear testing.

Definition: Gloves are pieces of clothing which cover your hands and wrists and have individual sections for each finger. You wear gloves to keep your hands warm or dry or to protect them.
Example: He stuck his gloves in his pocket.

Definition: When you go somewhere, you move or travel there.
Example: We went to Rome.

Definition: In games such as football, netball, or hockey, the goal is the space into which the players try to get the ball in order to score a point for their team.
Example: The keeper was back in goal after breaking a knuckle.

Definition: The name God is given to the spirit or being who is worshipped as the creator and ruler of the world, especially by Jews, Christians, and Muslims.
Example: He believes in God.

Definition: Gold is a valuable, yellow-coloured metal that is used for making jewellery and ornaments, and as an international currency.
Example: ...a sapphire set in gold.

Definition: Something that is golden is bright yellow in colour.
Example: She combed and arranged her golden hair.

Definition: Golf is a game in which you use long sticks called clubs to hit a small, hard ball into holes that are spread out over a large area of grassy land.
Example: The pair wanted to inspire more people with disabilities to play golf.

Definition: Good means pleasant or enjoyable.
Example: We had a really good time together.

Definition: The government of a country is the group of people who are responsible for governing it.
Example: The Government has insisted that confidence is needed before the economy can improve.

Definition: In some systems of government, a governor is a person who is in charge of the political administration of a region or state.
Example: He was governor of the province in the late 1970s.

Definition: If you grab something, you take it or pick it up suddenly and roughly.
Example: I managed to grab her hand.

Definition: If something is graded, its quality is judged, and it is often given a number or a name that indicates how good or bad it is.
Example: Dust masks are graded according to the protection they offer.

Definition: If something changes or is done gradually, it changes or is done in small stages over a long period of time, rather than suddenly.
Example: Electricity lines to 30,000 homes were gradually being restored yesterday.

Definition:
In Britain, a graduate is a person who has successfully completed a degree at a university or college and
has received a certificate that shows this.
Example: ...graduates in engineering.

Definition: A grain of wheat, rice, or other cereal crop is a seed from it.
Example: ...a grain of wheat.

Definition: If you describe a building or a piece of scenery as grand, you mean that its size or appearance is very impressive.
Example: ...this grand building in the center of town.

Definition: Your grandfather is the father of your father or mother. You can call your grandfather 'Grandfather'.
Example: His grandfather was a professor.

Definition: Your grandmother is the mother of your father or mother. You can call your grandmother 'Grandmother'.
Example: My grandmothers are both widows.

Definition: A grant is an amount of money that a government or other institution gives to an individual or to an organization for a particular purpose such as education or home improvements.
Example: They'd got a special grant to encourage research.

Definition: Grass is a very common plant consisting of large numbers of thin, spiky, green leaves that cover the surface of the ground.
Example: Small things stirred in the grass around the tent.

Definition: A grave is a place where a dead person is buried.
Example: They used to visit her grave twice a year.

Definition: the derived SI unit of absorbed ionizing radiation dose or kerma equivalent to an absorption per unit mass of one joule per kilogram of irradiated material. 1 gray is equivalent to 100 rads
Example: The ambiguities and gray areas of life do not bother you.

Definition: You use great to describe something that is very large. Great is more formal than big.
Example: The room had a great bay window.
How strange, thought the Countess, that the streets which are so elegant and crime-free are the ones with the greatest protection.

Definition: Green is the colour of grass or leaves.
Example: ...shiny red and green apples.

Definition: A grocery or a grocery store is a grocer's shop.
Example: On the corner stood what seemed to me the largest grocery store in the world.

Definition: The ground is the surface of the earth.
Example: Forty or fifty women were sitting cross-legged on the ground.

Definition:
A group of people or things is a number of people or things which are together in one place
at one time.
Example: The trouble involved a small group of football supporters.

Definition: When people, animals, and plants grow, they increase in size and change physically over a period of time.
Example: We stop growing at maturity.

Definition: increasing
Example: GROWING numbers of angry consumers are taking financial companies such as insurers and investment managers to court in an attempt to claim compensation.

Definition: The growth of something such as an industry, organization, or idea is its development in size, wealth, or importance.
Example: ...the growth of nationalism.

Definition: If one thing guarantees another, the first is certain to cause the second thing to happen.
Example: Surplus resources alone do not guarantee growth.

Definition: If you guard a place, person, or object, you stand near them in order to watch and protect them.
Example: Gunmen guarded homes near the cemetery with shotguns.

Definition: If you guess something, you give an answer or provide an opinion which may not be true because you do not have definite knowledge about the matter concerned.
Example:
The suit was faultless: Wood guessed that he was a very successful publisher or a
banker.

Definition: A guest is someone who is visiting you or is at an event because you have invited them.
Example: She was a guest at the wedding.

Definition: A guide is a book that gives you information or instructions to help you do or understand something.
Example: Our 10-page guide will help you to change your life for the better.

Definition: If an organization issues guidelines on something, it issues official advice about how to do it.
Example: The government should issue clear guidelines on the content of religious education.

Definition: If you feel guilty, you feel unhappy because you think that you have done something wrong or have failed to do something which you should have done.
Example: I feel so guilty, leaving all this to you.

Definition: A gun is a weapon from which bullets or other things are fired.
Example: He produced a gun and he came into the house.

Definition: A guy is a man.
Example: I was working with a guy from Manchester.

Definition: A habit is something that you do often or regularly.
Example: He has an endearing habit of licking his lips when he's nervous.

Definition: The habitat of an animal or plant is the natural environment in which it normally lives or grows.
Example: In its natural habitat, the hibiscus will grow up to 25ft.

Definition: Your hair is the fine threads that grow in a mass on your head.
Example: I wash my hair every night.

Definition:
Half of an amount or object is one of two equal parts that together make up the whole number,
amount, or object.
Example: They need an extra two and a half thousand pounds to complete the project.

Definition: The hall in a house or flat is the area just inside the front door, into which some of the other rooms open.
Example: The lights were on in the hall and in the bedroom.

Definition:
Your hands are the parts of your body at the end of your arms. Each hand has four fingers and
a thumb.
Example: I put my hand into my pocket and pulled out the letter.

Definition: A handful of people or things is a small number of them.
Example: He surveyed the handful of customers at the bar.

Definition: A handle is a small round object or a lever that is attached to a door and is used for opening and closing it.
Example: I turned the handle and found the door was open.

Definition: If something hangs in a high place or position, or if you hang it there, it is attached there so it does not touch the ground.
Example: Notices painted on sheets hang at every entrance.

Definition: Something that happens occurs or is done without being planned.
Example: We cannot say for sure what will happen.

Definition: Someone who is happy has feelings of pleasure, usually because something nice has happened or because they feel satisfied with their life.
Example: Marina was a confident, happy child.

Definition: Something that is hard is very firm and stiff to touch and is not easily bent, cut, or broken.
Example: He shuffled his feet on the hard wooden floor.

Definition: You use hardly to modify a statement when you want to emphasize that it is only a small amount or detail which makes it true, and that therefore it is best to consider the opposite statement as being true.
Example: I hardly know you.

Definition: A hat is a head covering, often with a brim round it, which is usually worn out of doors to give protection from the weather.
Example: ...putting on my nationalistic hat.

Definition: If you hate someone or something, you have an extremely strong feeling of dislike for them.
Example: Most people hate him, but they don't dare to say so, because he still rules the country.

Definition: You use the forms have and has with a past participle to form the present perfect tense of verbs.
Example: Alex has already gone.

Definition: You use he to refer to a man, boy, or male animal.
Example: He could never quite remember all our names.

Definition: Your head is the top part of your body, which has your eyes, mouth, and brain in it.
Example: ...the head of the queue.

Definition: A headline is the title of a newspaper story, printed in large letters at the top of the story, especially on the front page.
Example: The Daily Mail has the headline 'The Voice of Conscience'.

Definition: The headquarters of an organization are its main offices.
Example: ...fraud squad officers from London's police headquarters.

Definition: A person's health is the condition of their body and the extent to which it is free from illness or is able to resist illness.
Example: Caffeine is bad for your health.

Definition: Someone who is healthy is well and is not suffering from any illness.
Example: Most of us need to lead more balanced lives to be healthy and happy.

Definition: When you hear a sound, you become aware of it through your ears.
Example: She heard no further sounds.

Definition: A person's or animal's hearing is the sense which makes it possible for them to be aware of sounds.
Example: His mind still seemed clear and his hearing was excellent.

Definition: Your heart is the organ in your chest that pumps the blood around your body. People also use heart to refer to the area of their chest that is closest to their heart.
Example: The bullet had passed less than an inch from Andrea's heart.

Definition: When you heat something, you raise its temperature, for example by using a flame or a special piece of equipment.
Example: Meanwhile, heat the tomatoes and oil in a pan.

Definition: In some religions, heaven is said to be the place where God lives, where good people go when they die, and where everyone is always happy. It is usually imagined as being high up in the sky.
Example: I believed that when I died I would go to heaven and see God.

Definition: If someone says something heavily, they say it in a slow way which shows a feeling such as sadness, tiredness, or annoyance.
Example: 'I didn't even think about her,' he said heavily.

Definition: Something that is heavy weighs a lot.
Example: These scissors are awfully heavy.

Definition: Your heel is the back part of your foot, just below your ankle.
Example: He kicked it shut with the heel of his boot.

Definition: The height of a person or thing is their size or length from the bottom to the top.
Example: Her weight is about normal for her height.

Definition: A helicopter is an aircraft with long blades on top that go round very fast. It is able to stay still in the air and to move straight upwards or downwards.
Example: Local football games were abandoned so police helicopters could use the pitches to land on.

Definition: In some religions, hell is the place where the Devil lives, and where wicked people are sent to be punished when they die. Hell is usually imagined as being under the ground and full of flames.
Example: Bullies can make your life hell.

Definition: You say 'Hello' to someone when you meet them.
Example: Hello, Trish.

Definition:
If you help someone, you make it easier for them to do something, for example by doing part of the work for them or by giving
them advice or money.
Example: He has helped to raise a lot of money.

Definition: If you describe someone as helpful, you mean that they help you in some way, such as doing part of your job for you or by giving you advice or information.
Example: The staff in the London office are helpful but only have limited information.

Definition: You use her to refer to a woman, girl, or female animal.
Example: I went in the room and told her I had something to say to her.

Definition: You use here when you are referring to the place where you are.
Example: I'm here all by myself and I know I'm going to get lost.

Definition: A country's heritage is all the qualities, traditions, or features of life there that have continued over many years and have been passed on from one generation to another.
Example: The historic building is as much part of our heritage as the paintings.

Definition: The hero of a book, play, film, or story is the main male character, who usually has good qualities.
Example: The hero of Doctor Zhivago dies in 1929.

Definition: You use herself to refer to a woman, girl, or female animal.
Example: She let herself out of the room.

Definition: In informal situations, you say or shout 'hey' to attract someone's attention, or to show surprise, interest, or annoyance.
Example: 'Hey! Look out!' shouted Patty.

Definition: In informal situations, you say 'hi' to greet someone.
Example: 'Hi, Liz,' she said shyly.

Definition: If you hide something or someone, you put them in a place where they cannot easily be seen or found.
Example: He hid the bicycle in the hawthorn hedge.

Definition: Something that is high extends a long way from the bottom to the top when it is upright. You do not use high to describe people, animals, or plants.
Example: ...a house, with a high wall all around it.

Definition: If someone or something highlights a point or problem, they emphasize it or make you think about it.
Example: ...a moving ballad which highlighted the plight of the homeless.

Definition: Highly is used before some adjectives to mean 'very'.
Example: Mr Singh was a highly successful civil engineer.

Definition: A highway is a main road, especially one that connects towns or cities.
Example: I crossed the highway, dodging the traffic.

Definition: A hill is an area of land that is higher than the land that surrounds it.
Example: We trudged up the hill to the stadium.

Definition: You use him to refer to a man, boy, or male animal.
Example: John's aunt died suddenly and left him a surprisingly large sum.

Definition: You use himself to refer to a man, boy, or male animal.
Example: He smiles, pouring himself a cup of coffee.

Definition:
Your hips are the two areas at the sides of your body between the tops of your legs and your
waist.
Example: Tracey put her hands on her hips and sighed.

Definition: If you hire someone, you employ them or pay them to do a particular job for you.
Example: Sixteen of the contestants have hired lawyers and are suing the organisers.

Definition: You use his to indicate that something belongs or relates to a man, boy, or male animal.
Example: Brian splashed water on his face, then brushed his teeth.

Definition: A historian is a person who specializes in the study of history, and who writes books and articles about it.
Example: American religious historians like me usually do not spend much time thinking about the rationale for doing what we do.

Definition: Something that is historic is important in history, or likely to be considered important at some time in the future.
Example: King gave this historic speech the night before he was assassinated.

Definition: Historical people, situations, or things existed in the past and are considered to be a part of history.
Example: ...an important historical figure.

Definition: You can refer to the events of the past as history. You can also refer to the past events which concern a particular topic or place as its history.
Example: History is full of seemingly minor events leading to international showdowns.

Definition: If you hit someone or something, you deliberately touch them with a lot of force, with your hand or an object held in your hand.
Example: Find the exact grip that allows you to hit the ball hard.

Definition: When you hold something, you carry or support it, using your hands or your arms.
Example: Hold the knife at an angle.

Definition: A hole is a hollow space in something solid, with an opening on one side.
Example: He took a shovel, dug a hole, and buried his once-prized possessions.

Definition: A holiday is a period of time during which you relax and enjoy yourself away from home. People sometimes refer to their holiday as their holidays.
Example: I've just come back from a holiday in the United States.

Definition: If you describe something as holy, you mean that it is considered to be special because it is connected with God or a particular religion.
Example: To them, as to all Christians, this is a holy place.

Definition: Someone's home is the house or flat where they live.
Example: Last night they stayed at home and watched TV.

Definition: Homeless people have nowhere to live.
Example: ...the growing number of homeless families.

Definition: If you describe someone as honest, you mean that they always tell the truth, and do not try to deceive people or break the law.
Example: My dad was the most honest man I ever met.

Definition: Honey is a sweet, sticky, yellowish substance that is made by bees.
Example: Honey, I don't really think that's a good idea.

Definition: high regard or great respect given, received, or enjoyed
Example: to conduct oneself with honor

Definition: If you hope that something is true, or if you hope for something, you want it to be true or to happen, and you usually believe that it is possible or likely.
Example:
She had decided she must go on as usual, follow her normal routine, and hope and
pray.

Definition: The horizon is the line in the far distance where the sky seems to meet the land or the sea.
Example: A grey smudge appeared on the horizon. That must be Calais, thought Fay.

Definition: Horror is a feeling of great shock, fear, and worry caused by something extremely unpleasant.
Example: I felt numb with horror.

Definition: A horse is a large animal which people can ride. Some horses are used for pulling ploughs and carts.
Example: A small man on a grey horse had appeared.

Definition: A hospital is a place where people who are ill are looked after by nurses and doctors.
Example: ...a children's hospital with 120 beds.

Definition: The host at a party is the person who has invited the guests and provides the food, drink, or entertainment.
Example: Apart from my host, I didn't know a single person there.

Definition: Something that is hot has a high temperature.
Example: When the oil is hot, add the sliced onion.

Definition: A hotel is a building where people stay, for example on holiday, paying for their rooms and meals.
Example: You could walk to the mall from both hotels we stayed in.

Definition: An hour is a period of sixty minutes.
Example: They waited for about two hours.

Definition: A house is a building in which people live, usually the people belonging to one family.
Example: She has moved to a smaller house.

Definition: A household is all the people in a family or group who live together in a house.
Example: ...growing up in a male-only household.

Definition: You refer to the buildings in which people live as housing when you are talking about their standard, price, or availability.
Example: ...a shortage of affordable housing.

Definition: You use how to ask about the way in which something happens or is done.
Example: How do I make payments into my account?

Definition: You use however when you are adding a comment which is surprising or which contrasts with what has just been said.
Example:
This was not an easy decision. It is, however, a decision that we feel is dictated
by our duty.

Definition: Something or someone that is huge is extremely large in size.
Example: ...a tiny little woman with huge black glasses.

Definition: Human means relating to or concerning people.
Example: ...the human body.

Definition: any fluid or juice of an animal or plant; esp., any of the four fluids ( cardinal humors) formerly considered responsible for one's health and disposition; blood, phlegm, choler, or melancholy
Example: the aqueous humor

Definition: A hundred or one hundred is the number 100.
Example: According to one official more than a hundred people have been arrested.

Definition: When you are hungry, you want some food because you have not eaten for some time and have an uncomfortable or painful feeling in your stomach.
Example: My friend was hungry, so we drove to a shopping mall to get some food.

Definition: A hunter is a person who hunts wild animals for food or as a sport.
Example: The hunters stalked their prey.

Definition: Hunting is the chasing and killing of wild animals by people or other animals, for food or as a sport.
Example: Deer hunting was banned in Scotland in 1959.

Definition: If you hurt yourself or hurt a part of your body, you feel pain because you have injured yourself.
Example: Yasin had seriously hurt himself while trying to escape from the police.

Definition: Someone's husband is the man they are married to.
Example: Eva married her husband Jack in 1957.

Definition: A hypothesis is an idea which is suggested as a possible explanation for a particular situation or condition, but which has not yet been proved to be correct.
Example: To test this hypothesis, scientists can construct a simplified laboratory experiment.

Definition: I is the ninth letter of the English alphabet.
Example: Jim and I are getting married.

Definition: Ice is frozen water.
Example: Glaciers are moving rivers of ice.

Definition: An idea is a plan, suggestion, or possible course of action.
Example: It's a good idea to plan ahead.

Definition: An ideal is a principle, idea, or standard that seems very good and worth trying to achieve.
Example: The party has drifted too far from its socialist ideals.

Definition: The identification of something is the recognition that it exists, is important, or is true.
Example: Early identification of a disease can prevent death and illness.

Definition: If you can identify someone or something, you are able to recognize them or distinguish them from others.
Example:
There are a number of distinguishing characteristics by which you can identify a
Hollywood epic.

Definition: Your identity is who you are.
Example: Abu is not his real name, but it's one he uses to disguise his identity.

Definition: i.e. is used to introduce a word or sentence which makes what you have just said clearer or gives details.
Example: ...strategic pointsi.e. airports or military bases.

Definition: You use if in conditional sentences to introduce the circumstances in which an event or situation might happen, might be happening, or might have happened.
Example: She gets very upset if I exclude her.

Definition: If you ignore someone or something, you pay no attention to them.
Example: Why are you ignoring me?

Definition: Someone who is ill is suffering from a disease or a health problem.
Example: In November 1941 Payne was seriously ill with pneumonia.

Definition: If something is illegal, the law says that it is not allowed.
Example: It is illegal to intercept radio messages.

Definition: Illness is the fact or experience of being ill.
Example: If your child shows any signs of illness, take her to the doctor.

Definition: If you say that something illustrates a situation that you are drawing attention to, you mean that it shows that the situation exists.
Example: The example of the United States illustrates this point.

Definition: If you have an image of something or someone, you have a picture or idea of them in your mind.
Example: The image of art theft as a gentleman's crime is outdated.

Definition:
Your imagination is the ability that you have to form pictures or ideas in your mind of things that
are new and exciting, or things that you have not experienced.
Example: Antonia is a woman with a vivid imagination.

Definition: If you imagine something, you think about it and your mind forms a picture or idea of it.
Example: He could not imagine a more peaceful scene.

Definition: An immediate result, action, or reaction happens or is done without any delay.
Example: These tragic incidents have had an immediate effect.

Definition: If something happens immediately, it happens without any delay.
Example: He immediately flung himself to the floor.

Definition: An immigrant is a person who has come to live in a country from some other country. Compare emigrant.
Example: ...illegal immigrants.

Definition: Immigration is the coming of people into a country in order to live and work there.
Example: The government has decided to tighten its immigration policy.

Definition: The impact that something has on a situation, process, or person is a sudden and powerful effect that it has on them.
Example: They say they expect the meeting to have a marked impact on the future of the country.

Definition: If you implement something such as a plan, you ensure that what has been planned is done.
Example: The government promised to implement a new system to control financial loan institutions.

Definition: The implications of something are the things that are likely to happen as a result.
Example: The Attorney General was aware of the political implications of his decision to prosecute.

Definition: If you imply that something is the case, you say something which indicates that it is the case in an indirect way.
Example: 'Are you implying that I have something to do with those attacks?' she asked coldly.

Definition: The importance of something is its quality of being significant, valued, or necessary in a particular situation.
Example: We have always stressed the importance of economic reform.

Definition: Something that is important is very significant, is highly valued, or is necessary.
Example: Her sons are the most important thing in her life.

Definition: If you impose something on people, you use your authority to force them to accept it.
Example: Britain imposed fines on airlines which bring in passengers without proper papers.

Definition: Something that is impossible cannot be done or cannot happen.
Example: It was impossible for anyone to get in because no one knew the password.

Definition: If something impresses you, you feel great admiration for it.
Example: What impressed him most was their speed.

Definition: Your impression of a person or thing is what you think they are like, usually after having seen or heard them. Your impression of a situation is what you think is going on.
Example: What were your first impressions of college?

Definition: Something that is impressive impresses you, for example because it is great in size or degree, or is done with a great deal of skill.
Example: It is an impressive achievement.

Definition: If something improves or if you improve it, it gets better.
Example: Both the texture and condition of your hair should improve.

Definition: If there is an improvement in something, it becomes better. If you make improvements to something, you make it better.
Example: ...the dramatic improvements in organ transplantation in recent years.

Definition: Someone or something that is in something else is enclosed by it or surrounded by it. If you put something in a container, you move it so that it is enclosed by the container.
Example: He was in his car.

Definition: If something is an incentive to do something, it encourages you to do it.
Example: There is little or no incentive to adopt such measures.

Definition: An incident is something that happens, often something that is unpleasant.
Example: These incidents were the latest in a series of disputes between the two nations.

Definition: If one thing includes another thing, it has the other thing as one of its parts.
Example: A good British breakfast always includes sausages.

Definition:
You use including to introduce examples of people or things that are part of the group of people or things that
you are talking about.
Example: Stars including Joan Collins are expected to attend.

Definition: A person's or organization's income is the money that they earn or receive, as opposed to the money that they have to spend or pay out.
Example: Many families on low incomes will be unable to afford to buy their own home.

Definition: If one thing incorporates another thing, it includes the other thing.
Example: The new cars will incorporate a number of major improvements.

Definition: If something increases or you increase it, it becomes greater in number, level, or amount.
Example: The population continues to increase.

Definition: greater; higher
Example: Increased demand has led to changes behind the scenes.

Definition: growing; rising
Example: The `old Tweed " Butler had waited for -- with increasing anxiety -- had surfaced.

Definition: You can use increasingly to indicate that a situation or quality is becoming greater in intensity or more common.
Example: He was finding it increasingly difficult to make decisions.

Definition: If you describe something or someone as incredible, you like them very much or are impressed by them, because they are extremely or unusually good.
Example: The wildflowers will be incredible after this rain.

Definition: You use indeed to confirm or agree with something that has just been said.
Example: Later, he admitted that the payments had indeed been made.

Definition: If a country has or gains independence, it has its own government and is not ruled by any other country.
Example: In 1816, Argentina declared its independence from Spain.

Definition:
If one thing or person is independent of another, they are separate and not connected, so the first one is not affected or
influenced by the second.
Example: Your questions should be independent of each other.

Definition: An index is a system by which changes in the value of something and the rate at which it changes can be recorded, measured, or interpreted.
Example: ...the U.K. retail price index.

Definition: Indian means belonging or relating to India, or to its people or culture.
Example: ...the Indian government.

Definition: If one thing indicates another, the first thing shows that the second is true or exists.
Example: A survey of retired people has indicated that most are independent and enjoying life.
