Definition: An indication is a sign which suggests, for example, what people are thinking or feeling.
Example: All the indications are that we are going to receive reasonable support from abroad.

Definition: Individual means relating to one person or thing, rather than to a large group.
Example: They wait for the group to decide rather than making individual decisions.

Definition: You use industrial to describe things which relate to or are used in industry.
Example: ...industrial machinery and equipment.

Definition: Industry is the work and processes involved in collecting raw materials, and making them into products in factories.
Example: British industry suffers through insufficient investment in research.

Definition: An infant is a baby or very young child.
Example: ...young mums with infants in prams.

Definition: An infection is a disease caused by germs or bacteria.
Example: Ear infections are common in pre-school children.

Definition: Inflation is a general increase in the prices of goods and services in a country.
Example: ...rising unemployment and high inflation.

Definition: Influence is the power to make other people agree with your opinions or do what you want.
Example: I have rather a large influence over a good many people.

Definition: If you inform someone of something, you tell them about it.
Example: They would inform him of any progress they had made.

Definition: Information about someone or something consists of facts about them.
Example: Pat refused to give her any information about Sarah.

Definition: Ingredients are the things that are used to make something, especially all the different foods you use when you are cooking a particular dish.
Example: Mix in the remaining ingredients.

Definition: You use initial to describe something that happens at the beginning of a process.
Example: The initial reaction has been excellent.

Definition: Initially means soon after the beginning of a process or situation, rather than in the middle or at the end of it.
Example: Forecasters say the gales may not be as bad as they initially predicted.

Definition: An initiative is an important act or statement that is intended to solve a problem.
Example: Government initiatives to help young people have been inadequate.

Definition: An injury is damage done to a person's or an animal's body.
Example: Four police officers sustained serious injuries in the explosion.

Definition: The inner parts of something are the parts which are contained or are enclosed inside the other parts, and which are closest to the centre.
Example: She got up and went into an inner office.

Definition: If someone is innocent, they did not commit a crime which they have been accused of.
Example: He was sure that the man was innocent of any crime.

Definition: An inquiry is a question which you ask in order to get some information.
Example: He made some inquiries and discovered she had gone to the Continent.

Definition: Something or someone that is inside a place, container, or object is in it or is surrounded by it.
Example: Inside the passport was a folded slip of paper.

Definition: If you gain insight or an insight into a complex situation or problem, you gain an accurate and deep understanding of it.
Example:
The project would give scientists new insights into what is happening to the Earth's
atmosphere.

Definition: If you insist that something should be done, you say so very firmly and refuse to give in about it. If you insist on something, you say firmly that it must be done or provided.
Example: My family insisted that I should not give in, but stay and fight.

Definition: If someone or something inspires you to do something new or unusual, they make you want to do it.
Example: These herbs will inspire you to try out all sorts of exotic-flavoured dishes!

Definition: If you install a piece of equipment, you fit it or put it somewhere so that it is ready to be used.
Example: They had installed a new phone line in the apartment.

Definition: You use for instance to introduce a particular event, situation, or person that is an example of what you are talking about.
Example: There are a number of improvements; for instance, both mouse buttons can now be used.

Definition: If you do not do something, but do something else instead, you do the second thing and not the first thing, as the result of a choice or a change of behaviour.
Example:
He reached for the glass but did not drink, pushed it, instead, across the table
towards Joanna.

Definition: An institution is a large important organization such as a university, church, or bank.
Example: ...the Institution of Civil Engineers.

Definition: Institutional means relating to a large organization, for example a university, bank, or church.
Example: NATO remains the United States' chief institutional anchor in Europe.

Definition: An instruction is something that someone tells you to do.
Example:
Two lawyers were told not to leave the building but no reason for this instruction
was given.

Definition: An instructor is someone who teaches a skill such as driving or skiing. In American English, instructor can also be used to refer to a schoolteacher or to a university teacher of low rank.
Example: ...tuition from an approved driving instructor.

Definition: An instrument is a tool or device that is used to do a particular task, especially a scientific task.
Example: ...a thin tube-like optical instrument.

Definition: Insurance is an arrangement in which you pay money to a company, and they pay money to you if something unpleasant happens to you, for example if your property is stolen or damaged, or if you get a serious illness.
Example: The insurance company paid out for the stolen jewellery and silver.

Definition: Intellectual means involving a person's ability to think and to understand ideas and information.
Example: High levels of lead could damage the intellectual development of children.

Definition: Intelligence is the quality of being intelligent or clever.
Example: She's a woman of exceptional intelligence.

Definition: If you intend to do something, you have decided or planned to do it.
Example: She intends to do A levels and go to university.

Definition: Intense is used to describe something that is very great or extreme in strength or degree.
Example: He was sweating from the intense heat.

Definition: the state or quality of being intense
Example: The cast are superb and bring together the right mix of intensity and intelligence.

Definition: An intention is an idea or plan of what you are going to do.
Example: Beveridge announced his intention of standing for parliament.

Definition: a mutual or reciprocal action or influence
Example: The social network encourages social interaction between neighbours, making people aware of crime in their area.

Definition: If you have an interest in something, you want to learn or hear more about it.
Example: There has been a lively interest in the elections in the last two weeks.

Definition: If you are interested in something, you think it is important and want to learn more about it or spend time doing it.
Example: I thought she might be interested in Paula's proposal.

Definition: If you find something interesting, it attracts your attention, for example because you think it is exciting or unusual.
Example: It was interesting to be in a different environment.

Definition: Internal is used to describe things that exist or happen inside a country or organization.
Example: The country stepped up internal security.

Definition: International means between or involving different countries.
Example: ...an international agreement against exporting arms to that country.

Definition: The internet is the computer network which allows computer users to connect with computers all over the world, and which carries email.
Example: All very twenty-first century, I bought my tickets over the internet.

Definition: If you interpret something in a particular way, you decide that this is its meaning or significance.
Example: The whole speech might well be interpreted as a coded message to the Americans.

Definition: An interpretation of something is an opinion about what it means.
Example: The government put a different interpretation on the figures.

Definition: Intervention is the act of intervening in a situation.
Example:
...the role of the United States and its intervention in the internal affairs of
many countries.

Definition: An interview is a formal meeting at which someone is asked questions in order to find out if they are suitable for a job or a course of study.
Example: When I went for my first interview for this job I arrived extremely early.

Definition: If you put one thing into another, you put the first thing inside the second.
Example: Combine the remaining ingredients and put them into a dish.

Definition: To introduce something means to cause it to enter a place or exist in a system for the first time.
Example: The Government has introduced a number of other money-saving moves.

Definition: The introduction to a book or talk is the part that comes at the beginning and tells you what the rest of the book or talk is about.
Example:
Ellen Malos, in her introduction to 'The Politics of Housework', provides a summary
of the debates.

Definition: If there is an invasion of a country, a foreign army enters it by force.
Example: ...seven years after the Roman invasion of Britain.

Definition: If you invest in something, or if you invest a sum of money, you use your money in a way that you hope will increase its value, for example by paying it into a bank, or buying shares or property.
Example: They intend to invest directly in shares.

Definition: If someone, especially an official, investigates an event, situation, or claim, they try to find out what happened or what is the truth.
Example:
Gas officials are investigating the cause of an explosion which badly damaged a house
in Hampshire.

Definition: the act or process of investigating; a careful search or examination in order to discover facts, etc
Example: Whether he was heading here to see accomplices or simply fleeing we shall have to wait and see what the investigation discovers.

Definition: An investigator is someone who carries out investigations, especially as part of their job.
Example: British air accident investigators were being sent to help with the inquiry.

Definition: Investment is the activity of investing money.
Example: He said the government must introduce tax incentives to encourage investment.

Definition: An investor is a person or organization that buys stocks or shares, or pays money into a bank in order to receive a profit.
Example: The main investor in the project is the French bank Credit National.

Definition: If you invite someone to something such as a party or a meal, you ask them to come to it.
Example: She invited him to her 26th birthday party in New Jersey.

Definition: If a situation or activity involves something, that thing is a necessary part or consequence of it.
Example: Running a kitchen involves a great deal of discipline and speed.

Definition: If you are involved in a situation or activity, you are taking part in it or have a strong connection with it.
Example: If she were involved in business, she would make a strong chief executive.

Definition: Your involvement in something is the fact that you are taking part in it.
Example: You have no proof of my involvement in anything.

Definition: Iraqi means belonging or relating to Iraq, or to its people or culture.
Example: ...the Iraqi ambassador to the U.S..

Definition: Irish means belonging or relating to Ireland, or to its people, language, or culture. Irish sometimes refers to the whole of Ireland, and sometimes only to the Republic of Ireland.
Example: ...the Prime Minister of the Irish Republic.

Definition:
Iron is an element which usually takes the form of a hard, dark-grey metal. It is used
to make steel, and also forms part of many tools, buildings, and vehicles. Very small
amounts of iron occur in your blood and in food.
Example: The huge, iron gate was locked.

Definition: Islamic means belonging or relating to Islam.
Example: ...Islamic law.

Definition: An island is a piece of land that is completely surrounded by water.
Example: ...a wonderful day trip to the picturesque island of Gozo.

Definition: Israeli means belonging or relating to Israel, or to its people or culture.
Example: ...the Israeli government.

Definition: An issue is an important subject that people are arguing about or discussing.
Example: Agents will raise the issue of prize-money for next year's world championships.

Definition: You use it to refer to an object, animal, or other thing that has already been mentioned.
Example:
He saw the grey Land-Rover down the by-pass. It was more than a hundred yards from
him.

Definition: Italian means belonging or relating to Italy, or to its people, language, or culture.
Example: I watch Italian football a lot.

Definition: An item is one of a collection or list of objects.
Example: The most valuable item on show will be a Picasso drawing.

Definition: You use its to indicate that something belongs or relates to a thing, place, or animal that has just been mentioned or whose identity is known. You can use its to indicate that something belongs or relates to a child or baby.
Example: The British Labor Party concludes its annual conference today in Brighton.

Definition: Itself is used as the object of a verb or preposition when it refers to something that is the same thing as the subject of the verb.
Example: ...remarkable new evidence showing how the body rebuilds itself while we sleep.

Definition: A jacket is a short coat with long sleeves.
Example: ...a black leather jacket.

Definition: A jail is a place where criminals are kept in order to punish them, or where people waiting to be tried are kept.
Example: Three prisoners escaped from a jail.

Definition: Japanese means belonging or relating to Japan, or to its people, language, or culture.
Example: Japanese firms are looking for a new breed of manager.

Definition: A jet is an aircraft that is powered by jet engines.
Example: Her private jet landed in the republic on the way to Japan.

Definition: A Jew is a person who believes in and practises the religion of Judaism.
Jewish means belonging or relating to the religion of Judaism or to Jews.
Example: ...the Jewish festival of the Passover.

Definition: A job is the work that someone does to earn money.
Example: Once I'm in America I can get a job.

Definition: If one person or vehicle joins another, they move or go to the same place, for example so that both of them can do something together.
Example: His wife and children moved to join him in their new home.

Definition: Joint means shared by or belonging to two or more people.
Example: She and Frank had never gotten around to opening a joint account.

Definition: A joke is something that is said or done to make you laugh, for example a funny story.
Example: He debated whether to make a joke about shooting rabbits, but decided against it.

Definition: A journal is a magazine, especially one that deals with a specialized subject.
Example: All our results are published in scientific journals.

Definition: A journalist is a person whose job is to collect news and write about it for newspapers, magazines, television, or radio.
Example: Only now has she permitted a journalist to write about it.

Definition: When you make a journey, you travel from one place to another.
Example:
There is an express service from Paris which completes the journey to Bordeaux in
under 4 hours.

Definition: Joy is a feeling of great happiness.
Example: Salter shouted with joy.

Definition: A judge is the person in a court of law who decides how the law should be applied, for example how criminals should be punished.
Example: The judge adjourned the hearing until next Tuesday.

Definition: A judgment is an opinion that you have or express after thinking carefully about something.
Example: In your judgment, what has changed over the past few years?

Definition: Juice is the liquid that can be obtained from a fruit.
Example: ...fresh orange juice.

Definition: If you jump, you bend your knees, push against the ground with your feet, and move quickly upwards into the air.
Example: I jumped over the fence.

Definition: A junior official or employee holds a low-ranking position in an organization or profession.
Example: Junior and middle-ranking civil servants have pledged to join the indefinite strike.

Definition: In a court of law, the jury is the group of people who have been chosen from the general public to listen to the facts about a crime and to decide whether the person accused is guilty or not.
Example: The jury convicted Mr Hampson of all offences.

Definition: You use just to say that something happened a very short time ago, or is starting to happen at the present time. For example, if you say that someone has just arrived, you mean that they arrived a very short time ago.
Example: I've just bought a new house.

Definition: Justice is fairness in the way that people are treated.
Example: He has a good overall sense of justice and fairness.

Definition: To justify a decision, action, or idea means to show or prove that it is reasonable or necessary.
Example: No argument can justify a war.

Definition: If someone keeps or is kept in a particular state, they remain in it.
Example: The noise kept him awake.

Definition:
A key is a specially shaped piece of metal that you place in a lock and turn in order to
open or lock a door, or to start or stop the engine of a vehicle.
Example: They put the key in the door and entered.

Definition: If you kick someone or something, you hit them forcefully with your foot.
Example: He kicked the door hard.

Definition: You can refer to a child as a kid.
Example: They've got three kids.

Definition: If a person, animal, or other living thing is killed, something or someone causes them to die.
Example: More than 1,000 people have been killed by the armed forces.

Definition: A killer is a person who has killed someone, or who intends to kill someone.
Example: The police are searching for his killers.

Definition: A killing is an act of deliberately killing a person.
Example: This is a brutal killing.

Definition: If you talk about a particular kind of thing, you are talking about one of the types or sorts of that thing.
Example: The party needs a different kind of leadership.

Definition: A king is a man who is the most important member of the royal family of his country, and who is considered to be the Head of State of that country.
Example: ...the king and queen of Spain.

Definition: If you kiss someone, you touch them with your lips to show affection or sexual desire, or to greet them or say goodbye.
Example: She leaned up and kissed him on the cheek.

Definition: A kitchen is a room that is used for cooking and for household jobs such as washing dishes.
Example: They leave the kitchen and bathroom a mess and it gets on my nerves.

Definition: Your knee is the place where your leg bends.
Example: He will receive physiotherapy on his damaged left knee.

Definition: A knife is a tool for cutting or a weapon and consists of a flat piece of metal with a sharp edge on the end of a handle.
Example: ...a knife and fork.

Definition: If you knock on something such as a door or window, you hit it, usually several times, to attract someone's attention.
Example: She went directly to Simon's apartment and knocked on the door.

Definition: If you know a fact, a piece of information, or an answer, you have it correctly in your mind.
Example: I don't know the name of the place.

Definition: Knowledge is information and understanding about a subject which a person has, or which all people have.
Example: She told Parliament she had no knowledge of the affair.

Definition: A lab is the same as a laboratory.
Example: ...Diane Abbott (Lab, Hackney North and Stoke Newington).

Definition: A label is a piece of paper or plastic that is attached to an object in order to give information about it.
Example: He peered at the label on the bottle.

Definition: physical or mental exertion; work; toil
Example: the car labored up the hill

Definition: A laboratory is a building or a room where scientific experiments, analyses, and research are carried out.
Example: The process developed in our laboratories will improve cancer survival rates.

Definition: If there is a lack of something, there is not enough of it or it does not exist at all.
Example: Despite his lack of experience, he got the job.

Definition: You can use lady when you are referring to a woman, especially when you are showing politeness or respect.
Example: She's a very sweet old lady.

Definition: A lake is a large area of fresh water, surrounded by land.
Example: They can go fishing in the lake.

Definition: Land is an area of ground, especially one that is used for a particular purpose such as farming or building.
Example: Good agricultural land is in short supply.

Definition: The landscape is everything you can see when you look across an area of land, including hills, rivers, buildings, trees, and plants.
Example: ...Arizona's desert landscape.

Definition:
A language is a system of communication which consists of a set of sounds and written symbols which are used by the people
of a particular country or region for talking or writing.
Example: ...the English language.

Definition: If you have something on your lap when you are sitting down, it is on top of your legs and near to your body.
Example: She waited quietly with her hands in her lap.

Definition: A large thing or person is greater in size than usual or average.
Example: The pike lives mainly in large rivers and lakes.

Definition: You use largely to say that a statement is not completely true but is mostly true.
Example: The fund is largely financed through government borrowing.

Definition: You use last in expressions such as last Friday, last night, and last year to refer, for example, to the most recent Friday, night, or year.
Example: I got married last July.

Definition: Late means near the end of a day, week, year, or other period of time.
Example: It was late in the afternoon.

Definition: Later is the comparative of late.
Example: He resigned ten years later.

Definition: Latin is the language which the ancient Romans used to speak.
Example: Cuba was one of the least Catholic of the Latin countries.

Definition: When two people, things, or groups have just been mentioned, you can refer to the second of them as the latter.
Example: He tracked down his cousin and uncle. The latter was sick.

Definition: When you laugh, you make a sound with your throat while smiling and show that you are happy or amused. People also sometimes laugh when they feel nervous or are being unfriendly.
Example: He was about to offer an explanation, but she was beginning to laugh.

Definition: To launch a rocket, missile, or satellite means to send it into the air or into space.
Example: NASA plans to launch a satellite to study cosmic rays.

Definition: The law is a system of rules that a society or government develops in order to deal with crime, business agreements, and social relationships. You can also use the law to refer to the people who work in this system.
Example: Obscene and threatening phone calls are against the law.

Definition: A lawn is an area of grass that is kept cut short and is usually part of someone's garden or backyard, or part of a park.
Example: They were sitting on the lawn under a large beech tree.

Definition: A lawsuit is a case in a court of law which concerns a dispute between two people or organizations.
Example: The dispute culminated last week in a lawsuit against the government.

Definition: A lawyer is a person who is qualified to advise people about the law and represent them in court.
Example: Prosecution and defense lawyers are expected to deliver closing arguments next week.

Definition: If you lay something somewhere, you put it there in a careful, gentle, or neat way.
Example: Lay a sheet of newspaper on the floor.

Definition: A layer of a material or substance is a quantity or piece of it that covers a surface or that is between two other things.
Example: A fresh layer of snow covered the street.

Definition: If you lead a group of people, you walk or ride in front of them.
Example: John Major and the Duke of Edinburgh led the mourners.

Definition:
The leader of a group of people or an organization is the person who is in control of it or
in charge of it.
Example: We now need a new leader of the party and a new style of leadership.

Definition: You refer to people who are in control of a group or organization as the leadership.
Example: He is expected to hold talks with both the Croatian and Slovenian leaderships.

Definition: The leading person or thing in a particular area is the one which is most important or successful.
Example: ...a leading member of Bristol's Sikh community.

Definition:
The leaves of a tree or plant are the parts that are flat, thin, and usually green. Many trees
and plants lose their leaves in the winter and grow new leaves in the spring.
Example: In the garden, the leaves of the horse chestnut had already fallen.

Definition: A league is a group of people, clubs, or countries that have joined together for a particular purpose, or because they share a common interest.
Example: ...the League of Nations.

Definition: When you lean in a particular direction, you bend your body in that direction.
Example: Eileen leaned across and opened the passenger door.

Definition: If you learn something, you obtain knowledge or a skill through studying or training.
Example: Their children were going to learn English.

Definition: Learning is the process of gaining knowledge through studying.
Example: The brochure described the library as the focal point of learning on the campus.

Definition: You use the least to mean a smaller amount than anyone or anything else, or the smallest amount possible.
Example: I try to offend the least amount of people possible.

Definition: Leather is treated animal skin which is used for making shoes, clothes, bags, and furniture.
Example: He wore a leather jacket and dark trousers.

Definition: If you leave a place or person, you go away from that place or person.
Example: He would not be allowed to leave the country.

Definition: Left is the past tense and past participle of leave.
Example: Is there any gin left?

Definition: A person or animal's legs are the long parts of their body that they use to stand on.
Example: He was tapping his walking stick against his leg.

Definition: A legacy is money or property which someone leaves to you when they die.
Example: You could make a real difference to someone's life by leaving them a generous legacy.

Definition: Legal is used to describe things that relate to the law.
Example: He vowed to take legal action.

Definition: A legend is a very old and popular story that may be true.
Example: ...the legends of ancient Greece.

Definition: Legislation consists of a law or laws passed by a government.
Example: ...a letter calling for legislation to protect women's rights.

Definition: Something that is legitimate is acceptable according to the law.
Example:
The French government has condemned the coup in Haiti and has demanded the restoration
of the legitimate government.

Definition: A lemon is a bright yellow fruit with very sour juice. Lemons grow on trees in warm countries.
Example: ...a slice of lemon.

Definition:
The length of something is the amount that it measures from one end to the other along the longest
side.
Example: It is about a metre in length.

Definition: You use less to indicate that there is a smaller amount of something than before or than average. You can use 'a little', 'a lot', 'a bit', ' far', and 'much' in front of less.
Example: People should eat less fat to reduce the risk of heart disease.

Definition: A lesson is a fixed period of time when people are taught about a particular subject or taught how to do something.
Example: It would be his last French lesson for months.

Definition: If you let something happen, you allow it to happen without doing anything to stop or prevent it.
Example:
People said we were interfering with nature, and that we should just let the animals
die.

Definition: If you write a letter to someone, you write a message on paper and send it to them, usually by post.
Example: I had received a letter from a very close friend.

Definition: A level is a point on a scale, for example a scale of amount, quality, or difficulty.
Example: We do have the lowest level of inflation for some years.

Definition: Someone who has liberal views believes people should have a lot of freedom in deciding how to behave and think.
Example: She is known to have liberal views on divorce and contraception.

Definition: A public library is a building where things such as books, newspapers, videos, and music are kept for people to read, use, or borrow.
Example: ...the local library.

Definition: To license a person or activity means to give official permission for the person to do something or for the activity to take place.
Example: ...a proposal that would require the state to license guns.

Definition: If you are lying somewhere, you are in a horizontal position and are not standing or sitting.
Example: There was a child lying on the ground.

Definition:
Life is the quality which people, animals, and plants have when they are not dead, and
which objects and substances do not have.
Example: ...a baby's first minutes of life.

Definition: The lifestyle of a particular person or group of people is the living conditions, behaviour, and habits that are typical of them or are chosen by them.
Example: They enjoyed an income and lifestyle that many people would envy.

Definition: A lifetime is the length of time that someone is alive.
Example: During my lifetime I haven't got around to much travelling.

Definition: If you lift something, you move it to another position, especially upwards.
Example: The Colonel lifted the phone and dialed his superior.

Definition: Light is the brightness that lets you see things. Light comes from sources such as the sun, moon, lamps, and fire.
Example: Cracks of light filtered through the shutters.

Definition: If you say that one person or thing is like another, you mean that they share some of the same qualities or features.
Example: He looks like Father Christmas.

Definition: You use likely to indicate that something is probably the case or will probably happen in a particular situation.
Example: Experts say a 'yes' vote is still the likely outcome.

Definition: A limit is the greatest amount, extent, or degree of something that is possible.
Example: Her love for him was being tested to its limits.

Definition: The limitation of something is the act or process of controlling or reducing it.
Example: All the talk had been about the limitation of nuclear weapons.

Definition: Something that is limited is not very great in amount, range, or degree.
Example: They may only have a limited amount of time to get their points across.

Definition: A line is a long thin mark which is drawn or painted on a surface.
Example: Draw a line down that page's center.

Definition: If there is a link between two things or situations, there is a relationship between them, for example because one thing causes or affects the other.
Example: ...the link between smoking and lung cancer.

Definition: Your lips are the two outer parts of the edge of your mouth.
Example: Wade stuck the cigarette between his lips.

Definition: A list of things such as names or addresses is a set of them which all belong to a particular category, written down one below the other.
Example: Make a list of the top 10 tasks that you can delegate.

Definition: If you listen to someone who is talking or to a sound, you give your attention to them or it.
Example: He spent his time listening to the radio.

Definition: You can use literally to emphasize a statement. Some careful speakers of English think that this use is incorrect.
Example: We've got to get the economy under control or it will literally eat us up.

Definition: Literary means concerned with or connected with the writing, study, or appreciation of literature.
Example: Her literary criticism focuses on the way great literature suggests ideas.

Definition: Novels, plays, and poetry are referred to as literature, especially when they are considered to be good or important.
Example: ...classic works of literature.

Definition:
You use little to indicate that there is only a very small amount of something. You can use 'so', 'too', and
'very' in front of little.
Example: I had little money and little free time.

Definition:
If someone lives in a particular place or with a particular person, their home is in that place or
with that person.
Example: She has lived here for 10 years.

Definition: The work that you do for a living is the work that you do in order to earn the money that you need.
Example: Father never talked about what he did for a living.

Definition: If you load a vehicle or a container, you put a large quantity of things into it.
Example: The three men seemed to have finished loading the truck.

Definition: A loan is a sum of money that you borrow.
Example: The country has no access to foreign loans or financial aid.

Definition: Local means existing in or belonging to the area where you live, or to the area that you are talking about.
Example: We'd better check on the match in the local paper.

Definition: If you locate something or someone, you find out where they are.
Example: The scientists want to locate the position of the gene on a chromosome.

Definition: A location is the place where something happens or is situated.
Example: The first thing he looked at was his office's location.

Definition: When you lock something such as a door, drawer, or case, you fasten it, usually with a key, so that other people cannot open it.
Example: Are you sure you locked the front door?

Definition: Long means a great amount of time or for a great amount of time.
Example: Repairs to the cable did not take too long.

Definition: Something that is long-term has continued for a long time or will continue for a long time in the future.
Example: A new training scheme to help the long-term unemployed is expected.

Definition: If you look in a particular direction, you direct your eyes in that direction, especially so that you can see what is there or see what something is like.
Example: I looked down the hallway to room number nine.

Definition: Something that is loose is not firmly held or fixed in place.
Example: If a tooth feels very loose, your dentist may recommend that it's taken out.

Definition: If you lose a contest, a fight, or an argument, you do not succeed because someone does better than you and defeats you.
Example: They lost the Italian Cup Final.

Definition: Loss is the fact of no longer having something or having less of it than before.
Example: ...loss of sight.

Definition: Lost is the past tense and past participle of lose.
Example: Barely had I set foot in the street when I realised I was lost.

Definition: A lot of something or lots of it is a large amount of it. A lot of people or things, or lots of them, is a large number of them.
Example: A lot of our land is used to grow crops for export.

Definition: great numbers or quantities
Example: lots happier

Definition: If a noise is loud, the level of sound is very high and it can be easily heard. Someone or something that is loud produces a lot of noise.
Example: Suddenly there was a loud bang.

Definition: If you love someone, you feel romantically or sexually attracted to them, and they are very important to you.
Example: Oh, Amy, I love you.

Definition: If you describe someone or something as lovely, you mean that they are very beautiful and therefore pleasing to look at or listen to.
Example: You look lovely, Marcia.

Definition: Someone's lover is someone who they are having a sexual relationship with but are not married to.
Example: Every Thursday she would meet her lover Leon.

Definition: Something that is low measures only a short distance from the bottom to the top, or from the ground to the top.
Example: ...the low garden wall that separated the front garden from next door.

Definition: You can use lower to refer to the bottom one of a pair of things.
Example: She bit her lower lip.

Definition: Luck or good luck is success or good things that happen to you, that do not come from your own abilities or efforts.
Example: I knew I needed a bit of luck to win.

Definition: You say that someone is lucky when they have something that is very desirable or when they are in a very desirable situation.
Example: I am luckier than most. I have a job.

Definition: Lunch is the meal that you have in the middle of the day.
Example: Shall we meet somewhere for lunch?

Definition: Your lungs are the two organs inside your chest which fill with air when you breathe in.
Example: The lungs and heart are also exercised by singing.

Definition: A machine is a piece of equipment which uses electricity or an engine in order to do a particular kind of work.
Example: I put the coin in the machine and pulled the lever.

Definition: Someone who is mad has a mind that does not work in a normal way, with the result that their behaviour is very strange.
Example: She was afraid of going mad.

Definition: A magazine is a publication with a paper cover which is issued regularly, usually every week or every month, and which contains articles, stories, photographs, and advertisements.
Example: Her face is on the cover of a dozen or more magazines.

Definition: The mail is the public service or system by which letters and parcels are collected and delivered.
Example: Your check is in the mail.

Definition: The main thing is the most important one of several similar things in a particular situation.
Example: ...one of the main tourist areas of Amsterdam.

Definition: You use mainly when mentioning the main reason or thing involved in something.
Example:
He did not want to take up a competitive sport, mainly because he did not have anyone
to play with.

Definition: If you maintain something, you continue to have it, and do not let it stop or grow weaker.
Example: The Department maintains many close contacts with the chemical industry.

Definition: The maintenance of a building, vehicle, road, or machine is the process of keeping it in good condition by regularly checking it and repairing it when necessary.
Example: ...maintenance work on government buildings.

Definition:
You use major when you want to describe something that is more important, serious, or significant than other things in a
group or situation.
Example: The major factor in the decision to stay or to leave was usually professional.

Definition: The majority of people or things in a group is more than half of them.
Example: The majority of my patients come to me from out of town.

Definition: You can use make with a wide range of nouns to indicate that someone performs an action or says something. For example, if you make a suggestion, you suggest something.
Example: I'd just like to make a comment.

Definition: The maker of a product is the firm that manufactures it.
Example: ...Japan's two largest car makers.

Definition: Makeup consists of things such as lipstick, eye shadow, and powder which some women put on their faces to make themselves look more attractive or which actors use to change or improve their appearance.
Example: Normally she wore little makeup, but this evening was clearly an exception.

Definition: Someone who is male is a man or a boy.
Example:
It was the first new prison for adult male prisoners to be opened in Scotland for
60 years.

Definition: A mall is a very large enclosed shopping area.
Example: Our first additional site was in a strip mall which we converted into a campus.

Definition: A man is an adult male human being.
Example: He had not expected the young man to reappear before evening.

Definition: Management is the control and organizing of a business or other organization.
Example: The zoo needed better management rather than more money.

Definition: A manager is a person who is responsible for running part of or the whole of a business organization.
Example: The chef, staff and managers are all Chinese.

Definition: The manner in which you do something is the way that you do it.
Example: She smiled again in a friendly manner.

Definition: A manufacturer is a business or company which makes goods in large quantities to sell.
Example: ...the world's largest doll manufacturer.

Definition: Manufacturing is the business of making things in factories.
Example: We have excellent research labs in Switzerland, and a very good manufacturing plant near Birmingham.

Definition: You use many to indicate that you are talking about a large number of people or things.
Example: I don't think many people would argue with that.

Definition: A map is a drawing of a particular area such as a city, a country, or a continent, showing its main features as they would appear if you looked at them from above.
Example: He unfolded the map and set it on the floor.

Definition: A margin is the difference between two amounts, especially the difference in the number of votes or points between the winner and the loser in an election or other contest.
Example: They could end up with a 50-point winning margin.

Definition: A mark is a small area of something such as dirt that has accidentally got onto a surface or piece of clothing.
Example: Leather overshoes were put on the horses' hooves to stop them marking the turf.

Definition: A market is a place where goods are bought and sold, usually outdoors.
Example: He sold boots on a market stall.

Definition: Marketing is the organization of the sale of a product, for example, deciding on its price, the areas it should be supplied to, and how it should be advertised.
Example: ...expert advice on production and marketing.

Definition: A marriage is the relationship between two people who are married.
Example: In a good marriage, both partners work hard to solve any problems that arise.

Definition: If you are married, you have a husband or wife.
Example: We have been married for 14 years.

Definition: When two people  get married or marry, they legally become partners in a special ceremony. Get married is less formal and more commonly used than marry.
Example: I thought he would change after we got married.

Definition:
A mask is a piece of cloth or other material, which you wear over your face so that people
cannot see who you are, or so that you look like someone or something else.
Example: The gunman, whose mask had slipped, fled.

Definition: A mass of things is a large number of them grouped together.
Example: On his desk is a mass of books and papers.

Definition: Something that is massive is very large in size, quantity, or extent.
Example: There was evidence of massive fraud.

Definition: A servant's master is the man that he or she works for.
Example: My master ordered me not to deliver the message except in private.

Definition: A match is an organized game of football, tennis, cricket, or some other sport.
Example: Her nails were painted bright red to match her dress.

Definition: A material is a solid substance.
Example: ...electrons in a conducting material such as a metal.

Definition: Math is the same as mathematics.
Example: He studied math in college.

Definition: A matter is a task, situation, or event which you have to deal with or think about, especially one that involves problems.
Example: It was clear that she wanted to discuss some private matter.

Definition: You use may to indicate that something will possibly happen or be true in the future, but you cannot be certain.
Example: We may have some rain today.

Definition: You use maybe to express uncertainty, for example when you do not know that something is definitely true, or when you are mentioning something that may possibly happen in the future in the way you describe.
Example: Maybe she is in love.

Definition: The mayor of a town or city is the person who has been elected to represent it for a fixed period of time or, in some places, to run its government.
Example: The mayor has become a regular on the red carpet since his election.

Definition: A speaker or writer uses me to refer to himself or herself. Me is a first person singular pronoun. Me is used as the object of a verb or a preposition.
Example: I had to make important decisions that would affect me for the rest of my life.

Definition: A meal is an occasion when people sit down and eat, usually at a regular time.
Example: She sat next to him throughout the meal.

Definition: If you want to know what a word, code, signal, or gesture means, you want to know what it refers to or what its message is.
Example: In modern Welsh, 'glas' means 'blue'.

Definition: The meaning of a word, expression, or gesture is the thing or idea that it refers to or represents and which can be explained using other words.
Example: I hadn't a clue to the meaning of 'activism'.

Definition: Meanwhile means while a particular thing is happening.
Example: Bake the aubergines till soft. Meanwhile, heat the oil in a heavy pan.

Definition: If you measure the quality, value, or effect of something, you discover or judge how great it is.
Example: I continued to measure his progress against the charts in the doctor's office.

Definition: A measurement is a result, usually expressed in numbers, that you obtain by measuring something.
Example: We took lots of measurements.

Definition: Meat is flesh taken from a dead animal that people cook and eat.
Example: Meat and fish are relatively expensive.

Definition:
In a machine or piece of equipment, a mechanism is a part, often consisting of a set of smaller parts, which performs a particular
function.
Example: ...the locking mechanism.

Definition: You can refer to television, radio, newspapers, and magazines as the media.
Example: It is hard work and not a glamorous job as portrayed by the media.

Definition: Medical means relating to illness and injuries and to their treatment or prevention.
Example: Several police officers received medical treatment for cuts and bruises.

Definition: Medication is medicine that is used to treat and cure illness.
Example: She stopped taking the prescribed medications.

Definition: Medicine is the treatment of illness and injuries by doctors and nurses.
Example: He pursued a career in medicine.

Definition: If something is of medium size, it is neither large nor small, but approximately half way between the two.
Example: A medium dose produces severe nausea within hours.

Definition: If you meet someone, you happen to be in the same place as them and start talking to them. You may know the other person, but be surprised to see them, or you may not know them at all.
Example: I have just met the man I want to spend the rest of my life with.

Definition: A meeting is an event in which a group of people come together to discuss things or make decisions.
Example: Can we have a meeting to discuss that?

Definition: A member of a group is one of the people, animals, or things belonging to that group.
Example: He refused to name the members of staff involved.

Definition: Membership of an organization is the state of being a member of it.
Example: The country has also been granted membership of the World Trade Organisation.

Definition: Your memory is your ability to remember things.
Example: All the details of the meeting are fresh in my memory.

Definition: Mental means relating to the process of thinking.
Example: ...the mental development of children.

Definition: If you mention something, you say something about it, usually briefly.
Example: She did not mention her mother's absence.

Definition: In a restaurant or caf, or at a formal meal, the menu is a list of the food and drinks that are available.
Example: A waiter offered him the menu.

Definition: You use mere to emphasize how unimportant or inadequate something is, in comparison to the general situation you are describing.
Example: ...successful exhibitions which go beyond mere success.

Definition: You use merely to emphasize that something is only what you say and not better, more important, or more exciting.
Example: Michael is now merely a good friend.

Definition: If you say that something is a mess or in a mess, you think that it is in an untidy state.
Example: The house is a mess.

Definition: A message is a piece of information or a request that you send to someone or leave for them when you cannot speak to them directly.
Example: I got a message you were trying to reach me.

Definition: Metal is a hard substance such as iron, steel, gold, or lead.
Example: ...pieces of furniture in wood, metal and glass.

Definition: A meter is a device that measures and records something such as the amount of gas or electricity that you have used.
Example: He was there to read the electricity meter.

Definition: A method is a particular way of doing something.
Example: The pill is the most efficient method of birth control.

Definition: Mexican means belonging or relating to Mexico, or to its people or culture.
Example: ...the Mexican border town of Tijuana.

Definition: The middle of something is the part of it that is furthest from its edges, ends, or outside surface.
Example: Howard stood in the middle of the room, sipping a cup of coffee.

Definition: You use might to indicate that something will possibly happen or be true in the future, but you cannot be certain.
Example: Smoking might be banned totally in most buildings.

Definition: Military means relating to the armed forces of a country.
Example: Military action may become necessary.

Definition:
Milk is the white liquid produced by cows, goats, and some other animals, which people
drink and use to make butter, cheese, and yoghurt.
Example: He popped out to buy a pint of milk.

Definition: A million or one million is the number 1,000,000.
Example: Up to five million people a year visit the county.

Definition: You refer to someone's mind when talking about their thoughts. For example, if you say that something is in your mind, you mean that you are thinking about it, and if you say that something is at the back of your mind, you mean that you are aware of it, although you are not thinking about it very much.
Example: I'm trying to clear my mind of all this.

Definition: Mine is the first person singular possessive pronoun. A speaker or writer uses mine to refer to something that belongs or relates to himself or herself.
Example: Her right hand is inches from mine.

Definition: In Britain and some other countries, a minister is a person who is in charge of a particular government department.
Example: When the government had come to power, he had been named Minister of Culture.

Definition: You use minor when you want to describe something that is less important, serious, or significant than other things in a group or situation.
Example: She is known in Italy for a number of minor roles in films.

Definition: If you talk about a minority of people or things in a larger group, you are referring to a number of them that forms less than half of the larger group, usually much less than half.
Example: Local authority nursery provision covers only a tiny minority of working mothers.

Definition: A minute is one of the sixty parts that an hour is divided into. People often say 'a minute' or 'minutes' when they mean a short length of time.
Example: The pizza will then take about twenty minutes to cook.

Definition: If you say that a good event is a miracle, you mean that it is very surprising and unexpected.
Example: It is a miracle no one was killed.

Definition: A mirror is a flat piece of glass which reflects light, so that when you look at it you can see yourself reflected in it.
Example: He absent-mindedly looked at himself in the mirror.

Definition: If you miss something, you fail to hit it, for example when you have thrown something at it or you have shot a bullet at it.
Example: She hurled the ashtray across the room, narrowly missing my head.

Definition: A missile is a tube-shaped weapon that travels long distances through the air and explodes when it reaches its target.
Example: Helicopters fired missiles at the camp.

Definition: A mission is an important task that people are given to do, especially one that involves travelling to another country.
Example: Salisbury sent him on a diplomatic mission to North America.

Definition: If you make a mistake, you do something which you did not intend to do, or which produces a result that you do not want.
Example: She made the mistake of going against her doctor's advice.

Definition: If two substances mix or if you mix one substance with another, you stir or shake them together, or combine them in some other way, so that they become a single substance.
Example: Oil and water don't mix.

Definition: A mixture of things consists of several different things together.
Example: They looked at him with a mixture of horror, envy, and awe.

Definition: A mode of life or behaviour is a particular way of living or behaving.
Example: ...the capitalist mode of production.

Definition: A model of an object is a physical representation that shows what it looks like or how it works. The model is often smaller than the object it represents.
Example: ...an architect's model of a wooden house.

Definition: Moderate political opinions or policies are not extreme.
Example: He was an easygoing man of very moderate views.

Definition: Modern means relating to the present time, for example the present decade or present century.
Example: ...the problem of materialism in modern society.

Definition: A modest house or other building is not large or expensive.
Example: ...the modest home of a family who lived off the land.

Definition: Your mom is your mother. You can call your mom 'Mom'.
Example: We waited for Mom and Dad to get home.

Definition: You can refer to a very short period of time, for example a few seconds, as a moment or moments.
Example: In a moment he was gone.

Definition: Money is the coins or bank notes that you use to buy things, or the sum that you have in a bank account.
Example: A lot of the money that you pay at the cinema goes back to the film distributors.

Definition: If you monitor something, you regularly check its development or progress, and sometimes comment on it.
Example: Officials had not been allowed to monitor the voting.

Definition: A month is one of the twelve periods of time that a year is divided into, for example January or February.
Example: The trial is due to begin next month.

Definition: Your mood is the way you are feeling at a particular time. If you are in a good mood, you feel cheerful. If you are in a bad mood, you feel angry and impatient.
Example: He is clearly in a good mood today.

Definition: The moon is the object that you can often see in the sky at night. It goes round the Earth once every four weeks, and as it does so its appearance changes from a circle to part of a circle.
Example: ...the first man on the moon.

Definition: Morals are principles and beliefs concerning right and wrong behaviour.
Example: ...Western ideas and morals.

Definition: You use more to indicate that there is a greater amount of something than before or than average, or than something else. You can use 'a little', 'a lot', 'a bit', ' far', and 'much' in front of more.
Example: More and more people are surviving heart attacks.

Definition: You use moreover to introduce a piece of information that adds to or supports the previous statement.
Example: There was a man immediately behind her. Moreover, he was observing her strangely.

Definition: The morning is the part of each day between the time that people usually wake up and 12 o'clock noon or lunchtime.
Example: During the morning your guide will take you around the city.

Definition: A mortgage is a loan of money which you get from a bank or building society in order to buy a house.
Example: ...an increase in mortgage rates.

Definition: You use most to refer to the majority of a group of things or people or the largest part of something.
Example: Most of the houses in the capital don't have piped water.

Definition: You use mostly to indicate that a statement is generally true, for example true about the majority of a group of things or people, true most of the time, or true in most respects.
Example: I am working with mostly highly motivated people.

Definition: Your mother is the woman who gave birth to you. You can also call someone your mother if she brings you up as if she was this woman. You can call your mother 'Mother'.
Example: She sat on the edge of her mother's bed.

Definition:
Motion is the activity or process of continually changing position or moving from one place
to another.
Example: ...the laws governing light, sound, and motion.

Definition: Your motivation for doing something is what causes you to want to do it.
Example: Money is my motivation.

Definition: The motor in a machine, vehicle, or boat is the part that uses electricity or fuel to produce movement, so that the machine, vehicle, or boat can work.
Example: She got in and started the motor.

Definition: If you mount a campaign or event, you organize it and make it take place.
Example: ...a security operation mounted by the army.

Definition: A mountain is a very high area of land with steep sides.
Example: Ben Nevis, in Scotland, is Britain's highest mountain.

Definition: A mouse is a small furry animal with a long tail.
Example: ...a mouse running in a wheel in its cage.

Definition:
Your mouth is the area of your face where your lips are or the space behind your lips where
your teeth and tongue are.
Example: She clamped her hand against her mouth.

Definition: When you move something or when it moves, its position changes and it does not remain still.
Example: She moved the sheaf of papers into position.

Definition: A movement is a group of people who share the same beliefs, ideas, or aims.
Example:
It's part of a broader Hindu nationalist movement that's gaining strength throughout
the country.

Definition: A movie is a film.
Example: In the first movie Tony Curtis ever made he played a grocery clerk.

Definition: Mr is used before a man's name when you are speaking or referring to him.
Example: ...Mr Grant.

Definition: Mrs is used before the name of a married woman when you are speaking or referring to her. Many people prefer the title ' Ms'.
Example: Hello, Mrs Miles.

Definition: Ms is used, especially in written English, before a woman's name when you are speaking to her or referring to her. If you use Ms, you are not specifying if the woman is married or not.
Example: ...Ms Brown.

Definition: You use much to indicate the great intensity, extent, or degree of something such as an action, feeling, or change. Much is usually used with 'so', 'too', and 'very', and in negative clauses with this meaning.
Example: She laughs too much.

Definition: You use multiple to describe things that consist of many parts, involve many people, or have many uses.
Example: He died of multiple injuries.

Definition: Murder is the deliberate and illegal killing of a person.
Example: The three accused, aged between 19 and 20, are charged with attempted murder.

Definition: A muscle is a piece of tissue inside your body which connects two bones and which you use when you make a movement.
Example: Keeping your muscles strong and in tone helps you to avoid back problems.

Definition: A museum is a building where a large number of interesting and valuable objects, such as works of art or historical items, are kept, studied, and displayed to the public.
Example: For months Malcolm had wanted to visit the Parisian art museums.

Definition: Music is the pattern of sounds produced by people singing or playing instruments.
Example: ...classical music.

Definition: You use musical to indicate that something is connected with playing or studying music.
Example: We have a wealth of musical talent in this region.

Definition: A musician is a person who plays a musical instrument as their job or hobby.
Example: He was a brilliant musician.

Definition: A Muslim is someone who believes in Islam and lives according to its rules.
Example: ...Iran and other Muslim countries.

Definition:
You use must to indicate that you think it is very important or necessary for something to happen. You use must not or mustn't to indicate that you think it is very important or necessary for something not to
happen.
Example: What you wear should be stylish and clean, and must definitely fit well.

Definition: You use mutual to describe a situation, feeling, or action that is experienced, felt, or done by both of two people mentioned.
Example: The East and the West can work together for their mutual benefit and progress.

Definition: A speaker or writer uses my to indicate that something belongs or relates to himself or herself.
Example: I invited him back to my flat for a coffee.

Definition: A speaker or writer uses myself to refer to himself or herself. Myself is used as the object of a verb or preposition when the subject refers to the same person.
Example: I asked myself what I would have done in such a situation.

Definition: A mystery is something that is not understood or known about.
Example: The source of the gunshots still remains a mystery.

Definition: A myth is a well-known story which was made up in the past to explain natural events or to justify religious beliefs or social customs.
Example: There is a famous Greek myth in which Icarus flew too near to the Sun.

Definition: Someone who is naked is not wearing any clothes.
Example: Kate throws a kimono over her naked body.

Definition: The name of a person, place, or thing is the word or group of words that is used to identify them.
Example: 'What's his name?''Peter.'

Definition: A narrative is a story or an account of a series of events.
Example: ...a fast-moving narrative.

Definition: Something that is narrow measures a very small distance from one side to the other, especially compared to its length or height.
Example: ...through the town's narrow streets.

Definition: A nation is an individual country considered together with its social and political structures.
Example: Such policies would require unprecedented cooperation between nations.

Definition: National means relating to the whole of a country or nation rather than to part of it or to other nations.
Example: Ruling parties have lost ground in national and local elections.

Definition: Your native country or area is the country or area where you were born and brought up.
Example: It was his first visit to his native country since 1948.

Definition: If you say that it is natural for someone to act in a particular way or for something to happen in that way, you mean that it is reasonable in the circumstances.
Example: It is only natural for youngsters to crave the excitement of driving a fast car.

Definition: You use naturally to indicate that you think something is very obvious and not at all surprising in the circumstances.
Example: When things go wrong, all of us naturally feel disappointed and frustrated.

Definition:
Nature is all the animals, plants, and other things in the world that are not made by people,
and all the events and processes that are not caused by people.
Example: The most amazing thing about nature is its infinite variety.

Definition: If something is near a place, thing, or person, it is a short distance from them.
Example: Don't come near me.

Definition: If something is nearby, it is only a short distance away.
Example: He might easily have been seen by someone who lived nearby.

Definition: Nearly is used to indicate that something is not quite the case, or not completely the case.
Example: Goldsworth stared at me in silence for nearly twenty seconds.

Definition: If you say that something is not necessarily the case, you mean that it may not be the case or is not always the case.
Example: Anger is not necessarily the most useful or acceptable reaction to such events.

Definition: Something that is necessary is needed in order for something else to happen.
Example: I kept the engine running because it might be necessary to leave fast.

Definition: Your neck is the part of your body which joins your head to the rest of your body.
Example: She threw her arms round his neck and hugged him warmly.

Definition: If you need something, or need to do something, you cannot successfully achieve what you want or live properly without it.
Example: He desperately needed money.

Definition: A fact, situation, or experience that is negative is unpleasant, depressing, or harmful.
Example: The news from overseas is overwhelmingly negative.

Definition: If people negotiate with each other or negotiate an agreement, they talk about a problem or a situation such as a business arrangement in order to solve the problem or complete the arrangement.
Example: It is not clear whether the president is willing to negotiate with the democrats.

Definition: Negotiations are formal discussions between people who have different aims or intentions, especially in business or politics, during which they try to reach an agreement.
Example: We have had meaningful negotiations and I believe we are very close to a deal.

Definition: Your neighbor is someone who lives near you.
Example: My neighbor spies on me through a crack in the fence.

Definition: A neighborhood is one of the parts of a town where people live.
Example: There is no neighborhood which is really safe.

Definition: You use neither in front of the first of two or more words or expressions when you are linking two or more things which are not true or do not happen. The other thing is introduced by 'nor'.
Example: Professor Hisamatsu spoke neither English nor German.

Definition: Nerves are long thin fibres that transmit messages between your brain and other parts of your body.
Example: ...spinal nerves.

Definition: If someone is nervous, they are frightened or worried about something that is happening or might happen, and show this in their behaviour.
Example: The party has become deeply nervous about its prospects of winning the next election.

Definition: Net is a kind of cloth that you can see through. It is made of very fine threads woven together so that there are small equal spaces between them.
Example: I threw aside my mosquito net and jumped out of bed.

Definition: A network of lines, roads, veins, or other long thin things is a large number of them which cross each other or meet at many points.
Example: ...Strasbourg, with its rambling network of medieval streets.

Definition: Never means at no time in the past or at no time in the future.
Example: I have never lost the weight I put on in my teens.

Definition: You use nevertheless when saying something that contrasts with what has just been said.
Example: Many marriages fail. Nevertheless, people continue to get married.

Definition: Something that is new has been recently created, built, or invented or is in the process of being created, built, or invented.
Example: They've just opened a new hotel in the Stoke area.

Definition: Newly is used before a past participle or an adjective to indicate that a particular action is very recent, or that a particular state of affairs has very recently begun to exist.
Example: She was young at the time, and newly married.

Definition: News is information about a recently changed situation or a recent event.
Example: We waited and waited for news of him.

Definition: A newspaper is a publication consisting of a number of large sheets of folded paper, on which news, advertisements, and other information is printed.
Example: He was carrying a newspaper.

Definition: The next period of time, event, person, or thing is the one that comes immediately after the present one or after the previous one.
Example: I got up early the next morning.

Definition: If you say that something is nice, you mean that you find it attractive, pleasant, or enjoyable.
Example: I think silk ties can be quite nice.

Definition: The night is the part of each day when the sun has set and it is dark outside, especially the time when people are sleeping.
Example: He didn't sleep a wink all night.

Definition: Nine is the number 9.
Example: We still sighted nine yachts.

Definition: You use no to give a negative response to a question.
Example: 'Any problems?''No, I'm O.K.'

Definition: Nobody means not a single person, or not a single member of a particular group or set.
Example: They were shut away in a little room where nobody could overhear.

Definition: If you nod, you move your head downwards and upwards to show that you are answering 'yes' to a question, or to show agreement, understanding, or approval.
Example: 'Are you okay?' I asked. She nodded and smiled.

Definition: Noise is a loud or unpleasant sound.
Example: There was too much noise in the room and he needed peace.

Definition: A nomination is an official suggestion of someone as a candidate in an election or for a job.
Example: ...his candidacy for the Republican presidential nomination.

Definition: None of something means not even a small amount of it. None of a group of people or things means not even one of them.
Example: She did none of the maintenance on the vehicle itself.

Definition: Nonetheless means the same as nevertheless.
Example: There was still a long way to go. Nonetheless, some progress had been made.

Definition: You use nor after 'neither' in order to introduce the second alternative or the last of a number of alternatives in a negative statement.
Example: Neither Mr Rose nor Mr Woodhead was available for comment yesterday.

Definition: Something that is normal is usual and ordinary, and is what people expect.
Example:
He has occasional injections to maintain his good health but otherwise he lives a
normal life.

Definition:
If you say that something normally happens or that you normally do a particular thing, you mean that it is what usually happens or what you usually
do.
Example: All airports in the country are working normally today.

Definition: The north is the direction which is on your left when you are looking towards the direction where the sun rises.
Example: In the north the ground becomes very cold as the winter snow and ice covers the ground.

Definition: Northern means in or from the north of a region, state, or country.
Example: Their two children were immigrants to Northern Ireland from Pennsylvania.

Definition: Your nose is the part of your face which sticks out above your mouth. You use it for smelling and breathing.
Example: She wiped her nose with a tissue.

Definition: You use not with verbs to form negative statements.
Example: The sanctions are not working the way they were intended.

Definition: A note is a short letter.
Example: Stevens wrote him a note asking him to come to his apartment.

Definition: Nothing means not a single thing, or not a single part of something.
Example: I've done nothing much since coffee time.

Definition: If you notice something or someone, you become aware of them.
Example:
People should not hesitate to contact the police if they've noticed anyone acting
suspiciously.

Definition: A notion is an idea or belief about something.
Example: I reject absolutely the notion that privatisation of our industry is now inevitable.

Definition: A novel is a long written story about imaginary people and events.
Example: ...a novel by Herman Hesse.

Definition: You use now to refer to the present time, often in contrast to a time in the past or the future.
Example: She's a widow now.

Definition: You use nowhere to emphasize that a place has more of a particular quality than any other places, or that it is the only place where something happens or exists.
Example: Nowhere is language a more serious issue than in Hawaii.

Definition: National Trust
Nuclear means relating to the nuclei of atoms, or to the energy released when these nuclei are split or combined.
Example: ...a nuclear power station.

Definition: A number is a word such as 'two', ' nine', or ' twelve', or a symbol such as 1, 3, or 47. You use numbers to say how many things you are referring to or where something comes in a series.
Example: No, I don't know the room number.

Definition: If people or things are numerous, they exist or are present in large numbers.
Example: Sex crimes were just as numerous as they are today.

Definition: A nurse is a person whose job is to care for people who are ill.
Example: She had spent 29 years as a nurse.

Definition: The firm shelled fruit of some trees and bushes are called nuts. Some nuts can be eaten.
Example: Nuts and seeds are good sources of vitamin E.

Definition: An object is anything that has a fixed shape or form, that you can touch or see, and that is not alive.
Example: He squinted his eyes as though he were studying an object on the horizon.

Definition: Your objective is what you are trying to achieve.
Example: Our main objective was the recovery of the child safe and well.

Definition: If you have an obligation to do something, it is your duty to do that thing.
Example: When teachers assign homework, students usually feel an obligation to do it.

Definition: Observation is the action or process of carefully watching someone or something.
Example: ...careful observation of the movement of the planets.

Definition: If you observe a person or thing, you watch them carefully, especially in order to learn something about them.
Example: Stern also studies and observes the behaviour of babies.

Definition: You can refer to someone who sees or notices something as an observer.
Example: A casual observer would have taken them to be three men out for an evening stroll.

Definition: To obtain something means to get it or achieve it.
Example: Evans was trying to obtain a false passport and other documents.

Definition: If something is obvious, it is easy to see or understand.
Example: ...the need to rectify what is an obvious injustice.

Definition: You use obviously when you are stating something that you expect the person who is listening to know already.
Example: Obviously, they've had sponsorship from some big companies.

Definition: An occasion is a time when something happens, or a case of it happening.
Example: I often think fondly of an occasion some years ago at Covent Garden.

Definition: from time to time
Example: American football does occasionally cross the line between sport and entertainment.

Definition: Your occupation is your job or profession.
Example: I suppose I was looking for an occupation which was going to be an adventure.

Definition: The people who occupy a building or a place are the people who live or work there.
Example: There were over 40 tenants, all occupying one wing of the hospital.

Definition: When something occurs, it happens.
Example: If headaches only occur at night, lack of fresh air and oxygen is often the cause.

Definition: The ocean is the sea.
Example: There were few sights as beautiful as the calm ocean on a warm night.

Definition: If you describe someone or something as odd, you think that they are strange or unusual.
Example: He'd always been odd, but not to this extent.

Definition: You refer to how likely something is to happen as the odds that it will happen.
Example: What are the odds of finding a parking space right outside the door?

Definition: You use of to combine two nouns when the first noun identifies the feature of the second noun that you want to talk about.
Example: The average age of the women interviewed was only 21.5.

Definition: If something is taken off something else or moves off it, it is no longer touching that thing.
Example: He took his feet off the desk.

Definition: an offending
Example: He began to boil his water, tried to refuse invitations without causing offense, and religiously took the prescribed medicines.

Definition: Something that is offensive upsets or embarrasses people because it is rude or insulting.
Example: Some friends of his found the play horribly offensive.

Definition: If you offer something to someone, you ask them if they would like to have it or use it.
Example:
He has offered seats at the conference table to the Russian leader and the president
of Kazakhstan.

Definition: An office is a room or a part of a building where people work sitting at desks.
Example: He had an office just big enough for his desk and chair.

Definition: In the armed forces, an officer is a person in a position of authority.
Example: ...a retired British army officer.

Definition: Official means approved by the government or by someone in authority.
Example: According to the official figures, over one thousand people died during the revolution.

Definition: If something often happens, it happens many times or much of the time.
Example: They often spent Christmas at Prescott Hill.

Definition: You use oh to introduce a response or a comment on something that has just been said.
Example: 'Had you seen the car before?''Oh yes, it was always in the drive.'

Definition:
Oil is a smooth, thick liquid that is used as a fuel and for making the parts of machines move smoothly.
Oil is found underground.
Example: The company buys and sells about 600,000 barrels of oil a day.

Definition: Oklahoma
If you say that something is okay, you find it satisfactory or acceptable.
Example: ...a shooting range where it's OK to use weapons.

Definition: Someone who is old has lived for many years and is no longer young.
Example: ...a white-haired old man.

Definition: Olympic means relating to the Olympic Games.
Example: ...the reigning Olympic champion.

Definition: If someone or something is on a surface or object, the surface or object is immediately below them and is supporting their weight.
Example: He is sitting beside her on the sofa.

Definition: If something happens once, it happens one time only.
Example: I met Wilma once, briefly.

Definition: One is the number 1.
Example: They had three sons and one daughter.

Definition: An ongoing situation has been happening for quite a long time and seems likely to continue for some time in the future.
Example: There is an ongoing debate on the issue.

Definition: An onion is a round vegetable with a brown skin that grows underground. It has many white layers on its inside which have a strong, sharp smell and taste.
Example: Will you chop an onion up for me?

Definition: If a company goes online, its services become available on the internet.
Example: ...the first bank to go online.

Definition: You use only to indicate the one thing that is true, appropriate, or necessary in a particular situation, in contrast to all the other things that are not true, appropriate, or necessary.
Example: Only the President could authorize the use of the atomic bomb.

Definition: If something moves or is put onto an object or surface, it is then on that object or surface.
Example: I took my bags inside, lowered myself onto the bed and switched on the TV.

Definition: If you open something such as a door, window, or lid, or if it opens, its position is changed so that it no longer covers a hole or gap.
Example: He opened the window and looked out.

Definition: The opening event, item, day, or week in a series is the first one.
Example: They returned to take part in the season's opening game.
