Definition: If you operate a business or organization, you work to keep it running properly. If a business or organization operates, it carries out its work.
Example: Until his death in 1986, Greenwood owned and operated an enormous pear orchard.

Definition: Operating profits and costs are the money that a company earns and spends in carrying out its ordinary trading activities, in contrast to such things as interest and investment.
Example: The group made operating profits of 80m before interest.

Definition: An operation is a highly organized activity that involves many people doing different things.
Example: The rescue operation began on Friday afternoon.

Definition: An operator is a person who connects phone calls at a telephone exchange or in a place such as an office or hotel.
Example: He dialled the operator and put in a call for Rome.

Definition: Your opinion about something is what you think or believe about it.
Example: I wasn't asking for your opinion, Dick.

Definition: A politician's opponents are other politicians who belong to a different party or who have different aims or policies.
Example: ...Mr Kennedy's opponent in the leadership contest.

Definition: An opportunity is a situation in which it is possible for you to do something that you want to do.
Example: I had an opportunity to go to New York and study.

Definition: If you oppose someone or oppose their plans or ideas, you disagree with what they want to do and try to prevent them from doing it.
Example: Mr Taylor was not bitter towards those who had opposed him.

Definition: If one thing is opposite another, it is on the other side of a space from it.
Example: Jennie had sat opposite her at breakfast.

Definition: Opposition is strong, angry, or violent disagreement and disapproval.
Example: The government is facing a new wave of opposition in the form of a student strike.

Definition: An option is something that you can choose to do in preference to one or more alternatives.
Example:
He's argued from the start that America and its allies are putting too much emphasis
on the military option.

Definition: You use or to link two or more alternatives.
Example: 'Tea or coffee?' John asked.

Definition: Something that is orange is of a colour between red and yellow.
Example: ...men in bright orange uniforms.

Definition: If you do something in order to achieve a particular thing or in order that something can happen, you do it because you want to achieve that thing.
Example: Most schools are extremely unwilling to cut down on staff in order to cut costs.

Definition: Ordinary people or things are normal and not special or different in any way.
Example: I strongly suspect that most ordinary people would agree with me.

Definition: Organic methods of farming and gardening use only natural animal and plant products to help the plants or animals grow and be healthy, rather than using chemicals.
Example: Organic farming is expanding everywhere.

Definition: An organization is an official group of people, for example a political party, a business, a charity, or a club.
Example: Most of these specialized schools are provided by voluntary organizations.

Definition: If you organize an event or activity, you make sure that the necessary arrangements are made.
Example: In the end, we all decided to organize a concert for Easter.

Definition: If you talk about the orientation of an organization or country, you are talking about the kinds of aims and interests it has.
Example: ...a marketing orientation.

Definition: You can refer to the beginning, cause, or source of something as its origin or origins.
Example: ...theories about the origin of life.

Definition:
You use original when referring to something that existed at the beginning of a process or activity, or the characteristics that something
had when it began or was made.
Example: The original plan was to hold an indefinite stoppage.

Definition: When you say what happened or was the case originally, you are saying what happened or was the case when something began or came into existence, often to contrast it with what happened later.
Example: The plane has been kept in service far longer than originally intended.

Definition: You use other to refer to an additional thing or person of the same type as one that has been mentioned or is known about.
Example: They were just like any other young couple.

Definition: used to indicate that people or things are not the ones already mentioned, but different ones
Example: Adrina suddenly decided that she preferred the Lady Chastity's company to others '.

Definition: You use otherwise after stating a situation or fact, in order to say what the result or consequence would be if this situation or fact was not the case.
Example: Make a note of the questions you want to ask. You will invariably forget them otherwise.

Definition: You use ought to to mean that it is morally right to do a particular thing or that it is morally right for a particular situation to exist, especially when giving or asking for advice or opinions.
Example: If you get something good, you ought to share it.

Definition:
You use our to indicate that something belongs or relates both to yourself and to one or more
other people.
Example: We're expecting our first baby.

Definition: You use ourselves to refer to yourself and one or more other people as a group.
Example: We sat round the fire to keep ourselves warm.

Definition: When something is in a particular place and you take it out, you remove it from that place.
Example: Carefully pull out the centre pages.

Definition: The outcome of an activity, process, or situation is the situation that exists at the end of it.
Example: Mr. Singh said he was pleased with the outcome.

Definition: The outside of something is the part which surrounds or encloses the rest of it.
Example: ...the outside of the building.

Definition: An oven is a device for cooking that is like a box with a door. You heat it and cook food inside it.
Example: Put the onions and ginger in the oven and let them roast for thirty minutes.

Definition:
If one thing is over another thing or is moving over it, the first thing is directly above the second, either resting on it, or with a
space between them.
Example: He looked at himself in the mirror over the table.

Definition: You use overall to indicate that you are talking about a situation in general or about the whole of something.
Example: ...the overall rise in unemployment.

Definition: If you overcome a problem or a feeling, you successfully deal with it and control it.
Example: Molly had fought and overcome her fear of flying.

Definition: If a building or window overlooks a place, you can see the place clearly from the building or window.
Example: Pretty and comfortable rooms overlook a flower-filled garden.

Definition: If you owe money to someone, they have lent it to you and you have not yet paid it back. You can also say that the money is owing.
Example: The company owes money to more than 60 banks.

Definition: You use own to indicate that something belongs to a particular person or thing.
Example: Helen decided I should have my own shop.

Definition: The owner of something is the person to whom it belongs.
Example: The owner of the store was sweeping his floor when I walked in.

Definition: The pace of something is the speed at which it happens or is done.
Example: Many people were not satisfied with the pace of change.

Definition: When you pack, or when you pack a bag, you put clothes and other things into it, because you are leaving a place or going on holiday.
Example: When I was 17, I packed my bags and left home.

Definition: A package is a small parcel.
Example: I tore open the package.

Definition: A page is one side of one of the pieces of paper in a book, magazine, or newspaper. Each page usually has a number printed at the top or bottom.
Example: Where's your book? Take it out and turn to page 4.

Definition: Pain is the feeling of great discomfort you have, for example when you have been hurt or when you are ill.
Example: ...back pain.

Definition: If a part of your body is painful, it hurts because it is injured or because there is something wrong with it.
Example: Her glands were swollen and painful.

Definition: Paint is a coloured liquid that you put onto a surface with a brush in order to protect the surface or to make it look nice, or that you use to produce a picture.
Example: ...a pot of red paint.

Definition: A painter is an artist who paints pictures.
Example: DOCTORS have cured a painter and decorator suffering uncontrollable tremors in his right hand - with sound waves.

Definition: A painting is a picture which someone has painted.
Example: ...a large oil-painting of Queen Victoria.

Definition:
A pair of things are two things of the same size and shape that are used together or are both
part of something, for example shoes, earrings, or parts of the body.
Example: ...a pair of socks.

Definition: If something is pale, it is very light in colour or almost white.
Example: Migrating birds filled the pale sky.

Definition: Palestinian means belonging or relating to the region between the River Jordan and the Mediterranean Sea which used to be called Palestine, or to the Arabs who come from this region.

A palm or a palm tree is a tree that grows in hot countries. It has long leaves growing at the top, and
no branches.
Example: Dornberg slapped the table with the palm of his hand.

Definition: A pan is a round metal container with a long handle, which is used for cooking things in, usually on top of a cooker or stove.
Example: Heat the butter and oil in a large pan.

Definition: A panel is a small group of people who are chosen to do something, for example to discuss something in public or to make a decision.
Example: He assembled a panel of scholars to advise him.

Definition: If you pant, you breathe quickly and loudly with your mouth open, because you have been doing something energetic.
Example: She climbed rapidly until she was panting with the effort.

Definition: Paper is a material that you write on or wrap things with. The pages of this book are made of paper.
Example: He wrote his name down on a piece of paper for me.

Definition: Your parents are your mother and father.
Example: Children need their parents.

Definition:
A park is a public area of land with grass and trees, usually in a town, where people go
in order to relax and enjoy themselves.
Example: ...Regent's Park.

Definition:
Parking is the action of moving a vehicle into a place in a car park or by the side of the
road where it can be left.
Example: In many towns parking is allowed only on one side of the street.

Definition: A part of something is one of the pieces, sections, or elements that it consists of.
Example: I like that part of Cape Town.

Definition: The participants in an activity are the people who take part in it.
Example: 40 of the course participants are offered employment with the company.

Definition: If you participate in an activity, you take part in it.
Example: They expected him to participate in the ceremony.

Definition: Someone who is active moves around a lot or does a lot of things. [...]
You use particular to emphasize that you are talking about one thing or one kind of thing rather than other similar ones.
Example: I remembered a particular story about a postman who was a murderer.

Definition: You use particularly to indicate that what you are saying applies especially to one thing or situation.
Example: Keep your office space looking good, particularly your desk.

Definition: You use partly to indicate that something happens or exists to some extent, but not completely.
Example: It's partly my fault.

Definition: Your partner is the person you are married to or are having a romantic or sexual relationship with.
Example: Wanting other friends doesn't mean you don't love your partner.

Definition: Partnership or a partnership is a relationship in which two or more people, organizations, or countries work together as partners.
Example: ...the partnership between Germany's banks and its businesses.

Definition:
A party is a political organization whose members have similar aims and beliefs. Usually
the organization tries to get its members elected to the government of a country.
Example: ...a member of the Labour Party.

Definition: To pass someone or something means to go past them without stopping.
Example: As she passed the library door, the phone began to ring.

Definition: A passage is a long narrow space with walls or fences on both sides, which connects one place or room with another.
Example: Harry stepped into the passage and closed the door behind him.

Definition: A passenger in a vehicle such as a bus, boat, or plane is a person who is travelling in it, but who is not driving it or working on it.
Example: Mr Fullemann was a passenger in the car when it crashed.

Definition: Passion is strong sexual feelings towards someone.
Example: ...my passion for a dark-haired, slender boy named James.

Definition: The past is the time before the present, and the things that have happened.
Example: In the past, about a third of the babies born to women with diabetes were lost.

Definition:
A patch on a surface is a part of it which is different in appearance from the area around
it.
Example: ...the bald patch on the top of his head.

Definition: A path is a long strip of ground which people walk along to get from one place to another.
Example: We followed the path along the clifftops.

Definition: A patient is a person who is receiving medical treatment from a doctor or hospital. A patient is also someone who is registered with a particular doctor.
Example: The earlier the treatment is given, the better the patient's chances.

Definition: A pattern is the repeated or regular way in which something happens or is done.
Example: All three attacks followed the same pattern.

Definition: If you pause while you are doing something, you stop for a short period and then continue.
Example: 'It's rather embarrassing,' he began, and paused.

Definition:
When you pay an amount of money to someone, you give it to them because you are buying something from them or because
you owe it to them. When you pay something such as a bill or a debt, you pay the amount that you owe.
Example: Accommodation is freeall you pay for is breakfast and dinner.

Definition: A payment is an amount of money that is paid to someone, or the act of paying this money.
Example: Thousands of its customers are in arrears with loans and mortgage payments.

Definition: In Britain, a PC is a male police officer of the lowest rank. PC is an abbreviation for 'police constable'.
Example: The PCs took her to the local station.

Definition: If countries or groups involved in a war or violent conflict are discussing peace, they are talking to each other in order to try to end the conflict.
Example: Peace talks broke up without agreement last week.

Definition: The peak of a process or an activity is the point at which it is at its strongest, most successful, or most fully developed.
Example:
The party's membership has fallen from a peak of fifty-thousand after the Second
World War.

Definition: If you peer at something, you look at it very hard, usually because it is difficult to see clearly.
Example: I had been peering at a computer print-out that made no sense at all.

Definition: A penalty is a punishment that someone is given for doing something which is against a law or rule.
Example: One of those arrested could face the death penalty.

Definition: People are men, women, and children. People is normally used as the plural of person, instead of 'persons'.
Example: ...the people of Angola.

Definition: Pepper is a hot-tasting spice which is used to flavour food.
Example: Season with salt and pepper.

Definition: You use per to express rates and ratios. For example, if something costs 50 per year, you must pay 50 each year for it. If a vehicle is travelling at 40 miles per hour, it travels 40 miles each hour.
Example: Social Security refused to pay her more than 17 per week.

Definition: If you perceive something, you see, notice, or realize it, especially when it is not obvious.
Example: Many young people do not perceive the need to consider pensions at all.

Definition: A percentage is a fraction of an amount expressed as a particular number of hundredths of that amount.
Example: Only a few vegetable-origin foods have such a high percentage of protein.

Definition: Your perception of something is the way that you think about it or the impression you have of it.
Example: He is interested in how our perceptions of death affect the way we live.

Definition: Something that is perfect is as good as it could possibly be.
Example: He spoke perfect English.

Definition: You can use perfectly to emphasize an adjective or adverb, especially when you think the person you are talking to might doubt what you are saying.
Example: There's no reason why you can't have a perfectly normal child.

Definition: When you perform a task or action, especially a complicated one, you do it.
Example: We're looking for people of all ages who have performed outstanding acts of bravery.

Definition: A performance involves entertaining an audience by doing something such as singing, dancing, or acting.
Example: Inside the theatre, they were giving a performance of Bizet's Carmen.

Definition: You use perhaps to express uncertainty, for example, when you do not know that something is definitely true, or when you are mentioning something that may possibly happen in the future in the way you describe.
Example: Millson regarded her thoughtfully. Perhaps she was right.

Definition: A period is a length of time.
Example: This crisis might last for a long period of time.

Definition: Something that is permanent lasts for ever.
Example: Heavy drinking can cause permanent damage to the brain.

Definition: If someone who has authority over you gives you permission to do something, they say that they will allow you to do it.
Example: He asked permission to leave the room.

Definition: If someone permits something, they allow it to happen. If they permit you to do something, they allow you to do it.
Example: He can let the court's decision stand and permit the execution.

Definition: A person is an individual human being.
Example: At least one person died and several others were injured.

Definition:
A personal opinion, quality, or thing belongs or relates to one particular person rather than to other
people.
Example: He learned this lesson the hard wayfrom his own personal experience.

Definition: Your personality is your whole character and nature.
Example: She has such a kind, friendly personality.

Definition: You use personally to emphasize that you are giving your own opinion.
Example: Personally I think it's a waste of time.

Definition: The personnel of an organization are the people who work for it.
Example: There has been very little renewal of personnel in higher education.

Definition: A particular perspective is a particular way of thinking about something, especially one that is influenced by your beliefs or experiences.
Example:
He says the death of his father 18 months ago has given him a new perspective on
life.

Definition: If you persuade someone to do something, you cause them to do it by giving them good reasons for doing it.
Example: My partner persuaded me to come.

Definition: A pet is an animal that you keep in your home to give you company and pleasure.
Example: It is plainly cruel to keep turtles as pets.

Definition: A phase is a particular stage in a process or in the gradual development of something.
Example: This autumn, 6000 residents will participate in the first phase of the project.

Definition: A phenomenon is something that is observed to happen or exist.
Example: ...scientific explanations of natural phenomena.

Definition: Philosophy is the study or creation of theories about basic things such as the nature of existence, knowledge, and thought, or about how people should live.
Example: He studied philosophy and psychology at Cambridge.

Definition: The phone is an electrical system that you use to talk to someone else in another place, by dialling a number on a piece of equipment and speaking into it.
Example: You can buy insurance over the phone.

Definition: A photo is the same as a photograph.
Example: We must take a photo!

Definition: A photograph is a picture made using a camera.
Example: He wants to take some photographs of the house.

Definition: A photographer is someone who takes photographs as a job or hobby.
Example: ...a group of TV cameramen and press photographers.

Definition: A phrase is a short group of words that people often use as a way of saying something. The meaning of a phrase is often not obvious from the meaning of the individual words in it.
Example: He used a phrase I hate: 'You have to be cruel to be kind.'

Definition: Physical qualities, actions, or things are connected with a person's body, rather than with their mind.
Example: ...the physical and mental problems caused by the illness.

Definition: If something deteriorates, it becomes worse in some way. [...]
In formal American English or old-fashioned British English, a physician is a doctor.
Example: He supposedly had an appointment scheduled for tomorrow with a personal physician.

Definition: A piano is a large musical instrument with a row of black and white keys. When you press these keys with your fingers, little hammers hit wire strings inside the piano which vibrate to produce musical notes.
Example: I taught myself how to play the piano.

Definition: If you pick a particular person or thing, you choose that one.
Example: Mr Nowell had picked ten people to interview for six sales jobs in London.

Definition: A picture consists of lines and shapes which are drawn, painted, or printed on a surface and show a person, thing, or scene.
Example: A picture of Rory O'Moore hangs in the dining room at Kildangan.

Definition: A pie consists of meat, vegetables, or fruit baked in pastry.
Example: ...a chicken pie.

Definition: A piece of something is an amount of it that has been broken off, torn off, or cut off.
Example: ...a piece of cake.

Definition: A pile of things is a mass of them that is high in the middle and has sloping sides.
Example: ...a pile of sand.

Definition: A pilot is a person who is trained to fly an aircraft.
Example: He spent seventeen years as an airline pilot.

Definition: A pine tree or a pine is a tall tree which has very thin, sharp leaves and a fresh smell. Pine trees have leaves all year round.
Example: ...high mountains covered in pine trees.

Definition: Pink is the colour between red and white.
Example: ...pink lipstick.

Definition:
A pipe is a long, round, hollow object, usually made of metal or plastic, through which
a liquid or gas can flow.
Example: They had accidentally damaged a gas pipe while drilling.

Definition: A pitch is an area of ground that is marked out and used for playing a game such as football, cricket, or hockey.
Example: There was a swimming-pool, cricket pitches, and playing fields.

Definition: A place is any point, building, area, town, or country.
Example: ...Temple Mount, the place where the Temple actually stood.

Definition: A plan is a method of achieving something that you have worked out in detail beforehand.
Example: ...a detailed plan of action for restructuring the group.

Definition: A plane is a vehicle with wings and one or more engines, which can fly through the air.
Example: He had plenty of time to catch his plane.

Definition: A planet is a large, round object in space that moves around a star. The Earth is a planet.
Example: The picture shows six of the nine planets in the solar system.

Definition:
Planning is the process of deciding in detail how to do something before you actually start
to do it.
Example: The trip needs careful planning.

Definition: A plant is a living thing that grows in the earth and has a stem, leaves, and roots.
Example: Water each plant as often as required.

Definition:
Plastic is a material which is produced from oil by a chemical process and which is used
to make many objects. It is light in weight and does not break easily.
Example: ...a wooden crate, sheltered from wetness by sheets of plastic.

Definition: A plate is a round or oval flat dish that is used to hold food.
Example: Anita pushed her plate away; she had eaten virtually nothing.

Definition: A platform is a flat, raised structure, usually made of wood, which people stand on when they make speeches or give a performance.
Example: Nick finished what he was saying and jumped down from the platform.

Definition: When children, animals, or perhaps adults play, they spend time doing enjoyable things, such as using toys and taking part in games.
Example: ...invite the children round to play.

Definition: A player in a sport or game is a person who takes part, either as a job or for fun.
Example: ...his greatness as a player.

Definition: You say please when you are politely asking or inviting someone to do something.
Example: Can you help us please?

Definition: If something gives you pleasure, you get a feeling of happiness, satisfaction, or enjoyment from it.
Example: Watching sport gave him great pleasure.

Definition: If there is plenty of something, there is a large amount of it. If there are plenty of things, there are many of them. Plenty is used especially to indicate that there is enough of something, or more than you need.
Example: There was still plenty of time to take Jill out for pizza.

Definition: A plot is a secret plan by a group of people to do something that is illegal or wrong, usually against a person or a government.
Example: Security forces have uncovered a plot to overthrow the government.

Definition: You say plus to show that one number or quantity is being added to another.
Example: Send a cheque for 18.99 plus 2 for postage and packing.

Definition: The PM is an abbreviation for the Prime Minister.
Example: The PM pledged to make life better for the poorest families.

Definition:
A pocket is a kind of small bag which forms part of a piece of clothing, and which is used
for carrying small things such as money or a handkerchief.
Example: He took his flashlight from his jacket pocket and switched it on.

Definition: A poem is a piece of writing in which the words are chosen for their beauty and sound and are carefully arranged, often in short lines which rhyme.
Example: One wrote a short poem on the fabric.

Definition: A poet is a person who writes poems.
Example: He was a painter and poet.

Definition: Poems, considered as a form of literature, are referred to as poetry.
Example: ...Russian poetry.

Definition: You use point to refer to something that someone has said or written.
Example: We disagree with every point the Minister makes.

Definition: A pole is a long thin piece of wood or metal, used especially for supporting things.
Example: The truck crashed into a telegraph pole.

Definition: The police are the official organization that is responsible for making sure that people obey the law.
Example: The police are also looking for a second car.

Definition: A policy is a set of ideas or plans that is used as a basis for making decisions, especially in politics, economics, or business.
Example: ...plans which include changes in foreign policy and economic reforms.

Definition: Political means relating to the way power is achieved and used in a country or society.
Example: All other political parties there have been completely banned.

Definition: If you  engage in an activity, you do it or are actively involved with it. [...]
A politician is a person whose job is in politics, especially a member of parliament or congress.
Example: They have arrested a number of leading opposition politicians.

Definition: Politics are the actions or activities concerned with achieving and using power in a country or society. The verb that follows politics may be either singular or plural.
Example: The key question in British politics was how long the prime minister could survive.

Definition: A poll is a survey in which people are asked their opinions about something, usually in order to find out how popular something is or what people intend to do in the future.
Example: At least 60 per cent of the country wants the strikers to win, polls show.

Definition: Pollution is the process of polluting water, air, or land, especially with poisonous chemicals.
Example: The fine was for the company's pollution of the air near its plants.

Definition: A pool is the same as a swimming pool.
Example: ...a heated indoor pool.

Definition: Someone who is poor has very little money and few possessions.
Example: The reason our schools cannot afford better teachers is because people here are poor.

Definition: Pop is modern music that usually has a strong rhythm and uses electronic equipment.
Example: ...the perfect combination of Caribbean rhythms, European pop, and American soul.

Definition: Something that is popular is enjoyed or liked by a lot of people.
Example: This is the most popular ball game ever devised.

Definition: The population of a country or area is all the people who live in it.
Example: The country now has a population of about 110 million.

Definition: A porch is a sheltered area at the entrance to a building. It has a roof and sometimes has walls.
Example: Is there a light in the porch or garden?

Definition: A port is a town by the sea or on a river, which has a harbour.
Example: Port-Louis is an attractive little fishing port.

Definition: A portion of something is a part of it.
Example: Damage was confined to a small portion of the castle.

Definition: A portrait is a painting, drawing, or photograph of a particular person.
Example: The artist was asked to paint a portrait of the Queen.

Definition: When an actor or actress portrays someone, he or she plays that person in a play or film.
Example: In 1975 he portrayed the king in a Los Angeles revival of 'Camelot'.

Definition: If something poses a problem or a danger, it is the cause of that problem or danger.
Example: This could pose a threat to jobs in the coal industry.

Definition: The position of someone or something is the place where they are in relation to other things.
Example: The ship was identified, and its name and position were reported to the coastguard.

Definition: If you are positive about things, you are hopeful and confident, and think of the good aspects of a situation rather than the bad ones.
Example: Be positive about your future and get on with living a normal life.

Definition: If you possess something, you have it or own it.
Example: He was then arrested and charged with possessing an offensive weapon.

Definition: If you say there is a possibility that something is the case or that something will happen, you mean that it might be the case or it might happen.
Example:
We were not in the least worried about the possibility that sweets could rot the
teeth.

Definition: If it is possible to do something, it can be done.
Example: If it is possible to find out where your brother is, we shall.

Definition: You use possibly to indicate that you are not sure whether something is true or might happen.
Example: Exercise will not only lower blood pressure but possibly protect against heart attacks.

Definition: The post is the public service or system by which letters and packages are collected and delivered.
Example: You'll receive your book through the post.

Definition: A pot is a deep round container used for cooking stews, soups, and other food.
Example: ...metal cooking pots.

Definition: Potatoes are quite round vegetables with brown or red skins and white insides. They grow under the ground.
Example: roast ~

Definition: You use potential to say that someone or something is capable of developing into the particular kind of person or thing mentioned.
Example: The firm has identified 60 potential customers at home and abroad.

Definition: To cause something, usually something bad, means to make it happen. [...]

The pound is the unit of money which is used in the UK. It is represented by the symbol .
One UK pound is divided into a hundred pence. Some other countries, for example Egypt, also have a unit of money called
a pound.
Example: Coffee is two pounds a cup.

Definition: If you pour a liquid or other substance, you make it flow steadily out of a container by holding the container at an angle.
Example: Pour a pool of sauce on two plates and arrange the meat neatly.

Definition: Poverty is the state of being extremely poor.
Example: ...people living in absolute poverty.

Definition: Powder consists of many tiny particles of a solid substance.
Example: Put a small amount of the powder into a container and mix with water.

Definition: If someone has power, they have a lot of control over people and activities.
Example: She interviewed six women who have reached positions of great power and influence.

Definition: A powerful person or organization is able to control or influence people and events.
Example: You're a powerful manpeople will listen to you.

Definition: The practical aspects of something involve real situations and events, rather than just ideas and theories.
Example:
We can offer you practical suggestions on how to increase the fibre in your daily
diet.

Definition: You can refer to something that people do regularly as a practice.
Example:
Some firms have cut workers' pay below the level set in their contract, a practice
that is illegal in Germany.

Definition: When people pray, they speak to God in order to give thanks or to ask for help.
Example: He spent his time in prison praying and studying.

Definition: Prayer is the activity of speaking to God.
Example: They had joined a religious order and dedicated their lives to prayer and good works.

Definition: Precisely means accurately and exactly.
Example: Nobody knows precisely how many people are still living in the camp.

Definition: If you predict an event, you say that it will happen.
Example: The latest opinion polls are predicting a very close contest.

Definition:
If you prefer someone or something, you like that person or thing better than another, and so you
are more likely to choose them if there is a choice.
Example: Does he prefer a particular sort of music?

Definition: If you have a preference for something, you would like to have or do that thing rather than something else.
Example: Parents can express a preference for the school their child attends.

Definition: Pregnancy is the condition of being pregnant or the period of time during which a female is pregnant.
Example: The cream is safe to use during pregnancy.

Definition: If a woman or a female animal is pregnant, she has a baby or babies developing in her body.
Example: She got pregnant soon after they married.

Definition: Preparation is the process of getting something ready for use or for a particular purpose or making arrangements for something.
Example: Rub the surface of the wood in preparation for the varnish.

Definition: If you prepare something, you make it ready for something that is going to happen.
Example: The most important task was to prepare a list of missing items.

Definition: A prescription is the piece of paper on which your doctor writes an order for medicine and which you give to a chemist or pharmacist to get the medicine.
Example: You will have to take your prescription to a chemist.

Definition: Someone's presence in a place is the fact that they are there.
Example: They argued that his presence in the village could only stir up trouble.

Definition:
You use present to describe things and people that exist now, rather than those that existed in the
past or those that may exist in the future.
Example: He has brought much of the present crisis on himself.

Definition: Presentation is the appearance of something, which someone has worked to create.
Example: Her recipes were clear and her presentation simple.

Definition: If you preserve a situation or condition, you make sure that it remains as it is, and does not change or end.
Example: We will do everything to preserve peace.

Definition: The president of a country that has no king or queen is the person who is the head of state of that country.
Example: ...President Zuma.

Definition: Presidential activities or things relate or belong to a president.
Example: ...Peru's presidential election.

Definition: If you press something somewhere, you push it firmly against something else.
Example: He pressed his back against the door.

Definition: Pressure is force that you produce when you press hard on something.
Example: She kicked at the door with her foot, and the pressure was enough to open it.

Definition: If you pretend that something is the case, you act in a way that is intended to make people believe that it is the case, although in fact it is not.
Example: I pretend that things are really okay when they're not.

Definition: If you describe someone as pretty, you mean that they are attractive.
Example: She's a very charming and very pretty girl.

Definition: To prevent something means to ensure that it does not happen.
Example: These methods prevent pregnancy.

Definition: A previous event or thing is one that happened or existed before the one that you are talking about.
Example: I'm a lot happier than I was in my previous job.

Definition: Previously means at some time before the period that you are talking about.
Example: Guyana's railways were previously owned by private companies.

Definition: The price of something is the amount of money that you have to pay in order to buy it.
Example: ...a sharp increase in the price of petrol.

Definition:
Pride is a feeling of satisfaction which you have because you or people close to you have
done something good or possess something good.
Example: ...the sense of pride in a job well done.

Definition: A priest is a member of the Christian clergy in the Catholic, Anglican, or Orthodox church.
Example: He had trained to be a Catholic priest.

Definition: You use primarily to say what is mainly true in a particular situation.
Example: ...a book aimed primarily at high-energy physicists.

Definition: You use primary to describe something that is very important.
Example: That's the primary reason the company's share price has held up so well.

Definition: You use prime to describe something that is most important in a situation.
Example: Political stability, meanwhile, will be a prime concern.

Definition: Principal means first in order of importance.
Example: The principal reason for my change of mind is this.

Definition: A principle is a general belief that you have about the way you should behave, which influences your behaviour.
Example:
Buck never allowed himself to be bullied into doing anything that went against his
principles.

Definition:
If someone prints something such as a book or newspaper, they produce it in large quantities using
a machine.
Example: He started to print his own posters to distribute abroad.

Definition: You use prior to indicate that something has already happened, or must happen, before another event takes place.
Example: He claimed he had no prior knowledge of the protest.

Definition: If something is a priority, it is the most important thing you have to do or deal with, or must be done or dealt with before everything else you have to do.
Example: Being a parent is her first priority.

Definition: A prison is a building where criminals are kept as punishment or where people accused of a crime are kept before their trial.
Example: The prison's inmates are being kept in their cells.

Definition: A prisoner is a person who is kept in a prison as a punishment for a crime that they have committed.
Example: The committee is concerned about the large number of prisoners sharing cells.

Definition: If you have privacy, you are in a place or situation which allows you to do things without other people seeing you or disturbing you.
Example: He saw the publication of this book as an embarrassing invasion of his privacy.

Definition: Private industries and services are owned or controlled by an individual person or a commercial company, rather than by the state or an official organization.
Example: ...a joint venture with private industry.

Definition: If you say that something is probably the case, you think that it is likely to be the case, although you are not sure.
Example: The White House probably won't make this plan public until July.

Definition: A problem is a situation that is unsatisfactory and causes difficulties for people.
Example: ...the economic problems of the inner city.

Definition: A procedure is a way of doing something, especially the usual or correct way.
Example: A biopsy is usually a minor surgical procedure.

Definition: If you proceed to do something, you do it, often after doing something else first.
Example: He proceeded to tell me of my birth.

Definition: A process is a series of actions which are carried out in order to achieve a particular result.
Example: There was total agreement to start the peace process as soon as possible.

Definition: To produce something means to cause it to happen.
Example: The drug is known to produce side-effects in women.

Definition: A producer is a person whose job is to produce plays, films, programmes, or CDs.
Example: Vanya Kewley is a freelance film producer.

Definition:
A product is something that is produced and sold in large quantities, often as a result of
a manufacturing process.
Example: Try to get the best product at the lowest price.

Definition: Production is the process of manufacturing or growing something in large quantities.
Example: That model won't go into production until next year.

Definition: A profession is a type of job that requires advanced education or training.
Example: Harper was a teacher by profession.

Definition: Professional means relating to a person's work, especially work that requires special training.
Example: His professional career started at Liverpool University.

Definition: A professor in a British university is the most senior teacher in a department.
Example: ...Professor Cameron.

Definition: Your profile is the outline of your face as it is seen when someone is looking at you from the side.
Example: His handsome profile was turned away from us.

Definition: A profit is an amount of money that you gain when you are paid more for something than it cost you to make, get, or do it.
Example: Footballers are accustomed to profiting handsomely from bonuses.

Definition: A program is a set of instructions that a computer follows in order to perform a particular task.
Example:
The chances of an error occurring in a computer program increase with the size of
the program.

Definition: Progress is the process of gradually improving or getting nearer to achieving or completing something.
Example: The medical community continues to make progress in the fight against cancer.

Definition: A project is a task that requires a lot of time and effort.
Example: Money will also go into local development projects in Vietnam.

Definition: Someone who is prominent is important.
Example: ...a prominent member of the Law Society.

Definition: If you promise that you will do something, you say to someone that you will definitely do it.
Example: The post office has promised to resume first class mail delivery to the area on Friday.

Definition: If people promote something, they help or encourage it to happen, increase, or spread.
Example: You don't have to sacrifice environmental protection to promote economic growth.

Definition: To prompt someone to do something means to make them decide to do it.
Example: Japan's recession has prompted consumers to cut back on buying cars.

Definition: Proof is a fact, argument, or piece of evidence which shows that something is definitely true or definitely exists.
Example: This is not necessarily proof that he is wrong.

Definition: You use proper to describe things that you consider to be real and satisfactory rather than inadequate in some way.
Example: Two out of five people lack a proper job.

Definition: If something is done properly, it is done in a correct and satisfactory way.
Example: You're too thin. You're not eating properly.

Definition: Someone's property is all the things that belong to them or something that belongs to them.
Example:
Richard could easily destroy her personal property to punish her for walking out
on him.

Definition: A proportion of a group or an amount is a part of it.
Example: A large proportion of the dolphins in that area will eventually die.

Definition: A proposal is a plan or an idea, often a formal or written one, which is suggested for people to think about and decide upon.
Example:
The President is to put forward new proposals for resolving the country's constitutional
crisis.

Definition: If you propose something such as a plan or an idea, you suggest it for people to think about and decide upon.
Example: Britain is about to propose changes to some institutions.

Definition: (of a plan, motion, etc) put forward for consideration or action
Example: She proposed a walk along the front, away from the holiday bustle, the family scenes, the fractious palm trees.

Definition: In some countries, a prosecutor is a lawyer or official who brings charges against someone or tries to prove in a trial that they are guilty.
Example: The giant of a public prosecutor presided with brisk efficiency.

Definition: If there is some prospect of something happening, there is a possibility that it will happen.
Example: Unfortunately, there is little prospect of seeing these big questions answered.

Definition: To protect someone or something means to prevent them from being harmed or damaged.
Example: So, what can women do to protect themselves from heart disease?

Definition: To give or be protection against something unpleasant means to prevent people or things from being harmed or damaged by it.
Example: Such a diet is widely believed to offer protection against a number of cancers.

Definition: Protein is a substance found in food and drink such as meat, eggs, and milk. You need protein in order to grow and be healthy.
Example: Fish was a major source of protein for the working man.

Definition: If you protest against something or about something, you say or show publicly that you object to it. In American English, you usually say that you protest it.
Example: Groups of women took to the streets to protest against the arrests.

Definition: If you feel proud, you feel pleased about something good that you possess or have done, or about something good that a person close to you has done.
Example: I felt proud of his efforts.

Definition: If something proves to be true or to have a particular quality, it becomes clear after a period of time that it is true or has that quality.
Example: None of the rumours has ever been proved to be true.

Definition: If you provide something that someone needs or wants, or if you provide them with it, you give it to them or make it available to them.
Example: I'll be glad to provide a copy of this.

Definition: a person or thing that provides
Example: Obviously the West End had signed up to an entirely different weather system provider -- more channels presumably.

Definition: A province is a large section of a country which has its own administration.
Example: ...the Algarve, Portugal's southernmost province.

Definition: The provision of something is the act of giving it or making it available to people who need or want it.
Example: The department is responsible for the provision of residential care services.

Definition: Psychological means concerned with a person's mind and thoughts.
Example: John received constant physical and psychological abuse from his father.

Definition: A psychologist is a person who studies the human mind and tries to explain why people behave in the way that they do.
Example: Psychologists tested a group of six-year-olds.

Definition: Psychology is the scientific study of the human mind and the reasons for people's behaviour.
Example: ...Professor of Psychology at Bedford College.

Definition:
You can refer to people in general, or to all the people in a particular country or community,
as the public.
Example: Lauderdale House is now open to the public.

Definition: The publication of a book or magazine is the act of printing it and sending it to shops to be sold.
Example:
The guide is being translated into several languages for publication at the end of
the year.

Definition: in a public manner; without concealment; openly
Example: They have not been named publicly but their relatives have been informed.

Definition: When a company publishes a book or magazine, it prints copies of it, which are sent to shops to be sold.
Example: They publish reference books.

Definition: A publisher is a person or a company that publishes books, newspapers, or magazines.
Example: The publishers planned to produce the journal on a weekly basis.

Definition:
When you pull something, you hold it firmly and use force in order to move it towards you or away
from its previous position.
Example: They have pulled out patients' teeth unnecessarily.

Definition: Punishment is the act of punishing someone or of being punished.
Example: ...a group which campaigns against the physical punishment of children.

Definition: When you purchase something, you buy it.
Example: He purchased a ticket and went up on the top deck.

Definition: A pure substance is not mixed with anything else.
Example: ...a carton of pure orange juice.

Definition: The purpose of something is the reason for which it is made or done.
Example: The purpose of the occasion was to raise money for medical supplies.

Definition: If you pursue an activity, interest, or plan, you carry it out or follow it.
Example: He said his country would continue to pursue the policies laid down at the summit.

Definition: When you push something, you use force to make it move away from you or away from its previous position.
Example: The woman pushed back her chair and stood up.

Definition: When you put something in a particular place or position, you move it into that place or position.
Example: Leaphorn put the photograph on the desk.

Definition: When someone qualifies, they pass the examinations that they need to be able to work in a particular profession.
Example: But when I'd qualified and started teaching it was a different story.

Definition: The quality of something is how good or bad it is.
Example: Everyone can greatly improve the quality of life.

Definition: A quarter is one of four equal parts of something.
Example: A quarter of the residents are over 55 years old.

Definition: In American football, a quarterback is the player on the attacking team who begins each play and who decides which play to use.
Example: You hit the quarterback and the team feels it.

Definition: A question is something that you say or write in order to ask a person about something.
Example: They asked a great many questions about England.

Definition: Someone or something that is quick moves or does things with great speed.
Example: You'll have to be quick. The flight leaves in about three hours.

Definition: with speed; rapidly; very soon
Example: The King was prone to violent outbursts when enraged, which usually dissipated as quickly as they started.

Definition: Someone or something that is quiet makes only a small amount of noise.
Example: Tania kept the children reasonably quiet and contented.

Definition: in a quiet manner
Example: In retirement he has not gone quietly into the night.

Definition: If you quit your job, you choose to leave it.
Example: He quit his job as an office boy in Athens.

Definition: You use quite to indicate that something is the case to a fairly great extent. Quite is less emphatic than 'very' and ' extremely'.
Example: I felt quite bitter about it at the time.

Definition: If you quote someone as saying something, you repeat what they have written or said.
Example: He quoted Mr Polay as saying that peace negotiations were already underway.

Definition:
A race is a competition to see who is the fastest, for example in running, swimming, or
driving.
Example: The first Le Mans 24-hour motor race was won by Andr Lagache and Ren Lonard.

Definition: Racial describes things relating to people's race.
Example: ...the protection of national and racial minorities.

Definition: Radical changes and differences are very important and great in degree.
Example: The country needs a period of calm without more surges of radical change.

Definition: Radio is the broadcasting of programmes for the public to listen to, by sending out signals from a transmitter.
Example: The last 12 months have been difficult ones for local radio.

Definition:
A rail is a horizontal bar attached to posts or fixed round the edge of something as a fence
or support.
Example: He railed against hypocrisy and greed.

Definition: Rain is water that falls from the clouds in small drops.
Example: I hope you didn't get soaked standing out in the rain.

Definition: If you raise something, you move it so that it is in a higher position.
Example: He raised his hand to wave.

Definition: A range of things is a number of different things of the same general kind.
Example: A wide range of colours and patterns are available.

Definition: Someone's rank is the position or grade that they have in an organization.
Example: He eventually rose to the rank of captain.

Definition: A rapid change is one that happens very quickly.
Example: ...the country's rapid economic growth in the 1980s.

Definition: When someone ages, or when something ages them, they seem much older and less strong or less alert. [...]
Something that is rare is not common and is therefore interesting or valuable.
Example: ...the black-necked crane, one of the rarest species in the world.

Definition: If something rarely happens, it does not happen very often.
Example: June and her daughters laughed a lot and rarely fought.

Definition: The rate at which something happens is the speed with which it happens.
Example: The rate at which hair grows can be agonisingly slow.

Definition: You use rather when you are correcting something that you have just said, especially when you are describing a particular situation after saying what it is not.
Example:
Twenty million years ago, Idaho was not the arid place it is now. Rather, it was
warm and damp.

Definition: A rating of something is a score or measurement of how good or popular it is.
Example: ...a value-for-money rating of ten out of ten.

Definition: A ratio is a relationship between two things when it is expressed in numbers or amounts. For example, if there are ten boys and thirty girls in a room, the ratio of boys to girls is 1:3, or one to three.
Example: In 1978 there were 884 students at a lecturer/student ratio of 1:15.

Definition:
Raw materials or substances are in their natural state before being processed or used
in manufacturing.
Example: We import raw materials and energy and export mainly industrial products.

Definition: When someone or something reaches a place, they arrive there.
Example: He did not stop until he reached the door.

Definition: When you react to something that has happened to you, you behave in a particular way because of it.
Example: They reacted violently to the news.

Definition: Your reaction to something that has happened or something that you have experienced is what you feel, say, or do because of it.
Example: Reaction to the visit is mixed.

Definition: When you read something such as a book or article, you look at and understand the words that are written there.
Example: Have you read this book?

Definition: The readers of a newspaper, magazine, or book are the people who read it.
Example:
If you are a regular reader of Homes & Gardens you will know what an invaluable source
of inspiration it is.

Definition: Reading is the activity of reading books.
Example: I have always loved reading.

Definition: If someone is ready, they are properly prepared for something. If something is ready, it has been properly prepared and is now able to be used.
Example: It took her a long time to get ready for church.

Definition: Something that is real actually exists and is not imagined, invented, or theoretical.
Example: No, it wasn't a dream. It was real.

Definition: You use reality to refer to real things or the real nature of things rather than imagined, invented, or theoretical ideas.
Example: Fiction and reality were increasingly blurred.

Definition: If you realize that something is true, you become aware of that fact or understand it.
Example: As soon as we realised something was wrong, we moved the children away.

Definition: You can use really to emphasize a statement.
Example: I'm very sorry. I really am.

Definition: The reason for something is a fact or situation which explains why it happens or what causes it to happen.
Example: There is a reason for every important thing that happens.

Definition: If you think that someone is fair and sensible, you can say that they are reasonable.
Example: He's a reasonable sort of chap.

Definition: When you recall something, you remember it and tell others about it.
Example: Henderson recalled that he first met Pollard during a business trip to Washington.

Definition: When you receive something, you get it after someone gives it to you or sends it to you.
Example: They will receive their awards at a ceremony in Stockholm.

Definition: A recent event or period of time happened only a short while ago.
Example: In the most recent attack one man was shot dead and two others were wounded.

Definition: If you have done something recently or if something happened recently, it happened only a short time ago.
Example: The bank recently opened a branch in Germany.

Definition: A recipe is a list of ingredients and a set of instructions that tell you how to cook something.
Example: ...a traditional recipe for oatmeal biscuits.

Definition: Recognition is the act of recognizing someone or identifying something when you see it.
Example:
George said, 'Ida, how are you?' She frowned for a moment and then recognition dawned.
'George Black. Well, I never.'

Definition: If you recognize someone or something, you know who that person is or what that thing is.
Example: The receptionist recognized him at once.

Definition: If someone recommends a person or thing to you, they suggest that you would find that person or thing good or useful.
Example: I have just spent a holiday there and would recommend it to anyone.

Definition: The recommendations of a person or a committee are their suggestions or advice on what is the best thing to do.
Example: The committee's recommendations are unlikely to be made public.

Definition: If you keep a record of something, you keep a written account or photographs of it so that it can be referred to later.
Example: Keep a record of all the payments.

Definition: A recording of something is a record, CD, tape, or video of it.
Example: ...a video recording of a police interview.

Definition: When you recover from an illness or an injury, you become well again.
Example: He is recovering from a knee injury.

Definition: If a sick person makes a recovery, he or she becomes well again.
Example: He made a remarkable recovery from a shin injury.

Definition: If you recruit people for an organization, you select them and persuade them to join it or work for it.
Example: The police are trying to recruit more Black and Asian officers.

Definition: Something that is red is the colour of blood or fire.
Example: ...a bunch of red roses.

Definition: If you reduce something, you make it smaller in size or amount, or less in degree.
Example: It reduces the risks of heart disease.

Definition: When there is a reduction in something, it is made smaller.
Example: ...a future reduction in U.K. interest rates.

Definition: If you refer to a particular subject or person, you talk about them or mention them.
Example: In his speech, he referred to a recent trip to Canada.

Definition: Reference to someone or something is the act of talking about them or mentioning them. A reference is a particular example of this.
Example: He made no reference to any agreement.

Definition: If something reflects an attitude or situation, it shows that the attitude or situation exists or it shows what it is like.
Example: This conference with all of you here reflects the unity of our nation.

Definition: A reflection is an image that you can see in a mirror or in glass or water.
Example: Meg stared at her reflection in the bedroom mirror.

Definition: Reform consists of changes and improvements to a law, social system, or institution. A reform is an instance of such a change or improvement.
Example: The party embarked on a programme of economic reform.

Definition:
Refugees are people who have been forced to leave their homes or their country, either because there is a war there or because of their political
or religious beliefs.
Example: It would mean we could settle in another country as refugees.

Definition: If you refuse to do something, you deliberately do not do it, or you say firmly that you will not do it.
Example: He refused to comment after the trial.

Definition: If you regard someone or something as being a particular thing or as having a particular quality, you believe that they are that thing or have that quality.
Example: He was regarded as the most successful Chancellor of modern times.

Definition: You can use regarding to indicate the subject that is being talked or written about.
Example: He refused to divulge any information regarding the man's whereabouts.

Definition: If you say that someone did something regardless, you mean that they did it even though there were problems or factors that could have stopped them, or perhaps should have stopped them.
Example: Despite her recent surgery she has been carrying on regardless.

Definition: If you refer to a government or system of running a country as a regime, you are critical of it because you think it is not democratic and uses unacceptable methods.
Example: ...the collapse of the Fascist regime at the end of the war.

Definition: A region is a large area of land that is different from other areas of land, for example because it is one of the different parts of a country with its own customs and characteristics, or because it has a particular geographical feature.
Example: ...a remote mountain region.

Definition: Regional is used to describe things which relate to a particular area of a country or of the world.
Example: ...the autonomous regional government of Andalucia.

Definition: A register is an official list or record of people or things.
Example: ...registers of births, deaths and marriages.

Definition: Regular events have equal amounts of time between them, so that they happen, for example, at the same time each day or each week.
Example: Take regular exercise.

Definition: at regular times or intervals
Example: This was a favourite restaurant of ours situated in the hills above Half Moon Bay where we used to go regularly.

Definition: To regulate an activity or process means to control it, especially by means of rules.
Example: Serious reform is needed to improve institutions that regulate competition.

Definition:
Regulations are rules made by a government or other authority in order to control the way something
is done or the way people behave.
Example: Employers are using the new regulations to force out people over 65.

Definition: If something reinforces a feeling, situation, or process, it makes it stronger or more intense.
Example:
A stronger European Parliament would, they fear, only reinforce the power of the
larger countries.

Definition: If you reject something such as a proposal, a request, or an offer, you do not accept it or you do not agree to it.
Example:
The British government is expected to reject the idea of state subsidy for a new
high speed railway.

Definition: If something relates to a particular subject, it concerns that subject.
Example: Other recommendations relate to the details of how such data is stored.

Definition: Relations between people, groups, or countries are contacts between them and the way in which they behave towards each other.
Example: Greece has established full diplomatic relations with Israel.

Definition: The relationship between two people or groups is the way in which they feel and behave towards each other.
Example: ...the friendly relationship between France and Britain.

Definition: Your relatives are the members of your family.
Example: Do relatives of yours still live in Siberia?

Definition: Relatively means to a certain degree, especially when compared with other things of the same kind.
Example: The sums needed are relatively small.

Definition: If you relax or if something relaxes you, you feel more calm and less worried or tense.
Example: I ought to relax and stop worrying about it.

Definition: If a person or animal is released from somewhere where they have been locked up or looked after, they are set free or allowed to go.
Example: He was released from custody the next day.

Definition: Something that is relevant to a situation or person is important or significant in that situation or to that person.
Example: Is socialism still relevant to people's lives?

Definition: If you feel a sense of relief, you feel happy because something unpleasant has not happened or is no longer happening.
Example: I breathed a sigh of relief.

Definition: Religion is belief in a god or gods and the activities that are connected with this belief, such as praying or worshipping in a building such as a church or temple.
Example: ...his understanding of Indian philosophy and religion.

Definition: You use religious to describe things that are connected with religion or with one particular religion.
Example: ...religious groups.

Definition: If you rely on someone or something, you need them and depend on them in order to live or work properly.
Example: They relied heavily on the advice of their professional advisers.

Definition:
If someone or something remains in a particular state or condition, they stay in that state or condition and do not
change.
Example: The three men remained silent.

Definition: The remaining things or people out of a group are the things or people that still exist, are still present, or have not yet been dealt with.
Example: The three parties will meet next month to work out remaining differences.

Definition: Someone or something that is remarkable is unusual or special in a way that makes people notice them and be surprised or impressed.
Example: He was a remarkable man.

Definition: If you remember people or events from the past, you still have an idea of them in your mind and you are able to think about them.
Example: You wouldn't remember me. I was in another group.

Definition: If someone reminds you of a fact or event that you already know about, they say something which makes you think about it.
Example: So she simply welcomed him and reminded him of the last time they had met.

Definition: Remote areas are far away from cities and places where most people live, and are therefore difficult to get to.
Example: Landslides have cut off many villages in remote areas.

Definition: If you remove something from a place, you take it away.
Example: As soon as the cake is done, remove it from the oven.

Definition: If you repeat something, you say or write it again. You can say I repeat to show that you feel strongly about what you are repeating.
Example: He repeated that he had been mis-quoted.

Definition: If you do something repeatedly, you do it many times.
Example: Both men have repeatedly denied the allegations.

Definition: If one thing or person replaces another, the first is used or acts instead of the second.
Example: The council tax replaced the poll tax in 1993.

Definition: When you reply to something that someone has said or written to you, you say or write an answer to them.
Example: 'That's a nice dress,' said Michael. 'Thanks,' she replied solemnly.

Definition: If you report something that has happened, you tell people about it.
Example: They had been called in to clear drains after local people reported a foul smell.

Definition: A reporter is someone who writes news articles or who broadcasts news reports.
Example: ...a TV reporter.

Definition: If someone such as a lawyer or a politician represents a person or group of people, they act on behalf of that person or group.
Example: ...the politicians we elect to represent us.

Definition: If a group or person has representation in a parliament or on a committee, someone in the parliament or on the committee supports them and makes decisions on their behalf.
Example:
Independent shareholders who own about half the stock now have no representation
on the board.

Definition: A representative is a person who has been chosen to act or make decisions on behalf of another person or a group of people.
Example: ...trade union representatives.

Definition: Republican means relating to a republic. In republican systems of government, power is held by the people or the representatives that they elect.
Example: ...the nations that had adopted the republican form of government.

Definition: To have a reputation for something means to be known or remembered for it.
Example: She has a reputation for being a very depressing writer.

Definition: If you request something, you ask for it politely or formally.
Example: Mr Dennis said he had requested access to a telephone.

Definition: If you require something or if something is required, you need it or it is necessary.
Example: If you require further information, you should consult the registrar.

Definition: A requirement is a quality or qualification that you must have in order to be allowed to do something or to be suitable for something.
Example: Its products met all legal requirements.

Definition: Research is work that involves studying something and trying to discover facts about it.
Example: 65 percent of the 1987 budget went for nuclear weapons research and production.

Definition: Academic is used to describe things that relate to the work done in schools, colleges, and universities, especially work which involves studying and reasoning rather than practical or technical skills. [...]
If one thing or person resembles another, they are similar to each other.
Example: The fish had white, firm flesh that resembled chicken.

Definition: If you have reservations about something, you are not sure that it is entirely good or right.
Example: I told him my main reservation about his film was the ending.

Definition: The residents of a house or area are the people who live there.
Example: ...building low-cost homes for local residents.

Definition: If you resist something such as a change, you refuse to accept it and try to prevent it.
Example: The Chancellor warned employers to resist demands for high pay increases.

Definition: Resistance to something such as a change or a new idea is a refusal to accept it.
Example:
The U.S. wants big cuts in European agricultural export subsidies, but this is meeting
resistance.

Definition: A resolution is a formal decision taken at a meeting by means of a vote.
Example:
He replied that the U.N. had passed two major resolutions calling for a complete
withdrawal.

Definition: To resolve a problem, argument, or difficulty means to find a solution to it.
Example: We must find a way to resolve these problems before it's too late.

Definition: If you resort to a course of action that you do not really approve of, you adopt it because you cannot see any other way of achieving what you want.
Example: When all else failed, he resorted to violence.

Definition: The resources of an organization or person are the materials, money, and other things that they have and can use in order to function properly.
Example: Some families don't have the resources to feed themselves properly.

Definition: If you respect someone, you have a good opinion of their character or ideas.
Example: I want him to respect me as a career woman.

Definition: When you respond to something that is done or said, you react to it by doing or saying something yourself.
Example: They are likely to respond positively to the President's request for aid.

Definition: A respondent is a person who replies to something such as a survey or set of questions.
Example: 60 percent of the respondents said they disapproved of the president's performance.

Definition: Your response to an event or to something that is said is your reply or reaction to it.
Example: There has been no response to his remarks from the government.

Definition: If you have responsibility for something or someone, or if they are your responsibility, it is your job or duty to deal with them and to take decisions relating to them.
Example: Each manager had responsibility for just under 600 properties.

Definition: If someone or something is responsible for a particular event or situation, they are the cause of it or they can be blamed for it.
Example: He still felt responsible for her death.

Definition:
The rest is used to refer to all the parts of something or all the things in a group that remain or that you
have not already mentioned.
Example: It was an experience I will treasure for the rest of my life.

Definition: A restaurant is a place where you can eat a meal and pay for it. In restaurants your food is usually served to you at your table by a waiter or waitress.
Example: They ate in an Italian restaurant in Forth Street.

Definition: To restore a situation or practice means to cause it to exist again.
Example: The army has recently been brought in to restore order.

Definition: A restriction is an official rule that limits what you can do or that limits the amount or size of something.
Example: ...the lifting of restrictions on political parties and the news media.

Definition: A result is something that happens or exists because of something else that has happened.
Example:
Compensation is available for people who developed asthma as a direct result of their
work.

Definition: To retain something means to continue to have that thing.
Example: The interior of the shop still retains a nineteenth-century atmosphere.

Definition: When older people retire, they leave their job and usually stop working completely.
Example: At the age when most people retire, he is ready to face a new career.

Definition: Retirement is the time when a worker retires.
Example: ...the proportion of the population who are over retirement age.

Definition: When you return to a place, you go back there after you have been away.
Example: The Prime Minister will return to London tonight.

Definition: To reveal something means to make people aware of it.
Example: She has refused to reveal the whereabouts of her daughter.

Definition: Revenue is money that a company, organization, or government receives from people.
Example:
...a boom year at the cinema, with record advertising revenue and the highest ticket
sales since 1980.

Definition:
A review of a situation or system is its formal examination by people in authority. This is usually
done in order to see whether it can be improved or corrected.
Example: The president ordered a review of U.S. economic aid to Jordan.

Definition: A revolution is a successful attempt by a large group of people to change the political system of their country by force.
Example: The period since the revolution has been one of political turmoil.

Definition: A rhythm is a regular series of sounds or movements.
Example: His music of that period fused the rhythms of Jazz with classical forms.

Definition: Rice consists of white or brown grains taken from a cereal plant. You cook rice and usually eat it with meat or vegetables.
Example: ...a meal consisting of chicken, rice and vegetables.

Definition: A rich person has a lot of money or valuable possessions.
Example: You're going to be a very rich man.

Definition: If you rid a place or person of something undesirable or unwanted, you succeed in removing it completely from that place or person.
Example: The proposals are an attempt to rid the country of political corruption.

Definition: When you ride a horse, you sit on it and control its movements.
Example: I saw a girl riding a horse.

Definition: A rifle is a gun with a long barrel.
Example: They shot him at point blank range with an automatic rifle.

Definition: If something is right, it is correct and agrees with the facts.
Example: That's absolutely right.

Definition: When you ring someone, you phone them.
Example: He rang me at my mother's.

Definition: If something rises, it moves upwards.
Example: He watched the smoke rise from the chimney.

Definition: If there is a risk of something unpleasant, there is a possibility that it will happen.
Example: There is a small risk of brain damage from the procedure.

Definition: A river is a large amount of fresh water flowing continuously in a long line across the land.
Example: ...a chemical works on the banks of the river.

Definition: A road is a long piece of hard ground which is built between two places so that people can drive or ride easily from one place to the other.
Example: There was very little traffic on the roads.

Definition: Rock is the hard substance which the Earth is made of.
Example: The hills above the valley are bare rock.

Definition: If you have a role in a situation or in society, you have a particular position and function in it.
Example: ...the drug's role in preventing more serious effects of infection.

Definition: When something rolls or when you roll it, it moves along a surface, turning over many times.
Example: The ball rolled into the net.

Definition: Someone who is romantic or does romantic things says and does things that make their wife, husband, girlfriend, or boyfriend feel special and loved.
Example: When we're together, all he talks about is business. I wish he were more romantic.

Definition: The roof of a building is the covering on top of it that protects the people and things inside from the weather.
Example: ...a small stone cottage with a red slate roof.

Definition: A room is one of the separate sections or parts of the inside of a building. Rooms have their own walls, ceilings, floors, and doors, and are usually used for particular activities. You can refer to all the people who are in a room as the room.
Example: A minute later he excused himself and left the room.

Definition: The roots of a plant are the parts of it that grow under the ground.
Example: ...the twisted roots of an apple tree.

Definition: A rope is a thick cord or wire that is made by twisting together several thinner cords or wires. Ropes are used for jobs such as pulling cars, tying up boats, or tying things together.
Example: He tied the rope around his waist.

Definition: Rose is the past tense of rise.
Example: She bent to pick a red rose.

Definition: If a surface is rough, it is uneven and not smooth.
Example: His hands were rough and calloused, from years of karate practice.

Definition: without being exact or fully authenticated; approximately
Example: Roughly chop the stalks into strips and set aside.

Definition: To be positioned round a place or object means to surround it or be on all sides of it. To move round a place means to go along its edge, back to the point where you started.
Example: They were sitting round the kitchen table.

Definition: A route is a way from one place to another.
