Example: ...the most direct route to the town centre.

Definition: A routine is the usual series of things that you do at a particular time. A routine is also the practice of regularly doing things in a fixed order.
Example: The players had to change their daily routine and lifestyle.

Definition: A row of things or people is a number of them arranged in a line.
Example: ...a row of pretty little cottages.

Definition: If you rub a part of your body, you move your hand or fingers backwards and forwards over it while pressing firmly.
Example: He rubbed his arms and stiff legs.

Definition: Rules are instructions that tell you what you are allowed to do and what you are not allowed to do.
Example: ...a thirty-two-page pamphlet explaining the rules of basketball.

Definition:
When you run, you move more quickly than when you walk, for example because you are in a hurry
to get somewhere, or for exercise.
Example: I excused myself and ran back to the phone.

Definition: Running is the activity of moving fast on foot, especially as a sport.
Example: We chose to do cross-country running.

Definition: Rural places are far away from large towns or cities.
Example: These plants have a tendency to grow in the more rural areas.

Definition: If you rush somewhere, you go there quickly.
Example: A schoolgirl rushed into a burning flat to save a man's life.

Definition: Russian means belonging or relating to Russia, or to its people, language, or culture.
Example: ...the Russian parliament.

Definition: Something that is sacred is believed to be holy and to have a special connection with God.
Example: The owl is sacred for many Native American people.

Definition: If you are sad, you feel unhappy, usually because something has happened that you do not like.
Example: The relationship had been important to me and its loss left me feeling sad and empty.

Definition: Something that is safe does not cause physical harm or danger.
Example:
Officials arrived to assess whether it is safe to bring emergency food supplies into
the city.

Definition: Safety is the state of being safe from harm or danger.
Example: The report goes on to make a number of recommendations to improve safety on aircraft.

Definition: Sak is a Japanese alcoholic drink that is made from rice.
Example: for the sake of harmony

Definition: A salad is a mixture of raw or cold foods such as lettuce, cucumber, and tomatoes. It is often served with other food as part of a meal.
Example: ...a salad of tomato, onion and cucumber.

Definition: A salary is the money that someone is paid each month by their employer, especially when they are in a profession such as teaching, law, or medicine.
Example: The lawyer was paid a huge salary.

Definition: The sale of goods is the act of selling them for money.
Example: Efforts were made to limit the sale of sugary drinks.

Definition: the number of goods, products, or services that a company sells within a certain time period
Example: Sales growth smoothies here has slowed, but the numbers are still ahead of last year.

Definition: Salt is a strong-tasting substance, in the form of white powder or crystals, which is used to improve the flavour of food or to preserve it. Salt occurs naturally in sea water.
Example: Season lightly with salt and pepper.

Definition: If two or more things, actions, or qualities are the same, or if one is the same as another, they are very like each other in some way.
Example: The houses were all the samesquare, close to the street, needing paint.

Definition: A sample of a substance or product is a small quantity of it that shows you what it is like.
Example: You'll receive samples of paint, curtains and upholstery.

Definition: If someone in authority sanctions an action or practice, they officially approve of it and allow it to be done.
Example: He may now be ready to sanction the use of force.

Definition: Sand is a substance that looks like powder, and consists of extremely small pieces of stone. Some deserts and many beaches are made up of sand.
Example: They all walked barefoot across the damp sand to the water's edge.

Definition: A satellite is an object which has been sent into space in order to collect information or to be part of a communications system. Satellites move continually round the Earth or around another planet.
Example: The rocket launched two communications satellites.

Definition: Satisfaction is the pleasure that you feel when you do something or get something that you wanted or needed to do or get.
Example: She felt a small glow of satisfaction.

Definition: If someone or something satisfies you, they give you enough of what you want or need to make you pleased or contented.
Example: The pace of change has not been quick enough to satisfy everyone.

Definition: A sauce is a thick liquid which is served with other food.
Example: ...pasta cooked in a sauce of garlic, tomatoes, and cheese.

Definition: If you save someone or something, you help them to avoid harm or to escape from a dangerous or unpleasant situation.
Example: ...a final attempt to save 40,000 jobs in the troubled aero industry.

Definition: A saving is a reduction in the amount of time or money that is used or needed.
Example: Fill in the form below and you will be making a saving of 6.60 on a one-year subscription.

Definition: When you say something, you speak words.
Example: 'I'm sorry,' he said.

Definition: If you refer to the scale of something, you are referring to its size or extent, especially when it is very big.
Example: However, he underestimates the scale of the problem.

Definition: A scandal is a situation or event that is thought to be shocking and immoral and that everyone knows about.
Example: ...a financial scandal.

Definition: If you are scared of someone or something, you are frightened of them.
Example: I'm certainly not scared of him.

Definition: If you talk about a likely or possible scenario, you are talking about the way in which a situation may develop.
Example: ...the nightmare scenario of a divided and irrelevant Royal Family.

Definition: A scene in a play, film, or book is part of it in which a series of events happen in the same place.
Example: I found the proposal scene tremendously poignant.

Definition: A schedule is a plan that gives a list of events or tasks and the times at which each one should happen or be done.
Example: He has been forced to adjust his schedule.

Definition:
A scheme is a plan or arrangement involving many people which is made by a government or other
organization.
Example: ...schemes to help combat unemployment.

Definition: A scholar is a person who studies an academic subject and knows a lot about it.
Example: The library attracts thousands of scholars and researchers.

Definition: If you get a scholarship to a school or university, your studies are paid for by the school or university or by some other organization.
Example: He got a scholarship to the Pratt Institute of Art.

Definition: A school is a place where children are educated. You usually refer to this place as school when you are talking about the time that children spend there and the activities that they do there.
Example: ...a boy who was in my class at school.

Definition: Science is the study of the nature and behaviour of natural things and the knowledge that we obtain about them.
Example: The best discoveries in science are very simple.

Definition: Scientific is used to describe things that relate to science or to a particular science.
Example:
...federal financing of basic scientific research , especially in the fields of
health and national security.

Definition: A scientist is someone who has studied science and whose job is to teach or do research in science.
Example: Scientists have collected more data than expected.

Definition: If there is scope for a particular kind of behaviour or activity, people have the opportunity to behave in this way or do that activity.
Example: He believed in giving his staff scope for initiative.

Definition: In a sport or game, if a player scores a goal or a point, they gain a goal or point.
Example: He scored three goals in the first three minutes.

Definition: When someone screams, they make a very loud, high-pitched cry, for example because they are in pain or are very frightened.
Example: People were screaming; some of the houses nearest the bridge were on fire.

Definition:
A screen is a flat vertical surface on which pictures or words are shown. Television sets and computers have
screens, and films are shown on a screen in cinemas.
Example: Many viewers have strong opinions about violence on the screen.

Definition: The script of a play, film, or television programme is the written version of it.
Example: Jenny's writing a film script.

Definition: The sea is the salty water that covers about three-quarters of the Earth's surface.
Example: Most of the kids have never seen the sea.

Definition: If you search for something or someone, you look carefully for them.
Example: The Turkish security forces have started searching for the missing men.

Definition: The seasons are the main periods into which a year can be divided and which each have their own typical weather conditions.
Example: Autumn's my favourite season.

Definition: A seat is an object that you can sit on, for example a chair.
Example: Stephen returned to his seat.

Definition: A second is one of the sixty parts that a minute is divided into. People often say 'a second' or 'seconds' when they simply mean a very short time.
Example: For a few seconds nobody said anything.

Definition: If something is secret, it is known about by only a small number of people, and is not told or shown to anyone else.
Example: Soldiers have been training at a secret location.

Definition: A secretary is a person who is employed to do office work, such as typing letters, answering phone calls, and arranging meetings.
Example: My grandfather was secretary of the Scottish Miners' Union.

Definition: A section of something is one of the parts into which it is divided or from which it is formed.
Example:
He acknowledged that his family belonged to a section of society known as 'the idle
rich'.

Definition: A particular sector of a country's economy is the part connected with that specified type of industry.
Example: ...the nation's manufacturing sector.

Definition: If you secure something that you want or need, you obtain it, often after a lot of effort.
Example: Federal leaders continued their efforts to secure a ceasefire.

Definition: Security refers to all the measures that are taken to protect a place, or to ensure that only people with permission enter it or leave it.
Example: They are now under a great deal of pressure to tighten their airport security.

Definition: When you see something, you notice it using your eyes.
Example: You can't see colours at night.

Definition: A seed is the small, hard part of a plant from which a new plant grows.
Example: ...a packet of cabbage seed.

Definition: If you seek something such as a job or a place to live, you try to find one.
Example: They have had to seek work as labourers.

Definition:
You use seem to say that someone or something gives the impression of having a particular quality, or
of happening in the way you describe.
Example: We heard a series of explosions. They seemed quite close by.

Definition: A segment of something is one part of it, considered separately from the rest.
Example: ...the poorer segments of society.

Definition: If you seize something, you take hold of it quickly, firmly, and forcefully.
Example: 'Leigh,' he said, seizing my arm to hold me back.

Definition: If you select something, you choose it from a number of things of the same kind.
Example:
Voters are selecting candidates for both U.S. Senate seats and for 52 congressional
seats.

Definition: Selection is the act of selecting one or more people or things from a group.
Example: ...Darwin's principles of natural selection.

Definition: Your self is your basic personality or nature, especially considered in terms of what you are really like as a person.
Example: You're looking more like your usual self.

Definition: If you sell something that you own, you let someone have it in return for money.
Example: I sold everything I owned except for my car and my books.

Definition: The Senate is the smaller and more important of the two parts of the parliament in some countries, for example the United States and Australia.
Example: The Senate is expected to pass the bill shortly.

Definition: A senator is a member of a political Senate, for example in the United States or Australia.
Example: The first concerns the right of cultural councils to elect senators.

Definition: When you send someone something, you arrange for it to delivered to them, for example electronically or by post.
Example: Myra Cunningham sent me a note thanking me for dinner.

Definition: The senior people in an organization or profession have the highest and most important jobs.
Example: ...senior officials in the Israeli government.

Definition: Your senses are the physical abilities of sight, smell, hearing, touch, and taste.
Example: She stared at him again, unable to believe the evidence of her senses.

Definition: If you are sensitive to other people's needs, problems, or feelings, you show understanding and awareness of them.
Example: The classroom teacher must be sensitive to a child's needs.

Definition: A sentence is a group of words which, when they are written down, begin with a capital letter and end with a full stop, question mark, or exclamation mark. Most sentences contain a subject and a verb.
Example: They are already serving prison sentences for their part in the assassination.

Definition: If one thing is separate from another, there is a barrier, space, or division between them, so that they are clearly two things.
Example: Each villa has a separate sitting-room.

Definition: A sequence of events or things is a number of events or things that come one after another in a particular order.
Example: ...the sequence of events which led to the murder.

Definition: A series of things or events is a number of them that come one after the other.
Example: ...a series of meetings with students and political leaders.

Definition: Serious problems or situations are very bad and cause people to be worried or afraid.
Example: Crime is an increasingly serious problem in modern society.

Definition: You use seriously to indicate that you are not joking and that you really mean what you say.
Example: But seriously, we've had really positive feedback from all sorts of people.

Definition: If you serve your country, an organization, or a person, you do useful work for them.
Example: It is unfair to soldiers who have served their country well for many years.

Definition:
A service is something that the public needs, such as transport, communications facilities, hospitals, or energy supplies, which is provided in a planned and organized way by the government
or an official body.
Example: Britain still boasts the cheapest postal service.

Definition: A session is a meeting of a court, parliament, or other official group.
Example: ...an emergency session of parliament.

Definition: A set of things is a number of things that belong together or that are thought of as a group.
Example: There must be one set of laws for the whole of the country.

Definition: A particular setting is a particular place or type of surroundings where something is or takes place.
Example: Rome is the perfect setting for romance.

Definition: If people settle an argument or problem, or if something settles it, they solve it, for example by making a decision about who is right or about what to do.
Example: They agreed to try to settle their dispute by negotiation.

Definition: A settlement is an official agreement between two sides who were involved in a conflict or argument.
Example: Our objective must be to secure a peace settlement.

Definition: Seven is the number 7.
Example: Sarah and Ella have been friends for seven years.

Definition: Several is used to refer to an imprecise number of people or things that is not large but is greater than two.
Example: I had lived two doors away from this family for several years.

Definition: You use severe to indicate that something bad or undesirable is great or intense.
Example: ...a business with severe cash flow problems.

Definition: The two sexes are the two groups, male and female, into which people and animals are divided according to the function they have in producing young.
Example: ...an entertainment star who appeals to all ages and both sexes.

Definition: Sexual feelings or activities are connected with the act of sex or with people's desire for sex.
Example: This was the first sexual relationship I had had.

Definition: A shade of a particular colour is one of its different forms. For example, emerald green and olive green are shades of green.
Example: In the mornings the sky appeared a heavy shade of mottled gray.

Definition: A shadow is a dark shape on a surface that is made when something stands between a light and the surface.
Example: An oak tree cast its shadow over a tiny round pool.

Definition: If you shake something, you hold it and move it quickly backwards and forwards or up and down. You can also shake a person, for example, because you are angry with them or because you want them to wake up.
Example: The nurse shook the thermometer and put it under my armpit.

Definition: You use shall with 'I' and 'we' in questions in order to make offers or suggestions, or to ask for advice.
Example: Shall I get the keys?

Definition: The shape of an object, a person, or an area is the appearance of their outside edges or surfaces, for example whether they are round, square, curved, or fat.
Example: Each mirror is made to order and can be designed to almost any shape or size.

Definition: A company's shares are the many equal parts into which its ownership is divided. Shares can be bought by people as an investment.
Example:
This is why the British Airways' chairman has been so keen to buy shares in the rival
airline. .

Definition: A sharp point or edge is very thin and can cut through things very easily. A sharp knife, tool, or other object has a point or edge of this kind.
Example: The other end of the twig is sharpened into a sharp point to use as a toothpick.

Definition: You use she to refer to a woman, girl, or female animal who has already been mentioned or whose identity is clear.
Example: When Ann arrived home that night, she found Brian in the house watching TV.

Definition: A sheet is a large rectangular piece of cotton or other cloth that you sleep on or cover yourself with in a bed.
Example: Once a week, a maid changes the sheets.

Definition: A shelf is a flat piece of wood, metal, or glass which is attached to a wall or to the sides of a cupboard. Shelves are used for keeping things on.
Example: He took a book from the shelf.

Definition: The shell of a nut or egg is the hard covering which surrounds it.
Example: She shelled and ate a few nuts.

Definition: A shelter is a small building or covered place which is made to protect people from bad weather or danger.
Example: The city's bomb shelters were being prepared for possible air raids.

Definition: If you shift something or if it shifts, it moves slightly.
Example: He stopped, shifting his cane to his left hand.

Definition: When the sun or a light shines, it gives out bright light.
Example: It is a mild morning and the sun is shining.

Definition: A ship is a large boat which carries passengers or cargo.
Example: Within ninety minutes the ship was ready for departure.

Definition: A shirt is a piece of clothing that you wear on the upper part of your body. Shirts have a collar, sleeves, and buttons down the front.
Example: With just the odd blue shirt here and there.

Definition: Some people use shit to refer to solid waste matter from the body of a human being or animal.
Example: This is a load of shit.

Definition: If you have a shock, something suddenly happens which is unpleasant, upsetting, or very surprising.
Example: The extent of the violence came as a shock.

Definition:
Shoes are objects which you wear on your feet. They cover most of your foot and you wear
them over socks or stockings.
Example: ...a pair of shoes.

Definition: If someone shoots a person or an animal, they kill them or injure them by firing a bullet or arrow at them.
Example: The police had orders to shoot anyone who attacked them.

Definition: A shooting is an occasion when someone is killed or injured by being shot with a gun.
Example: Two more bodies were found nearby after the shooting.

Definition: A shop is a building or part of a building where things are sold.
Example: ...health-food shops.

Definition: When you do the shopping, you go to shops and buy things.
Example: I'll do the shopping this afternoon.

Definition: The shores or the shore of a sea, lake, or wide river is the land along the edge of it. Someone who is on shore is on the land rather than on a ship.
Example: They walked down to the shore.

Definition: If something is short or lasts for a short time, it does not last very long.
Example: The announcement was made a short time ago.

Definition:
If something happens shortly after or before something else, it happens not long after or before it. If something
is going to happen shortly, it is going to happen soon.
Example: Their trial will shortly begin.

Definition: Shot is the past tense and past participle of shoot.
Example: He had murdered Perceval at point blank range with a single shot.

Definition: You use should when you are saying what would be the right thing to do or the right state for something to be in.
Example: I should exercise more.

Definition: Your shoulders are between your neck and the tops of your arms.
Example: She led him to an armchair, with her arm round his shoulder.

Definition: If you shout, you say something very loudly, usually because you want people a long distance away to hear you or because you are angry.
Example: He had to shout to make himself heard above the near gale-force wind.

Definition: If something shows that a state of affairs exists, it gives information that proves it or makes it clear to people.
Example: Research shows that a high-fibre diet may protect you from bowel cancer.

Definition: A shower is a device for washing yourself. It consists of a pipe which ends in a flat cover with a lot of holes in it so that water comes out in a spray.
Example: She heard him turn on the shower.

Definition: If you shrug, you raise your shoulders to show that you are not interested in something or that you do not know or care about something.
Example: I shrugged, as if to say, 'Why not?'

Definition: If you shut something such as a door or if it shuts, it moves so that it fills a hole or a space.
Example: Just make sure you shut the gate after you.

Definition: If you are sick, you are ill. Sick usually means physically ill, but it can sometimes be used to mean mentally ill.
Example: He's very sick. He needs medication.

Definition:
The side of something is a position to the left or right of it, rather than in front of it, behind
it, or on it.
Example: There was a stone staircase against the side of the house.

Definition: When you sigh, you let out a deep breath, as a way of expressing feelings such as disappointment, tiredness, or pleasure.
Example: Michael sighed wearily.

Definition: Someone's sight is their ability to see.
Example: My sight is failing, and I can't see to read any more.

Definition: A sign is a mark or shape that always has a particular meaning, for example in mathematics or music.
Example: Equations are generally written with a two-bar equals sign.

Definition: A signal is a gesture, sound, or action which is intended to give a particular message to the person who sees or hears it.
Example: They fired three distress signals.

Definition: The significance of something is the importance that it has, usually because it will have an effect on a situation or shows something about a situation.
Example: Ideas about the social significance of religion have changed over time.

Definition: A significant amount or effect is large enough to be important or affect a situation to a noticeable degree.
Example: A small but significant number of 11-year-olds are illiterate.

Definition: To advance means to move forward, often in order to attack someone. [...]
If there is silence, nobody is speaking.
Example: They stood in silence.

Definition: Someone who is silent is not speaking.
Example: Trish was silent because she was reluctant to put her thoughts into words.

Definition: Silver is a valuable pale-grey metal that is used for making jewellery and ornaments.
Example: ...a hand-crafted brooch made from silver.

Definition: If one thing is similar to another, or if two things are similar, they have features that are the same.
Example: ...a savoury cake with a texture similar to that of carrot cake.

Definition: You use similarly to say that something is similar to something else.
Example: Most of the men who now gathered round him again were similarly dressed.

Definition: If you describe something as simple, you mean that it is not complicated, and is therefore easy to understand.
Example: ...simple pictures and diagrams.

Definition: You use simply to emphasize that something consists of only one thing, happens for only one reason, or is done in only one way.
Example: The table is simply a chipboard circle on a base.

Definition: Sin or a sin is an action or type of behaviour which is believed to break the laws of God.
Example: The Vatican's teaching on abortion is clear: it is a sin.

Definition: You use since when you are mentioning a time or event in the past and indicating that a situation has continued from then until now.
Example:
She had a breakthrough in her research some years ago, and since then she has been
very successful.

Definition: When you sing, you make musical sounds with your voice, usually producing words that fit a tune.
Example: I can't sing.

Definition: A singer is a person who sings, especially as a job.
Example: My mother was a singer in a dance band.

Definition: You use single to emphasize that you are referring to one thing, and no more than one thing.
Example: A single shot rang out.

Definition: A sink is a large fixed container in a kitchen, with taps to supply water. It is mainly used for washing dishes.
Example: In a naval battle your aim is to sink the enemy's ship.

Definition: People sometimes say sir as a very formal and polite way of addressing a man whose name they do not know or a man of superior rank. For example, a shop assistant might address a male customer as sir.
Example: Excuse me sir, but would you mind telling me what sort of car that is?

Definition: Your sister is a girl or woman who has the same parents as you.
Example: His sister Sarah helped him.

Definition: If you are sitting somewhere, for example in a chair, your bottom is resting on the chair and the upper part of your body is upright.
Example: Mother was sitting in her chair in the kitchen.

Definition: A site is a piece of ground that is used for a particular purpose or where a particular thing happens.
Example: He became a hod carrier on a building site.

Definition: You use situation to refer generally to what is happening in a particular place at a particular time, or to refer to what is happening to you.
Example: Army officers said the situation was under control.

Definition: Six is the number 6.
Example: ...a glorious career spanning more than six decades.

Definition: The size of something is how big or small it is. Something's size is determined by comparing it to other things, counting it, or measuring it.
Example:
Scientists have found the bones of a hoofed grazing animal about the size of a small
horse.

Definition: Skis are long, flat, narrow pieces of wood, metal, or plastic that are fastened to boots so that you can move easily on snow or water.
Example: ...a pair of skis.

Definition: A skill is a type of work or activity which requires special training and knowledge.
Example: Most of us will know someone who is always learning new skills, or studying new fields.

Definition: Your skin is the natural covering of your body.
Example: His skin is clear and smooth.

Definition: The sky is the space around the Earth which you can see when you stand outside and look upwards.
Example: The sun is already high in the sky.

Definition: A slave is someone who is the property of another person and has to work for that person.
Example:
The state of Liberia was formed a century and a half ago by freed slaves from the
United States.

Definition: Sleep is the natural state of rest in which your eyes are closed, your body is inactive, and your mind does not think.
Example: They were exhausted from lack of sleep.

Definition: A slice of bread, meat, fruit, or other food is a thin piece that has been cut from a larger piece.
Example: Try to eat at least four slices of bread a day.

Definition: When something slides somewhere or when you slide it there, it moves there smoothly over or against something.
Example: She slid the door open.

Definition: Something that is slight is very small in degree or quantity.
Example: Doctors say he has made a slight improvement.

Definition: Slightly means to some degree but not to a very large degree.
Example: His family then moved to a slightly larger house.

Definition: If you slip, you accidentally slide and lose your balance.
Example: He had slipped on an icy pavement.

Definition: Something that is slow moves, happens, or is done without much speed.
Example: The traffic is heavy and slow.

Definition: When you accumulate things or when they accumulate, they collect or are gathered over a period of time. [...]
A small person, thing, or amount of something is not large in physical size.
Example: She is small for her age.

Definition: Smart people and things are pleasantly neat and clean in appearance.
Example: He was smart and well groomed but not good looking.

Definition: The smell of something is a quality it has which you become aware of when you breathe in through your nose.
Example: ...the smell of freshly baked bread.

Definition: When you smile, the corners of your mouth curve up and you sometimes show your teeth. People smile when they are pleased or amused, or when they are being friendly.
Example: When he saw me, he smiled and waved.

Definition: Smoke consists of gas and small bits of solid material that are sent into the air when something burns.
Example: A cloud of black smoke blew over the city.

Definition: A smooth surface has no roughness, lumps, or holes.
Example: ...a rich cream that keeps skin soft and smooth.

Definition: If something snaps or if you snap it, it breaks suddenly, usually with a sharp cracking noise.
Example: He shifted his weight and a twig snapped.

Definition: Snow consists of a lot of soft white bits of frozen water that fall from the sky in cold weather.
Example: In Mid-Wales six inches of snow blocked roads.

Definition: You use so to refer back to something that has just been mentioned.
Example: 'Do you think that made much of a difference to the family?''I think so.'

Definition: You use so-called to indicate that you think a word or expression used to describe someone or something is in fact wrong.
Example: These are the facts that explode their so-called economic miracle.

Definition: Soccer is a game played by two teams of eleven players using a round ball. Players kick the ball to each other and try to score goals by kicking the ball into a large net. Outside the USA, this game is also referred to as football.
Example: Go to football games and soccer games.

Definition: Social means relating to society or to the way society is organized.
Example: ...the worst effects of unemployment, low pay and other social problems.

Definition: Society is people in general, thought of as a large organized group.
Example: This reflects attitudes and values prevailing in society.

Definition: Something that is soft is pleasant to touch, and not rough or hard.
Example: Regular use of a body lotion will keep the skin soft and supple.

Definition: Computer programs are referred to as software. Compare hardware.
Example: ...the people who write the software for big computer projects.

Definition: Soil is the substance on the surface of the earth in which plants grow.
Example: We have the most fertile soil in Europe.

Definition: Solar is used to describe things relating to the sun.
Example: A total solar eclipse is due to take place some time tomorrow.

Definition: A soldier is a person who works in an army, especially a person who is not an officer.
Example: You can make soldiers out of toast.

Definition: A solid substance or object stays the same shape whether it is in a container or not.
Example: ...the potential of greatly reducing our solid waste problem.

Definition: A solution to a problem or difficult situation is a way of dealing with it so that the difficulty is removed.
Example:
Although he has sought to find a peaceful solution, he is facing pressure to use
military force.

Definition: If you solve a problem or a question, you find a solution or an answer to it.
Example: Their domestic reforms did nothing to solve the problem of unemployment.

Definition:
You use some to refer to a quantity of something or to a number of people or things, when you are not stating
the quantity or number precisely.
Example: Robin opened some champagne.

Definition: Somebody means the same as someone.
Example: You may find somebody who wants the same sort of relationship that you do.

Definition: You use somehow to say that you do not know or cannot say how something was done or will be done.
Example: We'll manage somehow, you and me. I know we will.

Definition: You use someone or somebody to refer to a person without saying exactly who you mean.
Example: Her father was shot by someone trying to rob his small retail store.

Definition: You use something to refer to a thing, situation, event, or idea, without saying exactly what it is.
Example: He realized right away that there was something wrong.

Definition: You use sometimes to say that something happens on some occasions rather than all the time.
Example: During the summer, my skin sometimes gets greasy.

Definition: You use somewhat to indicate that something is the case to a limited extent or degree.
Example: He concluded that Oswald was somewhat abnormal.

Definition: You use somewhere to refer to a place without saying exactly where you mean.
Example: I've got a feeling I've seen him before somewhere.

Definition: Someone's son is their male child.
Example: He shared a pizza with his son Laurence.

Definition: A song is words sung to a tune.
Example: ...a voice singing a Spanish song.

Definition: If something is going to happen soon, it will happen after a short time. If something happened soon after a particular time or event, it happened a short time after it.
Example: You'll be hearing from us very soon.

Definition: A sophisticated machine, device, or method is more advanced or complex than others.
Example: Honeybees use one of the most sophisticated communication systems of any insect.

Definition: You say 'Sorry' or 'I'm sorry' as a way of apologizing to someone for something that you have done which has upset them or caused them difficulties, or when you bump into them accidentally.
Example: 'We're all talking at the same time.''Yeah. Sorry.'

Definition: If you talk about a particular sort of something, you are talking about a class of things that have particular features in common and that belong to a larger group of related things.
Example: What sort of school did you go to?

Definition: Your soul is the part of you that consists of your mind, character, thoughts, and feelings. Many people believe that your soul continues existing after your body is dead.
Example: She went to pray for the soul of her late husband.

Definition: A sound is something that you hear.
Example: The buzzer sounded in Daniel's office.

Definition: Soup is liquid food made by boiling meat, fish, or vegetables in water.
Example: ...home-made chicken soup.

Definition: The source of something is the person, place, or thing which you get it from.
Example:
...over 40 per cent of British adults use television as their major source of information
about the arts.

Definition: The south is the direction which is on your right when you are looking towards the direction where the sun rises.
Example: The town lies ten miles to the south of here.

Definition: Southern means in or from the south of a region, state, or country.
Example: The Everglades National Park stretches across the southern tip of Florida.

Definition: Soviet is used to describe something that belonged or related to the former Soviet Union.
Example: ...Soviet athletes.

Definition:
You use space to refer to an area that is empty or available. The area can be any size. For example, you can refer to a large area outside as
a large open space or to a small area between two objects as a small space.
Example: ...bits of open space such as fields and small parks.

Definition: Spanish means belonging or relating to Spain, or to its people, language, or culture.
Example: ...a Spanish sherry.

Definition: When you speak, you use your voice in order to say something.
Example: He tried to speak, but for once, his voice had left him.

Definition: A speaker at a meeting, conference, or other gathering is a person who is making a speech or giving a talk.
Example: Among the speakers at the gathering was the Treasury Secretary.

Definition: Someone or something that is special is better or more important than other people or things.
Example: You're very special to me, darling.

Definition: A specialist is a person who has a particular skill or knows a lot about a particular subject.
Example: If you are housebound, you can arrange for a home visit from a specialist adviser.

Definition: A species is a class of plants or animals whose members have the same main characteristics and are able to breed with each other.
Example: Pandas are an endangered species.

Definition: You use specific to refer to a particular fixed area, problem, or subject.
Example: Massage may help to increase blood flow to specific areas of the body.

Definition: You use specifically to emphasize that something is given special attention and considered separately from other things of the same kind.
Example: Our service is designed specifically for college students.

Definition: Speech is the ability to speak or the act of speaking.
Example: ...the development of speech in children.

Definition: The speed of something is the rate at which it moves or travels.
Example: He drove off at high speed.

Definition: When you spend money, you pay money for things that you want.
Example: By the end of the holiday I had spent all my money.

Definition: the act of paying out money
Example: Spending money on myself symbolised that those times were truly over.

Definition: If something spins or if you spin it, it turns quickly around a central point.
Example: The latest discs, used for small portable computers, spin 3600 times a minute.

Definition: Your spirit is the part of you that is not physical and that consists of your character and feelings.
Example: The human spirit is virtually indestructible.

Definition: Spiritual means relating to people's thoughts and beliefs, rather than to their bodies and physical surroundings.
Example: She lived entirely by spiritual values, in a world of poetry and imagination.

Definition: If something splits or if you split it, it is divided into two or more parts.
Example: In a severe gale the ship split in two.

Definition: A spokesman is a male spokesperson.
Example: A U.N. spokesman said that the mission will carry 20 tons of relief supplies.

Definition: Sports are games such as football and basketball and other competitive leisure activities which need physical effort and skill.
Example: I'd say football is my favourite sport.

Definition: Spots are small, round, coloured areas on a surface.
Example: The leaves have yellow areas on the top and underneath are powdery orange spots.

Definition:
If you spread something somewhere, you open it out or arrange it over a place or surface, so that all of it can be
seen or used easily.
Example: She spread a towel on the sand and lay on it.

Definition:
Spring is the season between winter and summer when the weather becomes warmer and plants
start to grow again.
Example: We planted bulbs to flower in spring.

Definition: A square is a shape with four sides that are all the same length and four corners that are all right angles.
Example: Serve the cake warm or at room temperature, cut in squares.

Definition: If you squeeze something, you press it firmly, usually with your hands.
Example: He squeezed her arm reassuringly.

Definition: the quality of being stable
Example: This stability provides a real foundation for future growth.

Definition: If something is stable, it is not likely to change or come to an end suddenly.
Example: The price of oil should remain stable for the rest of the year.

Definition: The staff of an organization are the people who work for it.
Example: They are staffed by volunteers.

Definition: A stage of an activity, process, or period is one part of it.
Example: The way children express their feelings depends on their stage of development.

Definition: Stairs are a set of steps inside a building which go from one floor to another.
Example: Nancy began to climb the stairs.

Definition: The stakes involved in a contest or a risky action are the things that can be gained or lost.
Example: The game was usually played for high stakes between two large groups.

Definition:
When you are standing, your body is upright, your legs are straight, and your weight is supported by your
feet.
Example: She was standing beside my bed staring down at me.

Definition: A standard is a level of quality or achievement, especially a level that is thought to be acceptable.
Example: The standard of professional cricket has never been lower.

Definition: Someone's standing is their reputation or status.
Example: ...an artist of international standing.

Definition: A star is a large ball of burning gas in space. Stars appear to us as small points of light in the sky on clear nights.
Example: The night was dark, the stars hidden behind cloud.

Definition: If you stare at someone or something, you look at them for a long time.
Example: Tamara stared at him in disbelief, shaking her head.

Definition: If you start to do something, you do something that you were not doing before and you continue doing it.
Example: John then unlocked the front door and I started to follow him up the stairs.

Definition: You can refer to countries as states, particularly when you are discussing politics.
Example: A successful secular state is built on liberal democratic foundations.

Definition: A statement is something that you say or write which gives information in a formal or definite way.
Example: Andrew now disowns that statement, saying he was depressed when he made it.

Definition: A station is a building by a railway line where trains stop so that people can get on or off.
Example: Ingrid went with him to the railway station to see him off.

Definition: quantitative data on any subject, esp data comparing the distribution of some quantity for different subclasses of the population
Example: But he has been mumbling statistics at me solidly, since he got the call from on high.

Definition: Your status is your social or professional position.
Example:
The fact that the burial involved an expensive coffin signifies that the person was
of high status.

Definition: If you stay where you are, you continue to be there and do not leave.
Example: 'Stay here,' Trish said. 'I'll bring the car down the drive to take you back.'

Definition: A steady situation continues or develops gradually without any interruptions and is not likely to change quickly.
Example:
Despite the steady progress of building work, the campaign against it is still going
strong.

Definition: If you steal something from someone, you take it away from them without their permission and without intending to return it.
Example: He was accused of stealing a small boy's bicycle.

Definition: Steel is a very strong metal which is made mainly from iron. Steel is used for making many things, for example bridges, buildings, vehicles, and cutlery.
Example: ...steel pipes.

Definition: If you take a step, you lift your foot and put it down in a different place, for example when you are walking.
Example: I took a step towards him.

Definition: A stick is a thin branch which has fallen off a tree.
Example: ...people carrying bundles of dried sticks to sell for firewood.

Definition: If a situation that used to exist still exists, it has continued and exists now.
Example: I still dream of home.

Definition: If you stir a liquid or other substance, you move it around or mix it in a container using something such as a spoon.
Example: Stir the soup for a few seconds.

Definition: Stocks are shares in the ownership of a company, or investments on which a fixed amount of interest will be paid.
Example: The shop stocks everything from chocolate to recycled loo paper.

Definition: Your stomach is the organ inside your body where food is digested before it moves into the intestines.
Example: He had an upset stomach.

Definition: Stone is a hard solid substance found in the ground and often used for building houses.
Example: He could not tell whether the floor was wood or stone.

Definition: If you have been doing something and then you stop doing it, you no longer do it.
Example: Stop throwing those stones!

Definition: If you refer to the storage of something, you mean that it is kept in a special place until it is needed.
Example: ...the storage of toxic waste.

Definition: A store is a building or part of a building where things are sold. In British English, store is used mainly to refer to a large shop selling a variety of goods, but in American English a store can be any size of shop.
Example: ...the decline in independent stores in the town centre.

Definition: A storm is very bad weather, with heavy rain, strong winds, and often thunder and lightning.
Example: ...the violent storms which whipped America's East Coast.

Definition: A story is a description of imaginary people and events, which is written or told in order to entertain.
Example: The second story in the book is titled 'The Scholar'.

Definition: A straight line or edge continues in the same direction and does not bend or curve.
Example: Keep the boat in a straight line.

Definition: Something that is strange is unusual or unexpected, and makes you feel slightly nervous or afraid.
Example: Then a strange thing happened.

Definition: A stranger is someone you have never met before.
Example: Telling a complete stranger about your life is difficult.

Definition: Strategic means relating to the most important, general aspects of something such as a military operation or political policy, especially when these are decided in advance.
Example: ...the new strategic thinking at the recent London summit.

Definition: A strategy is a general plan or set of plans intended to achieve something, especially over a long period.
Example: The group hope to agree a strategy for policing the area.

Definition: A stream is a small narrow river.
Example: There was a small stream at the end of the garden.

Definition: A street is a road in a city, town, or village, usually with houses along it.
Example: He lived at 66 Bingfield Street.

Definition: Your strength is the physical energy that you have, which gives you the ability to perform various actions, such as lifting or moving things.
Example: She has always been encouraged to swim to build up the strength of her muscles.

Definition: If something strengthens a person or group or if they strengthen their position, they become more powerful and secure, or more likely to succeed.
Example: The new constitution strengthens the government.

Definition: If you stress a point in a discussion, you put extra emphasis on it because you think it is important.
Example: The spokesman stressed that the measures did not amount to an overall ban.

Definition: Something that stretches over an area or distance covers or exists in the whole of that area or distance.
Example: The procession stretched for several miles.

Definition:
When there is a strike, workers stop doing their work for a period of time, usually in order to try to get
better pay or conditions for themselves.
Example: French air traffic controllers have begun a three-day strike in a dispute over pay.

Definition: String is thin rope made of twisted threads, used for tying things together or tying up parcels.
Example: He held out a small bag tied with string.

Definition: A strip of something such as paper, cloth, or food is a long, narrow piece of it.
Example:
...a new kind of manufactured wood made by pressing strips of wood together and baking
them.

Definition: If you stroke someone or something, you move your hand slowly and gently over them.
Example: Carla, curled up on the sofa, was stroking her cat.

Definition: Someone who is strong is healthy with good muscles and can move or carry heavy things, or do hard physical work.
Example: I'm not strong enough to carry him.

Definition: If you advocate a particular action or plan, you recommend it publicly. [...]
The structure of something is the way in which it is made, built, or organized.
Example: The typical family structure of Freud's patients involved two parents and two children.

Definition: If you struggle to do something, you try hard to do it, even though other people or things may be making it difficult for you to succeed.
Example: They had to struggle against all kinds of adversity.

Definition: A student is a person who is studying at a university or college.
Example: Warren's eldest son is an art student, at St Martin's.

Definition: A studio is a room where a painter, photographer, or designer works.
Example: She was in her studio again, painting onto a large canvas.

Definition: If you study, you spend time learning about a particular subject or subjects.
Example: ...a relaxed and happy atmosphere that will allow you to study to your full potential.

Definition: You can use stuff to refer to things such as a substance, a collection of things, events, or ideas, or the contents of something in a general way without mentioning the thing itself by name.
Example:
I'd like some coffee, and I don't object to the powdered stuff if it's all you've
got.

Definition: If you say that someone or something is stupid, you mean that they show a lack of good judgment or intelligence and they are not at all sensible.
Example: I'll never do anything so stupid again.

Definition:
The style of something is the general way in which it is done or presented, which often shows
the attitudes of the people involved.
Example: Our children's different needs and learning styles created many problems.

Definition: The subject of something such as a conversation, letter, or book is the thing that is being discussed or written about.
Example: It was I who first raised the subject of plastic surgery.

Definition: If you submit to something, you unwillingly allow something to be done to you, or you do what someone wants, for example because you are not powerful enough to resist.
Example:
In desperation, Mrs. Jones submitted to an operation on her right knee to relieve
the pain.

Definition: You use subsequent to describe something that happened or existed after the time or event that has just been referred to.
Example: ...the increase of population in subsequent years.

Definition: A substance is a solid, powder, liquid, or gas with particular properties.
Example: Ethylene glycol is a poisonous substance found in antifreeze.

Definition: Substantial means large in amount or degree.
Example: The party has just lost office and with it a substantial number of seats.

Definition: If you succeed in doing something, you manage to do it.
Example: We have already succeeded in working out ground rules with the Department of Defense.

Definition: Success is the achievement of something that you have been trying to do.
Example: It's important for the long-term success of any diet that you vary your meals.

Definition: Something that is successful achieves what it was intended to achieve. Someone who is successful achieves what they intended to achieve.
Example: How successful will this new treatment be?

Definition: Academic is used to describe things that relate to the work done in schools, colleges, and universities, especially work which involves studying and reasoning rather than practical or technical skills. [...]

You use such to refer back to the thing or person that you have just mentioned, or a thing or person like the one that you have just mentioned. You use such as and such...as to introduce a reference to the person or thing that has just been mentioned.
Example: There have been previous attempts at coups. We regard such methods as entirely unacceptable.

Definition: Sudden means happening quickly and unexpectedly.
Example: He had been deeply affected by the sudden death of his father-in-law.

Definition: If something happens suddenly, it happens quickly and unexpectedly.
Example: Suddenly, she looked ten years older.

Definition: If you sue someone, you start a legal case against them, usually in order to claim money from them because they have harmed you in some way.
Example: She sued him for libel over the remarks.

Definition: If you suffer pain, you feel it in your body or in your mind.
Example: Within a few days she had become seriously ill, suffering great pain and discomfort.

Definition: If something is sufficient for a particular purpose, there is enough of it for the purpose.
Example: One metre of fabric is sufficient to cover the exterior of an 18-in-diameter hatbox.

Definition:
Sugar is a sweet substance that is used to make food and drinks sweet. It is usually in
the form of small white or brown crystals.
Example: ...bags of sugar.

Definition: If you suggest something, you put forward a plan or idea for someone to think about.
Example: He suggested a link between class size and test results of seven-year-olds.

Definition: If you make a suggestion, you put forward an idea or plan for someone to think about.
Example: The dietitian was helpful, making suggestions as to how I could improve my diet.

Definition: People who commit suicide deliberately kill themselves because they do not want to continue living.
Example: She tried to commit suicide on several occasions.

Definition: A man's suit consists of a jacket, trousers, and sometimes a waistcoat, all made from the same fabric.
Example: ...a dark pin-striped business suit.

Definition: Summer is the season between spring and autumn when the weather is usually warm or hot.
Example: In summer I like to go sailing in Long Island.

Definition: A summit is a meeting at which the leaders of two or more countries discuss important matters.
Example: ...next week's Washington summit.

Definition: The sun is the ball of fire in the sky that the Earth goes round, and that gives us heat and light.
Example: The sun was now high in the southern sky.

Definition: Some people use super to mean very nice or very good.
Example: We had a super time.

Definition: If you supply someone with something that they want or need, you give them a quantity of it.
Example: ...an agreement not to produce or supply chemical weapons.

Definition: If you support someone or their ideas or aims, you agree with them, and perhaps help them because you want them to succeed.
Example: The vice president insisted that he supported the hard-working people of New York.

Definition: Supporters are people who support someone or something, for example a political leader or a sports team.
Example:
The fourth night of violence in the German city of Rostock was triggered by football
supporters.

Definition: You can use suppose or supposing before mentioning a possible situation or action. You usually then go on to consider the effects that this situation or action might have.
Example: Suppose someone gave you an egg and asked you to describe exactly what was inside.

Definition: You can use supposed to suggest that something that people talk about or believe in may not in fact exist, happen, or be as it is described.
Example: I am no longer fooled by the supposed benefits of a phoneless existence.

Definition: Supreme is used in the title of a person or an official group to indicate that they are at the highest level in a particular organization or system.
Example: MacArthur was Supreme Commander for the allied powers in the Pacific.

Definition: If you are sure that something is true, you are certain that it is true. If you are not sure about something, you do not know for certain what the true situation is.
Example:
He'd never been in a class before and he was not even sure that he should have been
teaching.

Definition: You use surely to emphasize that you think something should be true, and you would be surprised if it was not true.
Example: You're an intelligent woman, surely you realize by now that I'm helping you?

Definition: The surface of something is the flat top part of it or the outside of it.
Example: 97% of all the water on the Earth's surface is salt.

Definition: Surgery is medical treatment in which someone's body is cut open so that a doctor can repair, remove, or replace a diseased or damaged part.
Example: His father has just recovered from heart surgery.

Definition: A surprise is an unexpected event, fact, or piece of news.
Example: I have a surprise for you: We are moving to Switzerland!

Definition: If you are surprised at something, you have a feeling of surprise, because it is unexpected or unusual.
Example: This lady was genuinely surprised at what happened to her pet.

Definition: Something that is surprising is unexpected or unusual and makes you feel surprised.
Example: It is not surprising that children learn to read at different rates.

Definition: Something that is surprising is unexpected or unusual and makes you feel surprised. [...]
If a person or thing is surrounded by something, that thing is situated all around them.
Example: The small churchyard was surrounded by a rusted wrought-iron fence.

Definition: If you carry out a survey, you try to find out detailed information about a lot of different people or things, usually by asking people a series of questions.
Example: The council conducted a survey of the uses to which farm buildings are put.

Definition: If you refer to the survival of something or someone, you mean that they manage to continue or exist in spite of difficult circumstances.
Example: ...companies which have been struggling for survival in the advancing recession.

Definition: If a person or living thing survives in a dangerous situation such as an accident or an illness, they do not die.
Example: They battled to survive in icy seas for over four hours.

Definition: A survivor of a disaster, accident, or illness is someone who continues to live afterwards in spite of coming close to death.
Example: Officials said there were no survivors of the plane crash.

Definition: You use suspect when you are stating something that you believe is probably true, in order to make it sound less strong or direct.
Example: I suspect they were right.

Definition: If you sustain something, you continue it or maintain it for a period of time.
Example:
But he has sustained his fierce social conscience from young adulthood through old
age.

Definition: If someone swears, they use language that is considered to be rude or offensive, usually because they are angry.
Example: It's wrong to swear and shout.

Definition:
If you sweep an area of floor or ground, you push dirt or rubbish off it using a brush with a
long handle.
Example: The owner of the store was sweeping his floor when I walked in.

Definition: Sweet food and drink contains a lot of sugar.
Example: ...a mug of sweet tea.

Definition: When you swim, you move through water by making movements with your arms and legs.
Example: She learned to swim when she was really tiny.

Definition: If something swings or if you swing it, it moves repeatedly backwards and forwards or from side to side from a fixed point.
Example: The sail of the little boat swung crazily from one side to the other.

Definition:
A switch is a small control for an electrical device which you use to turn the device on or
off.
Example: Leona put some detergent into the dishwasher, shut the door and pressed the switch.

Definition: Something that is a symbol of a society or an aspect of life seems to represent it because it is very typical of it.
Example: To them, the monarchy is the special symbol of nationhood.

Definition: A symptom of an illness is something wrong with your body or mind that is a sign of the illness.
Example: One of the most common symptoms of schizophrenia is hearing imaginary voices.

Definition: A system is a way of working, organizing, or doing something which follows a fixed plan or set of rules. You can use system to refer to an organization or institution that is organized in this way.
Example: The present system of funding for higher education is unsatisfactory.

Definition: A table is a piece of furniture with a flat top that you put things on or sit at.
Example: She was sitting at the kitchen table eating a currant bun.

Definition: A tablespoon is a fairly large spoon used for serving food and in cooking.
Example: ...a tablespoon of sugar.

Definition: Tactics are the methods that you choose to use in order to achieve what you want in a particular situation.
Example: What sort of tactics will the President use to rally the people behind him?

Definition: The tail of an animal, bird, or fish is the part extending beyond the end of its body.
Example: The cattle were swinging their tails to disperse the flies.

Definition:
You can use take followed by a noun to talk about an action or event, when it would also be possible
to use the verb that is related to that noun. For example, you can say 'she took a shower' instead of 'she showered'.
Example: She was too tired to take a shower.

Definition: A tale is a story, often involving magic or exciting events.
Example: ...a collection of stories, poems and folk tales.

Definition: Talent is the natural ability to do something well.
Example: She is proud that both her children have a talent for music.

Definition: When you talk, you use spoken language to express your thoughts, ideas, or feelings.
Example: He was too distressed to talk.

Definition: Someone or something that is tall has a greater height than is normal or average.
Example: Being tall can make you feel incredibly self-confident.

Definition: A tank is a large container for holding liquid or gas.
Example: ...an empty fuel tank.

Definition: A tap is a device that controls the flow of a liquid or gas from a pipe or container, for example on a sink.
Example: She turned on the taps.

Definition: Tape is a narrow plastic strip covered with a magnetic substance. It is used to record sounds, pictures, and computer information.
Example: Tape is expensive and loses sound quality every time it is copied.

Definition: A target is something at which someone is aiming a weapon or other object.
Example: The village lies beside a main road, making it an easy target for bandits.

Definition: A task is an activity or piece of work which you have to do, usually as part of a larger project.
Example: Walker had the unenviable task of breaking the bad news to Hill.

Definition:
Taste is one of the five senses that people have. When you have food or drink in your mouth, your sense of
taste makes it possible for you to recognize what it is.
Example: I like the taste of fast food too much to give it up.

Definition:
Tax is an amount of money that you have to pay to the government so that it can pay for
public services.
Example: No-one enjoys paying tax.

Definition: Taxpayers are people who pay a percentage of their income to the government as tax.
Example: This does not represent value for money for the taxpayer.

Definition: Tea is a drink made by adding hot water to tea leaves or tea bags. Many people add milk to the drink and some add sugar.
Example: ...a cup of tea.

Definition: If you teach someone something, you give them instructions so that they know about it or how to do it.
Example: The trainers have a programme to teach them vocational skills.

Definition: A teacher is a person who teaches, usually as a job at a school or similar institution.
Example: I'm a teacher with 21 years' experience.

Definition: Teaching is the work that a teacher does in helping students to learn.
Example: The Government funds university teaching.

Definition: A team is a group of people who play a particular sport or game together against other similar groups of people.
Example: The team failed to qualify for the African Nations Cup finals.

Definition: Tears are the drops of salty liquid that come out of your eyes when you are crying.
Example: Her eyes filled with tears.

Definition: A teaspoon is a small spoon that you use to put sugar into tea or coffee.
Example: Drop the dough onto a baking sheet with a teaspoon.

Definition: Technical means involving the sorts of machines, processes, and materials that are used in industry, transport, and communications.
Example: In order to reach this limit a number of technical problems will have to be solved.

Definition: A technique is a particular method of doing an activity, usually a method that involves practical skills.
Example: ...tests performed using a new technique.

Definition: Technology refers to methods, systems, and devices which are the result of scientific knowledge being used for practical purposes.
Example: Technology is changing fast.

Definition: If you are in your teens, you are between thirteen and nineteen years old.
Example: Amazingly, all the performers are still in their teens.

Definition: A teenager is someone who is between thirteen and nineteen years old.
Example: As a teenager he attended Tulse Hill Senior High School.

Definition: The telephone is the electrical system of communication that you use to talk directly to someone else in a different place. You use the telephone by dialling a number on a piece of equipment and speaking into it.
Example: They usually exchanged messages by telephone.

Definition: A telescope is a long instrument shaped like a tube. It has lenses inside it that make distant things seem larger and nearer when you look through it.
Example: The telescope will enable scientists to see deeper into the universe than ever before.

Definition: A television or television set is a piece of electrical equipment consisting of a box with a glass screen on it on which you can watch programmes with pictures and sounds.
Example: She turned the television on and flicked around between news programmes.

Definition: If you tell someone something, you give them information.
Example: In the evening I returned to tell Phyllis our relationship was over.

Definition: The temperature of something is a measure of how hot or cold it is.
Example: The temperature soared to above 100 degrees in the shade.

Definition: Something that is temporary lasts for only a limited time.
Example: His job here is only temporary.

Definition: Ten is the number 10.
Example: Over the past ten years things have changed.

Definition: If something tends to happen, it usually happens or it often happens.
Example: A problem for manufacturers is that lighter cars tend to be noisy.

Definition: A tendency is a typical or repeated habit, action, or belief.
Example:
She has a tendency to glance around to see if there's someone more important to talk
to.

Definition: Tennis is a game played by two or four players on a rectangular court. The players use an oval racket with strings across it to hit a ball over a net across the middle of the court.
Example: Nowadays so many tennis players are peaking in their thirties.

Definition: Tension is the feeling that is produced in a situation when people are anxious and do not trust each other, and when there is a possibility of sudden violence or conflict.
Example: The tension between the two countries is likely to remain.

Definition: A tent is a shelter made of canvas or nylon which is held up by poles and ropes, and is used mainly by people who are camping.
Example: The big tent would remain standing.

Definition: A term is a word or expression with a specific meaning, especially one which is used in relation to a particular subject.
Example: Myocardial infarction is the medical term for a heart attack.

Definition: the actual language or mode of presentation used
Example: I didn't realize you were on such close personal terms with His Lordship, Andy.

Definition: A terrible experience or situation is very serious or very unpleasant.
Example:
Tens of thousands more suffered terrible injuries in the world's worst industrial
disaster.

Definition: Territory is land which is controlled by a particular country or ruler.
Example: The government denies that any of its territory is under rebel control.

Definition: Terror is very great fear.
Example: I shook with terror whenever I was about to fly in an aeroplane.

Definition: Terrorism is the use of violence, especially murder and bombing, in order to achieve political aims or to force a government to do something.
Example: ...the scourge of terrorism.

Definition: A terrorist is a person who uses violence, especially murder and bombing, in order to achieve political aims.
Example: One person was killed and three were wounded in terrorist attacks.

Definition: When you test something, you try it, for example by touching it or using it for a short time, in order to find out what it is, what condition it is in, or how well it works.
Example:
Either measure the temperature with a bath thermometer or test the water with your
wrist.

Definition: When someone testifies in a court of law, they give a statement of what they saw someone do or what they know of a situation, after having promised to tell the truth.
Example: Several eyewitnesses testified that they saw him run from the scene.

Definition: In a court of law, someone's testimony is a formal statement that they make about what they saw someone do or what they know of a situation, after having promised to tell the truth.
Example: His testimony was an important element of the Prosecution case.

Definition: A testing problem or situation is very difficult to deal with and shows a lot about the character of the person who is dealing with it.
Example: The most testing time is undoubtedly in the early months of your return to work.

Definition: The text of a book is the main part of it, rather than the introduction, pictures, or notes.
Example: The text is precise and informative.

Definition: You use than after a comparative adjective or adverb in order to link two parts of a comparison.
Example: The radio only weighs a few ounces and is smaller than a mobile phone.

Definition: You use thank you or, in more informal English, thanks to express your gratitude when someone does something for you or gives you what you want.
Example: Thank you very much for your call.

Definition: an expression of appreciation or gratitude or an acknowledgment of services or favours given
Example: Despite the noise, they hadn't got in, and Sam offered up silent thanks to the miller who had built so well.

Definition: You use that to refer back to an idea or situation expressed in a previous sentence or sentences.
Example: They said you particularly wanted to talk to me. Why was that?

Definition: You use the at the beginning of noun groups to refer to someone or something that you have already mentioned or identified.
Example: We both got up and, ignoring the waiter, made our way to the buffet.

Definition: A theater is a building with a stage in it, on which plays, shows, and other performances take place.
Example: They brought her to the theater where their new musical was in production.

Definition:
You use their to indicate that something belongs or relates to the group of people, animals, or
things that you are talking about.
Example: Janis and Kurt have announced their engagement.

Definition: You use them to refer to a group of people, animals, or things.
Example: The BeatlesI never get tired of listening to them.

Definition: A theme in a piece of writing, a talk, or a discussion is an important idea or subject that runs through it.
Example: The theme of the summit was women as 'agents of change'.

Definition: You use themselves to refer to people, animals, or things when the object of a verb or preposition refers to the same people or things as the subject of the verb.
Example: They all seemed to be enjoying themselves.

Definition: Then means at a particular time in the past or in the future.
Example:
He wanted an income after his retirement; until then, he wouldn't require additional
money.

Definition: A theory is a formal idea or set of ideas that is intended to explain something.
Example: Marx produced a new theory about historical change based upon conflict.

Definition: Therapy is the treatment of someone with mental or physical illness without the use of drugs or operations.
Example: In therapy, she began to let go of her obsession with Mike.

Definition: There is used as the subject of the verb 'be' to say that something exists or does not exist, or to draw attention to it.
Example: There are roadworks between the two towns.

Definition: You use therefore to introduce a logical result or conclusion.
Example: Muscle cells need lots of fuel and therefore burn lots of calories.

Definition: You use these at the beginning of noun groups to refer to someone or something that you have already mentioned or identified.
Example: Switch to an interest-paying current account. Most banks now offer these accounts.

Definition: You use they to refer to a group of people, animals, or things.
Example: The two men were far more alike than they would ever admit.

Definition: Something that is thick has a large distance between its two opposite sides.
Example: For breakfast I had a thick slice of bread and syrup.

Definition: Something that is thin is much narrower than it is long.
Example: A thin cable carries the signal to a computer.

Definition: You can use thing to refer to any object, feature, or event when you cannot, need not, or do not want to refer to it more precisely.
Example: 'What's that thing in the middle of the fountain?''Some kind of statue, I guess.'

Definition: If you think that something is the case, you have the opinion that it is the case.
Example: I certainly think that the film will attract people into the country.

Definition: The general ideas or opinions of a person or group can be referred to as their thinking.
Example: There was undeniably a strong theoretical dimension to his thinking.

Definition: The third item in a series is the one that you count as number three.
Example: I sleep on the third floor.

Definition: Thirty is the number 30.
Example: The building was built about thirty years ago.

Definition: You use this to refer back to a particular person or thing that has been mentioned or implied.
Example: Food should be left to stand. During this delay the centre carries on cooking.

Definition: You use those to refer to people or things which have already been mentioned.
Example:
Theoretically he had control over more than $400 million in U.S. accounts. But, in
fact, it was the U.S. Treasury and State Department who controlled those accounts.

Definition: You use though to introduce a statement in a subordinate clause which contrasts with the statement in the main clause. You often use though to introduce a fact which you regard as less important than the fact in the main clause.
Example:
The film was exactly how I had pictured it, though I think Gale should have had a
bigger part.

Definition: Thought is the past tense and past participle of think.
Example: The thought of Nick made her throat tighten.

Definition: A thousand or one thousand is the number 1,000.
Example: ...five thousand acres.

Definition: A threat to a person or thing is a danger that something unpleasant might happen to them. A threat is also the cause of this danger.
Example: Some couples see single people as a threat to their relationships.

Definition: If a person threatens to do something unpleasant to you, or if they threaten you, they say or imply that they will do something unpleasant to you, especially if you do not do what they want.
Example: He said army officers had threatened to destroy the town.

Definition: Three is the number 3.
Example: We waited three months before going back to see the specialist.

Definition: Your throat is the back of your mouth and the top part of the tubes that go down into your stomach and your lungs.
Example: She had a sore throat.

Definition: To move through something such as a hole, opening, or pipe means to move directly from one side or end of it to the other.
Example: The theatre was evacuated when rain poured through the roof at the Liverpool Playhouse.

Definition: If you say that something happens throughout a particular period of time, you mean that it happens during the whole of that period.
Example: The national tragedy of rival groups killing each other continued throughout 1990.

Definition: When you throw an object that you are holding, you move your hand or arm quickly and let go of the object, so that it moves through the air.
Example: He spent hours throwing a tennis ball against a wall.

Definition: You use thus to show that what you are about to mention is the result or consequence of something else that you have just mentioned.
Example:
Neither of them thought of turning on the lunch-time news. Thus Caroline didn't hear
of John's death until Peter telephoned.

Definition: A ticket is a small, official piece of paper or card which shows that you have paid to enter a place such as a theatre or a sports ground, or shows that you have paid for a journey.
Example: I queued for two hours to get a ticket to see the football game.

Definition: If you tie two things together or tie them, you fasten them together with a knot.
Example: He tied the ends of the plastic bag together.

Definition: Tight clothes or shoes are rather small and fit closely to your body.
Example: His jeans were too tight.

Definition: Time is what we measure in minutes, hours, days, and years.
Example: ...a two-week period of time.

Definition: Something or someone that is tiny is extremely small.
Example: The living room is tiny.

Definition: The tip of something long and narrow is the end of it.
Example: The sleeves covered his hands to the tips of his fingers.

Definition: If something tires you or if you tire, you feel that you have used a lot of energy and you want to rest or sleep.
Example: If driving tires you, take the train.

Definition: If you are tired, you feel that you want to rest or sleep.
Example: Michael is tired and he has to rest after his long trip.

Definition: In animals and plants, tissue consists of cells that are similar to each other in appearance and that have the same function.
Example: As we age we lose muscle tissue.

Definition: The title of a book, play, film, or piece of music is its name.
