Example: 'Patience and Sarah' was first published in 1969 under the title 'A Place for Us'.

Definition: You use to when indicating the place that someone or something visits, moves towards, or points at.
Example: Two friends and I drove to Florida during college spring break.

Definition: Tobacco is dried leaves which people smoke in pipes, cigars, and cigarettes. You can also refer to pipes, cigars, and cigarettes as a whole as tobacco.
Example: Try to do without tobacco and alcohol.

Definition: You use today to refer to the day on which you are speaking or writing.
Example: How are you feeling today?

Definition: Your toes are the five movable parts at the end of each foot.
Example: to toe a starting line

Definition: If people do something together, they do it with each other.
Example: We went on long bicycle rides together.

Definition: Tomatoes are small, soft, red fruit that you can eat raw in salads or cooked as a vegetable.
Example: Eat tomatoes with a little fat to enhance absorption.

Definition: You use tomorrow to refer to the day after today.
Example: Bye, see you tomorrow.

Definition: The tone of a sound is its particular quality.
Example: Cross could hear him speaking in low tones to Sarah.

Definition: Your tongue is the soft movable part inside your mouth which you use for tasting, eating, and speaking.
Example: I walked over to the mirror and stuck my tongue out.

Definition: Tonight is used to refer to the evening of today or the night that follows today.
Example: I'm at home tonight.

Definition: You use too after mentioning another person, thing, or aspect that a previous statement applies to or includes.
Example: 'Nice to talk to you.''Nice to talk to you too.'

Definition: A tool is any instrument or simple piece of equipment that you hold in your hands and use to do a particular kind of work. For example, spades, hammers, and knives are all tools.
Example: I find the best tool for the purpose is a pair of shears.

Definition: Your teeth are the hard white objects in your mouth, which you use for biting and chewing.
Example: She had very pretty straight teeth.

Definition: The top of something is its highest point or part.
Example: I waited at the top of the stairs.

Definition: A topic is a particular subject that you discuss or write about.
Example: The weather is a constant topic of conversation in Britain.

Definition: If you toss something somewhere, you throw it there lightly, often in a rather careless way.
Example: He screwed the paper into a ball and tossed it into the fire.

Definition: A total is the number that you get when you add several numbers together or when you count how many things there are in a group.
Example: The companies have a total of 1,776 employees.

Definition: wholly; completely; altogether
Example: She was totally loyal to Lazard, who'd helped her out with a new job.

Definition:
If you touch something, you put your hand onto it in order to feel it or to make contact with
it.
Example: Her tiny hands gently touched my face.

Definition: A tough person is strong and determined, and can tolerate difficulty or suffering.
Example: He built up a reputation as a tough businessman.

Definition: A tour is an organized trip that people such as musicians, politicians, or theatre companies go on to several different places, stopping to meet people or perform.
Example: The band are currently on a two-month tour of Europe.

Definition: A tourist is a person who is visiting a place for pleasure and interest, especially when they are on holiday.
Example: ...foreign tourists.

Definition: A tournament is a sports competition in which players who win a match continue to play further matches in the competition until just one person or team is left.
Example: `A lot of overhead activity -- must be a golf tournament on at Wentworth.

Definition: If you move, look, or point toward something or someone, you move, look, or point in their direction.
Example: They were all moving toward him down the stairs.

Definition: If you move, look, or point towards something or someone, you move, look, or point in their direction.
Example: Caroline leant across the table towards him.

Definition: A tower is a tall, narrow building, that either stands alone or forms part of another building such as a church or castle.
Example: He stood up and towered over her.

Definition:
A town is a place with many streets and buildings, where people live and work. Towns are larger than villages and smaller than cities. Many places that
are called towns in Britain would be called cities in the United States.
Example: ...Saturday night in the small town of Braintree, Essex.

Definition: A toy is an object that children play with, for example a doll or a model car.
Example: He was really too old for children's toys.

Definition: If you trace the origin or development of something, you find out or describe how it started or developed.
Example:
The exhibition traces the history of graphic design in America from the 19th century
to the present.

Definition: A track is a narrow road or path.
Example: We set off once more, over a rough mountain track.

Definition:
Trade is the activity of buying, selling, or exchanging goods or services between people,
firms, or countries.
Example: The ministry had direct control over every aspect of foreign trade.

Definition: A tradition is a custom or belief that has existed for a long time.
Example: ...the rich traditions of Afro-Cuban music, and dance.

Definition: Traditional customs, beliefs, or methods are ones that have existed for a long time without changing.
Example: ...traditional teaching methods.

Definition: Traffic refers to all the vehicles that are moving along the roads in a particular area.
Example: There was heavy traffic on the roads.

Definition: A tragedy is an extremely sad event or situation.
Example: They have suffered an enormous personal tragedy.

Definition: A trail is a rough path across open country or through forests.
Example: He was following a broad trail through the trees.

Definition: A train is a number of carriages, cars, or trucks which are all connected together and which are pulled by an engine along a railway. Trains carry people and goods from one place to another.
Example: The train pulled into a station.

Definition: Training is the process of learning the skills that you need for a particular job or activity.
Example: He called for much higher spending on education and training.

Definition: If you transfer something or someone from one place to another, or they transfer from one place to another, they go from the first place to the second.
Example: Remove the wafers with a spoon and transfer them to a plate.

Definition: To transform something into something else means to change or convert it into that thing.
Example: Your metabolic rate is the speed at which your body transforms food into energy.

Definition: a change or alteration, esp a radical one
Example:
There are so many clichs surrounding personal transformation, something that is open to all of us in a way that it wouldn't have
been in previous generations.

Definition: Transition is the process in which something changes from one state to another.
Example: The transition to a multi-party democracy is proving to be difficult.

Definition: If something that someone has said or written is translated from one language into another, it is said or written again in the second language.
Example: Only a small number of her books have been translated into English.

Definition: Transportation refers to any type of vehicle that you can travel in or carry goods in.
Example: The company will provide transportation.

Definition: If you travel, you go from one place to another, often to a place that is far away.
Example: You had better travel to Helsinki tomorrow.

Definition: If you treat someone or something in a particular way, you behave towards them or deal with them in that way.
Example: Artie treated most women with indifference.

Definition: Treatment is medical attention given to a sick or injured person or animal.
Example: Many patients are not getting the medical treatment they need.

Definition:
A treaty is a written agreement between countries in which they agree to do a particular thing
or to help each other.
Example: A formal peace treaty was signed later that year.

Definition: A tree is a tall plant that has a hard trunk, branches, and leaves.
Example: I planted those apple trees.

Definition: You use tremendous to emphasize how strong a feeling or quality is, or how large an amount is.
Example: I felt a tremendous pressure on my chest.

Definition: A trend is a change or development towards something new or different.
Example: This is a growing trend.

Definition: A trial is a formal meeting in a law court, at which a judge and jury listen to evidence and decide whether a person is guilty of a crime.
Example: New evidence showed the police lied at the trial.

Definition: Tribe is sometimes used to refer to a group of people of the same race, language, and customs, especially in a developing country. Some people disapprove of this use.
Example: ...three-hundred members of the Xhosa tribe.

Definition: A trick is an action that is intended to deceive someone.
Example: We are playing a trick on a man who keeps bothering me.

Definition: A trip is a journey that you make to a particular place.
Example: She tripped and fell last night and broke her hip.

Definition: Troops are soldiers, especially when they are in a large organized group doing a particular task.
Example: The operation will involve more than 35,000 troops from a dozen countries.

Definition: You can refer to problems or difficulties as trouble.
Example: I had trouble parking.

Definition: A truck is a large vehicle that is used to transport goods by road.
Example: Now and then they heard the roar of a heavy truck.

Definition: If something is true, it is based on facts rather than being invented or imagined, and is accurate and reliable.
Example: Everything I had heard about him was true.

Definition: You use truly to emphasize that something has all the features or qualities of a particular thing, or is the case to the fullest possible extent.
Example: ...a truly democratic system.

Definition: If you trust someone, you believe that they are honest and sincere and will not deliberately do anything to harm you.
Example: 'I trust you completely,' he said.

Definition: The truth about something is all the facts about it, rather than things that are imagined or invented.
Example: Is it possible to separate truth from fiction?

Definition: If you try to do something, you want to do it, and you take action which you hope will help you to do it.
Example: He secretly tried to block her advancement in the Party.

Definition: A tube is a long hollow object that is usually round, like a pipe.
Example: He is fed by a tube that enters his nose.

Definition: A tunnel is a long passage which has been made under the ground, usually through a hill or under the sea.
Example: ...two new railway tunnels through the Alps.

Definition: When you turn or when you turn part of your body, you move your body or part of your body so that it is facing in a different or opposite direction.
Example: He turned abruptly and walked away.

Definition: TV means the same as television.
Example: The TV was on.

Definition: Twelve is the number 12.
Example: Twelve days later Duffy lost his job.

Definition: Twenty is the number 20.
Example: He spent twenty years in India.

Definition: If something happens twice, there are two actions or events of the same kind.
Example: He visited me twice that fall.

Definition: If two people are twins, they have the same mother and were born on the same day.
Example: Sarah was looking after the twins.

Definition: Two is the number 2.
Example: He is now married with two children.

Definition: A type of something is a group of those things that have particular features in common.
Example: ...several types of lettuce.

Definition: You use typical to describe someone or something that shows the most usual characteristics of a particular type of person or thing, and is therefore a good example of that type.
Example: Cheney is many people's image of a typical cop: a big White guy, six foot, 220 pounds.

Definition: You use typically to say that something usually happens in the way that you are describing.
Example: Typically, parents apply to several schools.

Definition: If you say that someone or something is ugly, you mean that they are very unattractive and unpleasant to look at.
Example: ...an ugly little hat.

Definition: You use ultimate to describe the final result or aim of a long series of events.
Example: He said it is still not possible to predict the ultimate outcome.

Definition: Ultimately means finally, after a long and often complicated series of events.
Example:
Whatever the scientists ultimately conclude, all of their data will immediately be
disputed.

Definition: If you are unable to do something, it is impossible for you to do it, for example because you do not have the necessary skill or knowledge, or because you do not have enough time or money.
Example: She felt unable to concentrate on anything but the pain.

Definition: Someone's uncle is the brother of their mother or father, or the husband of their aunt.
Example: My uncle was the mayor of Memphis.

Definition: If a person or thing is under something, they are at a lower level than that thing, and may be covered or hidden by it.
Example: They found a labyrinth of tunnels under the ground.

Definition: If you undergo something necessary or unpleasant, it happens to you.
Example: New recruits have been undergoing training in recent weeks.

Definition: If you understand someone or understand what they are saying, you know what they mean.
Example: I think you heard and also understand me.

Definition: If you have an understanding of something, you know how it works or know what it means.
Example:
They have to have a basic understanding of computers in order to use the advanced
technology.

Definition: You can use unfortunately to introduce or refer to a statement when you consider that it is sad or disappointing, or when you want to express regret.
Example: Unfortunately, my time is limited.

Definition: A uniform is a special set of clothes which some people, for example soldiers or the police, wear to work in and which some children wear at school.
Example: The town police wear dark blue uniforms and flat caps.

Definition: A union is a workers' organization which represents its members and which aims to improve things such as their working conditions and pay.
Example: I feel that women in all types of employment can benefit from joining a union.

Definition: Something that is unique is the only one of its kind.
Example: Each person's signature is unique.

Definition: If you consider something as a unit, you consider it as a single, complete thing.
Example: Agriculture was based in the past on the family as a unit.

Definition: When people are united about something, they agree about it and act together.
Example: Every party is united on the need for parliamentary democracy.

Definition: Something that is universal relates to everyone in the world or everyone in a particular group or society.
Example: The insurance industry has produced its own proposals for universal health care.

Definition: The universe is the whole of space and all the stars, planets, and other forms of matter and energy in it.
Example: Einstein's equations showed the Universe to be expanding.

Definition: A university is an institution where students study for degrees and where academic research is done.
Example: Patrick is now at London University.

Definition: If something is unknown to you, you have no knowledge of it.
Example: An unknown number of demonstrators were arrested.

Definition: You use unless to introduce the only circumstances in which an event you are mentioning will not take place or in which a statement you are making is not true.
Example: Unless you are trying to lose weight to please yourself, it's hard to stay motivated.

Definition:
If one thing is unlike another thing, the two things have different qualities or characteristics from each
other.
Example: This was a foreign country, so unlike San Jose.

Definition: If you say that something is unlikely to happen or unlikely to be true, you believe that it will not happen or that it is not true, although you are not completely sure.
Example: A military coup seems unlikely.

Definition: If something happens until a particular time, it happens during the period before that time and stops at that time.
Example: Until 2016, he was a high-ranking officer in the army.

Definition: If something is unusual, it does not happen very often or you do not see it or hear it very often.
Example: They have replanted many areas with rare and unusual plants.

Definition: If a person or thing goes up something such as a slope, ladder, or chimney, they move away from the ground or to a higher position.
Example: They were climbing up a narrow mountain road.

Definition: If one thing is upon another, it is on it.
Example: He set the tray upon the table.

Definition: You use upper to describe something that is above something else.
Example: There is a smart restaurant on the upper floor.

Definition: Urban means belonging to, or relating to, a town or city.
Example: Most of the population is an urban population.

Definition: If you urge someone to do something, you try hard to persuade them to do it.
Example: They urged parliament to approve plans for their reform programme.

Definition:
A speaker or writer uses us to refer both to himself or herself and to one or more other people. You can use
us before a noun to make it clear which group of people you are referring to.
Example: Neither of us forgot about it.

Definition: If you use something, you do something with it in order to do a job or to achieve a particular result or effect.
Example: Trim off the excess pastry using a sharp knife.

Definition: If something used to be done or used to be the case, it was done regularly in the past or was the case in the past.
Example: People used to come and visit him every day.

Definition: If something is useful, you can use it to do something or to help you in some way.
Example: The slow cooker is very useful for people who go out all day.

Definition: A user is a person or thing that uses something such as a place, facility, product, or machine.
Example: Beach users have complained about people walking their dogs on the sand.

Definition: Usual is used to describe what happens or what is done most often in a particular situation.
Example: It is a neighborhood beset by all the usual inner-city problems.

Definition: If something usually happens, it is the thing that most often happens in a particular situation.
Example: The best information about hotels usually comes from friends who have been there.

Definition: The utility of something is its usefulness.
Example: Belief in the utility of higher education is shared by students nationwide.

Definition: A vacation is a period of the year when universities and colleges, and in the United States also schools, are officially closed.
Example: During his summer vacation, he visited Russia.

Definition: A valley is a low stretch of land between hills, especially one that has a river flowing through it.
Example: ...a wooded valley set against the backdrop of Monte Rosa.

Definition: If you describe something or someone as valuable, you mean that they are very useful and helpful.
Example: Many of our teachers also have valuable academic links with Heidelberg University.

Definition: The value of something such as a quality, attitude, or method is its importance or usefulness. If you place a particular value on something, that is the importance or usefulness you think it has.
Example: The value of this work experience should not be underestimated.

Definition: Something that is variable changes quite often, and there usually seems to be no fixed pattern to these changes.
Example: The potassium content of foodstuffs is very variable.

Definition: A variation on something is the same thing presented in a slightly different form.
Example: This delicious variation on an omelette is quick and easy to prepare.

Definition: If something has variety, it consists of things which are different from each other.
Example: Susan's idea of freedom was to have variety in her lifestyle.

Definition: If you say that there are various things, you mean there are several different things of the type mentioned.
Example: His plan is to spread the capital between various building society accounts.

Definition: If things vary, they are different from each other in size, amount, or degree.
Example: As they're handmade, each one varies slightly.

Definition: Something that is vast is extremely large.
Example: ...Afrikaner farmers who own vast stretches of land.

Definition: Vegetables are plants such as cabbages, potatoes, and onions which you can cook and eat.
Example: A good general diet should include plenty of fresh vegetables.

Definition: A vehicle is a machine such as a car, bus, or truck which has an engine and is used to carry people from place to place.
Example: The vehicle would not have the capacity to make the journey on one tank of fuel.

Definition: A venture is a project or activity which is new, exciting, and difficult because it involves the risk of failure.
Example: ...his latest writing venture.

Definition: A version of something is a particular form of it in which some details are different from earlier or later forms.
Example: ...an updated version of his book.

Definition: You use versus to indicate that two figures, ideas, or choices are opposed.
Example:
Only 18.8% of the class of 1982 had some kind of diploma four years after high school,
versus 45% of the class of 1972.

Definition: Very is used to give emphasis to an adjective or adverb.
Example: The problem and the answer are very simple.

Definition: A vessel is a ship or large boat.
Example: A Moroccan fishing vessel and a South Korean cargo ship collided in rough seas.

Definition: A veteran is someone who has served in the armed forces of their country, especially during a war.
Example: The charity was formed in 1919 to care for veterans of the First World War.

Definition: If you go somewhere via a particular place, you go through that place on the way to your destination.
Example: We drove via Lovech to the old Danube town of Ruse.

Definition: A victim is someone who has been hurt or killed.
Example: Not all the victims survived.

Definition: A victory is a success in a struggle, war, or competition.
Example: Union leaders are heading for victory in their battle over workplace rights.

Definition: A video is a film or television programme recorded digitally (or in the past on tape) for people to watch on a television set.
Example: We were watching videos with her.

Definition: Your views on something are the beliefs or opinions that you have about it, for example whether you think it is good, bad, right, or wrong.
Example: Neither of them had strong views on politics.

Definition: Viewers are people who watch television, or who are watching a particular programme on television.
Example: These programmes are each watched by around 19 million viewers every week.

Definition: A village consists of a group of houses, together with other buildings such as a church and a school, in a country area.
Example: He lives quietly in the country in a village near Lahti.

Definition: If someone violates an agreement, law, or promise, they break it.
Example: They went to prison because they violated the law.

Definition: a violating or being violated
Example: The women's response to this terrible violation was something the artists had taken some trouble to detail.

Definition: Violence is behaviour which is intended to hurt, injure, or kill people.
Example: Twenty people were killed in the violence.

Definition: If someone is violent, or if they do something which is violent, they use physical force or weapons to hurt, injure, or kill other people.
Example: A quarter of current inmates have committed violent crimes.

Definition: You can use virtually to indicate that something is so nearly true that for most purposes it can be regarded as true.
Example: Virtually all cooking was done over coal-fired ranges.

Definition: Virtue is thinking and doing what is right and avoiding what is wrong.
Example: Virtue is not confined to those who follow a faith.

Definition: A virus is a kind of germ that can cause disease.
Example: There are many different strains of flu virus.

Definition: If something is visible, it can be seen.
Example: The warning lights were clearly visible.

Definition: Your vision of a future situation or society is what you imagine or hope it would be like, if things were very different from the way they are now.
Example: I have a vision of a society that is free of exploitation and injustice.

Definition: If you visit someone, you go to see them and spend time with them.
Example: He wanted to visit his brother in Worcester.

Definition: A visitor is someone who is visiting a person or place.
Example: The other day we had some visitors from Switzerland.

Definition: Visual means relating to sight, or to things that you can see.
Example: ...the graphic visual depiction of violence.

Definition: If you say that something is vital, you mean that it is necessary or very important.
Example: The port is vital to supply relief to millions of drought victims.

Definition: When someone speaks or sings, you hear their voice.
Example: Miriam's voice was strangely calm.

Definition: The volume of something is the amount of it that there is.
Example: Senior officials will be discussing how the volume of sales might be reduced.

Definition: A volunteer is someone who does work without being paid for it, because they want to do it.
Example: She now helps in a local school as a volunteer three days a week.

Definition: A vote is a choice made by a particular person or group in a meeting or an election.
Example: He walked to the local polling centre to cast his vote.

Definition: Voters are people who have the legal right to vote in elections, or people who are voting in a particular election.
Example: The turnout was at least 62 percent of registered voters.

Definition: vs. is a written abbreviation for versus.
Example: ...England vs. Brazil in the U.S. Cup.

Definition: Someone who is vulnerable is weak and without protection, with the result that they are easily hurt physically or emotionally.
Example: Old people are often particularly vulnerable members of our society.

Definition: Someone's wages are the amount of money that is regularly paid to them for the work that they do.
Example: His wages have gone up.

Definition: When you wait for something or someone, you spend some time doing very little, because you cannot act until that thing happens or that person arrives.
Example: I walk to a street corner and wait for the school bus.

Definition: When you wake or when someone or something wakes you, you become conscious again after being asleep.
Example: It was cold and dark when I woke at 6.30.

Definition: When you walk, you move forward by putting one foot in front of the other in a regular way.
Example: Rosanna and Forbes walked in silence for some while.

Definition: A wall is one of the vertical sides of a building or room.
Example: Kathryn leaned against the wall of the church.

Definition: If you wander in a place, you walk around there in a casual way, often without intending to go in any particular direction.
Example: When he got bored he wandered around the fair.

Definition: If you want something, you feel a desire or a need for it.
Example: I want a drink.

Definition: A war is a period of fighting or conflict between countries or states.
Example: He spent part of the war in the National Guard.

Definition: Something that is warm has some heat but not enough to be hot.
Example: Wheat is grown in places which have cold winters and warm, dry summers.

Definition: If you warn someone about something such as a possible danger or problem, you tell them about it so that they are aware of it.
Example: When I had my first baby, friends warned me that children were expensive.

Definition: A warning is something which is said or written to tell people of a possible danger, problem, or other unpleasant thing that might happen.
Example: The minister gave a warning that if war broke out, it would be catastrophic.

Definition: If you wash something, you clean it using water and usually a substance such as soap or detergent.
Example: He got a job washing dishes in a pizza parlour.

Definition:
If you waste something such as time, money, or energy, you use too much of it doing something
that is not important or necessary, or is unlikely to succeed.
Example: There could be many reasons and he was not going to waste time speculating on them.

Definition: If you watch someone or something, you look at them, usually for a period of time, and pay attention to what is happening.
Example: The man was standing in his doorway watching him.

Definition: Water is a clear thin liquid that has no colour or taste when it is pure. It falls from clouds as rain and enters rivers and seas. All animals and people need water in order to live.
Example: Get me a glass of water.

Definition: If you wave or wave your hand, you move your hand from side to side in the air, usually in order to say hello or goodbye to someone.
Example: Jessica caught sight of Lois and waved to her.

Definition:
If you refer to a way of doing something, you are referring to how you can do it, for example the action you
can take or the method you can use to achieve it.
Example: Freezing isn't a bad way of preserving food.

Definition:
A speaker or writer uses we to refer both to himself or herself and to one or more other people as a group. You
can use we before a noun to make it clear which group of people you are referring to.
Example: We both swore we'd be friends ever after.

Definition: If someone is weak, they are not healthy or do not have good muscles, so that they cannot move quickly or carry heavy things.
Example: I was too weak to move or think or speak.

Definition:
Wealth is the possession of a large amount of money, property, or other valuable things.
You can also refer to a particular person's money or property as their wealth.
Example: Economic reform has brought relative wealth to peasant farmers.

Definition: Someone who is wealthy has a large amount of money, property, or valuable possessions.
Example: ...a wealthy international businessman.

Definition: A weapon is an object such as a gun, a knife, or a missile, which is used to kill or hurt people in a fight or a war.
Example: ...nuclear weapons.

Definition: When you wear something such as clothes, shoes, or jewellery, you have them on your body or on part of your body.
Example: He was wearing a brown uniform.

Definition: The weather is the condition of the atmosphere in one area at a particular time, for example if it is raining, hot, or windy.
Example: The weather was bad.

Definition: A wedding is a marriage ceremony and the party or special meal that often takes place after the ceremony.
Example: Most Britons still want a traditional wedding.

Definition: A week is a period of seven days. Some people consider that a week starts on Monday and ends on Sunday.
Example: I had a letter from my mother last week.

Definition: A weekend is Saturday and Sunday.
Example: She had agreed to have dinner with him in town the following weekend.

Definition: A weekly event or publication happens or appears once a week or every week.
Example: Each course comprises 10-12 informal weekly meetings.

Definition: If someone or something weighs a particular amount, this amount is how heavy they are.
Example: It weighs nearly 27 kilos (about 60 pounds).

Definition:
The weight of a person or thing is how heavy they are, measured in units such as kilograms,
pounds, or tons.
Example: What is your height and weight?

Definition: If you welcome someone, you greet them in a friendly way when they arrive somewhere.
Example: Several people came by to welcome me.

Definition: The welfare of a person or group is their health, comfort, and happiness.
Example: I do not think he is considering Emma's welfare.

Definition: You say well to indicate that you are about to say something.
Example: Sylvia shook hands. 'Well, you go get yourselves some breakfast.'.

Definition: The west is the direction which you look towards in the evening in order to see the sun set.
Example: I pushed on towards Flagstaff, a hundred miles to the west.

Definition: Western means in or from the west of a region, state, or country.
Example: ...hand-made rugs from Western and Central Asia.

Definition: If something is wet, it is covered in water, rain, sweat, tears, or another liquid.
Example: He towelled his wet hair.

Definition: You use what in questions when you ask for specific information about something that you do not know.
Example: What do you want?

Definition: You use whatever to refer to anything or everything of a particular type.
Example: Franklin was free to do pretty much whatever he pleased.

Definition: The wheels of a vehicle are the circular objects which are fixed underneath it and which enable it to move along the ground.
Example: The car wheels spun and slipped on some oil on the road.

Definition: You use when to ask questions about the time at which things happen.
Example: When are you going home?

Definition: You use whenever to refer to any time or every time that something happens or is true.
Example: She always called at the house whenever she was in the area.

Definition: You use where to ask questions about the place something or someone is in, or is coming from or going to.
Example: Where did you meet him?

Definition: You use whereas to introduce a comment which contrasts with what is said in the main clause.
Example: Pensions are linked to inflation, whereas they should be linked to the cost of living.

Definition: You use whether when you are talking about a choice or doubt between two or more alternatives.
Example: To this day, it's unclear whether he shot himself or was murdered.

Definition: You use which in questions when there are two or more possible answers or alternatives.
Example: Which do they want me to do, declare war or surrender?

Definition: If something happens while something else is happening, the two things are happening at the same time.
Example:
They were grinning and watching while one man laughed and poured his drink over the
head of another.

Definition: When you whisper, you say something very quietly, using your breath rather than your throat, so that only one person can hear you.
Example: 'Keep your voice down,' I whispered.

Definition: Something that is white is the colour of snow or milk.
Example: He had nice square white teeth.

Definition: You use who in questions when you ask about the name or identity of a person or group of people.
Example: Who's there?

Definition: If you refer to the whole of something, you mean all of it.
Example: Early in the eleventh century the whole of England was conquered by the Vikings.

Definition: You use whom in questions when you ask about the name or identity of a person or group of people.
Example: 'I want to send a telegram.''Fine, to whom?'

Definition:
You use whose at the beginning of a relative clause where you mention something that belongs to or is associated with the person or thing mentioned in
the previous clause.
Example: I saw a man shouting at a driver whose car was blocking the street.

Definition: You use why in questions when you ask about the reasons for something.
Example: Why hasn't he brought the bill?

Definition: Something that is wide measures a large distance from one side or edge to the other.
Example: All worktops should be wide enough to allow plenty of space for food preparation.

Definition: to a wide extent
Example: But owing to our present penchant for science, extreme magic is not widely used here.

Definition: Something that is widespread exists or happens over a large area, or to a great extent.
Example: There is widespread support for the new proposals.

Definition: Someone's wife is the woman they are married to.
Example: He married his wife Jane 37 years ago.

Definition:
Wild animals or plants live or grow in natural surroundings and are not looked after by
people.
Example: We saw two more wild cats creeping towards us in the darkness.

Definition: You use will to indicate that you hope, think, or have evidence that something is going to happen or be the case in the future.
Example:
The Prime Minister is now 64 years old and in all probability this will be the last
election that he is likely to contest.

Definition: If someone is willing to do something, they are fairly happy about doing it and will do it if they are asked or required to do it.
Example: The military now say they're willing to hold talks with the political parties.

Definition:
If you win something such as a competition, battle, or argument, you defeat those people you
are competing or fighting against, or you do better than everyone else involved.
Example: He does not have any realistic chance of winning the election.

Definition: A wind is a current of air that is moving across the earth's surface.
Example: The winds of change are blowing across the country.

Definition:
A window is a space in the wall of a building or in the side of a vehicle, which has glass
in it so that light can come in and you can see out.
Example: He stood at the window, moodily staring out.

Definition: Wine is an alcoholic drink which is made from grapes. You can also refer to alcoholic drinks made from other fruits or vegetables as wine.
Example: ...a bottle of white wine.

Definition: The wings of a bird or insect are the two parts of its body that it uses for flying.
Example: The bird flapped its wings furiously.

Definition: The winner of a prize, race, or competition is the person, animal, or thing that wins it.
Example: She will present the trophies to the award winners.

Definition: Winter is the season between autumn and spring when the weather is usually cold.
Example: In winter the nights are long and cold.

Definition: If you wipe something, you rub its surface to remove dirt or liquid from it.
Example: I'll just wipe the table.

Definition:
A wire is a long thin piece of metal that is used to fasten things or to carry electric
current.
Example: ...learning to wire and plumb the house herself.

Definition: Wisdom is the ability to use your experience and knowledge in order to make sensible decisions or judgments.
Example: ...the patience and wisdom that comes from old age.

Definition: A wise person is able to use their experience and knowledge in order to make sensible decisions and judgments.
Example: She has the air of a wise woman.

Definition: A wish is a desire or strong feeling that you want to have something or do something.
Example: She was sincere and genuine in her wish to make amends for the past.

Definition: If one person is with another, they are together in one place.
Example: With her were her son and daughter-in-law.

Definition: If you withdraw something from a place, you remove it or take it away.
Example: He reached into his pocket and withdrew a sheet of notepaper.

Definition: If something is within a place, area, or object, it is inside it or surrounded by it.
Example: Clients are entertained within private dining rooms.

Definition: You use without to indicate that someone or something does not have or use the thing mentioned.
Example: I don't like myself without a beard.

Definition: A witness to an event such as an accident or crime is a person who saw it.
Example: Witnesses to the crash say they saw an explosion just before the disaster.

Definition: A woman is an adult female human being.
Example: ...a young Lithuanian woman named Dayva.

Definition: If you wonder about something, you think about it, either because it interests you and you want to know more about it, or because you are worried or suspicious about it.
Example: I wondered what that noise was.

Definition: If you describe something or someone as wonderful, you think they are extremely good.
Example: The cold, misty air felt wonderful on his face.

Definition: Wood is the material which forms the trunks and branches of trees.
Example: Their dishes were made of wood.

Definition: Wooden objects are made of wood.
Example: ...the shop's bare brick walls and faded wooden floorboards.

Definition:
A word is a single unit of language that can be represented in writing or speech. In English,
a word has a space on either side of it when it is written.
Example: The words stood out clearly on the page.

Definition: People who work have a job, usually one which they are paid to do.
Example: He works for the U.S. Department of Transport.

Definition: A particular kind of worker does the kind of work mentioned.
Example: ...office workers.

Definition: Working people have jobs which they are paid to do.
Example: Like working women anywhere, Asian women are buying convenience foods.

Definition: a place where a number of people are employed, such as a factory
Example: Of course, I'm assuming they'll throw spanners in the works along the way.

Definition: A workshop is a period of discussion or practical work on a particular subject in which a group of people share their knowledge or experience.
Example: Trumpeter Marcus Belgrave ran a jazz workshop for young artists.

Definition: The world is the planet that we live on.
Example: It's a beautiful part of the world.

Definition: When you are worried, you are unhappy because you keep thinking about problems that you have or about unpleasant things that might happen in the future.
Example: He seemed very worried.

Definition: If you worry, you keep thinking about problems that you have or about unpleasant things that might happen.
Example: Don't worry, your luggage will come on afterwards by taxi.

Definition: If something is worth a particular amount of money, it can be sold for that amount or is considered to have that value.
Example: These books might be worth 80 or 90 or more to a collector.

Definition: You use would when you are saying what someone believed, hoped, or expected to happen or be the case.
Example: No one believed he would actually kill himself.

Definition: Wound is the past tense and past participle of wind2.
Example: The wound is healing nicely.

Definition:
When you wrap something, you fold paper or cloth tightly round it to cover it completely, for example
in order to protect it or so that you can give it to someone as a present.
Example: Harry had carefully bought and wrapped presents for Mark to give them.

Definition:
When you write something on a surface, you use something such as a pen or pencil to produce words,
letters, or numbers on the surface.
Example:
If you'd like one, simply write your name and address on a postcard and send it to
us.

Definition: A writer is a person who writes books, stories, or articles as a job.
Example: Turner is a writer and critic.

Definition: Writing is something that has been written or printed.
Example: 'It's from a notebook,' the sheriff said, 'And there's writing on it.'

Definition: If you say there is something wrong, you mean there is something unsatisfactory about the situation, person, or thing you are talking about.
Example: Pain is the body's way of telling us that something is wrong.

Definition: A yard is a unit of length equal to thirty-six inches or approximately 91.4 centimetres.
Example: The incident took place about 500 yards from where he was standing.

Definition: Yeah means yes.
Example: 'Bring us something to drink.''Yeah, yeah.'

Definition: A year is a period of twelve months or 365 or 366 days, beginning on the first of January and ending on the thirty-first of December.
Example: The year was 1840.

Definition: If you yell, you shout loudly, usually because you are excited, angry, or in pain.
Example: 'Eva!' he yelled.

Definition: Something that is yellow is the colour of lemons, butter, or the middle part of an egg.
Example: The walls have been painted bright yellow.

Definition: You use yes to give a positive response to a question.
Example: 'Are you a friend of Nick's?''Yes.'

Definition: You use yesterday to refer to the day before today.
Example: She left yesterday.

Definition: You use yet in negative statements to indicate that something has not happened up to the present time, although it probably will happen. You can also use yet in questions to ask if something has happened up to the present time. In British English the simple past tense is not normally used with this meaning of 'yet'.
Example: They haven't finished yet.

Definition: If you yield to someone or something, you stop resisting them.
Example: Will she yield to growing pressure for her to retire?

Definition: A speaker or writer uses you to refer to the person or people that they are talking or writing to. It is possible to use you before a noun to make it clear which group of people you are talking to.
Example: When I saw you across the room I knew I'd met you before.

Definition: A young person, animal, or plant has not lived or existed for very long and is not yet mature.
Example: In Scotland, young people can marry at 16.

Definition: A speaker or writer uses your to indicate that something belongs or relates to the person or people that they are talking or writing to.
Example: Emma, I trust your opinion a great deal.

Definition: A speaker or writer uses yours to refer to something that belongs or relates to the person or people that they are talking or writing to.
Example: I'll take my coat upstairs. Shall I take yours, Roberta?

Definition: A speaker or writer uses yourself to refer to the person that they are talking or writing to. Yourself is used when the object of a verb or preposition refers to the same person as the subject of the verb.
Example: Have the courage to be honest with yourself and about yourself.

Definition: Someone's youth is the period of their life during which they are a child, before they are a fully mature adult.
Example: In my youth my ambition had been to be an inventor.

Definition: A zone is an area that has particular features or characteristics.
Example: Many people have stayed behind in the potential war zone.

Definition: A strand of something such as hair, wire, or thread is a single thin piece of it.
Example: She tried to blow a gray strand of hair from her eyes.

Definition: When a person or a vehicle halts or when something halts them, they stop moving in the direction they were going and stand still.
Example: They halted at a short distance from the house.

Definition: If you dash somewhere, you run or go there quickly and suddenly.
Example: Suddenly she dashed down to the cellar.

Definition: If you describe someone as experienced, you mean that they have been doing a particular job or activity for a long time, and therefore know a lot about it or are very skilful at it.
Example: ...lawyers who are experienced in these matters.

Definition: A fitted piece of clothing is designed so that it is the same size and shape as your body rather than being loose.
Example: ...baggy trousers with fitted jackets.

Definition: You use re in business letters, faxes, or other documents to introduce a subject or item which you are going to discuss or refer to in detail.
Example:
Dear Mrs Cox, Re: Household Insurance. We note from our files that we have not yet
received your renewal instructions.

Definition: You use concerning to indicate what a question or piece of information is about.
Example: For more information concerning the club contact I. Coldwell.

Definition: A stirring event, performance, or account of something makes people very excited or enthusiastic.
Example: The Prime Minister made a stirring speech.

Definition: You can refer to what has just been stated or mentioned as the foregoing.
Example:
You might think from the foregoing that the French want to phase accents out. Not
at all.

Definition: going or coming before; former
Example: What matters is that you have slept well in the preceding week and that you feel nicely rested.

Definition: Earlier is the comparative of early.
Example: As mentioned earlier, the University supplements this information with an interview.

Definition: very great; exceptional or excessive
Example: The business at the police station took far too long, an exceeding politeness masking an exceeding inefficiency.

Definition: You use overseas to describe things that involve or are in foreign countries, usually across a sea or an ocean.
Example: He has returned to South Africa from his long overseas trip.

Definition: A defect is a fault or imperfection in a person or thing.
Example: 25 per cent of its listed client base defect to rival auditors.

Definition: Deficiency in something, especially something that your body needs, is not having enough of it.
Example: They did blood tests on him for signs of vitamin deficiency.

Definition: If a person, company, or country defaults on something that they have legally agreed to do, such as paying some money or doing a piece of work before a particular time, they fail to do it.
Example: The credit card business is down, and more borrowers are defaulting on loans.

Definition: Supreme is used in the title of a person or an official group to indicate that they are at the highest level in a particular organization or system.
Example: MacArthur was Supreme Commander for the allied powers in the Pacific.

Definition: A sovereign state or country is independent and not under the authority of any other country.
Example:
Lithuania and Armenia signed a treaty in Vilnius recognising each other as independent
sovereign states.

Definition: If there is an unlimited quantity of something, you can have as much or as many of that thing as you want.
Example: An unlimited number of copies can still be made from the original.

Definition: If something such as a decision or an arrangement is definite, it is firm and clear, and unlikely to be changed.
Example: It's too soon to give a definite answer.

Definition: If a person or animal devours something, they eat it quickly and eagerly.
Example: A medium-sized dog will devour at least one can of food per day.

Definition: When people such as immigrants assimilate into a community or when that community assimilates them, they become an accepted part of it.
Example: There is every sign that new Asian-Americans are just as willing to assimilate.

Definition: If a building or space can accommodate someone or something, it has enough room for them.
Example: The school in Poldown was not big enough to accommodate all the children.

Definition: A cushion is a fabric case filled with soft material, which you put on a seat to make it more comfortable.
Example: ...a velvet cushion.

Definition: If someone in authority suppresses an activity, they prevent it from continuing, by using force or making it illegal.
Example: Maritime security patrols protect busy trade routes and suppress illegal activity.

Definition: If you soften something or if it softens, it becomes less hard, stiff, or firm.
Example: Soften the butter mixture in a small saucepan.

Definition: A pillow is a rectangular cushion which you rest your head on when you are in bed.
Example: Your best bet is investing in a comfortable pillow which properly supports your head and neck.

Definition: to occupy one's attention completely; absorb
Example: engrossed in a book

Definition: If someone ill-treats you, they treat you badly or cruelly.
Example: They thought Mr Smith had been ill-treating his wife.

Definition: If someone insults you, they say or do something that is rude or offensive.
Example: I did not mean to insult you.

Definition: If you injure a person or animal, you damage some part of their body.
Example: A number of bombs have exploded, seriously injuring at least five people.

Definition: If you offend someone, you say or do something rude which upsets or embarrasses them.
Example: He apologizes for his comments and says he had no intention of offending the community.

Definition: If you curse, you use rude or offensive language, usually because you are angry about something.
Example: I cursed and hobbled to my feet.

Definition: If you say that someone is exploiting you, you think that they are treating you unfairly by using your work or ideas and giving you very little in return.
Example: Critics claim he exploited Black musicians for personal gain.

Definition: If you say that someone manipulates people, you disapprove of them because they skilfully force or persuade people to do what they want.
Example: He is a very difficult character. He manipulates people.

Definition: The misuse of something is incorrect, careless, or dishonest use of it.
Example: ...the misuse of power and privilege.

Definition: A scholarly person spends a lot of time studying and knows a lot about academic subjects.
Example: He was an intellectual, scholarly man.

Definition: A learned person has gained a lot of knowledge by studying.
Example: He is a serious scholar, a genuinely learned man.

Definition: Someone who is studious spends a lot of time reading and studying books.
Example: I was a very quiet, studious little girl.

Definition: If you don clothing, you put it on.
Example: The crowd threw petrol bombs at the police, who responded by donning riot gear.

Definition: When you greet someone, you say 'Hello' or shake hands with them.
Example: She liked to be home to greet Steve when he came in from school.

Definition: If you smash something or if it smashes, it breaks into many pieces, for example when it is hit or dropped.
Example: Someone smashed a bottle.

Definition: To wreck something means to completely destroy or ruin it.
Example: He wrecked the garden.

Definition: A collision occurs when a moving object crashes into something.
Example:
They were on their way to the Shropshire Union Canal when their van was involved
in a collision with a car.

Definition: A misfortune is something unpleasant or unlucky that happens to someone.
Example: She seemed to enjoy the misfortunes of others.

Definition: If you supplement something, you add something to it in order to improve it.
Example: ...people doing extra jobs outside their regular jobs to supplement their incomes.

Definition: You use precise to emphasize that you are referring to an exact thing, rather than something vague.
Example: At that precise moment I felt sorry for him and didn't want to hurt him.

Definition: If someone or something is on target, they are making good progress and are likely to achieve the result that is wanted.
Example: We were still right on target for our deadline.

Definition: If something is deadly, it is likely or able to cause someone's death, or has already caused someone's death.
Example: He was acquitted on charges of assault with a deadly weapon.

Definition: If you allege that something bad is true, you say it but do not prove it.
Example: They alleged that the fires were caused by defective machinery.

Definition: If you denounce a person or an action, you criticize them severely and publicly because you feel strongly that they are wrong or evil.
Example: The letter called for civil rights, but did not openly denounce the regime.

Definition: If you fulfil something such as a promise, dream, or hope, you do what you said or hoped you would do.
Example: The president fulfilled his promise of announcing a date for the referendum.

Definition: Fulfilment is a feeling of satisfaction that you get from doing or achieving something, especially something useful.
Example: ...professional fulfilment.

Definition: A cutting is a piece of writing which has been cut from a newspaper or magazine.
Example: ...a stack of old photographs and newspaper cuttings.

Definition: Biting wind or cold is extremely cold.
Example: ...a raw, biting northerly wind.

Definition: You use bitterly when you are describing an attitude which involves strong, unpleasant emotions such as anger or dislike.
Example: We are bitterly upset at what has happened.

Definition: If you grasp something, you take it in your hand and hold it very firmly.
Example: He grasped both my hands.

Definition: The way that you behave is the way that you do and say things, and the things that you do and say.
Example: I couldn't believe these people were behaving in this way.

Definition: A deed is something that is done, especially something that is very good or very bad.
Example: His heroic deeds were celebrated in every corner of India.

Definition: A pretence is an action or way of behaving that is intended to make people believe something that is not true.
Example: Welland made a pretence of writing a note in his pad.

Definition: busy doing or thinking about something
Example: He came of age in an occupied territory.

Definition: Someone who is  engaged in or engaged on a particular activity is doing that thing.
Example: They found the three engaged in target practice.

Definition: If you are energetic in what you do, you have a lot of enthusiasm and determination.
Example: Blackwell is 59, strong looking and enormously energetic.

Definition: A spirited action shows great energy and courage.
Example: This television program provoked a spirited debate in the United Kingdom.

Definition: in the act or process of making, working, etc.
Example: The meters weren't in operation after six o'clock, so he didn't have to worry about traffic officers.

Definition: You use militant to describe people who believe in something very strongly and are active in trying to bring about political or social change, often in extreme ways that other people find unacceptable.
Example: Militant mineworkers in Ukraine have voted for a one-day stoppage next month.

Definition: Someone who is partisan strongly supports a particular person or cause, often without thinking carefully about the matter.
Example: He is clearly too partisan to be a referee.

Definition: The organizer of an event or activity is the person who makes sure that the necessary arrangements are made.
Example:
The organisers of the demonstration concede that they hadn't sought permission for
it.

Definition: A warrior is a fighter or soldier, especially one in former times who was very brave and experienced in fighting.
Example: The ambassador thought these warrior women must be a phenomenon of modern womanhood.

Definition: Labour is very hard work, usually physical work.
Example: ...the labour of seeding, planting and harvesting.

Definition: A performer is a person who acts, sings, or does other entertainment in front of audiences.
Example: A performer in evening dress plays classical selections on the violin.

Definition: An artiste is a professional entertainer, for example a singer or a dancer.
Example: ...a cabaret artiste.

Definition: Genuine is used to describe people and things that are exactly what they appear to be, and are not false or an imitation.
Example: He is an inspiration and a genuine hero.

Definition: You use confirmed to describe someone who has a particular habit or belief that they are very unlikely to change.
Example: I'm a confirmed bachelor.

Definition: If you reckon that something is true, you think that it is true.
Example: Toni reckoned that it must be about three o'clock.

Definition: If you  go on doing something, or go on with an activity, you continue to do it.
Example: Unemployment is likely to go on rising this year.

Definition: If you carry on doing something, you continue to do it.
Example: The assistant carried on talking.

Definition: If something undesirable persists, it continues to exist.
Example: Contact your doctor if the cough persists.

Definition: If one thing complements another, it goes well with the other thing and makes its good qualities more noticeable.
Example: Nutmeg, parsley and cider all complement the flavour of these beans well.

Definition: Something that is an adjunct to something larger or more important is connected with it or helps to perform the same task.
Example: Physical therapy is an important adjunct to drug treatments.

Definition: Inclusion is the act of making a person or thing part of a group or collection.
Example: ...a confident performance which justified his inclusion in the team.

Definition: Someone's reckoning is a calculation they make about something, especially a calculation that is not very exact.
Example: By my reckoning we were seven or eight kilometres from Borj Mechaab.

Definition: A lecture is a talk someone gives in order to teach people about a particular subject, usually at a university or college.
Example: ...a series of lectures by Professor Eric Robinson.

Definition: If a person, event, or achievement is hailed as important or successful, they are praised publicly.
Example: He has been hailed as the best centreback in the land.

Definition: If something is a passable effort or of passable quality, it is satisfactory or quite good.
Example: Stan puffed out his thin cheeks in a passable imitation of his dad.

Definition: Acceptable activities and situations are those that most people approve of or consider to be normal.
Example: Is it acceptable for fans to boo their own side?

Definition: If you describe a quality such as the size of something as middling, you mean that it is average.
Example: The Beatles enjoyed only middling success until 1963.

Definition: If you modify something, you change it slightly, usually in order to improve it.
Example: The club members did agree to modify their recruitment policy.

Definition: An alteration is a change in or to something.
Example: Making some simple alterations to your diet will make you feel fitter.

Definition: A prize is money or something valuable that is given to someone who has the best results in a competition or game, or as a reward for doing good work.
Example: You must claim your prize by phoning our claims line.

Definition: Honour means doing what you believe to be right and being confident that you have done what is right.
Example: The officers died faithful to Poland and to the honour of a soldier.

Definition: Admittance is the act of entering a place or institution or the right to enter it.
Example: We had not been able to gain admittance to the flat.

Definition: A confession is a signed statement by someone in which they admit that they have committed a particular crime.
Example: They forced him to sign a confession.

Definition: A declaration is an official announcement or statement.
Example: They will sign the declaration tomorrow.

Definition: Something or someone that is immature is not yet completely grown or fully developed.
Example: The birds were in immature plumage.

Definition: A juvenile is a child or young person who is not yet old enough to be regarded as an adult.
Example:
The number of juveniles in the general population has fallen by a fifth in the past
10 years.

Definition: If someone is nominated for a job or position, their name is formally suggested as a candidate for it.
Example: Under party rules each candidate has to be nominated by 55 Labour MPs.

Definition: A grown-up is an adult; used by or to children.
Example: Jan was almost a grown-up.

Definition: When people or organizations such as banks lend you money, they give it to you and you agree to pay it back at a future date, often with an extra amount as interest.
Example: The bank is reassessing its criteria for lending money.

Definition: If you make a down payment on something, you pay only a percentage of the total cost when you buy it. You then finish paying for it later, usually by paying a certain amount every month.
Example:
If you're borrowing money for the down payment, provide a copy of the entire loan
agreement.

Definition: A deposit is a sum of money which is part of the full price of something, and which you pay when you agree to buy it.
Example: A 50 deposit is required when ordering, and the balance is due upon delivery.

Definition: If the process or rate of something accelerates or if something accelerates it, it gets faster and faster.
Example: Growth will accelerate to 2.9% next year.

Definition: If you do something beforehand, you do it earlier than a particular event.
Example: How could she tell beforehand that I was going to go out?

Definition: The foremost thing or person in a group is the most important or best.
Example: He was one of the world's foremost scholars of ancient Indian culture.

Definition: Revolutionary activities, organizations, or people have the aim of causing a political revolution.
Example: Do you know anything about the revolutionary movement?

Definition: When people or things sway, they lean or swing slowly from one side to the other.
Example: The people swayed back and forth with arms linked.

Definition: If one side in a war or conflict has superiority, it has an advantage over its enemy, for example because it has more soldiers or better equipment.
Example:
The U.S. will need a three-to-one superiority in forces to be sure of a successful
attack.

Definition: You use excitement to refer to the state of being excited, or to something that excites you.
Example: Everyone is in a state of great excitement.

Definition: If something gives you a thrill, it gives you a sudden feeling of great excitement, pleasure, or fear.
Example: I can remember the thrill of not knowing what I would get on Christmas morning.

Definition: Someone who is brave is willing to do things which are dangerous, and does not show fear in difficult or dangerous situations.
Example: He was not brave enough to report the loss of the documents.

Definition: If you are given promotion or a promotion in your job, you are given a more important job or rank in the organization that you work for.
Example: Consider changing jobs or trying for promotion.

Definition: Hype is the use of a lot of publicity and advertising to make people interested in something such as a product.
Example: We are certainly seeing a lot of hype by some companies.

Definition: If you are given notification of something, you are officially informed of it.
Example: Names of the dead and injured are being withheld pending notification of relatives.

Definition: Counsel is advice.
Example: He had always been able to count on her wise counsel.

Definition: If you notify someone of something, you officially inform them about it.
Example: The skipper notified the coastguard of the tragedy.

Definition: If someone is a defender of a particular thing or person that has been criticized, they argue or act in support of that thing or person.
Example: ...the most ardent defenders of conventional family values.

Definition: Happenings are things that happen, often in a way that is unexpected or hard to explain.
Example: The Budapest office plans to hire freelance reporters to cover the latest happenings.

Definition: If you are upset, you are unhappy or disappointed because something unpleasant has happened to you.
Example: After she died I felt very, very upset.

Definition: If you are frightened, you are anxious or afraid, often because of something that has just happened or that you think may happen.
Example: She was frightened of flying.

Definition: If you are anxious to do something or anxious that something should happen, you very much want to do it or very much want it to happen.
Example: The miners were anxious to avoid a strike.

Definition: Someone who is troubled is worried because they have problems.
Example: Rose sounded deeply troubled.

Definition: You use barring to indicate that the person, thing, or event that you are mentioning is an exception to your statement.
Example: Barring accidents, I believe they will succeed.

Definition: If you do something anew, you do it again, often in a different way from before.
Example: She's ready to start anew.

Definition: If you do something afresh, you do it again in a different way.
Example: They believe that the only hope for the French left is to start afresh.

Definition: Opposing ideas or tendencies are totally different from each other.
Example: I have a friend who has the opposing view and felt that the war was immoral.

Definition: Your old age is the period of years towards the end of your life.
Example: They worry about how they will support themselves in their old age.

Definition: Maturity is the state of being fully developed or adult.
Example:
Humans experience a delayed maturity; we arrive at all stages of life later than
other mammals.

Definition: the act of completing, or finishing
Example: The watchman thought more in terms of completion than conclusion, more of fulfilment than depletion.

Definition: When a child or young animal matures, it becomes an adult.
Example: You will learn what to expect as your child matures physically.

Definition: A programme of actions or events is a series of actions or events that are planned to be done.
Example: The general argued that the nuclear programme should still continue.

Definition: If you substitute one thing for another, or if one thing substitutes for another, it takes the place or performs the function of the other thing.
Example: They were substituting violence for dialogue.

Definition: A spy is a person whose job is to find out secret information about another country or organization.
Example: He was jailed for five years as an alleged British spy.

Definition: A mole is a natural dark spot or small dark lump on someone's skin.
Example: MI5 has tried to recruit him as a mole.

Definition: A  secret agent is a person who is employed by a government to find out the secrets of other governments.
Example: Sometimes at parties people asked her what she did and she would say, `I'm a secret agent.

Definition:
A means of doing something is a method, instrument, or process which can be used to do it.
Means is both the singular and the plural form for this use.
Example: The move is a means to fight crime.

Definition: If you are hostile to another person or an idea, you disagree with them or disapprove of them, often showing this in your behaviour.
Example: Many people felt he would be hostile to the idea of foreign intervention.

Definition: Something that is destructive causes or is capable of causing great damage, harm, or injury.
Example: ...the awesome destructive power of nuclear weapons.

Definition: A belligerent person is hostile and aggressive.
Example: ...the belligerent statements from both sides which have led to fears of war.

Definition: If you describe someone as forceful, you approve of them because they express their opinions and wishes in a strong, emphatic, and confident way.
Example: He was a man of forceful character, with considerable insight and diplomatic skills.

Definition: If you describe someone or something as convincing, you mean that they make you believe that a particular thing is true, correct, or genuine.
Example: This is the first convincing evidence that the ageing process can be slowed.

Definition: If one person concurs with another person, the two people agree. You can also say that two people concur.
Example: Local feeling does not necessarily concur with the press.

Definition: If one thing corresponds to another, there is a close similarity or connection between them. You can also say that two things correspond.
Example: Racegoers will be given a number which will correspond to a horse running in a race.

Definition: An accord between countries or groups of people is a formal agreement, for example to end a war.
Example: ...a fitting way to celebrate the peace accord.

Definition: Correspondence is the act of writing letters to someone.
Example: The judges' decision is final and no correspondence will be entered into.

Definition: If there is a similarity between two or more things, they are similar to each other.
Example: ...the astonishing similarity between my brother and my first-born son.

Definition: Farming is the activity of growing crops or keeping animals on a farm.
Example: Further recommendations Are modern farming methods to blame?

Definition: You can use rustic to describe things or people that you approve of because they are simple or unsophisticated in a way that is typical of the countryside.
Example: ...the rustic charm of a country lifestyle.

Definition: towards or at a place ahead or in advance, esp in space but also in time
Example: Take a big step forwards and come into a lunge.

Definition: If you do something in advance, you do it before a particular date or event.
Example: The subject of the talk is announced a week in advance.

Definition: You can use winning to describe a person or thing that wins something such as a competition, game, or election.
Example: ...the leader of the winning party.

Definition: If a person or thing is in front, they are ahead of others in a moving group, or further forward than someone or something else.
Example:
Officers will crack down on lunatic motorists who speed or drive too close to the
car in front.

Definition: at or towards a point or position ahead, in advance, etc
Example: Only from move 42 onwards did the champion begin to falter.

Definition: Further means to a greater extent or degree.
Example: Inflation is below 5% and set to fall further.

Definition: An attendant is someone whose job is to serve or help people in a place such as a car park or a cloakroom.
Example: Tony Williams was working as a car-park attendant in Los Angeles.

Definition: A blast is a big explosion, especially one caused by a bomb.
Example: 250 people were killed in the blast.

Definition: A breeze is a gentle wind.
Example: ...a cool summer breeze.

Definition: A broadcast is a programme, performance, or speech on the radio or on television.
Example:
In a broadcast on state radio the government announced that it was willing to resume
peace talks.

Definition: If you say that someone is beaming, you mean that they have a big smile on their face because they are happy, pleased, or proud about something.
Example: Frances beamed at her friend with undisguised admiration.

Definition: If you publicize a fact or event, you make it widely known to the public.
Example: The author appeared on television to publicize her latest book.

Definition: Publicity is information or actions that are intended to attract the public's attention to someone or something.
Example: Much advance publicity was given to the talks.

Definition: If you ventilate a room or building, you allow fresh air to get into it.
Example: Ventilate the room properly when paint stripping.

Definition: If the wind freshens, it becomes stronger and colder.
Example: The wind had freshened.

Definition: An aeroplane is a vehicle with wings and one or more engines that enable it to fly through the air.
Example: The other pilot will be carrying out the emergency checks and flying the aeroplane as it descends.

Definition: An airfield is an area of ground where aircraft take off and land. It is smaller than an airport.
Example: From the outside it still looks a bit like the disused airfield it once was.

Definition: Strong alcoholic drinks such as whisky, vodka, and gin can be referred to as liquor.
Example: The room was filled with cases of liquor.

Definition: Something that is animate has life, in contrast to things like stones and machines which do not.
Example: ...all aspects of the material world, animate and inanimate.

Definition: You can describe someone as lively when they behave in an enthusiastic and cheerful way.
Example: She had a sweet, lively personality.

Definition: You use spare to describe something that is the same as things that you are already using, but that you do not need yet and are keeping ready in case another one is needed.
Example:
If possible keep a spare pair of glasses accessible in case your main pair is broken
or lost.

Definition: If a group of people or things unite or if something unites them, they join together and act as a group.
Example: The two parties have been trying to unite since the New Year.

Definition: A person or animal that is solitary spends a lot of time alone.
Example: Paul was a shy, pleasant, solitary man.

Definition: An isolated place is a long way away from large towns and is difficult to reach.
Example: Many of the refugee villages are in isolated areas.

Definition: The sole thing or person of a particular type is the only one of that type.
Example: Their sole aim is to destabilize the Indian government.

Definition: Someone who is lonely is unhappy because they are alone or do not have anyone they can talk to.
Example: ...lonely people who just want to talk.

Definition: An abandoned place or building is no longer used or occupied.
Example: All that digging had left a network of abandoned mines and tunnels.

Definition: If something involves solely one thing or one person, it involves only this thing or this one person and no others.
Example: Too often we make decisions based solely upon what we see in the magazines.

Definition: as an individual or individuals rather than as a group; one at a time; separately; singly
Example: The two women ate in surly silence and individually excused themselves, both pleading headaches, even before the dessert was served.

Definition: If people do something singly, they each do it on their own, or do it one by one.
Example: They marched out singly or in pairs.

Definition: If you are by yourself, you are alone.
Example: ...a dark-haired man sitting by himself in a corner.

Definition: If you do something unaided, you do it without help from anyone or anything else.
Example: There had been at least thirteen previous attempts to reach the North Pole unaided.

Definition: If someone is unaccompanied, they are alone.
Example: The council must care for unaccompanied minors.

Definition: If one thing is alongside another thing, the first thing is next to the second.
Example: He crossed the street and walked alongside Central Park.

Definition: When you alternate two things, you keep using one then the other. When one thing alternates with another, the first regularly occurs after the other.
Example: Her aggressive moods alternated with gentle or more co-operative states.

Definition: If something will inevitably happen, it is certain to happen and cannot be prevented or avoided.
Example: Technological changes will inevitably lead to unemployment.

Definition: Something that is for keeps is permanent and will not change.
Example: Ensure that whatever you gain now will be for keeps.

Definition: If something happens or is done all the time, it happens or is done continually.
Example: We can't be together all the time.

Definition: Something that is astonishing is very surprising.
Example: It's astonishing, he's learned Latin in three hours!

Definition: Something that is striking is very noticeable or unusual.
Example: The most striking feature of those statistics is the high proportion of suicides.

Definition: A quantity is an amount that you can measure or count.
Example: ...a small quantity of water.

Definition: Reasoning is the process by which you reach a conclusion after thinking about all the facts.
Example: ...the reasoning behind the decision.

Definition: A commentator is a broadcaster who gives a radio or television commentary on an event.
Example: ...a sports commentator.

Definition: You use classical to describe something that is traditional in form, style, or content.
Example:
