Fokine did not change the steps of classical ballet; instead he found new ways of
using them.

Definition: Rage is strong anger that is difficult to control.
Example: He was red-cheeked with rage.

Definition: If you are outraged by something, it makes you extremely shocked and angry.
Example: Many people have been outraged by some of the things that have been said.

Definition: If you refer to someone's temper or say that they have a temper, you mean that they become angry very easily.
Example: He had a temper and could be nasty.

Definition: If you are enraged by something, it makes you extremely angry.
Example: He was enraged by news of plans to demolish the pub.

Definition: If you provoke someone, you deliberately annoy them and try to make them behave aggressively.
Example: He started shouting at me but I didn't do anything to provoke him.

Definition: If someone or something annoys you, it makes you fairly angry and impatient.
Example: Try making a note of the things which annoy you.

Definition: A gradient is a slope, or the degree to which the ground slopes.
Example: ...a gradient of 1 in 3.

Definition: A slope is the side of a mountain, hill, or valley.
Example: Saint-Christo is perched on a mountain slope.

Definition: If you incline to think or act in a particular way, or if something inclines you to it, you are likely to think or act in that way.
Example: I incline to the view that he is right.

Definition: An intersection is a place where roads or other lines meet or cross.
Example: ...at the intersection of two main canals.

Definition: You can refer to the opinions or attitudes that you have about something as your point of view.
Example: Thanks for your point of view, John.

Definition: Something that slants is sloping, rather than horizontal or vertical.
Example: The morning sun slanted through the glass roof.

Definition: If part of your body is inflamed, it is red or swollen, usually as a result of an infection, injury, or illness.
Example: Symptoms include red, itchy and inflamed skin.

Definition: Something that is nasty is very unpleasant to see, experience, or feel.
Example: ...an extremely nasty murder.

Definition: You can describe someone's behaviour as threatening when you think that they are trying to harm you.
Example: The police could have charged them with threatening behaviour.

Definition: If you describe a person, place, or thing as forbidding, you mean they have a severe, unfriendly, or threatening appearance.
Example: There was something a little severe and forbidding about her face.

Definition: A situation or piece of information that is grim is unpleasant, depressing, and difficult to accept.
Example: They painted a grim picture of growing crime.

Definition: If someone or something looks menacing, they give you a feeling that they are likely to cause you harm or put you in danger.
Example: The strong dark eyebrows give his face an oddly menacing look.

Definition: You can refer to an animal as a beast, especially if it is a large, dangerous, or unusual one.
Example: ...the threats our ancestors faced from wild beasts.

Definition: If you call someone a brute, you mean that they are rough, violent, and insensitive.
Example: Custer was an idiot and a brute and he deserved his fate.

Definition: In Judaism, Christianity, and Islam, the Devil is the most powerful evil spirit.
Example: ...the idea of angels with wings and devils with horns and hoofs.

Definition: A monster is a large imaginary creature that looks very ugly and frightening.
Example: ...the monster which is now the London marathon.

Definition: Someone or something that is savage is extremely cruel, violent, and uncontrolled.
Example: This was a savage attack on a defenceless young girl.

Definition: A jubilee is a special anniversary of an event, especially the 25th or 50th anniversary.
Example: ...Queen Victoria's jubilee.

Definition: If you do something in remembrance of a dead person, you do it as a way of showing that you want to remember them and that you respect them.
Example: They wore black in remembrance of those who had died.

Definition: the act or an instance of commemorating
Example: Manchester 3pm: national service of commemoration.

Definition: Something that heralds a future event or situation is a sign that it is going to happen or appear.
Example: ...the sultry evening that heralded the end of the baking hot summer.

Definition: A yearly event happens once a year or every year.
Example: The seven major industrial countries will have their yearly meeting in London.

Definition: An almanac is a book published every year which contains information about the movements of the planets, the changes of the moon and the tides, and the dates of important anniversaries.
Example: It was the advertisement of John Partridge's almanac that Man had come to talk about.

Definition: A handbook is a book that gives you advice and instructions about a particular subject, tool, or machine.
Example: ...handbooks on grammar.

Definition: A remedy is a successful way of dealing with a problem.
Example: The remedy lies in the hands of the government.

Definition: the act of vindicating or the condition of being vindicated
Example: It was claiming vindication yesterday after the results.

Definition: Defence is action that is taken to protect someone or something against attack.
Example: The land was flat, giving no scope for defence.

Definition: If you make a rebuttal of a charge or accusation that has been made against you, you make a statement which gives reasons why the accusation is untrue.
Example: He is conducting a point-by-point rebuttal of charges from former colleagues.

Definition: A forecast is a statement of what is expected to happen in the future, especially in relation to a particular event or situation.
Example: ...a forecast of a 2.25 per cent growth in the economy.

Definition: Anyhow means the same as anyway.
Example: Her curly hair stuck out all anyhow from under her hat.

Definition: A suite is a set of rooms in a hotel or other building.
Example: They had a fabulous time during their week in a suite at the Paris Hilton.

Definition: A compartment is one of the separate spaces into which a railway carriage is divided.
Example: On the way home we shared our first-class compartment with a group of businessmen.

Definition: housing or accommodation, esp as provided for military personnel and their families
Example: There are voices of optimism in some quarters.

Definition: Accommodation is used to refer to buildings or rooms where people live or stay.
Example: The government will provide temporary accommodation for up to three thousand people.

Definition: Seeming means appearing to be the case, but not necessarily the case. For example, if you talk about someone's seeming ability to do something, you mean that they appear to be able to do it, but you are not certain.
Example:
Wall Street analysts have been highly critical of the company's seeming inability
to control costs.

Definition: An alleged fact has been stated but has not been proved to be true.
Example: They have begun a hunger strike in protest at the alleged beating.

Definition: An outward journey is a journey that you make away from a place that you are intending to return to later.
Example:
Tickets must be bought seven days in advance, with outward and return journey dates
specified.

Definition: A marked change or difference is very obvious and easily noticed.
Example: There has been a marked increase in crimes against property.

Definition: A plain object, surface, or fabric is entirely in one colour and has no pattern, design, or writing on it.
Example: In general, a plain carpet makes a room look bigger.

Definition: reportedly; supposedly
Example: Argentina players had allegedly refused to use his planes.

Definition: You say on the face of it when you are describing how something seems when it is first considered, in order to suggest that people's opinion may change when they know or think more about the subject.
Example: On the face of it that seems to make sense. But the figures don't add up.

Definition: If something is seemingly the case, you mean that it appears to be the case, even though it may not really be so.
Example: A seemingly endless line of trucks waits in vain to load up.

Definition: You use outwardly to indicate the feelings or qualities that a person or situation may appear to have, rather than the ones that they actually have.
Example: They may feel tired and though outwardly calm, can be irritable.

Definition: apparently; seemingly
Example: This show is ostensibly tales about that, but he has a tendency to wander off down other routes.

Definition: If you plead with someone to do something, you ask them in an intense, emotional way to do it.
Example: The woman pleaded with her daughter to come back home.

Definition: A plea is an appeal or request for something, made in an intense or emotional way.
Example: Mr Nicholas made his emotional plea for help in solving the killing.

Definition: Attraction is a feeling of liking someone, and often of being sexually interested in them.
Example:
Our level of attraction to the opposite sex has more to do with confidence than how
we look.

Definition: Charm is the quality of being pleasant or attractive.
Example:
'Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs', the 1937 Disney classic, has lost none of its
original charm.

Definition: Fascination is the state of being greatly interested in or delighted by something.
Example: I've had a lifelong fascination with the sea and with small boats.

Definition: You say that someone has charisma when they can attract, influence, and inspire people by their personal qualities.
Example: He has neither the policies nor the personal charisma to inspire people.

Definition: When a new product such as a book or CD  comes out, it becomes available to the public.
Example: The book comes out this week.

Definition: An occurrence is something that happens.
Example: Complaints seemed to be an everyday occurrence.

Definition: The emergence of something is the process or event of its coming into existence.
Example: ...the emergence of global players.

Definition: A manifestation of something is one of the different ways in which it can appear.
Example: Different animals in the colony had different manifestations of the disease.

Definition: Something's relevance to a situation or person is its importance or significance in that situation or to that person.
Example: Politicians' private lives have no relevance to their public roles.

Definition: If you tackle a difficult problem or task, you deal with it in a very determined or efficient way.
Example: The first reason to tackle these problems is to save children's lives.

Definition: When you undertake a task or job, you start doing it and accept responsibility for it.
Example: She undertook the arduous task of monitoring the elections.

Definition: An approximate number, time, or position is close to the correct number, time, or position, but is not exact.
Example: The approximate cost varies from around 150 to 250.

Definition: Someone or something that is suitable for a particular purpose or occasion is right or acceptable for it.
Example:
Employers usually decide within five minutes whether someone is suitable for the
job.

Definition: A fitting is one of the smaller parts on the outside of a piece of equipment or furniture, for example a handle or a tap.
Example: ...brass light fittings.

Definition: If you give your consent to something, you give someone permission to do it.
Example: Pollard finally gave his consent to the search.

Definition: A licence is an official document which gives you permission to do, use, or own something.
Example: Payne lost his driving licence a year ago for drink-driving.

Definition: If you regard something or someone with favour, you like or support them.
Example: Will the show still find favour with a modern audience?

Definition: If you have a liking for something or someone, you like them.
Example: She had a liking for good clothes.

Definition: The creator of something is the person who made it or invented it.
Example: ...Ian Fleming, the creator of James Bond.

Definition: You can use realm to refer to any area of activity, interest, or thought.
Example: ...the realm of politics.

Definition: A quarrel is an angry argument between two or more friends or family members.
Example: I had a terrible quarrel with my other brothers.

Definition: When people clash, they fight, argue, or disagree with each other.
Example: A group of 400 demonstrators clashed with police.

Definition: To awaken a feeling in a person means to cause them to start having this feeling.
Example:
The aim of the cruise was to awaken an interest in and an understanding of foreign
cultures.

Definition: When someone who is sitting or lying down  gets up, they rise to a standing position.
Example: I got up and walked over to where he was.

Definition: If you ascend a hill or staircase, you go up it.
Example: Mrs Clayton had to hold Lizzie's hand as they ascended the steps.

Definition: Your limbs are your arms and legs.
Example: She would be able to stretch out her cramped limbs and rest for a few hours.

Definition: An appendage is something that is joined to or connected with something larger or more important.
Example:
The Great British Music Weekend was designed as an appendage to that year's Brit
Awards.

Definition: An inlet is a narrow strip of water which goes from a sea or lake into the land.
Example: ...a sheltered inlet.

Definition: A bay is a part of a coast where the land curves inwards.
Example: ...a short ferry ride across the bay.

Definition: If you equip a person or thing with something, you give them the tools or equipment that are needed.
Example: They equipped their vehicles with gadgets to deal with every possible contingency.

Definition: An outfit is a set of clothes.
Example: She was wearing an outfit she'd bought the previous day.

Definition: If you are prepared to do something, you are willing to do it if necessary.
Example: Are you prepared to take industrial action?

Definition: A mob is a large, disorganized, and often violent crowd of people.
Example: Bottles and cans were hurled on the terraces by the mob.

Definition: that which surrounds
Example: The tents of their army covered a vast area surrounding the old ruin.

Definition: Something that is handy is useful.
Example: The book gives handy hints on looking after indoor plants.

Definition: If you say that someone orchestrates an event or situation, you mean that they carefully organize it in a way that will produce the result that they want.
Example: The colonel was able to orchestrate a rebellion from inside an army jail.

Definition: If two or more things harmonize with each other, they fit in well with each other.
Example: ...slabs of pink and beige stone that harmonize with the carpet.

Definition: An adaptation of a book or play is a film or a television programme that is based on it.
Example: ...Branagh's screen adaptation of Shakespeare's Henry the Fifth.

Definition: If something fascinates you, it interests and delights you so much that your thoughts tend to concentrate on it.
Example: Politics fascinated Franklin's father.

Definition: An engaging person or thing is pleasant, interesting, and entertaining.
Example: ...one of her most engaging and least known novels.

Definition: A coming event or time is an event or time that will happen soon.
Example: This obviously depends on the weather in the coming months.

Definition: A newcomer is a person who has recently arrived in a place, joined an organization, or started a new activity.
Example: He must be a newcomer to town and he obviously didn't understand our local customs.

Definition: An incomer is someone who has recently come to live in a particular place or area.
Example: There was only one bridge by which an incomer could cross a minor conduit.

Definition: Childbirth is the act of giving birth to a child.
Example: She died in childbirth.

Definition: The Nativity is the birth of Jesus, which is celebrated by Christians at Christmas.
Example: They admired the tableau of the Nativity.

Definition: If you say that someone or something  turns up, you mean that they arrive, often unexpectedly or after you have been waiting a long time.
Example: Richard had turned up on Christmas Eve with Tony.

Definition: When something takes place, it happens, especially in a controlled or organized way.
Example: The discussion took place in a famous villa on the lake's shore.

Definition: If something ensues, it happens immediately after another event, usually as a result of it.
Example: If the Europeans did not reduce subsidies, a trade war would ensue.

Definition: A triumph is a great success or achievement, often one that has been gained with a lot of skill or effort.
Example: The championships proved to be a personal triumph for the coach.

Definition: Artwork is drawings and photographs that are prepared in order to be included in something such as a book or advertisement.
Example: The band have released the artwork for their forthcoming album.

Definition: creative ability; artistic or intellectual inventiveness
Example: It stands to reason, given man's creativity for destruction, that someone will invent the ultimately destructive device.

Definition: If you describe someone as cultured, you mean that they have good manners, are well educated, and know a lot about the arts.
Example: He is a cultured man with a wide circle of friends.

Definition: If people or things are dealt with separately or do something separately, they are dealt with or do something at different times or places, rather than together.
Example: Cook each vegetable separately until just tender.

Definition: If something is true notwithstanding something else, it is true in spite of that other thing.
Example: He despised William Pitt, notwithstanding the similar views they both held.

Definition: An interpolation is an addition to a piece of writing.
Example:
The interpolation appears to have been inserted very soon after the original text
was finished.

Definition: If you remark that something is the case, you say that it is the case.
Example: I remarked that I would go shopping that afternoon.

Definition: an act or instance of digressing from a main subject in speech or writing
Example: He surged into a historical digression about Augusta Alexandra Feldbausch and her long, miserable marriage with Paul von Doenecke.

Definition: If you inquire about something, you ask for information about it.
Example: 'Is something wrong?' he enquired.

Definition: A quiz is a game or competition in which someone tests your knowledge by asking you questions.
Example: We'll have a quiz at the end of the show.

Definition: A query is a question, especially one that you ask an organization, publication, or expert.
Example:
While she was off work, the Manager of the firm phoned her many times with queries
about accounts and customers.

Definition: A bid for something or a bid to do something is an attempt to obtain it or do it.
Example: ...the city's successful bid for European City of Culture.

Definition: If you summon someone, you order them to come to you.
Example: Howe summoned a doctor and hurried over.

Definition: Something that is dormant is not active, growing, or being used at the present time but is capable of becoming active later on.
Example: ...when the long dormant volcano erupted.

Definition: If someone is given a beating, they are hit hard many times, especially with something such as a stick.
Example: ...after a savage beating by fellow inmates.

Definition: An allegation is a statement saying that someone has done something wrong.
Example: The company has denied the allegations.

Definition: If you uphold something such as a law, a principle, or a decision, you support and maintain it.
Example: Our policy has been to uphold the law.

Definition: Someone's insistence on something is the fact that they insist that it should be done or insist that it is the case.
Example: ...Raeder's insistence that naval uniform be worn.

Definition: Determination is the quality that you show when you have decided to do something and you will not let anything stop you.
Example: Everyone concerned acted with great courage and determination.

Definition: If one item or share of something is allocated to a particular person or for a particular purpose, it is given to that person or used for that purpose.
Example: Tickets are limited and will be allocated to those who apply first.

Definition: To facilitate an action or process, especially one that you would like to happen, means to make it easier or more likely to happen.
Example: The new airport will facilitate the development of tourism.

Definition: If someone has the backing of an organization or an important person, they receive support or money from that organization or person in order to do something.
Example: He said the president had the full backing of his government to negotiate a deal.

Definition: A helper is a person who helps another person or group with a job they are doing.
Example: You must be my little friend and helper in pleasing him.

Definition: An affiliate is an organization which is officially connected with another, larger organization or is a member of it.
Example: All youth groups will have to affiliate to the National Youth Agency.

Definition: If you socialize, you meet other people socially, for example at parties.
Example: ...an open meeting, where members socialized and welcomed any new members.

Definition: If you presume that something is the case, you think that it is the case, although you are not certain.
Example: I presume you're here on business.

Definition: If you simulate an action or a feeling, you pretend that you are doing it or feeling it.
Example: They rolled about on the Gilligan Road, simulating a bloodthirsty fight.

Definition: A presumption is something that is accepted as true but is not certain to be true.
Example: ...the presumption that a defendant is innocent until proved guilty.

Definition: Sporting means relating to sports or used for sports.
Example: ...major sporting events, such as Wimbledon and the World Cup finals.

Definition: If you affix one thing to another, you stick it or attach it to the other thing.
Example: Complete the form and affix four tokens to its back.

Definition: If you ascribe an event or condition to a particular cause, you say or consider that it was caused by that thing.
Example: An autopsy eventually ascribed the baby's death to sudden infant death syndrome.

Definition: To infect people, animals, or plants means to cause them to have a disease or illness.
Example: A single mosquito can infect a large number of people.

Definition: Poison is a substance that harms or kills people or animals if they swallow it or absorb it.
Example: Poison from the weever fish causes paralysis, swelling, and nausea.

Definition: If something is contaminated by waste, dirt, chemicals, or radiation, it is made dirty or harmful.
Example: Have any fish been contaminated in the Arctic Ocean?

Definition: If you have a bout of an illness or of an unpleasant feeling, you have it for a short period.
Example: He was recovering from a severe bout of flu.

Definition: When you spell a word, you write or speak each letter in the word in the correct order.
Example: He gave his name and then helpfully spelt it.

Definition: In Britain, a solicitor is a lawyer who gives legal advice, prepares legal documents and cases, and represents clients in the lower courts of law. Compare barrister.
Example: Your solicitor may also have to contact other solicitors for information about your property.

Definition: The allure of something or someone is the pleasing or exciting quality that they have.
Example: It's a game that has really lost its allure.

Definition: Something that is seductive is very attractive or makes you want to do something that you would not otherwise do.
Example: It's a seductive argument.

Definition: If you say that something is charming, you mean that it is very pleasant or attractive.
Example: ...a charming little fishing village.

Definition: If something is tempting, it makes you want to do it or have it.
Example: In the end, I turned down Raoul's tempting offer of the Palm Beach trip.

Definition: Someone or something that has magnetism has unusual, powerful, and exciting qualities which attract people to them.
Example: There was no doubting the animal magnetism of the man.

Definition: Someone or something that is appealing is pleasing and attractive.
Example: There was a sense of humour to what he did that I found very appealing.

Definition: Something that is pleasing gives you pleasure and satisfaction.
Example: This area of France has a pleasing climate in August.

Definition: If you say that something is inviting, you mean that it has good qualities that attract you or make you want to experience it.
Example: The February air was soft, cool, and inviting.

Definition: If you describe something as fascinating, you find it very interesting and attractive, and your thoughts tend to concentrate on it.
Example: Madagascar is the most fascinating place I have ever been to.

Definition: If something is the prerogative of a particular person or group, it is a privilege or a power that only they have.
Example: Constitutional changes are exclusively the prerogative of the parliament.

Definition: If a place or building is accessible to people, it is easy for them to reach it or get into it. If an object is accessible, it is easy to reach.
Example: The Centre is easily accessible to the general public.

Definition: If a way of doing something is convenient, it is easy, or very useful or suitable for a particular purpose.
Example: ...a flexible and convenient way of paying for business expenses.

Definition: If someone is very willing to do something, you can talk about their readiness to do it.
Example: ...their readiness to co-operate with the new U.S. envoy.

Definition: the quality of being handy
Example: He then made himself a star through his handiness in combat - verbal and physical.

Definition: If a building is unoccupied, there is nobody in it.
Example: The house was unoccupied at the time of the explosion.

Definition: If you describe something as mediocre, you mean that it is of average quality but you think it should be better.
Example: His school record was mediocre.

Definition: If something frustrates you, it upsets or angers you because you are unable to do anything about the problems it creates.
Example: These questions frustrated me.

Definition: If someone or something hampers you, they make it difficult for you to do what you are trying to do.
Example: The bad weather hampered rescue operations.

Definition: If something that you want eludes you, you fail to obtain it.
Example: Sleep eluded her.

Definition: If you dodge, you move suddenly, often to avoid being hit, caught, or seen.
Example: He dodged amongst the seething crowds of men.

Definition: If you shun someone or something, you deliberately avoid them or keep away from them.
Example: From that time forward everybody shunned him.

Definition: If you evade something, you find a way of not doing something that you really ought to do.
Example: By his own admission, he evaded taxes as a Florida real-estate speculator.

Definition: A trophy is a prize, for example a silver cup, that is given to the winner of a competition or race.
Example: He finished third in the Tote Gold Trophy.

Definition: The decoration of a room is its furniture, wallpaper, and ornaments.
Example: The decoration and furnishings had to be practical enough for a family home.

Definition: Compensation is money that someone who has experienced loss or suffering claims from the person or organization responsible, or from the state.
Example: He received one year's salary as compensation for loss of office.

Definition:
You can use render with an adjective that describes a particular state to say that someone or something is changed into that state. For example, if someone or
something makes a thing harmless, you can say that they render it harmless.
Example: It contained so many errors as to render it worthless.

Definition: Someone who is informed knows about a subject or what is happening in the world.
Example: Informed people know the company is shaky.

Definition: If you describe someone or their attitudes as enlightened, you mean that they have sensible, modern attitudes and ways of dealing with things.
Example:
Enlightened companies include their human resources in their estimation of the firm's
worth.

Definition: Someone who is knowledgeable has or shows a clear understanding of many different facts about the world or about a particular subject.
Example: We employ friendly and knowledgeable staff.

Definition: You use hence to indicate that the statement you are about to make is a consequence of what you have just said.
Example:
The trade imbalance is likely to rise again in 1990. Hence a new set of policy actions
will be required soon.

Definition: Something that is appalling is so bad or unpleasant that it shocks you.
Example: They have been living under the most appalling conditions for two months.

Definition: You can say that something is shocking if you think that it is very bad.
Example: The media coverage was shocking.

Definition: Something that is alarming makes you feel afraid or anxious that something unpleasant or dangerous might happen.
Example: The disease has spread at an alarming rate.

Definition: If something is distressing, it upsets you or worries you.
Example: It is very distressing to see your baby attached to tubes and monitors.

Definition: If you are unwell, you are ill.
Example:
He had been riding in Hyde Park, but felt unwell as he was being driven back to his
office late this afternoon.

Definition: in a shocking, or disagreeable manner
Example: dreadfully tired

Definition: in a terrible manner
Example: a terribly funny man

Definition: Some people use babe as an affectionate way of addressing someone they love.
Example: I'm sorry, babe. I didn't mean it.

Definition: You call someone darling if you love them or like them very much.
Example: Thank you, darling.

Definition: You can call someone dearest when you are very fond of them.
Example: What's wrong, my dearest? You look tired.

Definition: If you move or look backwards, you move or look in the direction that your back is facing.
Example: The diver flipped over backwards into the water.

Definition: Your spine is the row of bones down your back.
Example: Today they will arrive without an entire central spine.

Definition: Your backbone is the column of small linked bones down the middle of your back.
Example: Small businesses are the economic backbone of this country.

Definition: The rear of something such as a building or vehicle is the back part of it.
Example: He settled back in the rear of the taxi.

Definition: An animal's hind legs are at the back of its body.
Example: Suddenly the cow kicked up its hind legs.

Definition: furthest back; last
Example: "The city people, those afoot... "Marak shuddered to think of the situation of the hindmost: beshti were some defense.

Definition: When someone or something reverses a decision, policy, or trend, they change it to the opposite decision, policy, or trend.
Example: They have made it clear they will not reverse the decision to increase prices.

Definition: If you have a grounding in a subject, you know the basic facts or principles of that subject, especially as a result of a particular course of training or instruction.
Example: The degree provides a thorough grounding in both mathematics and statistics.

Definition: You can use acute to indicate that an undesirable situation or feeling is very severe or intense.
Example: The war has aggravated an acute economic crisis.

Definition: If you describe something as unwise, you think that it is foolish and likely to lead to a bad result.
Example: It would be unwise to expect too much.

Definition: If a conclusion or method is unsound, it is based on ideas that are wrong.
Example: The thinking is good-hearted, but muddled and fundamentally unsound.

Definition: Unfavourable conditions or circumstances cause problems for you and reduce your chances of success.
Example: Unfavourable economic conditions were blocking a recovery of the insurance market.

Definition: If you describe someone as unfortunate, you mean that something unpleasant or unlucky has happened to them. You can also describe the unpleasant things that happen to them as unfortunate.
Example: Some unfortunate person passing below could all too easily be seriously injured.

Definition: Something that is inferior is not as good as something else.
Example: Much of the imported coffee is of inferior quality.

Definition: If something is inadequate, there is not enough of it or it is not good enough.
Example: Supplies of food and medicines are inadequate.

Definition: If you describe a person or animal as pathetic, you mean that they are sad and weak or helpless, and they make you feel very sorry for them.
Example: ...a pathetic little dog with a curly tail.

Definition: If you describe someone as incompetent, you are criticizing them because they are unable to do their job or a task properly.
Example: The court declared him incompetent to manage his financial affairs.

Definition: You use wicked to describe someone or something that is very bad and deliberately harmful to people.
Example: She described the shooting as a wicked attack.

Definition: Evil is a powerful force that some people believe to exist, and which causes wicked and bad things to happen.
Example: We are still being attacked by the forces of evil.

Definition: Someone who is corrupt behaves in a way that is morally wrong, especially by doing dishonest or illegal things in return for money or power.
Example: ...to save the nation from corrupt politicians of both parties.

Definition: Corruption is dishonesty and illegal behaviour by people in positions of authority or power.
Example: The President faces 54 charges of corruption and tax evasion.

Definition: If you say that a child is naughty, you mean that they behave badly or do not do what they are told.
Example: Girls, you're being very naughty.

Definition: If you say that someone is defiant, you mean they show aggression or independence by refusing to obey someone.
Example: The players are in defiant mood as they prepare for tomorrow's game.

Definition: If you describe a person or their behaviour as wayward, you mean that they behave in a selfish, bad, or unpredictable way, and are difficult to control.
Example: ...wayward children with a history of severe emotional problems.

Definition: If you describe something as foul, you mean it is dirty and smells or tastes unpleasant.
Example: ...foul polluted water.

Definition: If you are irritable, you are easily annoyed.
Example: He had been waiting for over an hour and was beginning to feel irritable.

Definition: If someone is ashamed, they feel embarrassed or guilty because of something they do or they have done, or because of their appearance.
Example: I felt incredibly ashamed of myself for getting so angry.

Definition: If you are apologetic, you show or say that you are sorry for causing trouble for someone, for hurting them, or for disappointing them.
Example: The hospital staff were very apologetic but that couldn't really compensate.

Definition: An injured person or animal has physical damage to part of their body, usually as a result of an accident or fighting.
Example: The other injured man had a superficial stomach wound.

Definition: Something that is diseased is affected by a disease.
Example: The arteries are diseased and a transplant is the only hope.

Definition: If food, wood, or another substance is rotten, it has decayed and can no longer be used.
Example: The smell outside this building is overwhelminglike rotten eggs.

Definition: Something that is sour has a sharp, unpleasant taste like the taste of a lemon.
Example: The stewed apple was sour even with honey.

Definition: Something that is insulting is rude or offensive.
Example: The article was insulting to the families of British citizens.

Definition: If you say that something is disgusting, you are criticizing it because it is extremely unpleasant.
Example: It tasted disgusting.

Definition: If someone is poorly, they are ill.
Example: I've just phoned Julie and she's still poorly.

Definition: You use greatly to emphasize the degree or extent of something.
Example: People would benefit greatly from a pollution-free vehicle.

Definition: A sack is a large bag made of rough woven material. Sacks are used to carry or store things such as vegetables or coal.
Example: ...a sack of potatoes.

Definition:
A sac is a small part of an animal's body, shaped like a little bag. It contains air, liquid,
or some other substance.
Example: The lungs consist of millions of tiny air sacs.

Definition: When you roast meat or other food, you cook it by dry heat in an oven or over a fire.
Example: I personally would rather roast a chicken whole.

Definition: If something stabilizes, or is stabilized, it becomes stable.
Example: Although her illness is serious, her condition is beginning to stabilize.

Definition: Equilibrium is a balance between several different influences or aspects of a situation.
Example: Stocks seesawed ever lower until prices found some new level of equilibrium.

Definition: If one thing is offset by another, the effect of the first thing is reduced by the second, so that any advantage or disadvantage is cancelled out.
Example: The increase in pay costs was more than offset by higher productivity.

Definition: Equanimity is a calm state of mind and attitude to life, so that you never lose your temper or become upset.
Example: His sense of humour allowed him to face adversaries with equanimity.

Definition: Constancy is the quality of staying the same even though other things change.
Example: Climate reflects a basic struggle between constancy and change.

Definition: The remainder of a group are the things or people that still remain after the other things or people have gone or have been dealt with.
Example: He gulped down the remainder of his coffee.

Definition: If there is a surplus of something, there is more than is needed.
Example: Germany suffers from a surplus of teachers.

Definition: A sphere is an object that is completely round in shape like a ball.
Example: ...the sphere of international politics.

Definition: You can refer to the world as the globe when you are emphasizing how big it is or that something happens in many different parts of it.
Example: ...bottles of beer from every corner of the globe.

Definition: A pellet is a small ball of paper, mud, lead, or other material.
Example: He was shot in the head by an air gun pellet.

Definition: If a law or someone in authority prohibits something, they forbid it or make it illegal.
Example: ...a law that prohibits tobacco advertising in newspapers and magazines.

Definition: A prohibition is a law or rule forbidding something.
Example: ...a prohibition on discrimination.

Definition: If someone in authority vetoes something, they forbid it, or stop it being put into action.
Example: They vetoed a draft resolution condemning the violence.

Definition: If you exclude someone from a place or activity, you prevent them from entering it or taking part in it.
Example: The Academy excluded women from its classes.

Definition: An ensemble is a group of musicians, actors, or dancers who regularly perform together.
Example: ...an ensemble of young musicians.

Definition: A bandage is a long strip of cloth which is wrapped around a wounded part of someone's body to protect or support it.
Example: We put some ointment and a bandage on his knee.

Definition: A binding promise, agreement, or decision must be obeyed or carried out.
Example: ...proposals for a legally binding commitment to reduce carbon emissions.

Definition: A repository is a place where something is kept safely.
Example: A church in Moscow became a repository for police files.

Definition: A mound of something is a large rounded pile of it.
Example: The bulldozers piled up huge mounds of dirt.

Definition: An accumulation of something is a large number of things which have been collected together or acquired over a period of time.
Example: ...an accumulation of experience and knowledge.

Definition: If you tilt an object or if it tilts, it moves into a sloping position with one end or side higher than the other.
Example: She tilted the mirror and began to comb her hair.

Definition: An inn is a small hotel or pub, usually an old one.
Example: ...the Waterside Inn.

Definition: A rod is a long, thin metal or wooden bar.
Example: ...a 15-foot thick roof that was reinforced with steel rods.

Definition: If something is forbidden, you are not allowed to do it or have it.
Example: Smoking was forbidden everywhere.

Definition: Something that is striped has stripes on it.
Example: ...a bottle green and maroon striped tie.

Definition: If someone's face or skin is lined, it has lines on it as a result of old age, tiredness, worry, or illness.
Example: His lined face was that of an old man.

Definition: If you restrict something, you put a limit on it in order to reduce it or prevent it becoming too great.
Example: There is talk of restricting the number of students on campus.

Definition: If you restrain someone, you stop them from doing what they intended or wanted to do, usually by using your physical strength.
Example: Wally gripped my arm, partly to restrain me and partly to reassure me.

Definition: An obstacle is an object that makes it difficult for you to go where you want to go, because it is in your way.
Example: Most competition cars will only roll over if they hit an obstacle.

Definition: A hurdle is a problem, difficulty, or part of a process that may prevent you from achieving something.
Example: Two-thirds of candidates fall at this first hurdle and are packed off home.

Definition: You use scarcely to emphasize that something is only just true or only just the case.
Example: He could scarcely breathe.

Definition: A cask is a wooden barrel that is used for storing things, especially alcoholic drink.
Example: ...casks of sherry.

Definition: A drum is a musical instrument consisting of a skin stretched tightly over a round frame. You play a drum by beating it with sticks or with your hands.
Example: ...an oil drum.

Definition: Someone's butt is their bottom.
Example: Frieda grinned, pinching him on the butt.

Definition: A vat is a large barrel or tank in which liquids can be stored.
Example: Life's too short to skim fat off a vat of soup with a cold teaspoon.

Definition: A cannon is a large gun, usually on wheels, which used to be used in battles.
Example: One of the reporters cannoned into Arnold.

Definition: A handicap is a physical or mental disability.
Example: He lost his leg when he was ten, but learnt to overcome his handicap.

Definition: A hindrance is a person or thing that makes it more difficult for you to do something.
Example: The higher rates have been a hindrance to economic recovery.

Definition: A barricade is a line of vehicles or other objects placed across a road or open space to stop people getting past, for example during street fighting or as a protest.
Example: Large areas of the city have been closed off by barricades set up by the demonstrators.

Definition: Fortifications are buildings, walls, or ditches that are built to protect a place and make it more difficult to attack.
Example: The government has started building fortifications along its eastern border.

Definition: The underside of something is the part of it which normally faces towards the ground.
Example: ...the underside of the car.

Definition: If one thing is underneath another, it is directly under it, and may be covered or hidden by it.
Example: The device exploded underneath a van.

Definition: A centre is a building where people have meetings, take part in a particular activity, or get help of some kind.
Example: A large wooden table dominates the centre of the room.

Definition: The essence of something is its basic and most important characteristic which gives it its individual identity.
Example:
The essence of consultation is to listen to, and take account of, the views of those
consulted.

Definition: Someone who is dishonourable is not honest and does things which you consider to be morally unacceptable.
Example: Mark had done nothing dishonourable.

Definition: Infamous people or things are well-known because of something bad.
Example: ...the infamous massacre of Indians at Wounded Knee.

Definition: You use firstly in speech or writing when you want to give a reason, make a point, or mention an item that will be followed by others connected with it.
Example:
The programme is behind schedule as a result, firstly, of increased costs, then of
technical problems.

Definition: If something is put on a particular footing, it is defined, established, or changed in a particular way, often so that it is able to develop or exist successfully.
Example: The new law will put official corruption on the same legal footing as treason.

Definition: A lavatory is the same as a toilet.
Example: ...the ladies' lavatory at the University of London.

Definition: A toilet is a large bowl with a seat, or a platform with a hole, which is connected to a water system and which you use when you want to get rid of urine or faeces from your body.
Example: She made Tina flush the pills down the toilet.

Definition: Artillery consists of large, powerful guns which are transported on wheels and used by an army.
Example: Using tanks and heavy artillery, they seized the town.

Definition: Ordnance refers to military supplies, especially weapons.
Example: ...a team clearing an area littered with unexploded ordnance.

Definition: A breed of a pet animal or farm animal is a particular type of it. For example, terriers are a breed of dog.
Example: ...rare breeds of cattle.

Definition: If a performer, performance, or activity entertains you, it amuses you, interests you, or gives you pleasure.
Example: ...games and ideas to entertain children.

Definition: If a government deports someone, usually someone who is not a citizen of that country, it sends them out of the country because they have committed a crime or because it believes they do not have the right to be there.
Example: ...a government decision earlier this month to deport all illegal immigrants.

Definition: A tack is a short nail with a broad, flat head, especially one that is used for fastening carpets to the floor.
Example: He had tacked this note to her door.

Definition: If something veers in a certain direction, it suddenly moves in that direction.
Example: The plane veered off the runway and careered through the perimeter fence.

Definition: If a vehicle or other moving thing swerves or if you swerve it, it suddenly changes direction, often in order to avoid hitting something.
Example: Drivers coming in the opposite direction swerved to avoid the crash.

Definition: If someone is battered, they are regularly hit and badly hurt by a member of their family or by their partner.
Example: ...evidence that the child was being battered.

Definition: If part of your body throbs, you feel a series of strong and usually painful beats there.
Example: His head throbbed.

Definition: Your pulse is the regular beating of blood through your body, which you can feel when you touch particular parts of your body, especially your wrist.
Example: Mahoney's pulse was racing, and he felt confused.

Definition: To ruin something means to severely harm, damage, or spoil it.
Example: Olivia was ruining her health through worry.

Definition: When a government or leader is overthrown, they are removed from power by force.
Example: That government was overthrown in a military coup three years ago.

Definition: If one player or team gives another one a thrashing, they defeat them easily or by a large score.
Example: Can the New Zealand bowlers fight back after their thrashing at Christchurch?

Definition: A tick is a written mark like a V: . It is used to show that something is correct or has been selected or dealt with.
Example: His exercise books were full of well deserved red ticks.

Definition: If you thump something, you hit it hard, usually with your fist.
Example: He thumped my shoulder affectionately, nearly knocking me over.

Definition: A bang is a sudden loud noise such as the noise of an explosion.
Example: I heard four or five loud bangs.

Definition: If you whisk someone or something somewhere, you take them or move them there quickly.
Example: He whisked her across the dance floor.

Definition:
If you fold something such as a piece of paper or cloth, you bend it so that one part covers
another part, often pressing the edge so that it stays in place.
Example: He folded the paper carefully.

Definition: If something such as a piece of cloth or paper flaps or if you flap it, it moves quickly up and down or from side to side.
Example: Grey sheets flapped on the clothes line.

Definition: If one player or team thrashes another in a game or contest, they defeat them easily or by a large score.
Example: The team thrashed their opponents 5-nil.

Definition: If something thin or light flutters, or if you flutter it, it moves up and down or from side to side with a lot of quick, light movements.
Example: Her chiffon skirt was fluttering in the night breeze.

Definition: If people agitate for something, they protest or take part in political activity in order to get it.
Example: The women who worked in these mills had begun to agitate for better conditions.

Definition: If you outdo someone, you are a lot more successful than they are at a particular activity.
Example: It was important for me to outdo them, to feel better than they were.

Definition: If you trounce someone in a competition or contest, you defeat them easily or by a large score.
Example: His team were trounced by Arsenal last Tuesday.

Definition: If something is superb, its quality is very good indeed.
Example: There is a superb 18-hole golf course 6 miles away.

Definition: If someone moves with grace, they move in a smooth, controlled, and attractive way.
Example: He went to the beautiful old Welsh dresser that graced this homely room.

Definition: A sensation is a physical feeling.
Example: Floating can be a very pleasant sensation.

Definition: A berth is a bed on a boat, train, or caravan.
Example: Goldring booked a berth on the first boat he could.

Definition: A heap of things is a pile of them, especially a pile arranged in a rather untidy way.
Example: ...a heap of bricks.

Definition: If you brew tea or coffee, you make it by pouring hot water over tea leaves or ground coffee.
Example: I'll get Venner to brew some tea.

Definition: Sooner is the comparative of soon.
Example: But she would sooner not talk about it.

Definition: When something commences or you commence it, it begins.
Example: The academic year commences at the beginning of October.

Definition: If you initiate something, you start it or cause it to happen.
Example: They wanted to initiate a discussion on economics.

Definition: If a condition or problem stems from something, it was caused originally by that thing.
Example: Much of the instability stems from the economic effects of the war.

Definition: a start; beginning (esp in the phrase from (or at) the outset)
Example: From the outset of this campaign we always said that if we only had one gun handed in, then it would be a success.

Definition: Animation is the process of making films in which drawings or puppets appear to move.
Example: The films are a mix of animation and full-length features.

Definition: A doctrine is a set of principles or beliefs, especially religious ones.
Example: ...the Marxist doctrine of perpetual revolution.

Definition: An ideology is a set of beliefs, especially the political beliefs on which people, parties, or countries base their actions.
Example: ...capitalist ideology.

Definition: A fellowship is a group of people that join together for a common purpose or interest.
Example: ...the National Schizophrenia Fellowship.

Definition: A strap is a narrow piece of leather, cloth, or other material. Straps are used to carry things, fasten things together, or to hold a piece of clothing in place.
Example: Nancy gripped the strap of her beach bag.

Definition: A sash is a long piece of cloth which people wear round their waist or over one shoulder, especially with formal or official clothes.
Example: She wore a white dress with a thin blue sash.

Definition: A loop is a curved or circular shape in something long, for example in a piece of string.
Example: Mrs. Morrell reached for a loop of garden hose.

Definition: If you punch someone or something, you hit them hard with your fist.
Example: After punching him on the chin she wound up hitting him over the head.

Definition: If a process stalls, or if someone or something stalls it, the process stops but may continue at a later time.
Example: They will try to stall the bill until the current session ends.

Definition: An inclination is a feeling that makes you want to act in a particular way.
Example: He had neither the time nor the inclination to think of other things.

Definition:
If you twist something, you turn it to make a spiral shape, for example by turning the two ends
of it in opposite directions.
Example: Her hands began to twist the handles of the bag she carried.

Definition: An arch is a structure that is curved at the top and is supported on either side by a pillar, post, or wall.
Example: Don't arch your back, keep your spine straight.

Definition: A curve is a smooth, gradually bending line, for example part of the edge of a circle.
Example: ...the curve of his lips.

Definition:
A hook is a bent piece of metal or plastic that is used for catching or holding things,
or for hanging things up.
Example: One of his jackets hung from a hook.

Definition:
When you bow to someone, you briefly bend your body towards them as a formal way of greeting them
or showing respect.
Example: They bowed low to Louis and hastened out of his way.

Definition: If you surrender, you stop fighting or resisting someone and agree that you have been beaten.
Example: He called on the rebels to surrender.

Definition: Neighbouring places or things are near other things of the same kind.
Example: Rwanda is to hold talks with leaders of neighbouring countries next week.

Definition: A gamble is a risky action or decision that you take in the hope of gaining money, success, or an advantage over other people.
Example: Yesterday, he named his cabinet and took a big gamble in the process.

Definition: If someone excels in something or excels at it, they are very good at doing it.
Example: Caine has always been an actor who excels in irony.

Definition: exceptional; extraordinary
Example: As it came across Raven's bow, its pi-lot threw the plane into a hard turn north, probably surpassing nine g's.

Definition: When your bank debits your account, money is taken from it and paid to someone else.
Example:
We will always confirm the revised amount to you in writing before debiting your
account.

Definition: An invoice is a document that lists goods that have been supplied or services that have been done, and says how much money you owe for them.
Example: We will then send you an invoice for the total course fees.

Definition: Banknotes are pieces of paper money.
Example: There will be no actual printing of banknotes.

Definition: If you advertise something such as a product, an event, or a job, you tell people about it online, in newspapers, on television, or on posters in order to encourage them to buy the product, go to the event, or apply for the job.
Example: The players can advertise baked beans, but not rugby boots.

Definition: If you consolidate something that you have, for example power or success, you strengthen it so that it becomes more effective or secure.
Example: The question is: will the junta consolidate its power by force?

Definition: having a strong commitment to an ideology, religion, etc
Example: In a committed relationship this isn't an issue.

Definition: You use fixed to describe something which stays the same and does not or cannot vary.
Example: They issue a fixed number of shares that trade publicly.

Definition: If you are  attached to someone or something, you like them very much.
Example: She is very attached to her family and friends.

Definition: If you say that a person is fated to do something, or that something is fated, you mean that it seems to have been decided by fate before it happens, and nothing can be done to avoid or change it.
Example: He was fated not to score.

Definition: If something is doomed to happen, or if you are doomed to a particular state, something unpleasant is certain to happen, and you can do nothing to prevent it.
Example: Their plans seemed doomed to failure.

Definition: Something that is trim is neat, tidy, and attractive.
Example: The neighbours' gardens were trim and neat.

Definition:
A fuse is a safety device in an electric plug or circuit. It contains a piece of wire which
melts when there is a fault so that the flow of electricity stops.
Example: The fuse blew as he pressed the button to start the motor.

Definition: If you say that someone or something is a nuisance, you mean that they annoy you or cause you a lot of problems.
Example: He could be a bit of a nuisance when he was drunk.

Definition: If someone or something causes inconvenience, they cause problems or difficulties.
Example: We apologize for any inconvenience caused during the repairs.

Definition: Confinement is the state of being forced to stay in a prison or another place which you cannot leave.
Example: She had been held in solitary confinement for four months.

Definition: Your ancestry is the fact that you are descended from certain people.
Example: ...a family who could trace their ancestry back to the sixteenth century.

Definition: A scrap of something is a very small piece or amount of it.
Example: A crumpled scrap of paper was found in her handbag.

Definition: If you nip somewhere, usually somewhere nearby, you go there quickly or for a short time.
Example: Should I nip out and get some groceries?

Definition: If you nibble food, you eat it by biting very small pieces of it, for example because you are not very hungry.
Example: He started to nibble his biscuit.

Definition: If a bird pecks at something or pecks something, it moves its beak forward quickly and bites at it.
Example: It was winter and the sparrows were pecking at whatever they could find.

Definition: If you munch food, you eat it by chewing it slowly, thoroughly, and rather noisily.
Example: Luke munched the chicken sandwiches.

Definition: If a plant, animal, or insect stings you, a sharp part of it, usually covered with poison, is pushed into your skin so that you feel a sharp pain.
Example: The nettles stung their legs.

Definition: If you prick something or prick holes in it, you make small holes in it with a sharp object such as a pin.
Example: Prick the potatoes and rub the skins with salt.

Definition: You can say that something takes effect when it starts to produce the results that are intended.
Example: The second injection should only have been given once the first drug had taken effect.

Definition: When you chill something or when it chills, you lower its temperature so that it becomes colder but does not freeze.
Example: Chill the fruit salad until serving time.

Definition: If you describe something as devastating, you are emphasizing that it is very harmful or damaging.
Example: The city took the full force of the devastating floods.

Definition: A tragic event or situation is extremely sad, usually because it involves death or suffering.
Example: It was just a tragic accident.

Definition: If a place is gloomy, it is almost dark so that you cannot see very well.
Example: Inside it's gloomy after all that sunshine.

Definition: Something that is depressing makes you feel sad and disappointed.
Example: Yesterday's unemployment figures were depressing.

Definition: A bruise is an injury which appears as a purple mark on your body, although the skin is not broken.
Example: How did you get that bruise on your cheek?

Definition: If someone is indicted for a crime, they are officially charged with it.
Example: He was later indicted on corruption charges.

Definition: A covering is a layer of something that protects or hides something else.
Example: Leave a thin covering of fat.

Definition: You can use madly to indicate that one person loves another a great deal.
Example: She has fallen madly in love with him.

Definition: A person who is prejudiced against someone has an unreasonable dislike of them. A person who is prejudiced in favour of someone has an unreasonable preference for them.
Example: I like to think I'm not prejudiced.

Definition: Wholesale is the activity of buying and selling goods in large quantities and therefore at cheaper prices, usually to shopkeepers who then sell them to the public. Compare retail.
Example: Warehouse clubs allow members to buy goods at wholesale prices.

Definition: Something that is implicit is expressed in an indirect way.
Example: This is seen as an implicit warning not to continue with military action.

Definition: If something obstructs a road or path, it blocks it, stopping people or vehicles getting past.
Example: Tractors and container lorries have completely obstructed the road.

Definition: If something or someone is obscure, they are unknown, or are known by only a few people.
Example: The origin of the custom is obscure.

Definition: If you interrupt someone who is speaking, you say or do something that causes them to stop.
Example: Turkin tapped him on the shoulder. 'Sorry to interrupt, Colonel.'.

Definition: A batch of things or people is a group of things or people of the same kind, especially a group that is dealt with at the same time or is sent to a particular place at the same time.
Example: ...the current batch of trainee priests.

Definition: A descent is a movement from a higher to a lower level or position.
Example: During their descent from the summit, a storm swept in.

Definition: A gust is a short, strong, sudden rush of wind.
Example: A gust of wind drove down the valley.

Definition: If someone puffs at a cigarette, cigar, or pipe, they smoke it.
Example: He lit a cigar and puffed at it twice.

Definition: When you exhale, you breathe out the air that is in your lungs.
Example: Hold your breath for a moment and exhale.

Definition: If someone is expelled from a school or organization, they are officially told to leave because they have behaved badly.
Example: More than five-thousand secondary school students have been expelled for cheating.

Definition: If something emits heat, light, gas, or a smell, it produces it and sends it out by means of a physical or chemical process.
Example: The new device emits a powerful circular column of light.

Definition: If you squander money, resources, or opportunities, you waste them.
Example: Hooker didn't squander his money on flashy cars or other vices.

Definition: If you spoil something, you prevent it from being successful or satisfactory.
Example: It's important not to let mistakes spoil your life.

Definition: If you botch something that you are doing, you do it badly or clumsily.
Example: It is a silly idea and he has botched it.

Definition: If something bursts or if you burst it, it suddenly breaks open or splits open and the air or other substance inside it comes out.
Example: The driver lost control when a tyre burst.

Definition: A puncture is a small hole in a car tyre or bicycle tyre that has been made by a sharp object.
Example: Somebody helped me mend the puncture.

Definition: A setback is an event that delays your progress or reverses some of the progress that you have made.
Example: The move represents a setback for the peace process.

Definition: If you are depressed, you are sad and feel that you cannot enjoy anything, because your situation is so difficult and unpleasant.
Example: He seemed somewhat depressed.

Definition: If you are unhappy, you are sad and depressed.
Example: Her marriage is in trouble and she is desperately unhappy.

Definition: If you describe something such as a joke, book, or film as smutty, you disapprove of it because it shows naked people or refers to sex in a rude or unpleasant way.
Example: ...smutty jokes.

Definition: If you describe something as obscene, you mean it offends you because it relates to sex or violence in a way that you think is unpleasant and shocking.
Example: I'm not prudish but I think these photographs are obscene.

Definition: A noticeboard is a board which is usually attached to a wall in order to display notices giving information about something.
Example: She added her name to the list on the noticeboard.

Definition: A plank is a long, flat, rectangular piece of wood.
Example: It was very strong, made of three solid planks of wood.

Definition: Timber is wood that is used for building houses and making furniture. You can also refer to trees that are grown for this purpose as timber.
Example: These Severn Valley woods have been exploited for timber since Saxon times.

Definition: A congress is a large meeting that is held to discuss ideas and policies.
Example: A lot has changed after the party congress.

Definition: If you  get on with someone, you like them and have a friendly relationship with them.
Example: The host fears the guests won't get on.

Definition: If you embark on something new, difficult, or exciting, you start doing it.
Example: He's embarking on a new career as a writer.

Definition: Someone's physique is the shape and size of their body.
Example: He has the physique and energy of a man half his age.

Definition: Your torso is the main part of your body, and does not include your head, arms, and legs.
Example: On the professor's desk at the front of the room was the upper torso and head of a man.

Definition: An expanse of something, usually sea, sky, or land, is a very large amount of it.
Example: ...a vast expanse of grassland.

Definition: Consistency is the quality or condition of being consistent.
Example: He scores goals with remarkable consistency.

Definition: The texture of something is the way that it feels when you touch it, for example how smooth or rough it is.
Example: Aloe Vera is used in moisturisers to give them a wonderfully silky texture.

Definition: Density is the extent to which something is filled or covered with people or things.
Example: ...a law which restricts the density of housing.

Definition: An explosive is a substance or device that can cause an explosion.
Example: ...one-hundred-and-fifty pounds of Semtex explosive.

Definition: If something is reserved for a particular person or purpose, it is kept specially for that person or purpose.
Example: A double room with a balcony overlooking the sea had been reserved for him.

Definition: A punt is a long boat with a flat bottom. You move the boat along by standing at one end and pushing a long pole against the bottom of the river.
Example: We punted up towards Grantchester and had a picnic in a meadow.

Definition: A frontier is a border between two countries.
Example: It wasn't difficult then to cross the frontier.

Definition: If one room, place, or object adjoins another, they are next to each other.
Example: Fields adjoined the garden and there were no neighbours.

Definition: A skirt is a piece of clothing that fastens at the waist and hangs down around the legs.
Example: We raced across a large field that skirted the slope of a hill.

Definition: Bound is the past tense and past participle of bind.
Example: There are bound to be price increases next year.

Definition: If you decorate something, you make it more attractive by adding things to it.
Example: He decorated his room with pictures of all his favorite sports figures.

Definition: If you say that someone is pestering you, you mean that they keep asking you to do something, or keep talking to you, and you find this annoying.
Example: I thought she'd stop pestering me, but it only seemed to make her worse.

Definition: A plague is a very infectious disease that spreads quickly and kills large numbers of people.
Example: A cholera plague had been killing many prisoners of war at the time.

Definition: If something irritates you, it keeps annoying you.
Example: Their attitude irritates me.

Definition: A flask is a bottle which you use for carrying drinks around with you.
Example: He took out a metal flask from a canvas bag.

Definition: A pitcher is a jug.
Example: ...a pitcher of iced water.

Definition: A carafe is a glass container in which you serve water or wine.
Example: He ordered a carafe of water.

Definition: People who are daring are willing to do or say things which are new or which might shock or anger other people.
Example: Bergit was probably more daring than I was.

Definition: When soldiers march somewhere, or when a commanding officer marches them somewhere, they walk there with very regular steps, as a group.
Example: A Scottish battalion was marching down the street.

Definition: a limit; boundary (esp in the phrase  know no bounds)
Example: Within these bounds, the novice is free to structure his own education.

Definition: The threshold of a building or room is the floor in the doorway, or the doorway itself.
Example: He stopped at the threshold of the bedroom.

Definition: A basin is a large or deep bowl that you use for holding liquids, or for mixing or storing food.
Example: Place the eggs and sugar in a large basin.

Definition: If you hurl something, you throw it violently and with a lot of force.
Example: Groups of angry youths hurled stones at police.

Definition: A stadium is a large sports ground with rows of seats all round it.
Example: ...a baseball stadium.

Definition: The trunk of a tree is the large main stem from which the branches grow.
Example: ...the gnarled trunk of a birch tree.

Definition: If you spar with someone, you box using fairly gentle blows instead of hitting your opponent hard, either when you are training or when you want to test how quickly your opponent reacts.
Example: With protective gear on you can spar with a partner.

Definition: A lad is a young man or boy.
Example: When I was a lad his age I would laugh at the strangest things.

Definition: You call someone sweetheart if you are very fond of them.
Example: Happy birthday, sweetheart.

Definition: A trademark is a name or symbol that a company uses on its products and that cannot legally be used by another company.
Example: ...the spiky punk hairdo that became his trademark.

Definition: The logo of a company or organization is the special design or way of writing its name that it puts on all its products, notepaper, or advertisements.
Example: logogram

Definition: A marque is the name of a famous company that makes motor vehicles, or the vehicles it produces.
Example: ...a marque long-associated with motor racing success, Alfa Romeo.

Definition: If someone or something is stigmatized, they are unfairly regarded by many people as being bad or having something to be ashamed of.
Example: Children in single-parent families must not be stigmatised.

Definition: A stamp or a postage stamp is a small piece of paper which you stick on an envelope or package before you post it to pay for the cost of the postage.
Example: ...a book of stamps.

Definition: If something shatters or is shattered, it breaks into a lot of small pieces.
Example: ...safety glass that won't shatter if it's broken.

Definition: A fracture is a slight crack or break in something, especially a bone.
Example: At least one-third of all women over ninety have sustained a hip fracture.

Definition: If a machine or a vehicle breaks down, it stops working.
Example: Their car broke down.

Definition: If a situation  goes wrong, it stops progressing in the way that you expected or intended, and becomes much worse.
Example: It all went horribly wrong.

Definition: When someone disobeys a person or an order, they deliberately do not do what they have been told to do.
Example: ...a naughty boy who often disobeyed his mother and father.

Definition: If you breach an agreement, a law, or a promise, you break it.
Example: The newspaper breached the code of conduct on privacy.

Definition: If you defy someone or something that is trying to make you behave in a particular way, you refuse to obey them and behave in that way.
Example: This was the first (and last) time that I dared to defy my mother.

Definition: If you weaken something or if it weakens, it becomes less strong or less powerful.
Example: The recession has weakened so many firms that many can no longer survive.

Definition: If you undermine something such as a feeling or a system, you make it less strong or less secure than it was before, often by a gradual process or by repeated efforts.
Example: Offering advice on each and every problem will undermine her feeling of being adult.

Definition: A tame animal or bird is one that is not afraid of humans.
Example: The deer never became tame; they would run away if you approached them.

Definition: If you suspend something, you delay it or stop it from happening for a while or until a decision is made about it.
Example: The union suspended strike action this week.

Definition: Your lashes are the hairs that grow on the edge of your upper and lower eyelids.
Example: Secure the anchor by lashing it to the rail.

Definition: If you decode a message that has been written or spoken in a code, you change it into ordinary language.
Example: All he had to do was decode it and pass it over.

Definition: If you hesitate, you do not speak or act for a short time, usually because you are uncertain, embarrassed, or worried about what you are going to say or do.
Example: The phone rang. Catherine hesitated, debating whether to answer it.

Definition: If you tremble, you shake slightly because you are frightened or cold.
Example: His mouth became dry, his eyes widened, and he began to tremble all over.

Definition: If something falters, it loses power or strength in an uneven way, or no longer makes much progress.
Example: Normal life is at a standstill, and the economy is faltering.

Definition: Inhalation is the process or act of breathing in, taking air and sometimes other substances into your lungs.
Example: ...a complete cycle of inhalation and exhalation.

Definition: A gasp is a short quick breath of air that you take in through your mouth, especially when you are surprised, shocked, or in pain.
Example: An audible gasp went round the court as the jury announced the verdict.

Definition: A hint is a suggestion about something that is made in an indirect way.
Example:
The Minister gave a strong hint that the government were thinking of introducing
tax concessions for mothers.

Definition: If you instil an idea or feeling in someone, especially over a period of time, you make them think it or feel it.
Example: They hope that their work will instil a sense of responsibility in children.

Definition: To inject someone with a substance such as a medicine means to put it into their body using a device with a needle called a syringe.
Example: His son was injected with strong drugs.

Definition: A span is the period of time between two dates or events during which something exists, functions, or happens.
Example: The batteries had a life span of six hours.

Definition: An aqueduct is a long bridge with many arches, which carries a water supply or a canal over a valley.
Example: ...an old Roman aqueduct.

Definition: If you reconcile two beliefs, facts, or demands that seem to be opposed or completely different, you find a way in which they can both be true or both be successful.
Example: It's difficult to reconcile the demands of my job and the desire to be a good father.

Definition: Something that is concise says everything that is necessary without using any unnecessary words.
Example: Burton's text is concise and informative.

Definition: Something that is to the point is relevant to the subject that you are discussing, or expressed neatly without wasting words or time.
Example: Mr. Baker was smiling and to the point.

Definition: If you refer to something in brief, you are referring to a shortened version of it with few details.
Example: ...and now sport in brief.

Definition: If you describe memories and descriptions as vivid, you mean that they are very clear and detailed.
Example:
People of my generation who lived through World War II have vivid memories of confusion
and incompetence.

Definition: Intellect is the ability to understand or deal with ideas and information.
Example: Do the emotions develop in parallel with the intellect?

Definition: great brightness; radiance
Example: He said:'It was a bit of individual brilliance for his goal.

Definition: If something sparkles, it is clear and bright and shines with a lot of very small points of light.
Example: The jewels on her fingers sparkled.

Definition: If you glare at someone, you look at them with an angry expression on your face.
Example: The old woman glared at him.

Definition: A person or animal that is intelligent has the ability to think, understand, and learn things quickly and well.
Example: Susan's a very bright and intelligent woman who knows her own mind.

Definition: Someone who is clever is intelligent and able to understand things easily or plan things well.
Example: He's a very clever man.

Definition: A knowing gesture or remark is one that shows that you understand something, for example the way that someone is feeling or what they really mean, even though it has not been mentioned directly.
Example: Ron gave her a knowing smile.

Definition: Sensible actions or decisions are good because they are based on reasons rather than emotions.
Example: It might be sensible to get a solicitor.

Definition: Someone who is cheerful is happy and shows this in their behaviour.
Example: They are both very cheerful in spite of their colds.

Definition: Someone or something that is promising seems likely to be very good or successful.
Example: A school has honoured one of its brightest and most promising former pupils.

Definition: Something that is encouraging gives people hope or confidence.
Example: There are encouraging signs of an artistic revival.

Definition: If you are alert, you are paying full attention to things around you and are able to deal with anything that might happen.
Example: We all have to stay alert.

Definition: The splendour of something is its beautiful and impressive appearance.
Example: The foreign ministers are meeting in the splendour of the Royal Palace.

Definition: Glamour is the quality of being more attractive, exciting, or interesting than ordinary people or things.
Example: ...the glamour of show biz.

Definition: If something such as a building or a piece of scenery has grandeur, it is impressive because of its size, its beauty, or its power.
Example: ...the grandeur and natural beauty of South America.

Definition: the quality of being magnificent
Example: `Nothing," Thopas replied, `I was just overcome by the magnificence of it all.
