Definition: A shining achievement or quality is a very good one which should be greatly admired.
Example: She is a shining example to us all.

Definition: Sparkling drinks are slightly fizzy.
Example: ...a glass of sparkling wine.

Definition: the condition of being bright
Example: The brightness of the light made no difference.

Definition: When a fire blazes, it burns strongly and brightly.
Example: Three people died as wreckage blazed, and rescuers fought to release trapped drivers.

Definition: If you fetch something or someone, you go and get them from the place where they are.
Example: Sylvia fetched a towel from the bathroom.

Definition: If there is an ample amount of something, there is enough of it and usually some extra.
Example: There'll be ample opportunity to relax, swim and soak up some sun.

Definition: A generous person gives more of something, especially money, than is usual or expected.
Example: German banks are more generous in their lending.

Definition: very much; enormously
Example: His progress has been hugely impressive given he has only been a manager for four seasons.

Definition: Vastly means to an extremely great degree or extent.
Example: The jury has heard two vastly different accounts of what happened.

Definition: If something is universally believed or accepted, it is believed or accepted by everyone with no disagreement.
Example: ...a universally accepted point of view.

Definition: If something written or spoken is vague, it does not explain or express things clearly.
Example: A lot of the talk was apparently vague and general.

Definition: If you describe something as straightforward, you approve of it because it is easy to do or understand.
Example: Disposable nappies are fairly straightforward to put on.

Definition: Someone who is bold is not afraid to do things which involve risk or danger.
Example: Amrita becomes a bold, daring rebel.

Definition: A ruined building or place has been very badly damaged or has gradually fallen down because no-one has taken care of it.
Example: ...a ruined church.

Definition: Something that is unsuccessful does not achieve what it was intended to achieve.
Example: His efforts were unsuccessful.

Definition: Something that is imperfect has faults and is not exactly as you would like it to be.
Example: We live in an imperfect world.

Definition: If you speak or do something in a halting way, you speak or do it slowly and with a lot of hesitation, usually because you are uncertain about what to say or do next.
Example: In a halting voice she said that she wished to make a statement.

Definition: To sear something means to burn its surface with a sudden intense heat.
Example: Grass fires have seared the land near the farming village of Basekhai.

Definition: Polish means belonging or relating to Poland, or to its people, language, or culture.
Example: The press conference was broadcast live on Polish television.

Definition: If you scrub something, you rub it hard in order to clean it, using a stiff brush and water.
Example: Surgeons began to scrub their hands and arms with soap and water before operating.

Definition: A confrontation is a dispute, fight, or battle between two groups of people.
Example: Confrontation with parents is a common reaction for adolescents.

Definition: A rendezvous is a meeting, often a secret one, that you have arranged with someone for a particular time and place.
Example: I had almost decided to keep my rendezvous with Tony.

Definition: the profit or return derived from a commercial transaction, investment, etc
Example: He had sold his parents ' house, and on the proceeds and the little income, he had managed to go to Oxford.

Definition: If you thwart someone or thwart their plans, you prevent them from doing or getting what they want.
Example: The accounting firm deliberately destroyed documents to thwart government investigators.

Definition: Something that is inexpensive does not cost very much.
Example: ...a variety of good inexpensive restaurants.

Definition: Something that is a bargain is good value for money, usually because it has been sold at a lower price than normal.
Example: At this price the wine is a bargain.

Definition: Architecture is the art of planning, designing, and constructing buildings.
Example: He studied classical architecture and design in Rome.

Definition: If a man has an erection, his penis is stiff, swollen, and sticking up because he is sexually aroused.
Example: ...the erection of temporary fencing to protect hedges under repair.

Definition: A projectile is an object that is fired from a gun or other weapon.
Example: projectile force

Definition: A bouquet is a bunch of flowers which is attractively arranged.
Example: The woman carried a bouquet of dried violets.

Definition: Spray is a lot of small drops of water which are being thrown into the air.
Example: The moon was casting a rainbow through the spray from the waterfall.

Definition:
A garland is a circular decoration made from flowers and leaves. People sometimes wear garlands of flowers on their
heads or around their necks.
Example: They wore garlands of summer flowers in their hair.

Definition: A wreath is an arrangement of flowers and leaves, usually in the shape of a circle, which you put on a grave or by a statue to show that you remember a person who has died or people who have died.
Example: The coffin lying before the altar was bare, except for a single wreath of white roses.

Definition: A clump of things such as trees or plants is a small group of them growing together.
Example: ...a clump of trees bordering a side road.

Definition: A bundle of things is a number of them that are tied together or wrapped in a cloth or bag so that they can be carried or stored.
Example:
She produced a bundle of notes and proceeded to count out one hundred and ninety-five
pounds.

Definition: Wrinkles are lines which form on someone's face as they grow old.
Example: His face was covered with wrinkles.

Definition: A pleat in a piece of clothing is a permanent fold that is made in the cloth by folding one part over the other and sewing across the top end of the fold.
Example: Pin fabric pleats together at each side.

Definition: If you ruffle someone's hair, you move your hand backwards and forwards through it as a way of showing your affection towards them.
Example: 'Don't let that get you down,' he said ruffling Ben's dark curls.

Definition: A pressing problem, need, or issue has to be dealt with immediately.
Example: It is one of the most pressing problems facing this country.

Definition: Blazing sun or blazing hot weather is very hot.
Example: Quite a few people were eating outside in the blazing sun.

Definition: Flaming is used to describe something that is burning and producing a lot of flames.
Example: The plane, which was full of fuel, scattered flaming fragments over a large area.

Definition: If you describe something as fiery, you mean that it is burning strongly or contains fire.
Example: A helicopter crashed in a fiery explosion in Vallejo.

Definition: To scorch something means to burn it slightly.
Example: The bomb scorched the side of the building.

Definition: Toast is bread which has been cut into slices and made brown and crisp by cooking at a high temperature.
Example: ...a piece of toast.

Definition: If food chars or if you char it, it burns slightly and turns black as it is cooking.
Example: Toast hazelnuts on a baking sheet until the skins char.

Definition: A glow is a dull, steady light, for example the light produced by a fire when there are no flames.
Example: ...the cigarette's red glow.

Definition: When you blush, your face becomes redder than usual because you are ashamed or embarrassed.
Example: 'Hello, Maria,' he said, and she blushed again.

Definition: If you flush, your face goes red because you are hot or ill, or because you are feeling a strong emotion such as embarrassment or anger.
Example: Do you sweat a lot or flush a lot?

Definition:
The colour of something is the appearance that it has as a result of the way in which it reflects
light. Red, blue, and green are colours.
Example: 'What colour is the car?''Red.'

Definition: When a dead person is interred, they are buried.
Example: ...the spot where his bones were originally interred.

Definition: If something is entombed, it is buried or permanently trapped by something.
Example: The city was entombed in volcanic lava.

Definition: A sepulchre is a building or room in which a dead person is buried.
If you conceal something, you cover it or hide it carefully.
Example: Frances decided to conceal the machine behind a hinged panel.

Definition: If an object embeds itself in a substance or thing, it becomes fixed there firmly and deeply.
Example:
The bullet blew off the tip of his forefinger before embedding itself in the wall
beside Williams' head.

Definition: If you immerse yourself in something that you are doing, you become completely involved in it.
Example: Since then I've lived alone and immersed myself in my career.

Definition: If something enfolds an object or person, they cover, surround, or are wrapped around that object or person.
Example: Aurora felt the opium haze enfold her.

Definition: To implant something into a person's body means to put it there, usually by means of a medical operation.
Example: He had implanted a laboratory-grown windpipe into a man stricken by throat cancer.

Definition: the act of offering something for sale
Example: Selling tickets would allow members to bring guests knowing there would be seats available for them.

Definition: A calling is a profession or career which someone is strongly attracted to, especially one which involves helping other people.
Example: He was a consultant physician, a serious man dedicated to his calling.

Definition: A hectic situation is one that is very busy and involves a lot of rushed activity.
Example: Despite his hectic work schedule, Benny has rarely suffered poor health.

Definition: If you describe something as tiring, you mean that it makes you tired so that you want to rest or sleep.
Example: It had been a long and tiring day.

Definition: If a place is crowded, it is full of people.
Example: He peered slowly around the small crowded room.

Definition: A place that is packed is very crowded.
Example: From 3.30 until 7pm, the shop is packed.

Definition: A fastening is something such as a clasp or zip that you use to fasten something and keep it shut.
Example: The sundress has a neat back zip fastening.

Definition: A clip is a small device, usually made of metal or plastic, that is specially shaped for holding things together.
Example: She took the clip out of her hair.

Definition: If a company or business person makes an acquisition, they buy another company or part of a company.
Example: ...the acquisition of a profitable paper recycling company.

Definition: When a liquid solidifies or is solidified, it changes into a solid.
Example: The thicker lava would have taken two weeks to solidify.

Definition: When something hardens or when you harden it, it becomes stiff or firm.
Example: Mould the mixture into shape while hot, before it hardens.

Definition: A rally is a large public meeting that is held in order to show support for something such as a political party.
Example: About three thousand people held a rally to mark international human rights day.

Definition: A crusade is a long and determined attempt to achieve something for a cause that you feel strongly about.
Example: Footballers launched an unprecedented crusade against racism on the terraces.

Definition: A tumour is a mass of diseased or abnormal cells that has grown in a person's or animal's body.
Example: The researchers hope the findings will increase treatment options because they can study recurring tumours to find out how they evolved.

Definition: A contender is someone who takes part in a competition.
Example:
Her trainer said yesterday that she would be a strong contender for a place in Britain's
Commonwealth squad.

Definition: An applicant for something such as a job or a place at a college is someone who makes a formal written request to be given it.
Example: There is no shortage of new applicants.

Definition: A nominee is someone who is nominated for a job, position, or award.
Example: His nominee for vice president was elected only after a second ballot.

Definition: A lid is the top of a box or other container which can be removed or raised when you want to open the container.
Example: A dull pain began to throb behind his lids.

Definition: Cork is a soft, light substance which forms the bark of a type of Mediterranean tree.
Example: ...cork floors.

Definition: A stopper is a piece of glass, plastic, or cork that fits into the top of a bottle or jar to close it.
Example: ...a bottle of colourless liquid sealed with a cork stopper.

Definition: If someone is accomplished at something, they are very good at it.
Example: She is an accomplished painter.

Definition: If you describe something as masterly, you admire it because it has been done extremely well or shows the highest level of ability and skill.
Example: Malcolm Hebden gives a masterly performance.

Definition: Someone who is qualified has passed the examinations that they need to pass in order to work in a particular profession.
Example: Demand has far outstripped supply of qualified teachers.

Definition: You can use skipper to refer to the captain of a ship or boat.
Example: ...the skipper of an English fishing boat.

Definition: To encapsulate particular facts or ideas means to represent all their most important aspects in a very small space or in a single object or event.
Example: A Wall Street Journal editorial encapsulated the views of many conservatives.

Definition: If you sum something up, you describe it as briefly as possible.
Example: One voter summed up the mood'Politicians have lost credibility,' he complained.

Definition: If you summarize something, you give a summary of it.
Example: Table 3.1 summarizes the information given above.

Definition: If something is preoccupying you, you are thinking about it a lot.
Example: Crime and the fear of crime preoccupy the community.

Definition: To invade a country means to enter it by force with an army.
Example: In autumn 1944 the allies invaded the Italian mainland at Anzio and Salerno.

Definition: Your pursuit of something is your attempts at achieving it. If you do something in pursuit of a particular result, you do it in order to achieve that result.
Example: ...a young man whose relentless pursuit of excellence is conducted with determination.

Definition: A thorough action or activity is one that is done very carefully and in a detailed way so that nothing is forgotten.
Example: We are making a thorough investigation.

Definition: Someone who is prudent is sensible and careful.
Example: It is always prudent to start any exercise programme gradually at first.

Definition: Someone who is sparing with something uses it or gives it only in very small quantities.
Example: I've not been sparing with the garlic.

Definition: Something that is economical does not require a lot of money to operate. For example a car that only uses a small amount of petrol is economical.
Example: ...plans to trade in their car for something smaller and more economical.

Definition: A canny person is clever and able to think quickly. You can also describe a person's behaviour as canny.
Example: He was far too canny to risk giving himself away.

Definition: To convey information or feelings means to cause them to be known or understood by someone.
Example: When I returned home, I tried to convey the wonder of this machine to my partner.

Definition: Transport refers to any vehicle that you can travel in or carry goods in.
Example: Have you got your own transport?

Definition: When radio and television programmes, computer data, or other electronic messages are transmitted, they are sent from one place to another, using wires, radio waves, or satellites.
Example: The game was transmitted live in Spain and Italy.

Definition: If one thing entails another, it involves it or causes it.
Example: Such a decision would entail a huge political risk.

Definition: A specimen is a single plant or animal which is an example of a particular species or type and is examined by scientists.
Example: 200,000 specimens of fungus are kept at the Komarov Botanical Institute.

Definition: A holder is someone who owns or has something.
Example: This season the club has had 73,500 season-ticket holders.

Definition: To bestow something on someone means to give or present it to them.
Example: The Queen has bestowed a knighthood on him.

Definition: A shed is a small building that is used for storing things such as garden tools.
Example: ...a garden shed.

Definition: A trap is a device which is placed somewhere or a hole which is dug somewhere in order to catch animals or birds.
Example: The locals were encouraged to trap and kill the birds.

Definition: If you snatch something or snatch at something, you take it or pull it away quickly.
Example: Mick snatched the cards from Archie's hand.

Definition: If you grip something, you take hold of it with your hand and continue to hold it firmly.
Example: She gripped the rope.

Definition: A snag is a small problem or disadvantage.
Example: A police clampdown on car thieves hit a snag when villains stole one of their cars.

Definition: A bolt is a long metal object which screws into a nut and is used to fasten things together.
Example:
The safety belt is easy to fit as there's no need to bolt it to seat belt anchorage
points.

Definition: If you haul something which is heavy or difficult to move, you move it using a lot of effort.
Example: A crane had to be used to haul the car out of the stream.

Definition: A grouping is a set of people or things that have something in common.
Example: There were two main political groupings pressing for independence.

Definition: A heading is the title of a piece of writing, which is written or printed at the top of the page.
Example: ...helpful chapter headings.

Definition: If you rejoice, you are very pleased about something and you show it in your behaviour.
Example: Garbo plays the Queen, rejoicing in the love she has found with Antonio.

Definition: If you say that people are carousing, you mean that they are behaving very noisily and drinking a lot of alcohol as they enjoy themselves.
Example: He's now more likely to be seen tending his garden than carousing with the stars.

Definition: A festival is an organized series of events such as musical concerts or drama productions.
Example: Numerous Umbrian towns hold their own summer festivals of music, theatre, and dance.

Definition: A gala is a special public celebration, entertainment, performance, or festival.
Example: ...a gala evening at the Royal Opera House.

Definition: If you achieve fame, you become very well-known.
Example: At the height of his fame, his every word was valued.

Definition: Glory is the fame and admiration that you gain by doing something impressive.
Example: Walsham had his moment of glory when he won a 20km race.

Definition: Known is the past participle of know.
Example: ...He was a known drug dealer.

Definition: A tether is a rope or chain which is used to tie an animal to a post or fence so that it can only move around within a small area.
Example: The officer dismounted, tethering his horse to a tree.

Definition: To confine something to a particular place or group means to prevent it from spreading beyond that place or group.
Example: Health officials have successfully confined the epidemic to the Tabatinga area.

Definition: Handcuffs are two metal rings which are joined together and can be locked round someone's wrists, usually by the police during an arrest.
Example: He was led away to jail in handcuffs.

Definition: If you describe a person's action as provocation or a provocation, you mean that it is a reason for someone else to react angrily, violently, or emotionally.
Example: He denies murder on the grounds of provocation.

Definition: If someone, especially a police officer, interrogates someone, they question them thoroughly for a long time in order to get some information from them.
Example: I interrogated everyone even slightly involved.

Definition: If someone accosts another person, especially a stranger, they stop them or go up to them and speak to them in a way that seems rude or threatening.
Example: A man had accosted me in the street.

Definition: The victor in a battle or contest is the person who wins.
Example: But this was a battle with no victors.

Definition:
A guardian is someone who has been legally appointed to look after the affairs of another person,
for example a child or someone who is mentally ill.
Example:
The National Party is lifting its profile as socially conservative guardian of traditional
values.

Definition: A patron is a person who supports and gives money to artists, writers, or musicians.
Example: Catherine the Great was a patron of the arts and sciences.

Definition: A backer is someone who helps or supports a project, organization, or person, often by giving or lending money.
Example: I was looking for a backer to assist me in the attempted buy-out.

Definition: The probability of something happening is how likely it is to happen, sometimes expressed as a fraction or a percentage.
Example: Without a transfusion, the victim's probability of dying was 100%.

Definition: An innovation is a new thing or a new method of doing something.
Example: The vegetarian burger was an innovation which was rapidly exported to Britain.

Definition: the act of modifying or the condition of being modified
Example: Could body modifications such as these soon become as ubiquitous as smartphones?

Definition: Conversion is the act or process of changing something into a different state or form.
Example: ...the conversion of disused rail lines into cycle routes.

Definition: If you swap something with someone, you give it to them and receive a different thing in exchange.
Example: Next week they will swap places and will repeat the switch weekly.

Definition: A duct is a pipe, tube, or channel which carries a liquid or gas.
Example: ...a big air duct in the ceiling.

Definition: Arteries are the tubes in your body that carry blood from your heart to the rest of your body. Compare vein.
Example: ...patients suffering from blocked arteries.

Definition: A groove is a deep line cut into a surface.
Example: Their wheels left grooves in the ground.

Definition: An assembly is a large group of people who meet regularly to make decisions or laws for a particular region or country.
Example: ...the campaign for the first free election to the National Assembly.

Definition: The people or things that make up something are the members or parts that form that thing.
Example: UK shoppers make up the largest percentage of foreign buyers.

Definition: If you have integrity, you are honest and firm in your moral principles.
Example: I have always regarded him as a man of integrity.

Definition: If you say that someone is eccentric, you mean that they behave in a strange way, and have habits or opinions that are different from those of most people.
Example: He is an eccentric character who likes wearing a beret and dark glasses.

Definition: A levy is a sum of money that you have to pay, for example as a tax to the government.
Example: ...an annual motorway levy on all drivers.

Definition: If you make an accusation against someone, you criticize them or express the belief that they have done something wrong.
Example: Kim rejects accusations that Country music is over-sentimental.

Definition: If you say that one thing is an indictment of another thing, you mean that it shows how bad the other thing is.
Example:
It's a sad indictment of society that police officers are regarded as easy targets
by thugs.

Definition: If a court or a group in authority impeaches a president or other senior official, it charges them with committing a crime which makes them unfit for office.
Example: ...an opposition move to impeach the President.

Definition: If something incriminates you, it suggests that you are responsible for something bad, especially a crime.
Example: He claimed that the drugs had been planted to incriminate him.

Definition: Custody is the legal right to keep and look after a child, especially the right given to a child's mother or father when they get divorced.
Example: I'm going to go to court to get custody of the children.

Definition: A ward is a room in a hospital which has beds for many people, often people who need similar treatment.
Example: A toddler was admitted to the emergency ward with a wound in his chest.

Definition: The pupils of a school are the children who go to it.
Example: Many secondary schools in Wales have over 1,000 pupils.

Definition: Your dependants are the people you support financially, such as your children.
Example: The British Legion raises funds to help ex-service personnel and their dependants.

Definition: A diagram is a simple drawing which consists mainly of lines and is used, for example, to explain how a machine works.
Example: ...a circuit diagram.

Definition: A blueprint for something is a plan or set of proposals that shows how it is expected to work.
Example: The country's president will offer delegates his blueprint for the country's future.

Definition: A graph is a mathematical diagram which shows the relationship between two or more sets of numbers or measurements.
Example: telegraph

Definition: If you delineate something such as an idea or situation, you describe it or define it, often in a lot of detail.
Example: Biography must to some extent delineate characters.

Definition: A sketch is a drawing that is done quickly without a lot of details. Artists often use sketches as a preparation for a more detailed painting or drawing.
Example: ...a sketch of a soldier by Orpen.

Definition: If you hunt for something or someone, you try to find them by searching carefully or thoroughly.
Example: A forensic team was hunting for clues.

Definition: A hound is a type of dog that is often used for hunting or racing.
Example: Newcomers are constantly hounding them for advice.

Definition: Something that is worthless is of no real value or use.
Example: The guarantee could be worthless if the firm goes out of business.

Definition: If you describe something as second-rate, you mean that it is of poor quality.
Example: ...second-rate restaurants.

Definition: the quality of being impudent
Example: Margot's very blue eyes flashed at this piece of impudence and she flushed.

Definition: A compound is an enclosed area of land that is used for a particular purpose.
Example: Police fired on them as they fled into the embassy compound.

Definition: A crate is a large box used for transporting or storing things.
Example: ...a pile of wooden crates.

Definition: Infancy is the period of your life when you are a very young child.
Example: ...minute details of Deborah's infancy.

Definition: A fragment of something is a small piece or part of it.
Example: ...fragments of metal in my shoulder.

Definition: Shavings are small very thin pieces of wood or other material which have been cut from a larger piece.
Example: The floor was covered with shavings from his wood carvings.

Definition: A flake is a small thin piece of something, especially one that has broken off a larger piece.
Example: ...flakes of paint.

Definition: If you scratch yourself, you rub your fingernails against your skin because it is itching.
Example: He scratched himself under his arm.

Definition: If someone nicks something, they steal it.
Example: He smashed a window to get in and nicked a load of silver cups.

Definition: A flaw in something such as a theory or argument is a mistake in it, which causes it to be less effective or valid.
Example: There were, however, a number of crucial flaws in his monetary theory.

Definition: You can refer to a level on a scale of measurement or achievement as a notch.
Example: Average earnings in the economy moved up another notch in August.

Definition: A gash is a long, deep cut in your skin or in the surface of something.
Example: There was an inch-long gash just above his right eye.

Definition: An assortment is a group of similar things that are of different sizes or colours or have different qualities.
Example: ...an assortment of cheese.

Definition: A temple is a building used for the worship of a god or gods, especially in the Buddhist and Hindu religions, and in ancient Greek and Roman times.
Example: ...a small Hindu temple.

Definition: A disc is a flat, circular shape or object.
Example: Most shredding machines are based on a revolving disc fitted with replaceable blades.

Definition: A spiral is a shape which winds round and round, with each curve above or outside the previous one.
Example: ...a spiral staircase.

Definition: If you say that one thing revolves around another thing, you mean that the second thing is the main feature or focus of the first thing.
Example: Since childhood, her life has revolved around tennis.

Definition: When something rotates or when you rotate it, it turns with a circular movement.
Example: The Earth rotates round the sun.

Definition: A metropolis is the largest, busiest, and most important city in a country or region.
Example: ...the bustling metropolis of Chengdu.

Definition: In Britain, a municipality is a city or town which is governed by its own locally-appointed officials. You can also refer to a city's or town's local government as a municipality.
Example: It was taken over by the municipality as offices after the war.

Definition: Courtesy is politeness, respect, and consideration for others.
Example: ...a gentleman who behaves with the utmost courtesy towards everyone he meets.

Definition: Tact is the ability to avoid upsetting or offending people by being careful not to say or do things that would hurt their feelings.
Example: On this occasion the press have not been intrusive and they have shown great tact.

Definition: a positive statement, usually made without an attempt at furnishing evidence
Example: They also challenge his assertion that the countries would be great friends after separation.

Definition:
To classify things means to divide them into groups or types so that things with similar characteristics
are in the same group.
Example: It is necessary initially to classify the headaches into certain types.

Definition: You can use lasting to describe a situation, result, or agreement that continues to exist or have an effect for a very long time.
Example: We are well on our way to a lasting peace.

Definition: permanent; lasting
Example: Historic houses have an enduring appeal for their owners.

Definition: An abiding feeling, memory, or interest is one that you have for a very long time.
Example: He has a genuine and abiding love of the craft.

Definition: Someone or something that is immortal is famous and likely to be remembered for a long time.
Example: ...the immortal Reverend Dr Spooner.

Definition: Something that is hygienic is clean and unlikely to cause illness.
Example: ...a white, clinical-looking kitchen that was easy to keep clean and hygienic.

Definition: Something that is sterile is completely clean and free from germs.
Example: He always made sure that any cuts were protected by sterile dressings.

Definition: To cleanse a place, person, or organization of something dirty, unpleasant, or evil means to make them free from it.
Example:
Straight after your last cigarette your body will begin to cleanse itself of tobacco
toxins.

Definition: A bath is a container, usually a long rectangular one, which you fill with water and sit in while you wash your body.
Example: In those days, only quite wealthy families had baths of their own.

Definition: A neat place, thing, or person is tidy and smart, and has everything in the correct place.
Example: So they left her in the neat little house, alone with her memories.

Definition: If you describe a person or thing as elegant, you mean that they are pleasing and graceful in appearance or style.
Example: Patricia looked beautiful and elegant as always.

Definition: Something that is comprehensible can be understood.
Example: He spoke abruptly, in barely comprehensible Arabic.

Definition: Something that is explicit is expressed or shown clearly and openly, without any attempt to hide anything.
Example: ...sexually explicit scenes in films and books.

Definition: If you describe someone as articulate, you mean that they are able to express their thoughts and ideas easily and well.
Example: She is an articulate young woman.

Definition: If you describe someone's behaviour or feelings as understandable, you think that they have reacted to a situation in a natural way or in the way you would expect.
Example: His unhappiness was understandable.

Definition: certainly or definitely; unquestionably
Example: There is undoubtedly a great deal of corruption in football.

Definition: You use evidently to say that something is obviously true, for example because you have seen evidence of it yourself.
Example: The man wore a bathrobe and had evidently just come from the bathroom.

Definition: If an object or substance is transparent, you can see through it.
Example: ...a sheet of transparent coloured plastic.

Definition: If a material is translucent, some light can pass through it.
Example: The building is roofed entirely with translucent corrugated plastic.

Definition: If you are untroubled by something, you are not affected or worried by it.
Example: She is untroubled by the fact that she didn't win.

Definition: If a report or investigation absolves someone from blame or responsibility, it formally states that he or she is not guilty or is not to blame.
Example: A police investigation yesterday absolved the police of all blame in the incident.

Definition: If someone is acquitted of a crime in a court of law, they are formally declared not to have committed the crime.
Example: Mr Ling was acquitted of disorderly behaviour by magistrates.

Definition: If a person or their decisions, actions, or ideas are vindicated, they are proved to be correct, after people have said that they were wrong.
Example: The director said he had been vindicated by the experts' report.

Definition: If a court, report, or person in authority exonerates someone, they officially say or show that that person is not responsible for something wrong or unpleasant that has happened.
Example: The official report basically exonerated everyone.

Definition: When you are describing the place where you are at the moment, or the place where you live, you can refer to it as your surroundings.
Example: Schumacher adapted effortlessly to his new surroundings.

Definition: If you clamber somewhere, you climb there with difficulty, usually using your hands as well as your feet.
Example: They clambered up the stone walls of a steeply terraced olive grove.

Definition: If you descend or if you descend a staircase, you move downwards from a higher to a lower level.
Example: Things are cooler and more damp as we descend to the cellar.

Definition: If you scramble over rocks or up a hill, you move quickly over them or up it using your hands to help you.
Example: Tourists were scrambling over the rocks looking for the perfect camera angle.

Definition: If you dismount from a horse or a bicycle, you get down from it.
Example: Emma dismounted and took her horse's bridle.

Definition: When you fasten something, you close it by means of buttons or a strap, or some other device. If something fastens with buttons or straps, you can close it in this way.
Example: She got quickly into her Mini and fastened the seat-belt.

Definition: If a factory or business  shuts down or if someone shuts it down, work there stops or it no longer trades as a business.
Example: Smaller contractors had been forced to shut down.

Definition: If something ceases, it stops happening or existing.
Example: At one o'clock the rain had ceased.

Definition: If you discontinue something that you have been doing regularly, you stop doing it.
Example: Do not discontinue the treatment without consulting your doctor.

Definition: If you clinch something you are trying to achieve, such as a business deal or victory in a contest, you succeed in obtaining it.
Example: Hibernian clinched the First Division title when they beat Hamilton 2-0.

Definition: You can refer to the last part of a book, story, play, or film as the ending, especially when you are considering the way that the story ends.
Example: The film has a Hollywood happy ending.

Definition: If you have an intimate friendship with someone, you know them very well and like them a lot.
Example: I discussed with my intimate friends whether I would immediately have a baby.

Definition: Someone who is loving feels or shows love to other people.
Example: Jim was a most loving husband and father.

Definition: Proximity to a place or person is nearness to that place or person.
Example: Part of the attraction is Darwin's proximity to Asia.

Definition: Intimacy between two people is a very close personal relationship between them.
Example: ...a means of achieving intimacy with another person.

Definition: Devotion is great love, affection, or admiration for someone.
Example: At first she was flattered by his devotion.

Definition: the state or quality of being thick
Example: three thicknesses of cloth

Definition: The accuracy of information or measurements is their quality of being true or correct, even in small details.
Example: We cannot guarantee the accuracy of these figures.

Definition: You say there is humidity when the air feels very heavy and damp.
Example: The heat and humidity were insufferable.

Definition: a heavy quality or state
Example: But she sighed not out of irritation, rather out of a heaviness of the heart.

Definition: the quality or state, or an instance, of being reticent; reserve
Example: His direct, cooperative manner came as a refreshing change after the sullen reticence of the previous few days.

Definition: Something that is noticeable is very obvious, so that it is easy to see, hear, or recognize.
Example:
It is noticeable that trees planted next to houses usually lean away from the house
wall.

Definition: In a competition, especially an election, if two or more competitors are  neck and neck, they are level with each other and have an equal chance of winning.
Example: The latest polls indicate that the two main parties are neck and neck.

Definition: If you say that something is imminent, especially something unpleasant, you mean it is almost certain to happen very soon.
Example: There appeared no imminent danger.

Definition: An impending event is one that is going to happen very soon.
Example: On the morning of the expedition I awoke with a feeling of impending disaster.

Definition: Mist consists of a large number of tiny drops of water in the air, which make it difficult to see very far.
Example: Thick mist made flying impossible.

Definition: When there is fog, there are tiny drops of water in the air which form a thick cloud and make it difficult to see things.
Example: The crash happened in thick fog.

Definition: Haze is light mist, caused by particles of water or dust in the air, which prevents you from seeing distant objects clearly. Haze often forms in hot weather.
Example: They vanished into the haze near the horizon.

Definition: Obscurity is the state of being known by only a few people.
Example:
Tom's showbiz career began when he was plucked from obscurity by director Stephen
Daldry.

Definition: When something made of cloth billows, it swells out and moves slowly in the wind.
Example: The curtains billowed in the breeze.

Definition: If you confuse two things, you get them mixed up, so that you think one of them is the other one.
Example: Great care is taken to avoid confusing the two types of projects.

Definition: If you distort a statement, fact, or idea, you report or represent it in an untrue way.
Example: The media distorts reality; categorises people as all good or all bad.

Definition: If something impairs something such as an ability or the way something works, it damages it or makes it worse.
Example: Consumption of alcohol impairs your ability to drive a car or operate machinery.

Definition: A disco is a place or event at which people dance to pop music.
Example: Fridays and Saturdays are regular disco nights.

Definition: A bat is a specially shaped piece of wood that is used for hitting the ball in baseball, softball, cricket, rounders, or table tennis.
Example: ...a baseball bat.

Definition: To bludgeon someone means to hit them several times with a heavy object.
Example: He broke into the old man's house and bludgeoned him with a hammer.

Definition: A gathering is a group of people meeting together for a particular purpose.
Example: His sardonic manner and good looks helped to make him sought-after at literary gatherings.

Definition: A cruise is a holiday during which you travel on a ship or boat and visit a number of places.
Example: He and his wife were planning to go on a world cruise.

Definition: Sails are large pieces of material attached to the mast of a ship. The wind blows against the sails and pushes the ship along.
Example: The white sails billow with the breezes they catch.

Definition: When something drifts somewhere, it is carried there by the movement of wind or water.
Example: We proceeded to drift on up the river.

Definition: Fur is the thick and usually soft hair that grows on the bodies of many mammals.
Example: This creature's fur is short, dense and silky.

Definition: Plaster is a smooth paste made of sand, lime, and water which goes hard when it dries. Plaster is used to cover walls and ceilings and is also used to make sculptures.
Example: There were huge cracks in the plaster, and the green shutters were faded.

Definition: If you smear a surface with an oily or sticky substance or smear the substance onto the surface, you spread a layer of the substance over the surface.
Example: My sister smeared herself with suntan oil and slept by the swimming pool.

Definition: A coating of a substance is a thin layer of it spread over a surface.
Example: Under the coating of dust and cobwebs, he discovered a fine French Louis XVI clock.

Definition: If something is overlaid with something else, it is covered by it.
Example: The floor was overlaid with rugs of oriental design.

Definition: Something that is chilly is unpleasantly cold.
Example: It was a chilly afternoon.

Definition: If you say that something is freezing or freezing cold, you are emphasizing that it is very cold.
Example: The cinema was freezing.

Definition: In a bitter argument or conflict, people argue very angrily or fight very fiercely.
Example: ...the scene of bitter fighting during the Second World War.

Definition: Frozen is the past participle of freeze.
Example: It was bitterly cold now and the ground was frozen hard.

Definition: If a part of your body is numb, you cannot feel anything there.
Example: He could feel his fingers growing numb at their tips.

Definition: to collapse or break down
Example: He wants the UK to follow Europe in forcing motorists to give way.

Definition: If a feeling or noise subsides, it becomes less strong or loud.
Example: The pain had subsided during the night.

Definition: A faint sound, colour, mark, feeling, or quality has very little strength or intensity.
Example: He became aware of the soft, faint sounds of water dripping.

Definition: If you  pass out, you faint or collapse.
Example: He felt sick and dizzy and then passed out.

Definition: If you  black out, you lose consciousness for a short time.
Example:
I could feel blood draining from my face. I wondered whether I was about to black
out.

Definition: When people assemble or when someone assembles them, they come together in a group, usually for a particular purpose such as a meeting.
Example: There wasn't even a convenient place for students to assemble between classes.

Definition: A compilation is a book, CD, or programme that contains many different items that have been gathered together, usually ones which have already appeared in other places.
Example: His latest album release is a compilation of his jazz works over the past decade.

Definition: An anthology is a collection of writings by different writers published together in one book.
Example: ...an anthology of poetry.

Definition: A donation is something which someone gives to a charity or other organization.
Example: Employees make regular donations to charity.

Definition: Alms are gifts of money, clothes, or food to poor people.
Example: Alms were distributed to those in need.

Definition: When people are united about something, they agree about it and act together.
Example: Every party is united on the need for parliamentary democracy.

Definition: An aggregate amount or score is made up of several smaller amounts or scores added together.
Example: The rate of growth of GNP will depend upon the rate of growth of aggregate demand.

Definition: A composite object or item is made up of several different things, parts, or substances.
Example: ...composite pictures with different faces superimposed over one another.

Definition: If a series of events have a cumulative effect, each event makes the effect greater.
Example:
Simple pleasures, such as a walk on a sunny day, have a cumulative effect on our
mood.

Definition: When two or more things, especially organizations, amalgamate or are amalgamated, they become one large thing.
Example: The firm has amalgamated with an American company.

Definition: If you  team up with someone, you join them in order to work together for a particular purpose. You can also say that two people or groups team up. [...]
If someone unifies different things or parts, or if the things or parts unify, they are brought together to form one thing.
Example:
A flexible retirement age is being considered by Ministers to unify men's and women's
pension rights.

Definition: Up-and-coming people are likely to be successful in the future.
Example: ...his readiness to share the limelight with young, up-and-coming stars.

Definition: If you use aspiring to describe someone who is starting a particular career, you mean that they are trying to become successful in it.
Example: Many aspiring young artists are advised to learn by copying the masters.

Definition: The advent of an important event, invention, or situation is the fact of it starting or coming into existence.
Example: ...the leap forward in communication made possible by the advent of the mobile phone.

Definition: Accession is the act of taking up a position as the ruler of a country.
Example: ...the 50th anniversary of the Queen's accession to the throne.

Definition: Luxury is very great comfort, especially among beautiful and expensive surroundings.
Example: By all accounts he leads a life of considerable luxury.

Definition: If you console someone who is unhappy about something, you try to make them feel more cheerful.
Example: 'Never mind, Ned,' he consoled me.

Definition: When people cheer, they shout loudly to show their approval or to encourage someone who is doing something such as taking part in a game.
Example: We all cheered as they drove up the street.

Definition: Something that is pleasant is nice, enjoyable, or attractive.
Example: I've got a pleasant little apartment.

Definition: If you describe a room or house as homely, you like it because you feel comfortable and relaxed there.
Example: I wanted a homely room but I wanted it to look smart, too.

Definition: Something that is relaxing is pleasant and helps you to relax.
Example: I find cooking very relaxing.

Definition: If you are at ease, you are feeling confident and relaxed, and are able to talk to people without feeling nervous or anxious. If you put someone at their ease, you make them feel at ease.
Example: It is essential to feel at ease with your therapist.

Definition: If you are contented, you are satisfied with your life or the situation you are in.
Example: Whenever he returns to this place he is happy and contented.

Definition: Someone who is well-off is rich enough to be able to do and buy most of the things that they want.
Example: My grandparents were quite well-off.

Definition: Prosperous people, places, and economies are rich and successful.
Example: ...the youngest son of a relatively prosperous British family.

Definition: If you are affluent, you have a lot of money.
Example: Today's affluent Indian tourists are also big spenders.

Definition: A well-to-do person is rich enough to be able to do and buy most of the things that they want.
Example: ...a rather well-to-do family of diamond cutters.

Definition: If you show mastery of a particular skill or language, you show that you have learned or understood it completely and have no difficulty using it.
Example: He doesn't have mastery of the basic rules of grammar.

Definition: Mercantile means relating to or involved in trade.
Example: ...the emergence of a new mercantile class.

Definition: A profitable organization or practice makes a profit.
Example: Improved transport turned agriculture into a highly profitable business.

Definition: sought after; popular
Example: The prediction is significant because forecasters have pencilled a huge increase in demand over the coming decades.

Definition: Something that is marketable is able to be sold because people want to buy it.
Example: ...telling them how to turn their prize research projects into marketable products.

Definition: If you describe a person or society as materialistic, you are critical of them because they attach too much importance to money and material possessions.
Example: During the 1980s, Britain became a very materialistic society.

Definition: A mercenary is a soldier who is paid to fight by a country or group that they do not belong to.
Example: What we don't want is a foreign mercenary.

Definition: If you describe someone as venal, you disapprove of them because they are prepared to do almost anything in return for money, even things which are dishonest or immoral.
Example: Government propaganda made the radicals appear at best deluded, at worst venal.

Definition: An advertisement is an announcement online, or in a newspaper, on television, or on a poster about something such as a product, event, or job.
Example: Miss Parrish recently placed an advertisement in the local newspaper.

Definition: To execute someone means to kill them as a punishment for a serious crime.
Example: He was executed by lethal injection earlier today.

Definition: You use dedicated to describe someone who enjoys a particular activity very much and spends a lot of time doing it.
Example: Her great-grandfather had clearly been a dedicated and stoical traveller.

Definition: Someone who is devoted to a person loves that person very much.
Example: ...a loving and devoted husband.

Definition: Someone who is loyal remains firm in their friendship or support for a person or thing.
Example: They had remained loyal to the president.

Definition: If you are intent on doing something, you are eager and determined to do it.
Example: The rebels are obviously intent on keeping up the pressure.

Definition: If someone is imprisoned, they are locked up or kept somewhere, usually in prison as a punishment for a crime or for political opposition.
Example: The local priest was imprisoned for 18 months on charges of anti-state agitation.

Definition: To consign something or someone to a place or situation where they will be forgotten or do not want to be means to put them there.
Example: For decades, many of his works were consigned to the basements of museums.

Definition: A dedication is a message which is written at the beginning of a book, or a short announcement which is sometimes made before a play or piece of music is performed, as a sign of affection or respect for someone.
Example: Their dedication, hard work and determination made the world proud.

Definition: Loyalty is the quality of staying firm in your friendship or support for someone or something.
Example: I have sworn an oath of loyalty to the monarchy.

Definition: Adherence is the fact of adhering to a particular rule, agreement, or belief.
Example: ...strict adherence to the constitution.

Definition: When someone makes a pledge, they make a serious promise that they will do something.
Example:
The meeting ended with a pledge to step up cooperation between the six states of
the region.

Definition: An undertaking is a task or job, especially a large or difficult one.
Example: Organizing the show has been a massive undertaking.

Definition: A delegation is a group of people who have been sent somewhere to have talks with other people on behalf of a larger group of people.
Example: ...a delegation from Somaliland.

Definition: If you describe something as vulgar, you think it is in bad taste or of poor artistic quality.
Example: I think it's a very vulgar house.

Definition: Coarse things have a rough texture because they consist of thick threads or large pieces.
Example: ...a jacket made of very coarse cloth.

Definition:
The circulation of a newspaper or magazine is the number of copies that are sold each time it is
produced.
Example: The Daily News once had the highest circulation of any daily in the country.

Definition: The transmission of something is the passing or sending of it to a different person or place.
Example: ...the possible risk for blood-borne disease transmission.

Definition: A squad is a section of a police force that is responsible for dealing with a particular type of crime.
Example: The building was evacuated and the bomb squad called.

Definition: Companionship is having someone you know and like with you, rather than being on your own.
Example: I depended on his companionship and on his judgment.

Definition: the act, process, or result of differentiating
Example: Information systems may be a key element in competitive differentiation.

Definition: The juxtaposition of two contrasting objects, images, or ideas is the fact that they are placed together or described together, so that the differences between them are emphasized.
Example: This juxtaposition of brutal reality and lyrical beauty runs through Park's stories.

Definition: If you make or draw an analogy between two things, you show that they are similar in some way.
Example: Once again, Hockett draws an analogy with American football.

Definition: If there is a resemblance between two people or things, they are similar to each other.
Example: There was a remarkable resemblance between him and Pete.

Definition: A correlation between things is a connection or link between them.
Example: ...the correlation between smoking and disease.

Definition: If you have to contend with a problem or difficulty, you have to deal with it or overcome it.
Example: It is time, once again, to contend with racism.

Definition: Your rival is a person, business, or organization who you are competing or fighting against in the same area or for the same things.
Example: The world champion finished more than two seconds ahead of his nearest rival.

Definition: If one person or thing is vying with another for something, the people or things are competing for it.
Example:
California is vying with other states to capture a piece of the growing communications
market.

Definition: Rivalry is competition or fighting between people, businesses, or organizations who are in the same area or want the same things.
Example: ...the rivalry between the Inkatha and the ANC.

Definition: Someone who is ambitious has a strong desire to be successful, rich, or powerful.
Example: Chris is so ambitious, so determined to do it all.

Definition: If you say that someone is pushing a particular age, you mean that they are nearly that age.
Example: Pushing 40, he was an ageing rock star.

Definition: Your adversary is someone you are competing with, or arguing or fighting against.
Example: Elliott crossed the finish line just half a second behind his adversary.

Definition: A contestant in a competition or quiz is a person who takes part in it.
Example: There are lots of contestants on reality shows but few of them make an impact.

Definition: If you make or raise an objection to something, you say that you do not like it or agree with it.
Example: Some managers have recently raised objections to the PFA handling these negotiations.

Definition: If you have a grievance about something that has happened or been done, you believe that it was unfair.
Example: They had a legitimate grievance.

Definition: You use wholly to emphasize the extent or degree to which something is the case.
Example:
While the two are only days apart in age they seem to belong to wholly different
generations.

Definition: You use utterly to emphasize that something is very great in extent, degree, or amount.
Example: Everything about the country seemed utterly different from what I'd experienced before.

Definition: Someone who is  finished with something is no longer doing it or dealing with it or is no longer interested in it.
Example: One suspects he will be finished with boxing.

Definition: Done is the past participle of do1.
Example: When her deal is done, the client emerges with her purchase.

Definition: Mixed feelings or reactions include some good things and some bad things.
Example: I came home from the meeting with mixed feelings.

Definition: If you say that someone has an obsession with a person or thing, you think they are spending too much time thinking about them.
Example: She would try to forget her obsession with Christopher.

Definition: If you have a preoccupation with something or someone, you keep thinking about them because they are important to you.
Example: Karouzos's poetry shows a profound preoccupation with the Orthodox Church.

Definition: A phobia is a very strong irrational fear or hatred of something.
Example: The man had a phobia about flying.

Definition: If you accuse a person of having a fixation on something or someone, you mean they think about a particular subject or person to an extreme and excessive degree.
Example: The country's fixation on the war may delay a serious examination of domestic needs.

Definition: You use troublesome to describe something or someone that causes annoying problems or difficulties.
Example: He needed surgery to cure a troublesome back injury.

Definition: A constituent is someone who lives in a particular constituency, especially someone who is able to vote in an election.
Example: Caffeine is the active constituent of drinks such as tea and coffee.

Definition: The inherent qualities of something are the necessary and natural parts of it.
Example: Stress is an inherent part of dieting.

Definition: If something has intrinsic value or intrinsic interest, it is valuable or interesting because of its basic nature or character, and not because of its connection with other things.
Example: The paintings have no intrinsic value except as curiosities.

Definition: If you say that something comprises or is comprised of a number of things or people, you mean it has them as its parts or members.
Example: MCC's main committee comprises 18 members.

Definition: The making of something is the act or process of producing or creating it.
Example: ...Salamon's book about the making of this movie.

Definition: The convergence of different ideas, groups, or societies is the process by which they stop being different and become more similar.
Example: ...the need to move towards greater economic convergence.

Definition: Distress is a state of extreme sorrow, suffering, or pain.
Example: Jealousy causes distress and painful emotions.

Definition: If you disturb someone, you interrupt what they are doing and upset them.
Example: I hope I'm not disturbing you.

Definition: If someone is caring, they are affectionate, helpful, and sympathetic.
Example: He is a lovely boy, very gentle and caring.

Definition: If you are attentive, you are paying close attention to what is being said or done.
Example: The vast majority of the attentive audience applauded these sentiments.

Definition: A person who is solicitous shows anxious concern for someone or something.
Example: He was so solicitous of his guests.

Definition: A rider is someone who rides a horse, a bicycle, or a motorcycle as a hobby or job. You can also refer to someone who is riding a horse, a bicycle, or a motorcycle as a rider.
Example: She is a very good and experienced rider.

Definition: An ailment is an illness, especially one that is not very serious.
Example: The pharmacist can assist you with the treatment of common ailments.

Definition: If you have a weakness for something, you like it very much, although this is perhaps surprising or undesirable.
Example: Stephen himself had a weakness for cats.

Definition: Seasoning is salt, pepper, or other spices that are added to food to improve its flavour.
Example: Mix the meat with the onion, carrot, and some seasoning.

Definition: To nourish a person, animal, or plant means to provide them with the food that is necessary for life, growth, and good health.
Example: The food she eats nourishes both her and the baby.

Definition: the act or an instance of picking up, turning over, or touching something
Example: A police watchdog is probing 17 officers over the handling of the case.

Definition: An escort is a person who travels with someone in order to protect or guard them.
Example: He arrived with a police escort shortly before half past nine.

Definition: Your dependence on something or someone is your need for them in order to succeed or be able to survive.
Example: ...the city's traditional dependence on tourism.

Definition: Someone who has self-assurance shows confidence in the things that they say and do because they are sure of their abilities.
Example: Your quiet self-assurance can open new job doors.

Definition: If you give someone an assurance that something is true or will happen, you say that it is definitely true or will definitely happen, in order to make them feel less worried.
Example: He would like an assurance that other forces will not move into the territory.

Definition: If you do something with aplomb, you do it with confidence in a relaxed way.
Example: The whole cast executed the production with truly professional aplomb.

Definition: Someone who is self-assured shows confidence in what they say and do because they are sure of their own abilities.
Example: He's a self-assured, confident negotiator.

Definition: Someone who is assured is very confident and relaxed.
Example: He was infinitely more assured than in his more recent parliamentary appearances.

Definition: establishment of the correctness of a theory, fact, etc
Example: A Government spokesman said age verification would be compulsory.

Definition: If you affirm that something is true or that something exists, you state firmly and publicly that it is true or exists.
Example: The courts have affirmed that the act can be applied to social media.

Definition: the act of affirming or the state of being affirmed
Example: It is therefore important that the affirmation be a positive one.

Definition: Acceptance of an offer or a proposal is the act of saying yes to it or agreeing to it.
Example: The Party is being degraded by its acceptance of secret donations.

Definition: An endorsement is a statement or action which shows that you support or approve of something or someone.
Example: That adds up to an endorsement of the status quo.

Definition: Hostility is unfriendly or aggressive behaviour towards people or ideas.
Example: ...the age-old hostility towards all things English.

Definition: Strife is strong disagreement or fighting.
Example: Money is a major cause of strife in many marriages.

Definition: Bewilderment is the feeling of being bewildered.
Example: He shook his head in bewilderment.

Definition: Uncertainty is a state of doubt about the future or about what is the right thing to do.
Example: ...a period of political uncertainty.

Definition: Puzzlement is the confusion that you feel when you do not understand something.
Example: He frowned in puzzlement.

Definition: Chaos is a state of complete disorder and confusion.
Example: The world's first transatlantic balloon race ended in chaos last night.

Definition: Turmoil is a state of confusion, disorder, uncertainty, or great anxiety.
Example: ...the political turmoil of 1989.

Definition: An upheaval is a big change which causes a lot of trouble, confusion, and worry.
Example: Wherever there is political upheaval, invariably there are refugees.

Definition: Perplexity is a feeling of being confused and frustrated because you do not understand something.
Example: He began counting them and then, with growing perplexity, counted them a second time.

Definition: A junction is a place where roads or railway lines join.
Example: Follow the road to a junction and turn left.

Definition: Sensibility is the ability to experience deep feelings.
Example: Everything he writes demonstrates the depth of his sensibility.

Definition: When there is unanimity among a group of people, they all agree about something or all vote for the same thing.
Example: All decisions would require unanimity.

Definition: If an action or event has repercussions, it causes unpleasant things to happen some time after the original action or event.
Example: It was an effort which was to have painful repercussions.

Definition: If you describe someone as guarded, you mean that they are careful not to show their feelings or give away information.
Example: The boy gave him a guarded look.

Definition: Kindness is the quality of being gentle, caring, and helpful.
Example: We have been treated with such kindness by everybody.

Definition: If things, for example systems, ideas, and beliefs, are compatible, they work well together or can exist together successfully.
Example: Free enterprise, he argued, was compatible with Russian values and traditions.

Definition: A harmonious relationship, agreement, or discussion is friendly and peaceful.
Example: Their harmonious relationship resulted in part from their similar goals.

Definition: If something invariably happens or is invariably true, it always happens or is always true.
Example: They almost invariably get it wrong.

Definition: To embody an idea or quality means to be a symbol or expression of that idea or quality.
Example: Jack Kennedy embodied all the hopes of the 1960s.

Definition: An edifice is a large and impressive building.
Example: The American consulate was a magnificent edifice in the centre of Bordeaux.

Definition: a person who buys goods in a shop
Example: Three in ten canny shoppers use coupons and vouchers to keep the costs down.

Definition: If a place or object is enclosed by something, the place or object is inside that thing or completely surrounded by it.
Example: The rules state that samples must be enclosed in two watertight containers.

Definition: If you curb something, you control it and keep it within limits.
Example: ...advertisements aimed at curbing the spread of the disease.

Definition: Concurrent events or situations happen at the same time.
Example: Galerie St. Etienne is holding three concurrent exhibitions.

Definition: If you are satisfied with something, you are happy because you have got what you wanted or needed.
Example: We are not satisfied with these results.

Definition: If you are pleased, you are happy about something or satisfied with something.
Example: Felicity seemed pleased at the suggestion.

Definition: A rsum is a short account, either spoken or written, of something that has happened or that someone has said or written.
Example: I will leave with you a resum of his most recent speech.

Definition: If a part of your body, especially your throat, is constricted or if it constricts, something causes it to become narrower.
Example: Severe migraine can be treated with a drug which constricts the blood vessels.

Definition: If you tighten your grip on something, or if your grip tightens, you hold the thing more firmly or securely.
Example: Luke answered by tightening his grip on her shoulder.

Definition: If you shorten an event or the length of time that something lasts, or if it shortens, it does not last as long as it would otherwise do or as it used to do.
Example: Smoking can shorten your life.

Definition: If you differentiate between things or if you differentiate one thing from another, you recognize or show the difference between them.
Example: A child may not differentiate between his imagination and the real world.

Definition: If you donate something to a charity or other organization, you give it to them.
Example: He frequently donates large sums to charity.

Definition: A donor is someone who gives a part of their body or some of their blood to be used by doctors to help a person who is ill.
Example: Doctors removed the healthy kidney from the donor.

Definition: A magazine's or a newspaper's subscribers are the people who pay to receive copies of it regularly.
Example: I have been a subscriber to Railway Magazine for many years.

Definition: An offering is something that is specially produced to be sold.
Example: It was very, very good, far better than vegetarian offerings in many a posh restaurant.

Definition: Self-discipline is the ability to control yourself and to make yourself work hard or behave in a particular way without needing anyone else to tell you what to do.
Example: Exercising at home alone requires a tremendous amount of self-discipline.

Definition: If you show self-restraint, you do not do something even though you would like to do it, because you think it would be better not to.
Example: We honor self-restraint, often to the point of harboring demons, and are fierce in defense of our privacy.

Definition: If you delimit something, you fix or establish its limits.
Example: This is not meant to delimit what approaches social researchers can adopt.

Definition: A contentious issue causes a lot of disagreement or arguments.
Example: Sanctions are expected to be among the most contentious issues.

Definition: To reorganize something or to reorganize means to change the way in which something is organized, arranged, or done.
Example: It is the mother who is expected to reorganize her busy schedule.

Definition: If you are someone's disciple, you are influenced by their teachings and try to follow their example.
Example: ...a disciple of Freud.

Definition: a person newly converted to a religious faith or sect; a convert, esp a gentile converted to Judaism
Example: Traditionally, the proselyte wears a white jumpsuit, white socks and white underclothing.

Definition: The ruling group of people in a country or organization is the group that controls its affairs.
Example: ...the Mexican voters' growing dissatisfaction with the ruling party.

Definition: In a court of law, the verdict is the decision that is given by the jury or judge at the end of a trial.
Example: The jury returned a unanimous guilty verdict.

Definition: You say that something is refreshing when it is pleasantly different from what you are used to.
Example: It's refreshing to hear somebody speaking common sense.

Definition: Audacity is audacious behaviour.
Example: I was shocked at the audacity and brazenness of the gangsters.

Definition: The sophistication of machines or methods is their quality of being more advanced or complex than others.
Example: ...the sophistication of one of the world's richest cities.

Definition: dignified grace in appearance, movement, or behaviour
Example: He had dark curls to his shoulders and he struck me as the epitome of male grace and elegance.

Definition: If someone has poise, they are calm, dignified, and self-controlled.
Example: What amazed him even more than her appearance was her poise.

Definition: the quality of being urbane
Example: He lacked Wayne's urbanity, but he was more restful than Wayne, more reminiscent of her own kind.

Definition: If something lessens or you lessen it, it becomes smaller in size, amount, degree, or importance.
Example: As time went on, her anxiety lessened.

Definition: If something bad or undesirable abates, it becomes much less strong or severe.
Example: The storms had abated by the time they rounded Cape Horn.

Definition: A calm person does not show or feel any worry, anger, or excitement.
Example: She is usually a calm and diplomatic woman.

Definition: An author's collected works or letters are all their works or letters published in one book or in a set of books.
Example: ...the collected works of Rudyard Kipling.

Definition: If you are relaxed, you are calm and not worried or tense.
Example: As soon as I had made the final decision, I felt a lot more relaxed.

Definition: Composure is the appearance or feeling of calm and the ability to control your feelings.
Example:
For once Dimbleby lost his composure. It was all he could do to stop tears of mirth
falling down his cheeks.

Definition: Self-control is the ability to not show your feelings or not do the things that your feelings make you want to do.
Example: His self-control, reserve and aloofness were almost inhuman.

Definition: lacking in enthusiasm
Example: Nathan's friends were unenthusiastic, but the prospect of Bartlemy's cooking overcame their resistance.

Definition: If you accuse someone of being indifferent to something, you mean that they have a complete lack of interest in it.
Example: People have become indifferent to the suffering of others.

Definition: Something, especially a liquid, that is lukewarm is only slightly warm.
Example: Wash your face with lukewarm water.

Definition: If you are uninterested in something or someone, you do not want to know any more about them, because you think they have no special or exciting qualities.
Example: I was so uninterested in the result that I didn't even bother to look at it.

Definition: If you accuse someone of indifference to something, you mean that they have a complete lack of interest in it.
Example: ...his callous indifference to the plight of his son.

Definition: Something or someone that is fashionable is popular or approved of at a particular time.
Example: It became fashionable to eat certain kinds of fish.

Definition: Someone or something that is stylish is smart, elegant, and fashionable.
Example: ...a very attractive and very stylish woman of 27.

Definition: A reproduction is a copy of something such as a piece of furniture or a work of art.
Example: ...a reproduction of a popular religious painting.

Definition: If you duplicate something that has already been done, you repeat or copy it.
Example: His task will be to duplicate his success overseas here at home.

Definition: A photocopy is a copy of a document made using a photocopier.
Example: Staff photocopied the cheque before cashing it.

Definition: If you try to reproduce something, you try to copy it.
Example: I shall not try to reproduce the policemen's English.

Definition: If you replicate someone's experiment, work, or research, you do it yourself in exactly the same way.
Example: He invited her to his laboratory to see if she could replicate the experiment.

Definition: The nucleus of an atom or cell is the central part of it.
Example: Neutrons and protons are bound together in the nucleus of an atom.

Definition: The kernel of a nut is the part that is inside the shell.
Example: The kernel of the film is James Franco's relationship with his ill father.

Definition:
If you say that someone monopolizes something, you mean that they have a very large share of it and prevent other people
from having a share.
Example: They are controlling so much cocoa that they are virtually monopolizing the market.

Definition: If you do something with precision, you do it exactly as it should be done.
Example: The choir sang with precision.

Definition: Exactitude is the quality of being very accurate and careful.
Example: ...the precision and exactitude of current genetic mapping.

Definition: Decorum is behaviour that people consider to be correct, polite, and respectable.
Example: I was treated with decorum and respect throughout the investigation.

Definition: Propriety is the quality of being socially or morally acceptable.
Example: Their sense of social propriety is eroded.

Definition: politeness or courtesy, esp when formal
Example: It also betrays an insensitivity to history and a lack of basic human respect and civility.

Definition: If you rectify something that is wrong, you change it so that it becomes correct or satisfactory.
Example: Only an act of Congress could rectify the situation.

Definition: If you redress something such as a wrong or a complaint, you do something to correct it or to improve things for the person who has been badly treated.
Example: More and more victims turn to litigation to redress wrongs done to them.

Definition: An amendment is a section that is added to a law or rule in order to change it.
Example: ...an amendment to the defense bill.

Definition: The parliament of some countries, for example Britain, is the group of people who make or change its laws, and decide what policies the country should follow.
Example: Parliament today approved the policy, but it has not yet become law.

Definition: A calculation is something that you think about and work out mathematically. Calculation is the process of working something out mathematically.
Example: Leonard made a rapid calculation: he'd never make it in time.

Definition: A sum of money is an amount of money.
Example: Large sums of money were lost.

Definition: If you retaliate when someone harms or annoys you, you do something which harms or annoys them in return.
Example: I was sorely tempted to retaliate.

Definition: Bravery is brave behaviour or the quality of being brave.
Example: He deserves the highest praise for his bravery.

Definition: If you say that someone has shown fortitude, you admire them for being brave, calm, and uncomplaining when they have experienced something unpleasant or painful.
Example: He suffered a long series of illnesses with tremendous dignity and fortitude.

Definition: A progression is a gradual development from one state to another.
Example: Both drugs slow the progression of HIV, but neither cures the disease.

Definition: A racecourse is a track on which horses race.
Example: The racecourse gallop got the freshness out of her.

Definition: An electrical circuit is a complete route which an electric current can flow around.
Example: Any attempts to cut through the cabling will break the electrical circuit.

Definition: When liquid gushes out of something, or when something gushes a liquid, the liquid flows out very quickly and in large quantities.
Example: Piping-hot water gushed out.

Definition: A law court is a place where legal matters are decided by a judge and jury or by a magistrate.
Example: She would never resort to the law courts to resolve her marital problems.

Definition: A tribunal is a special court or committee that is appointed to deal with particular problems.
Example: His case comes before an industrial tribunal in March.

Definition: A palace is a very large impressive house, especially one which is the official home of a king, queen, or president.
Example: ...Buckingham Palace.
