Definition: A castle is a large building with thick, high walls. Castles were built by important people, such as kings, in former times, especially for protection during wars and battles.
Example: FANCY yourself as king of the castle?

Definition: A manor is a large private house in the country, usually built in the Middle Ages, and also includes the land and smaller buildings around it.
Example: Thieves broke into the manor at night.

Definition: If you woo people, you try to encourage them to help you, support you, or vote for you, for example by promising them things which they would like.
Example: They wooed customers by offering low interest rates.

Definition:
An eclipse of the sun is an occasion when the moon is between the Earth and the sun, so that for a short time you cannot see part or all of the sun. An eclipse of the moon is an occasion when the Earth is between the sun and the moon, so that for
a short time you cannot see part or all of the moon.
Example: ...an eclipse of the sun.

Definition: If you take on the mantle of something such as a profession or an important job, you take on the responsibilities and duties which must be fulfilled by anyone who has this profession or job.
Example:
Glasgow has broadened its appeal since taking on the mantle of European City of Culture
in 1990.

Definition: If someone or something traverses an area of land or water, they go across it.
Example: I traversed the narrow pedestrian bridge.

Definition: Something or someone which is a shield against a particular danger or risk provides protection from it.
Example: He used his left hand as a shield against the reflecting sunlight.

Definition: If you take refuge somewhere, you try to protect yourself from physical harm by going there.
Example: They took refuge in a bomb shelter.

Definition: If you insure yourself or your property, you pay money to an insurance company so that, if you become ill or if your property is damaged or stolen, the company will pay you a sum of money.
Example: For protection against unforeseen emergencies, you insure your house and your car.

Definition: To compensate someone for money or things that they have lost means to pay them money or give them something to replace that money or those things.
Example:
The official promise to compensate people for the price rise clearly hadn't been
worked out properly.

Definition: Bedclothes are the sheets and covers which you put over yourself when you get into bed.
Example: He turned on his side angrily, bunching the bedclothes around him.

Definition: Bedding is sheets, duvets, and blankets that are used on beds.
Example: Make sure pots of summer bedding have been emptied, scrubbed out and put away.

Definition: A wrapper is a piece of paper, plastic, or thin metal which covers and protects something that you buy, especially food.
Example: I emptied the sweet wrappers from the ashtray.

Definition: Reporting is the presenting of news in newspapers, on radio, and on television.
Example: ...honest and impartial political reporting.

Definition: If you intimidate someone, you deliberately make them frightened enough to do what you want them to do.
Example: Jones had set out to intimidate and dominate Paul.

Definition: If something daunts you, it makes you feel slightly afraid or worried about dealing with it.
Example: ...a gruelling journey that would have daunted a woman half her age.

Definition: If something or someone frightens you, they cause you to suddenly feel afraid, anxious, or nervous.
Example: He knew that Soli was trying to frighten him, so he smiled to hide his fear.

Definition: If something scares you, it frightens or worries you.
Example: You're scaring me.

Definition: To cleave something means to split or divide it into two separate parts, often violently.
Example: They just cleave the stone along the cracks.

Definition: If you give in, you admit that you are defeated or that you cannot do something.
Example: All right. I give in. What did you do with the ship?

Definition: A chink in a surface is a very narrow crack or opening in it.
Example: ...a chink in the wall.

Definition: If something or someone plunges in a particular direction, especially into water, they fall, rush, or throw themselves in that direction.
Example: At least 50 people died when a bus plunged into a river.

Definition: If someone or something hurtles somewhere, they move there very quickly, often in a rough or violent way.
Example: A pretty young girl came hurtling down the stairs.

Definition: If you describe something or someone as smashing, you mean that you like them very much.
Example: It was smashing. I really enjoyed it.

Definition: If a business or project  goes under, it becomes unable to continue in operation or in existence.
Example: If one firm goes under it could provoke a cascade of bankruptcies.

Definition: A lotion is a liquid that you use to clean, improve, or protect your skin or hair.
Example: ...suntan lotion.

Definition: An ointment is a smooth thick substance that is put on sore skin or a wound to help it heal.
Example: A range of ointments and creams is available for the treatment of eczema.

Definition: A conception of something is an idea that you have of it in your mind.
Example: My conception of a garden was based on gardens I had visited in England.

Definition: An invention is a machine, device, or system that has been invented by someone.
Example: It's been a tricky business marketing his new invention.

Definition: If you describe someone or their ideas as imaginative, you are praising them because they are easily able to think of or create new or exciting things.
Example: ...an imaginative writer.

Definition: An inventive person is good at inventing things or has clever and original ideas.
Example: ...Stroman's ceaselessly inventive choreography.

Definition: Inspiration is a feeling of enthusiasm you get from someone or something, which gives you new and creative ideas.
Example: My inspiration comes from poets like Baudelaire and Jacques Prvert.

Definition: Productivity is the rate at which goods are produced.
Example: The third-quarter results reflect continued improvements in productivity.

Definition: If you refer to someone's minions, you are referring to people who have to do what that person tells them to do, especially unimportant or boring tasks.
Example: She delegated the job to one of her minions.

Definition: A puppet is a doll that you can move, either by pulling strings which are attached to it or by putting your hand inside its body and moving your fingers.
Example: When the invasion occurred he ruled as a puppet of the occupiers.

Definition: If you praise someone or something, you express approval for their achievements or qualities.
Example: The American president praised Turkey for its courage.

Definition: An offence is a crime that breaks a particular law and requires a particular punishment.
Example:
Thirteen people have been charged with treasonan offence which can carry the death
penalty.

Definition: a person who breaks the law
Example: And if you're postulating some other lawbreaker, it's highly unlikely, for a number of reasons.

Definition: If someone is convicted of a crime, they are found guilty of that crime in a law court.
Example: In 1977 he was convicted of murder and sentenced to life imprisonment.

Definition: An offender is a person who has committed a crime.
Example: This led to a large number of convicted offenders being released from prison.

Definition: Delinquency is criminal behaviour, especially that of young people.
Example: He had no history of delinquency.

Definition: You can refer to a person who attacks someone as their attacker.
Example: There were signs that she struggled with her attacker before she was repeatedly stabbed.

Definition: If someone in authority censors letters or the media, they officially examine them and cut out any information that is regarded as secret.
Example: The military-backed government has heavily censored the news.

Definition: If a fact, action, or event is decisive, it makes it certain that there will be a particular result.
Example: ...his decisive victory in the presidential elections.

Definition: If you refer to a decision, event, or change as momentous, you mean that it is very important, often because of the effects that it will have in the future.
Example: ...the momentous decision to send in the troops.

Definition: powerfully and finally influencing a decision; decisive
Example: The schemes have procedures for deciding disputes over the deposit.

Definition: If you are disparaging about someone or something, or make disparaging comments about them, you say things which show that you do not have a good opinion of them.
Example: He was critical of the people, disparaging of their crude manners.

Definition: A disapproving action or expression shows that you do not approve of something or someone.
Example: Janet gave him a disapproving look.

Definition: If you say that someone is being scathing about something, you mean that they are being very critical of it.
Example: His report was scathing about all terror groups.

Definition: If you make a derogatory remark or comment about someone or something, you express your low opinion of them.
Example: He refused to withdraw derogatory remarks made about his boss.

Definition: continual and usually trivial criticism
Example: But sly obfuscation and specious fault-finding don't help.

Definition: If you censure someone for something that they have done, you tell them that you strongly disapprove of it.
Example: The ethics committee may take a decision to admonish him or to censure him.

Definition: If you feel or show disapproval of something or someone, you feel or show that you do not approve of them.
Example: His action had been greeted with almost universal disapproval.

Definition:
Disparagement is the act of speaking about someone or something in a way which shows that you do
not have a good opinion of them.
Example: Reviewers have been almost unanimous in their disparagement of this book.

Definition: The harvest is the gathering of a crop.
Example: There were about 300 million tons of grain in the fields at the start of the harvest.

Definition: When animals graze or are grazed, they eat the grass or other plants that are growing in a particular place. You can also say that a field is grazed by animals.
Example: Five cows graze serenely around a massive oak.

Definition: If you browse in a shop, you look at things in a fairly casual way, in the hope that you might find something you like.
Example: I stopped in several bookstores to browse.

Definition: A ford is a shallow place in a river or stream where it is possible to cross safely without using a boat.
Example: They were guarding the bridge, so we forded the river.

Definition: If you blend substances together or if they blend, you mix them together so that they become one substance.
Example: Blend the butter with the sugar and beat until light and creamy.

Definition: Something that is an amalgam of two or more things is a mixture of them.
Example: ...amalgam fillings.

Definition: A multitude of things or people is a very large number of them.
Example: There are a multitude of small quiet roads to cycle along.

Definition: A throng is a large crowd of people.
Example: The crowds thronged into the mall.

Definition: A flock of birds, sheep, or goats is a group of them.
Example: They kept a small flock of sheep.

Definition: If you cram things or people into a container or place, you put them into it, although there is hardly enough room for them.
Example: While nobody was looking, she squashed her school hat and crammed it into a wastebasket.

Definition: If people jostle you, they bump against you or push you in a way that annoys you, usually because you are in a crowd and they are trying to get past you.
Example: You get 2,000 people jostling each other and bumping into furniture.

Definition: If someone weeps, they cry.
Example: She wanted to laugh and weep all at once.

Definition: When someone sobs, they cry in a noisy way, breathing in short breaths.
Example: She began to sob again, burying her face in the pillow.

Definition: If you bawl, you shout in a very loud voice, for example because you are angry or you want people to hear you.
Example: When I came back to the hotel Laura and Peter were shouting and bawling at each other.

Definition: A petition is a document signed by a lot of people which asks a government or other official group to do a particular thing.
Example: We recently presented the government with a petition signed by 4,500 people.

Definition: An inquisitive person likes finding out about things, especially secret things.
Example: Barrow had an inquisitive nature.

Definition: A searching question or look is intended to discover the truth about something.
Example: They asked her some searching questions on moral philosophy and logic.

Definition: A draught is a current of air that comes into a place in an undesirable way.
Example: Block draughts around doors and windows.

Definition: A ritual is a religious service or other ceremony which involves a series of actions performed in a fixed order.
Example: This is the most ancient, and holiest of the Shinto rituals.

Definition: Patronage is the support and money given by someone to a person or a group such as a charity.
Example: ...government patronage of the arts in Europe.

Definition:
If you carve an object, you make it by cutting it out of a substance such as wood or stone. If you carve something such as wood or stone into an object, you make the object by cutting it
out.
Example: One of the prisoners has carved a beautiful wooden chess set.

Definition: If you mow an area of grass, you cut it using a machine called a lawnmower.
Example: He continued to mow the lawn and do other routine chores.

Definition: A dock is an enclosed area in a harbour where ships go to be loaded, unloaded, and repaired.
Example: ...the loading dock.

Definition: When something diminishes, or when something diminishes it, it becomes reduced in size, importance, or intensity.
Example: The threat of nuclear war has diminished.

Definition: If you delete something that has been written down or stored in a computer, you cross it out or remove it.
Example: He also deleted files from the computer system.

Definition: Excise is a tax that the government of a country puts on particular goods, such as cigarettes and alcoholic drinks, which are produced for sale in its own country.
Example: ...this year's rise in excise duties.

Definition: To harm a person or animal means to cause them physical injury, usually on purpose.
Example: The hijackers seemed anxious not to harm anyone.

Definition: To mar something means to spoil or damage it.
Example: A number of problems marred the smooth running of this event.

Definition: A stain is a mark on something that is difficult to remove.
Example: Remove stains by soaking in a mild solution of bleach.

Definition: Something that is harmful has a bad effect on something else, especially on a person's health.
Example: ...the harmful effects of smoking.

Definition: Something that is detrimental to something else has a harmful or damaging effect on it.
Example: ...foods suspected of being detrimental to health.

Definition: If you say that someone's comments or actions are hurtful, you mean that they are unkind and upsetting.
Example: Her comments can only be hurtful to Mrs Green's family.

Definition: If you describe the cost of something as ruinous, you mean that it costs far more money than you can afford or than is reasonable.
Example: Many Britons will still fear the potentially ruinous costs of their legal system.

Definition: If someone prances around, they walk or move around with exaggerated movements, usually because they want people to look at them and admire them.
Example: He was horrified at the thought of having to prance about on a stage in tights.

Definition: Capers are the small green buds of caper plants. They are usually sold preserved in vinegar.
Example: They were capering about, shouting and laughing.

Definition: A hazard is something which could be dangerous to you, your health or safety, or your plans or reputation.
Example: A new report suggests that chewing-gum may be a health hazard.

Definition: If you say that someone or something is a menace to other people or things, you mean that person or thing is likely to cause serious harm.
Example: In my view you are a menace to the public.

Definition: Something that is perilous is very dangerous.
Example: ...a perilous journey across the war-zone.

Definition: If an activity or action is risky, it is dangerous or likely to fail.
Example: Investing in airlines is a very risky business.

Definition: Something that is hazardous is dangerous, especially to people's health or safety.
Example: They have no way to dispose of the hazardous waste they produce.

Definition: Secrecy is the act of keeping something secret, or the state of being kept secret.
Example: The British government has thrown a blanket of secrecy over the details.

Definition: Ignorance of something is lack of knowledge about it.
Example: I am embarrassed by my complete ignorance of history.

Definition: Dusk is the time just before night when the daylight has almost gone but when it is not completely dark.
Example: We arrived home at dusk.

Definition: Nightfall is the time of day when it starts to get dark.
Example: I need to get to Lyon by nightfall.

Definition: The gloom is a state of near darkness.
Example: ...the gloom of a foggy November morning.

Definition: Hidden is the past participle of hide.
Example: Under all the innocent fun, there are hidden dangers, especially for children.

Definition: Someone or something that is mysterious is strange and is not known about or understood.
Example: He died in mysterious circumstances.

Definition: If you are miserable, you are very unhappy.
Example: I took a series of badly paid secretarial jobs which made me really miserable.

Definition: to meet by prior arrangement
Example: But blokes need to meet up to maintain friendships.

Definition: The deceased is used to refer to a particular person or to particular people who have recently died.
Example: The identities of the deceased have now been determined.

Definition: Gone is the past participle of go1.
Example: While he was gone she had tea with the Colonel.

Definition: An inanimate object is one that has no life.
Example: He thought of the baby almost as an inanimate object.

Definition: A trader is a person whose job is to trade in goods or stocks.
Example: Market traders display an exotic selection of the island's produce.

Definition: A marketer is someone whose job involves marketing.
Example:
The job of a marketer is to cultivate this schismatic core, this broken soul, at the
center of every product.

Definition: A merchant is a person who buys or sells goods in large quantities, especially one who imports and exports them.
Example: Any knowledgeable wine merchant would be able to advise you.

Definition: A beloved person, thing, or place is one that you feel great affection for.
Example: He lost his beloved wife last year.

Definition: held in high regard, esp in respect of merit
Example: a valued friend

Definition: Your favourite thing or person of a particular type is the one you like most.
Example: ...a bottle of his favourite champagne.

Definition: Dying is the present participle of die.
Example: ...a dying man.

Definition: Bereavement is the sorrow you feel or the state you are in when a relative or close friend dies.
Example: When Mary died Anne did not share her brother's sense of bereavement.

Definition: To clothe someone means to provide them with clothes to wear.
Example: She was on her own with two kids to feed and clothe.

Definition: If you prostrate yourself, you lie down flat on the ground, on your front, usually to show respect for God or a person in authority.
Example: They prostrated themselves before their king.

Definition: The failings of someone or something are their faults or unsatisfactory features.
Example:
Like many in Russia, she blamed the country's failings on futile attempts to catch
up with the West.

Definition: If something such as the value of something slumps, it falls suddenly and by a large amount.
Example: Net profits slumped by 41%.

Definition: the action of making or becoming less
Example: himself the father, thus lessening the force of the illegitimacy.

Definition: You use profound to emphasize that something is very great or intense.
Example: ...discoveries which had a profound effect on many areas of medicine.

Definition: within the private thoughts or feelings; secretly
Example: inwardly resentful

Definition: If you buy or sell something privately, you buy it from or sell it to another person directly, rather than in a shop or through a business.
Example: The whole process makes buying a car privately as painless as buying from a garage.

Definition: Peaceful activities and situations do not involve war.
Example: He has attempted to find a peaceful solution to the conflict.

Definition: If something is unbroken, it is continuous or complete and has not been interrupted or broken.
Example: ...an unbroken run of 38 match wins.

Definition: If you are keen on doing something, you very much want to do it. If you are keen that something should happen, you very much want it to happen.
Example: You're not keen on going, are you?

Definition: perceived as too loud
Example: Off to the west were chalk cliffs, their bases battered by booming surf.

Definition: A bass is a man with a very deep singing voice.
Example: ...the great Russian bass Chaliapin.

Definition: the centre
Example: I ask him why he is always in the midst of a storm of controversy.

Definition: To crush something means to press it very hard so that its shape is destroyed or so that it breaks into pieces.
Example: Andrew crushed his empty can.

Definition: If you are overwhelmed by a feeling or event, it affects you very strongly, and you do not know how to deal with it.
Example: He was overwhelmed by a longing for times past.

Definition: If one country or group of people conquers another, they take complete control of their land.
Example: During 1936, Mussolini conquered Abyssinia.

Definition: Foil consists of sheets of metal as thin as paper. It is used to wrap food in.
Example: Pour cider around the meat and cover with foil.

Definition: Conquest is the act of conquering a country or group of people.
Example: He had led the conquest of southern Poland in 1939.

Definition: You can use the accused to refer to a person or a group of people charged with a crime or on trial for it.
Example: The accused is alleged to be a member of a right-wing gang.

Definition: A litigant is a person who is involved in a civil legal case, either because they are making a formal complaint about someone, or because a complaint is being made about them.
Example: The litigants in the case were all detained but their appeals were dismissed.

Definition: Something that is prickly feels rough and uncomfortable, as if it has a lot of prickles.
Example: The bunk mattress was hard, the blankets prickly and slightly damp.

Definition: If you say that someone is thin-skinned, you mean that they are easily upset by criticism or unpleasantness.
Example:
Some fear he is too thin-skinned to survive the rough-and-tumble of a presidential
campaign.

Definition: If you say that one thing looks or sounds suspiciously like another thing, you mean that it probably is that thing, or something very similar to it, although it may be intended to seem different.
Example: The tan-coloured dog looks suspiciously like an American pit bull terrier.

Definition: When something such as an idea, feeling, or illness lingers, it continues to exist for a long time, often much longer than expected.
Example: The scent of her perfume lingered on in the room.

Definition: If one thing or person lags behind another thing or person, their progress is slower than that of the other.
Example:
Britain still lags behind most of Europe in its provisions for women who want time
off to have babies.

Definition: If you loiter somewhere, you remain there or walk up and down without any real purpose.
Example: Unemployed young men loiter at the entrance of the factory.

Definition: If you dawdle, you spend more time than is necessary going somewhere.
Example: Eleanor will be back any moment, if she doesn't dawdle.

Definition: If you give up something, you stop doing it or having it.
Example: Coastguards had given up all hope of finding the two divers alive.

Definition: If you rescue someone, you get them out of a dangerous or unpleasant situation.
Example: Helicopters rescued nearly 20 people from the roof of the burning building.

Definition: A consignment of goods is a load that is being delivered to a place or person.
Example: The first consignment of food has already left Bologna.

Definition: Goods are things that are made to be sold.
Example: Money can be exchanged for goods or services.

Definition: Speaking is the activity of giving speeches and talks.
Example: It would also train women union members in public speaking and decision-making.

Definition: The pronunciation of a word or language is the way in which it is pronounced.
Example: She gave the word its French pronunciation.

Definition: an order; command (often in the phrases do or  follow the bidding of, at someone's bidding)
Example: Bidding is not expected to open until the new year.

Definition: Self-government is government of a country or region by its own people rather than by others.
Example: This experiment in business self-government proved disastrous.

Definition: Autonomy is the control or government of a country, organization, or group by itself rather than by others.
Example: Activists stepped up their demands for local autonomy last month.

Definition: a presentation, exhibition, or display
Example: a good showing in the contest

Definition: If you contradict someone, you say that what they have just said is wrong, or suggest that it is wrong by saying something different.
Example: She dared not contradict him.

Definition: If you renounce a belief or a way of behaving, you decide and declare publicly that you no longer have that belief or will no longer behave in that way.
Example: You must renounce your old ways of thinking.

Definition: If you discard something, you get rid of it because you no longer want it or need it.
Example: Read the manufacturer's guidelines before discarding the box.

Definition: When people in authority revoke something such as a licence, a law, or an agreement, they cancel it.
Example: The government revoked her license to operate migrant labor crews.

Definition: If you forbid someone to do something, or if you forbid an activity, you order that it must not be done.
Example: They'll forbid you to marry.

Definition: Despair is the feeling that everything is wrong and that nothing will improve.
Example: 'Oh, I despair sometimes,' he says in mock sorrow.

Definition: Misery is great unhappiness.
Example: All that money brought nothing but sadness and misery and tragedy.

Definition: A recession is a period when the economy of a country is doing badly, for example because industry is producing less and more people are becoming unemployed.
Example: The recession caused sales to drop off.

Definition: Something that is hollow has a space inside it, as opposed to being solid all the way through.
Example: ...a hollow tree.

Definition: A pit is a coal mine.
Example: It was a better community then when all the pits were working.

Definition:
If you dip something in a liquid, you put it into the liquid for a short time, so that only part of it is
covered, and take it out again.
Example: They dip the food into the sauce.

Definition: the quality or condition of being severe
Example: There are no extenuating circumstances that could lessen the severity of the crime I have committed.

Definition: Gravity is the force which causes things to drop to the ground.
Example:
Arrows would continue to fly forward forever were it not for gravity, which brings
them down to earth.

Definition: The breadth of something is the distance between its two sides.
Example: The breadth of the whole camp was 400 paces.

Definition: The warmth of something is the heat that it has or produces.
Example: She went further into the room, drawn by the warmth of the fire.

Definition:
Complexity is the state of having many different parts connected or related to each other in
a complicated way.
Example: ...a diplomatic tangle of great complexity.

Definition: Intricacy is the state of being made up of many small parts or details.
Example: The price depends on the intricacy of the work.

Definition: An ambassador is an important official who lives in a foreign country and represents his or her own country's interests there.
Example: ...the German ambassador to Poland.

Definition: A wilderness is a desert or other area of natural land which is not used by people.
Example: ...the icy Canadian wilderness.

Definition: A wasteland is an area of land on which not much can grow or which has been spoiled in some way.
Example: The pollution has already turned vast areas into a wasteland.

Definition: A desolate place is empty of people and lacking in comfort.
Example: ...a desolate landscape of flat green fields broken by marsh.

Definition: suffering from a lack of care
Example: Annual mercury can still be seen in neglected gardens.

Definition: A forsaken place is not lived in, used, or looked after.
Example: The delta region of the Rio Grande river was a forsaken land of thickets and swamps.

Definition: The abandonment of a place, thing, or person is the act of leaving it permanently or for a long time, especially when you should not do so.
Example: ...memories of her father's complete abandonment of her.

Definition: A betrayal is an action which betrays someone or something, or the fact of being betrayed.
Example: She felt that what she had done was a betrayal of Patrick.

Definition: If a building or a piece of land is in a state of dereliction, it is deserted or abandoned.
Example: The previous owners had rescued the building from dereliction.

Definition: the act or an instance of defecting
Example: Speculation about further defections continued to sweep the party last night.

Definition: If someone absconds from somewhere such as a prison, they escape from it or leave it without permission.
Example: He was ordered to appear the following day, but absconded.

Definition: If you decamp, you go away from somewhere secretly or suddenly.
Example: We all decamped to the pub.

Definition: If something has merit, it has good or worthwhile qualities.
Example: The argument seemed to have considerable merit.

Definition: If something warrants a particular action, it makes the action seem necessary or appropriate for the circumstances.
Example: The allegations are serious enough to warrant an investigation.

Definition: A tailor is a person whose job is to make men's clothes.
Example: We can tailor the program to the patient's needs.

Definition: A dressmaker is a person who makes women's or children's clothes.
Example: She drew it, her dressmaker made it up.

Definition: If you feel longing or a longing for something, you have a rather sad feeling because you want it very much.
Example: He felt a longing for the familiar.

Definition: essential, needed, or necessary
Example: She suffered a fractured jaw and required plastic surgery.

Definition: You use intended to describe the thing you are trying to achieve or person you are trying to affect.
Example: The intended target had been a military building.

Definition: Lust is a feeling of strong sexual desire for someone.
Example: His relationship with Angie was the first which combined lust with friendship.

Definition: A person's libido is the part of their personality that is considered to cause their emotional, especially sexual, desires.
Example: Lack of sleep is a major factor in loss of libido.

Definition: Your appetite is your desire to eat.
Example: He has a healthy appetite.

Definition: If you are raring to do something or are raring for it, you are very eager to do it or very eager that it should happen.
Example: Sarah's here and raring to meet you.

Definition: If large numbers of people or animals are slaughtered, they are killed in a way that is cruel or unnecessary.
Example: Thirty-four people were slaughtered while queuing up to cast their votes.

Definition: To exterminate a group of people or animals means to kill all of them.
Example: A huge effort was made to exterminate the rats.

Definition: A trifle is something that is considered to have little importance, value, or significance.
Example: He had no money to spare on trifles.

Definition: A catalogue is a list of things such as the goods you can buy from a particular company, the objects in a museum, or the books in a library.
Example: ...the world's biggest seed catalogue.

Definition: If something  turns out a particular way, it happens in that way or has the result or degree of success indicated.
Example: I had no idea that it would turn out like this.

Definition: A gadget is a small machine or device which does something useful. You sometimes refer to something as a gadget when you are suggesting that it is complicated and unnecessary.
Example: ...kitchen gadgets including toasters, kettles and percolators.

Definition: If you say that someone has dedicated themselves to something, you approve of the fact that they have decided to give a lot of time and effort to it because they think that it is important.
Example: Back on the island, he dedicated himself to politics.

Definition: If something dwindles, it becomes smaller, weaker, or less in number.
Example: The factory's workforce has dwindled from over 4,000 to a few hundred.

Definition: Abstinence is the practice of abstaining from something such as alcoholic drink or sex, often for health or religious reasons.
Example: ...six months of abstinence.

Definition: A slim person has an attractively thin and well-shaped body.
Example: The young woman was tall and slim.

Definition: difference; unlikeness
Example: Linguists used to record those slight generational dissimilarities and then lament the demise of a regional dialect.

Definition: Disagreement means objecting to something such as a proposal.
Example: Britain and France have expressed some disagreement with the proposal.

Definition: If one thing is dissimilar to another, or if two things are dissimilar, they are very different from each other.
Example: His methods were not dissimilar to those used by Freud.

Definition: If you are opposed to something, you disagree with it or disapprove of it.
Example: We are utterly opposed to racism in all of its forms.

Definition: If you describe something or someone as trying, you mean that they are difficult to deal with and make you feel impatient or annoyed.
Example: Support from those closest to you is vital in these trying times.

Definition: An awkward situation is embarrassing and difficult to deal with.
Example: I was the first to ask him awkward questions but there'll be harder ones to come.

Definition: A demanding job or task requires a lot of your time, energy, or attention.
Example: He found he could no longer cope with his demanding job.

Definition: Hardship is a situation in which your life is difficult or unpleasant, often because you do not have enough money.
Example: Many people are suffering economic hardship.

Definition: If strain is put on an organization or system, it has to do more than it is able to do.
Example: The prison service is already under considerable strain.

Definition: If someone or something bores you, you find them dull and uninteresting.
Example: Dickie bored him all through the meal with stories of the Navy.

Definition: If you rummage through something, you search for something you want by moving things around in a careless or hurried way.
Example: They rummage through piles of second-hand clothes for something that fits.

Definition: If someone taunts you, they say unkind or insulting things to you, especially about your weaknesses or failures.
Example: A gang taunted a disabled man.

Definition: If you poke someone or something, you quickly push them with your finger or with a sharp object.
Example: Lindy poked him in the ribs.

Definition: If you thrust something or someone somewhere, you push or move them there quickly with a lot of force.
Example: They thrust him into the back of a jeep.

Definition: If you nudge someone, you push them gently, usually with your elbow, in order to draw their attention to something.
Example: I nudged Stan and pointed again.

Definition: A feast is a large and special meal.
Example:
Lunch was a feast of meat and vegetables, cheese, yoghurt and fruit, with unlimited
wine.

Definition: A banquet is a grand formal dinner.
Example: Last night he attended a state banquet at Buckingham Palace.

Definition: A repast is a meal.
Example: Rather sourly he acknowledged Peter, glowered at Anna, and settled himself at the table for his midday repast.

Definition: If you do something promptly, you do it immediately.
Example: Sister Francesca entered the chapel, took her seat, and promptly fell asleep.

Definition: immediately; at once
Example: I came instantly I saw the need

Definition: If you do something  right away or right off, you do it immediately.
Example: He wants to see you right away.

Definition: actually present
Example: He was due to fly back to the States today to deliver the tape to me in person.

Definition: If you learn or experience something at first hand, you experience it yourself or learn it directly rather than being told about it by other people.
Example: He saw at first hand the effects of the recent heavy fighting.

Definition: If someone is frank, they state or express things in an open and honest way.
Example: 'It is clear that my client has been less than frank with me,' said his lawyer.

Definition: You use honestly to emphasize that you are referring to your, or someone else's, true beliefs or feelings.
Example: I honestly feel I cannot do any more to prove myself.

Definition: If you do something openly, you do it without hiding any facts or hiding your feelings.
Example: They want their church to talk openly about mental illness.

Definition: You use frankly when you are expressing an opinion or feeling to emphasize that you mean what you are saying, especially when the person you are speaking to may not like it.
Example: 'You don't give a damn about my feelings, do you.''Quite frankly, I don't.'

Definition: You use plainly to indicate that you believe something is obviously true, often when you are trying to convince someone else that it is true.
Example: The judge's conclusion was plainly wrong.

Definition: Honesty is the quality of being honest.
Example: They said the greatest virtues in a politician were integrity, correctness and honesty.

Definition: Candour is the quality of speaking honestly and openly about things.
Example: ...a brash, forceful man, noted both for his candour and his quick temper.

Definition: the quality or state of being sincere; honesty, genuineness, good faith, etc.
Example: Yet there was no denying either the dowser's sincerity or his supreme confidence.

Definition: If you instruct someone to do something, you formally tell them to do it.
Example: The family has instructed solicitors to sue Thomson for compensation.

Definition: Bent is the past tense and past participle of bend.
Example: The trees were all bent and twisted from the wind.

Definition: If you do something at once, you do it immediately.
Example: I have to go, I really must, at once.

Definition: If you say that something is presently happening, you mean that it is happening now.
Example: She is presently developing a number of projects.

Definition: Filth is a disgusting amount of dirt.
Example: The living-room floor was littered with filth and tin cans.

Definition: Muck is dirt or some other unpleasant substance.
Example: This congealed muck was interfering with the filter.

Definition: Grime is dirt which has collected on the surface of something.
Example: Kelly got the grime off his hands before rejoining her in the kitchen.

Definition: Clay is a kind of earth that is soft when it is wet and hard when it is dry. Clay is shaped and baked to make things such as pots and bricks.
Example: ...the heavy clay soils of Cambridgeshire.

Definition: Gossip is informal conversation, often about other people's private affairs.
Example: He spent the first hour talking gossip.

Definition: the state or quality of being infirm
Example: `Did the post-mortem on Leonard Pearson reveal any infirmity or disability?

Definition: The incapacity of a person, society, or system to do something is their inability to do it.
Example: ...Europe's incapacity to take collective action.

Definition: If something sickens you, it makes you feel disgusted.
Example: The notion that art should be controlled by intellectuals sickened him.

Definition: If someone or something vanishes, they disappear suddenly or in a way that cannot be explained.
Example: He just vanished and was never seen again.

Definition: When a liquid evaporates, or is evaporated, it changes from a liquid state to a gas, because its temperature has increased.
Example: Moisture is drawn to the surface of the fabric so that it evaporates.

Definition: If something recedes from you, it moves away.
Example: Luke's footsteps receded into the night.

Definition: A catastrophe is an unexpected event that causes great suffering or damage.
Example: From all points of view, war would be a catastrophe.

Definition: Corrections are marks or comments made on a piece of work, especially school work, which indicate where there are mistakes and what are the right answers.
Example: ...jails and other parts of the correction system.

Definition: Restraints are rules or conditions that limit or restrict someone or something.
Example: The Prime Minister is calling for new restraints on trade unions.

Definition: To punish someone means to make them suffer in some way because they have done something wrong.
Example: I don't believe that George ever had to punish the children.

Definition: If someone is reprimanded, they are spoken to angrily or seriously for doing something wrong, usually by a person in authority.
Example: He was reprimanded by a teacher for talking in the corridor.

Definition: If you castigate someone or something, you speak to them angrily or criticize them severely.
Example: Marx never lost an opportunity to castigate colonialism.

Definition: To govern a place such as a country, or its people, means to be officially in charge of the place, and to have responsibility for making laws, managing the economy, and controlling public services.
Example: They go to the polls on Friday to choose the people they want to govern their country.

Definition: If you uncover something, especially something that has been kept secret, you discover or find out about it.
Example: Auditors said they had uncovered evidence of fraud.

Definition: If you invent something such as a machine or process, you are the first person to think of it or make it.
Example: He invented the first electric clock.

Definition: An inventor is a person who has invented something, or whose job is to invent things.
Example: ...Alexander Graham Bell, the inventor of the telephone.

Definition: The originator of something such as an idea or scheme is the person who first thought of it or began it.
Example: ...the originator of the theory of relativity.

Definition:
Someone who is referred to as a pioneer in a particular area of activity is one of the first people to be involved in it
and develop it.
Example: ...one of the leading pioneers of British photo journalism.

Definition: An announcement is a statement made to the public or to the media which gives information about something that has happened or that will happen.
Example: Sir Robert made his announcement after talks with the President.

Definition: A revelation is a surprising or interesting fact that is made known to people.
Example: ...the seemingly everlasting revelations about his private life.

Definition: A breakthrough is an important development or achievement.
Example: The company looks poised to make a significant breakthrough in China.

Definition: Prejudice is an unreasonable dislike of a particular group of people or things, or a preference for one group of people or things over another.
Example: There is widespread prejudice against workers over 45.

Definition: Bias is a tendency to prefer one person or thing to another, and to favour that person or thing.
Example: Bias against women permeates every level of the judicial system.

Definition: Injustice is a lack of fairness in a situation.
Example: They'll continue to fight injustice.

Definition: Intolerance is unwillingness to let other people act in a different way or hold different opinions from you.
Example: ...his intolerance of any opinion other than his own.

Definition: If a person or thing is under scrutiny, they are being studied or observed very carefully.
Example: His private life came under media scrutiny.

Definition: A platter is a large, flat plate used for serving food.
Example: The food was being served on silver platters.

Definition: A fare is the money that you pay for a journey that you make, for example, in a bus, train, or taxi.
Example: He could barely afford the railway fare.

Definition: If you disregard something, you ignore it or do not take account of it.
Example: He disregarded the advice of his executives.

Definition: If you spurn someone or something, you reject them.
Example: He spurned the advice of management consultants.

Definition: If you repudiate something or someone, you show that you strongly disagree with them and do not want to be connected with them in any way.
Example: Leaders urged people to turn out in large numbers to repudiate the violence.

Definition: If someone or something is banished from a place or area of activity, they are sent away from it and prevented from entering it.
Example: John was banished from England.

Definition: To dispel an idea or feeling that people have means to stop them having it.
Example:
This result should dispel the notion that developing countries are dependent on exports
of agricultural products.

Definition: If someone shelves a plan or project, they decide not to continue with it, either for a while or permanently.
Example: Atlanta has shelved plans to include golf in the 1996 Games.

Definition: When someone is discharged from hospital, prison, or one of the armed services, they are officially allowed to leave, or told that they must leave.
Example: He has a broken nose but may be discharged today.

Definition: A disturbance is an incident in which people behave violently in public.
Example: During the disturbance which followed, three Englishmen were hurt.

Definition: When there is a riot, a crowd of people behave violently in a public place, for example they fight, throw stones, or damage buildings and vehicles.
Example: Twelve inmates have been killed during a riot at the prison.

Definition: If someone formally unveils something such as a new statue or painting, they draw back the curtain which is covering it.
Example: ...a ceremony to unveil a monument to the victims.

Definition: Detachment is the feeling that you have of not being personally involved in something or of having no emotional interest in it.
Example: ...a doctor's professional detachment.

Definition: If you say that an idea or situation is far removed from something, you mean that it is very different from it.
Example: He found it hard to concentrate on conversation so far removed from his present preoccupations.

Definition: Dim light is not bright.
Example: She stood waiting, in the dim light.

Definition: If you are uncertain about something, you do not know what you should do, what is going to happen, or what the truth is about something.
Example: He was uncertain about his brother's intentions.

Definition: An indirect result or effect is not caused immediately and obviously by a thing or person, but happens because of something else that they have done.
Example: Businesses are feeling the indirect effects from the recession that's going on elsewhere.

Definition: Someone who is reserved keeps their feelings hidden.
Example: He was unemotional, quite quiet, and reserved.

Definition: Withdrawn is the past participle of withdraw.
Example: He had become withdrawn and moody.

Definition: A faraway place is a long distance from you or from a particular place.
Example: They have just returned from faraway places with wonderful stories to tell.

Definition: Something that is blank has nothing on it.
Example: We could put some of the pictures over on that blank wall over there.

Definition: Someone who is abstracted is thinking so deeply that they are not fully aware of what is happening around them.
Example: Meg was so abstracted she scarcely noticed that the train had stopped.

Definition: Disconnected things are not linked in any way.
Example: ...sequences of utterly disconnected events.

Definition: Decided means clear and definite.
Example: Her ignorance of the area put her at a decided disadvantage.

Definition: If someone or something has the quality of excellence, they are extremely good in some way.
Example: ...the top U.S. award for excellence in journalism and the arts.

Definition: If you can discriminate between two things, you can recognize that they are different.
Example: He is incapable of discriminating between a good idea and a terrible one.

Definition: If someone dispenses something that they own or control, they give or provide it to a number of people.
Example: The Union had already dispensed 40,000 in grants.

Definition: Rationing is the system of limiting the amount of food, water, petrol, or other necessary substances that each person is allowed to have or buy when there is not enough of them.
Example: The municipal authorities here are preparing for food rationing.

Definition: Something that is varied consists of things of different types, sizes, or qualities.
Example: It is essential that your diet is varied and balanced.

Definition: A divergence is a difference between two or more things, attitudes, or opinions.
Example: There's a substantial divergence of opinion within the party.

Definition: When something breaks up or when you break it up, it separates or is divided into several smaller parts.
Example: Civil war could come if the country breaks up.

Definition: If you alienate someone, you make them become unfriendly or unsympathetic towards you.
Example: The government cannot afford to alienate either group.

Definition: If someone embroils you in a fight or an argument, they get you deeply involved in it.
Example: Any hostilities could result in retaliation and further embroil U.N. troops in fighting.

Definition: A feud is a quarrel in which two people or groups remain angry with each other for a long time, although they are not always fighting or arguing.
Example: ...a long and bitter feud between the state government and the villagers.

Definition: The separation of two or more things or groups is the fact that they are separate or become separate, and are not linked.
Example: He believes in the separation of the races.

Definition: Parting is the act of leaving a particular person or place. A parting is an occasion when this happens.
Example: Parting from any one of you for even a short time is hard.

Definition: If two people  split up, or if someone or something splits them up, they end their relationship or marriage.
Example: My parents split up when I was 16.

Definition: To isolate a person or organization means to cause them to lose their friends or supporters.
Example:
This policy could isolate the country from the other permanent members of the United
Nations Security Council.

Definition: If you detach one thing from another that it is fixed to, you remove it. If one thing detaches from another, it becomes separated from it.
Example: Detach the white part of the application form and keep it.

Definition: When someone cheats, they do not obey a set of rules which they should be obeying, for example in a game or exam.
Example: Students may be tempted to cheat in order to get into top schools.

Definition: A certificate is an official document stating that particular facts are true.
Example: ...birth certificates.

Definition: If someone in an official position certifies something, they officially state that it is true.
Example: The president certified that the project would receive $650m from overseas sources.

Definition: If you verify something, you check that it is true by careful examination or investigation.
Example: I verified the source from which I had that information.

Definition: If someone calls a woman a bitch, they are saying in a very rude way that they think her behaviour is very unpleasant.
Example: They're forever bitching about everybody else.

Definition: If something unpleasant haunts you, you keep thinking or worrying about it over a long period of time.
Example: The decision to leave her children now haunts her.

Definition: Someone who is domesticated willingly does household tasks such as cleaning.
Example: Mum wasn't very domesticated.

Definition: A servant is someone who is employed to work at another person's home, for example as a cleaner or a gardener.
Example: Like any other public servants, police must respond to public demand.

Definition: If you describe someone or something as outstanding, you think that they are very remarkable and impressive.
Example: Derartu is an outstanding athlete and deserved to win.

Definition: The exit is the door through which you can leave a public building.
Example: He picked up the case and walked towards the exit.

Definition: Matching is used to describe things which are of the same colour or design.
Example:
She bought more fabric in the same design so she could make matching curtains and
cushions.

Definition: A lookalike is someone who has a very similar appearance to another person, especially a famous person.
Example: ...a Marilyn Monroe look-alike.

Definition: If you say that one person is the spitting image of another, you mean that they look very similar.
Example: Nina looks the spitting image of her mother.

Definition: Hesitation is an unwillingness to do something, or a delay in doing it, because you are uncertain, worried, or embarrassed about it.
Example: He promised there would be no more hesitations in pursuing reforms.

Definition: A dilemma is a difficult situation in which you have to choose between two or more alternatives.
Example: He was faced with the dilemma of whether or not to return to his country.

Definition: If you disbelieve someone or disbelieve something that they say, you do not believe that what they say is true.
Example: There is no reason to disbelieve him.

Definition: If something is defective, there is something wrong with it and it does not work properly.
Example: Her sight was becoming defective.

Definition: Fell is the past tense of fall.
Example: Badly infected trees should be felled and burned.

Definition: If you outline an idea or a plan, you explain it in a general way.
Example: The mayor outlined his plan to clean up the town's image.

Definition: When people or animals creep somewhere, they move quietly and slowly.
Example: Back I go to the hotel and creep up to my room.

Definition: When you crawl, you move forward on your hands and knees.
Example: Don't worry if your baby seems a little reluctant to crawl or walk.

Definition: A theatre is a building with a stage in it, on which plays, shows, and other performances take place.
Example: If we went to the theatre it was a very big event.

Definition: Acting is the activity or profession of performing in plays or films.
Example: She pursued an acting career after four years of modelling.

Definition: Glasses are sometimes referred to as spectacles.
Example: He looked at me over the tops of his spectacles.

Definition: Theatrical means relating to the theatre.
Example:
These are the prizes given for the most outstanding British theatrical performances
of the year.

Definition: If one vehicle tows another, it pulls it along behind it.
Example: He had been using the vehicle to tow his work trailer.

Definition: When you inhale, you breathe in. When you inhale something such as smoke, you take it into your lungs when you breathe in.
Example: He took a long slow breath, inhaling deeply.

Definition: When you  breathe in, you take some air into your lungs.
Example: She breathed in deeply.

Definition: To extract a substance means to obtain it from something else, for example by using industrial or chemical processes.
Example: ...the traditional method of pick and shovel to extract coal.

Definition:
A pump is a machine or device that is used to force a liquid or gas to flow in a particular
direction.
Example: ...pumps that circulate the fuel around in the engine.

Definition: If you deduce something or deduce that something is true, you reach that conclusion because of other things that you know to be true.
Example: Alison had cleverly deduced that I was the author of the letter.

Definition: To entice someone to go somewhere or to do something means to try to persuade them to go to that place or to do that thing.
Example: Retailers have tried almost everything to entice shoppers through their doors.

Definition: An illustration is an example or a story which is used to make a point clear.
Example: ...a perfect illustration of the way Britain absorbs and adapts external influences.

Definition: A cartoon is a humorous drawing or series of drawings in a newspaper or magazine.
Example: ...a cartoon strip in the Daily Mirror.

Definition: A nightmare is a very frightening dream.
Example: All the victims still suffered nightmares.

Definition: An illusion is a false idea or belief.
Example: Do not have any illusions that an industrial tribunal will right all employment wrongs.

Definition: A delusion is a false idea.
Example: I was under the delusion that he intended to marry me.

Definition: If you have an ambition to do or achieve something, you want very much to do it or achieve it.
Example: His ambition is to sail round the world.

Definition: A frock is a dress.
Example: Your party frock is sorted.

Definition: A gown is a dress, usually a long dress, which women wear on formal occasions.
Example: The new ball gown was a great success.

Definition: A garment is a piece of clothing; used especially in contexts where you are talking about the manufacture or sale of clothes.
Example: Many of the garments have the customers' name tags sewn into the linings.

Definition: If you swallow something, you cause it to go from your mouth down into your stomach.
Example: You are asked to swallow a capsule containing vitamin B.

Definition: If you drain a liquid from a place or object, you remove the liquid by causing it to flow somewhere else. If a liquid drains somewhere, it flows there.
Example: Miners built the tunnel to drain water out of the mines.

Definition: If you sip a drink or sip at it, you drink by taking just a small amount at a time.
Example: Jessica sipped her drink thoughtfully.

Definition: A person's tipple is the alcoholic drink that they usually drink.
Example: My favourite tipple is a glass of port.

Definition:
A hammer is a tool that consists of a heavy piece of metal at the end of a handle. It is used,
for example, to hit nails into a piece of wood or a wall, or to break things into
pieces.
Example: He used a hammer and chisel to chip away at the wall.

Definition: A herd is a large group of animals of one kind that live together.
Example: ...large herds of elephant and buffalo.

Definition: A shepherd is a person whose job is to look after sheep.
Example: She was shepherded by her guards up the rear ramp of the aircraft.

Definition: If one thing spurs you to do another, it encourages you to do it.
Example:
It's the money that spurs these fishermen to risk a long ocean journey in their flimsy
boats.

Definition: Instinct is the natural tendency that a person or animal has to behave or react in a particular way.
Example: I didn't have as strong a maternal instinct as some other mothers.

Definition: When liquid drips somewhere, or you drip it somewhere, it falls in individual small drops.
Example: Sit your child forward and let the blood drip into a tissue or on to the floor.

Definition: If a container leaks, there is a hole or crack in it which lets a substance such as liquid or gas escape. You can also say that a container leaks a substance such as liquid or gas.
Example: The roof leaked.

Definition: If a price, level, or amount  goes down, it becomes lower or less than it was.
Example: Income from sales tax went down.

Definition: If you unload goods from a vehicle, or you unload a vehicle, you remove the goods from the vehicle, usually after they have been transported from one place to another.
Example: Unload everything from the boat and clean it thoroughly.

Definition: If you eject someone from a place, you force them to leave.
Example: Officials used guard dogs to eject the protesters.

Definition: Beads are small pieces of coloured glass, wood, or plastic with a hole through the middle. Beads are often put together on a piece of string or wire to make jewellery.
Example: ...a string of beads.

Definition: Globules of a liquid or of a soft substance are tiny round particles of it.
Example: ...globules of saliva.

Definition: Bubbles are small balls of air or gas in a liquid.
Example: Ink particles attach themselves to air bubbles and rise to the surface.

Definition: An abyss is a very deep hole in the ground.
Example: He felt he was on the edge of an abyss; one false move and he was done for.

Definition: A stimulant is a drug that makes your body work faster, often increasing your heart rate and making you less likely to sleep.
Example: Side effects of drug stimulants and alcohol abuse.

Definition: Thirst is the feeling that you need to drink something.
Example: Coca is well-known for reducing hunger, thirst and fatigue.

Definition: A drought is a long period of time during which no rain falls.
Example: Drought and famines have killed up to two million people here.

Definition: If you are thirsty, you feel a need to drink something.
Example: If a baby is thirsty, it feeds more often.

Definition: If something, especially the ground or a plant, is parched, it is very dry, because there has been no rain.
Example: The clouds gathered and showers poured down upon the parched earth.

Definition: Someone who is sarcastic says or does the opposite of what they really mean in order to mock or insult someone.
Example: She poked fun at people's shortcomings with sarcastic remarks.

Definition: anticipated
Example: Chlorr leapt forward as well, faster and farther than Sam had expected.

Definition: If an amount of money is payable, it has to be paid or it can be paid.
Example: Purchase tax was not payable on goods for export.

Definition: owed; due
Example: ten dollars owing on a bill

Definition: A privilege is a special right or advantage that only one person or group has.
Example:
The Russian Federation has issued a decree abolishing special privileges for government
officials.

Definition: An entitlement to something is the right to have it or do it.
Example: They lose their entitlement to benefit when they start work.

Definition: Grit is very small pieces of stone. It is often put on roads in winter to make them less slippery.
Example: He felt tiny bits of grit and sand peppering his knees.

Definition: If you sprinkle a thing with something such as a liquid or powder, you scatter the liquid or powder over it.
Example: Sprinkle the meat with salt and place in the pan.

Definition: If people have a particular number of things apiece, they have that number each.
Example: He and I had two fish apiece.

Definition: Hunger is the feeling of weakness or discomfort that you get when you need something to eat.
Example: Hunger is the body's signal that levels of blood sugar are too low.

Definition: A yearning for something is a very strong desire for it.
Example: He spoke of his yearning for another child.

Definition: Earnest people are very serious and sincere in what they say or do, because they think that their actions and beliefs are important.
Example: Ella was a pious, earnest woman.

Definition: Enthusiasm is great eagerness to be involved in a particular activity which you like and enjoy or which you think is important.
Example: His enthusiasm for the game is infectious.

Definition: the state or quality of being sensitive
Example: There is growing sensitivity on this issue.

Definition: Appreciation of something is the recognition and enjoyment of its good qualities.
Example: ...an investigation into children's understanding and appreciation of art.

Definition: If you arrive somewhere in good time, you arrive early so that there is time to spare before a particular event.
Example: If we're out, we always make sure we're home in good time for the programme.

Definition: Earliest is the superlative of early.
Example: Her earliest memories were of her mother dealing with bailiffs.

Definition: If you attain something, you gain it or achieve it, often after a lot of effort.
Example: Jim is halfway to attaining his pilot's licence.

Definition: The simplicity of something is the fact that it is not complicated and can be understood or done easily.
Example: The apparent simplicity of his plot is deceptive.

Definition: Leisure is the time when you are not working and you can relax and do things that you enjoy.
Example: ...a relaxing way to fill my leisure time.

Definition: Relaxation is a way of spending time in which you rest and feel comfortable.
Example: You should be able to find the odd moment for relaxation.

Definition: If something relieves an unpleasant feeling or situation, it makes it less unpleasant or causes it to disappear completely.
Example: Meditation can relieve stress.

Definition: If you soothe someone who is angry or upset, you make them feel calmer.
Example: He would take her in his arms and soothe her.

Definition: If you do something readily, you do it in a way which shows that you are very willing to do it.
Example: I asked her if she would allow me to interview her, and she readily agreed.

Definition: A carefree person or period of time doesn't have or involve any problems, worries, or responsibilities.
Example:
They certainly gave the impression of a carefree couple who delighted in each other's
company.

Definition: A leisurely action is done in a relaxed and unhurried way.
Example: Lunch was a leisurely affair.

Definition: When you chew food, you use your teeth to break it up in your mouth so that it becomes easier to swallow.
Example: Be certain to eat slowly and chew your food extremely well.

Definition: When you dine, you have dinner.
Example: He dines alone most nights.

Definition: Commerce is the activities and procedures involved in buying and selling things.
Example: They have made their fortunes from industry and commerce.

Definition: A worm is a small animal with a long thin body, no bones and no legs.
Example: I worm all my birds in early spring.

Definition: The verge of a road is a narrow piece of ground by the side of a road, which is usually covered with grass or flowers.
Example: the verge of the forest, on the verge of hysteria

Definition: If you are on the brink of something, usually something important, terrible, or exciting, you are just about to do it or experience it.
Example: Their economy is teetering on the brink of collapse.

Definition: The dominance of a particular person or thing is the fact that they are more powerful, successful, or important than other people or things.
Example: ...an attempt by each group to establish dominance over the other.

Definition: the quality or state of beingurgent; need for action, haste, etc.; stress or pressure, as of necessity
Example: I took the front steps two at a time, recalling the urgency in Albert Dopplinger's voice.

Definition: Something that is instructive gives useful information.
Example: ...an entertaining and instructive documentary.

Definition: serving to inform or clarify; instructive
Example: Orange and white light flashed over the bay, illuminating the water and the mountains.

Definition: You can use virtual to indicate that something is so nearly true that for most purposes it can be regarded as true.
Example: Argentina came to a virtual standstill while the game was being played.

Definition: hinted at or suggested; not directly expressed
Example: The warning is meaningless without an implied threat.

Definition: If you endeavour to do something, you try very hard to do it.
Example: I will endeavour to arrange it.

Definition: A ballot is a secret vote in which people select a candidate in an election, or express their opinion about something.
Example: The result of the ballot will not be known for two weeks.

Definition: Something that is thrilling is very exciting and enjoyable.
Example: Our wildlife trips offer a thrilling encounter with wildlife in its natural state.

Definition: A faction is an organized group of people within a larger group, which opposes some of the ideas of the larger group and fights for its own ideas.
Example: A peace agreement will be signed by the leaders of the country's warring factions.

Definition: If you describe a group of people as a clique, you mean that they spend a lot of time together and seem unfriendly towards people who are not in the group.
Example: The ruling clique often encompasses people far outside the narrow confines of government.

Definition: The removal of something is the act of removing it.
Example: What they expected to be the removal of a small lump turned out to be major surgery.

Definition: The withdrawal of something is the act or process of removing it, or ending it.
Example: ...withdrawal of friendship.

Definition: The aristocracy is a class of people in some countries who have a high social rank and special titles.
Example: ...a member of the aristocracy.

Definition: When you hug someone, you put your arms around them and hold them tightly, for example because you like them or are pleased to see them. You can also say that two people hug each other or that they hug.
Example: She had hugged him exuberantly and invited him to dinner the next day.

Definition: If you cuddle someone, you put your arms round them and hold them close as a way of showing your affection.
Example: He cuddled the newborn girl.

Definition: If someone comes up or comes up to you, they approach you until they are standing close to you.
Example: Her cat came up and rubbed itself against their legs.

Definition: If something is urgent, it needs to be dealt with as soon as possible.
Example: There is an urgent need for food and water.

Definition: A sentiment that people have is an attitude which is based on their thoughts and feelings.
Example: Public sentiment rapidly turned anti-American.

Definition: Your intuition or your intuitions are unexplained feelings you have that something is true even when you have no evidence or proof of it.
Example: Her intuition was telling her that something was wrong.

Definition: An emotive situation or issue is likely to make people feel strong emotions.
Example: Embryo research is an emotive issue.

Definition: Something that is delicate is small and beautifully shaped.
Example: He had delicate hands.

Definition: A passionate person has very strong feelings about something or a strong belief in something.
Example: ...his passionate commitment to peace.

Definition: If you are enthusiastic about something, you show how much you like or enjoy it by the way that you behave and talk.
Example: Tom was very enthusiastic about the place.

Definition: Someone or something that is sentimental feels or shows pity or love, sometimes to an extent that is considered exaggerated and foolish.
Example: I'm trying not to be sentimental about the past.

Definition:
Someone who speaks with a particular accent pronounces the words of a language in a distinctive way that shows which country,
region, or social class they come from.
Example: He had developed a slight American accent.

Definition: If someone or something exerts influence, authority, or pressure, they use it in a strong or determined way, especially in order to produce a particular effect.
Example:
He exerted considerable influence on the thinking of the scientific community on
these issues.

Definition: A labourer is a person who does a job which involves a lot of hard physical work.
Example: He has worked as a labourer in factories and on building sites.

Definition: If a part of your body is bare, it is not covered by any clothing.
Example: She was wearing only a thin robe over a flimsy nightdress, and her feet were bare.

Definition: If something that someone says or writes is meaningless, it has no meaning, or appears to have no meaning.
Example: The sentence 'kicked the ball the man' is meaningless.

Definition: A vain attempt or action is one that fails to achieve what was intended.
Example: The drafting committee worked through the night in a vain attempt to finish on schedule.

Definition: If you say that something is pointless, you are criticizing it because it has no sense or purpose.
Example: Violence is always pointless.

Definition: A person's or animal's guts are all the organs inside them.
Example: It is not always necessary to gut the fish prior to freezing.

Definition: If you describe a situation or a feeling as a void, you mean that it seems empty because there is nothing interesting or worthwhile about it.
Example: His death has left a void in the cricketing world which can never be filled.

Definition: To evacuate someone means to send them to a place of safety, away from a dangerous building, town, or area.
Example: They were planning to evacuate the seventy American officials still in the country.

Definition: If you vacate a place or a job, you leave it or give it up, making it available for other people.
Example: He vacated the flat and went to stay with an uncle.

Definition: If someone is empowered to do something, they have the authority or power to do it.
Example: The army is now empowered to operate on a shoot-to-kill basis.

Definition: The expiry of something such as a contract, deadline, or visa is the time that it comes to an end or stops being valid.
Example: ...the expiry of a fixed term contract.

Definition: The extremity of something is its furthest end or edge.
Example: ...a small port on the north-western extremity of the Iberian peninsula.

Definition: Things that interlock or are interlocked go between or through each other so that they are linked.
Example: The parts interlock.

Definition: Mesh is material like a net made from wire, thread, or plastic.
Example: The ground-floor windows are obscured by wire mesh.

Definition: Something that is abundant is present in large quantities.
Example: There is an abundant supply of cheap labour.

Definition: A log is a piece of a thick branch or of the trunk of a tree that has been cut so that it can be used for fuel or for making things.
Example: He dumped the logs on the big stone hearth.

Definition: A continuous process or event continues for a period of time without stopping.
Example: Residents report that they heard continuous gunfire.

Definition: If something is uninterrupted, it is continuous and has no breaks or interruptions in it.
Example: This enables the healing process to continue uninterrupted.

Definition: Exclusively is used to refer to situations or activities that involve only the thing or things mentioned, and nothing else.
Example: ...an exclusively male domain.

Definition: If you are enchanted by someone or something, they cause you to have feelings of great delight or pleasure.
Example: Dena was enchanted by the house.

Definition: Delight is a feeling of very great pleasure.
Example: Throughout the house, the views are a constant source of surprise and delight.

Definition: Ecological means involved with or concerning ecology.
Example: Large dams have harmed Siberia's delicate ecological balance.

Definition: If you pay for something in instalments, you pay small sums of money at regular intervals over a period of time, rather than paying the whole amount at once.
Example: The first instalment of 1 per share is payable on application.

Definition: Things that are identical are exactly the same.
Example: Nearly all the houses were identical.

Definition: If one amount or value is the equivalent of another, they are the same.
Example: The equivalent of two tablespoons of polyunsaturated oils is ample each day.

Definition: The apparatus of an organization or system is its structure and method of operation.
Example: For many years, the country had been buried under the apparatus of the regime.

Definition: A blunder is a stupid or careless mistake.
Example: I think he made a tactical blunder by announcing it so far ahead of time.

Definition: If you  get away, you succeed in leaving a place or a person's company.
Example: She'd gladly have gone anywhere to get away from the cottage.

Definition: When an aeroplane takes off, it leaves the ground and starts flying.
Example: We eventually took off at 11 o'clock and arrived in Venice at 1.30.

Definition: Recreation consists of things that you do in your spare time to relax.
Example: Saturday afternoon is for recreation and outings.

Definition: A distraction is something that turns your attention away from something you want to concentrate on.
Example: I feel this is getting to be a distraction from what I really want to do.

Definition: If something baffles you, you cannot understand it or explain it.
Example: An apple tree producing square fruit is baffling experts.

Definition: If one thing is a prerequisite for another, it must happen or exist before the other thing is possible.
Example: Good self-esteem is a prerequisite for a happy life.

Definition: The necessity of something is the fact that it must happen or exist.
Example: There is agreement on the necessity of reforms.

Definition: You use fundamentally for emphasis when you are stating an opinion, or when you are making an important or general statement about something.
Example: Fundamentally, women like him for his sensitivity and charming vulnerability.

Definition: A celebrated person or thing is famous and much admired.
Example: He was soon one of the most celebrated young painters in England.

Definition: If you describe a person or their work as distinguished, you mean that they have been very successful in their career and have a good reputation.
Example: ...a distinguished academic family.

Definition: the property and claims against debtors that a business enterprise may apply to discharge its liabilities. Assets may be fixed, current, liquid, or intangible and are shown balanced against liabilities
If you make an appraisal of something, you consider it carefully and form an opinion about it.
Example: What is needed in such cases is a calm appraisal of the situation.

Definition: in defiance of; regardless of; notwithstanding
