Example: She's a 35-year-old divorce who somehow manages to look like a fashion plate in spite of the pittance we pay her.

Definition: Drawn is the past participle of draw.
Example: She looked drawn and tired when she turned towards me.

Definition: Sunset is the time in the evening when the sun disappears out of sight from the sky.
Example: The dance ends at sunset.

Definition: Twilight is the time just before night when the daylight has almost gone but when it is not completely dark.
Example: They returned at twilight, and set off for one of the promenade bars.

Definition: Day-to-day things or activities exist or happen every day as part of ordinary life.
Example: I am a vegetarian and use a lot of lentils in my day-to-day cooking.

Definition: Diurnal means happening or active during the daytime.
Example: Kangaroos are diurnal animals.

Definition: Quotidian activities or experiences are basic, everyday activities or experiences.
Example: ...the minutiae of their quotidian existence.

Definition: in all places; everywhere
Example: Get a little louder and a little softer; go higher and lower.

Definition: for an express purpose; with specific intentions
Example: It will be expressly prohibited from selling debt securities.

Definition: If you inspect something, you look at every part of it carefully in order to find out about it or check that it is all right.
Example: Elaine went outside to inspect the playing field.

Definition: the act or process of exploring
Example: Oil companies around the world have been selling forecourts in recent years to focus on exploration and production.

Definition: An exam is a formal test that you take to show your knowledge or ability in a particular subject, or to obtain a qualification.
Example: I don't want to take any more exams.

Definition: If you probe into something, you ask questions or try to discover facts about it.
Example:
The more they probed into his background, the more inflamed their suspicions would
become.

Definition: critical examination
Example: It was like a watchtower, with the town spread out below for his inspection.

Definition: If you analyse something, you consider it carefully or use statistical methods in order to fully understand it.
Example: McCarthy was asked to analyse the data from the first phase of trials of the vaccine.

Definition: If one person or thing surpasses another, the first is better than, or has more of a particular quality than, the second.
Example: He was determined to surpass the achievements of his older brothers.

Definition: Departure or a departure is the act of going away from somewhere.
Example: ...the President's departure for Helsinki.

Definition: A freak event or action is one that is a very unusual or extreme example of its type.
Example: Weir broke his leg in a freak accident playing golf.

Definition: If something is an anomaly, it is different from what is usual or expected.
Example: The computer's software detected an anomaly caused by a virus.

Definition: inspiring new ideas or enthusiasm
Example: Maybe you don't always come across as omniscient, but at least you get the occasional stimulating surprise.

Definition: Something or someone that is inspiring is exciting and makes you feel strongly interested and enthusiastic...
Example: She was one of the most inspiring people I've ever met.

Definition: able to hold the interest or attention of someone
Example: Gripping dramas that weave their stories over multiple series have become increasingly valuable in a rapidly changing industry.

Definition: If you work out a solution to a problem or mystery, you manage to find the solution by thinking or talking about it.
Example: Negotiators are due to meet later today to work out a compromise.

Definition: If you practise something, you keep doing it regularly in order to be able to do it better.
Example: Lauren practises the piano every day.

Definition: A drill is a tool or machine that you use for making holes.
Example: ...pneumatic drills.

Definition: to spend no more than the money one has
Example: You know how it was; Greaves sold anything for a few bob, to make ends meet.

Definition: If people subsist, they are just able to obtain the food or money that they need in order to stay alive.
Example: The prisoners subsisted on one mug of the worst quality porridge three times a day.

Definition: If you envisage something, you imagine that it is true, real, or likely to happen.
Example: He envisages the possibility of establishing direct diplomatic relations in the future.

Definition: If you say that something is costly, you mean that it costs a lot of money, often more than you would want to pay.
Example: Having professionally-made curtains can be costly, so why not make your own?

Definition: costing more than the average
Example: That's what they do with high-priced art books of which they only sell a few thousand copies between them.

Definition: If you describe something as lavish, you mean that it is very elaborate and impressive and a lot of money has been spent on it.
Example: ...a lavish party to celebrate Bryan's fiftieth birthday.

Definition: Someone who is extravagant spends more money than they can afford or uses more of something than is reasonable.
Example: We are not extravagant; restaurant meals are a luxury and designer clothes are out.

Definition: If someone blows something up or if it blows up, it is destroyed by an explosion.
Example: He was jailed for 45 years for trying to blow up a plane.

Definition: When a volcano erupts, it throws out a lot of hot, melted rock called lava, as well as ash and steam.
Example: The volcano erupted, devastating a large area.

Definition: If you  go off someone or something, you stop liking them.
Example: 'Why have they gone off him now?''It could be something he said.'

Definition: A scout is someone who is sent to an area of countryside to find out the position of an enemy army.
Example: They sent two men out in front as scouts.

Definition: An expedition is an organized journey that is made for a particular purpose such as exploration.
Example: ...Byrd's 1928 expedition to Antarctica.

Definition: An outburst of an emotion, especially anger, is a sudden strong expression of that emotion.
Example: ...an outburst of anger.

Definition: Disclosure is the act of giving people new or secret information.
Example: ...insufficient disclosure of negative information about the company.

Definition: If you disclose new or secret information, you tell people about it.
Example: Neither side would disclose details of the transaction.

Definition: Subjection to someone involves being completely controlled by them.
Example: ...their complete subjection to their captors.

Definition: If you have a susceptibility to something unpleasant, you are likely to be affected by it.
Example: ...his increased susceptibility to infections.

Definition: If you describe something as exclusive, you mean that it is limited to people who have a lot of money or who belong to a high social class, and is therefore not available to everyone.
Example: He is already a member of Britain's most exclusive club.

Definition: If something has been done specially for a particular person or purpose, it has been done only for that person or purpose.
Example: ...a soap specially designed for those with sensitive skins.

Definition: If you widen something or if it widens, it becomes greater in measurement from one side or edge to the other.
Example: He had an operation last year to widen a heart artery.

Definition: To prolong something means to make it last longer.
Example: Mr Chesler said foreign military aid was prolonging the war.

Definition: When something lengthens or when you lengthen it, it increases in length.
Example: The evening shadows were lengthening.

Definition: The continuation of something is the fact that it continues, rather than stopping.
Example: It's the coalition forces who are to blame for the continuation of the war.

Definition: The postponement of an event is the act of delaying it happening or arranging for it to take place at a later time than originally planned.
Example: The postponement was due to a dispute over where the talks should be held.

Definition: If something happens for an extended period of time, it happens for a long period of time.
Example: Any child who receives dedicated teaching over an extended period is likely to improve.

Definition: If you talk about the magnitude of something, you are talking about its great size, scale, or importance.
Example: An operation of this magnitude is going to be difficult.

Definition: Alien means belonging to a different country, race, or group, usually one you do not like or are frightened of.
Example: He said they were opposed to the presence of alien forces in the region.

Definition: Something that is exotic is unusual and interesting, usually because it comes from or is related to a distant country.
Example: ...brilliantly coloured, exotic flowers.

Definition: You use additionally to introduce something extra such as an extra fact or reason.
Example:
You can pay bills over the internet. Additionally, you can check your balance or
order statements.

Definition: Furthest means to a greater extent or degree than ever before or than anything or anyone else.
Example: Wages slipped furthest in the retail, customer service and sales sectors.

Definition: The observance of something such as a law or custom is the practice of obeying or following it.
Example: Local councils should use their powers to ensure strict observance of laws.

Definition: Supervision is the supervising of people, activities, or places.
Example: A toddler requires close supervision and firm control at all times.

Definition: Surveillance is the careful watching of someone, especially by an organization such as the police or the army.
Example: He was arrested after being kept under constant surveillance.

Definition: Cloth is fabric which is made by weaving or knitting a substance such as cotton, wool, silk, or nylon. Cloth is used especially for making clothes.
Example: She began cleaning the wound with a piece of cloth.

Definition: If someone will not countenance something, they do not agree with it and will not allow it to happen.
Example: Jake would not countenance Janis's marrying while still a student.

Definition: Amenities are things such as shopping centres or sports facilities that are provided for people's convenience, enjoyment, or comfort.
Example: The hotel amenities include health clubs, conference facilities, and banqueting rooms.

Definition: Certainty is the state of being definite or of having no doubts at all about something.
Example: I have told them with absolute certainty there'll be no change of policy.

Definition: A mill is a building in which grain is crushed to make flour.
Example: ...a pepper mill.

Definition: If you describe someone or something as dull, you mean they are not interesting or exciting.
Example: They are both nice people but can be rather dull.

Definition: If you bleach something, you use a chemical to make it white or pale in colour.
Example: These products don't bleach the hair.

Definition: changed from the original colour, in an undesirable way
Example: Hardin didn't know him, but he did notice a dark, discoloured bruise on his right cheek.

Definition: made lighter in colour
Example: Her long pale yellow hair was bleached in highlights by the summer sun, her arms brushed with a light tan.

Definition: Washed-out colours are very pale.
Example: He stared at me out of those washed-out blue eyes.

Definition: If someone or something withers, they become very weak.
Example: When he went into retirement, he visibly withered.

Definition: If people or animals perish, they die as a result of very harsh conditions or as the result of an accident.
Example: Most of the butterflies perish in the first frosts of autumn.

Definition: When something sags, it hangs down loosely or sinks downwards in the middle.
Example: The shirt's cuffs won't sag and lose their shape after washing.

Definition: If something droops, it hangs or leans downwards with no strength or firmness.
Example: Crook's eyelids drooped.

Definition:
If things or people disappoint you, they are not as good as you had hoped, or do not do what you hoped they would
do.
Example: She knew that she would disappoint him.

Definition: If you neglect someone or something, you fail to look after them properly.
Example: The woman denied that she had neglected her child.

Definition: If you describe an event or an attempt to do something as a fiasco, you are emphasizing that it fails completely.
Example: The blame for the Charleston fiasco did not lie with him.

Definition: The losers of a game, contest, or struggle are the people who are defeated or beaten.
Example: ...the winners and losers of this year's Super Bowl.

Definition: Disappointment is the state of feeling disappointed.
Example: Despite winning the title, their last campaign ended in great disappointment.

Definition: When something such as a dead body, a dead plant, or a tooth decays, it is gradually destroyed by a natural process.
Example: The bodies buried in the fine ash slowly decayed.

Definition: Bankruptcy is the state of being bankrupt.
Example: It is the second airline in two months to file for bankruptcy.

Definition: If you describe someone or something as unbiased, you mean they are fair and not likely to support one particular person or group involved in something.
Example: There is no clear and unbiased information available for consumers.

Definition: Someone who is impartial is not directly involved in a particular situation, and is therefore able to give a fair opinion or decision about it.
Example: As an impartial observer my analysis is supposed to be objective.

Definition: If someone is even-handed, they are completely fair, especially when they are judging other people or dealing with two groups of people.
Example: ...an even-handed account of the ethical arguments involved.

Definition: not prejudiced or biased; impartial
Example: `There must be a few honest and unprejudiced lawyers around.

Definition: Someone or something that is respectable is approved of by society and considered to be morally correct.
Example: He came from a perfectly respectable middle-class family.

Definition: You use positively to emphasize that you really mean what you are saying.
Example: This is positively the worst thing that I can even imagine.

Definition: You use deservedly to indicate that someone deserved what happened to them, especially when it was something good.
Example: He deservedly won the Player of the Year award.

Definition: If someone or something tumbles somewhere, they fall there with a rolling or bouncing movement.
Example: A small boy tumbled off a third floor fire escape.

Definition: If an amount, rate, or price plummets, it decreases quickly by a large amount.
Example: In Tokyo share prices have plummeted for the sixth successive day.

Definition: having rotted as a result of bacterial, fungal, or chemical action; decomposed
Example: The incentive is to leave other decayed teeth.

Definition: If a statement or idea is untrue, it is false and not based on facts.
Example: The allegations were completely untrue.

Definition: A fraudulent activity is deliberately deceitful, dishonest, or untrue.
Example: ...fraudulent claims about being a nurse.

Definition: If you say that a situation is unreal, you mean that it is so strange that you find it difficult to believe it is happening.
Example: It was unreal. Like some crazy childhood nightmare.

Definition: Fraud is the crime of gaining money or financial benefits by a trick or by lying.
Example: He was jailed for two years for fraud and deception.

Definition: Deception is the act of deceiving someone or the state of being deceived by someone.
Example: He admitted conspiring to obtain property by deception.

Definition: An untruth is a lie.
Example: The Advertising Standards Authority accused estate agents of using blatant untruths.

Definition: Deceit is behaviour that is deliberately intended to make people believe something which is not true.
Example: They have been involved in a campaign of deceit.

Definition: Dishonesty is dishonest behaviour.
Example: She accused the government of dishonesty and incompetence.

Definition: The inaccuracy of a statement or measurement is the fact that it is not accurate or correct.
Example: He was disturbed by the inaccuracy of the answers.

Definition: A well-known person or thing is known about by a lot of people and is therefore famous or familiar. If someone is well-known for a particular activity, a lot of people know about them because of their involvement with that activity.
Example: He surrounds himself with attractive, intelligent, or well-known people.

Definition: If someone shows disrespect, they speak or behave in a way that shows lack of respect for a person, law, or custom.
Example: ...young people with complete disrespect for authority.

Definition: lack of modesty; presumption; boldness
Example: He sent her a message the next day to apologise for his forwardness.

Definition: An acquaintance is someone who you have met and know slightly, but not well.
Example: The proprietor was an old acquaintance of his.

Definition: If you are disrespectful, you show no respect in the way that you speak or behave to someone.
Example: ...accusations that he had been disrespectful to the Queen.

Definition: Your parentage is the identity and origins of your parents. For example, if you are of Greek parentage, your parents are Greek.
Example: She's a Londoner of mixed parentage (English and Jamaican).

Definition: publicly acknowledged as excellent
Example: Many acclaimed him as one of the best new managers in the country.

Definition: Someone or something that is notable is important or interesting.
Example: The proposed new structure is notable not only for its height, but for its shape.

Definition: A follower of a particular person, group, or belief is someone who supports or admires this person, group, or belief.
Example:
Followers of the movement were forced to give all their money and possessions to
the group.

Definition: An enthusiast is a person who is very interested in a particular activity or subject and who spends a lot of time on it.
Example: He is a great sports enthusiast.

Definition: If something refreshes you when you have become hot, tired, or thirsty, it makes you feel cooler or more energetic.
Example: The lotion cools and refreshes the skin.

Definition: To stimulate something means to encourage it to begin or develop further.
Example: America's priority is rightly to stimulate its economy.

Definition: If something excites you, it makes you feel very happy, eager, or enthusiastic.
Example: I only take on work that excites me, even if it means turning down lots of money.

Definition: A fairy tale is a story for children involving magical events and imaginary creatures.
Example: She was like a princess in a fairy tale.

Definition:
A romance is a relationship between two people who are in love with each other but who are
not married to each other.
Example: After a whirlwind romance the couple announced their engagement in July.

Definition: If you cultivate land or crops, you prepare land and grow crops on it.
Example: She also cultivated a small garden of her own.

Definition: If you say that something leaves an indelible impression, you mean that it is very unlikely to be forgotten.
Example: My visit to India in 1986 left an indelible impression on me.

Definition: Someone who is overweight weighs more than is considered healthy or attractive.
Example: Being even moderately overweight increases your risk of developing high blood pressure.

Definition: You can describe someone or something as plump to indicate that they are rather fat or rounded.
Example: Maria was small and plump with a mass of curly hair.

Definition: fatness or stoutness of body; obesity
Example: He was not large, and in the past year or so he had begun to show corpulence.

Definition: If you say that someone has flab, you mean they have loose flesh on their body because they are rather fat, especially when you are being critical of them.
Example: Don had a hefty roll of flab overhanging his waistband.

Definition: A person's destiny is everything that happens to them during their life, including what will happen in the future, especially when it is considered to be controlled by someone or something else.
Example: We are masters of our own destiny.

Definition: A patriarch is the male head of a family or tribe.
Example:
The patriarch of the house, Mr Jawad, rules it with a ferocity renowned throughout
the neighbourhood.

Definition: If you condemn something, you say that it is very bad and unacceptable.
Example: Political leaders united yesterday to condemn the latest wave of violence.

Definition: If you regret something that you have done, you wish that you had not done it.
Example: I simply gave in to him, and I've regretted it ever since.

Definition: A spotlight is a powerful light, for example in a theatre, which can be directed so that it lights up a small area.
Example: The budget crisis also spotlighted a weakening American economy.

Definition: Ardour is a strong, intense feeling of love or enthusiasm for someone or something.
Example: ...songs of genuine passion and ardour.

Definition: If you regard someone or something with affection, you like them and are fond of them.
Example: She thought of him with affection.

Definition: A phone's receiver is the part that you hold near to your ear and speak into.
Example:
A built-in TMC radio receiver picked up information about tailbacks, and alerted
us promptly to a motorway hold-up.

Definition: A meadow is a field which has grass and flowers growing in it.
Example: Their herds of sheep were taken in off the fields and meadows and plains.

Definition: An arena is a place where sports, entertainments, and other public events take place. It has seats around it where people sit and watch.
Example: ...the largest indoor sports arena in the world.

Definition: Empirical evidence or study relies on practical experience rather than theories.
Example: There is no empirical evidence to support his thesis.

Definition: If you strive to do something or strive for something, you make a great effort to do it or get it.
Example: He strives hard to keep himself very fit.

Definition: to argue or fight
Combat is fighting that takes place in a war.
Example: Over 16 million men had died in combat.

Definition: A brawl is a rough or violent fight.
Example: He had been in a drunken street brawl.

Definition: If you pluck a fruit, flower, or leaf, you take it between your fingers and pull it in order to remove it from its stalk where it is growing.
Example: I plucked a lemon from the tree.

Definition: If you repress a feeling, you make a deliberate effort not to show or have this feeling.
Example: People who repress their emotions risk having nightmares.

Definition: A boxer is someone who takes part in the sport of boxing.
Example: Certainly some veteran boxer shorts have vanished.

Definition: A pugilist is a boxer.
Example: He was a priest, but a sinister one: swarthy, blunt-featured and built like a pugilist.

Definition: If two things or people have a likeness to each other, they are similar to each other.
Example: These myths have a startling likeness to one another.

Definition: A personage is a famous or important person.
Example: ...MPs, film stars and other important personages.

Definition: If facts or events do not  add up, they make you confused about a situation because they do not seem to be consistent. If something that someone has said or done adds up, it is reasonable and sensible.
Example: Police said they arrested Olivia because her statements did not add up.

Definition: A folder is a thin piece of cardboard in which you can keep loose papers.
Example: He took out a folder containing my proposal and slammed it on his desk.

Definition:
A dossier is a collection of papers containing information on a particular event, or on a person
such as a criminal or a spy.
Example: The company is compiling a dossier of evidence to back its allegations.

Definition: A parade is a procession of people or vehicles moving through a public place in order to celebrate an important day or event.
Example: A military parade marched slowly and solemnly down Pennsylvania Avenue.

Definition: If people or things saturate a place or object, they fill it completely so that no more can be added.
Example: In the last days before the vote, both sides are saturating the airwaves.

Definition: If something pervades a place or thing, it is a noticeable feature throughout it.
Example: The smell of sawdust and glue pervaded the factory.

Definition: If an idea, feeling, or attitude permeates a system or permeates society, it affects every part of it or is present throughout it.
Example: Bias against women permeates every level of the judicial system.

Definition: A gorge is a deep, narrow valley with very steep sides, usually where a river passes through mountains or an area of hard rock.
Example: I could spend each day gorging on chocolate.

Definition: If there is a glut of something, there is so much of it that it cannot all be sold or used.
Example: There's a glut of agricultural products in Western Europe.

Definition: A cinema is a place where people go to watch films for entertainment.
Example: The country has relatively few cinemas.

Definition: If a decision, action, or change is irrevocable, it cannot be changed or reversed.
Example: It may well be worth waiting for better times before making any irrevocable commitment.

Definition: Something that is definitive provides a firm conclusion that cannot be questioned.
Example: No one has come up with a definitive answer as to why this should be so.

Definition: If you say that something has happened at last or at long last, you mean it has happened after you have been hoping for it for a long time.
Example: I'm so glad that we've found you at last!

Definition: If someone unearths facts or evidence about something bad, they discover them with difficulty, usually because they were being kept secret or were being lied about.
Example: Researchers have unearthed documents linking her to the forced adoption of children.

Definition: If you procure something, especially something that is difficult to get, you obtain it.
Example: It remained very difficult to procure food, fuel and other daily necessities.

Definition: Something that is satisfactory is acceptable to you or fulfils a particular need or purpose.
Example: I never got a satisfactory answer.

Definition: If you say that someone or something is all right, you mean that you find them satisfactory or acceptable.
Example: Is it all right with you if we go now?

Definition: A refined substance has been made pure by having other substances removed from it.
Example: ...refined sugar.

Definition: If a person or thing is worthy of something, they deserve it because they have the qualities or abilities required.
Example: The bank might think you're worthy of a loan.

Definition: If you describe a person, organization, or cause as deserving, you mean that you think they should be helped.
Example: The money saved could be used for more deserving causes.

Definition: When it is sunny, the sun is shining brightly.
Example: The weather was surprisingly warm and sunny.

Definition: If you forfeit something, you lose it or are forced to give it up because you have broken a rule or done something wrong.
Example: He was ordered to forfeit more than 1.5m in profits.

Definition: If a person or group is penalized for something, they are made to suffer in some way because of it.
Example: Some of the players may, on occasion, break the rules and be penalized.

Definition: A digit is a written symbol for any of the ten numbers from 0 to 9.
Example: Her telephone number differs from mine by one digit.

Definition: Your thumb is the short thick part on the side of your hand next to your four fingers.
Example: She bit the tip of her left thumb, not looking at me.

Definition: If you finalize something such as a plan or an agreement, you complete the arrangements for it, especially by discussing it with other people.
Example: Negotiators from the three countries finalized the agreement in August.

Definition: If you refer to a fire as an inferno, you mean that it is burning fiercely and causing great destruction.
Example: Rescue workers fought to get to victims inside the inferno.

Definition: If someone detonates a device such as a bomb, or if it detonates, it explodes.
Example: Their underground vehicle hit a trip wire that detonated a bomb.

Definition: A bombardment is a strong and continuous attack of gunfire or bombing.
Example: The city has been flattened by heavy artillery bombardments.

Definition: Condemnation is the act of saying that something or someone is very bad and unacceptable.
Example: There was widespread condemnation of Saturday's killings.

Definition: Compact things are small or take up very little space. You use this word when you think this is a good quality.
Example: ...my compact office in Washington.

Definition: Something that is dense contains a lot of things or people in a small area.
Example: Where Bucharest now stands, there once was a large, dense forest.

Definition: the quality or condition of being hard
Example: He felt the hardness of the iron railing press against his spine.

Definition: If something is done safely, it is done in a way that makes it unlikely that anyone will be harmed.
Example: The waste is safely locked away until it is no longer radioactive.

Definition: A strict rule or order is very clear and precise or severe and must always be obeyed completely.
Example: The officials had issued strict instructions that we were not to get out of the jeep.

Definition: If you describe a feeling or attitude as unwavering, you mean that it is strong and firm and does not weaken.
Example: She has been encouraged by the unwavering support of her family.

Definition: If you describe someone's attitude, feeling, or way of behaving as unswerving, you mean that it is strong and firm and does not weaken or change.
Example: In his diary of 1944, he proclaims unswerving loyalty to the monarchy.

Definition: If you describe someone's beliefs as unshakeable, you are emphasizing that they are so strong that they cannot be destroyed or altered.
Example: William has acquired an unshakeable belief in himself.

Definition: You use strictly to emphasize that something is of one particular type, or intended for one particular thing or person, rather than any other.
Example: He seemed fond of her in a strictly professional way.

Definition: If you are determined to do something, you have made a firm decision to do it and will not let anything stop you.
Example: His enemies are determined to ruin him.

Definition: If you have a settled way of life, you stay in one place, in one job, or with one person, rather than moving around or changing.
Example: He decided to lead a more settled life with his partner.

Definition: If one thing is inseparable from another, the things are so closely connected that they cannot be considered separately.
Example: He firmly believes liberty is inseparable from social justice.

Definition: You use to begin with when you are talking about the first stage of a situation, event, or process.
Example: It was great to begin with but now it's difficult.

Definition: Novelty is the quality of being different, new, and unusual.
Example: After a few hours, however, the novelty wore off.

Definition: the quality or condition of being original
Example: No originality and no great melody.

Definition: If you trawl through a large number of similar things, you search through them looking for something that you want or something that is suitable for a particular purpose.
Example: A team of officers is trawling through the records of thousands of petty thieves.

Definition: Angling is the activity or sport of fishing with a fishing rod.
Example: Why all this in an angling column?

Definition: If you insert an object into something, you put the object inside it.
Example: He took a small key from his pocket and slowly inserted it into the lock.

Definition: Someone who is competent is efficient and effective.
Example: He was a loyal, distinguished and very competent civil servant.

Definition: Competence is the ability to do something well or effectively.
Example:
His competence as an economist had been reinforced by his successful fight against
inflation.

Definition: Vigour is physical or mental energy and enthusiasm.
Example: His body lacks the bounce and vigour of a normal two-year-old.

Definition: If someone has a seizure, they have a sudden violent attack of an illness, especially one that affects their heart or brain.
Example: ...a mild cardiac seizure.

Definition: A spasm is a sudden tightening of your muscles, which you cannot control.
Example: A muscular spasm in the coronary artery can cause a heart attack.

Definition: If there is an outbreak of something unpleasant, such as violence or a disease, it suddenly starts to happen.
Example:
The festival ended a day early after an outbreak of violence involving hundreds of
youths.

Definition: If you repair something that has been damaged or is not working properly, you mend it.
Example: Goldsmith has repaired the roof to ensure the house is wind-proof.

Definition: If you mend something that is broken or not working, you repair it, so that it works properly or can be used.
Example: They took a long time to mend the roof.

Definition: to make neat; tidy
Example: Use a large knife to trim and neaten the edges.

Definition: Something that is tidy is neat and is arranged in an organized way.
Example: Having a tidy desk can seem impossible if you have a busy, demanding job.

Definition: If someone rigs an election, a job appointment, or a game, they dishonestly arrange it to get the result they want or to give someone an unfair advantage.
Example: She accused her opponents of rigging the vote.

Definition: A dose of medicine or a drug is a measured amount of it which is intended to be taken at one time.
Example: One dose of penicillin can wipe out the infection.

Definition: If you have an injection, a doctor or nurse puts a medicine into your body using a device with a needle called a syringe.
Example: They gave me an injection to help me sleep.

Definition: A banner is a long strip of cloth with something written on it. Banners are usually attached to two poles and carried during a protest or rally.
Example: ...a large crowd of students carrying banners denouncing the government.

Definition: A spark is a tiny bright piece of burning material that flies up from something that is burning.
Example: The fire gradually got bigger and bigger. Sparks flew off in all directions.

Definition: Something that is horizontal is flat and level with the ground, rather than at an angle to it.
Example: The board consists of vertical and horizontal lines.

Definition: To be prone to something, usually something bad, means to have a tendency to be affected by it or to do it.
Example: For all her experience, she was still prone to nerves.

Definition: If a part of the body of a person or animal is outstretched, it is stretched out as far as possible.
Example: She came to Anna, her arms outstretched.

Definition: If there is uniformity in something such as a system, organization, or group of countries, the same rules, ideas, or methods are applied in all parts of it.
Example: Spanish liberals sought to create linguistic as well as administrative uniformity.

Definition: Someone or something boring is so dull and uninteresting that they make people tired and impatient.
Example:
Not only are mothers not paid but also most of their boring or difficult work is
unnoticed.

Definition: A feeling of emptiness is an unhappy or frightening feeling that nothing is worthwhile, especially when you are very tired or have just experienced something upsetting.
Example: The result later in life may be feelings of emptiness and depression.

Definition: If you talk about the tedium of a job, task, or situation, you think it is boring and rather frustrating.
Example: She began to wonder whether she wouldn't go mad with the tedium of the job.

Definition: The monotony of something is the fact that it never changes and is boring.
Example: A night on the town may help to break the monotony of the week.

Definition: Something that is monotonous is very boring because it has a regular, repeated pattern which never changes.
Example: It's monotonous work, like most factory jobs.

Definition: Flavourings are substances that are added to food or drink to give it a particular taste.
Example: Our range of herbal teas contain no preservatives, colourings or artificial flavourings.

Definition: If you savour an experience, you enjoy it as much as you can.
Example: She savored her newfound freedom.

Definition: A spice is a part of a plant, or a powder made from that part, which you put in food to give it flavour. Cinnamon, ginger, and paprika are spices.
Example: ...herbs and spices.

Definition: To enrich something means to improve its quality, usually by adding something to it.
Example: An extended family enriches life in many ways.

Definition: If you run away from a place, you leave it because you are unhappy there.
Example: I ran away from home when I was sixteen.

Definition: the quality or state of being sensual
Example: With your partner, focus on intimacy and sensuality initially.

Definition: If an object is pressed into a pulp, it is crushed or beaten until it is soft, smooth, and wet.
Example: The olives are crushed to a pulp by stone rollers.

Definition: A voyage is a long journey on a ship or in a spacecraft.
Example: He aims to follow Columbus's voyage to the West Indies.

Definition: Aviation is the operation and production of aircraft.
Example: This is strictly prohibited in accordance with international civil aviation law.

Definition: A flying animal has wings and is able to fly.
Example: ...species of flying insects.

Definition: If you glide somewhere, you move silently and in a smooth and effortless way.
Example: Waiters glide between tightly packed tables bearing trays of pasta.

Definition: If sounds or smells waft through the air, or if something such as a light wind wafts them, they move gently through the air.
Example: The scent of climbing roses wafts through the window.

Definition: A storey of a building is one of its different levels, which is situated above or below other levels.
Example: Houses must not be more than two storeys high.

Definition: A tier is a row or layer of something that has other layers above or below it.
Example: ...the auditorium with the tiers of seats around and above it.

Definition: If something disconcerts you, it makes you feel anxious, confused, or embarrassed.
Example: Antony's wry smile disconcerted Sutcliffe.

Definition: A stump is a small part of something that remains when the rest of it has been removed or broken off.
Example: If you have a tree stump, check it for fungus.

Definition: If someone or something confounds you, they make you feel surprised or confused, often by showing you that your opinions or expectations of them were wrong.
Example: He momentarily confounded his critics by his cool handling of the hostage crisis.

Definition: If there is a flood, a large amount of water covers an area which is usually dry, for example when a river flows over its banks or a pipe bursts.
Example: More than 70 people were killed in the floods, caused when a dam burst.

Definition: A bloom is the flower on a plant.
Example: ...the sweet fragrance of the white blooms.

Definition: Blossom is the flowers that appear on a tree before the fruit.
Example: The cherry blossom came out early in Washington this year.

Definition: If something flourishes, it is successful, active, or common, and developing quickly and strongly.
Example: Business flourished and within six months they were earning 18,000 roubles a day.

Definition: If the amount, value, level, or volume of something soars, it quickly increases by a great deal.
Example: Insurance claims are expected to soar.

Definition: When you steer a car, boat, or plane, you control it so that it goes in the direction that you want.
Example: What is it like to steer a ship this size?

Definition: If an aircraft is airborne, it is in the air and flying.
Example: The pilot did manage to get airborne.

Definition: having little or no attachment
Example: floating capital

Definition: A speedy process, event, or action happens or is done very quickly.
Example: We wish Bill a speedy recovery.

Definition: A hurried action is done quickly, because you do not have much time in which to do it.
Example: ...a hurried breakfast.

Definition: undertaken quickly or without much care; hurried
Example: Red lights burned in my sockets, swimming to green, then black and white lines rushed towards me, going to black.

Definition: Fleeting is used to describe something which lasts only for a very short time.
Example: The girls caught only a fleeting glimpse of the driver.

Definition: When something or someone departs from a place, they leave it and start a journey to another place.
Example: Our tour departs from Heathrow Airport on 31 March and returns 16 April.

Definition: If you obey a person, a command, or an instruction, you do what you are told to do.
Example: Cissie obeyed her mother without question.

Definition: Successive means happening or existing one after another without a break.
Example: Jackson was the winner for a second successive year.

Definition: Ensuing events happen immediately after other events.
Example: The ensuing argument had been bitter.

Definition: If something provides a person, animal, or plant with nourishment, it provides them with the food that is necessary for life, growth, and good health.
Example: The mother provides the embryo with nourishment and a place to grow.

Definition: to sell or pass off (something, esp an inferior article) as genuine, valuable, etc
Example: This tough policy was not foisted on reluctant tenants by councillors.

Definition: To propel something in a particular direction means to cause it to move in that direction.
Example: Floor the accelerator pedal and you are propelled forward in a wave of power.

Definition: If you wrench something that is fixed in a particular position, you pull or twist it violently, in order to move or remove it.
Example: He felt two men wrench the suitcase from his hand.

Definition: to force open by levering
Example: Friends who work together can share prize news.

Definition: Extraneous things are not relevant or essential to the situation you are involved in or the subject you are talking about.
Example: We ought not to bring in extraneous matters in trying to find a basis for a settlement.

Definition: If something is unfamiliar to you, you know nothing or very little about it, because you have not seen or experienced it before.
Example: She grew many wonderful plants that were unfamiliar to me.

Definition: A grove is a group of trees that are close together.
Example: ...open fields and groves of trees.

Definition: If you omit someone or something, you do not include them in an activity or piece of work, deliberately or accidentally.
Example: Omit the salt in this recipe.

Definition: A configuration is an arrangement of a group of things.
Example: ...Stonehenge, in south-western England, an ancient configuration of giant stones.

Definition: A mould is a hollow container that you pour liquid into. When the liquid becomes solid, it takes the same shape as the mould.
Example: Spoon the mixture carefully into the mould.

Definition: A questionnaire is a written list of questions which are answered by a lot of people in order to provide information for a report or a survey.
Example: Headteachers will be asked to fill in a questionnaire.

Definition: Something that is stiff is firm or does not bend easily.
Example: The furniture was stiff, uncomfortable, too delicate, and too neat.

Definition: Someone who is detached is not personally involved in something or has no emotional interest in it.
Example: He tries to remain emotionally detached from the prisoners, but fails.

Definition: Someone who is aloof is not very friendly and does not like to spend time with other people.
Example: He seemed aloof and detached.

Definition: officially permitted or empowered
Example: my authorized agent

Definition: Something that is ceremonial relates to a ceremony or is used in a ceremony.
Example: He represented the nation on ceremonial occasions.

Definition: Someone or something that is solemn is very serious rather than cheerful or humorous.
Example: His solemn little face broke into smiles.

Definition: If you use established to describe something such as an organization, you mean that it is officially recognized or generally approved of because it has existed for a long time.
Example: Their religious adherence is not to the established church.

Definition: If something is symmetrical, it has two halves which are exactly the same, except that one half is the mirror image of the other.
Example: ...the neat rows of perfectly symmetrical windows.

Definition: The constitution of a country or organization is the system of laws which formally states people's rights and duties.
Example: The king was forced to adopt a new constitution which reduced his powers.

Definition: One-time is used to describe something such as a job, position, or role which someone used to have, or something which happened in the past.
Example: The legislative body had voted to oust the country's onetime rulers.

Definition: You use erstwhile to describe someone that used to be the type of person indicated, but no longer is.
Example: Erstwhile workers may have become managers.

Definition: Bygone means happening or existing a very long time ago.
Example: The book recalls other memories of a bygone age.

Definition: wealth; an abundance of money, valuable possessions, or property
Example: His rags to riches story struck a chord with all football fans last season.

Definition: If you describe someone or their behaviour as presumptuous, you disapprove of them because they are doing something that they have no right or authority to do.
Example: It would be presumptuous to judge what the outcome will be.

Definition: If someone talks or behaves in a rather impolite and disrespectful way, you can call this behaviour impertinence or an impertinence.
Example: He was punished for his impertinence.

Definition: reasonable knowledge or acquaintance, as with a subject or place
Example: New signings all looked useful and familiarity is certain to bring further improvements.

Definition: a structure of masonry, concrete, etc, placed beneath a wall to provide support
Example: It would be foolish not to borrow to rebuild the underpinnings of our economic wealth.

Definition: The groundwork for something is the early work on it which forms the basis for further work.
Example: Yesterday's meeting was to lay the groundwork for the task ahead.

Definition: The bedrock of something is the principles, ideas, or facts on which it is based.
Example: Mutual trust is the bedrock of a relationship.

Definition: If you describe something as the mainstay of a particular thing, you mean that it is the most basic part of it.
Example: Fish and rice were the mainstays of the country's diet.

Definition: If people erect something such as a building, bridge, or barrier, they build it or create it.
Example:
Opposition demonstrators have erected barricades in roads leading to the parliament
building.

Definition: A justification for something is an acceptable reason or explanation for it.
Example: To me the only justification for a zoo is educational.

Definition: If something submerges or if you submerge it, it goes below the surface of some water or another liquid.
Example: Hippos are unable to submerge in the few remaining water holes.

Definition: A casing is a substance or object that covers something and protects it.
Example: ...the outer casings of missiles.

Definition: If you devise a plan, system, or machine, you have the idea for it and design it.
Example: We devised a scheme to help him.

Definition: If you are complimentary about something, you express admiration for it.
Example: The staff have been very complimentary, and so have the customers.

Definition: free; at no cost
Example: Old-fashioned banks were not built with marble halls for nothing.

Definition: If you do unpaid work or are an unpaid worker, you do a job without receiving any money for it.
Example: Even unpaid work for charity is better than nothing.

Definition: If an activity is unrestricted, you are free to do it in the way that you want, without being limited by any rules.
Example: Freedom to pursue extra-curricular activities is totally unrestricted.

Definition: If something moves or happens unimpeded, it continues without being stopped or interrupted by anything.
Example: We drove, unimpeded by anyone, to Arras.

Definition: If you disengage something, or if it disengages, it becomes separate from something which it has been attached to.
Example: She disengaged the film advance mechanism on the camera.

Definition: Someone who is unemployed does not have a job.
Example: The problem is millions of people are unemployed.

Definition: If people who were working are idle, they have no jobs or work.
Example: Employees have been idle almost a month because of shortages.

Definition: If you disentangle a complicated or confused situation, you make it easier to understand or manage to understand it, by clearly recognizing each separate element.
Example: In this new book, Harrison brilliantly disentangles complex debates.

Definition: If you extricate yourself or another person from a difficult or serious situation, you free yourself or the other person from it.
Example:
It represents a last ditch attempt by the country to extricate itself from its economic
crisis.

Definition: Sovereignty is the power that a country has to govern itself or another country or state.
Example: Britain's concern to protect national sovereignty is far from new.

Definition: Liberty is the freedom to live your life in the way that you want, without interference from other people or the authorities.
Example:
Wit Wolzek claimed the legislation could impinge on privacy, self determination and
respect for religious liberty.

Definition: the act of freeing or state of being freed; liberation
Example: The vital role played by women at home in factories and mills and as nurses at the front advanced the case for female emancipation after the war.

Definition: an exempting or being exempted; freedom or release from a liability, obligation, etc.; immunity
Example: The Fardohnyans have been given a special exemption by the Church.

Definition: If you stiffen, you stop moving and stand or sit with muscles that are suddenly tense, for example because you feel afraid or angry.
Example: Ada stiffened at the sound of his voice.

Definition: If there is a recurrence of something, it happens again.
Example: Police are out in force to prevent a recurrence of the violence.

Definition: If there is a repetition of an event, usually an undesirable event, it happens again.
Example: The government has taken measures to prevent a repetition of last year's confrontation.

Definition: Repeated actions or events are ones which happen many times.
Example: He did not return the money, despite repeated reminders.

Definition: If you describe something as invigorating, you mean that it makes you feel more energetic.
Example: ...the bright Finnish sun and invigorating northern air.

Definition: A brisk activity or action is done quickly and in an energetic way.
Example: Taking a brisk walk can often induce a feeling of well-being.

Definition: If you say that someone has a rosy face, you mean that they have pink cheeks and look very healthy.
Example: Bethan's round, rosy face seemed hardly to have aged at all.

Definition: A companion is someone who you spend time with or who you are travelling with.
Example: Fred had been her constant companion for the last six years of her life.

Definition: If an organization or an individual sponsors something such as an event or someone's training, they pay some or all of the expenses connected with it, often in order to get publicity for themselves.
Example:
Mercury, in association with The Independent, is sponsoring Britain's first major
Pop Art exhibition for over 20 years.

Definition: When people have an amicable relationship, they are pleasant to each other and solve their problems without quarrelling.
Example: The meeting ended on reasonably amicable terms.

Definition: Amiability is the quality of being friendly and pleasant.
Example: I found his amiability charming.

Definition: If people are living in harmony with each other, they are living together peacefully rather than fighting or arguing.
Example: We must try to live in peace and harmony with ourselves and those around us.

Definition: Goodwill is a friendly or helpful attitude towards other people, countries, or organizations.
Example: I invited them to dinner, a gesture of goodwill.

Definition: The exterior of something is its outside surface.
Example: In one ad the viewer scarcely sees the car's exterior.

Definition: Facing is fabric which is stitched inside the edges of a piece of clothing in order to make them look neat and strengthen them.
Example: Her gaze was still unfocused, but the head was at least facing the right direction.

Definition: The facade of a building, especially a large one, is its front wall or the wall that faces the street.
Example: They hid the troubles plaguing their marriage behind a facade of family togetherness.

Definition: In a seaside town, the promenade is the road by the sea where people go for a walk.
Example: People came out in smarter clothes to promenade along the front.

Definition: A boulevard is a wide street in a city, usually with trees along each side.
Example: ...Lenton Boulevard.

Definition: If someone is in the vanguard of something such as a revolution or an area of research, they are involved in the most advanced part of it. You can also refer to the people themselves as the vanguard.
Example: They are in the vanguard of a movement reshaping the computer industry.

Definition: If you are in disguise, you are not wearing your usual clothes or you have altered your appearance in other ways, so that people will not recognize you.
Example: You'll have to travel in disguise.

Definition: A reward is something that you are given, for example because you have behaved well, worked hard, or provided a service to the community.
Example: Never give children sweets, biscuits or cakes as a reward for being good.

Definition: Petrol is a liquid which is used as a fuel for motor vehicles.
Example: That's up to five times cheaper than petrol.

Definition: If something inflames a situation or inflames people's feelings, it makes people feel even more strongly about something.
Example: The General holds the rebels responsible for inflaming the situation.

Definition: To be replete with something means to be full of it.
Example: The Harbor was replete with boats.

Definition: A swelling is a raised, curved shape on the surface of your body which appears as a result of an injury or an illness.
Example: His eye was partly closed, and there was a swelling over his lid.

Definition: the state of being entire or whole; completeness
Example: It touches on the entirety of life as sacred.

Definition: The totality of something is the whole of it.
Example: ...a process of change which involves the totality of human experience.

Definition: Sufficiency of something is enough of that thing to achieve a purpose or to fulfil a need.
Example: There were doubts over the sufficiency of the evidence.

Definition: You use maximum to describe an amount which is the largest that is possible, allowed, or required.
Example: Under planning law the maximum height for a fence or hedge is 2 metres.

Definition: If you describe an event or a period of time as eventful, you mean that a lot of interesting, exciting, or important things have happened during it.
Example: Her eventful life included holding senior positions in the Colonial Service.

Definition: Something that is rounded is curved in shape, without any points or sharp edges.
Example: ...a low rounded hill.

Definition: If you describe a woman as voluptuous, you mean that she has large breasts and hips and is considered attractive in a sexual way.
Example: ...a voluptuous, well-rounded lady with glossy black hair.

Definition: If you describe a woman as shapely, you mean that she has an attractively curvy body.
Example: ...their shapely legs.

Definition: Something that is voluminous is very large or contains a lot of things.
Example: ...a voluminous trench coat.

Definition: If a piece of clothing is baggy, it hangs loosely on your body.
Example: ...a baggy jumper.

Definition: more than sufficiently; fully; generously
Example: They are being amply rewarded for their efforts.

Definition: Amusement is the feeling that you have when you think that something is funny or amusing.
Example: He stopped and watched with amusement to see the child so absorbed.

Definition: The underlying features of an object, event, or situation are not obvious, and it may be difficult to discover or reveal them.
Example: To stop a problem you have to understand its underlying causes.

Definition: A burial is the act or ceremony of putting a dead body into a grave in the ground.
Example: The priest prepared the body for burial.

Definition: If someone or something is humorous, they are amusing, especially in a clever or witty way.
Example: He was quite humorous, and I liked that about him.

Definition: Someone or something that is amusing makes you laugh or smile.
Example: He had a terrific sense of humour and could be very amusing.

Definition: If you describe something as comical, you mean that it makes you want to laugh because it seems funny or silly.
Example: Her expression is almost comical.

Definition: serving to entertain or give pleasure; diverting; amusing
Example: We sit out here at night, and the patio's nice for entertaining.

Definition: If you describe someone or something as peculiar, you think that they are strange or unusual, sometimes in an unpleasant way.
Example: Mr Kennet has a rather peculiar sense of humour.

Definition: If you feel queasy or if you have a queasy stomach, you feel rather ill, as if you are going to be sick.
Example: He was very prone to seasickness and already felt queasy.

Definition: A quip is a remark that is intended to be amusing or clever.
Example: The commentators make endless quips about the female players' appearance.

Definition: A pun is a clever and amusing use of a word or phrase with two meanings, or of words with the same sound but different meanings. For example, if someone says 'The peasants are revolting', this is a pun because it can be interpreted as meaning either that the peasants are fighting against authority, or that they are disgusting.
Example: He is constantly punning, constantly playing with language.

Definition: Hereafter means from this time onwards.
Example: I realised how hard life was going to be for me hereafter.

Definition: A forthcoming event is planned to happen soon.
Example: ...his opponents in the forthcoming elections.

Definition: Your outlook is your general attitude towards life.
Example: The illness had a profound effect on his outlook.

Definition: If you lobby someone such as a member of a government or council, you try to persuade them that a particular law should be changed or that a particular thing should be done.
Example:
Carers from all over the U.K. lobbied Parliament last week to demand a better financial
deal.

Definition: A corridor is a long passage in a building, with doors and rooms on one or both sides.
Example: The republic lay in a narrow corridor of disputed land.

Definition: A pastime is something that you do in your spare time because you enjoy it or are interested in it.
Example: His favourite pastime is golf.

Definition: A diversion is an action or event that attracts your attention away from what you are doing or concentrating on.
Example: The robbers threw smoke bombs to create a diversion.

Definition: A creature's prey are the creatures that it hunts and eats in order to live.
Example: These animals were the prey of hyenas.

Definition: A quarry is an area that is dug out from a piece of land or the side of a mountain in order to get stone or minerals.
Example: ...an old limestone quarry.

Definition: An interval between two events or dates is the period of time between them.
Example: The ferry service has restarted after an interval of 12 years.

Definition: A recess is a break between the periods of work of an official body such as a committee, a court of law, or a government.
Example: The conference broke for a recess.

Definition: something that interrupts, such as a comment, question, or action
Example: The whole adds up to a book that takes some time to read, because there are so many interruptions for laughter.

Definition: A gulf is an important or significant difference between two people, things, or groups.
Example: Within society, there is a growing gulf between rich and poor.

Definition: When people congregate, they gather together and form a group.
Example: Youngsters love to congregate here in the evenings.

Definition: When you accumulate things or when they accumulate, they collect or are gathered over a period of time.
Example: Households accumulate wealth across a broad spectrum of assets.

Definition: If you muster something such as support, strength, or energy, you gather as much of it as you can in order to do something.
Example: He travelled around West Africa trying to muster support for his movement.

Definition: If you tuck something somewhere, you put it there so that it is safe, comfortable, or neat.
Example: He tried to tuck his flapping shirt inside his trousers.

Definition: A homosexual relationship is a sexual relationship between people of the same sex.
Example: A fraud trial involving two homosexual lawyers was abandoned.

Definition: Lesbian is used to describe gay women.
Example: Many of her best friends were lesbian.

Definition: personal property or belongings
Example: Many of those effects would now be produced on computer.

Definition: You can use broadly to indicate that something is generally true.
Example: The President broadly got what he wanted out of his meeting.

Definition: Principally means more than anything else.
Example: This is principally because the major export markets are slowing.

Definition: To manufacture something means to make it in a factory, usually in large quantities.
Example: They manufacture the class of plastics known as thermoplastic materials.

Definition: Wax is a solid, slightly shiny substance made of fat or oil which is used to make candles and polish. It melts when it is heated.
Example: There were coloured candles which had spread pools of wax on the furniture.

Definition: To induce a state or condition means to cause it.
Example: Doctors said surgery could induce a heart attack.

Definition: If you inherit money or property, you receive it from someone who has died.
Example: He has no son to inherit his land.

Definition: A phantom is a ghost.
Example: They vanished down the stairs like two phantoms.

Definition: If you refer to the spectre of something unpleasant, you are referring to something that you are frightened might occur.
Example: Failure to arrive at a consensus over the issue raised the spectre of legal action.

Definition: If you refer to someone as an ogre, you are saying in a humorous way that they are very frightening.
Example: Bank managerslike tax inspectorsdo not really like being thought of as ogres.

Definition: If you describe someone as a titan of a particular field, you mean that they are very important and powerful or successful in that field.
Example: ...the country's two richest business titans.

Definition: Genius is very great ability or skill in a particular subject or activity.
Example: This is the mark of her real genius as a designer.

Definition: Someone who is talented has a natural ability to do something well.
Example: Howard is a talented pianist.

Definition: Someone who is skilled has the knowledge and ability to do something well.
Example: Not all doctors are skilled in helping their patients make choices.

Definition: A lass is a young woman or girl.
Example: Anne is a Lancashire lass from Longton, near Preston.

Definition: When you confer with someone, you discuss something with them in order to make a decision. You can also say that two people confer.
Example: He conferred with Hill and the others in his office.

Definition: If you are inclined to behave in a particular way, you often behave in that way, or you want to do so.
Example: Nobody felt inclined to argue with Smith.

Definition: Someone who is addicted to a harmful drug cannot stop taking it.
Example: Many of the women are addicted to heroin and cocaine.

Definition: If you are disposed to do something, you are willing or eager to do it.
Example: We passed one or two dwellings, but were not disposed to stop.

Definition: You can add happily to a statement to indicate that you are glad that something happened or is true.
Example: Happily, his neck injuries were not serious.

Definition: Freely means many times or in large quantities.
Example: We have referred freely to his ideas.

Definition: If you peek at something or someone, you have a quick look at them, often secretly.
Example: On two occasions she had peeked at him through a crack in the wall.

Definition: When you scan written material, you look through it quickly in order to find important or interesting information.
Example: She scanned the advertisement pages of the newspapers.

Definition: If you get a glimpse of someone or something, you see them very briefly and not very well.
Example:
Some of the fans had waited 24 hours outside the hotel to catch a glimpse of the
singer.

Definition: If you peep, or peep at something, you have a quick look at it, often secretly and quietly.
Example: Children came to peep at him round the doorway.

Definition: If something exists or happens worldwide, it exists or happens throughout the world.
Example: His books have sold more than 20 million copies worldwide.

Definition: Gauntlets are long, thick, protective gloves.
Example: ...a pair of black leather driving gauntlets.

Definition: When a bell tolls or when someone tolls it, it rings slowly and repeatedly, often as a sign that someone has died.
Example: Church bells tolled and black flags fluttered.

Definition: When a bell or a clock chimes, it makes ringing sounds.
Example: He heard the front doorbell chime.

Definition: A deity is a god or goddess.
Example: The power of these female deities was fierce and unambiguous.

Definition: Divinity is the study of religion.
Example: He entered Otago University to study arts and divinity.

Definition: Blond or blonde  hair can be very light brown or light yellow.
Example: There were two little girls, one Asian and one with blonde hair.

Definition: If your opinion or your reaction is favourable to something, you agree with it and approve of it.
Example:
The portraits attracted favourable comment when exhibited in the Royal Hibernian
Academy.

Definition: If you are proficient in something, you can do it well.
Example: A great number of Egyptians are proficient in foreign languages.

Definition: Something that is beneficial helps people or improves their lives.
Example: ...vitamins which are beneficial to our health.

Definition: If something is advantageous to you, it is likely to benefit you.
Example: Free exchange of goods was advantageous to all.

Definition: Something that is desirable is worth having or doing because it is useful, necessary, or popular.
Example: Prolonged negotiation was not desirable.

Definition: Someone or something that is productive produces or does a lot for the amount of resources used.
Example: Training makes workers highly productive.

Definition: People sometimes say 'goodness' or 'my goodness' to express surprise.
Example: Goodness, I wonder if he knows.

Definition: If you describe people or actions as honourable, you mean that they are good and deserve to be respected and admired.
Example: I believe he was an honourable man, dedicated to the people and his union.

Definition: Ethical means relating to beliefs about right and wrong.
Example: ...the moral and ethical standards in the school.

Definition: If something is agreeable, it is pleasant and you enjoy it.
Example: ...workers in more agreeable and better paid occupations.

Definition: In Britain and some other countries, a ministry is a government department which deals with a particular thing or area of activity, for example trade, defence, or transport.
Example: ...the Ministry of Justice.

Definition: The ruler of a country is the person who rules the country.
Example: ...the former military ruler of Lesotho.

Definition: If you lunge in a particular direction, you move in that direction suddenly and clumsily.
Example: He lunged at me, grabbing me violently.

Definition: A fibre is a thin thread of a natural or artificial substance, especially one that is used to make cloth or rope.
Example: If you look at the paper under a microscope you will see the fibres.

Definition: If you say that something or someone is magnificent, you mean that you think they are extremely good, beautiful, or impressive.
Example: ...a magnificent country house in wooded grounds.

Definition: An allowance is money that is given to someone, usually on a regular basis, in order to help them pay for the things that they need.
Example: He lives on a single parent's allowance.

Definition: An endowment is a gift of money that is made to an institution or community in order to provide it with an annual income.
Example: The company revived the finances of the Oxford Union with a generous 1m endowment.

Definition: Turf is short, thick, even grass.
Example: They shuffled slowly down the turf towards the cliff's edge.

Definition: Cannabis is the hemp plant when it is used as a drug.
Example: Items purchased there had been used to grow cannabis.

Definition: If you betray someone who loves or trusts you, your actions hurt and disappoint them.
Example: When I tell someone I will not betray his confidence, I keep my word.

Definition: A tomb is a large grave that is above ground and that usually has a sculpture or other decoration on it.
Example: The excavation team on the Greek island found four stone tombs up to 2,000 years old.

Definition: A vault is a secure room where money and other valuable things can be kept safely.
Example: Most of the money was in storage in bank vaults.

Definition: A crypt is an underground room underneath a church or cathedral.
Example: ...people buried in the crypt of an old London church.

Definition: A mausoleum is a building which contains the grave of a famous person or the graves of a rich family.
Example: It had evidently been a royal mausoleum.

Definition: If you describe the amount or level of something as excessive, you disapprove of it because it is more or higher than is necessary or reasonable.
Example: ...the alleged use of excessive force by police.

Definition: If someone behaves or moves with dignity, they are calm, controlled, and admirable.
Example: ...her extraordinary dignity and composure.

Definition: You use majesty in expressions such as Your Majesty or Her Majesty when you are addressing or referring to a King or Queen.
Example: I quite agree, Your Majesty.

Definition: If you refer to someone's generosity, you mean that they are generous, especially in doing or giving more than is usual or expected.
Example: There are stories about his generosity, the massive amounts of money he gave to charities.

Definition: the state or quality of being immense; vastness; enormity
Example: It was twice the height of a man, and a foot or more thick, its immensity moved by a system of ropes and weights.

Definition: Someone who is skilful at something does it very well.
Example: He is widely regarded as Hungary's most skilful politician.

Definition: Leafy trees and plants have lots of leaves on them.
Example: His two-story brick home was graced with a patio and surrounded by tall, leafy trees.

Definition: If you are inexperienced, you have little knowledge or experience of a particular situation or activity.
Example: They are inexperienced when it comes to decorating.

Definition: If something  springs up, it suddenly appears or begins to exist.
Example: New theatres and arts centres sprang up all over the country.

Definition: If something shoots up, it grows or increases very quickly.
Example: Sales shot up by 9% last month.

Definition: When something originates or when someone originates it, it begins to happen or exist.
Example: This particular plant originated in North Africa.

Definition: Plants, trees, and flowers can be referred to as vegetation.
Example: The inn has a garden of semi-tropical vegetation.

Definition: A lump of something is a solid piece of it.
Example: The potter shaped and squeezed the lump of clay into a graceful shape.

Definition: Collateral is money or property which is used as a guarantee that someone will repay a loan.
Example: Many people use personal assets as collateral for small business loans.

Definition: A surety is money or something valuable which you give to someone to show that you will do what you have promised.
Example: The insurance company will take warehouse stocks or treasury bonds as surety.

Definition: If someone in authority oversees a job or an activity, they make sure that it is done properly.
Example: Use a surveyor or architect to oversee and inspect the different stages of the work.

Definition: If you supervise an activity or a person, you make sure that the activity is done correctly or that the person is doing a task or behaving correctly.
Example: University teachers have refused to supervise students' examinations.

Definition: A sentry is a soldier who guards a camp or a building.
Example: The sentry would not let her enter.

Definition: A warder is someone who works in a prison supervising the prisoners.
Example: Chryssa was led to the gate by the young warder who had given her a cigarette; he was depressed and cold now.

Definition: A warden is a person who is responsible for a particular place or thing, and for making sure that the laws or regulations that relate to it are obeyed.
Example: He was a warden at the local parish church.

Definition: The custodian of an official building, a companies' assets, or something else valuable is the person who is officially in charge of it.
Example: ...the custodian of the holy shrines in Mecca and Medina.

Definition: the act or an instance of speculating
Example: There is much speculation about the reasons for the move.

Definition: A lodger is a person who pays money to live in someone else's house.
Example: Jennie took in a lodger to help with the mortgage.

Definition: Manual work is work in which you use your hands or your physical strength rather than your mind.
Example: ...skilled manual workers.

Definition: A guidebook is a book that gives tourists information about a town, area, or country.
Example: ...a guidebook to Italian art.

Definition: If someone is rueful, they feel or express regret or sorrow in a quiet and gentle way.
Example: He shook his head and gave me a rueful smile.

Definition: If you look sheepish, you look slightly embarrassed because you feel foolish or you have done something silly.
Example:
The couple leapt apart when she walked in on them and later came downstairs looking
sheepish.

Definition: If someone or their conduct is culpable, they are responsible for something wrong or bad that has happened.
Example: Their decision to do nothing makes them culpable.

Definition: If someone is to blame for something bad that has happened, they are responsible for causing it.
Example: If their forces were not involved, then who is to blame?

Definition: Firearms are guns.
Example: He was also charged with illegal possession of firearms.

Definition:
Someone's mannerisms are the gestures or ways of speaking which are very characteristic of them, and which
they often use.
Example: His mannerisms are more those of a preoccupied math professor.

Definition: Addiction is the condition of taking harmful drugs and being unable to stop taking them.
Example: She helped him fight his drug addiction.

Definition: The mane on a horse or lion is the long thick hair that grows from its neck.
Example: He had a great mane of white hair.

Definition: You use partial to refer to something that is not complete or whole.
Example: He managed to reach a partial agreement with both republics.

Definition: A hallway in a building is a long passage with doors into rooms on both sides of it.
Example: It has a spacious hallway with room for a study area, and the dining room and sitting room have a striking curved wall.

Definition: An auditorium is the part of a theatre or concert hall where the audience sits.
Example: The Albert Hall is a huge auditorium.

Definition: A workman is a man who works with his hands, for example building or repairing houses or roads.
Example: In University Square workmen are building a steel fence.

Definition: When you clap, you hit your hands together to show appreciation or attract attention.
Example: The men danced and the women clapped.

Definition: An ovation is a large amount of applause from an audience for a particular performer or speaker.
Example: They had lost by a wide margin, but their supporters gave them a defiant, loyal ovation.

Definition: Your handwriting is your style of writing with a pen or pencil.
Example: The address was in Anna's handwriting.

Definition: Pests are insects or small animals which damage crops or food supplies.
Example: ...crops which are resistant to some of the major insect pests and diseases.

Definition: A knob is a round handle on a door or drawer which you use in order to open or close it.
Example: He turned the knob and pushed against the door.

Definition: The hilt of a sword, dagger, or knife is its handle.
Example: ...the hilt of the small, sharp knife.

Definition: the handle of an axe, knife, etc
Example: st that had been clenched on my knife haft suddenly loosened, and a relaxed readiness spread through me.

Definition: If someone administers something such as a country, the law, or a test, they take responsibility for organizing and supervising it.
Example: The plan calls for the U.N. to administer the country until elections can be held.

Definition: If something dangles from somewhere or if you dangle it somewhere, it hangs or swings loosely.
Example: A gold bracelet dangled from his left wrist.

Definition: If a group of people lynch someone, they kill that person without letting them have a trial, especially by hanging, because they believe that the person has committed a crime.
Example:
An enraged crowd went to the local prison determined to lynch the people detained
there.

Definition: jutting or sticking out
