Example: I was afraid of hurting her jaw, because of using so much pressure on her projecting teeth.

Definition: If someone is undecided, they cannot decide about something or have not yet decided about it.
Example: After university she was still undecided as to what career she wanted to pursue.

Definition: In an unsettled situation, there is a lot of uncertainty about what will happen.
Example: Britain's unsettled political scene also worries some investors.

Definition: If a problem or difficulty is unresolved, no satisfactory solution has been found to it.
Example: The murder remains unresolved.

Definition: If you describe something or someone as swinging, you mean that they are lively and fashionable.
Example: The stuffy '50s gave way to the swinging '60s.

Definition: To hover means to stay in the same position in the air without moving forwards or backwards. Many birds and insects can hover by moving their wings very quickly.
Example: Beautiful butterflies hovered above the wild flowers.

Definition: When you say how or when something  came about, you say how or when it happened.
Example: Any possible solution can only come about through dialogue.

Definition: If something bad or unlucky befalls you, it happens to you.
Example: ...the disaster that befell the island of Flores.

Definition: If you overtake a vehicle or a person that is ahead of you and moving in the same direction, you pass them.
Example: When he eventually overtook the last truck, he pulled over to the inside lane.

Definition: to happen or happen to; befall (often in the phrase  woe betide (someone))
Example: And woe betide anyone he thought had stepped out of line.

Definition: If you are delighted, you are extremely pleased and excited about something.
Example: I know Frank will be delighted to see you.

Definition: If someone is  blessed with a particular good quality or skill, they have that good quality or skill.
Example: Both are blessed with uncommon ability to fix things.

Definition: Something that is joyful causes happiness and pleasure.
Example: Giving birth to a child is both painful and joyful.

Definition: If something happens persistently, it happens again and again or for a long time.
Example: The allegations have been persistently denied by ministers.

Definition: If you say something earnestly, you say it very seriously, often because you believe that it is important or you are trying to persuade someone else to believe it.
Example: 'Did you?' she asked earnestly.

Definition: You use exacting to describe something or someone that demands hard work and a great deal of care.
Example: The Duke was not well enough to carry out such an exacting task.

Definition: If you describe something or someone as formidable, you mean that you feel slightly frightened by them because they are very great or impressive.
Example: We have a formidable task ahead of us.

Definition: Harsh climates or conditions are very difficult for people, animals, and plants to live in.
Example: The weather grew harsh, chilly and unpredictable.

Definition: People or things that are reliable can be trusted to work well or to behave in the way that you want them to.
Example: She was efficient and reliable.

Definition: on no account; in no way
Example: An inglorious but probably by no means unique send-off; it is not known where he spent the night.

Definition: If you detest someone or something, you dislike them very much.
Example: My mother detested him.

Definition: If you loathe something or someone, you dislike them very much.
Example: The two men loathe each other.

Definition: If you despise something or someone, you dislike them and have a very low opinion of them.
Example: I can never, ever forgive him. I despise him.

Definition: If you dislike someone or something, you consider them to be unpleasant and do not like them.
Example: We don't serve liver often because so many people dislike it.

Definition: Your skull is the bony part of your head which encloses your brain.
Example: Her husband was later treated for a fractured skull.

Definition: A crown is a circular ornament, usually made of gold and jewels, which a king or queen wears on their head at official ceremonies. You can also use crown to refer to anything circular that is worn on someone's head.
Example: ...a crown of flowers.

Definition: If one event or period of time precedes another, it happens before it.
Example: Intensive negotiations between the main parties preceded the vote.

Definition: A head teacher is a teacher who is in charge of a school.
Example: The premise that good head teachers can improve schools is the heart of the problem.

Definition: If you describe something as wholesome, you approve of it because you think it is likely to have a positive influence on people's behaviour or mental state, especially because it does not involve anything sexually immoral.
Example: ...good, wholesome fun.

Definition: contributing to health or growth; nutritious
Example: Under Chade's strict directions, I ate a nourishing meal of bland and healthful food every noon.

Definition: If you overhear someone, you hear what they are saying when they are not talking to you and they do not know that you are listening.
Example: I overheard two doctors discussing my case.

Definition: If you heed someone's advice or warning, you pay attention to it and do what they suggest.
Example: But few at the conference in London last week heeded his warning.

Definition: When a hot liquid boils or when you boil it, bubbles appear in it and it starts to change into steam or vapour.
Example: I stood in the kitchen, waiting for the water to boil.

Definition: According to some religions, paradise is a wonderful place where people go after they die, if they have led good lives.
Example: The Koran describes paradise as a place containing a garden of delight.

Definition: Torpor is the state of being completely inactive mentally or physically, for example because of illness or laziness.
Example: He had slumped into a state of torpor from which nothing could rouse him.

Definition: Intensive activity involves concentrating a lot of effort or people on one particular task in order to try to achieve a great deal in a short time.
Example: ...several days and nights of intensive negotiations.

Definition: A concentrated liquid has been increased in strength by having water removed from it.
Example: Sweeten dishes sparingly with honey, or concentrated apple or pear juice.

Definition: You use painfully to emphasize a quality or situation that is undesirable.
Example: Things are moving painfully slowly.

Definition: A viscous liquid is thick and sticky.
Example: ...dark, viscous blood.

Definition: A sticky substance is soft, or thick and liquid, and can stick to other things. Sticky things are covered with a sticky substance.
Example: ...sticky toffee.

Definition: A filling is a small amount of metal or plastic that a dentist puts in a hole in a tooth to prevent further decay.
Example: The longer your child can go without needing a filling, the better.

Definition: You use humid to describe an atmosphere or climate that is very damp, and usually very hot.
Example: Visitors can expect hot and humid conditions.

Definition: If you describe a society, its laws, or customs as oppressive, you think they treat people cruelly and unfairly.
Example: The new laws will be just as oppressive as those they replace.

Definition: Sorrowful means very sad.
Example: His father's face looked suddenly soft and sorrowful.

Definition: You describe something that you see or hear as melancholy when it gives you an intense feeling of sadness.
Example: ...a painter of haunting melancholy canvases.

Definition: Someone's stature is their height.
Example: It's more than his physical stature that makes him remarkable.

Definition: Something, especially something important, that is the culmination of an activity, process, or series of events happens at the end of it.
Example: Their arrest was the culmination of an operation in which 120 other people were detained.

Definition: The climax of something is the most exciting or important moment in it, usually near the end.
Example: For Pritchard, getting a medal was the climax of her career.

Definition: The zenith of something is the time when it is most successful or powerful.
Example: His career is now at its zenith.

Definition: Torment is extreme suffering, usually mental suffering.
Example: The torment of having her baby kidnapped is written all over her face.

Definition: Suffering is serious pain which someone feels in their body or their mind.
Example: They began to recover slowly from their nightmare of pain and suffering.

Definition: Agony is great physical or mental pain.
Example: She called out in agony.

Definition:
A cooperative is a business or organization run by the people who work for it, or owned by the people who use it. These people share
its benefits and profits.
Example: They decided a housing cooperative was the way to regenerate the area.

Definition: If you describe someone as accommodating, you like the fact that they are willing to do things in order to please you or help you.
Example: Everyone would wonder who was the extra person she was accommodating.

Definition: An expedient is an action that achieves a particular purpose, but may not be morally right.
Example:
He pretended to be energised by the expedient of wearing his shirt with the sleeves
rolled up.

Definition: If someone is in attendance at a place or an event, they are there.
Example: There were murmurs from those in attendance, some approving, some not.

Definition: An inheritance is money or property which you receive from someone who has died.
Example: She feared losing her inheritance to her stepmother.

Definition: Something that is your birthright is something that you feel you have a basic right to have, simply because you are a human being.
Example: Freedom is the natural birthright of every human.

Definition: Someone who is a protagonist of an idea or movement is a supporter of it.
Example: ...the main protagonists of their countries' integration into the world market.

Definition: If part of a plant, animal, or human secretes a liquid, it produces it.
Example: The sweat glands secrete water.

Definition: A cache is a quantity of things such as weapons that have been hidden.
Example: A huge arms cache was discovered by police.

Definition: If you  hole up somewhere, you hide or shut yourself there, usually so that people cannot find you or disturb you.
Example:
His creative process involves holing up in his Paris flat with the phone off the
hook.

Definition: If you withhold something that someone wants, you do not let them have it.
Example: Police withheld the dead boy's name yesterday until relatives could be told.

Definition: The pelt of an animal is its skin, which can be used to make clothing or rugs.
Example: ...a bed covered with beaver pelts.

Definition: If you describe something such as a mountain or cliff as towering, you mean that it is very tall and therefore impressive.
Example: ...towering cliffs of black granite which rise straight out of the sea.

Definition: A steep slope rises at a very sharp angle and is difficult to go up.
Example: ...a narrow, steep-sided valley.

Definition: Blustery weather is rough, windy, and often rainy, with the wind often changing in strength or direction.
Example: It's a cold night here, with intermittent rain showers and a blustery wind.

Definition: Something that is aloft is in the air or off the ground.
Example: He held the trophy proudly aloft.

Definition: A high-pitched sound is shrill and high in pitch.
Example: A woman squealed in a high-pitched voice.

Definition: A piercing sound or voice is high-pitched and very sharp and clear in an unpleasant way.
Example: A piercing scream split the air.

Definition: A shrill sound is high-pitched and unpleasant.
Example: Shrill cries and startled oaths flew up around us as pandemonium broke out.

Definition: A penetrating sound is loud and usually high-pitched.
Example: Mary heard the penetrating siren of an ambulance.

Definition: If you are excited, you are so happy that you cannot relax, especially because you are thinking about something pleasant that is going to happen to you.
Example: I'm very excited about the possibility of playing for England's first team.

Definition: If you describe someone's character or behaviour as merry, you mean that they are happy and cheerful.
Example: He was much loved for his merry nature.

Definition: Someone who is intoxicated is drunk.
Example: He appeared intoxicated, police said.

Definition: The high point of an event or period of time is the most exciting or enjoyable part of it.
Example: The high point of this trip was a day at the races in Balgriffin.

Definition: A  main road is an important road that leads from one town or city to another.
Example: Webb turned off the main road and drove round to the car park.

Definition: A motorway is a major road that has been specially built for fast travel over long distances. Motorways have several lanes and special places where traffic gets on and leaves.
Example: ...the M1 motorway.

Definition: A thoroughfare is a main road in a town or city which usually has shops along it and a lot of traffic.
Example: ...a busy thoroughfare.

Definition: If you rent something, you regularly pay its owner a sum of money in order to be able to have it and use it yourself.
Example: She rents a house with three other girls.

Definition: A charter is a formal document describing the rights, aims, or principles of an organization or group of people.
Example: ...Article 50 of the United Nations Charter.

Definition: A lease is a legal agreement by which the owner of a building, a piece of land, or something such as a car allows someone else to use it for a period of time in return for money.
Example: He took up a 10 year lease on the house at Rossie Priory.

Definition: A recorder is a wooden or plastic musical instrument in the shape of a pipe. You play the recorder by blowing into the top of it and covering and uncovering the holes with your fingers.
Example: Data recorders also pin-point mechanical faults rapidly, reducing repair times.

Definition: To chronicle a series of events means to write about them or show them in broadcasts in the order in which they happened.
Example: The series chronicles the everyday adventures of two eternal bachelors.

Definition: If you clutch at something or clutch something, you hold it tightly, usually because you are afraid or anxious.
Example: I staggered and had to clutch at a chair for support.

Definition: If someone convenes a meeting or conference, they arrange for it to take place. You can also say that people convene or that a meeting convenes.
Example: Last August he convened a meeting of his closest advisers at Camp David.

Definition: When people such as the police detain someone, they keep them in a place under their control.
Example: The act allows police to detain a suspect for up to 48 hours.

Definition: A cavity is a space or hole in something such as a solid object or a person's body.
Example: the abdominal cavity

Definition: A burrow is a tunnel or hole in the ground that is dug by an animal such as a rabbit.
Example: The larvae burrow into cracks in the floor.

Definition: A bird's nest is the home that it makes to lay its eggs in.
Example: I can see an eagle's nest on the rocks.

Definition: A den is the home of certain types of wild animals such as lions or foxes.
Example: I could provide you with the addresses of at least three illegal drinking dens.

Definition: A hovel is a small hut, especially one which is dirty or needs a lot of repair.
Example: They lived in a squalid hovel for the next five years.

Definition: A slum is an area of a city where living conditions are very bad and where the houses are in bad condition.
Example: ...a slum area of St Louis.

Definition: Festivity is the celebration of something in a happy way.
Example: There was a general air of festivity and abandon.

Definition: Hallowed is used to describe something that is respected and admired, usually because it is old, important, or has a good reputation.
Example: Every cricketer wants to prove his worth on the hallowed turf of Lord's.

Definition: A devout person has deep religious beliefs.
Example: She was a devout Christian.

Definition: A godly person is someone who is deeply religious and shows obedience to the rules of their religion.
Example: ...a learned and godly preacher.

Definition: A residence is a house where people live.
Example: ...hotels and private residences.

Definition: Your abode is the place where you live.
Example: I went round the streets and found his new abode.

Definition: Your birthplace is the place where you were born.
Example: Ironbridge Gorge is known as the birthplace of the Industrial Revolution.

Definition: Your homeland is your native country.
Example: Many are planning to return to their homeland.

Definition: Someone who is destitute has no money or possessions.
Example: ...destitute children who live on the streets.

Definition:
(of a person) living in a foreign country because they cannot live in their own country,
usually for political reasons
Example: Why, after being exiled in the Cosm for so many years, were these people now gaining access to Quiddity?

Definition: evicted, as from a dwelling, land, etc.; ousted
Example: Someone had taken the book away from him - he could still feel his anger at being dispossessed of it.

Definition: A trustworthy person is reliable, responsible, and can be trusted completely.
Example: He is a trustworthy and level-headed leader.

Definition: Decent is used to describe something which is considered to be of an acceptable standard or quality.
Example: Nearby is a village with a decent pub.

Definition: If you are sitting or standing upright, you are sitting or standing with your back straight, rather than bending or lying down.
Example: Helen sat upright in her chair.

Definition: If you do something in good faith, you seriously believe that what you are doing is right, honest, or legal, even though this may not be the case.
Example:
This report was published in good faith but we regret any confusion which may have
been caused.

Definition: A vista is a view from a particular place, especially a beautiful view from a high place.
Example: From my bedroom window I looked out on a crowded vista of hills and rooftops.

Definition: Alarm is a feeling of fear or anxiety that something unpleasant or dangerous might happen.
Example: The news was greeted with alarm by MPs.

Definition: Panic is a very strong feeling of anxiety or fear, which makes you act without thinking carefully.
Example: An earthquake hit the capital, causing panic among the population.

Definition: Hatred is an extremely strong feeling of dislike for someone or something.
Example: Her hatred of them would never lead her to murder.

Definition: Disgust is a feeling of very strong dislike or disapproval.
Example: He spoke of his disgust at the incident.

Definition: Loathing is a feeling of great dislike and disgust.
Example: Deacon made no secret of his loathing of Bayldon.

Definition: If you have an aversion to someone or something, you dislike them very much.
Example: Many people have a natural and emotional aversion to insects.

Definition: An atrocity is a very cruel, shocking action.
Example: Those who committed this atrocity should be tried and punished.

Definition: Cruelty is behaviour that deliberately causes pain or distress to people or animals.
Example: Britain had laws against cruelty to animals but none to protect children.

Definition: If someone nags you, they keep asking you to do something you have not done yet or do not want to do.
Example: The more Sarah nagged her, the more stubborn Cissie became.

Definition: A mare is an adult female horse.
Example: It were a chestnut mare the man rode.

Definition: A colt is a young male horse.
Example: But she has yet to win against colts.

Definition: A hospice is a special hospital for people who are dying, where their practical and emotional needs are dealt with as well as their medical needs.
Example: ...a hospice for cancer patients.

Definition: A radio or television presenter is a person who introduces the items in a particular programme.
Example: Most people think being a television presenter is exciting.

Definition: Stifling heat is so intense that it makes you feel uncomfortable. You can also use stifling to describe a place that is extremely hot.
Example: The stifling heat of the little room was beginning to make me nauseous.

Definition: A heated discussion or quarrel is one where the people involved are angry and excited.
Example: It was a very heated argument and they were shouting at each other.

Definition: Raging water moves very forcefully and violently.
Example: The field trip involved crossing a raging torrent.

Definition: A  guest house is a small hotel.
Example: We are happy to splash out but prefer camping and guest houses to luxury hotels.

Definition: A dynasty is a series of rulers of a country who all belong to the same family.
Example: The Seljuk dynasty of Syria was founded in 1094.

Definition: You use immensely to emphasize the degree or extent of a quality, feeling, or process.
Example: Wind surfing can be strenuous but immensely exciting.

Definition: If you refer to the fact that people are mortal, you mean that they have to die and cannot live for ever.
Example: A man is deliberately designed to be mortal. He grows, he ages, and he dies.

Definition: A  human being is a human child or adult.
Example: This was his right as a human being.

Definition: If you say that you are starving, you mean that you are very hungry.
Example: Apart from anything else I was starving.

Definition: If you are ravenous, you are extremely hungry.
Example: She realized that she had eaten nothing since leaving home, and she was ravenous.

Definition: If you are famished, you are very hungry.
Example: Isn't dinner ready? I'm famished.

Definition: an intense desire or longing
Example: They do these fad diets and have shakes - of course your body's craving food!

Definition: If you ache or a part of your body aches, you feel a steady, fairly strong pain.
Example: Her head was throbbing and she ached all over.

Definition: If you have a pained expression or look, you look upset, worried, or slightly annoyed.
Example: a pained expression

Definition: Grief is a feeling of extreme sadness.
Example: ...a huge outpouring of national grief for the victims of the shootings.

Definition: Someone's spouse is the person they are married to.
Example: Will either become a better parent and spouse?

Definition: If you conserve a supply of something, you use it carefully so that it lasts for a long time.
Example: The republic's factories have closed for the weekend to conserve energy.

Definition: The premises of a business or an institution are all the buildings and land that it occupies in one place.
Example: There is a kitchen on the premises.

Definition: If you describe something such as a task or an activity as, for example, a difficult proposition or an attractive proposition, you mean that it is difficult or pleasant to do.
Example: Making easy money has always been an attractive proposition.

Definition:
When there is frost or a frost, the temperature outside falls below freezing point and the ground becomes covered
in ice crystals.
Example: There is frost on the ground and snow is forecast.

Definition: A glaze is a thin layer of liquid which is put on a piece of pottery and becomes hard and shiny when the pottery is heated in a very hot oven.
Example: ...hand-painted French tiles with decorative glazes.

Definition: Suspicion or a suspicion is a belief or feeling that someone has committed a crime or done something wrong.
Example:
There was a suspicion that this runner attempted to avoid the procedures for dope
testing.

Definition: If you say that a person or thing is the epitome of something, you are emphasizing that they are the best possible example of a particular type of person or thing.
Example: Maureen was the epitome of sophistication.

Definition: An imaginary person, place, or thing exists only in your mind or in a story, and not in real life.
Example: Lots of children have imaginary friends.

Definition: If you describe an object, idea, or course of action as impractical, you mean that it is not sensible or realistic, and does not work well in practice.
Example: When stalking subjects, a tripod is impractical.

Definition: having the quality of deciding
Example: The role of religion in determining political affiliation was replaced by class.

Definition: Unity is the state of different areas or groups being joined together to form a single country or organization.
Example: There is support for economic unity in trade and industry to promote growth and prosperity.

Definition: A specification is a requirement which is clearly stated, for example about the necessary features in the design of something.
Example:
Troll's exclusive, personalized luggage is made to our own exacting specifications
in heavy-duty PVC/nylon.

Definition:
The individuality of a person or thing consists of the qualities that make them different from other
people or things.
Example: People should be free to express their individuality.

Definition: If you describe someone's words or actions as malicious, you mean that they are intended to harm people or their reputation, or cause them embarrassment and upset.
Example: That might merely have been malicious gossip.

Definition: Acrimonious words or quarrels are bitter and angry.
Example: There followed an acrimonious debate.

Definition: If something is unlawful, the law does not allow you to do it.
Example: ...employees who believe their dismissal was unlawful.

Definition: In countries where the legal system distinguishes between very serious crimes and less serious ones, a felony is a very serious crime such as armed robbery.
Example: He pleaded guilty to six felonies.

Definition: the state or quality of being criminal
Example: This was organised criminality, a high street business making money at the cost of human suffering.

Definition: Sickness is the state of being ill or unhealthy.
Example: In fifty-two years of working he had one week of sickness.

Definition: Malaise is a state in which there is something wrong with a society or group, for which there does not seem to be a quick or easy solution.
Example: There is no easy short-term solution to Britain's chronic economic malaise.

Definition: If something adorns a place or an object, it makes it look more beautiful.
Example: His watercolour designs adorn a wide range of books.

Definition: An ornament is an attractive object that you display in your home or in your garden.
Example: ...a shelf containing a few photographs and ornaments.

Definition: If something is embellished with decorative features or patterns, it has those features or patterns on it and they make it look more attractive.
Example: The stern was embellished with carvings in red and blue.

Definition: A  figure of speech is an expression or word that is used with a metaphorical rather than a literal meaning.
Example: Of course I'm not. It was just a figure of speech.

Definition: A metaphor is an imaginative way of describing something by referring to something else which is the same in a particular way. For example, if you want to say that someone is very shy and frightened of things, you might say that they are a mouse.
Example:
...the avoidance of 'violent expressions and metaphors' like 'kill two birds with
one stone'.

Definition: Ingenuity is skill at working out how to achieve things or skill at inventing new things.
Example: Inspecting the nest may require some ingenuity.

Definition: the visual memory or the imagination
Example: Try to see a picture of each column in your mind's eye.

Definition: If you fancy something, you want to have it or to do it.
Example: What do you fancy doing, anyway?

Definition: If you visualize something, you imagine what it is like by forming a mental picture of it.
Example:
Susan visualized her wedding day and saw herself walking down the aisle on her father's
arm.

Definition: Settlers are people who go to live in a new country.
Example: The village was founded by settlers from the Volga region.

Definition: the act or process of executing
Example: Selected for his urgency but execution was unusually poor.

Definition: The ramifications of a decision, plan, or event are all its consequences and effects, especially ones which are not obvious at first.
Example: Consider the long-term ramifications of any loan.

Definition: If you say that someone insinuates that something bad is the case, you mean that they say it in an indirect way.
Example: The libel claim followed an article which insinuated that the President was lying.

Definition: highly valued
Example: Senior ratings competed for prized bunk space near an air outlet.

Definition: If you are in a commanding position or situation, you are in a strong or powerful position or situation.
Example: Right now you're in a more commanding position than you have been for ages.

Definition: A decree is an official order or decision, especially one made by the ruler of a country.
Example:
In July he issued a decree ordering all unofficial armed groups in the country to
disband.

Definition: If someone disturbs you when you are in a private place or having a private conversation, you can call this event an intrusion.
Example: I hope you don't mind this intrusion, Jon.

Definition: If you feel hopeless, you feel very unhappy because there seems to be no possibility of a better situation or success.
Example: He had not heard her cry before in this uncontrolled, hopeless way.

Definition: If you refer to someone's inability to do something, you are referring to the fact that they are unable to do it.
Example: Her inability to concentrate could cause an accident.

Definition: If you say that something is absurd, you are criticizing it because you think that it is ridiculous or that it does not make sense.
Example: It is absurd to be discussing compulsory redundancy policies for teachers.

Definition: If you say that something or someone is ridiculous, you mean that they are very foolish.
Example: It is ridiculous to suggest we are having a romance.

Definition: If you describe something as unacceptable, you strongly disapprove of it or object to it and feel that it should not be allowed to continue.
Example: It is totally unacceptable for children to swear.

Definition: If something leaves an imprint on a place or on your mind, it has a strong and lasting effect on it.
Example: The city bears the imprint of Japanese investment.

Definition: If you say that something is splendid, you mean that it is very good.
Example: The book includes a wealth of splendid photographs.

Definition: When you recuperate, you recover your health or strength after you have been ill or injured.
Example: I went away to the country to recuperate.

Definition: If someone is offered an inducement to do something, they are given or promised gifts or benefits in order to persuade them to do it.
Example: They offer every inducement to foreign businesses to invest in their states.

Definition: Your motive for doing something is your reason for doing it.
Example: Police have ruled out robbery as a motive for the killing.

Definition: Encouragement is the activity of encouraging someone, or something that is said or done in order to encourage them.
Example: I also had friends who gave me a great deal of encouragement.

Definition: Not counting a particular thing means not including that thing. Counting a particular thing means including that thing.
Example:
...an average operating profit of 15% to 16% of sales, not counting administrative
expenses.

Definition: If someone integrates into a social group, or is integrated into it, they behave in such a way that they become part of the group or are accepted into it.
Example: He didn't integrate successfully into the Italian way of life.

Definition: A merger is the joining together of two separate companies or organizations so that they become one.
Example: ...a merger between two of Britain's biggest trades unions.

Definition: A federation is a federal country.
Example: ...the Russian Federation.

Definition: the act of combining or adding parts to make a unified whole
Example: It argues that this reduces the system integration risk.

Definition: If one thing boosts another, it causes it to increase, improve, or be more successful.
Example: It wants the government to take action to boost the economy.

Definition: If you say that something is unbelievable, you are emphasizing that it is very good, impressive, intense, or extreme.
Example: His guitar solos are just unbelievable.

Definition: If you say that something is unthinkable, you are emphasizing that it cannot possibly be accepted or imagined as a possibility.
Example: Splitting the family in this way was almost unthinkable.

Definition: Self-reliance is the ability to do things and make decisions by yourself, without needing other people to help you.
Example: People learned self-reliance because they had to.

Definition: If one thing is unrelated to another, there is no connection between them. You can also say that two things are unrelated.
Example: My line of work is entirely unrelated to politics.

Definition: If one thing is unconnected with another or the two things are unconnected, the things are not related to each other in any way.
Example: She was known to have had personal problems unconnected with her job.

Definition: Someone who is unattached is not married or does not have a girlfriend or boyfriend.
Example: I knew only two or three unattached men.

Definition: If a country or group is self-sufficient, it is able to produce or make everything that it needs.
Example: This enabled the country to become self-sufficient in sugar.

Definition: If you describe a person or their attitude or behaviour as unconventional, you mean that they do not behave in the same way as most other people in their society.
Example: Linus Pauling is an unconventional genius.

Definition: You use solo to indicate that someone does something alone rather than with other people.
Example: He had just completed his final solo album.

Definition: A self-governing region or organization is governed or run by its own people rather than by the people of another region or organization.
Example: ...a self-governing province.

Definition: An autonomous country, organization, or group governs or controls itself rather than being controlled by anyone else.
Example: They proudly declared themselves part of a new autonomous province.

Definition: Someone who is separated from their wife or husband lives apart from them, but is not divorced.
Example: Most single parents are either divorced or separated.

Definition: A listing is a published list, or an item in a published list.
Example: A full listing of the companies will be published quarterly.

Definition: If you specify something, you give information about what is required or should happen in a certain situation.
Example: They specified a spacious entrance hall.

Definition: steady and careful application
Example: There was no evidence of any due diligence about the people who received the cash.

Definition: To infuse a quality into someone or something, or to infuse them with a quality, means to fill them with it.
Example: Many of the girls seemed to be infused with excitement on seeing the snow.

Definition: If you endorse someone or something, you say publicly that you support or approve of them.
Example: I can endorse their opinion wholeheartedly.

Definition: An autograph is the signature of someone famous which is specially written for a fan to keep.
Example: He went backstage and asked for her autograph.

Definition: If you slash something, you make a long, deep cut in it.
Example: He came within two minutes of bleeding to death after slashing his wrists.

Definition: The interior of something is the inside part of it.
Example: The interior of the house was furnished with heavy, old-fashioned pieces.

Definition: Your inward thoughts or feelings are the ones that you do not express or show to other people.
Example: I sighed with inward relief.

Definition: Someone who is blameless has not done anything wrong.
Example: He feels he is blameless.

Definition: If you describe someone as naive, you think they lack experience and so expect things to be easy or people to be honest or kind.
Example: It's naive to think that teachers are always tolerant.

Definition: Information that is confidential is meant to be kept secret or private.
Example: She accused them of leaking confidential information about her private life.

Definition: If you are motivated by something, especially an emotion, it causes you to behave in a particular way.
Example: They are motivated by a need to achieve.

Definition: If something arouses a particular reaction or attitude in people, it causes them to have that reaction or attitude.
Example: We left in the daytime so as not to arouse suspicion.

Definition: You can use machinery to refer to machines in general, or machines that are used in a factory or on a farm.
Example: ...quality tools and machinery.

Definition: Induction is a procedure or ceremony for introducing someone to a new job, organization, or way of life.
Example: ...the induction of the girls into the sport.

Definition: You use alternatively to introduce a suggestion or to mention something different to what has just been stated.
Example:
Allow about eight hours for the drive from Calais. Alternatively, you can fly to
Brive.

Definition: ideally; by preference; if one had a choice
Example: And preferably without too many fellow tourists around.

Definition: Accepted ideas are agreed by most people to be correct or reasonable.
Example: There is no generally accepted definition of life.

Definition: Schooling is education that children receive at school.
Example: He had little formal schooling.

Definition: A thinker is a person who spends a lot of time thinking deeply about important things, especially someone who is famous for thinking of new or interesting ideas.
Example: ...some of the world's greatest thinkers.

Definition: Espionage is the activity of finding out the political, military, or industrial secrets of your enemies or rivals by using spies.
Example: The authorities have arrested several people suspected of espionage.

Definition: the activity of trying to obtain secret information from rival countries, organizations, companies, etc
Example: Repelled by the thought of him spying on my neighbours dressed in a floral nightie, I decided to give him a wide berth.

Definition: to set apart or appoint (for a certain purpose or person, or to do something); intend; design
Example: One of his fellow commanders had been a school contemporary; the other was destined to become his brother-in-law.

Definition: If resources such as money are earmarked for a particular purpose, they are reserved for that purpose.
Example: ...the extra money being earmarked for the new projects.

Definition: A fierce animal or person is very aggressive or angry.
Example: They look like the teeth of some fierce animal.

Definition: You use burning to describe something that is extremely hot.
Example: ...the burning desert of Central Asia.

Definition: Fervour for something is a very strong feeling for or belief in it.
Example: They were concerned only with their own religious fervour.

Definition: A hobby is an activity that you enjoy doing in your spare time.
Example: My hobbies are letter writing, football, music, photography, and tennis.

Definition: If you describe someone's behaviour as affected, you disapprove of the fact that they behave in an unnatural way that is intended to impress other people.
Example: She had an affected air and a disdainful look.

Definition: If you describe something as intriguing, you mean that it is interesting or strange.
Example: This intriguing book is both thoughtful and informative.

Definition: An absorbing task or activity interests you a great deal and takes up all your attention and energy.
Example: 'Two Sisters' is an absorbing read.

Definition: To clarify something means to make it easier to understand, usually by explaining it in more detail.
Example: Thank you for writing and allowing me to clarify the present position.

Definition: If you paraphrase someone or paraphrase something that they have said or written, you express what they have said or written in a different way.
Example: Parents, to paraphrase Philip Larkin, can seriously damage your health.

Definition: An actor's portrayal of a character in a play or film is the way that he or she plays the character.
Example: ...her acclaimed portrayal of Ophelia in Hamlet.

Definition: A rendering of a play, poem, or piece of music is a performance of it.
Example: ...a rendering of Verdi's Requiem by the BBC Symphony Orchestra.

Definition: the act of mediating; intercession
Example: I would put the offer that you have made to your son again and attempt to resolve the dispute using the family mediation service.

Definition: Interference by a person or group is their unwanted or unnecessary involvement in something.
Example: The parliament described the decree as interference in the republic's internal affairs.

Definition: the act of inserting or something that is inserted
Example: This is a procedure that involves the insertion of one or more silicone implants and can take as little as an hour to perform.

Definition: The debut of a performer or sports player is their first public performance, appearance, or recording.
Example: Israel's brightest young star made his international debut on Wednesday.

Definition: The initiation of something is the starting of it.
Example: They announced the initiation of a rural development programme.

Definition: A baptism is a Christian ceremony in which a person is baptized. Compare christening.
Example: Marriage and baptism set out a framework for the nourishing and fulfilment of family life.

Definition: If you acquaint someone with something, you tell them about it so that they know it. If you acquaint yourself with something, you learn about it.
Example: ...efforts to acquaint the public with their rights under the new law.

Definition: If you familiarize yourself with something, or if someone familiarizes you with it, you learn about it and start to understand it.
Example: I was expected to familiarise myself with the keyboard.

Definition: If you say that an action or procedure is just a formality, you mean that it is done only because it is normally done, and that it will not have any real effect on the situation.
Example:
He would not go as far as confirming his appointment, but that appears to be a mere
formality.

Definition: You can describe an event as a prelude to a more important event when it happens before it and acts as an introduction to it.
Example: Most unions see privatisation as an inevitable prelude to job losses.

Definition: A preface is an introduction at the beginning of a book, which explains what the book is about or why it was written.
Example: I will preface what I am going to say with a few lines from Shakespeare.

Definition: A takeover is the act of gaining control of a company by buying more of its shares than anyone else.
Example: ...the government's takeover of the corporation.

Definition: To expend something, especially energy, time, or money, means to use it or spend it.
Example: Children expend a lot of energy and may need more high-energy food than adults.

Definition: An examiner is a person who sets or marks an examination.
Example: Pens down when the examiner says so.

Definition: An inspector is a person, usually employed by a government agency, whose job is to find out whether people are obeying official regulations.
Example: The mill was finally shut down by state safety inspectors.

Definition: the provision of funds for an operation, project, etc
Example: ` Executives from head office of the distribution company that's putting up most of the financing.

Definition: If you sacrifice something that is valuable or important, you give it up, usually to obtain something else for yourself or for other people.
Example: They sacrificed family life to their careers.

Definition: An invitation is a written or spoken request to come to an event such as a party, a meal, or a meeting.
Example: ...an invitation to lunch.

Definition: To implicate someone means to show or claim that they were involved in something wrong or criminal.
Example: He was to resign when one of his own aides was implicated in a financial scandal.

Definition: A tangle of something is a mass of it twisted together in an untidy way.
Example: A tangle of wires is all that remains of the computer and phone systems.

Definition: If someone or something is implicated in a crime or a bad situation, they are involved in it or responsible for it.
Example: The President was implicated in the cover-up and forced to resign.

Definition: You use intricate to describe something that has many small parts or details.
Example: ...intricate patterns and motifs.

Definition: Collaboration is the act of working together to produce a piece of work, especially a book or some research.
Example: There is substantial collaboration with neighbouring departments.

Definition: If you have an attachment to someone or something, you are fond of them or loyal to them.
Example: As a teenager she formed a strong attachment to one of her teachers.

Definition: Something that is inflexible cannot be altered in any way, even if the situation changes.
Example: Workers insisted the new system was too inflexible.

Definition: Communal means relating to particular groups in a country or society.
Example: Communal violence broke out in different parts of the country.

Definition: A jest is something that you say that is intended to be amusing.
Example: It was a jest rather than a reproach.

Definition: A witticism is a witty remark or joke.
Example: His witticisms on and off the bench were long remembered.

Definition: If you call someone a fool, you are indicating that you think they are not at all sensible and show a lack of good judgment.
Example: 'You fool!' she shouted.

Definition: If someone mocks you, they show or pretend that they think you are foolish or inferior, for example by saying something funny about you, or by imitating your behaviour.
Example: I thought you were mocking me.

Definition: A farce is a humorous play in which the characters become involved in complicated and unlikely situations.
Example: The plot often borders on farce.

Definition: If you say that something spoken or written is nonsense, you mean that you consider it to be untrue or silly.
Example: Most orthodox doctors however dismiss this as complete nonsense.

Definition: A parody is a humorous piece of writing, drama, or music which imitates the style of a well-known person or represents a familiar situation in an exaggerated way.
Example:
'The Scarlet Capsule' was a parody of the popular 1959 TV series 'The Quatermass
Experiment'.

Definition: Something that is a sham is not real or is not really what it seems to be.
Example: The government's promises were exposed as a hollow sham.

Definition: A diary is a book which has a separate space for each day of the year. You use a diary to write down things you plan to do, or to record what happens in your life day by day.
Example: My new book, a diary of that period, is my right of reply.

Definition: If you make a pilgrimage to a holy place, you go there for a religious reason.
Example: ...the pilgrimage to Mecca.

Definition: A magistrate is an official who acts as a judge in law courts which deal with minor crimes or disputes.
Example: He might even appear before some half-wit magistrate in Cumbria or Poole or somewhere and get let out on bail -- same result.

Definition: The referee is the official who controls a sports event such as a football game or a boxing match.
Example: The match will be refereed by Derek Bevan from Wales.

Definition: An umpire is a person whose job is to make sure that a sports match or contest is played fairly and that the rules are not broken.
Example: The umpire's decision is final.

Definition: If you adjudicate on a dispute or problem, you make an official judgment or decision about it.
Example: ...a commissioner to adjudicate on legal rights.

Definition: If someone mediates between two groups of people, or mediates an agreement between them, they try to settle an argument between them by talking to both groups and trying to find things that they can both agree to.
Example: My mom was the one who mediated between Zelda and her mom.

Definition: An assessor is a person who is employed to calculate the value of something, or the amount of money that should be paid, for example in tax.
Example: Two judges and six lay assessors sentenced White to life in prison.

Definition: An arbiter is a person or institution that judges and settles a quarrel between two other people or groups.
Example: He was the ultimate arbiter on both theological and political matters.

Definition: Your common sense is your natural ability to make good judgments and to behave in a practical and sensible way.
Example: Use your common sense.

Definition: A liquid is a substance which is not solid but which flows and can be poured, for example water.
Example: Drink plenty of liquid.

Definition: A fluid is a liquid.
Example: The blood vessels may leak fluid, which distorts vision.

Definition: If you leap, you jump high in the air or jump a long distance.
Example: He had leapt from a window in the building and escaped.

Definition: When an object such as a ball bounces or when you bounce it, it moves upwards from a surface or away from it immediately after hitting it.
Example: I bounced a ball against the house.

Definition: If something makes you recoil, you move your body quickly away from it because it frightens, offends, or hurts you.
Example: For a moment I thought he was going to kiss me. I recoiled in horror.

Definition: If something jolts or if something jolts it, it moves suddenly and quite violently.
Example: The wagon jolted again.

Definition: If you flinch, you make a small sudden movement, especially when something surprises you or hurts you.
Example: Murat had looked into the eyes of the firing squad without flinching.

Definition: If a bad situation escalates or if someone or something escalates it, it becomes greater in size, seriousness, or intensity.
Example: Both unions and management fear the dispute could escalate.

Definition: If someone assails you, they criticize you strongly.
Example: The opposition's newspapers assail the government each day.

Definition: If you describe something as secondary, you mean that it is less important than something else.
Example:
The street erupted in a huge explosion, with secondary explosions in the adjoining
buildings.

Definition: You use lesser in order to indicate that something is smaller in extent, degree, or amount than another thing that has been mentioned.
Example: Any medication is affected to a greater or lesser extent by many factors.

Definition: You use lately to describe events in the recent past, or situations that started a short time ago.
Example: Dad's health hasn't been too good lately.

Definition: Fairness is the quality of being reasonable, right, and just.
Example: He said that there had to be fairness for both victims of crime and suspects.

Definition: In finance, your equity is the sum of your assets, for example the value of your house, once your debts have been subtracted from it.
Example: To capture his equity, Murphy must either sell or refinance.

Definition: To deter someone from doing something means to make them not want to do it or continue doing it.
Example:
Supporters of the death penalty argue that it would deter criminals from carrying
guns.

Definition: If something inhibits an event or process, it prevents it or slows it down.
Example: Sugary drinks inhibit digestion.

Definition: The upkeep of a building or place is the work of keeping it in good condition.
Example: The money will be used for the estate's upkeep.

Definition: If something hinders you, it makes it more difficult for you to do something or make progress.
Example: Does the fact that your players are part-timers help or hinder you?

Definition: If you impede someone or something, you make their movement, development, or progress difficult.
Example: Fallen rock is impeding the progress of rescue workers.

Definition: The timbre of someone's voice or of a musical instrument is the particular quality of sound that it has.
Example: His voice had a deep timbre.

Definition: An indicator is a measurement or value which gives you an idea of what something is like.
Example: ...vital economic indicators, such as inflation, growth and the trade gap.

Definition: When a part of your body tingles, you have a slight stinging feeling there.
Example: The backs of his thighs tingled.

Definition: To tease someone means to laugh at them or make jokes about them in order to embarrass, annoy, or upset them.
Example: He told her how the boys in East Poldown had set on him, teasing him.

Definition: If someone slays an animal, they kill it in a violent way.
Example: ...the hill where St George slew the dragon.

Definition: A taxing task or problem is one that requires a lot of mental or physical effort.
Example: It's unlikely that you'll be asked to do anything too taxing.

Definition: If you say that someone is deathly pale or deathly still, you are emphasizing that they are very pale or still, like a dead person.
Example: Bernadette turned deathly pale.

Definition: A fatal action has very undesirable effects.
Example: She knew it was fatal to try to argue with Stephen.

Definition: If something is hilarious, it is extremely funny and makes you laugh a lot.
Example: We thought it was hilarious when we first heard about it.

Definition: If you describe something as ludicrous, you are emphasizing that you think it is foolish, unreasonable, or unsuitable.
Example: It was ludicrous to suggest that the visit could be kept secret.

Definition: A massacre is the killing of a large number of people at the same time in a violent and cruel way.
Example: Maria lost her 62-year-old mother in the massacre.

Definition: If you scotch a rumour, plan, or idea, you put an end to it before it can develop any further.
Example: They have scotched rumours that they are planning a special London show.

Definition: If something deadens a feeling or a sound, it makes it less strong or loud.
Example: He needs morphine to deaden the pain in his chest.

Definition: A murderer is a person who has murdered someone.
Example: One of these men may have been the murderer.

Definition: A scourge is something that causes a lot of trouble or suffering to a group of people.
Example: Union chiefs demanded more urgent action to stop the scourge of unemployment.

Definition: If you talk about people or things of the same ilk, you mean people or things of the same type as a person or thing that has been mentioned.
Example: Finding and talking to others of your ilk is easy through online communities.

Definition: If something is flattering, it makes you appear more attractive.
Example: Some styles are so flattering that they instantly become classics.

Definition: A piece of clothing, a colour, or a hairstyle that is becoming makes the person who is wearing it look attractive.
Example: Softer fabrics are much more becoming than stiffer ones.

Definition: The monarch of a country is the king, queen, emperor, or empress.
Example: For more information or to book flights see monarch.

Definition: A  big name is a person who is successful and famous because of their work.
Example: ...all the big names in rock and pop.

Definition: When you shave, you remove the hair from your face using a razor or shaver so that your face is smooth.
Example: He took a bath and shaved before dinner.

Definition: If you scrape something from a surface, you remove it, especially by pulling a sharp object over the surface.
Example: She went round the car scraping the frost off the windows.

Definition: On a ship or aircraft, the galley is the kitchen.
Example: DOWNSIDE The galley kitchen is a bit cramped.

Definition: If someone stabs you, they push a knife or sharp object into your body.
Example: Somebody stabbed him in the stomach.

Definition:
A tag is a small piece of card or cloth which is attached to an object or person and has
information about that object or person on it.
Example: Staff wore name tags.

Definition:
A tab is a small piece of cloth or paper that is attached to something, usually with information
about that thing written on it.
Example: A stupid medical clerk had slipped the wrong tab on his X-ray.

Definition: If there is a shortage of something, there is not enough of it.
Example: A shortage of funds is preventing the U.N. from monitoring relief.

Definition: If you say that someone is a noble person, you admire and respect them because they are unselfish and morally good.
Example: He was an upright and noble man who was always willing to help in any way he could.

Definition: Dame is a title given to a woman as a special honour because of important service or work that she has done.
Example: ...Dame Judi Dench.

Definition: A pond is a small area of water that is smaller than a lake. Ponds are often made artificially.
Example: She chose a bench beside the duck pond and sat down.

Definition: A reservoir is a lake that is used for storing water before it is supplied to people.
Example: ...the huge oil reservoir beneath the Kuwaiti desert.

Definition: The countryside is land which is away from towns and cities.
Example: I've always loved the English countryside.

Definition: A moor is an area of open and usually high land with poor soil that is covered mainly with grass and heather.
Example: Colliford is higher, right up on the moors.

Definition: A saddle is a leather seat that you put on the back of an animal so that you can ride the animal.
Example: Why don't we saddle a couple of horses and go for a ride?

Definition: If you are encumbered by something, it prevents you from moving freely or doing what you want.
Example: Lead weights and air cylinders encumbered the divers as they walked to the shore.

Definition: The scenery in a country area is the land, water, or plants that you can see around you.
Example: ...the island's spectacular scenery.

Definition: Your vocabulary is the total number of words you know in a particular language.
Example: His speech is immature, his vocabulary limited.

Definition: A dialect is a form of a language that is spoken in a particular area.
Example: In the fifties, many Italians spoke only local dialect.

Definition: You use jargon to refer to words and expressions that are used in special or technical ways by particular groups of people, often making the language difficult to understand.
Example: The manual is full of the jargon and slang of self-improvement courses.

Definition: The terminology of a subject is the set of special words and expressions used in connection with it.
Example: ...gastritis, which in medical terminology means an inflammation of the stomach.

Definition: The wording of a piece of writing or a speech are the words used in it, especially when these are chosen to have a particular effect.
Example: The two sides failed to agree on the wording of a final report.

Definition: Ripples are little waves on the surface of water caused by the wind or by something moving in or on the water.
Example: You throw a pebble in a pool and it ripples.

Definition: If you splash about or splash around in water, you hit or disturb the water in a noisy way, causing some of it to fly up into the air.
Example: A lot of people were in the water, swimming or simply splashing about.

Definition: If you slap someone, you hit them with the palm of your hand.
Example: He would push or slap them once in a while.

Definition: When people or animals lick something, they move their tongue across its surface.
Example: She folded up her letter, licking the envelope flap with relish.

Definition: Things that are plentiful exist in such large amounts or numbers that there is enough for people's wants or needs.
Example: Fish are plentiful in the lake.

Definition: If something is worrying, it causes people to worry.
Example: It's worrying that they're doing things without training.

Definition: You use chiefly to indicate that a particular reason, emotion, method, or feature is the main or most important one.
Example: He joined the consular service, chiefly because this was one of the few job vacancies.

Definition: Latest is the superlative of late.
Example: ...her latest book.

Definition: If someone is behindhand, they have been delayed or have made less progress in their work than they or other people think they should.
Example: Poor Dr Pegler got terribly behindhand with his appointments.

Definition: When you chuckle, you laugh quietly.
Example: The banker chuckled and said, 'Of course not.'

Definition: If someone giggles, they laugh in a childlike way, because they are amused, nervous, or embarrassed.
Example: Both girls began to giggle.

Definition: If someone sniggers, they laugh quietly in a disrespectful way, for example at something rude or unkind.
Example: Suddenly, three schoolkids sitting near me started sniggering.

Definition: If you dispatch someone to a place, you send them there for a particular reason.
Example: He dispatched scouts ahead.

Definition: A statute is a rule or law which has been made by a government or other organization and formally written down.
Example: The new statute covers the care for, bringing up and protection of children.

Definition: You use secular to describe things that have no connection with religion.
Example: He spoke about preserving the country as a secular state.

Definition: An amateur is someone who does something as a hobby and not as a job.
Example: Jerry is an amateur who dances because he feels like it.

Definition:
If you are unqualified, you do not have any qualifications, or you do not have the right qualifications
for a particular job.
Example: She was unqualified for the job.

Definition: Someone who is untrained has not been taught the skills that they need for a particular job, activity, or situation.
Example: It is a nonsense to say we have untrained staff dealing with emergencies.

Definition: A seam is a line of stitches which joins two pieces of cloth together.
Example: The average U.K. coal seam is one metre thick.

Definition: A stratum of society is a group of people in it who are similar in their education, income, or social status.
Example: It was an enormous task that affected every stratum of society.

Definition: Guidance is help and advice.
Example:
...an opportunity for young people to improve their performance under the guidance
of professional coaches.

Definition: A dog's leash is a long thin piece of leather or a chain, which you attach to the dog's collar so that you can keep the dog under control.
Example: All dogs in public places should be on a leash.

Definition: Cord is strong, thick string.
Example: The door had been tied shut with a length of nylon cord.

Definition: Reins are the thin leather straps attached round a horse's neck which are used to control the horse.
Example: He was determined to see the party keep a hold on the reins of power.

Definition:
A needle is a small, very thin piece of polished metal which is used for sewing. It has a sharp point at one end and a hole in the
other for a thread to go through.
Example: She took the needle off the record and turned the lights out.

Definition:
A pad is a fairly thick, flat piece of a material such as cloth or rubber. Pads are used, for example,
to clean things, to protect things, or to change their shape.
Example: He withdrew the needle and placed a pad of cotton-wool over the spot.

Definition: If you prop an object on or against something, you support it by putting something underneath it or by resting it somewhere.
Example: He rocked back in the chair and propped his feet on the desk.

Definition: If you recline on something, you sit or lie on it with the upper part of your body supported at an angle.
Example: She proceeded to recline on a chaise longue.

Definition: A slender person is attractively thin and graceful.
Example: She was slender, with delicate wrists and ankles.

Definition: A skinny person is extremely thin, often in a way that you find unattractive.
Example: He was quite a skinny little boy.

Definition: If you memorize something, you learn it so that you can remember it exactly.
Example: He studied his map, trying to memorize the way to Rose's street.

Definition: If you mislay something, you put it somewhere and then forget where you have put it.
Example: I appear to have mislaid my jumper.

Definition: If you entrust something important to someone or entrust them with it, you make them responsible for looking after it or dealing with it.
Example:
If parents wanted to entrust their child to the best surgeons, they traveled to Bologna's
medical school.

Definition: A delegate is a person who is chosen to vote or make decisions on behalf of a group of other people, especially at a conference or a meeting.
Example: He plans to delegate more authority to his deputies.

Definition: If you bequeath your money or property to someone, you legally state that they should have it when you die.
Example:
Fields's will bequeathed his wife Hattie and son Claude the sum of twenty thousand
dollars.

Definition: You say that someone is endowed with a particular desirable ability, characteristic, or possession when they have it by chance or by birth.
Example: You are endowed with wealth, good health and a lively intellect.

Definition: If you brace yourself for something unpleasant or difficult, you prepare yourself for it.
Example: He braced himself for the icy plunge into the black water.

Definition: A bequest is money or property which you legally leave to someone when you die.
Example: The church here was left a bequest to hire doctors who would work amongst the poor.

Definition: Judicial means relating to the legal system and to judgments made in a court of law.
Example: ...an independent judicial inquiry.

Definition: If an activity, organization, or product is lawful, it is allowed by law.
Example: It remains lawful to own these swords but not to carry them in public.

Definition: To legitimize something, especially something bad, means to officially allow it, approve it, or make it seem acceptable.
Example: They will accept no agreement that legitimizes the ethnic division of the country.

Definition: The duration of an event or state is the time during which it happens or exists.
Example: He was given the task of protecting her for the duration of the trial.

Definition: You use minus to show that one number or quantity is being subtracted from another.
Example: One minus one is zero.

Definition: If something or someone is lacking in a particular quality, they do not have any of it or enough of it.
Example: ...if your hair is lacking in lustre and feeling dry.

Definition: If something is at a particular altitude, it is at that height above sea level.
Example: The aircraft had reached its cruising altitude of about 39,000 feet.

Definition: In architecture, an elevation is the front, back, or side of a building, or a drawing of one of these.
Example: ...the addition of two-storey wings on the north and south elevations.

Definition: A balanced report, book, or other document takes into account all the different opinions on something and presents information in a fair and reasonable way.
Example: ...a fair, balanced, comprehensive report.

Definition: If something devastates an area or a place, it damages it very badly or destroys it totally.
Example: A few days before, a fire had devastated large parts of Windsor Castle.

Definition: To demolish something such as a building means to destroy it completely.
Example: A storm moved directly over the island, demolishing buildings and flooding streets.

Definition: If you describe someone as tolerant, you approve of the fact that they allow other people to say and do as they like, even if they do not agree with or like it.
Example: They need to be tolerant of different points of view.

Definition: If you describe someone as open-minded, you approve of them because they are willing to listen to and consider other people's ideas and suggestions.
Example: He was very open-minded about other people's work.

Definition: A permissive person, society, or way of behaving allows or tolerates things which other people disapprove of.
Example: ...the permissive tolerance of the 1960s.

Definition: Someone who is progressive or has progressive ideas has modern ideas about how things should be done, rather than traditional ones.
Example: ...a progressive businessman who had voted for Roosevelt in 1932 and 1936.

Definition: If someone is libertarian or has libertarian attitudes, they believe in or support the idea that people should be free to think and behave in the way that they want.
Example: ...the libertarian argument that people should be allowed to choose.

Definition: A handsome man has an attractive face with regular features.
Example: ...a tall, dark, handsome sheep farmer.

Definition: In a house, a lounge is a room where people sit and relax.
Example: The Holmbergs were sitting before a roaring fire in the lounge, sipping their cocoa.

Definition: Falsehood is the quality or fact of being untrue or of being a lie.
Example: She called the verdict a victory of truth over falsehood.

Definition: a fabricating or being fabricated; construction; manufacture
Example: But it was more than a simple fabrication, that much was clear.

Definition: A fib is a small, unimportant lie.
Example: She told innocent fibs like anyone else.

Definition: If someone fabricates information, they invent it in order to deceive people.
Example: All four claim that officers fabricated evidence against them.

Definition: If someone misrepresents a person or situation, they give a wrong or inaccurate account of what the person or situation is like.
Example: He said that the press had misrepresented him as arrogant and bullying.

Definition: If you say that someone is deceitful, you mean that they behave in a dishonest way by making other people believe something that is not true.
Example: They claimed the government had been deceitful.

Definition: If you describe someone as treacherous, you mean that they are likely to betray you and cannot be trusted.
Example: He publicly left the party and denounced its treacherous leaders.

Definition: If someone who is giving evidence in a court of law commits perjury, they lie.
Example: This witness has committed perjury and no reliance can be placed on her evidence.

Definition: You can use wildlife to refer to the animals and other living things that live in the wild.
Example: People were concerned that pets or wildlife could be affected by the pesticides.

Definition: People's or animals' behaviour is the way that they behave. You can refer to a typical and repeated way of behaving as a behaviour.
Example: Make sure that good behaviour is rewarded.

Definition: If you hoist something heavy somewhere, you lift it or pull it up there.
Example: Hoisting my suitcase on to my shoulder, I turned and headed toward my hotel.

Definition: To exalt someone or something means to praise them very highly.
Example: However difficult she might have been, this book exalts her as both mother and muse.

Definition: A stimulus is something that encourages activity in people or things.
Example: Interest rates could fall soon and be a stimulus to the U.S. economy.

Definition: When something disperses or when you disperse it, it spreads over a wide area.
Example: The oil appeared to be dispersing.

Definition: Illumination is the lighting that a place has.
Example: The only illumination came from a small window high in the opposite wall.

Definition: A bulb is the glass part of an electric lamp, which gives out light when electricity passes through it.
Example: The stairwell was lit by a single bulb.

Definition: A torch is a small electric light which is powered by batteries and which you can carry in your hand.
Example: They lit a torch and set fire to the chapel's thatch.

Definition: To illuminate something means to shine light on it and to make it brighter and more visible.
Example: No streetlights illuminated the street.

Definition: If you light something up or if it lights up, it becomes bright, usually when you shine light on it.
Example: ...a keypad that lights up when you pick up the handset.

Definition: If someone brightens or their face brightens, they suddenly look happier.
Example: Seeing him, she seemed to brighten a little.

Definition: When something lightens or when you lighten it, it becomes less dark in colour.
Example: The sky began to lighten.

Definition: A glowing description or opinion about someone or something praises them highly or supports them strongly.
Example:
The media has been speaking in glowing terms of the relationship between the two
countries.

Definition: When you ignite something or when it ignites, it starts burning or explodes.
Example: The bombs ignited a fire which destroyed some 60 houses.

Definition: Something that is insubstantial is not large, solid, or strong.
Example: Mars has an insubstantial atmosphere, consisting almost entirely of carbon dioxide.

Definition: Something that is lightweight weighs less than most other things of the same type.
Example: ...lightweight denim.

Definition: Someone who is gentle is kind, mild, and calm.
Example: My son was a quiet and gentle man.

Definition: less colourful than previously
Example: Sally looked away, as the music ended and the moment faded.

Definition: Something that is insignificant is unimportant, especially because it is very small.
Example: In 1949 Bonn was a small, insignificant city.

Definition: Someone who is light-hearted is cheerful and happy.
Example: They were light-hearted and prepared to enjoy life.

Definition: If you say that something is probable, you mean that it is likely to be true or likely to happen.
Example:
It is probable that the medication will suppress the symptom without treating the
condition.

Definition: If there is an odds-on chance that something will happen, it is very likely that it will happen.
Example: Gerald was no longer the odds-on favourite to win the contest.

Definition: A deadline is a time or date before which a particular task must be finished or a particular thing must be done.
Example: We were not able to meet the deadline because of manufacturing delays.

Definition: Your qualifications are the examinations that you have passed.
Example: They will be encouraged to mix academic A-levels with vocational qualifications.

Definition: Something that is restricted is quite small or limited.
Example: ...the monotony of a heavily restricted diet.

Definition: If something is clearly defined or strongly defined, its outline is clear or strong.
Example: A clearly defined track now leads down to the valley.

Definition: Creases are lines that are made in cloth or paper when it is crushed or folded.
Example: She stood up, frowning at the creases in her silk dress.

Definition: A furrow is a long, thin line in the earth which a farmer makes in order to plant seeds or to allow water to flow along.
Example: Dirt bike trails crisscrossed the grassy furrows.

Definition: A queue is a line of people or vehicles that are waiting for something.
Example: I watched as he got a tray and joined the queue.

Definition: The trajectory of a moving object is the path that it follows as it moves.
Example: ...the trajectory of an artillery shell.

Definition: Someone's lineage is the series of families from which they are directly descended.
Example: They can trace their lineage directly back to the 18th century.

Definition: A succession of things of the same kind is a number of them that exist or happen one after the other.
Example: Adams took a succession of jobs which have stood him in good stead.

Definition: A fringe is hair which is cut so that it hangs over your forehead.
Example: The jacket had leather fringes.

Definition: The rim of a container such as a cup or glass is the edge that goes all the way round the top.
Example: She looked at him over the rim of her glass.

Definition: The brim of a hat is the wide part that sticks outwards at the bottom.
Example: Rain dripped from the brim of his baseball cap.

Definition: An inventory is a written list of all the objects in a particular place.
Example: Before starting, he made an inventory of everything that was to stay.

Definition: If you itemize a number of things, you make a list of them.
Example: Itemise your gear and mark major items with your name and post code.

Definition: 'Hark!' means 'Listen!'.
Example: Hark. I hear the returning footsteps of my love.

Definition: A well-read person has read a lot of books and has learned a lot from them.
Example: He was clever, well-read and interested in the arts.

Definition: Something that is lettered is covered or decorated with letters or words.
Example: ...a crudely lettered cardboard sign.

Definition: literary knowledge, ability, or learning
Example: At the top of every note she'd written in big bold letters URGENT.

Definition: The lore of a particular country or culture is its traditional stories and history.
Example: ...the Book of the Sea, which was stuffed with sailors' lore.

Definition: A leaflet is a little book or a piece of paper containing information about a particular subject.
Example: Campaigners handed out leaflets on passive smoking.

Definition: A brochure is a magazine or thin book with pictures that gives you information about a product or service.
Example: ...travel brochures.

Definition: Something that is short-lived does not last very long.
Example: Any hope that the speech would end the war was short-lived.

Definition: If you describe something or someone as unimportant, you mean that they do not have much influence, effect, or value, and are therefore not worth serious consideration.
Example: It was an unimportant job, and paid very little.

Definition: You can use petty to describe things such as problems, rules, or arguments which you think are unimportant or relate to unimportant things.
Example: He was miserable all the time and rows would start over petty things.

Definition: If you describe something as trivial, you think that it is unimportant and not serious.
Example:
The director tried to wave aside these issues as trivial details that could be settled
later.

Definition: A lodge is a house or hut in the country or in the mountains where people stay on holiday, especially when they want to shoot or fish.
Example: ...a Victorian hunting lodge.

Definition: If a proposal, principle, or opinion prevails, it gains influence or is accepted, often after a struggle or argument.
Example: We hope that common sense would prevail.

Definition: If you  get along with someone, you have a friendly relationship with them. You can also say that two people get along.
