Definition: A pragmatic way of dealing with something is based on practical considerations, rather than theoretical ones. A pragmatic person deals with things in a practical way.
Example: Robin took a pragmatic look at her situation.

Definition: A supplication is a prayer to God or a respectful request to someone in authority for help.
Example: He raised his arms in a gesture of supplication.

Definition: Communion with nature or with a person is the feeling that you are sharing thoughts or feelings with them.
Example: ...communion with nature.

Definition: If you describe what someone says as a litany of things, you mean that you have heard it many times before, and you think it is boring or insincere.
Example: She remained in the doorway, listening to his litany of complaints against her client.

Definition: An invocation is a request for help or forgiveness made to a god.
Example: ...an invocation for divine guidance.

Definition: Intercession is the act of interceding with someone.
Example: His intercession could be of help to the tribe.

Definition: Squarely means directly or in the middle, rather than indirectly or at an angle.
Example: I kept the gun aimed squarely at his eyes.

Definition: If you foretell a future event, you predict that it will happen.
Example: ...prophets who have foretold the end of the world.

Definition: If you foresee something, you expect and believe that it will happen.
Example: He did not foresee any problems.

Definition: Gestation is the process in which babies grow inside their mother's body before they are born.
Example: ...the seventeenth week of gestation.

Definition: If someone is expectant, they are excited because they think something interesting is about to happen.
Example: An expectant crowd gathered.

Definition: pregnant
Example: Rather than the biting retort Mikel was expecting, she shrugged.

Definition: If you describe something as meaningful, you mean that it is serious, important, or useful in some way.
Example: She believes these talks will be the start of a constructive and meaningful dialogue.

Definition: Something that is pointed has a point at one end.
Example: ...a pointed roof.

Definition: If something is in the vicinity of a particular place, it is near it.
Example: There were a hundred or so hotels in the vicinity of the railway station.

Definition: You can describe something as existent when it exists.
Example: Their remedy lay within the range of existent technology.

Definition: If something is extant, it is still in existence, in spite of being very old.
Example: Two fourteenth-century manuscripts of this text are still extant.

Definition: Submission is a state in which people can no longer do what they want to do because they have been brought under the control of someone else.
Example: The army intends to take the city or simply starve it into submission.

Definition: Packaging is the container or covering that something is sold in.
Example: It is selling very well, in part because the packaging is so attractive.

Definition: conformity or harmony (esp in the phrases in or out of keeping)
Example: Everybody in here was keeping something back for themselves.

Definition: Conservation is saving and protecting the environment.
Example: ...a four-nation regional meeting on elephant conservation.

Definition: A sanctuary is a place where people who are in danger from other people can go to be safe.
Example: His church became a sanctuary for thousands of people who fled the civil war.

Definition:
Jam is a thick sweet food that is made by cooking fruit with a large amount of sugar,
and that is usually spread on bread.
Example: ...home-made jam.

Definition: If you beg someone to do something, you ask them very anxiously or eagerly to do it.
Example: I begged him to come back to England with me.

Definition: Steam is the hot mist that forms when water boils. Steam vehicles and machines are operated using steam as a means of power.
Example: In an electric power plant the heat converts water into high-pressure steam.

Definition: When you compress something or when it compresses, it is pressed or squeezed so that it takes up less space.
Example: Poor posture, sitting or walking slouched over, compresses the body's organs.

Definition: If you grind a substance such as corn, you crush it between two hard surfaces or with a machine until it becomes a fine powder.
Example: Store the peppercorns in an airtight container and grind the pepper as you need it.

Definition: If someone is living in a make-believe world, they are pretending that things are better, different, or more exciting than they really are instead of facing up to reality.
Example: ...the glamorous make-believe world of show business.

Definition: Elimination is the process of getting rid of waste products from your body by going to the bathroom.
Example: Breast-feeding is as natural as sex or elimination or any other bodily function.

Definition: To safeguard something or someone means to protect them from being harmed, lost, or badly treated.
Example: They will press for international action to safeguard the ozone layer.

Definition: A precaution is an action that is intended to prevent something dangerous or unpleasant from happening.
Example: Could he not, just as a precaution, move to a place of safety?

Definition: Anticipation is a feeling of excitement about something pleasant or exciting that you know is going to happen.
Example: There's been an atmosphere of anticipation around here for a few days now.

Definition: Self-respect is a feeling of confidence and pride in your own ability and worth.
Example: They have lost not only their jobs, but their homes and their self-respect.

Definition: Someone's ego is their sense of their own worth. For example, if someone has a large ego, they think they are very important and valuable.
Example: He had a massive ego; never would he admit he was wrong.

Definition: Conceit is very great pride in your abilities or achievements that other people feel is too great.
Example: He knew, without conceit, he was considered a genius.

Definition: If you refer to someone's vanity, you are critical of them because they take great pride in their appearance or abilities.
Example: Men who use steroids are often motivated by sheer vanity.

Definition: the quality or state of being arrogant; overbearing pride or self-importance
Example: To spite his parents, to excuse his arrogance, to explain his outlandish behaviour.

Definition: If you say that someone has pretensions, you disapprove of them because they claim or pretend that they are more important than they really are.
Example: Her wide-eyed innocence soon exposes the pretensions of the art world.

Definition: An etching is a picture printed from a metal plate that has had a design cut into it with acid.
Example: It has often bought paintings, etchings and photographs by little-known artists that subsequently become considerably more valuable.

Definition: An engraving is a picture or design that has been cut into a surface.
Example: ...a color engraving of oranges and lemons.

Definition: If you refer to someone as a jailbird, you mean that they are in prison, or have been in prison.
Example: But she is set to have her world turned upside down by her jailbird dad 's return over the summer.

Definition: A captive person or animal is being kept imprisoned or enclosed.
Example: Her heart had begun to pound inside her chest like a captive animal.

Definition: A hostage is someone who has been captured by a person or organization and who may be killed or injured if people do not do what that person or organization demands.
Example: It is hopeful that two hostages will be freed in the next few days.

Definition: A detainee is someone who is held prisoner by a government because of his or her political views or activities.
Example: These detainees should be released as soon as possible.

Definition: If you are living in seclusion, you are in a quiet place away from other people.
Example: She lived in seclusion with her husband on their farm in Panama.

Definition: Isolation is the state of feeling alone and without friends or help.
Example: Many deaf people have feelings of isolation and loneliness.

Definition: Solitude is the state of being alone, especially when this is peaceful and pleasant.
Example: He enjoyed his moments of solitude before the pressures of the day began.

Definition: A secluded place is quiet and private.
Example: We were tucked away in a secluded corner of the room.

Definition: If you refer to someone's plight, you mean that they are in a difficult or distressing situation that is full of problems.
Example: ...the worsening plight of developing nations plagued by debts.

Definition: Output is used to refer to the amount of something that a person or thing produces.
Example: Manual workers need a good breakfast for high-energy output.

Definition: White-collar workers work in offices rather than doing physical work such as making things in factories or building things.
Example: White-collar workers now work longer hours.

Definition: general appearance or outline
Example: The diamond was unbroken, the lines of magical fire streaming without pause between the brightness of the cardinal marks.

Definition: A biography of someone is an account of their life, written by someone else.
Example: ...a volume of biography and criticism.

Definition: If one thing displaces another, it forces the other thing out of its place, position, or role, and then occupies that place, position, or role itself.
Example:
These factories have displaced tourism as the country's largest source of foreign
exchange.

Definition: If something  stands out, it is very noticeable.
Example: Every tree, wall and fence stood out against dazzling white fields.

Definition: If you vow to do something, you make a serious promise or decision that you will do it.
Example: While many models vow to go back to college, few do.

Definition: Advancement is progress in your job or in your social position.
Example: He cared little for social advancement.

Definition: If equipment or services are upgraded, they are improved or made more efficient.
Example: Helicopters have been upgraded and modernized.

Definition: When someone or something achieves a more important rank or status, you can say that they are elevated to it.
Example: He was elevated to the post of prime minister.

Definition: If you are impervious to someone's actions, you are not affected or influenced by them.
Example: She seems almost impervious to the criticism from all sides.

Definition: Someone who is resistant to something is opposed to it and wants to prevent it.
Example: Some people are very resistant to the idea of exercise.

Definition: Someone who is polite has good manners and behaves in a way that is socially correct and not rude to other people.
Example: Everyone around him was trying to be polite, but you could tell they were all bored.

Definition: Seemly behaviour or dress is appropriate in the particular circumstances.
Example: Self-assertion was not thought seemly in a woman.

Definition: If you have a holding in a company, you own shares in it.
Example: That would increase Olympia & York's holding to 35%.

Definition: The likelihood of something happening is how likely it is to happen.
Example: The likelihood of infection is minimal.

Definition: You can refer to a person or organization that gives or supplies a particular thing as a giver of that thing.
Example: It was William who was the giver of the piano.

Definition: If you stipulate a condition or stipulate that something must be done, you say clearly that it must be done.
Example: She could have stipulated that she would pay when she collected the computer.

Definition: You use civic to describe people or things that have an official status in a town or city.
Example: ...the local politicians and civic leaders of Manchester.

Definition: Someone or something that is respected is admired and considered important by many people.
Example: He is highly respected for his novels and plays.

Definition: Something that tempts you attracts you and makes you want it, even though it may be wrong or harmful.
Example: Reducing income could tempt an offender into further crime.

Definition: the act, fact, or process of exerting; active use of strength, power, etc.; exercise
Example: He was flabby and untidy, his face was red and his hair wet with exertion.

Definition: Retribution is punishment for a crime, especially punishment which is carried out by someone other than the official authorities.
Example: He didn't want any further involvement for fear of retribution.

Definition: If you do penance for something wrong that you have done, you do something that you find unpleasant to show that you are sorry.
Example: ...a time of fasting, penance and pilgrimage.

Definition: Maltreatment is cruel behaviour, especially involving hurting a person or animal.
Example: 2,000 prisoners died as a result of torture and maltreatment.

Definition: If you describe something as immaculate, you mean that it is extremely clean, tidy, or neat.
Example: Her front room was kept immaculate.

Definition: The clarity of something such as a book or argument is its quality of being well explained and easy to understand.
Example: ...the clarity with which the author explains technical subjects.

Definition: Cleanliness is the degree to which people keep themselves and their surroundings clean.
Example: Many of Britain's beaches fail to meet minimum standards of cleanliness.

Definition: An abstract idea or way of thinking is based on general ideas rather than on real things and events.
Example: ...abstract principles such as justice.

Definition: Philosophical means concerned with or relating to philosophy.
Example: He was not accustomed to political or philosophical discussions.

Definition: A piece of information that is speculative is based on guesses rather than knowledge.
Example: The papers ran speculative stories about his mysterious disappearance.

Definition: Innocence is the quality of having no experience or knowledge of the more complex or unpleasant aspects of life.
Example: ...the sweet innocence of youth.

Definition: If you shove someone or something, you push them with a quick, violent movement.
Example: He shoved her out of the way.

Definition: When a lawyer cross-examines someone during a trial or hearing, he or she questions them about the evidence that they have already given.
Example: The accused's lawyers will get a chance to cross-examine him.

Definition: A swift event or process happens very quickly or without delay.
Example: Our task is to challenge the U.N. to make a swift decision.

Definition: Something that is instantaneous happens immediately and very quickly.
Example: Death was instantaneous because both bullets hit the heart.

Definition: Muted colours are soft and gentle, not bright and strong.
Example: He likes sombre, muted coloursshe likes bright colours.

Definition: Confidentially is used to say that what you are telling someone is a secret and should not be discussed with anyone else.
Example: Confidentially, I am not sure that it wasn't above their heads.

Definition: You can use calmly to emphasize that someone is behaving in a very controlled or ordinary way in a frightening or unusual situation.
Example: The gunmen calmly walked away and escaped in a waiting car.

Definition: A hushed place is peaceful and much quieter and calmer than usual.
Example: The house seemed muted, hushed as if it had been deserted.

Definition: Something that remains undisturbed is not touched, moved, or used by anyone.
Example: The desk looked undisturbed.

Definition: a state of calm or quietude
Example: Office workers take their sandwiches there to enjoy its tranquillity.

Definition: If you are discreet, you are polite and careful in what you do or say, because you want to avoid embarrassing or offending someone.
Example: They were gossipy and not always discreet.

Definition: A shy person is nervous and uncomfortable in the company of other people.
Example: He is painfully shy of women.

Definition: Someone or something that is tender expresses gentle and caring feelings.
Example: Her voice was tender, full of pity.

Definition: A quest is a long and difficult search for something.
Example: My quest for a better bank continues.

Definition: A fence made from metal bars is called a railing or railings.
Example: He walked out on to the balcony where he rested his arms on the railing.

Definition: A shaft is a long vertical passage, for example for a lift.
Example: He was found dead at the bottom of a lift shaft.

Definition: A deluge of things is a large number of them which arrive or happen at the same time.
Example: A deluge of manuscripts began to arrive in the post.

Definition: If something uplifts people, it helps them to have a better life, for example by making them feel happy or by improving their social conditions.
Example: We need a little something to help sometimes, to uplift us and make us feel better.

Definition: If you intensify something or if it intensifies, it becomes greater in strength, amount, or degree.
Example: Britain is intensifying its efforts to secure the release of the hostages.

Definition: If something heightens a feeling or if the feeling heightens, the feeling increases in degree or intensity.
Example: The move has heightened tension in the state.

Definition: If you amplify a sound, you make it louder, usually by using electronic equipment.
Example: This landscape seemed to trap and amplify sounds.

Definition: An increment in something or in the value of something is an amount by which it increases.
Example: The average yearly increment in labour productivity in industry was 4.5 per cent.

Definition: If you foster a child, you take it into your family for a period of time, without becoming its legal parent.
Example: She has since gone on to find happiness by fostering more than 100 children.

Definition: If you roam an area or roam around it, you wander or travel around it without having a particular purpose.
Example: Barefoot children roamed the streets.

Definition: If someone roves about an area or roves an area, they wander around it.
Example: ...roving about the town in the dead of night and seeing something peculiar.

Definition: A caste is one of the traditional social classes into which people are divided in a Hindu society.
Example: In the secretariat, there is a mix of those from the lower and upper castes.

Definition: The nobility of a society are all the people who have titles and belong to a high social class.
Example: They married into the nobility and entered the highest ranks of state administration.

Definition: If something precipitates an event or situation, usually a bad one, it causes it to happen suddenly or sooner than normal.
Example: The recent killings have precipitated the worst crisis yet.

Definition: If you say that something is priceless, you are emphasizing that it is worth a very large amount of money.
Example: They are priceless, unique and irreplaceable.

Definition: Something that is out of the ordinary is unusual or different.
Example: The boy's knowledge was out of the ordinary.

Definition: Bloody is used by some people to emphasize what they are saying, especially when they are angry.
Example: Forty-three demonstrators were killed in bloody clashes.

Definition: The tempo of an event is the speed at which it happens.
Example: ...owing to the slow tempo of change in an overwhelmingly rural country.

Definition: Velocity is the speed at which something moves in a particular direction.
Example: ...the velocity of light.

Definition: In many sports, the list of the best players made by an official organization is called the rankings.
Example: ...the 25 leading teams in the world rankings.

Definition: A classification is a division or category in a system which divides things into groups or types.
Example: Its tariffs cater for four basic classifications of customer.

Definition: An unrefined food or other substance is in its natural state and has not been processed.
Example: Unrefined carbohydrates include brown rice and other grains.

Definition: A crude method or measurement is not exact or detailed, but may be useful or correct in a rough, general way.
Example: Measurements of blood pressure are a crude way of assessing the risk of heart disease.

Definition: If you are unprepared for something, you are not ready for it, and you are therefore surprised or at a disadvantage when it happens.
Example: I was totally unprepared for the announcement on the next day.

Definition: If you describe someone as ignorant, you mean that they do not know things they should know. If someone is ignorant of a fact, they do not know it.
Example: People don't like to ask questions for fear of appearing ignorant.

Definition: A backlash against a tendency or recent development in society or politics, is a sudden, strong reaction against it.
Example: ...the male backlash against feminism.

Definition: When someone recites a poem or other piece of writing, they say it aloud after they have learned it.
Example: They recited poetry to one another.

Definition: If you declaim, you speak dramatically, as if you were acting in a theatre.
Example: He raised his right fist and declaimed: 'Liar and cheat!'

Definition: If you cannot comprehend something, you cannot understand it.
Example: I just cannot comprehend your attitude.

Definition: If something is construed in a particular way, its nature or meaning is interpreted in that way.
Example: What may seem helpful behaviour to you can be construed as interference by others.

Definition: Perusal of something such as a letter, article, or document is the action of reading it.
Example: Peter Cooke undertook to send each of us a sample contract for perusal.

Definition: A recital is a performance of music or poetry, usually given by one person.
Example: ...a solo recital by the harpsichordist Maggie Cole.

Definition: A rendition of a play, poem, or piece of music is a performance of it.
Example: The musicians burst into a rousing rendition of 'Happy Birthday'.

Definition: Ripe fruit or grain is fully grown and ready to eat.
Example: Always choose firm, but ripe fruit.

Definition: Mellow is used to describe things that have a pleasant, soft, rich colour, usually red, orange, yellow, or brown.
Example: ...a classic Queen Anne house of mellow red brick with a white portico.

Definition: on the point of; intending to
Example: Tell her you were about to go to bed with me for the second time tonight.

Definition: An authentic person, object, or emotion is genuine.
Example: ...authentic Italian food.

Definition: If something or someone is bona fide, they are genuine or real.
Example: We are happy to donate to bona fide charitable causes.

Definition: Actuality is the state of really existing rather than being imagined.
Example: It exists in dreams rather than actuality.

Definition: An accomplishment is something remarkable that has been done or achieved.
Example: For a novelist, that's quite an accomplishment.

Definition: A reasoned discussion or argument is based on sensible reasons, rather than on an appeal to people's emotions.
Example: Abortion is an issue which produces little reasoned argument.

Definition: If you recollect something, you remember it.
Example:
Ramona spoke with warmth when she recollected the doctor who used to be at the county
hospital.

Definition: To evoke a particular memory, idea, emotion, or response means to cause it to occur.
Example: ...the scene evoking memories of those old movies.

Definition: An acknowledgment is a statement or action which recognizes that something exists or is true.
Example:
The president's resignation appears to be an acknowledgment that he has lost all
hope of keeping the country together.

Definition: the act or an instance of commending; praise
Example: Had it worked, he'd probably have been given a commendation.

Definition: In sport, if a person or their performance is unbeaten, nobody else has performed well enough to beat them.
Example: He's unbeaten in 20 fights.

Definition: If you describe something as unparalleled, you are emphasizing that it is, for example, bigger, better, or worse than anything else of its kind, or anything that has happened before.
Example: Germany's unparalleled prosperity is based on wise investments.

Definition: If you  bounce back after a bad experience, you return very quickly to your previous level of success, enthusiasm, or activity.
Example: We lost two or three early games in the World Cup, but we bounced back.

Definition: If you retrieve something, you get it back from the place where you left it.
Example: He reached over and retrieved his jacket from the back seat.

Definition: If something is salvaged, someone manages to save it, for example from a ship that has sunk, or from a building that has been damaged.
Example: The team's first task was to decide what equipment could be salvaged.

Definition: If you recoup a sum of money that you have spent or lost, you get it back.
Example: Insurance companies are trying to recoup their losses by increasing premiums.

Definition: When there is a revival of something, it becomes active or popular again.
Example: This return to realism has produced a revival of interest in a number of artists.

Definition: The Restoration was the event in 1660 when Charles the Second became King of England, Scotland, and Ireland after a period when there had been no King or Queen.
Example: ...a Restoration comedy.

Definition: A beginner is someone who has just started learning to do something and cannot do it very well yet.
Example: The course is suitable for beginners and advanced students.

Definition: An apprentice is a young person who works for someone in order to learn their skill.
Example: I started off as an apprentice and worked my way up.

Definition: A novice is someone who has been doing a job or other activity for only a short time and so is not experienced at it.
Example: As a novice writer, this is something I'm interested in.

Definition: A person who is embarrassed feels shy, ashamed, or guilty about something.
Example: He looked a bit embarrassed.

Definition: A communist is someone who believes in communism.
Example: ...the Communist Party.

Definition: Socialist means based on socialism or relating to socialism.
Example: ...members of the ruling Socialist party.

Definition: Something that degrades someone causes people to have less respect for them.
Example: ...the notion that pornography degrades women.

Definition: If something is downgraded, it is given less importance than it used to have or than you think it should have.
Example: The boy's condition has been downgraded from critical to serious.

Definition: If someone demotes you, they give you a lower rank or a less important position than you already have, often as a punishment.
Example:
It's very difficult to demote somebody who has been standing in during maternity
leave.

Definition: When you thicken a liquid or when it thickens, it becomes stiffer and more solid.
Example: Thicken the broth with the cornflour.

Definition: If people gel with each other, or if two groups of people gel, they work well together because their skills and personalities fit together well.
Example: They have gelled very well with the rest of the side.

Definition: A clot is a sticky lump that forms when blood dries up or becomes thick.
Example: He needed emergency surgery to remove a blood clot from his brain.

Definition: The trimming on something such as a piece of clothing is the decoration, for example along its edges, that is in a different colour or material.
Example: ...the lace trimming on her satin nightgown.

Definition: An allusion is an indirect reference to someone or something.
Example: The title is perhaps an allusion to the author's childhood.

Definition: A testimonial is a written statement about a person's character and abilities, often written by their employer.
Example: Her employer could provide testimonials to her character and ability.

Definition:
Someone's credentials are their previous achievements, training, and general background, which indicate
that they are qualified to do something.
Example: ...her credentials as a Bach specialist.

Definition: An echo is a sound which is caused by a noise being reflected off a surface such as a wall.
Example: He listened and heard nothing but the echoes of his own voice in the cave.

Definition: If you do something that is deliberate, you planned or decided to do it beforehand, and so it happens on purpose rather than by chance.
Example: It has a deliberate policy to introduce world art to Britain.

Definition:
Someone's or something's counterpart is another person or thing that has a similar function or position in a different
place.
Example: The Foreign Secretary telephoned his Italian counterpart to protest.

Definition: A slur is an insulting remark which could damage someone's reputation.
Example: This is yet another slur on the integrity of the Metropolitan Police.

Definition: If you reproach someone, you say or show that you are disappointed, upset, or angry because they have done something wrong.
Example: She is quick to reproach anyone who doesn't live up to her own high standards.

Definition: If someone is living in exile, they are living in a foreign country because they cannot live in their own country, usually for political reasons.
Example: He is now living in exile in Egypt.

Definition: An  asylum seeker is a person who is trying to get asylum in a foreign country.
Example: Fewer than 7% of asylum seekers are accepted as political refugees.

Definition: Rubbish consists of unwanted things or waste material such as used paper, empty tins and bottles, and waste food.
Example: ...unwanted household rubbish.

Definition: Deference is a polite and respectful attitude towards someone, especially because they have an important position.
Example: The old sense of deference and restraint in royal reporting has vanished.

Definition: If you describe someone as parochial, you are critical of them because you think they are too concerned with their own affairs and should be thinking about more important things.
Example: She was a secretary on the local parochial church council.

Definition: If you enrol or are enrolled at an institution or on a course, you officially join it and pay a fee for it.
Example: Cherny was enrolled at the University in 1945.

Definition: If someone enlists or is enlisted, they join the army, navy, marines, or air force.
Example:
Six days after war was declared, he enlisted in the 5th Battalion,The Cameronians
and was sent to France.

Definition: When a statement or fact  sinks in, you finally understand or realize it fully.
Example: The implication took a while to sink in.

Definition: To fortify a place means to make it stronger and more difficult to attack, often by building a wall or ditch round it.
Example: The knights had fortified the main town on the island.

Definition: If you toughen something or if it toughens, you make it stronger so that it will not break easily.
Example: Do not add salt to beans when cooking as this tends to toughen the skins.

Definition: When an employee is dismissed from their job, you can refer to their dismissal.
Example: ...Mr Low's dismissal from his post at the head of the commission.

Definition: A denial of something is a statement that it is not true, does not exist, or did not happen.
Example: Despite official denials, the rumours still persist.

Definition: The exclusion of something is the act of deliberately not using, allowing, or considering it.
Example: This paves the way for the exclusion of all but emergency care.

Definition: If you rebuff someone or rebuff a suggestion that they make, you refuse to do what they suggest.
Example: His proposals have already been rebuffed by the Prime Minister.

Definition: If someone is jilted, the person they are having a romantic relationship with suddenly ends the relationship in a surprising and upsetting way.
Example: She was jilted by her first fianc.

Definition:
You use comparative to show that you are judging something against a previous or different situation. For example, comparative calm is a situation which is calmer than before or calmer than the situation in other
places.
Example: ...those who manage to reach the comparative safety of Fendel.

Definition: parallel; equivalent
Example: I read off the codes on the sides of the boxes and Viktor placed a set of corresponding documents on each.

Definition: Something that is comparable to something else is roughly similar, for example in amount or importance.
Example: ...paying the same wages to men and women for work of comparable value.

Definition: Respective means relating or belonging separately to the individual people you have just mentioned.
Example: Steve and I were at very different stages in our respective careers.

Definition: If a person or situation  loosens up, they become more relaxed and less tense.
Example: Relax, smile; loosen up in mind and body and behaviour.

Definition: If someone unbends, their attitude becomes less strict than it was.
Example: In her dying days the old Queen unbent a little.

Definition: a liberating or being liberated
Example: women's liberation movement

Definition: When something dissipates or when you dissipate it, it becomes less or becomes less strong until it disappears or goes away completely.
Example: The tension in the room had dissipated.

Definition: If a substance dissolves in liquid or if you dissolve it, it becomes mixed with the liquid and disappears.
Example: Heat gently until the sugar dissolves.

Definition: Something that is pertinent is relevant to a particular subject.
Example: She had asked some pertinent questions.

Definition: If two or more things are related, there is a connection between them.
Example: The philosophical problems of chance and of free will are closely related.

Definition: A respite is a short period of rest from something unpleasant.
Example: It was some weeks now since they had had any respite from shellfire.

Definition: If you refer to the replacement of one thing by another, you mean that the second thing takes the place of the first.
Example: ...the replacement of damaged or lost books.

Definition: If you endure a painful or difficult situation, you experience it and do not avoid it or give up, usually because you cannot.
Example: The company endured heavy financial losses.

Definition: To commemorate an important event or person means to remember them by means of a special action, ceremony, or specially-created object.
Example:
One room contained a gallery of paintings commemorating great moments in baseball
history.

Definition: If you describe something such as a fact or remark as irrelevant, you mean that it is not connected with what you are discussing or dealing with.
Example: ...irrelevant details.

Definition: If you erase a thought or feeling, you destroy it completely so that you can no longer remember something or no longer feel a particular emotion.
Example: They are desperate to erase the memory of that last defeat in Cardiff.

Definition: To eradicate something means to get rid of it completely.
Example: They are already battling to eradicate illnesses such as malaria and tetanus.

Definition: You can say that you are going to recapitulate the main points of an explanation, argument, or description when you want to draw attention to the fact that you are going to repeat the most important points as a summary.
Example: Let's just recapitulate the essential points.

Definition: If a match between two sports teams is replayed, the two teams play it again, because neither team won the first time, or because the match was stopped because of bad weather.
Example: Drawn matches were replayed three or four days later.

Definition: To retort means to reply angrily to someone.
Example: Was he afraid, he was asked. 'Afraid of what?' he retorted.

Definition: If one thing symbolizes another, it is used or regarded as a symbol of it.
Example: A cherry twig is placed in water to symbolize the hope of new life to come.

Definition: An exposition of an idea or theory is a detailed explanation or account of it.
Example: A long exposition of the new republican ideas would be tiresome.

Definition: If you describe someone or something as exemplary, you think they are extremely good.
Example: Underpinning this success has been an exemplary record of innovation.

Definition: the act of stipulating
Example: The only stipulation that McGregor made was about the governor.

Definition: The inhabitants of a place are the people who live there.
Example: ...the inhabitants of Glasgow.

Definition: The householder is the person who owns or rents a particular house.
Example: Millions of householders are eligible to claim the new council tax benefit.

Definition: If something or someone withstands a force or action, they survive it or do not give in to it.
Example: ...armoured vehicles designed to withstand chemical attack.

Definition: If someone or something is at fault, they are to blame or are responsible for a particular situation that has gone wrong.
Example: He could never accept that he had been at fault.

Definition: If you are accountable to someone for something that you do, you are responsible for it and must be prepared to justify your actions to that person.
Example: Public officials can finally be held accountable for their actions.

Definition: If people or things are liable to something unpleasant, they are likely to experience it or do it.
Example: She will grow into a woman particularly liable to depression.

Definition: Someone or something that is authoritative gives an impression of power and importance and is likely to be obeyed.
Example: He has a commanding presence and a deep, authoritative voice.

Definition: Repose is a state in which you are resting and feeling calm.
Example: He had a still, almost blank face in repose.

Definition: If you reinstate someone, you give them back a job or position which had been taken away from them.
Example: The governor is said to have agreed to reinstate five senior workers who were dismissed.

Definition: Reinstatement is the act of giving someone back a job or position which has been taken away from them.
Example: Parents campaigned in vain for her reinstatement.

Definition: Restitution is the act of giving back to a person something that was lost or stolen, or of paying them money for the loss.
Example: The victims are demanding full restitution.

Definition: When something such as the economy, a business, a trend, or a feeling is revived or when it revives, it becomes active, popular, or successful again.
Example: ...an attempt to revive the British economy.

Definition: If there is a renewal of an activity or a situation, it starts again.
Example: They will discuss the possible renewal of diplomatic relations.

Definition: If you retreat, you move away from something or someone.
Example: 'I've already got a job,' I said quickly, and retreated from the room.

Definition: To go to bed with someone means to have sex with them.
Example: You could go to bed ( boring ).

Definition: If something  goes back to a particular time in the past, it was made or started at that time.
Example: The feud between the two sects goes back to the 11th century.

Definition: If something recurs, it happens more than once.
Example: ...a theme that was to recur frequently in his work.

Definition: If something that you had forgotten  comes back to you, you remember it.
Example: I'll think of his name in a moment when it comes back to me.

Definition: If you reconsider a decision or opinion, you think about it and try to decide whether it should be changed.
Example: We want you to reconsider your decision to resign from the board.

Definition: If you revise the way you think about something, you adjust your thoughts, usually in order to make them better or more suited to how things are.
Example: He soon came to revise his opinion of the profession.

Definition: A critique is a written examination and judgment of a situation or of a person's work or ideas.
Example: She had brought a book, a feminist critique of Victorian lady novelists.

Definition: A commentary is a description of an event that is broadcast on radio or television while the event is taking place.
Example: He gave the listening crowd a running commentary.

Definition: A revolt is an illegal and often violent attempt by a group of people to change their country's political system.
Example: It was undeniably a revolt by ordinary people against their leaders.

Definition: When there is a coup, a group of people seize power in a country.
Example: ...a military coup.

Definition: A rebellion is a violent organized action by a large group of people who are trying to change their country's political system.
Example: The British soon put down the rebellion.

Definition: Opulent things or places look grand and expensive.
Example: ...an opulent office on Wimpole Street in London's West End.

Definition: A full-bodied wine has a full, rich flavor.
Example: ...a soft but full-bodied wine with concentrated blackcurrant flavor.

Definition: Food that is delicious has a very pleasant taste.
Example: There's always a wide selection of delicious meals to choose from.

Definition: Something that is fruitful produces good and useful results.
Example: We had a long, happy, fruitful relationship.

Definition: Land or soil that is fertile is able to support the growth of a large number of strong healthy plants.
Example: ...fertile soil.

Definition: A prolific writer, artist, or composer produces a large number of works.
Example: She is a prolific writer of novels and short stories.

Definition: Someone who is sane is able to think and behave normally and reasonably, and is not mentally ill.
Example: He seemed perfectly sane.

Definition: When a noise resounds, it is heard very loudly and clearly.
Example: A roar of approval resounded through the Ukrainian parliament.

Definition: When a loud sound reverberates through a place, it echoes through it.
Example: The sound of the tank guns reverberated through the little Bavarian town.

Definition: If something resonates, it vibrates and produces a deep, strong sound.
Example: The bass guitar began to thump so loudly that it resonated in my head.

Definition: If something looms over you, it appears as a large or unclear shape, often in a frightening way.
Example: Vincent loomed over me, as pale and grey as a tombstone.

Definition: An ascent is an upward journey, especially when you are walking or climbing.
Example: He led the first ascent of Kangchenjunga, the world's third highest mountain.

Definition: A rocket is a space vehicle that is shaped like a long tube.
Example: There has been a renewed rocket attack on the capital.

Definition: If there is an upturn in the economy or in a company or industry, it improves or becomes more successful.
Example: They do not expect an upturn in the economy until the end of the year.

Definition: Rebels are people who are fighting against their own country's army in order to change the political system there.
Example: ...fighting between rebels and government forces.

Definition: A mutiny is a refusal by people, usually soldiers or sailors, to continue obeying a person in authority.
Example: A series of coup attempts and mutinies within the armed forces destabilized the regime.

Definition: To endanger something or someone means to put them in a situation where they might be harmed or destroyed completely.
Example: The debate could endanger the proposed peace talks.

Definition: To jeopardize a situation or activity means to do something that may destroy it or cause it to fail.
Example: He has jeopardised the future of his government.

Definition: Something that imperils you puts you in danger.
Example: You imperilled the lives of other road users by your driving.

Definition: A boulder is a large rounded rock.
Example: The granite is reduced to heaps of reddish rounded boulders.

Definition: A reel is a cylindrical object around which you wrap something such as cinema film, magnetic tape, fishing line, or cotton thread.
Example: ...a 30m reel of cable.

Definition: If you are stunned by something, you are extremely shocked or surprised by it and are therefore unable to speak or do anything.
Example: Many cinema-goers were stunned by the film's violent and tragic end.

Definition: A rumble is a low continuous noise.
Example: The silence of the night was punctuated by the distant rumble of traffic.

Definition: Drumming is the action of playing the drums.
Example: He pointed up to the roof, through which the steady drumming of rain could be heard.

Definition: If something, usually a vehicle, roars somewhere, it goes there very fast, making a loud noise.
Example: A police car roared past.

Definition: If you are fond of someone, you feel affection for them.
Example: I am very fond of Michael.

Definition: If you describe someone as idealistic, you mean that they have ideals, and base their behaviour on these ideals, even though this may be impractical.
Example: Idealistic young people died for the cause.

Definition: If you say that someone is being unrealistic, you mean that they do not recognize the truth about a situation, especially about the difficulties involved in something they want to achieve.
Example:
There are many who feel that the players are being completely unrealistic in their
demands.

Definition: If you refer to someone as a visionary, you mean that they have strong, original ideas about how things might be different in the future, especially about how things might be improved.
Example: Visionaries see the world ahead in terms of what it can be.

Definition: High-flown language is very grand, formal, or literary.
Example:
It is highly probable that many of the Service's personnel were put off by such high-flown
rhetoric.

Definition: Leeway is the freedom that someone has to take the action they want to or to change their plans.
Example: Rarely do schoolteachers have leeway to teach classes the way they want.

Definition: An uneven surface or edge is not smooth, flat, or straight.
Example: He staggered on the uneven surface of the car park.

Definition:
A rocky place is covered with rocks or consists of large areas of rock and has nothing growing
on it.
Example: The paths are often very rocky so strong boots are advisable.

Definition: A rugged area of land is uneven and covered with rocks, with few trees or plants.
Example: ...rugged mountainous terrain.

Definition: Someone who is boisterous is noisy, lively, and full of energy.
Example: ...a boisterous but good-natured crowd.

Definition: If something is unpleasant, it gives you bad feelings, for example by making you feel upset or uncomfortable.
Example: The symptoms can be uncomfortable, unpleasant and serious.

Definition: Sketchy information about something does not include many details and is therefore incomplete or inadequate.
Example: Details of what actually happened are still sketchy.

Definition: Something that is imprecise is not clear, accurate, or precise.
Example: The charges were vague and imprecise.

Definition: not having a polished surface
Example: A glorious, but unpolished, grandmother clock idly ticked away the time.

Definition: Something that is spherical is round like a ball.
Example: ...purple and gold spherical earrings.

Definition: Something that is bowed is curved.
Example: ...a woman with bowed legs.

Definition: A curved object has the shape of a curve or has a smoothly bending surface.
Example: ...a small, curved staircase.

Definition: Customary is used to describe things that people usually do in a particular society or in particular circumstances.
Example: It is customary to offer a drink or a snack to guests.

Definition: If you say that an event is predictable, you mean that it is obvious in advance that it will happen.
Example: This was a predictable reaction, given the bitter hostility between the two countries.

Definition: If you describe something such as a job, task, or situation as tedious, you mean it is boring and rather frustrating.
Example: Such lists are long and tedious to read.

Definition: When people squabble, they quarrel about something that is not really important.
Example: They are devoted to each other although they squabble all the time.

Definition: Massage is the action of squeezing and rubbing someone's body, as a way of making them relax or reducing their pain.
Example: Alex asked me if I wanted a massage.

Definition: If you caress someone, you stroke them gently and affectionately.
Example: He was gently caressing her golden hair.

Definition: If your skin chafes or is chafed by something, it becomes sore as a result of something rubbing against it.
Example: My shorts were chafing my thighs.

Definition: A grate is a framework of metal bars in a fireplace, which holds the coal or wood.
Example: A wood fire burned in the grate.

Definition: To abrade something means to scrape or wear down its surface by rubbing it.
Example: My skin was abraded and very tender.

Definition: A precept is a general rule that helps you to decide how you should behave in particular circumstances.
Example: ...an electoral process based on the precept that all men are born equal.

Definition: A criterion is a factor on which you judge or decide something.
Example:
The most important criterion for entry is that applicants must design and make their
own work.

Definition: A canon is a member of the clergy who is on the staff of a cathedral.
Example: He had to read a canon of accepted literary texts.

Definition: If you say, for example, that silence reigns in a place or confusion reigns in a situation, you mean that the place is silent or the situation is confused.
Example: Confusion reigned about how the debate would end.

Definition: to be master; reign
Example: Presumably, rivalries and wildly varying commercial fortunes held sway then as now.

Definition: A shuttle is the same as a space shuttle.
Example: ...the BA shuttle to Glasgow.

Definition: If you refer to a cascade of something, you mean that there is a large amount of it.
Example: The women have lustrous cascades of black hair.

Definition: When you bleed, you lose blood from your body as a result of injury or illness.
Example: His head had struck the sink and was bleeding.

Definition: A perpetual feeling, state, or quality is one that never ends or changes.
Example: ...the creation of a perpetual union.

Definition: (of liquids) moving as in a stream
Example: On such a cold evening, he told them, it was important to take some exercise to keep the blood flowing.

Definition: If something is moving, it makes you feel strongly an emotion such as sadness, pity, or sympathy.
Example: It is very moving to see how much strangers can care for each other.

Definition: Agrarian means relating to the ownership and use of land, especially farmland, or relating to the part of a society or economy that is concerned with agriculture.
Example: ...a rich area with a highly developed agrarian economy.

Definition: The pastoral duties of a priest or other religious leader involve looking after the people he or she has responsibility for, especially by helping them with their personal problems.
Example: ...the pastoral care of the sick.

Definition: If you hurry somewhere, you go there as quickly as you can.
Example: Claire hurried along the road.

Definition: If someone bustles somewhere, they move there in a hurried way, often because they are very busy.
Example: My mother bustled around the kitchen.

Definition:
Haste is the quality of doing something quickly, sometimes too quickly so that you are
careless and make mistakes.
Example: In their haste to escape the rising water, they dropped some expensive equipment.

Definition: A hasty movement, action, or statement is sudden, and often done in reaction to something that has just happened.
Example: He started screaming insults so I made a hasty escape.

Definition: If you are frantic, you are behaving in a wild and uncontrolled way because you are frightened or worried.
Example: A bird had been locked in and was by now quite frantic.

Definition: A surge is a sudden large increase in something that has previously been steady, or has only increased or developed slowly.
Example: Specialists see various reasons for the recent surge in inflation.

Definition: If a law or principle is inviolable, you must not break it.
Example: The game had a single inviolable rule: obstacles were to be overcome, not circumvented.

Definition: If you describe something as sacrosanct, you consider it to be special and are unwilling to see it criticized or changed.
Example: Freedom of the press is sacrosanct.

Definition: Sorrow is a feeling of deep sadness or regret.
Example: It was a time of great sorrow.

Definition: If you say that something is deplorable, you think that it is very bad and unacceptable.
Example: Many of them live under deplorable conditions.

Definition: Something that is intact is complete and has not been damaged or changed.
Example: Most of the cargo was left intact after the explosion.

Definition: If you are unscathed after a dangerous experience, you have not been injured or harmed by it.
Example: Tony emerged unscathed apart from a severely bruised finger.

Definition: Someone who is cautious acts very carefully in order to avoid possible danger.
Example: The scientists are cautious about using enzyme therapy on humans.

Definition: A coffer is a large strong chest used for storing valuable objects such as money or gold and silver.
Example: The money goes towards sports, as well as swelling the coffers of the government.

Definition: Someone's well-being is their health and happiness.
Example: Singing can create a sense of wellbeing.

Definition: An auction is a public sale where goods are sold to the person who offers the highest price.
Example: He bought the picture at auction in London some years ago.

Definition: In areas such as the Middle East and India, a bazaar is a place where there are many small shops and stalls.
Example: Kamal was a vendor in Egypt's open-air bazaar.

Definition: If two or more things are alike, they are similar in some way.
Example: We looked very alike.

Definition:
If a country, group, or person boycotts a country, organization, or activity, they refuse to be involved with it in any way
because they disapprove of it.
Example: The main opposition parties are boycotting the elections.

Definition: If one country or group of countries imposes an embargo against another, it forbids trade with that country.
Example: The United Nations imposed an arms embargo against the country.

Definition: If you chastise someone, you speak to them angrily or punish them for something wrong that they have done.
Example: Thomas Rane chastised Peters for his cruelty.

Definition: If you scour something such as a place or a book, you make a thorough search of it to try to find what you are looking for.
Example: Rescue crews had scoured an area of 30 square miles.

Definition: A spacecraft is a rocket or other vehicle that can travel in space.
Example: He says he has filmed numerous alien spacecraft.

Definition: A colony is a country which is controlled by a more powerful country.
Example: He was born in Algeria, a former colony of France.

Definition: A dependency is a country which is controlled by another country.
Example: ...the tiny British dependency of Montserrat in the eastern Caribbean.

Definition: Dominion is control or authority.
Example: They truly believe they have dominion over us.

Definition: If you indulge in something or if you indulge yourself, you allow yourself to have or do something that you know you will enjoy.
Example: We had enough time to indulge in a bit of window shopping.

Definition: If you reassure someone, you say or do things to make them stop worrying about something.
Example: I tried to reassure her, 'Don't worry about it. We won't let it happen again.'

Definition: A salad dressing is a mixture of oil, vinegar, and herbs or flavourings, which you pour over salad.
Example: Mix the ingredients for the dressing in a bowl.

Definition: If you relish something, you get a lot of enjoyment from it.
Example: I relish the challenge of doing jobs that others turn down.

Definition: If you divulge a piece of secret or private information, you tell it to someone.
Example: Officials refuse to divulge details of the negotiations.

Definition: Shame is an uncomfortable feeling that you get when you have done something wrong or embarrassing, or when someone close to you has.
Example: She felt a deep sense of shame.

Definition: If someone is alarmed, they feel afraid or anxious that something unpleasant or dangerous might happen.
Example: They should not be too alarmed by the press reports.

Definition: very frightened
Example: She looked startled and gazed at me with a terrified fascination.

Definition: A panorama is a view in which you can see a long way over a wide area of land, usually because you are on high ground.
Example: Horton looked out over a panorama of fertile valleys and gentle hills.

Definition: Fuss is anxious or excited behaviour which serves no useful purpose.
Example: I don't know what all the fuss is about.

Definition: If you describe someone as calculating, you disapprove of the fact that they deliberately plan to get what they want, often by hurting or harming other people.
Example: Northbridge is a cool, calculating and clever criminal who could strike again.

Definition: Someone who is cunning has the ability to achieve things in a clever way, often by deceiving other people.
Example: These disturbed kids can be cunning.

Definition: A sly look, expression, or remark shows that you know something that other people do not know or that was meant to be a secret.
Example: His lips were spread in a sly smile.

Definition: artful and scheming; conniving; crafty
Example: Worker participation in designing these foundations should be brought into play from the very beginning.

Definition: A learner is someone who is learning about a particular subject or how to do something.
Example: ...a new aid for younger children or slow learners.

Definition: Academy is sometimes used in the names of secondary schools and colleges, or private high schools in the United States.
Example: ...the Royal Academy of Music.

Definition: An institute is an organization set up to do a particular type of work, especially research or teaching. You can also use institute to refer to the building the organization occupies.
Example: ...the National Cancer Institute.

Definition: When someone shrieks, they make a short, very loud cry, for example because they are suddenly surprised, are in pain, or are laughing.
Example: She shrieked and leapt from the bed.

Definition: If someone bellows, they shout angrily in a loud, deep voice.
Example: 'I didn't ask to be born!' she bellowed.

Definition: Thunder is the loud noise that you hear from the sky after a flash of lightning, especially during a storm.
Example: There was frequent thunder and lightning, and torrential rain.

Definition: If a vehicle screeches somewhere or if its tyres screech, its tyres make an unpleasant high-pitched noise on the road.
Example: A black Mercedes screeched to a halt beside the helicopter.

Definition: A vet is someone who is qualified to treat sick or injured animals.
Example: The shelter will serve Christmas dinner for 200 vets.

Definition: A pen is a long thin object which you use to write in ink.
Example: I really intended to pen this letter to you early this morning.

Definition: Lace is a very delicate cloth which is made with a lot of holes in it. It is made by twisting together very fine threads of cotton to form patterns.
Example: She finally found the perfect gown, a beautiful creation trimmed with lace.

Definition: Undisclosed information is not revealed to the public.
Example: The company has been sold for an undisclosed amount.

Definition: Something that is underground is below the surface of the ground.
Example: Solid low-level waste will be disposed of deep underground.

Definition: If you do something in secret, you do it without anyone else knowing.
Example: Dan found out that I had been meeting my ex-boyfriend in secret.

Definition: You describe a situation as a paradox when it involves two or more facts or qualities which seem to contradict each other.
Example:
The paradox is that the region's most dynamic economies have the most primitive financial
systems.

Definition: A sheltered place is protected from wind and rain.
Example: ...a shallow-sloping beach next to a sheltered bay.

Definition: If you make sure that something is done, you take action so that it is done.
Example: Make sure that you follow the instructions carefully.

Definition: A germ is a very small organism that causes disease.
Example: Chlorine is widely used to kill germs.

Definition: If you confiscate something from someone, you take it away from them, usually as a punishment.
Example: The courts can confiscate assets from people who have committed offences.

Definition: If the armed forces commandeer a vehicle or building owned by someone else, they officially take charge of it so that they can use it.
Example: The soldiers commandeered vehicles in the capital and occupied the television station.

Definition: If something is impounded by the police, customs officers, or other officials, they officially take possession of it because a law or rule has been broken.
Example: The ship was impounded under the terms of the U.N. trade embargo.

Definition: Someone who is privileged has an advantage or opportunity that most other people do not have, often because of their wealth or high social class.
Example: They were, by and large, a very wealthy, privileged elite.

Definition: In music, a medley is a collection of different tunes or songs that are played one after the other as a single piece of music.
Example: ...a medley of traditional songs.

Definition: In psychology, your psyche is your mind and your deepest feelings and attitudes.
Example: 'It probably shows up a deeply immature part of my psyche,' he confesses.

Definition: If you fling something somewhere, you throw it there using a lot of force.
Example: The woman flung the cup at him.

Definition: If one thing or person is superior to another, the first is better than the second.
Example: We have a relationship infinitely superior to those of many of our friends.

Definition: Comprehension is the ability to understand something.
Example: This was utterly beyond her comprehension.

Definition: If you are thoughtful, you are quiet and serious because you are thinking about something.
Example: Nancy, who had been thoughtful for some time, suddenly spoke.

Definition: If you have patience, you are able to stay calm and not get annoyed, for example when something takes a long time, or when someone is not doing what you want them to do.
Example: He doesn't have the patience to wait.

Definition: If you describe someone as touchy, you mean that they are easily upset, offended, or irritated.
Example: She is very touchy about her past.

Definition: If you say that someone is paranoid, you mean that they are extremely suspicious and afraid of other people.
Example: I'm not going to get paranoid about it.

Definition: If you describe a task or problem as tricky, you mean that it is difficult to do or deal with.
Example: Parking can be tricky in the town centre.

Definition: A thorny plant or tree is covered with thorns.
Example: ...thorny hawthorn trees.

Definition: Delicacy is the quality of being easy to break or harm, and refers especially to people or things that are attractive or graceful.
Example: ...the delicacy of a rose.

Definition: If you describe a situation as fragile, you mean that it is weak or uncertain, and unlikely to be able to resist strong pressure or attack.
Example: ...moves that will place added strain on an already fragile economy.

Definition: Doom is a terrible future state or event which you cannot prevent.
Example: ...his warnings of impending doom.

Definition: To disconnect a piece of equipment means to separate it from its source of power or to break a connection that it needs in order to work.
Example: The device automatically disconnects the ignition when the engine is switched off.

Definition: If someone disbands a group of people, or if the group disbands, it stops operating as a single unit.
Example: All the armed groups will be disbanded.

Definition: If you say that someone is sincere, you approve of them because they really mean the things they say. You can also describe someone's behaviour and beliefs as sincere.
Example: He's sincere in his views.

Definition: If you are resolved to do something, you are determined to do it.
Example: Barnes was resolved to moving on when his contract expired.

Definition: the state or quality of being solemn
Example: Both treat this narrative with formality and solemnity.

Definition: Sobriety is the state of being sober rather than drunk.
Example: ...the values society depends upon, such as honesty, sobriety and trust.

Definition: Stern words or actions are very severe.
Example: She issued a stern warning to those who persist in violence.

Definition: Someone's attendance at an event or an institution is the fact that they are present at the event or go regularly to the institution.
Example: Her attendance at school was sporadic.

Definition: If you worship a god, you show your respect to the god, for example by saying prayers.
Example: I enjoy going to church and worshipping God.

Definition: A rite is a traditional ceremony that is carried out by a particular group or within a particular society.
Example: Most traditional societies have transition rites at puberty.

Definition: If a piece of equipment is overhauled, it is cleaned, checked thoroughly, and repaired if necessary.
Example: They had ensured the plumbing was overhauled a year ago.

Definition: A sitting is one of the periods when a meal is served when there is not enough space for everyone to eat at the same time.
Example: Dinner was in two sittings.

Definition: A backdrop is a large piece of cloth, often with scenery painted on it, that is hung at the back of a stage while a play is being performed.
Example: Leeds Castle will provide a dramatic backdrop to a fireworks display next Saturday.

Definition: If something is located in a particular place, it is present or has been built there.
Example: The restaurant is located near the cathedral.

Definition: If a device or process is activated, something causes it to start working.
Example: Video cameras with night vision can be activated by movement.

Definition: If something is allotted to someone, it is given to them as their share.
Example: The seats are allotted to the candidates who have won the most votes.

Definition: If a doctor prescribes medicine or treatment for you, he or she tells you what medicine or treatment to have.
Example: Our doctor diagnosed a throat infection and prescribed antibiotics and junior aspirin.

Definition: If something is compulsory, you must do it or accept it, because it is the law or because someone in a position of authority says you must.
Example: In East Germany, learning Russian was compulsory.

Definition: If you condense something, especially a piece of writing or speech, you make it shorter, usually by including only the most important parts.
Example: We have learnt how to condense serious messages into short, self-contained sentences.

Definition: If people colonize a foreign country, they go to live there and take control of it.
Example: The first British attempt to colonize Ireland was in the twelfth century.

Definition: A clearing is a small area in a forest where there are no trees or bushes.
Example: A helicopter landed in a clearing in the dense jungle.

Definition: Clearance is the removal of old buildings, trees, or other things that are not wanted from an area.
Example: ...a slum clearance operation in Nairobi.

Definition: An outpost is a small group of buildings used for trading or military purposes, either in a distant part of your own country or in a foreign country.
Example: ...a remote mountain outpost, linked to the outside world by the poorest of roads.

Definition: Someone who is cruel deliberately causes pain or distress to people or animals.
Example: Children can be so cruel.

Definition: Austerity is a situation in which people's living standards are reduced because of economic difficulties.
Example: ...an economic austerity programme.

Definition: If you describe something as austere, you approve of its plain and simple appearance.
Example: ...a cream linen suit and austere black blouse.

Definition: Lovemaking refers to sexual activities that take place between two people who love each other.
Example: Their love-making became less and less frequent.

Definition: If you describe something as erotic, you mean that it involves sexual feelings or arouses sexual desire.
Example:
It might sound like some kind of wild fantasy, but it wasn't an erotic experience
at all.

Definition: Someone or something that is sensual shows or suggests a great liking for physical pleasures, especially sexual pleasures.
Example: He was a very sensual person.

Definition: A hue is a colour.
Example: The same hue will look different in different light.

Definition: A tint is a small amount of colour.
Example: Its large leaves often show a delicate purple tint.

Definition: If something darkens or if a person or thing darkens it, it becomes darker.
Example: The sky darkened abruptly.

Definition: A nuance is a small difference in sound, feeling, appearance, or meaning.
Example: Do you understand the nuances of British humour?

Definition: Graduation is the successful completion of a course of study at a university, college, or school, for which you receive a degree or diploma.
Example: They asked what his plans were after graduation.

Definition: If something transmutes or is transmuted into a different form, it is changed into that form.
Example: She ceased to think, as anger transmuted into passion.

Definition: A silhouette is the solid dark shape that you see when someone or something has a bright light or pale background behind them.
Example: The dark silhouette of the castle ruins stood out boldly against the fading light.

Definition: If you jiggle something, you move it quickly up and down or from side to side.
Example: He jiggled the doorknob noisily.

Definition: When you shiver, your body shakes slightly because you are cold or frightened.
Example: He shivered in the cold.

Definition: A quake is the same as an earthquake.
Example: The quake destroyed mud buildings in many remote villages.

Definition: If you shudder, you shake with fear, horror, or disgust, or because you are cold.
Example: Lloyd had urged her to eat caviar. She had shuddered at the thought.

Definition: If an injury or illness disables someone, it affects them so badly that it restricts the way that they can live their life.
Example: She did all this tendon damage and it really disabled her.

Definition: You use guise to refer to the outward appearance or form of someone or something, which is often temporary or different from their real nature.
Example: He turned up at a fancy dress Easter dance in the guise of a white rabbit.

Definition: A quota is the limited number or quantity of something which is officially allowed.
Example: The quota of four tickets per person had been reduced to two.

Definition: When there is not enough of something, your ration of it is the amount that you are allowed to have.
Example: The meat ration was down to one pound per person per week.

Definition: Something that is spiky has one or more sharp points.
Example: Her short spiky hair is damp with sweat.

Definition: Someone who is quick-witted is intelligent and good at thinking quickly.
Example: He is really quick-witted and smart.

Definition: If you describe someone as astute, you think they show an understanding of behaviour and situations, and are skilful at using this knowledge to their own advantage.
Example: She was politically astute.

Definition: An abrupt change or action is very sudden, often in a way which is unpleasant.
Example: Rosie's idyllic world came to an abrupt end when her parents' marriage broke up.

Definition: Something that is clear-cut is easy to recognize and quite distinct.
Example: This was a clear-cut case of the original landowner being in the right.

Definition: Something that is pungent has a strong, sharp smell or taste which is often so strong that it is unpleasant.
Example: The more herbs you use, the more pungent the sauce will be.

Definition: A slab of something is a thick, flat piece of it.
Example: ...slabs of stone.

Definition:
A membrane is a thin piece of skin which connects or covers parts of a person's or animal's
body.
Example: This serum balances the skin by forming a thin membrane on the face to limit moisture loss.

Definition: A rack is a frame or shelf, usually with bars or hooks, that is used for holding things or for hanging things on.
Example: My rucksack was too big for the luggage rack.

Definition: A husk is the outer covering of a grain or a seed.
Example: You will now be able to squeeze the bright green beans out of their grey husks.

Definition: A pod is a seed container that grows on plants such as peas or beans.
Example: ...fresh peas in the pod.

Definition: Someone who shows modesty does not talk much about their abilities or achievements.
Example: His modesty does him credit, for the food he produces speaks for itself.

Definition: The hull of a boat or tank is the main body of it.
Example: The hull had suffered extensive damage to the starboard side.

Definition: A barrage is continuous firing on an area with large guns and tanks.
Example: The artillery barrage on the city centre was the heaviest since the ceasefire.

Definition: If you bombard someone with something, you make them face a great deal of it. For example, if you bombard them with questions or criticism, you keep asking them a lot of questions or you keep criticizing them.
Example: He bombarded Catherine with questions to which he should have known the answers.

Definition: An awning is a piece of material attached to a caravan or building which provides shelter from the rain or sun.
Example: He searched for a place to stop, and when he saw a drive-in at West Columbia, he pulled the car under the awning.

Definition: If an object or a surface gleams, it reflects light because it is shiny and clean.
Example: His black hair gleamed in the sun.

Definition: If something has a sheen, it has a smooth and gentle brightness on its surface.
Example: The carpet had a silvery sheen to it.

Definition: Something that is buff is pale brown in colour.
Example: He took a largish buff envelope from his pocket.

Definition: To burnish the image of someone or something means to improve their image.
Example: It was a move that has burnished Mr Hu's populist credentials.

Definition: Trauma is a very severe shock or very upsetting experience, which may cause psychological damage.
Example: I'd been through the trauma of losing a house.

Definition: A bombshell is a sudden piece of bad or unexpected news.
Example: His resignation after thirteen years is a political bombshell.

Definition: The breakdown of something such as a relationship, plan, or discussion is its failure or ending.
Example: ...the breakdown of talks between the U.S. and E.U. officials.

Definition: If someone is in a daze, they are feeling confused and unable to think clearly, often because they have had a shock or surprise.
Example: For 35 minutes I was walking around in a daze.

Definition: If you stagger, you walk very unsteadily, for example because you are ill or drunk.
Example: He lost his balance, staggered back against the rail and toppled over.

Definition: A jar is a glass container with a lid that is used for storing food.
Example: ...yellow cucumbers in great glass jars.

Definition: If someone is horrified, they feel shocked or disgusted, usually because of something that they have seen or heard.
Example: His family were horrified by the change.

Definition: If something appals you, it disgusts you because it seems so bad or unpleasant.
Example: His ignorance appals me.

Definition: If an event or someone's behaviour is unexpected, it surprises you because you did not think that it was likely to happen.
Example: His death was totally unexpected.

Definition: Something that is startling is so different, unexpected, or remarkable that people react to it with surprise.
Example: Sometimes the results may be rather startling.

Definition: A mop is a piece of equipment for washing floors. It consists of a sponge or many pieces of string attached to a long handle.
Example: There was a woman mopping the stairs.

Definition: When plants, vegetables, or seeds sprout, they produce new shoots or leaves.
Example: It only takes a few days for beans to sprout.

Definition: A bud is a small pointed lump that appears on a tree or plant and develops into a leaf or flower.
Example: Rosanna's favourite time is early summer, just before the buds open.

Definition: A twig is a very small thin branch that grows out from a main branch of a tree or bush.
Example: Then I twigged that they'd been planning this for a while.

Definition: A supermarket is a large shop which sells all kinds of food and some household goods.
Example: Most of us do our food shopping in the supermarket.

Definition: Something that is succinct expresses facts or ideas clearly and in few words.
Example: The book gives an admirably succinct account of the technology and its history.

Definition: Wee means small in size or extent.
Example: I've got a wee kitten in the flat.

Definition: If you are unaware of something, you do not know about it.
Example: Many people are unaware of just how much food and drink they consume.

Definition: A terse statement or comment is brief and unfriendly.
Example: He issued a terse statement.

Definition: If you describe someone as curt, you mean that they speak or reply in a brief and rather rude way.
Example: Her tone of voice was curt.

Definition: A shooter is a person who shoots a gun.
Example: An eyewitness identified him as the shooter.

Definition: Your elbow is the part of your arm where the upper and lower halves of the arm are joined.
Example: He slipped and fell, badly bruising an elbow.

Definition: In sport, if someone volleys the ball, they hit it before it touches the ground.
Example: He volleyed the ball spectacularly into the far corner of the net.

Definition: If you say that you are inundated with things such as letters, demands, or requests, you are emphasizing that you receive so many of them that you cannot deal with them all.
Example: Her office was inundated with requests for tickets.

Definition: If you feel nauseous, you feel as if you want to vomit.
Example: If the patient is poorly nourished, the drugs make them feel nauseous.

Definition: If you vomit, food and drink comes back up from your stomach and out through your mouth.
Example: Any product made from cow's milk made him vomit.

Definition: If you are bored, you feel tired and impatient because you have lost interest in something or because you have nothing to do.
