Example: I am getting very bored with this entire business.

Definition: If you are  fed up, you are unhappy, bored, or tired of something, especially something that you have been experiencing for a long time.
Example: He had become fed up with city life.

Definition: If you are weary, you are very tired.
Example: They're getting awfully weary of this silly war.

Definition: If you describe a person or their interest in something as morbid, you mean that they are very interested in unpleasant things, especially death, and you think this is strange.
Example: Some people have a morbid fascination with crime.

Definition: A sadistic person obtains pleasure from hurting other people and making them suffer physically or mentally.
Example: The prisoners rioted against mistreatment by sadistic guards.

Definition: A facet of something is a single part or aspect of it.
Example: The caste system shapes nearly every facet of Indian life.

Definition: Someone's viewpoint is the way that they think about things in general, or the way they think about a particular thing.
Example: The novel is shown from the girl's viewpoint.

Definition: If you moan, you make a low sound, usually because you are unhappy or in pain.
Example: Tony moaned in his sleep and then turned over on his side.

Definition: When something thin and dry rustles or when you rustle it, it makes soft sounds as it moves.
Example: The leaves rustled in the wind.

Definition: If you murmur something, you say it very quietly, so that not many people can hear what you are saying.
Example: He turned and murmured something to the professor.

Definition: Your eyesight is your ability to see.
Example: He suffered from poor eyesight and could no longer read properly.

Definition: In the theatre or in a musical performance, a performer's cue is something another performer says or does that is a signal for them to begin speaking, playing, or doing something.
Example:
The actors not performing sit at the side of the stage in full view, waiting for
their cues.

Definition: If you respond to prompting, you do what someone encourages or reminds you to do.
Example: New York needed little prompting from their coach Bill Parcells.

Definition: If you knowingly do something wrong, you do it even though you know it is wrong.
Example: He repeated that he had never knowingly taken illegal drugs.

Definition: A gag is something such as a piece of cloth that is tied around or put inside someone's mouth in order to stop them from speaking.
Example: His captors had put a gag of thick leather in his mouth.

Definition: The muzzle of an animal such as a dog is its nose and mouth.
Example: The mongrel presented his muzzle for scratching.

Definition: Someone who is mute is silent for a particular reason and does not speak.
Example: He was mute, distant, and indifferent.

Definition: Someone who is dumb is completely unable to speak.
Example: ...a young deaf and dumb man.

Definition: If you are speechless, you are temporarily unable to speak, usually because something has shocked you.
Example: Alex was almost speechless with rage and despair.

Definition: If you describe someone as uncommunicative, you are critical of them because they do not talk to other people very much and are unwilling to express opinions or give information.
Example: My daughter is very difficult, uncommunicative and moody.

Definition: A taciturn person does not say very much and can seem unfriendly.
Example: A taciturn man, he replied to my questions in monosyllables.

Definition: If someone is tongue-tied, they are unable to say anything because they feel shy or nervous.
Example: In their presence I became self-conscious and tongue-tied.

Definition: You use likewise when you are comparing two methods, states, or situations and saying that they are similar.
Example:
All attempts by the Socialists to woo him back were spurned. Similar overtures from
the right have likewise been rejected.

Definition: If you describe someone or something as uncomplicated, you approve of them because they are easy to deal with or understand.
Example: She is a beautiful, uncomplicated girl.

Definition: Someone who is artless is simple and honest, and does not think of deceiving other people.
Example: She was curiously artless.

Definition: A misdemeanour is an act that some people consider to be wrong or unacceptable.
Example: Emily knew nothing about her husband's misdemeanours.

Definition: If someone transgresses, they break a moral law or a rule of behaviour.
Example: If a politician transgresses, that is not the fault of the media.

Definition: A lapse is a moment or instance of bad behaviour by someone who usually behaves well.
Example: On Friday he showed neither decency nor dignity. It was an uncommon lapse.

Definition: If you err, you make a mistake.
Example: It criticises the main contractor for seriously erring in its original estimates.

Definition: A wrongdoer is a person who does things that are immoral or illegal.
Example:
Is there anything more gratifying than accepting a wrongdoer's humble apologies with
Queenly dignity and good nature?

Definition: If you describe someone as an evildoer, you mean that they are wicked, and that they deliberately cause harm or suffering to others.
Example: Better to deny the existence of evil than have to eliminate the evildoer in their midst.

Definition: If you croon, you sing or hum quietly and gently.
Example: He would much rather have been crooning in a smoky bar.

Definition: Carols are Christian religious songs that are sung at Christmas.
Example:
The singing of Christmas carols is a custom derived from early dance routines of
pagan origin.

Definition: A chant is a word or group of words that is repeated over and over again.
Example: He was greeted by the chant of 'Judas! Judas!'

Definition: When a bird or an insect such as a cricket or grasshopper chirps, it makes short high-pitched sounds.
Example: The crickets chirped faster and louder.

Definition: When a bird warbles, it sings pleasantly.
Example: The bird continued to warble.

Definition: A vocalist is a singer who sings with a pop group.
Example: He and Carla take turns as the band's lead vocalist.

Definition: If you talk about a lone person or thing, you mean that they are alone.
Example: A lone woman motorist waited for six hours for help yesterday because of a name mix-up.

Definition: If you give someone or something your undivided attention, you concentrate on them fully and do not think about anything else.
Example:
Eldest children are the only ones to have experienced the undivided attention of
their parents.

Definition: If you flop into a chair, for example, you sit down suddenly and heavily because you are so tired.
Example: Bunbury flopped down upon the bed and rested his tired feet.

Definition: A plough is a large farming tool with sharp blades which is pulled across the soil to turn it over, usually before seeds are planted.
Example: They ploughed nearly 100,000 acres of virgin moorland.

Definition: Your comrades are your friends, especially friends that you share a difficult or dangerous situation with.
Example: Unlike so many of his comrades he survived the war.

Definition: If an organization is affiliated with another larger organization, it is officially connected with the larger organization or is a member of it.
Example: There are currently 50 unions affiliated to the Trades Union Congress.

Definition: Allied forces or troops are armies from different countries who are fighting on the same side in a war.
Example: ...the approaching Allied forces.

Definition: If one thing is associated with another, the two things are connected with each other.
Example: These symptoms are particularly associated with migraine headaches.

Definition: If you perch on something, you sit down lightly on the very edge or tip of it.
Example: He perched on the corner of the desk.

Definition: When someone officiates at a ceremony or formal occasion, they are in charge and perform the official part of it.
Example: Bishop Silvester officiated at the funeral.

Definition: Expertise is special skill or knowledge that is acquired by training, study, or practice.
Example:
The problem is that most local authorities lack the expertise to deal sensibly in
this market.

Definition: If you show proficiency in something, you show ability or skill at it.
Example: Evidence of basic proficiency in English is part of the admission requirement.

Definition: When you refer to someone's complexion, you are referring to the natural colour or condition of the skin on their face.
Example: She had short brown hair and a pale complexion.

Definition: A sheep's fleece is the coat of wool that covers it.
Example: She claims he fleeced her out of thousands of pounds.

Definition: The firmament is the sky or heaven.
Example: There are no stars in the firmament.

Definition: When you doze, you sleep lightly or for a short period, especially during the daytime.
Example: For a while she dozed fitfully.

Definition: Slumber is sleep.
Example: He had fallen into exhausted slumber.

Definition: If you wedge something, you force it to remain in a particular position by holding it there tightly or by fixing something next to it to prevent it from moving.
Example: I shut the shed door and wedged it with a log of wood.

Definition: If you snub someone, you deliberately insult them by ignoring them or by behaving or speaking rudely towards them.
Example: He snubbed her in public and made her feel an idiot.

Definition: A bit of something is a small amount of it.
Example: All it required was a bit of work.

Definition: If a vehicle skids, it slides sideways or forwards while moving, for example when you are trying to stop it suddenly on a wet road.
Example: The car pulled up too fast and skidded on the dusty shoulder of the road.

Definition: If you slither somewhere, you slide along in an uneven way.
Example: Robert lost his footing and slithered down the bank.

Definition: If you sneak somewhere, you go there very quietly on foot, trying to avoid being seen or heard.
Example: Sometimes he would sneak out of his house late at night to be with me.

Definition: Something, usually something unpleasant, that is protracted lasts a long time, especially longer than usual or longer than you hoped.
Example: After protracted negotiations, Ogden got the deal he wanted.

Definition: If you are uncomfortable, you are slightly worried or embarrassed, and not relaxed and confident.
Example: The request for money made them feel uncomfortable.

Definition: Something or someone that is chic is fashionable and sophisticated.
Example: Her gown was very French and very chic.

Definition: An odour is a particular and distinctive smell.
Example: The whole herb has a characteristic taste and odour.

Definition: The scent of something is the pleasant smell that it has.
Example: Flowers are chosen for their scent as well as their look.

Definition: A fragrance is a pleasant or sweet smell.
Example: ...a shrubby plant with a strong characteristic fragrance.

Definition: Perfume is a pleasant-smelling liquid that you can put on your skin to make yourself smell nice.
Example: The hall smelled of her mother's perfume.

Definition: To reek of something, usually something unpleasant, means to smell very strongly of it.
Example: He came home reeking of fish.

Definition: To stink means to smell extremely unpleasant.
Example: Get away from meyour breath stinks.

Definition: If there is a whiff of a particular smell, you smell it only slightly or only for a brief period of time, for example as you walk past someone or something.
Example: He caught a whiff of her perfume.

Definition: When you grin, you smile broadly.
Example: He grins, delighted at the memory.

Definition: If you smirk, you smile in an unpleasant way, often because you believe that you have gained an advantage over someone else or know something that they do not know.
Example: Two men looked at me, nudged each other and smirked.

Definition: Sleek hair or fur is smooth and shiny and looks healthy.
Example: ...sleek black hair.

Definition: Someone who is polished shows confidence and knows how to behave socially.
Example: He is polished, charming, articulate and an excellent negotiator.

Definition: Shiny things are bright and reflect light.
Example: Her blonde hair was shiny and clean.

Definition: Glossy means smooth and shiny.
Example: ...glossy black hair.

Definition: the quality of being fluent, esp facility in speech or writing
Example: They were able to answer with ease and fluency questions about the differences between them.

Definition: the state or quality of being serene
Example: You go for beauty and serenity in a partner.

Definition: Food or drink that is creamy contains a lot of cream or milk.
Example: ...rich, creamy coffee.

Definition: If you describe something as velvety, you mean that it is pleasantly soft to touch and has the appearance or quality of velvet.
Example: The grass grew thick and velvety.

Definition: having a calming, assuaging, or relieving effect
Example: Gaining a perspective on the present by examining the past can be very soothing to someone burdened with troubles.

Definition: Someone who is fluent in a particular language can speak the language easily and correctly. You can also say that someone speaks fluent French, Chinese, or some other language.
Example: She studied eight foreign languages but is fluent in only six of them.

Definition: Something that is effortless is done easily and well.
Example: In a single effortless motion, he scooped Frannie into his arms.

Definition: Someone who is suave is charming, polite, and elegant, but may be insincere.
Example: He is a suave, cool and cultured man.

Definition: A slick performance, production, or advertisement is skilful and impressive.
Example: There's a big difference between an amateur movie and a slick Hollywood production.

Definition: Someone who is urbane is polite and appears comfortable in social situations.
Example: She describes him as urbane and charming.

Definition: If you flatten something or if it flattens, it becomes flat or flatter.
Example: He carefully flattened the wrappers and put them between the leaves of his book.

Definition: If something clicks or if you click it, it makes a short, sharp sound.
Example: The applause rose to a crescendo and cameras clicked.

Definition: When a dog barks, it makes a short, loud noise, once or several times.
Example: Don't let the dogs bark.

Definition: A blizzard is a very heavy snowstorm with strong winds.
Example:
Retailers were hit with a blizzard of new products and brands in all shapes, sizes
and colours.

Definition: Sociable people are friendly and enjoy talking to other people.
Example: She was, and remained, extremely sociable, enjoying dancing, golf and bicycling.

Definition: If you describe a person as companionable, you mean they are friendly and pleasant to be with.
Example: They walked companionably back to the house.

Definition: If the people who live near you are neighbourly, they are friendly and helpful. If you live in a neighbourly place, it has a friendly atmosphere.
Example: The noise would have provoked alarm and neighbourly concern.

Definition: Someone who is gregarious enjoys being with other people.
Example: She is such a gregarious and outgoing person.

Definition: If something has a silky texture, it is smooth, soft, and shiny, like silk.
Example: ...dresses in seductively silky fabrics.

Definition: A furry animal is covered with thick, soft hair.
Example: ...the coyote's furry tail.

Definition: A yielding surface or object is quite soft and will move or bend rather than staying stiff if you put pressure on it.
Example: ...the yielding ground.

Definition: If something is pliable, you can bend it easily without cracking or breaking it.
Example: As your baby grows bigger, his bones become less pliable.

Definition: When someone in authority is lenient, they are not as strict or severe as expected.
Example: He believes the government is already lenient with drug traffickers.

Definition: If you describe someone as easy-going, you mean that they are not easily annoyed, worried, or upset, and you think this is a good quality.
Example: He was easy-going and good-natured.

Definition: If you say that a person's behaviour or a system is lax, you mean they are not careful or strict about maintaining high standards.
Example: One of the problem areas is lax security for airport personnel.

Definition: If you describe someone or something as compassionate, you mean that they feel or show pity, sympathy, and understanding for people who are suffering.
Example: My father was a deeply compassionate man.

Definition: When a group of people are unanimous, they all agree about something or all vote for the same thing.
Example: Editors were unanimous in their condemnation of the proposals.

Definition: You use at times to say that something happens or is true on some occasions or at some moments.
Example: The debate was highly emotional at times.

Definition: If you do something from time to time, you do it occasionally but not regularly.
Example: Her daughters visited him from time to time when he was ill.

Definition: Someone's descendants are the people in later generations who are related to them.
Example: They are descendants of the original English and Scottish settlers.

Definition: A ballad is a long song or poem which tells a story in simple language.
Example:
...an eighteenth century ballad about some lost children called the Babes in the
Wood.

Definition: A tune is a series of musical notes that is pleasant and easy to remember.
Example: She was humming a merry little tune.

Definition: If you describe someone as cultivated, you mean they are well educated and have good manners.
Example: His mother was an elegant, cultivated woman.

Definition: If you are regretful, you show that you regret something.
Example: Mr Griffin gave a regretful smile.

Definition: If you are contrite, you are very sorry because you have done something wrong.
Example: She was instantly contrite. 'Oh, I am sorry! You must forgive me.'

Definition: Someone who is repentant shows or says that they are sorry for something wrong they have done.
Example: He was feeling guilty and depressed, repentant and scared.

Definition: If you are sympathetic to someone who is in a bad situation, you are kind to them and show that you understand their feelings.
Example: She was very sympathetic to the problems of adult students.

Definition: If someone is distressed, they are upset or worried.
Example: I feel very alone and distressed about my problem.

Definition: You describe someone as wretched when you feel sorry for them because they are in an unpleasant situation or have suffered unpleasant experiences.
Example: These wretched people had seen their homes going up in flames.

Definition: A din is a very loud and unpleasant noise that lasts for some time.
Example: They tried to make themselves heard over the din of the crowd.

Definition: Someone or something that is robust is very strong or healthy.
Example: More women than men go to the doctor. Perhaps men are more robust or worry less?

Definition: The derivation of something, especially a word, is its origin or source.
Example: The derivation of its name is obscure.

Definition: a spring that is the source of a stream
Example: `I understand,' the companion at his side interrupted, `as the fountainhead yourself, you had no individual experience of it and yet-- '

Definition: You use verbal to indicate that something is expressed in speech rather than in writing or action.
Example: They were jostled and subjected to a torrent of verbal abuse.

Definition: An orator is someone who is skilled at making formal speeches, especially ones which affect people's feelings and beliefs.
Example: Lenin was the great orator of the Russian Revolution.

Definition: A lecturer is a teacher at a university or college.
Example: ...a lecturer in law at Southampton University.

Definition: Something that is distinctive has a special quality or feature which makes it easily recognizable and different from other things of the same type.
Example: ...the distinctive odour of chlorine.

Definition: Articulation is the action of producing a sound or word clearly, in speech or music.
Example:
...a singer able to sustain a full tone and clear articulation over extremely long
periods.

Definition: Someone's diction is how clearly they speak or sing.
Example: His diction wasn't very good.

Definition: Someone's utterances are the things that they say.
Example: ...the Queen's public utterances.

Definition: If a process or movement gains momentum, it keeps developing or happening more quickly and keeps becoming less likely to stop.
Example: This campaign is really gaining momentum.

Definition: The acceleration of a process or change is the fact that it is getting faster and faster.
Example: He has also called for an acceleration of political reforms.

Definition: If you zoom somewhere, you go there very quickly.
Example: We zoomed through the gallery.

Definition: If you recount a story or event, you tell or describe it to people.
Example: He then recounted the story of the interview for his first job.

Definition: You can refer to the amusing things that people say as their humour.
Example: Her humour and determination were a source of inspiration to others.

Definition: Morale is the amount of confidence and cheerfulness that a group of people have.
Example: Many pilots are suffering from low morale.

Definition: Metaphysical means relating to metaphysics.
Example: ...metaphysical questions like personal responsibility for violence.

Definition: Someone or something that is ethereal has a delicate beauty.
Example: She's the prettiest, most ethereal romantic heroine in the movies.

Definition: to separate or become separate; disrupt
Example: After all, those who will live in peace must agree to disagree in many things with their fellow-labourers, and not let little things part or disunite them.

Definition: If someone or something disrupts an event, system, or process, they cause difficulties that prevent it from continuing or operating in a normal way.
Example: Anti-war protesters disrupted the debate.

Definition: When something rips or when you rip it, you tear it forcefully with your hands or with a tool such as a knife.
Example: I felt the banner rip as we were pushed in opposite directions.

Definition: When you halve something or when it halves, it is reduced to half its previous size or amount.
Example: Dr Lee believes that men who exercise can halve their risk of cancer of the colon.

Definition: If you say that someone flaunts their possessions, abilities, or qualities, you mean that they display them in a very obvious way, especially in order to try to obtain other people's admiration.
Example: They drove around in Rolls-Royces, openly flaunting their wealth.

Definition: If someone boasts about something that they have done or that they own, they talk about it very proudly, in a way that other people may find irritating or offensive.
Example: Witnesses said Furci boasted that he took part in killing them.

Definition: Pimples are small raised spots, especially on the face.
Example: ...spots and pimples.

Definition: A pustule is a small infected swelling on the skin.
Example: `Pedar," he said to Danlo one day, ~has a pustule in place of a heart.

Definition: If a situation unfolds, it develops and becomes known or understood.
Example: The outcome depends on conditions as well as how events unfold.

Definition: If someone or something is squashed, they are pressed or crushed with such force that they become injured or lose their shape.
Example: Robert was hurt when he was squashed against a fence by a car.

Definition: If you are pressurized into doing something, you are forcefully persuaded to do it.
Example: Do not be pressurized into making your decision immediately.

Definition: If you describe someone as well-balanced, you mean that they are sensible and do not have many emotional problems.
Example: ...a fun-loving, well-balanced individual.

Definition: The workforce is the total number of people in a country or region who are physically able to do a job and are available for work.
Example: ...a country where half the workforce is unemployed.

Definition: the gaming stake put up before the deal in poker by the players
Example: antecede, ante-Victorian

Definition: If you wager on the result of a horse race, football match, or other event, you give someone a sum of money which they give you back with extra money if the result is what you predicted, or which they keep if it is not.
Example: Just because people wagered on the Yankees did not mean that they liked them.

Definition: to become or cause to become erect
Example: straighten up your room before leaving

Definition: Your stance on a particular matter is your attitude to it.
Example: The Congress had agreed to reconsider its stance on the armed struggle.

Definition: A booth is a small area separated from a larger public area by screens or thin walls where, for example, people can make a phone call or vote in private.
Example: I called her from a public phone booth near the entrance to the bar.

Definition: A kiosk is a small building or structure from which people can buy things such as sandwiches or newspapers through an open window.
Example: I tried to buy an ice-cream from a kiosk.

Definition: The calibre of a person is the quality or standard of their ability or intelligence, especially when this is high.
Example: I was impressed by the high calibre of the researchers and analysts.

Definition: If you goggle at something, you stare at it with your eyes wide open, usually because you are surprised by it.
Example: She goggled at me.

Definition: If you refer to a particular state of affairs, you mean the general situation and circumstances connected with someone or something.
Example: This state of affairs cannot continue for too long, if parliament is to recover.

Definition: If you say that someone or something is dependable, you approve of them because you feel that you can be sure that they will always act consistently or sensibly, or do what you need them to do.
Example: He was a good friend, a dependable companion.

Definition: If someone plagiarizes another person's idea or work, they use it or copy it and pretend that they thought of it or created it.
Example: Moderates are plagiarizing his ideas in hopes of wooing voters.

Definition: If you flit around or flit between one place and another, you go to lots of places without staying for very long in any of them.
Example: Laura flits about New York hailing taxis at every opportunity.

Definition: A particular kind of gait is a particular way of walking.
Example: ...a tubby little man in his fifties, with sparse hair and a rolling gait.

Definition: If one thing is an offshoot of another, it has developed from that other thing.
Example: Psychology began as a purely academic offshoot of natural philosophy.

Definition: If you cling to someone or something, you hold onto them tightly.
Example: Another man was rescued as he clung to the riverbank.

Definition: If you tolerate a situation or person, you accept them although you do not particularly like them.
Example: She can no longer tolerate the position that she's in.

Definition: Someone or something that is motionless is not moving at all.
Example:
He has this ability of being able to remain as motionless as a statue, for hours
on end.

Definition: Something that is stationary is not moving.
Example: Stationary cars in traffic jams cause a great deal of pollution.

Definition: not moving; still
Example: It is worse at rest, sitting still is difficult and sleep becomes a nightmare.

Definition: Something or someone that is noiseless does not make any sound.
Example: The snow was light and noiseless as it floated down.

Definition: If soldiers or the police subdue a group of people, they defeat them or bring them under control by using force.
Example: Senior government officials admit they have not been able to subdue the rebels.

Definition: A commotion is a lot of noise, confusion, and excitement.
Example: He heard a commotion outside.

Definition: Merchandise is goods that are bought, sold, or traded.
Example: The new firm will own the merchandising rights to its shows and stars.

Definition: Someone's wares are the things that they sell, usually in the street or in a market.
Example: Vendors displayed their wares in baskets or on the ground.

Definition: If you say, for example, that someone is of French extraction, you mean that they or their family originally came from France.
Example: Her real father was of Italian extraction.

Definition: Animals such as cattle and sheep which are kept on a farm are referred to as livestock.
Example: The heavy rains and flooding killed scores of livestock.

Definition: Cattle are cows and bulls.
Example: ...the finest herd of beef cattle for two hundred miles.

Definition: If you describe something such as a saying or an image as hackneyed, you think it is no longer likely to interest, amuse, or affect people because it has been used, seen, or heard many times before.
Example:
Power corrupts and absolute power absolutely corrupts. That's the old hackneyed phrase,
but it's true.

Definition: Your abdomen is the part of your body below your chest where your stomach and intestines are.
Example: He was suffering from pains in his abdomen.

Definition: A gem is a jewel or stone that is used in jewellery.
Example: ...a gold mask inset with emeralds and other gems.

Definition: A jewel is a precious stone used to decorate valuable things that you wear, such as rings or necklaces.
Example: ...a golden box containing precious jewels.

Definition: If you refrain from doing something, you deliberately do not do it.
Example: Mrs Hardie refrained from making any comment.

Definition: If you desist from doing something, you stop doing it.
Example: Ford never desisted from trying to persuade him to return to America.

Definition: If you  draw up a document, list, or plan, you prepare it and write it out.
Example: They agreed to draw up a formal agreement.

Definition: If movement or activity comes to or is brought to a standstill, it stops completely.
Example: Abruptly the group ahead of us came to a standstill.

Definition: The destination of someone or something is the place to which they are going or being sent.
Example: Spain is still our most popular holiday destination.

Definition: A warehouse is a large building where raw materials or manufactured goods are stored until they are exported to other countries or distributed to shops to be sold.
Example: From there it is a short walk to two old salt warehouses.

Definition: A depot is a place where large amounts of raw materials, equipment, arms, or other supplies are kept until they are needed.
Example: ...food depots.

Definition: A storehouse is a building in which things, usually food, are stored.
Example: Some of the cottages had been turned into storehouses.

Definition: A hurricane is an extremely violent wind or storm.
Example: This stirring philosophy was to be swept away with hurricane force.

Definition: A gale is a very strong wind.
Example: ...forecasts of fierce gales over the next few days.

Definition: An outcry is a reaction of strong disapproval and anger shown by the public or media about a recent event.
Example: The killing caused an international outcry.

Definition: If people are clamouring for something, they are demanding it in a noisy or angry way.
Example: ...competing parties clamouring for the attention of the voter.

Definition: If you flounce somewhere, you walk there quickly with exaggerated movements, in a way that shows you are annoyed or upset.
Example: She flounced out of my room in a huff.

Definition: Fumes are the unpleasant and often unhealthy smoke and gases that are produced by fires or by things such as chemicals, fuel, or cooking.
Example: ...car exhaust fumes.

Definition: If you say that someone rants, you mean that they talk loudly or angrily, and exaggerate or say foolish things.
Example: As the boss began to rant, I stood up and went out.

Definition: An anecdote is a short, amusing account of something that has happened.
Example: Pete was telling them an anecdote about their mother.

Definition: Consecutive periods of time or events happen one after the other without interruption.
Example: The Cup was won for the third consecutive year by the Toronto Maple Leafs.

Definition: Orthodox beliefs, methods, or systems are ones which are accepted or used by most people.
Example: Payne gained a reputation for sound, if orthodox, views.

Definition: A heterosexual relationship is a sexual relationship between a man and a woman.
Example: Even red-blooded heterosexuals had to admit he was handsome.

Definition: If you describe something or someone as weird, you mean that they are strange.
Example: That first day was weird.

Definition: An oddity is someone or something that is very strange.
Example: Carlson noticed another oddity; his plant had bloomed twice.

Definition: An abnormality in something, especially in a person's body or behaviour, is an unusual part or feature of it that may be worrying or dangerous.
Example: Further scans are required to confirm the diagnosis of an abnormality.

Definition: A peculiarity that someone or something has is a strange or unusual characteristic or habit.
Example: Joe's other peculiarity was that he was constantly munching hard candy.

Definition: You use tactical to describe an action or plan which is intended to help someone achieve what they want in a particular situation.
Example:
It's not yet clear whether the Prime Minister's resignation offer is a serious one,
or whether it's simply a tactical move.

Definition: If something is calculated to have a particular effect, it is specially done or arranged in order to have that effect.
Example: Their movements were calculated to terrify landowners into abandoning their holdings.

Definition: A brook is a small stream.
Example: She'd had a plan of action, one that would brook no interference.

Definition: A lane is a narrow road, especially in the country.
Example: ...a quiet country lane.

Definition: Avenue is sometimes used in the names of streets. The written abbreviation Ave. is also used.
Example: ...the most expensive stores on Park Avenue.

Definition: Brawn is physical strength.
Example: He's got plenty of brains as well as brawn.

Definition: something at which one excels; forte
Example: We work on these situations in training and finishing is actually one of our strongest points.

Definition: If you bolster something such as someone's confidence or courage, you increase it.
Example: Hopes of an early cut in interest rates bolstered confidence.

Definition: If something invigorates you, it makes you feel more energetic.
Example: Take a deep breath in to invigorate you.

Definition: A stint is a period of time which you spend doing a particular job or activity or working in a particular place.
Example: He is returning to this country after a five-year stint in Hong Kong.

Definition: A walkout is a strike.
Example: The commission's proceedings have been wrecked by tantrums and walkouts.

Definition: If you  walk out of a meeting, a performance, or an unpleasant situation, you leave it suddenly, usually in order to show that you are angry or bored.
Example: Several dozen councillors walked out of the meeting in protest.

Definition: If you smack someone, you hit them with your hand.
Example: She smacked me on the side of the head.

Definition: Yarn is thread used for knitting or making cloth.
Example: She still spins the yarn and knits sweaters for her family.

Definition: Twine is strong string used especially in gardening and farming.
Example: He had twined his chubby arms around Vincent's neck.

Definition: A necklace is a piece of jewellery such as a chain or a string of beads which someone wears round their neck.
Example: ...a diamond necklace and matching earrings.

Definition: If you sling something somewhere, you throw it there carelessly.
Example: I saw him take off his anorak and sling it into the back seat.

Definition: If you shred something such as food or paper, you cut it or tear it into very small, narrow pieces.
Example: They may be shredding documents.

Definition: When someone disrobes, they remove their clothes.
Example: She stood up and began to disrobe, folding each garment neatly.

Definition: The peel of a fruit such as a lemon or an apple is its skin.
Example: ...grated lemon peel.

Definition: If someone plunders a place or plunders things from a place, they steal things from it.
Example: They plundered and burned the market town of Leominster.

Definition: If someone is robbed, they have money or property stolen from them.
Example: Mrs Yacoub was robbed of her 3,000 designer watch at her West London home.

Definition: If people loot shops or houses, they steal things from them, for example during a war or riot.
Example: The trouble began when gangs began breaking windows and looting shops.

Definition: If you fondle someone or something, you touch them gently with a stroking movement, usually in a sexual way.
Example: He tried to kiss her and fondle her.

Definition: If you pat something or someone, you tap them lightly, usually with your hand held flat.
Example: 'Don't you worry about any of this,' she said patting me on the knee.

Definition: Apoplexy is a stroke.
Example: He has already caused apoplexy with his books on class and on war.

Definition: the sound of a bell rung to announce a death or a funeral
Example: It's like ringing the death knell on a sale.

Definition: If you refer to an action, or the result of an action, as a feat, you admire it because it is an impressive and difficult achievement.
Example: A racing car is an extraordinary feat of engineering.

Definition: Muscular means involving or affecting your muscles.
Example:
As a general rule, all muscular effort is enhanced by breathing in as the effort
is made.

Definition: Someone who is self-confident behaves confidently because they feel sure of their abilities or value.
Example: She'd blossomed into a self-confident young woman.

Definition: Vigorous physical activities involve using a lot of energy, usually to do short and repeated actions.
Example: Very vigorous exercise can increase the risk of heart attacks.

Definition: A compelling argument or reason is one that convinces you that something is true or that something should be done.
Example: A compelling answer was provided in the final session from two different sources.

Definition: If you describe something as unmistakable, you mean that it is so obvious that it cannot be mistaken for anything else.
Example: He didn't give his name, but the voice was unmistakable.

Definition: When people toil, they work very hard doing unpleasant or tiring tasks.
Example:
People who toiled in dim, dank factories were too exhausted to enjoy their family
life.

Definition: When you wrestle with a difficult problem, you try to deal with it.
Example: Delegates wrestled with the problems of violence and sanctions.

Definition: If you grapple with a problem or difficulty, you try hard to solve it.
Example: The economy is just one of several critical problems the country is grappling with.

Definition: If you describe an experience or situation as an ordeal, you think it is difficult and unpleasant.
Example: ...the painful ordeal of the last eight months.

Definition: If you scrutinize something, you examine it very carefully, often to find out some information from it or about it.
Example: Her purpose was to scrutinize his features to see if he was an honest man.

Definition: If you refer to something as idiocy, you mean that you think it is very stupid.
Example: ...the idiocy of continuing government subsidies for environmentally damaging activities.

Definition: If you say that someone or something is silly, you mean that they are foolish, childish, or ridiculous.
Example: My best friend tells me that I am silly to be upset about this.

Definition: If someone is rash or does rash things, they act without thinking carefully first, and therefore make mistakes or behave foolishly.
Example: It would be rash to rely on such evidence.

Definition: Consequently means as a result.
Example:
Grandfather Dingsdale had sustained a broken back while working in the mines. Consequently,
he spent the rest of his life in a wheelchair.

Definition: The gist of a speech, conversation, or piece of writing is its general meaning.
Example: He related the gist of his conversation to Naseby.

Definition: A goodly amount or part of something is a fairly large amount or part of it, often more than was expected.
Example:
The Central Intelligence Agency employed a goodly number of expert professionals
in this particular field.

Definition: Someone or something that is sturdy looks strong and is unlikely to be easily injured or damaged.
Example: She was a short, sturdy woman in her early sixties.

Definition: If someone is ousted from a position of power, job, or place, they are forced to leave it.
Example: The leaders have been ousted from power by nationalists.

Definition: If something is superseded by something newer, it is replaced because it has become old-fashioned or unacceptable.
Example: Hand tools are relics of the past that have now been superseded by the machine.

Definition: An eminent person is well-known and respected, especially because they are good at their profession.
Example: ...an eminent scientist.

Definition: recognized as being true or existing
Example: the acknowledged leader of the group

Definition: If something happens all at once, it happens suddenly, often when you are not expecting it to happen.
Example: I feel terribly sleepy all at once.

Definition: If the authorities prosecute someone, they charge them with a crime and put them on trial.
Example: The police have decided not to prosecute because the evidence is not strong enough.

Definition: If something deteriorates, it becomes worse in some way.
Example: There are fears that the situation might deteriorate into full-scale war.

Definition: If something  falls off, it separates from the thing to which it was attached and moves towards the ground.
Example: When your exhaust falls off, you have to replace it.

Definition: an indirect or devious hint or suggestion
Example: `Of course I checked, " Graham retorted, stung by the insinuation that he hadn't followed standard UNACO procedures.

Definition: An actor's or performer's costume is the set of clothes they wear while they are performing.
Example: Even from a distance the effect of his fox costume was stunning.

Definition: If someone flatters you, they praise you in an exaggerated way that is not sincere, because they want to please you or to persuade you to do something.
Example: I knew she was just flattering me.

Definition: Legal proceedings are legal action taken against someone.
Example: ...criminal proceedings against the former prime minister.

Definition: A pinnacle is a pointed piece of stone or rock that is high above the ground.
Example: A walker fell 80ft from a rocky pinnacle.

Definition: Sunlight is the light that comes from the sun during the day.
Example: I saw her sitting at a window table, bathed in sunlight.

Definition: Daylight is the natural light that there is during the day, before it gets dark.
Example: It was still daylight but all the cars had their headlights on.

Definition: If you describe someone or something as marvellous, you are emphasizing that they are very good.
Example: He certainly is a marvellous actor.

Definition: If you say that something is presumably the case, you mean that you think it is very likely to be the case, although you are not certain.
Example: Presumably the front door was locked when you came down this morning?

Definition: Something that is paramount or of paramount importance is more important than anything else.
Example: The child's welfare must be seen as paramount.

Definition: If you describe something as superlative, you mean that it is extremely good.
Example: Some superlative cheeses are made in this region.

Definition: The prevailing wind in an area is the type of wind that blows over that area most of the time.
Example: The direction of the prevailing winds should be taken into account.

Definition: If you do something without question, you do it without arguing or asking why it is necessary.
Example:
...military formations, carrying out without question the battle orders of superior
officers.

Definition: to be revealed
Example: And there's one other aspect to this that's come to light, something that I couldn't discuss over the radio.

Definition: Amazement is the feeling you have when something surprises you very much.
Example: I stared at her in amazement.

Definition: Astonishment is a feeling of great surprise.
Example: I spotted a shooting star which, to my astonishment, was bright green in colour.

Definition: Disbelief is not believing that something is true or real.
Example: She looked at him in disbelief.

Definition: If something amazes you, it surprises you very much.
Example: He amazed us by his knowledge of Welsh history.

Definition: If something or someone astonishes you, they surprise you very much.
Example: My news will astonish you.

Definition: If something astounds you, you are very surprised by it.
Example: He used to astound his friends with feats of physical endurance.

Definition: filled with incredulity or surprise
Example: He is amazed when people from TV shows get into Twitter spats with those who criticise them.

Definition: If you are astonished by something, you are very surprised about it.
Example: I was astonished by his stupidity.

Definition: perturbed, embarrassed, or confused
Example: Birmingham seemed no less disconcerted, with many empty seats bearing witness to the audience's reluctance to journey forth in the snow.

Definition: To encircle something or someone means to surround or enclose them, or to go round them.
Example: A forty-foot-high concrete wall encircles the jail.

Definition: If something encompasses particular things, it includes them.
Example: The extra services encompass a wide range of special interests.

Definition: If you are besieged by people, many people want something from you and continually bother you.
Example: She was besieged by the press and the public.

Definition: If someone or something is beset by problems or fears, they have many problems or fears which affect them severely.
Example: The country is beset by severe economic problems.

Definition: Edging is something that is put along the borders or sides of something else, usually to make it look attractive.
Example: ...the satin edging on Randall's blanket.

Definition: An overview of a situation is a general understanding or description of it as a whole.
Example: The central section of the book is a historical overview of drug use.

Definition: A valuation is a judgment that someone makes about how much money something is worth.
Example: ...an independent valuation of the company.

Definition: If one person outlives another, they are still alive after the second person has died. If one thing outlives another thing, the first thing continues to exist after the second has disappeared or been replaced.
Example: I'm sure Rose will outlive many of us.

Definition: If one thing outlasts another thing, the first thing lives or exists longer than the second.
Example: These naturally dried flowers will outlast a bouquet of fresh blooms.

Definition: If you distrust someone or something, you think they are not honest, reliable, or safe.
Example: I don't have any particular reason to distrust them.

Definition: Mistrust is the feeling that you have towards someone who you do not trust.
Example: There was mutual mistrust between the two men.

Definition: If you describe something as dubious, you mean that you do not consider it to be completely honest, safe, or reliable.
Example: This claim seems to us to be rather dubious.

Definition: If you say that something is questionable, you mean that it is not completely honest, reasonable, or acceptable.
Example: He has been dogged by allegations of questionable business practices.

Definition: If someone blasphemes, they say rude or disrespectful things about God or religion, or they use God's name as a swear word.
Example: 'Don't blaspheme,' my mother said.

Definition: If someone or something creates a vacuum, they leave a place or position which then needs to be filled by another person or thing.
Example: The collapse of the army left a vacuum in the area.

Definition: If one thing engulfs another, it completely covers or hides it, often in a sudden and unexpected way.
Example: A seven-year-old boy was found dead after a landslide engulfed a block of flats.

Definition: If you swagger, you walk in a very proud, confident way, holding your body upright and swinging your hips.
Example: A broad-shouldered man wearing a dinner jacket swaggered confidently up to the bar.

Definition: An arc is a smoothly curving line or movement.
Example: The Aleutian chain is a long arc of islands in the North Pacific.

Definition: Sugary food or drink contains a lot of sugar.
Example: Sugary canned drinks rot your teeth.

Definition: You use cloying to describe something that you find unpleasant because it is much too sweet, or too sentimental.
Example: Her cheap, cloying scent enveloped him.

Definition: Dessert is something sweet, such as fruit or a pudding, that you eat at the end of a meal.
Example: She had homemade ice cream for dessert.

Definition: A pudding is a cooked sweet food made with flour, fat, and eggs, and usually served hot.
Example: ...a cherry sponge pudding with warm custard.

Definition: Something that is satisfying makes you feel happy, especially because you feel you have achieved something.
Example: I found wood carving satisfying.

Definition: Something or someone that is cute is very pretty or attractive, or is intended to appear pretty or attractive.
Example: Oh, look at that dog! He's so cute.

Definition: charming, fascinating, or intriguing
Example: But he is enjoying life no longer taking pictures.

Definition: If you swirl something liquid or flowing, or if it swirls, it moves round and round quickly.
Example: She smiled, swirling the drink in her glass.

Definition: If something swivels or if you swivel it, it turns around a central point so that it is facing in a different direction.
Example: She swivelled her chair round and stared out across the back lawn.

Definition: constant change; vacillation; instability
Example: Investors were more concerned about the here and now, he said, and fluctuations in the price of the yellow metal.

Definition: A lever is a handle or bar that is attached to a piece of machinery and which you push or pull in order to operate the machinery.
Example: Push the tiny lever on the lock.

Definition:
An allegory is a story, poem, or painting in which the characters and events are symbols of something else. Allegories are
often moral, religious, or political.
Example: The book is a kind of allegory of Latin American history.

Definition: A web is the thin net made by a spider from a sticky substance which it produces in its body.
Example: ...the spider's web in the window.

Definition: A grid is something which is in a pattern of straight lines that cross over each other, forming squares. On maps the grid is used to help you find a particular thing or place.
Example: ...a grid of ironwork.

Definition: If someone is abducted by another person, he or she is taken away illegally, usually using force.
Example: His car was held up and he was abducted by four gunmen.

Definition: Someone's aptitude for a particular kind of work or activity is their ability to learn it quickly and to do it well.
Example: An aptitude for computing is beneficial for students taking this degree.

Definition: When people chat, they talk to each other in an informal and friendly way.
Example: The women were chatting.

Definition: If you chatter, you talk quickly and continuously, usually about things which are not important.
Example: Everyone's chattering away in different languages.

Definition: to gossip about another's personal matters or secrets
Example: Users can vote on deals and comments, and can tattle on expired or misrepresented deals.

Definition: A lofty ideal or ambition is noble, important, and admirable.
Example: It was a bank that started out with grand ideas and lofty ideals.

Definition: If something spouts liquid or fire, or if liquid or fire spout out of something, it comes out very quickly with a lot of force.
Example: He replaced the boiler when the last one began to spout flames.

Definition: Rap is a type of music in which the words are not sung but are spoken in a rapid, rhythmic way.
Example: ...the unexpected pleasure of hearing the band not only rap but even sing.

Definition:
When you seal an envelope, you close it by folding part of it over and sticking it down, so that
it cannot be opened without being torn.
Example: He sealed the envelope and put on a stamp.

Definition: If you can discern something, you are aware of it and know what it is.
Example: You need a long series of data to be able to discern such a trend.

Definition: If someone has a penchant for something, they have a special liking for it or a tendency to do it.
Example: ...a stylish woman with a penchant for dark glasses.

Definition: tender or doting affection
Example: Over the years he had developed a fondness for Rolf that went beyond any business relationship.

Definition: A tutor is a teacher at a British university or college. In some American universities or colleges, a tutor is a teacher of the lowest rank.
Example: He is course tutor in archaeology at the University of Southampton.

Definition:
A troupe is a group of actors, singers, or dancers who work together and often travel around together, performing in different
places.
Example: ...troupes of travelling actors.

Definition:
A ladder is a piece of equipment used for climbing up something or down from something. It consists of two long pieces
of wood, metal, or rope with steps fixed between them.
Example: If they want to climb the ladder of success they should be given that opportunity.

Definition: The claws of a bird or animal are the thin, hard, curved nails at the end of its feet.
Example: The cat tried to cling to the edge by its claws.

Definition: If something lacerates your skin, it cuts it badly and deeply.
Example: Its claws lacerated his thighs.

Definition: To sever something means to cut completely through it or to cut it completely off.
Example: Richardson severed his right foot in a motorbike accident.

Definition: A rupture is a severe injury in which an internal part of your body tears or bursts open, especially the part between the bowels and the abdomen.
Example: His stomach might rupture from all the acid.

Definition: Something that is impermanent does not last for ever.
Example: We are reminded just how small and how impermanent we are.

Definition: If you say that something is transitory, you mean that it lasts only for a short time.
Example: Most teenage romances are transitory.

Definition: If something is the case or will happen for the time being, it is the case or will happen now, but only until something else becomes possible or happens.
Example: For the time being, however, immunotherapy is still in its experimental stages.

Definition: Momentarily means for a short time.
Example: She paused momentarily when she saw them.

Definition: If you gravitate towards a particular place, thing, or activity, you are attracted by it and go to it or get involved in it.
Example: Traditionally young Asians in Britain have gravitated towards medicine, law and engineering.

Definition: If you take a particular turning, you go along a road which leads away from the side of another road.
Example: Take the next turning on the right.

Definition: If there is friction between people, there is disagreement and argument between them.
Example: Sara sensed that there had been friction between her children.

Definition: If you have a feeling of unease, you feel rather anxious or afraid, because you think that something is wrong.
Example: Tommy began to feel deep unease about Gabe's story.

Definition: If you dread something which may happen, you feel very anxious and unhappy about it because you think it will be unpleasant or upsetting.
Example: I'm dreading Christmas this year.

Definition: Fright is a sudden feeling of fear, especially the fear that you feel when something unpleasant surprises you.
Example: The steam pipes rattled suddenly, and Franklin uttered a shriek and jumped with fright.

Definition: If you call a man or child a rascal, you mean that they behave badly and are rude or dishonest.
Example: What's that old rascal been telling you?

Definition: A monkey is an animal with a long tail which lives in hot countries and climbs trees.
Example: She's such a little monkey.

Definition: If you call a child a scamp, you mean that they are naughty or disrespectful but you like them, so you find it difficult to be angry with them.
Example: Have some respect for me, you scamp!

Definition: A motif is a design which is used as a decoration or as part of an artistic pattern.
Example: ...a rose motif.

Definition: A leitmotif in something such as a book or film or in a person's life is an idea or an object which occurs again and again.
Example:
The title of one of Dietrich's best-known songs could serve as the leitmotif for
her life.

Definition: You use as well when mentioning something which happens in the same way as something else already mentioned, or which should be considered at the same time as that thing.
Example: If the university invites one candidate to speak, all others will be invited as well.

Definition: The width of something is the distance it measures from one side or edge to the other.
Example: Measure the full width of the window.

Definition: Luxuriant plants, trees, and gardens are large, healthy, and growing well.
Example: ...large oak trees with wide spreading branches and luxuriant foliage.

Definition: A chunky person is broad and heavy.
Example: The soprano was a chunky girl from California.

Definition: If an object or substance is opaque, you cannot see through it.
Example: You can always use opaque glass if you need to block a street view.

Definition: If you describe something such as a barrier or a forest as impenetrable, you mean that it is impossible or very difficult to get through.
Example: ...the Caucasus range, an almost impenetrable barrier between Europe and Asia.

Definition: A condensed book, explanation, or piece of information has been made shorter, usually by including only the most important parts.
Example:
The Council was merely given a condensed version of what had already been disclosed
in Washington.

Definition: If someone's voice is husky, it is low and rather rough, often in an attractive way.
Example: His voice was husky with grief.

Definition: If your voice is hoarse or if you are hoarse, your voice sounds rough and unclear, for example because your throat is sore.
Example: 'So what do you think?' she said in a hoarse whisper.

Definition: If you describe someone as insensitive, you are criticizing them for being unaware of or unsympathetic to other people's feelings.
Example: I felt he was being insensitive about the enormity of what we had done.

Definition: To attenuate something means to reduce it or weaken it.
Example: You could never eliminate risk, but preparation and training could attenuate it.

Definition: An attenuated object is unusually long and thin.
Example: ...round arches and attenuated columns.

Definition: Something that is watery is weak or pale.
Example: A watery light began to show through the branches.

Definition: If a liquid is diluted or dilutes, it is added to or mixes with water or another liquid, and becomes weaker.
Example: If you give your baby juice, dilute it well with cooled, boiled water.

Definition: Something that is sparse is small in number or amount and spread out over an area.
Example: Many slopes are rock fields with sparse vegetation.

Definition: You describe something as scanty when there is less of it than you think there should be.
Example: So far, what scanty evidence we have points to two suspects.

Definition: If you describe something such as an argument or explanation as unconvincing, you find it difficult to believe because it does not seem real.
Example:
Mr Patel phoned the University for an explanation, and he was given the usual unconvincing
excuses.

Definition: If you describe someone or something as feeble, you mean that they are weak.
Example: He told them he was old and feeble and was not able to walk so far.

Definition: If someone has wispy hair, their hair does not grow thickly on their head.
Example: Grey wispy hair straggled down to her shoulders.

Definition: Your belongings are the things that you own, especially things that are small enough to be carried.
Example: I collected my belongings and left.

Definition: If you ponder something, you think about it carefully.
Example: I found myself constantly pondering the question: 'How could anyone do these things?'

Definition: Deliberation is the long and careful consideration of a subject.
Example: After much deliberation, a decision was reached.

Definition: A bully is someone who often hurts or frightens other people.
Example: I fell victim to the office bully.

Definition: If someone terrorizes you, they keep you in a state of fear by making it seem likely that they will attack you.
Example: Bands of gunmen have hijacked food shipments and terrorized relief workers.

Definition: Your gullet is the tube which goes from your mouth to your stomach.
Example: Acid reflux from an inflamed stomach or gullet can force blood upwards, too.

Definition: Your windpipe is the tube in your body that carries air into your lungs when you breathe.
Example: The leopard obviously hadn't been able to close off the windpipe.

Definition: To dislodge something means to remove it from where it was fixed or held.
Example: Rainfall had dislodged debris from the slopes of the volcano.

Definition: When people try to unseat a person who is in an important job or position, they try to remove him or her from that job or position.
Example: It is still not clear who was behind Sunday's attempt to unseat the President.

Definition: If something overturns or if you overturn it, it turns upside down or on its side.
Example: The lorry veered out of control, overturned and smashed into a wall.

Definition: If something flicks in a particular direction, or if someone flicks it, it moves with a short, sudden movement.
Example: His tongue flicked across his lips.

Definition: A voucher is a ticket or piece of paper that can be used instead of money to pay for something.
Example: The winners will each receive a voucher for a pair of cinema tickets.

Definition: A coupon is a piece of printed paper which allows you to pay less money than usual for a product, or to get it free.
Example: Bring the coupon below to any Tecno store and pay just 10.99.

Definition: If you tie a knot in a piece of string, rope, cloth, or other material, you pass one end or part of it through a loop and pull it tight.
Example: One lace had broken and been tied in a knot.

Definition: A cramped room or building is not big enough for the people or things in it.
Example:
There are hundreds of families living in cramped conditions on the floor of the airport
lounge.

Definition: If you feel snug or are in a snug place, you are very warm and comfortable, especially because you are protected from cold weather.
Example: They lay snug and warm amid the blankets.

Definition: Stringent laws, rules, or conditions are very severe or are strictly controlled.
Example: He announced that there would be more stringent controls on the possession of weapons.

Definition: Something that is taut is stretched very tight.
Example: When muscles are taut or cold there is more chance of injury or strain.

Definition: A tense situation or period of time is one that makes people anxious, because they do not know what is going to happen next.
Example: This gesture of goodwill did little to improve the tense atmosphere at the talks.

Definition: Laws, rules, or systems that are rigid cannot be changed or varied, and are therefore considered to be rather severe.
Example: Several colleges in our study have rigid rules about student conduct.

Definition: Compressed air or gas is squeezed into a small space or container and is therefore at a higher pressure than normal. It is used especially as a source of power for machines.
Example: Scott-Hughes hesitated, his lips compressed, then sighed.

Definition: If you dump something somewhere, you put it or unload it there quickly and carelessly.
Example: We dumped our bags at the nearby Grand Hotel and hurried towards the market.

Definition: A gratuity is a gift of money to someone who has done something for you.
Example: The porter expects a gratuity.

Definition:
If something exhausts you, it makes you so tired, either physically or mentally, that you have no energy
left.
Example: Don't exhaust him.

Definition: Fatigue is a feeling of extreme physical or mental tiredness.
Example: She continued to have severe stomach cramps, aches, fatigue, and depression.

Definition: If you are feeling fatigued, you are suffering from extreme physical or mental tiredness.
Example: Winter weather can leave you feeling fatigued and tired.

Definition: Spent is the past tense and past participle of spend.
Example: Radioactive waste is simply spent fuel.

Definition: Stale food is no longer fresh or good to eat.
Example: Their daily diet consisted of a lump of stale bread, a bowl of rice and stale water.

Definition: A well-worn expression, remark, or idea has been used so often that it no longer seems to have much meaning or to be interesting.
Example: To use a well-worn cliche, it is packed with information.

Definition: Ownership of something is the state of owning it.
Example: They decided to relax their rules on the foreign ownership of their airlines.

Definition: Nowadays means at the present time, in contrast with the past.
Example: Nowadays it's acceptable for women to be ambitious. But it wasn't then.

Definition: in a joint manner; together
Example: There are just the two brothers, they own both the house and the mine jointly and they've always been close.

Definition: If two or more things exist, happen, or are true at the same time, they exist, happen, or are true together although they seem to contradict each other.
Example: I was afraid of her, but at the same time I really liked her.

Definition: Someone who is self-possessed is calm and confident and in control of their emotions.
Example: She is clearly the most articulate and self-possessed member of her family.

Definition: If someone is composed, they are calm and able to control their feelings.
Example: Laura was very calm and composed.

Definition: Overly means more than is normal, necessary, or reasonable.
Example: Employers may become overly cautious about taking on new staff.

Definition: If you pawn something that you own, you leave it with a pawnbroker, who gives you money for it and who can sell it if you do not pay back the money before a certain time.
Example: He is contemplating pawning his watch.

Definition: If a person dupes you, they trick you into doing something or into believing something which is not true.
Example: ...a plot to dupe stamp collectors into buying fake rarities.

Definition: A jumper is a warm knitted piece of clothing which covers the upper part of your body and your arms.
Example: Isabel had on a simple jumper and skirt.

Definition: A garnish is a small amount of salad, herbs, or other food that is used to decorate cooked or prepared food.
Example: ...a garnish of chopped raw onion, tomato and fresh coriander.

Definition: If you jerk something or someone in a particular direction, or they jerk in a particular direction, they move a short distance very suddenly and quickly.
Example: Mr Griffin jerked forward in his chair.

Definition: If you flip a device on or off, or if you flip a switch, you turn it on or off by pressing the switch quickly.
Example: He didn't flip on the headlights until he was two blocks away.

Definition: If you heave something heavy or difficult to move somewhere, you push, pull, or lift it using a lot of effort.
Example: It took five strong men to heave the statue up a ramp and lower it into place.

Definition: To compute a quantity or number means to calculate it.
Example: I tried to compute the cash value of the ponies and horse boxes.

Definition: Accessories are items of equipment that are not usually essential, but which can be used with or added to something else in order to make it more efficient, useful, or decorative.
Example: ...an exclusive range of hand-made bedroom and bathroom accessories.

Definition: A high-powered machine or piece of equipment is very powerful and efficient.
Example: ...high powered lasers.

Definition: A vicious person or a vicious blow is violent and cruel.
Example: He was a cruel and vicious man.

Definition: If you say that someone is ruthless, you mean that you disapprove of them because they are very harsh or cruel, and will do anything that is necessary to achieve what they want.
Example: The President was ruthless in dealing with any hint of internal political dissent.

Definition: impossible to understand; perplexing; bewildering; puzzling
Example: She was alive, but everlastingly inaccessible, and Alberg found this baffling and frustrating.

Definition: If food is chewy, it needs to be chewed a lot before it becomes soft enough to swallow.
Example: The meat was too chewy.

Definition: If the texture of something, for example someone's skin, is leathery, it is tough and hard, like leather.
Example: His hair and beard are both untidy and his skin is quite leathery.

Definition: Stringy food contains long, thin pieces that are difficult or unpleasant to eat.
Example: The meat was stringy.

Definition: You can refer to a short journey as an excursion, especially if it is made for pleasure or enjoyment.
Example: In Bermuda, Sam's father took him on an excursion to a coral barrier.

Definition: A ramble is a long walk in the countryside.
Example: ...an hour's ramble through the woods.

Definition: A pillar is a tall solid structure, which is usually used to support part of a building.
Example: ...the pillars supporting the roof.

Definition: A plaything is a toy or other object that a child plays with.
Example: ...an untidy garden scattered with children's playthings.

Definition: A doll is a child's toy which looks like a small person or baby.
Example: The detail is rendered so well that this big dolls' house goes well beyond the girly play imperative.

Definition: A trinket is a pretty piece of jewellery or small ornament that is inexpensive.
Example: She sold trinkets to tourists.

Definition: A bauble is a small, cheap ornament or piece of jewellery.
Example: ...Christmas trees decorated with coloured baubles.

Definition: cheap; shoddy
Example: The poor must be grateful for gimcrack blandness.

Definition: The remnants of something are small parts of it that are left over when the main part has disappeared or been destroyed.
Example: After twenty-four hours of fighting, the remnants of the force were fleeing.

Definition: any pieces, scraps, fragments, etc, that are left unused or still extant, as after use, consumption, the passage of time, etc
Example: They parked in the car park and walked the half mile to the stone remains of the fort.

Definition: If you barter goods, you exchange them for other goods, rather than selling them for money.
Example: They have been bartering wheat for cotton and timber.

Definition: Freight is the movement of goods by lorries, trains, ships, or aeroplanes.
Example: France derives 16% of revenue from air freight.

Definition: Adversity is a very difficult or unfavourable situation.
Example: He showed courage in adversity.

Definition: If you  fall behind, you do not make progress or move forward as fast as other people.
Example: Evans had rheumatic fever, missed school and fell behind.

Definition: A convoy is a group of vehicles or ships travelling together.
Example: ...a U.N. convoy carrying food and medical supplies.

Definition: When people rehearse a play, dance, or piece of music, they practise it in order to prepare for a performance.
Example: A group of actors are rehearsing a play about Joan of Arc.

Definition: When a metamorphosis occurs, a person or thing develops and changes into something completely different.
Example: ...his metamorphosis from a republican to a democrat.

Definition: If someone revamps something, they make changes to it in order to try and improve it.
Example: All Italy's political parties have accepted that it is time to revamp the system.

Definition: A conveyance is a vehicle.
Example: Mahoney had never seen such a conveyance before.

Definition: Wandering is used to describe people who travel around rather than staying in one place for a long time.
Example: ...a band of wandering musicians.

Definition: Indulgence means treating someone with special kindness, often when it is not a good thing.
Example: The king's indulgence towards his sons angered the business community.

Definition:
A pact is a formal agreement between two or more people, organizations, or governments to do a particular
thing or to help each other.
Example: Stalin signed a non-aggression pact with Nazi Germany in 1939.

Definition: A stunt is something interesting that is done in order to attract attention and get publicity for the person or company responsible for it.
Example: In a bold promotional stunt for the movie, he smashed his car into a passing truck.

Definition: If you deceive someone, you make them believe something that is not true, usually in order to get some advantage for yourself.
Example: He has deceived and disillusioned us all.

Definition: Sleight of hand is the deceiving of someone in a skilful way.
Example: He accused Mr MacGregor of 'sleight of hand'.

Definition: An outing is a short enjoyable trip, usually with a group of people, away from your home, school, or place of work.
Example: One evening, she made a rare outing to the local discotheque.

Definition: If you stumble, you put your foot down awkwardly while you are walking or running and nearly fall over.
Example: He stumbled and almost fell.

Definition: If you hop, you move along by jumping on one foot.
Example: I hopped down three steps.

Definition: If someone plods, they walk slowly and heavily.
Example: Crowds of French and British families plodded around in yellow plastic macs.

Definition: A tramp is a person who has no home or job, and very little money. Tramps go from place to place, and get food or money by asking people or by doing casual work.
Example: They put on their coats and tramped through the falling snow.

Definition: If you trudge somewhere, you walk there slowly and with heavy steps, especially because you are tired or unhappy.
Example: We had to trudge up the track back to the station.

Definition: Someone's or something's shortcomings are the faults or weaknesses which they have.
Example: Marriages usually break down as a result of the shortcomings of both partners.

Definition: If you are afflicted by pain, illness, or disaster, it affects you badly and makes you suffer.
Example: The organization has been afflicted by political corruption for decades.

Definition: A lorry is a large vehicle that is used to transport goods by road.
Example: ...a seven-ton lorry.

Definition: When you start a formal or business letter or email with ' Dear Sir' or 'Dear Madam', you write Yours faithfully before your signature at the end.
Example: I knew my own instincts, but I'd promised, I'd faithfully promised.

Definition: If something happens in real life, it actually happens and is not just in a story or in someone's imagination.
Example: In FarmVille, wheat grows in two days - in real life, it takes months.

Definition: A passageway is a long narrow space with walls or fences on both sides, which connects one place or room with another.
Example: Outside, in the passageway, I could hear people moving about.

Definition: A subway is an underground railway.
Example: ...the Bay Area Rapid Transit subway system.

Definition: If a river or road meanders, it has a lot of bends, rather than going in a straight line from one place to another.
Example: ...roads that meandered round the edges of the fields.

Definition: If something has a parallel, it is similar to something else, but exists or happens in a different place or at a different time. If it has no parallel or is without parallel, it is not similar to anything else.
Example:
Readers familiar with English history will find a vague parallel to the suppression
of the monasteries.

Definition: Complementary things are different from each other but make a good combination.
Example: To improve the quality of life through work, two complementary strategies are necessary.

Definition: Unattractive people and things are unpleasant in appearance.
Example: I'm 27, have a nice flat, a good job and I'm not unattractive.

Definition: If you describe something as unsightly, you mean that it is unattractive to look at.
Example: My mother has had unsightly varicose veins for years.

Definition: Conclusive evidence shows that something is certainly true.
Example: Her attorneys claim there is no conclusive evidence that any murders took place.

Definition: Worst is the superlative of bad.
Example: Though mine safety has much improved, miners' families still fear the worst.

Definition: You can use utmost to emphasize the importance or seriousness of something or to emphasize the way that it is done.
Example: It is a matter of the utmost urgency to find out what has happened to these people.

Definition: Someone who is incapable of doing something is unable to do it.
Example: She seemed incapable of taking decisions.

Definition: Someone who is powerless is unable to control or influence events.
Example: If you don't have money, you're powerless.

Definition: If you are unfit, your body is not in good condition because you have not been taking regular exercise.
Example: Many children are so unfit they are unable to do even basic exercises.

Definition: If you have sympathy for someone who is in a bad situation, you are sorry for them, and show this in the way you behave towards them.
Example: We expressed our sympathy for her loss.

Definition: You use alas to say that you think that the facts you are talking about are sad or unfortunate.
Example: Such scandals have not, alas, been absent.

Definition: Your attire is the clothes you are wearing.
Example: ...seven women dressed in their finest attire.

Definition: The sameness of something is its lack of variety.
Example: He grew bored by the sameness of the speeches.

Definition: Wedlock is the state of being married.
Example: Births out of wedlock were a source of shame.

Definition: Matrimony is marriage.
Example: ...the bonds of matrimony.
