Definition: If you describe something as unrivalled, you are emphasizing that it is better than anything else of the same kind.
Example: He had an unrivalled knowledge of south Arabian society, religion, law and customs.

Definition: If you describe someone or something as incomparable, you mean that they are extremely good or impressive.
Example: ...paintings by the incomparable Salvador Dali.

Definition: You use inimitable to describe someone, especially a performer, when you like or admire them because of their special qualities.
Example: The major box office attraction was, of course, the inimitable Peter Hunningale.

Definition: An entity is something that exists separately from other things and has a clear identity of its own.
Example: ...the earth as a living entity.

Definition: If people are agreed on something, they have reached a joint decision on it or have the same opinion about it.
Example: Okay, so are we agreed on going north?

Definition: A generalization is a statement that seems to be true in most situations or for most people, but that may not be completely true in all cases.
Example: He is making sweeping generalisations to get his point across.

Definition: A generality is a general statement that covers a range of things, rather than being concerned with specific instances.
Example: I'll start with some generalities and then examine a few specific examples.

Definition: The cosmos is the universe.
Example: ...the natural laws of the cosmos.

Definition: If you describe a situation, experience, or activity as uncharted territory or waters, you mean that it is new or unfamiliar.
Example: Carter's fourth album definitely moves into uncharted territory.

Definition: If you describe someone or something as unidentified, you mean that nobody knows who or what they are.
Example: He was shot this morning by unidentified intruders at his house.

Definition: If you remain anonymous when you do something, you do not let people know that you were the person who did it.
Example: You can remain anonymous if you wish.

Definition: Unnamed people or things are talked about but their names are not mentioned.
Example: An unnamed man collapsed and died while he was walking near Dundonald.

Definition: Something that is improbable is unlikely to be true or to happen.
Example: ...a highly improbable coincidence.

Definition: In spoken English and informal written English, till is often used instead of until.
Example: They had to wait till Monday to ring the bank manager.

Definition: The topmost thing in a number of things is the one that is highest or nearest the top.
Example: ...the topmost branches of a gigantic oak tree.

Definition: Metropolitan means belonging to or typical of a large busy city.
Example: ...the metropolitan district of Miami.

Definition: An impulse is a sudden desire to do something.
Example: Unable to resist the impulse, he glanced at the sea again.

Definition: If you utilize something, you use it.
Example: Sound engineers utilize a range of techniques to enhance the quality of the recordings.

Definition: Usage is the way in which words are actually used in particular contexts, especially with regard to their meanings.
Example: The word 'undertaker' had long been in common usage.

Definition: Worn is the past participle of wear.
Example: Worn rugs increase the danger of tripping.

Definition: If you  cast off something, you get rid of it because it is no longer necessary or useful to you, or because it is harmful to you.
Example: The essay exhorts women to cast off their servitude to husbands and priests.

Definition: A dale is a valley.
Example: I just wanted... you know... "She looked away out over the dale.

Definition: A vale is a valley.
Example: ...a small vale, sheltering under mist-shrouded hills.

Definition: If something is worthwhile, it is enjoyable or useful, and worth the time, money, or effort that is spent on it.
Example: The President's trip to Washington this week seems to have been worthwhile.

Definition: Someone or something that is changeable is likely to change many times.
Example: The forecast is for changeable weather.

Definition: You can describe something as unstable if it is likely to change suddenly, especially if this creates difficulty or danger.
Example: After the fall of Pitt in 1801 there was a decade of unstable government.

Definition: Deviation means doing something that is different from what people consider to be normal or acceptable.
Example: Deviation from the norm is not tolerated.

Definition:
A variant of a particular thing is something that has a different form to that thing, although
it is related to it.
Example: The quagga was a strikingly beautiful variant of the zebra.

Definition:
-watcher combines with nouns to form other nouns that refer to people who are interested in a group of animals or people, and who study them
closely.
Example: The bird-watchers crept about in the bushes.

Definition: A spectator is someone who watches something, especially a sporting event.
Example: Thirty thousand spectators watched the final game.

Definition: An onlooker is someone who watches an event take place but does not take part in it.
Example: A handful of onlookers stand in the field watching.

Definition: If someone infringes a law or a rule, they break it or do something which disobeys it.
Example: The film exploited his image and infringed his copyright.

Definition: If someone is raped, they are forced to have sex, usually by violence or threats of violence.
Example: A young woman was brutally raped in her own home.

Definition: If someone trespasses, they go onto someone else's land without their permission.
Example: They were trespassing on private property.

Definition: An infringement is an action or situation that interferes with your rights and the freedom you are entitled to.
Example: ...infringement of privacy.

Definition: If someone desecrates something which is considered to be holy or very special, they deliberately damage or insult it.
Example: She shouldn't have desecrated the picture of a religious leader.

Definition: Profane behaviour shows disrespect for a religion or religious things.
Example: ...profane language.

Definition: To defile something that people think is important or holy means to do something to it or say something about it which is offensive.
Example: He had defiled the sacred name of the Holy Prophet.

Definition: a desecrating or being desecrated
Example: They called in the doctor, they raised Cain, they rang through to Tbilisi to protest at the desecration.

Definition: Sacrilege is behaviour that shows great disrespect for a holy place or object.
Example: Stealing from a place of worship was regarded as sacrilege.

Definition: Brutality is cruel and violent treatment or behaviour. A brutality is an instance of cruel and violent treatment or behaviour.
Example: ...police brutality.

Definition: Bloodshed is violence in which people are killed or wounded.
Example: The government must increase the pace of reforms to avoid further bloodshed.

Definition: Savagery is extremely cruel and violent behaviour.
Example: ...the sheer savagery of war.

Definition: You add in effect to a statement or opinion that is not precisely accurate, but which you feel is a reasonable description or summary of a particular situation.
Example: That deal would create, in effect, the world's biggest airline.

Definition: Something that is perceptible can only just be seen or noticed.
Example: Pasternak gave him a barely perceptible smile.

Definition: Something that is observable can be seen.
Example: Mars is too faint and too low in the sky to be observable.

Definition: the act or result of amplifying
Example: He had a slight lisp, which the amplification accentuated.

Definition:
A franchise is an authority that is given by an organization to someone, allowing them to sell its goods or services or to take part in an activity which the organization
controls.
Example: ...fast-food franchises.

Definition: Suffrage is the right of people to vote for a government or national leader.
Example: He was an advocate of universal suffrage as a basis for social equality.

Definition: To pronounce a word means to say it using particular sounds.
Example: Have I pronounced your name correctly?

Definition: An unprotected person or place is not looked after or defended, and so they may be harmed or attacked.
Example:
What better target than an unprotected girl, going along that river walkway in the
dark?

Definition: Someone's remuneration is the amount of money that they are paid for the work that they do.
Example: ...the continuing marked increase in the remuneration of the company's directors.

Definition: Someone who is awake is not sleeping.
Example: I don't stay awake at night worrying about that.

Definition: If you stroll somewhere, you walk there in a slow, relaxed way.
Example: A young couple stroll past me hand in hand.

Definition: A hike is a long walk in the country, especially one that you go on for pleasure.
Example: You could hike through the Fish River Canyon.

Definition: An obstruction is something that blocks a road or path.
Example: John was irritated by drivers parking near his house and causing an obstruction.

Definition: If someone strays somewhere, they wander away from where they are supposed to be.
Example: Tourists often get lost and stray into dangerous areas.

Definition: If you digress, you move away from the subject you are talking or writing about and talk or write about something different for a while.
Example: I've digressed a little to explain the situation so far, so let me now recap.

Definition: If you crave something, or crave for it, you want to have it very much.
Example: There may be certain times of day when smokers crave their cigarette.

Definition: When you heat something up, especially food which has already been cooked and allowed to go cold, you make it hot.
Example: Freda heated up a pie for me.

Definition: If you describe something as ominous, you mean that it worries you because it makes you think that something unpleasant is going to happen.
Example: There was an ominous silence at the other end of the phone.

Definition: Sponge is a very light soft substance with lots of little holes in it, which can be either artificial or natural. It is used to clean things or as a soft layer.
Example: ...a sponge mattress.

Definition: When you rinse something, you wash it in clean water in order to remove dirt or soap from it.
Example: After shampooing, always rinse the hair several times in clear water.

Definition: Debris is pieces from something that has been destroyed or pieces of rubbish or unwanted material that are spread around.
Example: I watched the rescue workers sifting through the debris.

Definition: A barren landscape is dry and bare, and has very few plants and no trees.
Example: ...the country's landscape of high barren mountains.

Definition: Breakers are big sea waves, especially at the point when they just reach the shore.
Example: He checked the power cable - intact as far as he could see, then traced it back to the circuit breaker.

Definition: the act or an instance of vibrating
Example: Three changes in frequency give three sound vibrations.

Definition: A tremor is a small earthquake.
Example: News of 160 redundancies had sent tremors through the community.

Definition: If there is an upsurge in something, there is a sudden, large increase in it.
Example: ...the upsurge in oil prices.

Definition: Someone who is frail is not very strong or healthy.
Example: She lay in bed looking particularly frail.

Definition: Impotence is a lack of power to influence people or events.
Example: ...a sense of impotence in the face of deplorable events.

Definition: The inadequacy of something is the fact that there is not enough of it, or that it is not good enough.
Example: ...the inadequacy of the water supply.

Definition: A transparency is a small piece of photographic film with a frame around it which can be projected onto a screen so that you can see the picture.
Example: Cataracts is a condition that affects the transparency of the lenses.

Definition: If you refer to the frailties or frailty of people, you are referring to their weaknesses.
Example: ...the frailties of human nature.

Definition: Exhaustion is the state of being so tired that you have no energy left.
Example: Staff say he is suffering from exhaustion.

Definition: If someone or something is ineffectual, they fail to do what they are expected to do or are trying to do.
Example: The mayor had become ineffectual in the struggle to clamp down on drugs.

Definition: If you describe someone as cowardly, you disapprove of them because they are easily frightened and avoid doing dangerous and difficult things.
Example: I was too cowardly to complain.

Definition: An object or substance that is brittle is hard but easily broken.
Example: Pine is brittle and breaks.

Definition: If someone is lame, they are unable to walk properly because of damage to one or both of their legs.
Example: He was aware that she was lame in one leg.

Definition: If you describe something such as furniture, clothing, or the way that a house is decorated as tasteless, you consider it to be vulgar and unattractive.
Example: ...a flat crammed with spectacularly tasteless objets d'art.

Definition: Erosion is the gradual destruction and removal of rock or soil in a particular area by rivers, the sea, or the weather.
Example: As their roots are strong and penetrating, they prevent erosion.

Definition: a marriage ceremony; wedding
Example: But she's more interested in inspecting her nails than discussing the details of their forthcoming nuptials.

Definition: Ballast is any substance that is used in ships or hot-air balloons to make them heavier and more stable. Ballast usually consists of water, sand, or iron.
Example: The weight of public opinion provides ballast in an atmosphere of social equality.

Definition: If there is a preponderance of one type of person or thing in a group, there is more of that type than of any other.
Example: ...a preponderance of bright, middle-class children in one group.

Definition: When a liquid trickles, or when you trickle it, it flows slowly in very small amounts.
Example: A tear trickled down the old man's cheek.

Definition: If something such as liquid or gas seeps somewhere, it flows slowly and in small amounts into a place where it should not go.
Example: Radioactive water had seeped into underground reservoirs.

Definition: Something that is damp is slightly wet.
Example: Her hair was still damp.

Definition: During a rainy day, season, or period it rains a lot.
Example: They walked along the promenade on a rainy night.

Definition: An orbit is the curved path in space that is followed by an object going round and round a planet, moon, or star.
Example: Mars and Earth have orbits which change with time.

Definition: If you twirl something or if it twirls, it turns around and around with a smooth, fairly fast movement.
Example: Bonnie twirled her empty glass in her fingers.

Definition: If you mutter, you speak very quietly so that you cannot easily be heard, often because you are complaining about something.
Example: 'God knows what's happening in that madman's mind,' she muttered.

Definition: If you mumble, you speak very quietly and not at all clearly with the result that the words are difficult to understand.
Example: Her grandmother mumbled in her sleep.

Definition: A spacious room or other place is large in size or area, so that you can move around freely in it.
Example: The house has a spacious kitchen and dining area.

Definition: swollen, esp as an indication of illness or injury
Example: The distended irises could hardly be distinguished from the holes of the pupils.

Definition: If you describe something as wide-ranging, you mean it deals with or affects a great variety of different things.
Example: ...a wide-ranging debate about the party's goals.

Definition: If you describe actions, events, or changes as far-reaching, you mean that they have a very great influence and affect a great number of things.
Example: The economy is in danger of collapse unless far-reaching reforms are implemented.

Definition: furious
Example: He wasn't much; but he was here, and her impotence to prevent his going infuriated her.

Definition: If you describe something as outrageous, you are emphasizing that it is unacceptable or very shocking.
Example: I must apologise for my outrageous behaviour.

Definition: If you say that something is fantastic, you are emphasizing that you think it is very good or that you like it a lot.
Example: I have a fantastic social life.

Definition: If one thing is a testament to another, it shows that the other thing exists or is true.
Example: Braka's house, just off Sloane Square, is a testament to his Gothic tastes.

Definition: An annexe is a building which is joined to or is next to a larger main building.
Example: ...setting up a museum in an annexe to the theatre.

Definition: A flex is an electric cable containing two or more wires that is connected to an electrical appliance.
Example: He slowly flexed his muscles and tried to stand.

Definition: Telegraph is a system of sending messages over long distances, either by means of electricity or by radio signals. Telegraph was used more often before the invention of telephones and computers.
Example: Churchill telegraphed an urgent message to Wavell.

Definition: Prudence is care and good sense that someone shows when making a decision or taking action.
Example: Western businessmen are showing remarkable prudence in investing in the region.

Definition: A sage is a person who is regarded as being very wise.
Example: ...ancient Chinese sages.

Definition: If it seems politic to do a particular thing, that seems to be the most sensible thing to do in the circumstances.
Example: Many towns often found it politic to change their allegiance.

Definition: If someone  drops out of college or a race, for example, they leave it without finishing what they started.
Example: He'd dropped out of high school at the age of 16.

Definition: If a region or group secedes from the country or larger group to which it belongs, it formally becomes a separate country or stops being a member of the larger group.
Example: Sectors of the Basque and Catalan populations would like to secede from Spain.

Definition: If you retract something that you have said or written, you say that you did not mean it.
Example:
Mr Smith hurriedly sought to retract the statement, but it had just been broadcast
on national radio.

Definition: To validate something such as a claim or statement means to prove or confirm that it is true or correct.
Example: This discovery seems to validate the claims of popular astrology.

Definition: Curiosity is a desire to know about something.
Example: Ryle accepted more out of curiosity than anything else.

Definition: Admiration is a feeling of great liking and respect for a person or thing.
Example: I have always had the greatest admiration for him.

Definition: a private conversation between two people
Example: to speak tte--tte

Definition: If something obsesses you or if you obsess about something, you keep thinking about it and find it difficult to think about anything else.
Example: I must admit that maps obsess me.

Definition: If someone harries you, they keep bothering you or trying to get something from you.
Example: He is increasingly active in harrying the government in late-night debates.

Definition: A swathe of land is a long strip of land.
Example: On May 1st the army took over another swathe of territory.

Definition: A novelist is a person who writes novels.
Example: ...a romantic novelist.

Definition:
If you hack something or hack at it, you cut it with strong, rough strokes using a sharp tool such as an axe or
knife.
Example: An armed gang barged onto the train and began hacking and shooting anyone in sight.

Definition: A columnist is a journalist who regularly writes a particular kind of article in a newspaper or magazine.
Example: Clarence Page is a columnist for the Chicago Tribune.

Definition: If you say that something is amiss, you mean there is something wrong.
Example: Their instincts warned them something was amiss.

Definition: A faulty piece of equipment has something wrong with it and is not working properly.
Example: The money will be used to repair faulty equipment.

Definition: A machine or device that is out of order is broken and does not work.
Example: Their phone's out of order.

Definition:
If there is an inverse relationship between two things, one of them becomes larger as the other becomes
smaller.
Example: The tension grew in inverse proportion to the distance from their final destination.

Definition: If someone mistreats a person or an animal, they treat them badly, especially by making them suffer physically.
Example: ...a lad who mistreats a horse.

Definition: A courtyard is an open area of ground which is surrounded by buildings or walls.
Example: They walked through the arch and into the cobbled courtyard.

Definition: If an animal such as a wolf or a dog howls, it makes a long, loud, crying sound.
Example: Somewhere in the streets beyond a dog suddenly howled, baying at the moon.

Definition: If you say that something only goes so far or can only go so far, you mean that its extent, effect, or influence is limited.
Example: Their loyalty only went so far.

Definition: If you relinquish something such as power or control, you give it up.
Example: He does not intend to relinquish power.

Definition: If you resign from a job or position, you formally announce that you are leaving it.
Example: A hospital administrator has resigned over claims he lied to get the job.

Definition: You can refer to a person's children or to an animal's young as their offspring.
Example: Eleanor was now less anxious about her offspring than she had once been.

Definition: Litter is rubbish that is left lying around outside.
Example: If you see litter in the corridor, pick it up.

Definition: Adolescence is the period of your life in which you develop from being a child into being an adult.
Example: Some people become very self-conscious in adolescence.

Definition: Young people, especially children, are sometimes referred to as youngsters.
Example: Other youngsters are not so lucky.

Definition: A filament is a very thin piece or thread of something, for example the piece of wire inside a light bulb.
Example: This was going to prove the hardest bit of all - breaking the envelope without damaging the filament inside.

Definition: Thread or a thread is a long very thin piece of a material such as cotton, nylon, or silk, especially one that is used in sewing.
Example: This time I'll do it properly with a needle and thread.

Definition: When a vehicle or driver pulls up, the vehicle slows down and stops.
Example: The cab pulled up and the driver jumped out.

Definition: If you slam a door or window or if it slams, it shuts noisily and with great force.
Example: She slammed the door and locked it behind her.

Definition: If you describe someone as worldly-wise, you mean they are experienced and know about the practical or social aspects of life, and are not easily shocked or impressed.
Example: She sighed and put on one of her worldly-wise expressions - the experienced woman advising the innocent.

Definition: Something that is shaped like a particular object or in a particular way has the shape of that object or a shape of that type.
Example: A new perfume from Russia came in a bottle shaped like a tank.

Definition: Built-in devices or features are included in something as a part of it, rather than being separate.
Example: ...a built-in double oven.

Definition: If something is touching, it causes feelings of sadness or sympathy.
Example: This is a touching tale of adolescent friendship.

Definition: To export products or raw materials means to sell them to another country.
Example: The nation also exports rice.

Definition: the act of deserting or abandoning or the state of being deserted or abandoned
Example: It seemed like there had been a sudden mass desertion.

Definition: To dampen something such as someone's enthusiasm or excitement means to make it less lively or intense.
Example: Nothing seems to dampen his perpetual enthusiasm.

Definition: If something muffles a sound, it makes it quieter and more difficult to hear.
Example: Blake held his handkerchief over the mouthpiece to muffle his voice.

Definition: To mitigate something means to make it less unpleasant, serious, or painful.
Example: ...ways of mitigating the effects of an explosion.

Definition: Inhibitions are feelings of fear or embarrassment that make it difficult for you to behave naturally.
Example: The whole point about dancing is to stop thinking and lose all your inhibitions.

Definition: If someone is in hiding, they have secretly gone somewhere where they cannot be seen or found.
Example: Gray is thought to be in hiding near the France/Italy border.

Definition: Censorship is the censoring of books, plays, films, or reports, especially by government officials, because they are considered immoral or secret in some way.
Example: The government today announced that press censorship was being lifted.

Definition: A crackdown is strong official action that is taken to punish people who break laws.
Example: ...anti-government unrest that ended with the violent army crackdown.

Definition: If someone stifles something you consider to be a good thing, they prevent it from continuing.
Example: Regulations on children stifled creativity.

Definition: Concealment is the state of being hidden or the act of hiding something.
Example: The criminals vainly sought concealment from the searchlight.

Definition: When a solid substance melts or when you melt it, it changes to a liquid, usually because it has been heated.
Example: The snow had melted, but the lake was still frozen solid.

Definition: Damn, damn it, and dammit are used by some people to express anger or impatience.
Example: Don't be flippant, damn it! This is serious.

Definition: If you scold someone, you speak angrily to them because they have done something wrong.
Example: If he finds out, he'll scold me.

Definition: the act of imposing
Example: Normally that should be emphasised by the imposition of consecutive sentences.

Definition: When you knead dough or other food, you press and squeeze it with your hands so that it becomes smooth and ready to cook.
Example: Lightly knead the mixture on a floured surface.

Definition: If something is misapplied, it is used for a purpose for which it is not intended or not suitable.
Example: Many lines from Shakespeare's plays are misquoted and misapplied.

Definition: If something disintegrates, it becomes seriously weakened, and is divided or destroyed.
Example: During October 1918 the Austro-Hungarian Empire began to disintegrate.

Definition: A place or building that is derelict is empty and in a bad state of repair because it has not been used or lived in for a long time.
Example: The body was found dumped in a derelict warehouse.

Definition: The hulk of something is the large, ruined remains of it.
Example: ...the ruined hulk of the old church tower.

Definition: To augment something means to make it larger, stronger, or more effective by adding something to it.
Example: While searching for a way to augment the family income, she began making dolls.

Definition: Your appendix is a small closed tube inside your body which is attached to your digestive system.
Example: ...a burst appendix.

Definition: A book or film which is a sequel to an earlier one continues the story of the earlier one.
Example: She is currently writing a sequel to her first novel.

Definition: If you are on time, you are not late.
Example: Don't worry, she'll be on time.

Definition: If someone or something is on track, they are acting or progressing in a way that is likely to result in success.
Example: It may take some time to get the economy back on track.

Definition: A substance that is lethal can kill people or animals.
Example: ...a lethal dose of sleeping pills.

Definition: If you describe someone's policy or attitude as hardline, you mean that it is strict or extreme, and they refuse to change it.
Example: The United States has taken a lot of criticism for its hard-line stance.

Definition: A clipping is an article, picture, or advertisement that has been cut from a newspaper or magazine.
Example: ...bulletin boards crowded with newspaper clippings.

Definition: An excerpt is a short piece of writing or music which is taken from a larger piece.
Example: ...an excerpt from Tchaikovsky's Nutcracker.

Definition: If someone or something is  tied up, they are busy or being used, with the result that they are not available for anything else.
Example: He's tied up with his new book. He's working hard, you know.

Definition: A strenuous activity or action involves a lot of energy or effort.
Example: Avoid strenuous exercise in the evening.

Definition: Warring is used to describe groups of people who are involved in a conflict or quarrel with each other.
Example: The warring factions have not yet turned in all their heavy weapons.

Definition: If you say that an activity or relationship is one-sided, you think that one of the people or groups involved does much more than the other or is much stronger than the other.
Example: The negotiating was completely one-sided.

Definition: A guerrilla is someone who fights as part of an unofficial army, usually against an official army or police force.
Example: The guerrillas threatened to kill their hostages.

Definition: If events or actions occur at irregular intervals, the periods of time between them are of different lengths.
Example: Cars passed at irregular intervals.

Definition: A combatant is a person, group, or country that takes part in the fighting in a war.
Example:
I have never suggested that U.N. forces could physically separate the combatants
in the region.

Definition: If you say that someone overemphasizes something, you mean that they give it more importance than it deserves or than you consider appropriate.
Example: Sometimes diversity and richness of detail are overemphasized.

Definition: You use elaborate to describe something that is very complex because it has a lot of different parts.
Example: ...an elaborate research project.

Definition: If you exaggerate, you indicate that something is, for example, worse or more important than it really is.
Example: He thinks I'm exaggerating.

Definition: Heartfelt is used to describe a deep or sincere feeling or wish.
Example: My heartfelt sympathy goes out to all the relatives.

Definition: You can use seasoned to describe a person who has a lot of experience of something. For example, a seasoned traveller is a person who has travelled a lot.
Example: The author is a seasoned academic.

Definition: If you say that one thing is rooted in another, you mean that it is strongly influenced by it or has developed from it.
Example: The crisis is rooted in deep rivalries between the two groups.

Definition: A chronic illness or disability lasts for a very long time. Compare acute.
Example: ...chronic back pain.

Definition: If you persevere with something, you keep trying to do it and do not give up, even though it is difficult.
Example: ...his ability to persevere despite obstacles and setbacks.

Definition: The accompaniment to a song or tune is the music that is played at the same time as it and forms a background to it.
Example: He sang 'My Funny Valentine' to a piano accompaniment.

Definition: Revenge involves hurting or punishing someone who has hurt or harmed you.
Example: The prisoners took revenge on their captors, eventually overcoming them.

Definition: Repayments are amounts of money which you pay at regular intervals to a person or organization in order to repay a debt.
Example: They were unable to meet their mortgage repayments.

Definition: If you berate someone, you speak to them angrily about something they have done wrong.
Example: Marion berated Joe for the noise he made.

Definition: A navigable river is wide and deep enough for a boat to travel along safely.
Example: ...the navigable portion of the Nile.

Definition: Adequacy is the quality of being good enough or great enough in amount to be acceptable.
Example:
Several studies point to a real cause for concern over the adequacy of the diet eaten
by British children.

Definition: fairly; somewhat
Example: Maybe she'll go to college one day; she has always been quick to pick things up, doing passably well in school without half trying.

Definition: Morality is the belief that some behaviour is right and acceptable and that other behaviour is wrong.
Example: ...standards of morality and justice in society.

Definition: If someone is given an accolade, something is done or said about them which shows how much people admire them.
Example: The Nobel prize has become the ultimate accolade in the sciences.

Definition: A proclamation is a public announcement about something important, often about something of national importance.
Example: ...a proclamation of independence.

Definition: A deposition is a formal written statement, made for example by a witness to a crime, which can be used in a court of law if the witness cannot be present.
Example: The jury heard 200 pages of depositions.

Definition: An undeveloped country or region does not have modern industries and usually has a low standard of living.
Example: The big losers will be the undeveloped countries.

Definition: An imperfection in someone or something is a fault, weakness, or undesirable feature that they have.
Example: He concedes that there are imperfections in the system.

Definition: Childish means relating to or typical of a child.
Example: ...childish enthusiasm.

Definition: Infantile behaviour or illnesses are typical of very young children.
Example: ...infantile aggression.

Definition: If you describe someone or something as puerile, you mean that they are silly and childish.
Example: Concert organisers branded the group's actions as puerile.

Definition: Someone who is youthful behaves as if they are young or younger than they really are.
Example: I'm a very youthful 50.

Definition: If you expedite something, you cause it to be done more quickly.
Example: The committee expedited the settling of all compensation claims.

Definition: When something speeds up or when you speed it up, it moves or travels faster.
Example: You notice that your breathing has speeded up a bit.

Definition: If something quickens or if you quicken it, it becomes faster or moves at a greater speed.
Example: Ainslie's pulse quickened in alarm.

Definition: If you describe someone as an extremist, you disapprove of them because they try to bring about political change by using violent or extreme methods.
Example:
The country needs a strong intelligence service to counter espionage and foreign
extremists.

Definition: Something that is subversive is intended to weaken or destroy a political system or government.
Example: This courageous and subversive movie has attracted widespread critical support.

Definition: Insurgents are people who are fighting against the government or army of their own country.
Example:
By early yesterday, the insurgents had taken control of the country's main military
air base.

Definition: Something that is innovative is new and original.
Example: ...products which are more innovative than those of their competitors.

Definition: Someone who is courageous shows courage.
Example: It was a very frightening experience and they were very courageous.

Definition: If you describe a person or their actions as heroic, you admire them because they show extreme bravery.
Example: He had acted heroically during the liner's evacuation.

Definition: A disturbed person is very upset emotionally, and often needs special care or treatment.
Example: ...working with severely emotionally disturbed children.

Definition: If you tip something over or if it tips over, it falls over or turns over.
Example: He tipped the table over in front of him.

Definition: If you capsize a boat or if it capsizes, it turns upside down in the water.
Example: The sea got very rough and the boat capsized.

Definition: If you are uneasy, you feel anxious, afraid, or embarrassed, because you think that something is wrong or that there is danger.
Example: He said nothing but gave me a sly grin that made me feel terribly uneasy.

Definition: Something that is problematic involves problems and difficulties.
Example: Some places are more problematic than others for solo travellers.

Definition: If a situation or experience is stressful, it causes the person involved to feel stress.
Example: I think I've got one of the most stressful jobs there is.

Definition: Puberty is the stage in someone's life when their body starts to become physically mature.
Example: Margaret had reached the age of puberty.

Definition: A grown man or woman is one who is fully developed and mature, both physically and mentally.
Example: I've never seen a group of grown men laugh so much.

Definition: You use surrogate to describe a person or thing that is given a particular role because the person or thing that should have the role is not available.
Example: Martin had become Howard Cosell's surrogate son.

Definition: Reconnaissance is the activity of obtaining military information about a place by sending soldiers or planes there, or by the use of satellites.
Example: The helicopter was returning from a reconnaissance mission.

Definition: If you describe a person, organization, or their behaviour as unfriendly, you mean that they behave towards you in an unkind or rather hostile way.
Example: It is not fair for him to be permanently unfriendly to someone who has hurt him.

Definition: If a person is antagonistic to someone or something, they show hatred or dislike towards them.
Example: Nearly all the women I interviewed were aggressively antagonistic to the idea.

Definition: If someone is unkind, they behave in an unpleasant, unfriendly, or slightly cruel way. You can also describe someone's words or actions as unkind.
Example: All last summer he'd been unkind to her.

Definition: An inhospitable place is unpleasant to live in.
Example: ...the Earth's most inhospitable regions.

Definition: Adverse decisions, conditions, or effects are unfavourable to you.
Example:
The police said Mr Hadfield's decision would have no adverse effect on the progress
of the investigation.

Definition: If you describe a person or place as uncongenial, you mean that they are unfriendly and unpleasant.
Example: He continued to find the Simpsons uncongenial bores.

Definition: A person who is combative is aggressive and eager to fight or argue.
Example: He conducted the meeting in his usual combative style, refusing to admit any mistakes.

Definition: Animosity is a strong feeling of dislike and anger. Animosities are feelings of this kind.
Example: There's a long history of animosity between the two nations.

Definition: If you describe someone as dynamic, you approve of them because they are full of energy or full of new and exciting ideas.
Example: He seemed a dynamic and energetic leader.

Definition: Something that is potent is very effective and powerful.
Example: Their most potent weapon was the Exocet missile.

Definition: Incontrovertible evidence or facts are absolutely certain and cannot be shown to be wrong.
Example: We have incontrovertible evidence of what took place.

Definition: Agriculture is farming and the methods that are used to raise and look after crops and animals.
Example: Ukraine is strong both in industry and agriculture.

Definition: the planting, tending, improving, or harvesting of crops or plants
Example: The only crop under cultivation was barley.

Definition: Husbandry is farming animals, especially when it is done carefully and well.
Example: ...soil-conserving methods of good husbandry.

Definition: Bucolic means relating to the countryside.
Example: ...the bucolic surroundings of Chantilly.

Definition: If you refer to someone as a yokel, you think they are uneducated and stupid because they come from the countryside.
Example: a local yokel

Definition: A peasant is a poor person of low social status who works on the land; used of people who live in countries where farming is still a common way of life.
Example: ...the peasants in the Peruvian highlands.

Definition: If you refer to someone as a bumpkin, you think they are uneducated and stupid because they come from the countryside.
Example: ...unsophisticated country bumpkins.

Definition: provided at the same time as something else as an extra or addition; supplementary
Example: Mildred Sauvage-Brown was also in the council chamber, accompanying Sarah Ellis.

Definition: If things radiate out from a place, they form a pattern that is like lines drawn from the centre of a circle to various points on its edge.
Example: ...the various walks which radiate from the Heritage Centre.

Definition: An airplane is a vehicle with wings and one or more engines that enable it to fly through the air.
Example: Who first understood what was required to make an airplane fly?

Definition: To enliven events, situations, or people means to make them more lively or cheerful.
Example: I love the way a good flirtation can enliven the most mundane situation.

Definition: Someone who is animated or who is having an animated conversation is lively and is showing their feelings.
Example: She was seen in animated conversation with the singer.

Definition: If you say that someone or something has vitality, you mean that they have great energy and liveliness.
Example: Without continued learning, graduates will lose their intellectual vitality.

Definition: You can refer to food that has not been eaten after a meal as leftovers.
Example: Refrigerate any leftovers.

Definition: If you cooperate with someone, you work with them or help them for a particular purpose. You can also say that two people cooperate.
Example:
The U.N. had been cooperating with the State Department on a plan to find countries
willing to take the refugees.

Definition: Someone who is unsociable does not like talking to other people and tries to avoid meeting them.
Example: The experience has made me reclusive and unsociable.

Definition: A reclusive person or animal lives alone and deliberately avoids the company of others.
Example: She had been living a reclusive life since her marriage broke up.

Definition: A hermit is a person who lives alone, away from people and society.
Example: We're all like hermit crabs : little naked creatures that have found a suitable shell and decided to live inside it until it stops fitting.

Definition: A recluse is a person who lives alone and deliberately avoids other people.
Example: His widow became a virtual recluse for the remainder of her life.

Definition: If something is vacant, it is not being used by anyone.
Example: Half way down the coach was a vacant seat.

Definition: If you do something single-handed, you do it on your own, without help from anyone else.
Example: I brought up my seven children single-handed.

Definition: When people or things are left unattended, they are not being watched or looked after.
Example: Never leave young children unattended near any pool or water tank.

Definition: If something is unguarded, nobody is protecting it or looking after it.
Example: I should not leave my briefcase and camera bag unguarded.

Definition: If you intersperse one group of things with another or among another, you put or include the second things between or among the first things.
Example: Originally the intention was to intersperse the historical scenes with modern ones.

Definition: If there is an interchange of ideas or information among a group of people, each person talks about his or her ideas or gives information to the others.
Example: What made the meeting exciting was the interchange of ideas from different disciplines.

Definition: Rotation is circular movement. A rotation is the movement of something through one complete circle.
Example: ...the daily rotation of the Earth upon its axis.

Definition: happening in succession
Example: He knew the arguments which would be deployed, the alternating cajolery and menace.

Definition: Someone or something that is abnormal is unusual, especially in a way that is worrying.
Example: ...abnormal heart rhythms and high anxiety levels.

Definition: If someone or something is conspicuous, people can see or notice them very easily.
Example: He spent his money in a conspicuous way on fast cars and luxury holidays.

Definition: An interpreter is a person whose job is to translate what someone is saying into another language.
Example: Aristide spoke to the press through an interpreter.

Definition: Greek means belonging or relating to Greece, or to its people, language, or culture.
Example: ...a beautiful beach on a beautiful Greek island.

Definition: When people or animals rampage through a place, they rush about there in a wild or violent way, causing damage or destruction.
Example:
Hundreds of youths rampaged through the town, shop windows were smashed and cars
overturned.

Definition: Indignation is the feeling of shock and anger which you have when you think that something is unjust or unfair.
Example:
She was filled with indignation at the conditions under which miners were forced
to work.

Definition: If something or someone infuriates you, they make you extremely angry.
Example: Jimmy's presence had infuriated Hugh.

Definition: If someone rouses you when you are sleeping or if you rouse, you wake up.
Example: Hilton roused him at eight-thirty by rapping on the door.

Definition: If something predisposes you to think or behave in a particular way, it makes it likely that you will think or behave in that way.
Example:
They take pains to hire people whose personalities predispose them to serve customers
well.

Definition: If a part of your body is swollen, it is larger and rounder than normal, usually as a result of injury or illness.
Example: My eyes were so swollen I could hardly see.

Definition: the state or quality of being unpleasant
Example: Quite enough unpleasantness is already caused on public transport by people using electronic equipment in such a way.

Definition: If you do something in spite of yourself, you do it although you did not really intend to or expect to.
Example: The blunt comment made Richard laugh in spite of himself.

Definition: You can use venom to refer to someone's feelings of great bitterness and anger towards someone.
Example: He reserved particular venom for critics of his foreign policy.

Definition: Obscenity is behaviour, art, or language that is sexual and offends or shocks people.
Example: He insisted these photographs were not art but obscenity.

Definition: Pornography refers to books, magazines, and films that are designed to cause sexual excitement by showing or describing sexual acts.
Example: A nationwide campaign against pornography began in the summer.

Definition: If you talk about the indecency of something or someone, you are indicating that you find them morally or sexually offensive.
Example: ...the indecency of their language.

Definition: If something is frightening, it makes you feel afraid, anxious, or nervous.
Example: It was a very frightening experience and they were very courageous.

Definition: Something that is dismal is bad in a sad or depressing way.
Example: My prospects of returning to a suitable job are dismal.

Definition: If a situation is bleak, it is bad, and seems unlikely to improve.
Example: The immediate outlook remains bleak.

Definition: If you describe a violent action as mindless, you mean that it is done without thought and will achieve nothing.
Example: ...a plot that mixes blackmail, extortion and mindless violence.

Definition: An instinctive feeling, idea, or action is one that you have or do without thinking or reasoning.
Example: It's an absolutely instinctive reactionif a child falls you pick it up.

Definition: A demon is an evil spirit.
Example: ...a woman possessed by demons.

Definition: If you describe someone as a fiend, you mean that they are extremely wicked or cruel.
Example: We must catch the fiend who did this.

Definition: A brutal act or person is cruel and violent.
Example: He was the victim of a very brutal murder.

Definition: In former times, barbarians were people from other countries who were thought to be uncivilized and violent.
Example: The Roman Empire was overrun by Nordic barbarians.

Definition: If you are mauled by an animal, you are violently attacked by it and badly injured.
Example: He had been mauled by a bear.

Definition: A fete is an event that is usually held outdoors and includes competitions, entertainments, and the selling of used and home-made goods.
Example:
Anouska Hempel, the British dress designer, was feted in New York this week at a
spectacular dinner.

Definition: A memorial is a structure built in order to remind people of a famous person or event.
Example: Building a memorial to Columbus has been his lifelong dream.

Definition:
If you describe a person or thing as the forerunner of someone or something similar, you mean they existed before them and either influenced
their development or were a sign of what was going to happen.
Example: ...a machine which, in some respects, was the forerunner of the modern helicopter.

Definition: If people proclaim something, they formally make it known to the public.
Example: He has sent me to proclaim liberty to the captives.

Definition: An antidote is a chemical substance that stops or controls the effect of a poison.
Example: When he returned, he noticed their sickness and prepared an antidote.

Definition: Armaments are weapons and military equipment belonging to an army or country.
Example: ...global efforts to reduce nuclear and other armaments.

Definition: the armed services (esp the army)
Example: He also mentioned how good his relations with the military are.

Definition: The negation of something is its complete opposite or something which destroys it or makes it lose its effect.
Example:
Unintelligible legislation is the negation of the rule of law and of parliamentary
democracy.

Definition: If you make a prediction about something, you say what you think will happen.
Example:
He was unwilling to make a prediction about which books would sell in the coming
year.

Definition: A projection is an estimate of a future amount.
Example: ...the company's projection of 11 million visitors for the first year.

Definition: A prognosis is an estimate of the future of someone or something, especially about whether a patient will recover from an illness.
Example: If the cancer is caught early, the prognosis is excellent.

Definition: A carriage is an old-fashioned vehicle, usually for a small number of passengers, which is pulled by horses.
Example: The President-elect followed in an open carriage drawn by six beautiful gray horses.

Definition: A locker is a small metal or wooden cupboard with a lock, where you can put your personal possessions, for example in a school, place of work, or sports club.
Example: They told me how the locker room became a hospital as they were treating the injured fans.

Definition: according to what is, was, or may be supposed
Example: But at the time of the murder, she was supposedly in a cab trying to find an open florist shop.

Definition: If you say that something is reportedly true, you mean that someone has said that it is true, but you have no direct evidence of it.
Example: More than two hundred people have reportedly been killed in the past week's fighting.

Definition: Something that is unadorned is plain, rather than having decoration on it.
Example: The room is typically simple and unadorned, with white walls and a tiled floor.

Definition: A patent is an official right to be the only person or company allowed to make or sell a new product for a certain period of time.
Example: P&G applied for a patent on its cookies.

Definition: If something is evident, you notice it easily and clearly.
Example: His footprints were clearly evident in the heavy dust.

Definition: A plateau is a large area of high and fairly flat land.
Example: A broad valley opened up leading to a high, flat plateau of cultivated land.

Definition: Grassland is land covered with wild grass.
Example: ...areas of open grassland.

Definition: to all appearances
Example: Anna watched them, shielding her eyes from the sun's glare on the surface of the water.

Definition: Magic is the power to use supernatural forces to make impossible things happen, such as making people disappear or controlling events in nature.
Example: They believe in magic.

Definition: If you say that something has enchantment, you mean that it makes you feel great delight or pleasure. Your enchantment with something is the fact of your feeling great delight and pleasure because of it.
Example: The wilderness campsite had its own peculiar enchantment.

Definition: Sorcery is magic performed by using the power of evil spirits.
Example: I almost forgot the sorcery and spells.

Definition: to accept (an unpleasant fact, reality, etc)
Example: When people begin to accept and face up to what has happened, they are enabled to handle it and grow through the experience.

Definition: An apt remark, description, or choice is especially suitable.
Example: The words of this report are as apt today as in 1929.

Definition: A kingdom is a country or region that is ruled by a king or queen.
Example: The kingdom's power declined.

Definition: An empire is a number of individual nations that are all controlled by the government or ruler of one particular country.
Example: ...the Roman Empire.

Definition: If you say that someone is wrangling with someone over a question or issue, you mean that they have been arguing angrily for quite a long time about it.
Example: The two sides have spent most of their time wrangling over procedural problems.

Definition: When something rattles or when you rattle it, it makes short sharp knocking sounds because it is being shaken or it keeps hitting against something hard.
Example: She slams the kitchen door so hard I hear dishes rattle.

Definition: A creek is a narrow place where the sea comes a long way into the land.
Example: Follow Austin Creek for a few miles.

Definition: A cove is a part of a coast where the land curves inwards so that the sea is partly enclosed.
Example: ...a hillside overlooking Fairview Cove.

Definition: A vent is a hole in something through which air can come in and smoke, gas, or smells can go out.
Example: Quite a lot of steam escaped from the vent at the front of the machine.

Definition: If someone refers to the hoi polloi, they are referring in a humorous or rather rude way to ordinary people, in contrast to rich, well-educated, or upper-class people.
Example: Monstrously inflated costs are designed to keep the hoi polloi at bay.

Definition: If you refer to people as scum, you are expressing your feelings of dislike and disgust for them.
Example: ...scum marks around the bath.

Definition: If an army or an armed force overruns a place, area, or country, it succeeds in occupying it very quickly.
Example: A group of rebels overran the port area and most of the northern suburbs.

Definition: If you coordinate an activity, you organize the various people and things involved in it.
Example:
Government officials visited the earthquake zone on Thursday morning to coordinate
the relief effort.

Definition: An outsider is someone who does not belong to a particular group or organization.
Example: The most likely outcome may be to subcontract much of the work to an outsider.

Definition: the action or feeling of one who rejoices
Example: Harley Rivera's arrest and confession, even if the latter was suspect, ought to be grounds for rejoicing.

Definition: If you invoke a law, you state that you are taking a particular action because that law allows or tells you to.
Example: The judge invoked an international law that protects refugees.

Definition: Latent is used to describe something which is hidden and not obvious at the moment, but which may develop further in the future.
Example: Advertisements attempt to project a latent meaning behind an overt message.

Definition: Someone or something that is inactive is not doing anything or is not working.
Example: He certainly was not politically inactive.

Definition: Someone or something that is quiescent is quiet and inactive.
Example: ...a society which was politically quiescent and above all deferential.

Definition: When you designate someone or something as a particular thing, you formally give them that description or name.
Example: ...a man interviewed in one of our studies whom we shall designate as E.

Definition: If one thing presupposes another, the first thing cannot be true or exist unless the second thing is true or exists.
Example: All your arguments presuppose that he's a rational, intelligent man.

Definition: If someone feigns a particular feeling, attitude, or physical condition, they try to make other people think that they have it or are experiencing it, although this is not true.
Example: One morning, I didn't want to go to school, and decided to feign illness.

Definition: If you imitate someone, you copy what they do or produce.
Example: ...a genuine German musical which does not try to imitate the American model.

Definition: If you describe a man's behaviour as gentlemanly, you approve of him because he has good manners.
Example: He was respected by all who knew him for his kind and gentlemanly consideration.

Definition: To pollute water, air, or land means to make it dirty and dangerous to live in or to use, especially with poisonous chemicals or sewage.
Example: Heavy industry pollutes our rivers with noxious chemicals.

Definition: A toxin is any poisonous substance produced by bacteria, animals, or plants.
Example: Experts have linked this condition to a build-up of toxins in the body.

Definition: An incantation is a series of words that a person says or sings as a magic spell.
Example: ...strange prayers and incantations.

Definition: Exorcism is the removing of evil spirits from a person or place by the use of prayer.
Example: The exorcism was broadcast on television.

Definition: Something that is enticing is extremely attractive and makes you want to get it or to become involved with it.
Example: A prospective premium of about 30 per cent on their initial investment is enticing.

Definition: Someone or something that is alluring is very attractive.
Example:
Why are the contents of the next person's shopping trolley always more alluring than
one's own?

Definition: the condition or quality of being informal
Example: It is highly questionable whether the code strikes the right balance between informality and formality.

Definition: warmth of feeling
Example: The matron almost smiled, the first glimmer of cordiality that Amy had glimpsed in her.

Definition: the quality or condition of being available
Example: Or perhaps it was simply the attraction of availability, of proximity.

Definition: An uninhabited place is one where nobody lives.
Example: ...an uninhabited island in the North Pacific.

Definition: If someone or something discourages you, they cause you to lose your enthusiasm about your actions.
Example: It may be difficult to do at first. Don't let this discourage you.

Definition: If you are disappointed, you are rather sad because something has not happened or because something is not as good as you had hoped.
Example: Castle-hunters won't be disappointed with the Isle of Man.

Definition: having had one's confidence and determination reduced
Example: Some of you are hurting, discouraged, angry in your marriages.

Definition: If you are discontented, you are not satisfied with your situation.
Example: The government tried to appease discontented workers.

Definition: Annoyance is the feeling that you get when someone makes you feel fairly angry or impatient.
Example: To her annoyance the stranger did not go away.

Definition: Irritation is a feeling of annoyance, especially when something is happening that you cannot easily stop or control.
Example: For the first time Leonard felt irritation at her methods.

Definition: If a person or animal darts somewhere, they move there suddenly and quickly.
Example: Ingrid darted across the deserted street.

Definition: If you sidestep a problem, you avoid discussing it or dealing with it.
Example: Rarely, if ever, does he sidestep a question.

Definition: If you parry a question or argument, you cleverly avoid answering it or dealing with it.
Example: In an awkward press conference, Mr King parried questions on the allegations.

Definition: If someone circumvents a rule or restriction, they avoid having to obey the rule or restriction, in a clever and perhaps dishonest way.
Example: Military planners tried to circumvent the treaty.

Definition: A souvenir is something which you buy or keep to remind you of a holiday, place, or event.
Example: ...a souvenir of the summer of 1992.

Definition: valuables seized by violence, esp in war
Example: He enjoyed the spoils of his apparent success.

Definition: If you refer to something or someone as a relic of an earlier period, you mean that they belonged to that period but have survived into the present.
Example: The tower is a relic of grim days when big houses had to be fortified against invaders.

Definition: A memento is an object which you keep because it reminds you of a person or a special occasion.
Example: More anglers are taking cameras when they go fishing to provide a memento of catches.

Definition: A medal is a small metal disc which is given as an award for bravery or as a prize in a sporting event.
Example: We also make medals and awards.

Definition: Reparations are sums of money that are paid after a war by the defeated country for the damage and injuries it caused in other countries.
Example: Israel accepted billions of dollars in war reparations.

Definition: If you are given something, usually money, in recompense, you are given it as a reward or because you have suffered.
Example: He demands no financial recompense for his troubles.

Definition: recompense or compensation given or gained for some injury, insult, etc
Example: to make amends for rudeness

Definition: If you say that something such as behaviour or a situation is disgraceful, you disapprove of it strongly, and feel that the person or people responsible should be ashamed of it.
Example: It's disgraceful that they have detained him for so long.

Definition: Something that is disturbing makes you feel worried or upset.
Example: There was something about him she found disturbing.

Definition: If you cancel something that has been arranged, you stop it from happening. If you cancel an order for goods or services, you tell the person or organization supplying them that you no longer wish to receive them.
Example: She cancelled her visit to Japan.

Definition: If you transpose something from one place or situation to another, you move it there.
Example: The director transposes the action from 16th Century France to post-Civil War America.

Definition: If you describe a person or their remarks or thoughts as perceptive, you think that they are good at noticing or realizing things, especially things that are not obvious.
Example: He was one of the most perceptive U.S. political commentators.

Definition: Something that is flawed has a mark, fault, or mistake in it.
Example: ...the unique beauty of a flawed object.

Definition: If you describe a situation as shaky, you mean that it is weak or unstable, and seems unlikely to last long or be successful.
Example: A shaky ceasefire is holding after three days of fighting between rival groups.

Definition: If a building, machine, activity, or area is unsafe, it is dangerous.
Example: Critics claim the trucks are unsafe.

Definition: Something that is disadvantageous to you puts you in a worse position than other people.
Example:
One proposed change may be advantageous for parents and disadvantageous for couples
without children, or vice versa.

Definition: Conditions that are inimical to something make it difficult for that thing to exist or do well.
Example: ...a false morality that is inimical to human happiness.

Definition: A disastrous event has extremely bad consequences and effects.
Example: ...the recent, disastrous earthquake.

Definition: If you describe an event or situation as calamitous, you mean it is very unfortunate or serious.
Example: ...the calamitous state of the country.

Definition: If you describe something as inopportune or if you say that it happens at an inopportune time, you mean that it happens at an unfortunate or unsuitable time, and causes trouble or embarrassment because of this.
Example: The dismissals came at an inopportune time.

Definition: You describe something as regrettable when you think that it is bad and that it should not happen or have happened.
Example: ...an investigation into what the army described as a regrettable incident.

Definition: If you describe something as lamentable, you mean that it is very unfortunate or disappointing.
Example: This lamentable state of affairs lasted until 1947.

Definition: Something that is inappropriate is not useful or suitable for a particular situation or purpose.
Example: The industry is inappropriate to the region's present and future needs.

Definition: If you refer to the mediocrity of something, you mean that it is of average quality but you think it should be better.
Example: ...the mediocrity of most contemporary literature.

Definition: a subordinating or being subordinated
Example: `It could only be insubordinate if I was in a position of subordination, and I'm not.

Definition: Servitude is the condition of being enslaved or of being completely under the control of someone else.
Example: ...a life of servitude.

Definition: If you say that something is ineffective, you mean that it has no effect on a process or situation.
Example: Economic reform will continue to be painful and ineffective.

Definition: If you say that someone is inept, you are criticizing them because they do something with a complete lack of skill.
Example: He was inept and lacked the intelligence to govern.

Definition: If you say that someone or something is vile, you mean that they are very unpleasant.
Example: The weather was consistently vile.

Definition: A mischievous person likes to have fun by playing harmless tricks on people or doing things they are not supposed to do.
Example: She rocks back and forth on her chair like a mischievous child.

Definition: A playful gesture or person is friendly or humorous.
Example: ...a playful kiss on the tip of his nose.

Definition: If you describe someone or their behaviour as impish, you mean that they are rather disrespectful or naughty in a playful way.
Example: Gillespie is well known for his impish sense of humour.

Definition: A devilish idea or action is cruel or unpleasant.
Example: ...the devilish destructiveness of modern weapons.

Definition: A vice is a habit which is regarded as a weakness in someone's character, but not usually as a serious fault.
Example:
His only vice is to get drunk on champagne after concluding a successful piece of
business.

Definition: Something that depraves someone makes them morally bad or evil.
Example: ...material likely to deprave or corrupt those who see it.

Definition: If you pervert something such as a process or society, you interfere with it so that it is not as good as it used to be or as it should be.
Example: Any reform will destroy and pervert our constitution.

Definition: To subvert something means to destroy its power and influence.
Example: ...an alleged plot to subvert the state.

Definition: To debase something means to reduce its value or quality.
Example: Politicians have debased the meaning of the word 'freedom'.

Definition: If you are disobedient, you deliberately do not do what someone in authority tells you to do, or what a rule or law says that you should do.
Example: Her tone was that of a parent to a disobedient child.

Definition: Improper activities are illegal or dishonest.
Example: 25 officers were investigated following allegations of improper conduct.

Definition: If you think someone behaves in an unacceptable way and does not do what they are told, you can say they are rebellious.
Example: ...a rebellious teenager.

Definition: Something that is erratic does not follow a regular pattern, but happens at unexpected times or moves along in an irregular way.
Example: Argentina's erratic inflation rate threatens to upset the plans.

Definition: If you describe people, especially children, as unruly, you mean that they behave badly and are difficult to control.
Example: It's not good enough just to blame the unruly children.

Definition: If you describe actions or attitudes as wilful, you are critical of them because they are done or expressed deliberately, especially with the intention of causing someone harm.
Example: Wilful neglect of our manufacturing industry has caused this problem.

Definition: If you describe something as unmanageable, you mean that it is difficult to use, deal with, or control.
Example: People were visiting the house every day, sometimes in unmanageable numbers.

Definition: If you describe something as indecent, you mean that it is shocking and offensive, usually because it relates to sex or nakedness.
Example: He accused Mrs Moore of making an indecent suggestion.

Definition: If you describe someone as foul-mouthed, you disapprove of them because they use offensive words or say very rude things.
Example: He's a coarse, foul-mouthed bully.

Definition: If one thing entangles itself with another, the two things become caught together very tightly.
Example: The blade of the oar had entangled itself with something in the water.

Definition: When an animal snarls, it makes a fierce, rough sound in its throat while showing its teeth.
Example: He raced ahead up into the bush, barking and snarling.

Definition: Someone who is bad-tempered is not very cheerful and gets angry easily.
Example: He became bad-tempered and we argued constantly.

Definition: If someone has a snappy style of speaking, they speak in a quick, clever, brief, and often funny way.
Example: Each film gets a snappy two-line summary.

Definition: lack of patience; intolerance of or irritability with anything that impedes or delays
Example: Love is ready to say more - don't let impatience jinx it.

Definition: a disagreeable or sullen mood; bad temper
Example: Chryssa was still not clear why, at the outset, he had been in such ill humour.

Definition: Something that is unhealthy is likely to cause illness or poor health.
Example: Avoid unhealthy foods such as hamburger and chips.

Definition: If you describe a person as twisted, you dislike them because you think they are strange in an unpleasant way.
Example: ...a twisted man who shot at the president.

Definition: to make (a person) resentful or bitter
Example: And the situation only gets worse following with the arrival of their embittered mother.

Definition: to make disappointed or disillusioned
Example: Scots are not all nationalists, but many are grossly disenchanted with politics as usual.

Definition: When people are rude, they act in an impolite way towards other people or say impolite things about them.
Example: He's rude to her friends and obsessively jealous.

Definition: Someone who is abusive behaves in a cruel and violent way towards other people.
Example: He became violent and abusive toward Ben's mother.

Definition: characteristic of a slight; disparaging; disdainful
Example: a slighting remark

Definition: An ailing organization or society is in difficulty and is becoming weaker.
Example: The rise in overseas sales is good news for the ailing American economy.

Definition: If a group of people pillage a place, they steal property from it using violent methods.
Example: Soldiers went on a rampage, pillaging stores and shooting.

Definition: A pouch is a flexible container like a small bag.
Example: a leather tobacco pouch

Definition: Your bladder is the part of your body where urine is stored until it leaves your body.
Example: Two years ago he had his gall bladder removed.

Definition: Something that has symmetry is symmetrical in shape, design, or structure.
Example: ...the incredible beauty and symmetry of a snowflake.

Definition: An excess of something is a larger amount than is needed, allowed, or usual.
Example: An excess of house plants in a small flat can be oppressive.

Definition: A surfeit of something is an amount which is too large.
Example: Rationing had put an end to a surfeit of biscuits long ago.

Definition: If there is a superfluity of something, there is more of it than is needed.
Example: The city has a superfluity of five-star hotels.

Definition: If an action or procedure is mandatory, people have to do it, because it is a rule or a law.
Example: ...the mandatory retirement age of 65.

Definition: If it is imperative that something is done, that thing is extremely important and must be done.
Example: It was imperative that he act as naturally as possible.

Definition: The archive or archives are a collection of documents and records that contain historical information. You can also use archives to refer to the place where archives are stored.
Example: ...the archives of the Imperial War Museum.

Definition: A depository is a place where objects can be stored safely.
Example: They have 2,500 tons of paper stored in their depository.

Definition: In ancient Greece, an oracle was a priest or priestess who made statements about future events or about the truth.
Example: Not waiting for her answer, he glanced down at his oracle, the clipboard.

Definition: Something that is stripy has stripes on it.
Example: He was wearing a stripy shirt and baggy blue trousers.

Definition: having rigid usually straight lengths of metal, wood, etc
Example: Above him the barred door, framed by cracks of light, hung close.

Definition: Something that is streaky is marked with long stripes that are a different colour to the rest of it.
Example: She has streaky fair hair and blue eyes.

Definition: having creases or crumples
Example: The eyes darted suspicion and malice at him and the nose was wrinkled in distaste.

Definition: A wizened person is old and has a lot of lines on their skin.
Example: ...a little wizened old fellow with no teeth.

Definition: A constraint is something that limits or controls what you can do.
Example: Their decision to abandon the trip was made because of financial constraints.

Definition: A keg is a small barrel used for storing something such as beer or other alcoholic drinks.
Example: Heaving the old wine keg against a wall, I was able to climb up and seize a rafter.

Definition: The stub of a cigarette or a pencil is the last short piece of it which remains when the rest has been used.
Example: He pulled the stub of a pencil from behind his ear.

Definition: If you bump into something or someone, you accidentally hit them while you are moving.
Example: They stopped walking and he almost bumped into them.

Definition: A disadvantage is a factor which makes someone or something less useful, acceptable, or successful than other people or things.
Example: His two main rivals suffer the disadvantage of having been long-term political exiles.

Definition: If you have a  head start on other people, you have an advantage over them in something such as a competition or race.
Example: A good education gives your child a head start in life.

Definition: An elixir is a liquid that is considered to have magical powers.
Example: ...the elixir of life.

Definition: If you describe a person's action or attitude as shameful, you think that it is so bad that the person ought to be ashamed.
Example: ...the most shameful episode in U.S. naval history.

Definition: To be notorious means to be well-known for something bad.
Example: ...an area notorious for crime and violence.

Definition: A foothold is a strong or favourable position from which further advances or progress may be made.
Example:
If this business is to have a successful future, it must establish a firm foothold
in Europe.

Definition: Your upbringing is the way that your parents or carers treat you and the things that they teach you when you are growing up.
Example: Martin's upbringing shaped his whole life.

Definition: When something multiplies or when you multiply it, it increases greatly in number or amount.
Example: Such disputes multiplied in the eighteenth and nineteenth centuries.

Definition: If people propagate an idea or piece of information, they spread it and try to make people believe it or support it.
Example:
They propagated political doctrines which promised to tear apart the fabric of our
society.

Definition: the action of pairing for reproduction
Something that is enjoyable gives you pleasure.
Example: It was much more enjoyable than I had expected.

Definition: Expulsion is when someone is forced to leave a school, university, or organization.
Example: Her hatred of authority led to her expulsion from high school.

Definition: Pins are very small thin pointed pieces of metal. They are used in sewing to fasten pieces of material together until they have been sewn.
Example: They pinned a notice to the door.

Definition: If you stitch cloth, you use a needle and thread to join two pieces together or to make a decoration.
Example: Fold the fabric and stitch the two layers together.

Definition: When you sew something such as clothes, you make them or repair them by joining pieces of cloth together by passing thread through them with a needle.
Example: She sewed the dresses on the sewing machine.

Definition: A hem on something such as a piece of clothing is an edge that is folded over and stitched down to prevent threads coming loose. The hem of a skirt or dress is the bottom edge.
Example: Turn under and hem the outer edges.

Definition: Beaten earth has been pressed down, often by people's feet, until it is hard.
Example: Before you is a well-worn path of beaten earth.

Definition: If something vibrates or if you vibrate it, it shakes with repeated small, quick movements.
Example: The ground shook and the cliffs seemed to vibrate.

Definition: People or organizations that go bankrupt do not have enough money to pay their debts.
Example: If the firm cannot sell its products, it will go bankrupt.

Definition: A person with a physical disability or a serious permanent injury is sometimes referred to as a cripple.
Example: She has gone from being a healthy, fit, and sporty young woman to being a cripple.

Definition: Something that impoverishes a person or a country makes them poor.
Example: We need to reduce the burden of taxes that impoverish the economy.

Definition: Insolvency is the state of not having enough money to pay your debts.
Example: ...companies on the brink of insolvency.

Definition: Penury is the state of being extremely poor.
Example: He was brought up in penury, without education.

Definition: the condition of being worn out or in poor working order; a condition requiring repairs
Example: And when he arrives, he finds the place in serious disrepair.
