Definition: a thrashing or beating with a whip or similar implement
A thud is a dull sound, such as that which a heavy object makes when it hits something soft.
Example: She tripped and fell with a sickening thud.

Definition: A thwack is a sound made when two solid objects hit each other hard.
Example: I listened to the thwack of the metal balls.

Definition: A whip is a long thin piece of material such as leather or rope, fastened to a stiff handle. It is used for hitting people or animals.
Example: Eye-witnesses claimed Mr Melton whipped the horse up to 16 times.

Definition: If something swishes or if you swish it, it moves quickly through the air, making a soft sound.
Example: A car swished by heading for the coast.

Definition: If someone is in a state of agitation, they are very worried or upset, and show this in their behaviour, movements, or voice.
Example: Danny returned to Father's house in a state of intense agitation.

Definition: If your arms or legs flail or if you flail them about, they wave about in an energetic but uncontrolled way.
Example: His arms were flailing in all directions.

Definition: Turbulence is a state of confusion and disorganized change.
Example: The 1960s and early 1970s were a time of change and turbulence.

Definition: Something that is exquisite is extremely beautiful or pleasant, especially in a delicate way.
Example: The Indians brought in exquisite beadwork to sell.

Definition: If you do something with finesse, you do it with great skill and style.
Example: ...handling momentous diplomatic challenges with tact and finesse.

Definition: inclination or tendency to help or do good to others; charity
Example: There is no question that churches may establish benevolence funds.

Definition: A blessing is something good that you are grateful for.
Example: Rivers are a blessing for an agricultural country.

Definition: A bunk is a bed that is fixed to a wall, especially in a ship or caravan.
Example: He left his bunk and went up on deck again.

Definition: An anchor is a heavy hooked object that is dropped from a boat into the water at the end of a chain in order to make the boat stay in one place.
Example: We could anchor off the pier.

Definition: If you soak something or leave it to soak, you put it into a liquid and leave it there.
Example: Soak the beans for 2 hours.

Definition: Ferment is excitement and trouble caused by change or uncertainty.
Example: The whole country has been in a state of political ferment for some months.

Definition: A staunch supporter or believer is very loyal to a person, organization, or set of beliefs, and supports them strongly.
Example: He's a staunch supporter of controls on government spending.

Definition: The stalk of a flower, leaf, or fruit is the thin part that joins it to the plant or tree.
Example: A single pale blue flower grows up from each joint on a long stalk.

Definition:
Camaraderie is a feeling of trust and friendship among a group of people who have usually known each other
for a long time or gone through some kind of experience together.
Example: ...the loyalty and camaraderie of the wartime Army.

Definition: A girdle is a piece of underwear that fits tightly around the stomach and hips.
Example: Weather satellites have observed a ring of volcanic ash girdling the earth.

Definition: If a sharp object pierces something, or if you pierce something with a sharp object, the object goes into it and makes a hole in it.
Example: One bullet pierced the left side of his chest.

Definition:
A hedge is a row of bushes or small trees, usually along the edge of a garden, field, or
road.
Example: You can hedge against redundancy or illness with insurance.

Definition: If you procrastinate, you keep leaving things you should do until later, often because you do not want to do them.
Example: Most often we procrastinate when faced with something we do not want to do.

Definition: To divert vehicles or travellers means to make them follow a different route or go to a different destination than they originally intended. You can also say that someone or something diverts from a particular route or to a particular place.
Example:
...Rainham Marshes, east London, where a new bypass will divert traffic from the
A13.

Definition: A coil of rope or wire is a length of it that has been wound into a series of loops.
Example: Tod shook his head angrily and slung the coil of rope over his shoulder.

Definition: If someone's face or body contorts or is contorted, it moves into an unnatural and unattractive shape or position.
Example: His face contorts as he screams out the lyrics.

Definition: If a physical object is mangled, it is crushed or twisted very forcefully, so that it is difficult to see what its original shape was.
Example: His body was crushed and mangled beyond recognition.

Definition: The pivot in a situation is the most important thing which everything else is based on or arranged around.
Example: Forming the pivot of the exhibition is a large group of watercolours.

Definition: If you sprain a joint such as your ankle or wrist, you accidentally damage it by twisting it or bending it violently.
Example: He fell and sprained his ankle.

Definition: If someone is misquoted, something that they have said or written is repeated incorrectly.
Example: He claimed that he had been misquoted and he threatened to sue the magazine for libel.

Definition: A crook is a dishonest person or a criminal.
Example: The man is a crook and a liar.

Definition: If something bobs, it moves up and down, like something does when it is floating on water.
Example: Huge balloons bobbed about in the sky above.

Definition: The prow of a ship or boat is the front part of it.
Example: Then a tram to work; he enjoyed a tram ride, especially if he went on the top to sit on the prow as on a galleon.

Definition: Fore is used to refer to parts at the front of an animal, ship, or aircraft.
Example: There had been no direct damage in the fore part of the ship.

Definition: A lottery is a type of gambling game in which people buy numbered tickets. Several numbers are then chosen, and the people who have those numbers on their tickets win a prize.
Example: ...the national lottery.

Definition: If you speculate about something, you make guesses about its nature or identity, or about what might happen.
Example: Critics of the project speculate about how many hospitals could be built instead.

Definition: If you describe someone as resolute, you approve of them because they are very determined not to change their mind or not to give up a course of action.
Example: Voters perceive him as a decisive and resolute international leader.

Definition: A fake fur or a fake painting, for example, is a fur or painting that has been made to look valuable or genuine, often in order to deceive people.
Example: The bank manager is said to have issued fake certificates.

Definition: (of a gesture, statement or emotion) not real
Example: ``Oh, thanks very much," Katrina said with feigned indignation.

Definition: If you say that someone is insincere, you are being critical of them because they say things they do not really mean, usually pleasant, admiring, or encouraging things.
Example:
Some people are so terribly insincere you can never tell if they are telling the
truth.

Definition: If something is destined to happen or if someone is destined to behave in a particular way, that thing seems certain to happen or be done.
Example: He feels that he was destined to become a musician.

Definition: If you say that something was predestined, you mean that it could not have been prevented or changed because it had already been decided by a power such as God or fate.
Example: His was not a political career predestined from birth.

Definition: If you say that something is preordained, you mean you believe it to be happening in the way that has been decided by a power such as God or fate.
Example: ...the belief that our actions are the unfolding of a preordained destiny.

Definition: If you describe something as ill-fated, you mean that it ended or will end in an unsuccessful or unfortunate way.
Example: ...Captain Scott's ill-fated Antarctic expedition.

Definition: An array of different things or people is a large number or wide range of them.
Example: As the deadline approached she experienced a bewildering array of emotions.

Definition: Imprisonment is the state of being imprisoned.
Example: She was sentenced to seven years' imprisonment.

Definition: Detention is when someone is arrested or put into prison, especially for political reasons.
Example: ...the detention without trial of government critics.

Definition: If you pinch a part of someone's body, you take a piece of their skin between your thumb and first finger and give it a short squeeze.
Example: She pinched his arm as hard as she could.

Definition: A dram is a small measure of whisky.
Example: ...a dram of whisky.

Definition: If you crunch something hard, such as a sweet, you crush it noisily between your teeth.
Example: She sucked an ice cube into her mouth, and crunched it loudly.

Definition: Incense is a substance that is burned for its sweet smell, often as part of a religious ceremony.
Example: This proposal will incense conservation campaigners.

Definition: If someone swindles a person or an organization, they deceive them in order to get something valuable from them, especially money.
Example: A City businessman swindled investors out of millions of pounds.

Definition: Trickery is the use of dishonest methods in order to achieve something.
Example: They are notorious for resorting to trickery in order to impress their clients.

Definition: A pang is a sudden strong feeling or emotion, for example of sadness or pain.
Example: For a moment she felt a pang of guilt about the way she was treating him.

Definition: If you refrigerate food, you make it cold, for example by putting it in a fridge, usually in order to preserve it.
Example: Refrigerate the dough overnight.

Definition: to weaken or destroy the hope, courage, enthusiasm, etc, of
Example: And he is refusing to be disheartened after seeing his chances limited this season.

Definition: Dismay is a strong feeling of fear, worry, or sadness that is caused by something unpleasant and unexpected.
Example: Local councillors have reacted with dismay and indignation.

Definition: Something that is catastrophic involves or causes a sudden terrible disaster.
Example: A tidal wave caused by the earthquake hit the coast causing catastrophic damage.

Definition: A traumatic experience is very shocking and upsetting, and may cause psychological damage.
Example: I suffered a nervous breakdown. It was a traumatic experience.

Definition: If you describe something as dreary, you mean that it is dull and depressing.
Example: ...a dreary little town in the Midwest.

Definition: a discoloring or being discolored
Example: `There has to be some tarnishing or discoloration, an indication that the thing has been underwater for half a century.

Definition: To blacken something means to make it black or very dark in colour. Something that blackens becomes black or very dark in colour.
Example: They spent hours blackening the grate and polishing the fire-irons.

Definition: A blemish is a small mark on something that spoils its appearance.
Example: Every piece is inspected, and if there is the slightest blemish on it, it is rejected.

Definition: An unfair action is not right or fair.
Example: America decided that imported steel had an unfair advantage over steel made at home.

Definition: Understood is the past tense and past participle of understand.
Example: They had discovered they shared a loathing of Tarja Tenragan that few in the Defenders understood.

Definition: You can describe something as abstruse if you find it difficult to understand, especially when you think it could be explained more simply.
Example: ...fruitless discussions about abstruse resolutions.

Definition: Something that is confusing makes it difficult for people to know exactly what is happening or what to do.
Example: The statement is highly confusing.

Definition: A blur is a shape or area which you cannot see clearly because it has no distinct outline or because it is moving very fast.
Example: Out of the corner of my eye I saw a blur of movement on the other side of the glass.

Definition: When there is disruption of an event, system, or process, it is prevented from continuing or operating in a normal way.
Example: The strike is expected to cause delays and disruption to flights from Britain.

Definition: When there is a stoppage, people stop working because of a disagreement with their employers.
Example: Mineworkers in Ukraine have voted for a one-day stoppage next month.

Definition: The suspension of something is the act of delaying or stopping it for a while or until a decision is made about it.
Example:
A strike by British Airways ground staff has led to the suspension of flights between
London and Manchester.

Definition: deterioration, esp of morality or culture; decay; degeneration
Example: He had fame at his fingertips, only to reject it for a life that lurched from decadence to decay.

Definition: A squall is a sudden strong wind which often causes a brief, violent rain storm or snow storm.
Example: The boat was hit by a squall north of the island.

Definition: If you suck something, you hold it in your mouth and pull at it with the muscles in your cheeks and tongue, for example in order to get liquid out of it.
Example: They waited in silence and sucked their sweets.

Definition: The expiration of a fixed period of time is its ending.
Example: ...a few hours before the expiration of the midnight deadline.

Definition: If you overindulge, or overindulge in something that you like very much, usually food or drink, you allow yourself to have more of it than is good for you.
Example: We all overindulge occasionally.

Definition: If you pamper someone, you make them feel comfortable by doing things for them or giving them expensive or luxurious things, sometimes in a way which has a bad effect on their character.
Example: Why don't you let your mother pamper you for a while?

Definition: If you bungle something, you fail to do it properly, because you make mistakes or are clumsy.
Example:
Two prisoners bungled an escape bid after running either side of a lamp-post while
handcuffed.

Definition: If a pregnant woman has a miscarriage, her baby is born before it is properly formed, and it dies.
Example: a miscarriage of justice

Definition: A barge is a long, narrow boat with a flat bottom. Barges are used for carrying heavy loads, especially on canals.
Example: Students tried to barge into the secretariat buildings.

Definition: If you deflate someone or something, you take away their confidence or make them seem less important.
Example: Britain's other hopes of medals were deflated earlier in the day.

Definition: If you hold up your hand or something you have in your hand, you move it upwards into a particular position and keep it there.
Example: She held up her hand stiffly.

Definition: Poverty-stricken people or places are extremely poor.
Example: ...a teacher of poverty-stricken kids.

Definition: Deprived people or people from deprived areas do not have the things that people consider to be essential in life, for example acceptable living conditions or education.
Example: ...probably the most severely deprived children in the country.

Definition: Sunken ships have sunk to the bottom of a sea, ocean, or lake.
Example: The sunken sailing-boat was a glimmer of white on the bottom.

Definition: If you are disgruntled, you are cross and dissatisfied because things have not happened the way that you wanted them to happen.
Example: Disgruntled employees recently called for his resignation.

Definition: Discontent is the feeling that you have when you are not satisfied with your situation.
Example: There are reports of widespread discontent in the capital.

Definition: If you feel dissatisfaction with something, you are not contented or pleased with it.
Example: She has already expressed her dissatisfaction with this aspect of the policy.

Definition: Someone's displeasure is a feeling of annoyance that they have about something that has happened.
Example: The population has already begun to show its displeasure at the slow pace of change.

Definition: A clumsy person moves or handles things in a careless, awkward way, often so that things are knocked over or broken.
Example: I'd never seen a clumsier, less coordinated boxer.

Definition: Someone or something that is unsuitable for a particular purpose or situation does not have the right qualities for it.
Example: Amy's shoes were unsuitable for walking any distance.

Definition: You use gross to describe something unacceptable or unpleasant to a very great amount, degree, or intensity.
Example: The company were guilty of gross negligence.

Definition: conformity; agreement; accord (esp in the phrase in accordance with)
Example: in accordance with the plans

Definition: A situation that is volatile is likely to change suddenly and unexpectedly.
Example: There have been riots before and the situation is volatile.

Definition: If there is stormy weather, there are strong winds and heavy rain.
Example: It had been a night of stormy weather, with torrential rain and high winds.

Definition: If you bypass someone or something that you would normally have to get involved with, you ignore them, often because you want to achieve something more quickly.
Example: A growing number of employers are trying to bypass the unions altogether.

Definition: When you terminate something or when it terminates, it ends completely.
Example: Her next remark abruptly terminated the conversation.

Definition: A frill is a long narrow strip of cloth or paper with many folds in it, which is attached to something as a decoration.
Example: ...net curtains with frills.

Definition: An adornment is something that is used to make a person or thing more beautiful.
Example: It was a building without any adornment or decoration.

Definition: The enhancement of something is the improvement of it in relation to its value, quality, or attractiveness.
Example: Music is merely an enhancement to the power of her words.

Definition: If there is an epidemic of a particular disease somewhere, it affects a very large number of people there and spreads quickly to other areas.
Example: A flu epidemic is sweeping through Moscow.

Definition: Contagion is the spreading of a particular disease by someone touching another person who is already affected by the disease.
Example: I'm a blood donor; I can't risk any contagion.

Definition: An influx of people or things into a place is their arrival there in large numbers.
Example: ...the first large influx of immigrants to arrive on these shores.

Definition: The bane of someone or the bane of someone's life is something that frequently makes them feel unhappy or annoyed.
Example: Rain is the bane of holiday-makers.

Definition: If someone is tortured, another person deliberately causes them great pain over a period of time, in order to punish them or to make them reveal information.
Example: French police are convinced that she was tortured and killed.

Definition: If you are annoyed, you are fairly angry about something.
Example: She tapped her forehead and looked annoyed with herself.

Definition: A jug is a cylindrical container with a handle and is used for holding and pouring liquids.
Example: ...a jug of water.

Definition: Something that is a starting point for a discussion or process can be used to begin it or act as a basis for it.
Example: These proposals represent a realistic starting point for negotiation.

Definition: You use minimum to describe an amount which is the smallest that is possible, allowed, or required.
Example: He was only five feet nine, the minimum height for a policeman.

Definition: A ravine is a very deep narrow valley with steep sides.
Example: The bus is said to have overturned and fallen into a ravine.

Definition: A trough is a long narrow container from which farm animals drink or eat.
Example: The old stone cattle trough still sits by the main entrance.

Definition: A trait is a particular characteristic, quality, or tendency that someone or something has.
Example: Many of our personality traits are developed during those early months.

Definition: Someone's speciality is a particular type of work that they do most or do best, or a subject that they know a lot about.
Example: My father was a historian of repute. His speciality was the history of Germany.

Definition: The hallmark of something or someone is their most typical quality or feature.
Example: It's a technique that has become the hallmark of Amber Films.

Definition: To trample on someone's rights or values or to trample them means to deliberately ignore or destroy them.
Example:
They say loggers are destroying rain forests and trampling on the rights of indigenous
people.

Definition: A badge is a piece of metal or cloth which you wear to show that you belong to an organization or support a cause. American English usually uses button to refer to a small round metal badge.
Example: Foreign companies used to consider a New York listing a badge of honour.

Definition: If an arrangement, plan, or deal  falls through, it fails to happen.
Example: They wanted to turn the estate into a private golf course, but the deal fell through.

Definition: If you flout something such as a law, an order, or an accepted way of behaving, you deliberately do not obey it or follow it.
Example: ...illegal campers who persist in flouting the law.

Definition: If something wanes, it becomes gradually weaker or less, often so that it eventually disappears.
Example: While his interest in these sports began to wane, a passion for rugby developed.

Definition: If you are debilitated by something such as an illness, it causes your body or mind to become gradually weaker.
Example: Stewart took over yesterday when Russell was debilitated by a stomach virus.

Definition: If a machine, railway line, or bridge is sabotaged, it is deliberately damaged or destroyed, for example in a war or as a protest.
Example: The main pipeline supplying water was sabotaged by rebels.

Definition: A compromise is a situation in which people accept something slightly different from what they really want, because of circumstances or because they are considering the wishes of other people.
Example: Encourage your child to reach a compromise between what he wants and what you want.

Definition: If you describe someone or something as bland, you mean that they are rather dull and unexciting.
Example: Serle has a blander personality than Howard.

Definition:
When people domesticate wild animals or plants, they bring them under control and use them to produce food
or as pets.
Example: We domesticated the dog to help us with hunting.

Definition: If you postpone an event, you delay it or arrange for it to take place at a later time than was originally planned.
Example: He decided to postpone the expedition until the following day.

Definition: If you are debarred from doing something, you are prevented from doing it by a law or regulation.
Example: If found guilty, she could be debarred from politics for seven years.

Definition: If you decipher a piece of writing or a message, you work out what it says, even though it is very difficult to read or understand.
Example: I'm still no closer to deciphering the code.

Definition: If you waver, you cannot decide about something or you consider changing your mind about something.
Example: Some military commanders wavered over whether to support the coup.

Definition: lack of eagerness or willingness; disinclination
Example: This discerning reluctance shows impressive discipline.

Definition: the simultaneous existence of two opposed and conflicting attitudes, emotions, etc
Example: The latter gave the album its edgy ambivalence about home and country.

Definition: If you vacillate between two alternatives or choices, you keep changing your mind.
Example: She vacillates between studying economics and languages.

Definition: If someone has a stutter, they find it difficult to say the first sound of a word, and so they often hesitate or repeat it two or three times.
Example: He spoke with a pronounced stutter.

Definition: If you gulp something, you eat or drink it very quickly by swallowing large quantities of it at once.
Example: She quickly gulped her tea.

Definition: When you choke or when something chokes you, you cannot breathe properly or get enough air into your lungs.
Example: The coffee was almost too hot to swallow and made him choke for a moment.

Definition: If someone or something engenders a particular feeling, atmosphere, or situation, they cause it to occur.
Example: It helps engender a sense of common humanity.

Definition: If a person or animal is vaccinated, they are given a vaccine, usually by injection, to prevent them from getting a disease.
Example: Dogs must be vaccinated against distemper.

Definition: A conduit is a small tunnel, pipe, or channel through which water or electrical wires go.
Example: He was welcomed and used as a trusted conduit for information.

Definition: A canal is a long, narrow stretch of water that has been made for boats to travel along or to bring water to a particular area.
Example: ...the Grand Union Canal.

Definition: If you pacify someone who is angry, upset, or not pleased, you succeed in making them calm or pleased.
Example: Is this a serious step, or is this just something to pacify the critics?

Definition: If you propitiate someone, you stop them being angry or impatient by doing something to please them.
Example: I've never gone out of my way to propitiate people.

Definition: You use in short when you have been giving a lot of details and you want to give a conclusion or summary.
Example: Try tennis, badminton or windsurfing. In short, anything challenging.

Definition: You use in a word to indicate that you are giving a summary of what you have just been saying, or are giving a reply, in as brief a way as possible.
Example: Victor, in a word, got increasingly fed up.

Definition: If something glitters, light comes from or is reflected off different parts of it.
Example: The bay glittered in the sunshine.

Definition: You use glittering to indicate that something is very impressive or successful.
Example: ...a brilliant school pupil destined for a glittering academic career.

Definition: Someone or something that is vibrant is full of life, energy, and enthusiasm.
Example: Tom felt himself being drawn towards her vibrant personality.

Definition: If you describe someone as vivacious, you mean that they are lively, exciting, and attractive.
Example: She's beautiful, vivacious, and charming.

Definition: When someone scowls, an angry or hostile expression appears on their face.
Example: He scowled, and slammed the door behind him.

Definition: When someone frowns, their eyebrows become drawn together, because they are annoyed, worried, or puzzled, or because they are concentrating.
Example: Nancy shook her head, frowning.

Definition: If you glower at someone or something, you look at them angrily.
Example: He glowered at me but said nothing.

Definition: If someone or something dazzles you, you are extremely impressed by their skill, qualities, or beauty.
Example: George dazzled her with his knowledge of the world.

Definition:
A flare is a small device that produces a bright flame. Flares are used as signals, for example
on ships.
Example: ...a ship which had fired a distress flare.

Definition: Wit is the ability to use words or ideas in an amusing, clever, and imaginative way.
Example: Boulding was known for his biting wit.

Definition: the quality of being canny
Example: With a canniness which bordered on the telepathic he asked for a Tio Pepe.

Definition: Dexterity is skill in using your hands, or sometimes your mind.
Example: ...Reid's dexterity on the guitar.

Definition: If you describe a person or their behaviour as expressive, you mean that their behaviour clearly indicates their feelings or intentions.
Example: You can train people to be more expressive.

Definition: Speech or writing that is eloquent is well expressed and effective in persuading people.
Example: I heard him make a very eloquent speech at that dinner.

Definition: A shrewd person is able to understand and judge a situation quickly and to use this understanding to their own advantage.
Example: She's a shrewd businesswoman.

Definition: Exuberance is behaviour which is energetic, excited, and cheerful.
Example: Her burst of exuberance and her brightness overwhelmed me.

Definition: Your spirit is the part of you that is not physical and that consists of your character and feelings. [...]
Example: To her surprise, Alma found herself smiling, perkily, feeling a real small rush of high spirits.

Definition: If you say that something is comforting, you mean it makes you feel less worried or unhappy.
Example: My mother had just died and I found the book very comforting.

Definition: If you are wary of something or someone, you are cautious because you do not know much about them and you believe they may be dangerous or cause problems.
Example: People did not teach their children to be wary of strangers.

Definition: the fact, quality, or condition of being vigilant
Example: Psychotic depression; remorse over killing Doyle; saved from suicide by the vigilance of heroic landing staff.

Definition: the quality or state of being wary
Example: Margaret Morrison's prim frown gave way to perplexity which in turn yielded to a certain wariness.

Definition: A siren is a warning device which makes a long, loud noise. Most fire engines, ambulances, and police cars have sirens.
Example: It sounds like an air raid siren.

Definition: If a person, a country, or an organization has prestige, they are admired and respected because of the position they hold or the things they have achieved.
Example: ...efforts to build up the prestige of the United Nations.

Definition: Something that is glorious is very beautiful and impressive.
Example: ...a glorious rainbow in the air.

Definition: Fizzy drinks are drinks that contain small bubbles of carbon dioxide. They make a sound like a long 's' when you pour them.
Example: ...fizzy water.

Definition: Someone who is bubbly is very lively and cheerful and talks a lot.
Example: ...a bubbly girl who loves to laugh.

Definition: An effervescent liquid is one that contains or releases bubbles of gas.
Example: ...an effervescent mineral water.

Definition: A frothy liquid has lots of bubbles on its surface.
Example: ...frothy milk shakes.

Definition: If a light or flame flickers, it shines unsteadily.
Example: Fluorescent lights flickered, and then the room was brilliantly, blindingly bright.

Definition: If you are magnanimous, you behave kindly and generously towards someone, especially after defeating them or being treated badly by them.
Example: I was prepared to be magnanimous, prepared to feel compassion for him.

Definition: If you describe a person in authority as benevolent, you mean that they are kind and fair.
Example: The company has proved to be a most benevolent employer.

Definition: If a situation will continue indefinitely, it will continue for ever or until someone decides to change it or end it.
Example: The visit has now been postponed indefinitely.

Definition: An abstraction is a general idea rather than one relating to a particular object, person, or situation.
Example: Is it worth fighting a big war, in the name of an abstraction like sovereignty?

Definition: If you say that there is ambiguity in something, you mean that it is unclear or confusing, or it can be understood in more than one way.
Example: There is considerable ambiguity about what this part of the agreement actually means.

Definition: You say that something is unspecified when you are not told exactly what it is.
Example: The government said an unspecified number of bandits were killed.

Definition: Generalized means involving many different things, rather than one or two specific things.
Example: ...a generalised discussion about admirable singers.

Definition: Someone who is absent-minded forgets things or does not pay attention to what they are doing, often because they are thinking about something else.
Example: In his later life he became even more absent-minded.

Definition: If you are absorbed in something or someone, you are very interested in them and they take up all your attention and energy.
Example: They were completely absorbed in each other.

Definition: If you are distracted, you are not concentrating on something because you are worried or are thinking about something else.
Example: She had seemed curiously distracted.

Definition: Something that is indistinct is unclear and difficult to see, hear, or recognize.
Example: The lettering is fuzzy and indistinct.

Definition: If something is unclear, it is not known or not certain.
Example: It is unclear how much popular support they have among the island's population.

Definition: If you say that someone is fearless, you mean that they are not afraid at all, and you admire them for this.
Example: ...his fearless campaigning for racial justice.

Definition: An enterprising person is willing to try out new, unusual ways of doing or achieving something.
Example:
Some enterprising members found ways of reducing their expenses or raising their
incomes.

Definition: A building that is dilapidated is old and in a generally bad condition.
Example: We want to finish `ere by next week because we've got some work to do for the dilapidated Board.

Definition: If something is useless, you cannot use it.
Example: He realised that their money was useless in this country.

Definition: You use -impaired in adjectives where you are describing someone with a particular disability. For example, someone who is hearing-impaired has a disability affecting their hearing, and someone who is visually-impaired has a disability affecting their sight.
Example: More than 1 in 20 of the population is hearing-impaired to some extent.

Definition: A faltering attempt, effort, or movement is uncertain because the person doing it is nervous or weak, or does not really know what to do.
Example: 'Now I feel I can do it,' he said in faltering English.

Definition: If you are hesitant about doing something, you do not do it quickly or immediately, usually because you are uncertain, embarrassed, or worried.
Example: She was hesitant about coming forward with her story.

Definition: You can refer to something as a blight when it causes great difficulties, and damages or spoils other things.
Example: This discriminatory policy has really been a blight on America.

Definition: Varnish is an oily liquid which is painted onto wood or other material to give it a hard, clear, shiny surface.
Example: The varnish comes in six natural wood shades.

Definition: Lacquer is a special liquid which is painted on wood or metal in order to protect it and to make it shiny.
Example: We put on the second coating of lacquer.

Definition: When a substance is refined, it is made pure by having all other substances removed from it.
Example: Oil is refined to remove naturally occurring impurities.

Definition: Undergrowth consists of bushes and plants growing together under the trees in a forest.
Example: ...plunging through the undergrowth.

Definition: An aroma is a strong, pleasant smell.
Example: ...the wonderful aroma of freshly baked bread.

Definition: Moisture is tiny drops of water in the air, on a surface, or in the ground.
Example: When the soil is dry, more moisture is lost from the plant.

Definition: Drizzle is light rain falling in fine drops.
Example: The drizzle had now stopped and the sun was breaking through.

Definition: If something such as knowledge or information is diffused, or if it diffuses somewhere, it is made known over a wide area or to a lot of people.
Example: Over time, the technology is diffused and adopted by other countries.

Definition: A sprig is a small stem with leaves on it which has been picked from a bush or plant, especially so that it can be used in cooking or as a decoration.
Example: Serve garnished with the sprigs of parsley.

Definition: A buttonhole is a hole that you push a button through in order to fasten a shirt, coat, or other piece of clothing.
Example: This fearsome woman buttonholed me in the first week and said she was very unhappy.

Definition: If something is festooned with, for example, lights, balloons, or flowers, large numbers of these things are hung from it or wrapped around it, especially in order to decorate it.
Example: The temples are festooned with lights.

Definition: shrunken and withered
Example: It sat in my palm, a shrivelled brain from some small animal.

Definition: If you crumple something such as paper or cloth, or if it crumples, it is squashed and becomes full of untidy creases and folds.
Example: She crumpled the paper in her hand.

Definition: creased
Example: The grubby man had changed into a crumpled clean shirt and trousers.

Definition: An impassioned speech or piece of writing is one in which someone expresses their strong feelings about an issue in a forceful way.
Example: He made an impassioned appeal for peace.

Definition: Spicy food is strongly flavoured with spices.
Example: Thai food is hot and spicy.

Definition: Food that is piquant has a pleasantly spicy taste.
Example: ...a crisp mixed salad with an unusually piquant dressing.

Definition: When something shrivels or when something shrivels it, it becomes dryer and smaller, often with lines in its surface, as a result of losing the water it contains.
Example: The plant shrivels and dies.

Definition: Food that is crisp is pleasantly hard, or has a pleasantly hard surface.
Example: Bake the potatoes for 15 minutes, till they're nice and crisp.

Definition: If you singe something or if it singes, it burns very slightly and changes colour but does not catch fire.
Example: The electric fire had begun to singe the bottoms of his trousers.

Definition: If something glimmers, it produces or reflects a faint, gentle, often unsteady light.
Example: The moon glimmered faintly through the mists.

Definition: If someone reddens or their face reddens, their face turns pink or red, often because they are embarrassed or angry.
Example: He was working himself up to a fury, his face reddening.

Definition: If you are engrossed in something, it holds your attention completely.
Example: Tony didn't notice because he was too engrossed in his work.

Definition: If you inculcate an idea or opinion in someone's mind, you teach it to them by repeating it until it is fixed in their mind.
Example: We have tried to inculcate a feeling of citizenship in youngsters.

Definition: Something that is chaotic is in a state of complete disorder and confusion.
Example: My own house feels as filthy and chaotic as a bus terminal.

Definition: If you say that a situation or activity is wearing, you mean that it requires a lot of energy and makes you feel mentally or physically tired.
Example: She finds the continual confrontation very wearing.

Definition: When a liquid congeals, it becomes very thick and sticky and almost solid.
Example: The blood had started to congeal.

Definition: If you accustom yourself or another person to something, you make yourself or them become used to it.
Example: The team has accustomed itself to the pace of first division rugby.

Definition: When people, especially soldiers, regroup, or when someone regroups them, they form an organized group again, in order to continue fighting.
Example: Now the rebel army has regrouped and reorganised.

Definition: An entrant is a person who has recently become a member of an institution such as a university.
Example: ...a young school entrant.

Definition: A claimant is someone who is receiving money from the state because they are unemployed or they are unable to work because they are ill.
Example: ...benefit claimants.

Definition: A person's suitor is someone who wants to marry them.
Example: My mother had a suitor who adored her.

Definition: A plug on a piece of electrical equipment is a small plastic object with two or three metal pins which fit into the holes of an electric socket, connecting the equipment to the electricity supply.
Example: She put the plug in the sink and filled it with cold water.

Definition: You use provisional to describe something that has been arranged or appointed for the present, but may be changed in the future.
Example: ...the possibility of setting up a provisional coalition government.

Definition: If a situation or agreement is conditional on something, it will only happen or continue if this thing happens.
Example: Their support is conditional on his proposals meeting their approval.

Definition: When food digests or when you digest it, it passes through your body to your stomach. Your stomach removes the substances that your body needs and gets rid of the rest.
Example:
Do not undertake strenuous exercise for a few hours after a meal to allow food to
digest.

Definition: When creatures such as insects or rats infest plants or a place, they are present in large numbers and cause damage.
Example: ...pests like aphids which infest cereal crops.

Definition: A swarm of bees or other insects is a large group of them flying together.
Example: A dark cloud of bees comes swarming out of the hive.

Definition: Someone who is conscientious is very careful to do their work properly.
Example: We are generally very conscientious about our work.

Definition: A painstaking search, examination, or investigation is done extremely carefully and thoroughly.
Example: Forensic experts carried out a painstaking search of the debris.

Definition: People who are frugal or who live frugal lives do not eat much or spend much money on themselves.
Example: She lives a frugal life.

Definition: If you say that someone is thrifty, you are praising them for saving money, not buying unnecessary things, and not wasting things.
Example: My mother taught me to be thrifty.

Definition: If you impart information to people, you tell it to them.
Example: The ability to impart knowledge is the essential qualification for teachers.

Definition: The bearer of something such as a message is the person who brings it to you.
Example: I hate to be the bearer of bad news.

Definition: A sheath is a covering for the blade of a knife.
Example: Her ivory sheath dress had obviously been painted on.

Definition: A hut is a small house with only one or two rooms, especially one which is made of wood, mud, grass, or stones.
Example: It matches the shepherd 's hut in the garden.

Definition: A shack is a simple hut built from tin, wood, or other materials.
Example: All the little shacks had been destroyed.

Definition: A snare is a trap for catching birds or small animals. It consists of a loop of wire or rope which pulls tight around the animal.
Example:
Given data which are free from bias there are further snares to avoid in statistical
work.

Definition: If you ensnare someone, you gain power over them, especially by using dishonest or deceitful methods.
Example: Feminism is simply another device to ensnare women.

Definition: If you entrap someone, you trick or deceive them and make them believe or do something wrong.
Example: The police have been given extra powers to entrap drug traffickers.

Definition:
To lure someone means to trick them into a particular place or to trick them into doing something that they should
not do.
Example: He lured her to his home and shot her with his father's gun.

Definition: A cage is a structure of wire or metal bars in which birds or animals are kept.
Example: I hate to see birds in cages.

Definition: Traction is a form of medical treatment, in which weights and pulleys are used to gently pull or stretch an injured part of the body for a period of time. You say that a person who is having this treatment is in traction.
Example: Is there an alternative to traction for a broken leg?

Definition: A hitch is a slight problem or difficulty which causes a short delay.
Example: After some technical hitches the show finally got under way.

Definition: If you describe people, especially people who are old, as hale, you mean that they are healthy.
Example: She is remarkable and I'd like to see her remain hale and hearty for years yet.

Definition: If you revel in a situation or experience, you enjoy it very much.
Example: Revelling in her freedom, she took a hotel room and stayed for several days.

Definition: If someone or something is in a position of prominence, they are well-known and important.
Example: He came to prominence during the last World Cup.

Definition: Stardom is the state of being very famous, usually as an actor, musician, or sports player.
Example: In 1929 she shot to stardom on Broadway in a Noel Coward play.

Definition: If you are shackled by something, it prevents you from doing what you want to do.
Example: The trade unions are shackled by the law.

Definition: If you say that you are fettered by something, you dislike it because it prevents you from behaving or moving in a free and natural way.
Example: ...a private trust which would not be fettered by bureaucracy.

Definition: The reformation of something is the act or process of changing and improving it.
Example: He devoted his energies to the reformation of science.

Definition: You can refer to a change that leads to a new period of growth and improvement in something as its rebirth.
Example: ...the rebirth of democracy in Latin America.

Definition: If your feelings or actions towards someone are reciprocated, the other person feels or behaves in the same way towards you as you have felt or behaved towards them.
Example: He reciprocated the party leader's good wishes.

Definition: If you bandy words with someone, you argue with them.
Example: Brand shook his head. He was tired of bandying words with the man.

Definition: Your veins are the thin tubes in your body through which your blood flows towards your heart. Compare artery.
Example: Many veins are found just under the skin.

Definition: Blood vessels are the narrow tubes through which your blood flows.
Example: We were having a great time when suddenly he burst a blood vessel.

Definition: Unification is the process by which two or more countries join together and become one country.
Example:
The political unification of Spain began in 1469 with the marriage of Ferdinand and
Isabella.

Definition: Coherence is a state or situation in which all the parts or ideas fit together well so that they form a united whole.
Example: The anthology has a surprising sense of coherence.

Definition: Something that is bizarre is very odd and strange.
Example: The game was also notable for the bizarre behaviour of the team's manager.

Definition: A tariff is a tax that a government collects on goods coming into a country.
Example: America wants to eliminate tariffs on items such as electronics.

Definition: Prosecution is the action of charging someone with a crime and putting them on trial.
Example: Harding pleaded guilty to a charge of hindering the prosecution of the suspects.

Definition: A cur is an unfriendly dog, especially a mongrel.
Example: Elliot was vilified as a cur and a scoundrel.

Definition: If you say that something is futile, you mean there is no point in doing it, usually because it has no chance of succeeding.
Example: He brought his arm up in a futile attempt to ward off the blow.

Definition: A conglomerate is a large business firm consisting of several different companies.
Example: It was a medium-size conglomerate, with companies dealing with almost everything except retail merchandising.

Definition: To complicate something means to make it more difficult to understand or deal with.
Example: What complicates the issue is the burden of history.

Definition: If a bad situation worsens or if something worsens it, it becomes more difficult, unpleasant, or unacceptable.
Example: The security forces had to intervene to prevent the situation worsening.

Definition: If someone pilfers, they steal things, usually small cheap things.
Example: Staff were pilfering behind the bar.

Definition: If the police apprehend someone, they catch them and arrest them.
Example: Police have not apprehended her killer.

Definition: A shrine is a place of worship which is associated with a particular holy person or object.
Example: ...the holy shrine of Mecca.

Definition: If you gyrate, you dance or move your body quickly with circular movements.
Example: The woman began to gyrate to the music.

Definition: Diplomacy is the activity or profession of managing relations between the governments of different countries.
Example: Today's UN resolution will be a significant success for American diplomacy.

Definition: If you describe something as timeless, you mean that it is so good or beautiful that it cannot be affected by changes in society or fashion.
Example: There is a timeless quality to his best work.

Definition: Something that is eternal lasts for ever.
Example: Whoever believes in Him shall have eternal life.

Definition: Something that is everlasting never comes to an end.
Example: ...a message of peace and everlasting life.

Definition: If you refer to someone's undying feelings, you mean that the feelings are very strong and are unlikely to change.
Example: Dianne declared her undying love for Sam.

Definition: If something is indestructible, it is very strong and cannot be destroyed.
Example: This type of plastic is almost indestructible.

Definition: Eternity is time without an end or a state of existence outside time, especially the state which some people believe they will pass into after they have died.
Example: I have always found the thought of eternity terrifying.

Definition: eternity
Example: Remember that the return on a perpetuity is equal to the yearly cash flow divided by the present value.

Definition: Sanitary means concerned with keeping things clean and healthy, especially by providing a sewage system and a clean water supply.
Example: Sanitary conditions are appalling.

Definition: Antiseptic is a substance that kills germs and harmful bacteria.
Example: She bathed the cut with antiseptic.

Definition: A person or animal that is infertile is unable to produce babies.
Example: According to one survey, one woman in eight is infertile.

Definition: Something that is unproductive does not produce any good results.
Example: They are well aware that much of their time and effort is unproductive.

Definition: Fruitless actions, events, or efforts do not achieve anything at all.
Example: It was a fruitless search.

Definition: An industry, company, or product that is unprofitable does not make any profit or does not make enough profit.
Example: ...unprofitable state-owned industries.

Definition: Futility is a total lack of purpose or usefulness.
Example: ...the injustice and futility of terrorism.

Definition: To purge an organization of its unacceptable members means to remove them from it. You can also talk about purging people from an organization.
Example: The leadership voted to purge the party of 'hostile and anti-party elements'.

Definition: If you purify a substance, you make it pure by removing any harmful, dirty, or inferior substances from it.
Example: I take wheat and yeast tablets daily to purify the blood.

Definition: Soap is a substance that you use with water for washing yourself or sometimes for washing clothes.
Example: ...a bar of lavender soap.

Definition: If something is happening or working nicely, it is happening or working in a satisfactory way or in the way that you want it to.
Example: She has a bit of private money, so they manage quite nicely.

Definition: If you describe someone as methodical, you mean that they do things carefully, thoroughly, and in order.
Example:
Da Vinci was methodical in his research, carefully recording his observations and
theories.

Definition: If you say that someone is fastidious, you mean that they pay great attention to detail because they like everything to be very neat, accurate, and in good order.
Example: ...her fastidious attention to historical detail.

Definition: If you describe a movement, person, or object as dainty, you mean that they are small, delicate, and pretty.
Example: ...dainty pink flowers.

Definition: If you describe a woman as petite, you are politely saying that she is small and slim.
Example: She was small and petite with long blonde hair.

Definition: Something that is ingenious is very clever and involves new ideas, methods, or equipment.
Example: ...a truly ingenious invention.

Definition: You say that people are vocal when they speak forcefully about something that they feel strongly about.
Example: He has been very vocal in his displeasure over the results.

Definition: If you describe a decision, action, or idea as justified, you think it is reasonable and acceptable.
Example: In my opinion, the decision was wholly justified.

Definition: If something is coherent, it is well planned, so that it is clear and sensible and all its parts go well with each other.
Example: He has failed to work out a coherent strategy for modernising the service.

Definition: Lucid writing or speech is clear and easy to understand.
Example: ...a lucid account of the history of mankind.

Definition: You use blatant to describe something bad that is done in an open or very obvious way.
Example: Outsiders will continue to suffer the most blatant discrimination.

Definition: If you say that something is manifest, you mean that it is clearly true and that nobody would disagree with it if they saw it or considered it.
Example: ...the manifest failure of the policies.

Definition: If you say that something is limpid, you mean that it is very clear and transparent.
Example: ...limpid blue eyes.

Definition: If a person is unconcerned about something, usually something that most people would care about, they are not interested in it or worried about it.
Example: Paul was unconcerned about what he had done.

Definition: not disturbed or troubled
Example: The audience seemed unperturbed by the distant thud of artillery.

Definition: Acquittal is a formal declaration in a court of law that someone who has been accused of a crime is innocent.
Example: ...the acquittal of six police officers charged with perverting the course of justice.

Definition: The ratification of a treaty or written agreement is the process of ratifying it.
Example: The E.U. will now complete ratification of the treaty by June 1.

Definition: An amnesty is an official pardon granted to a group of prisoners by the state.
Example:
Activists who were involved in crimes of violence will not automatically be granted
amnesty.

Definition: If the cost, level, or amount of something  comes down, it becomes less than it was before.
Example: Interest rates should come down.

Definition: If someone who has broken a law or rule  gets off, they are not punished, or are given only a very small punishment.
Example: He is likely to get off with a small fine.

Definition: If something gets you down, it makes you unhappy.
Example: At times when my work gets me down, I like to fantasize about being a farmer.

Definition: If something is alight, it is burning.
Example: She paused and turned, her face alight with happiness.

Definition: You can describe people and things as sexy if you think they are sexually exciting or sexually attractive.
Example: She was one of the sexiest women I had seen.

Definition: A house or room that is cosy is comfortable and warm.
Example: Downstairs there's a breakfast room and guests can relax in the cosy bar.

Definition: Informal speech or behaviour is relaxed and friendly rather than serious, very correct, or official.
Example: She is refreshingly informal.

Definition: If you examine or discuss something in detail, you do it thoroughly and carefully.
Example: We examine the wording in detail before deciding on the final text.

Definition: If you are affectionate, you show your love or fondness for another person in the way that you behave towards them.
Example: They seemed devoted to each other and were openly affectionate.

Definition: A neighbourhood is one of the parts of a town where people live.
Example: It seemed like a good neighbourhood to raise my children.

Definition: Sexual intercourse is the physical act of sex between two people.
Your allegiance is your support for and loyalty to a particular group, person, or belief.
Example: My allegiance to Kendall and his company ran deep.

Definition: Reverence for someone or something is a feeling of great respect for them.
Example: ...showing a deep reverence for their religion.

Definition: Holiness is the state or quality of being holy.
Example: The holiness of God reveals one's own sin.

Definition: Dampness is moisture in the air, or on the surface of something.
Example: I could see big circles of dampness under each arm.

Definition: Smog is a mixture of fog and smoke which occurs in some busy industrial cities.
Example: Cars cause pollution, both smog and acid rain.

Definition: Someone who is in a stupor is almost unconscious and is unable to act or think normally, especially as a result of drink or drugs.
Example: He fell back onto the sofa in a drunken stupor.

Definition: A trance is a state of mind in which someone seems to be asleep and to have no conscious control over their thoughts or actions, but in which they can see and hear things and respond to commands given by other people.
Example: Like a man in a trance, Blake found his way back to his rooms.

Definition: Oblivion is the state of not being aware of what is happening around you, for example because you are asleep or unconscious.
Example: He just drank himself into oblivion.

Definition: If you describe something or someone as an enigma, you mean they are mysterious or difficult to understand.
Example: Iran remains an enigma for the outside world.

Definition: Embarrassment is the feeling you have when you are embarrassed.
Example: It is a source of embarrassment to Londoners that the standard of pubs is so low.

Definition: Chagrin is a feeling of disappointment, upset, or annoyance, perhaps because of your own failure.
Example: Much to his father's chagrin, Al had no taste for further education.

Definition: disfigured or misshapen
Example: But that leadership is deformed by autocracy.

Definition: If you describe something as crooked, especially something that is usually straight, you mean that it is bent or twisted.
Example: ...the crooked line of his broken nose.

Definition: The helm of a boat or ship is the part that is used to steer it.
Example:
I got into our dinghy while Willis took the helm and positioned the boat for the
photograph.

Definition: When someone navigates a ship or an aircraft somewhere, they decide which course to follow and steer it there. You can also say that a ship or an aircraft navigates somewhere.
Example: Captain Cook safely navigated his ship without accident for 100 voyages.

Definition: If you pile up a quantity of things or if they pile up, they gradually form a pile.
Example: Bulldozers piled up huge mounds of dirt.

Definition: When you daub a substance such as mud or paint on something, you spread it on that thing in a rough or careless way.
Example: The make-up woman daubed mock blood on Jeremy.

Definition: If someone is unsympathetic, they are not kind or helpful to a person in difficulties.
Example: Her partner was unsympathetic and she felt she had no one to turn to.

Definition: Frigid means extremely cold.
Example: A snowstorm hit the West today, bringing with it frigid temperatures.

Definition: If you describe something as icy or icy cold, you mean that it is extremely cold.
Example: An icy wind blew hard across the open spaces.

Definition: If you describe something such as a loss as grievous, you mean that it is extremely serious or worrying in its effects.
Example: Their loss would be a grievous blow to our engineering industries.

Definition: the quality or state of being acid
Example: Dishes rich in olive oil go well with red wines high in acidity, which is the case with many Italian reds.

Definition: If you are resentful, you feel resentment.
Example: At first I felt very resentful and angry about losing my job.

Definition: If you are petrified, you are extremely frightened, perhaps so frightened that you cannot think or move.
Example: I've always been petrified of being alone.

Definition: If you describe someone as unfeeling, you are criticizing them for their lack of kindness or sympathy for other people.
Example: He was branded an unfeeling bully.

Definition: unable to move and with no feeling
Example: She stared out at the paralysed, angry traffic, shaking her head.

Definition: astonishment
Example:
He was talking about the Church but I was in such a state of stupefaction that I was
unable to concentrate on his words.

Definition: Paralysis is the loss of the ability to move and feel in all or part of your body.
Example: ...paralysis of the leg.

Definition: lacking sensation or consciousness
Example:
Better yet, turn me into an insensible chair with a broken rush seat, a nail on the
hoof of a horse!

Definition: If someone is paralysed by an accident or an illness, they have no feeling in their body, or in part of their body, and are unable to move.
Example: Her married sister had been paralysed in a road accident.

Definition: When the tide or the sea ebbs, its level gradually falls.
Example: When the tide ebbs it's a rock pool inhabited by crustaceans.

Definition: If you feel dizzy, you feel that you are losing your balance and are about to fall.
Example: Her head still hurt, and she felt slightly dizzy and disoriented.

Definition: If you feel giddy, you feel unsteady and think that you are about to fall over, usually because you are not well.
Example: He felt giddy and light-headed.

Definition: If you feel light-headed, you feel rather unsteady and strange, for example because you are ill or because you have drunk too much alcohol.
Example: If you skip breakfast, you may feel light-headed.

Definition: Languor is a pleasant feeling of being relaxed and not having any energy or interest in anything.
Example: She, in her languor, had not troubled to eat much.

Definition: In Britain, the United States, and some other countries, the Treasury is the government department that deals with the country's finances.
Example: The Treasury has long been predicting an upturn in consumer spending.

Definition: A subscription is an amount of money that you pay regularly in order to belong to an organization, to help a charity or campaign, or to receive copies of a magazine or newspaper.
Example: You can become a member by paying the yearly subscription.

Definition: You can use would-be to describe someone who wants or attempts to do a particular thing. For example, a would-be writer is someone who wants to be a writer.
Example: ...a book that provides encouragement for would-be writers.

Definition: Extravagance is the spending of more money than is reasonable or than you can afford.
Example: ...gross mismanagement and financial extravagance.

Definition: When a group of people applaud, they clap their hands in order to show approval, for example when they have enjoyed a play or concert.
Example: The audience laughed and applauded.

Definition: If someone is heartened by something, it encourages them and makes them cheerful.
Example: He will have been heartened by the opinion poll published yesterday.

Definition: If you find someone's words or actions reassuring, they make you feel less worried about something.
Example: It was reassuring to hear John's familiar voice.

Definition: Something that is restful helps you to feel calm and relaxed.
Example: Adjust the lighting so it is soft and restful.

Definition: If you describe someone as grasping, you are criticizing them for wanting to get and keep as much money as possible, and for being unwilling to spend it.
Example: ...a greedy grasping individual.

Definition: If you describe someone as greedy, you mean that they want to have more of something such as food or money than is necessary or fair.
Example: He attacked greedy bosses for awarding themselves big rises.

Definition: Someone who is faithful to a person, organization, idea, or activity remains firm in their belief in them or support for them.
Example: She had been faithful to her promise to guard this secret.

Definition: If you relegate someone or something to a less important position, you give them this position.
Example: Military heroes were relegated to the status of ordinary citizens.

Definition: the condition or quality of being obedient
Example: Such structure also trained in the virtues of obedience and respect that were built into the larger political system.

Definition: If you describe a person or thing as flashy, you mean they are smart and noticeable, but in a rather vulgar way.
Example: He was much less flashy than his brother.

Definition: the condition or quality of being crude
Example: Jo-Beth stared at its crudity: the meat-face stared back at her.

Definition: If you describe a person as uncouth, you mean that their behaviour is rude, noisy, and unpleasant.
Example: ...that oafish, uncouth person.

Definition: Boorish behaviour is rough, uneducated, and rude.
Example: ...their boorish rejection of the ageing movie star.

Definition: If you say that someone is impolite, you mean that they are rather rude and do not have good manners.
Example: It is impolite to ask too many questions.

Definition: the condition of being vulgar; lack of good manners
Example: She took refuge in this extravagant, romantic atmosphere when she felt weighed down by the vulgarity of real life.

Definition: The readership of a book, newspaper, or magazine is the number or type of people who read it.
Example: Its readership has grown to over 15,000 subscribers.

Definition: Your bloodstream is the blood that flows around your body.
Example: The disease releases toxins into the bloodstream.

Definition: Fraternity refers to friendship and support between people who feel they are closely linked to each other.
Example: Bob needs the fraternity of others who share his mission.

Definition: If something happens in conformity with something such as a law or someone's wishes, it happens as the law says it should, or as the person wants it to.
Example: The prime minister is, in conformity with the constitution, chosen by the president.

Definition: If there is a semblance of a particular condition or quality, it appears to exist, even though this may be a false impression.
Example: At least a semblance of normality has been restored to parts of the country.

Definition: If you describe something as disorderly, you mean that it is untidy, irregular, or disorganized.
Example: ...a large and disorderly room.

Definition: A turbulent time, place, or relationship is one in which there is a lot of change, confusion, and disorder.
Example: They had been together for five or six turbulent years of rows and reconciliations.

Definition: Someone or something that is bothersome is annoying or irritating.
Example: It's all been very noisy and bothersome in Parliament this week.

Definition: Something that is an integral part of something is an essential part of that thing.
Example: Rituals and festivals form an integral part of every human society.

Definition: The confluence of two rivers is the place where they join and become one larger river.
Example: The 160-metre falls mark the dramatic confluence of the rivers Nera and Velino.

Definition: Perils are great dangers.
Example: ...the perils of the sea.

Definition: Nutritious food contains substances which help your body to be healthy.
Example: It is always important to choose enjoyable, nutritious foods.

Definition: Something that is healthful is good for your health.
Example: Does the college cafeteria provide a healthful diet?

Definition: A person's or thing's reliance on something is the fact that they need it and often cannot live or work without it.
Example: ...the country's increasing reliance on foreign aid.

Definition: If you have self-confidence, you behave confidently because you feel sure of your abilities or value.
Example: With the end of my love affair, I lost all the self-confidence I once had.

Definition: Self-possession is the quality of being self-possessed.
Example: She found her customary self-possession had deserted her.

Definition: An oath is a formal promise, especially a promise to be loyal to a person or country.
Example: He took an oath of loyalty to the government.

Definition: the act of confirming
Example: She then sent the reservation confirmation for a very expensive restaurant.

Definition: Antipathy is a strong feeling of dislike or hostility towards someone or something.
Example: She'd often spoken of her antipathy towards London.

Definition: You use mayhem to refer to a situation that is not controlled or ordered, when people are behaving in a disorganized, confused, and often violent way.
Example: Their arrival caused mayhem as crowds of people rushed towards them.

Definition: If you are suspicious of someone or something, you do not trust them, and are careful when dealing with them.
Example:
He was rightly suspicious of meeting me until I reassured him I was not writing about
him.

Definition: A consonant is a sound such as ' p', ' f', 'n', or ' t' which you pronounce by stopping the air flowing freely through your mouth. Compare vowel.
Example: I found their work very much consonant with this way of thinking.

Definition: A congenial person, place, or environment is pleasant.
Example: He is back in more congenial company.

Definition: If you have an affinity with someone or something, you feel that you are similar to them or that you know and understand them very well.
Example: He has a close affinity with the landscape he knew when he was growing up.

Definition: Like-minded people have similar opinions, ideas, attitudes, or interests.
Example: ...the opportunity to mix with hundreds of like-minded people.

Definition: Empathy is the ability to share another person's feelings and emotions as if they were your own.
Example: Having begun my life in a children's home I have great empathy with the little ones.

Definition: If two people or groups have a rapport, they have a good relationship in which they are able to understand each other's ideas or feelings very well.
Example: He said he wanted 'to establish a rapport with the Indian people'.

Definition: If you say that someone personifies a particular thing or quality, you mean that they seem to be a perfect example of that thing, or to have that quality to a very large degree.
Example: She seemed to personify goodness and nobility.

Definition: Things which are simultaneous happen or exist at the same time.
Example: ...the simultaneous release of the book and the album.

Definition: Concomitant is used to describe something that happens at the same time as another thing and is connected with it.
Example: Cultures that were better at trading saw a concomitant increase in their wealth.

Definition: If you say that someone is smug, you are criticizing the fact they seem very pleased with how good, clever, or lucky they are.
Example: Thomas and his wife looked at each other in smug satisfaction.

Definition: A summary of something is a short account of it, which gives the main points but not the details.
Example: What follows is a brief summary of the process.

Definition: A synopsis is a summary of a longer piece of writing or work.
Example: For each title there is a brief synopsis of the book.

Definition: A screw is a metal object similar to a nail, with a raised spiral line around it. You turn a screw using a screwdriver so that it goes through two things, for example two pieces of wood, and fastens them together.
Example: Each bracket is fixed to the wall with just three screws.

Definition: If there is a disparity between two or more things, there is a noticeable difference between them.
Example: ...disparities in pay between men and women.

Definition: A tribute is something that you say, do, or make to show your admiration and respect for someone.
Example: The song is a tribute to Roy Orbison.

Definition: Willpower is a very strong determination to do something.
Example: I know I've got the willpower to do it.

Definition: Someone who is argumentative is always ready to disagree or start quarrelling with other people.
Example: You're in an argumentative mood today!

Definition: Someone who is perverse deliberately does things that are unreasonable or that result in harm for themselves.
Example: It would be perverse to stop this healthy trend.

Definition: If you rearrange things, you change the way in which they are organized or ordered.
Example: When she returned, she found Malcolm had rearranged all her furniture.

Definition:
When a political leader reshuffles the ministers in a government, he or she changes their jobs so that some of the ministers change
their responsibilities.
Example:
The prime minister told reporters this morning that he plans to reshuffle his entire
cabinet.

Definition: A governing body or organization is one which controls a particular activity.
Example: The league became the governing body for amateur fencing in the U.S.

Definition: The reigning champion is the most recent winner of a contest or competition at the time you are talking about.
Example: ...the reigning world champion.

Definition: If you describe something, especially a place, climate, or activity as bracing, you mean that it makes you feel fresh and full of energy.
Example: ...a bracing walk.

Definition: If you describe someone or something as sedate, you mean that they are quiet and rather dignified, though perhaps a bit dull.
Example: She took them to visit her sedate, elderly cousins.

Definition: Something that is tranquil is calm and peaceful.
Example: The tranquil atmosphere of The Connaught allows guests to feel totally at home.

Definition: If you placate someone, you do or say something to make them stop feeling angry.
Example: He smiled, trying to placate me.

Definition: If you mollify someone, you do or say something to make them less upset or angry.
Example: The investigation was undertaken primarily to mollify pressure groups.

Definition: If you are casual, you are, or you pretend to be, relaxed and not very concerned about what is happening or what you are doing.
Example: It's difficult for me to be casual about anything.

Definition: Water or another liquid that is tepid is slightly warm.
Example: She bent her mouth to the tap and drank the tepid water.

Definition: If someone does something in a half-hearted way, they do it without any real effort, interest, or enthusiasm.
Example: The previous owner had made a half-hearted attempt at renovating the place.

Definition: If you describe someone as apathetic, you are criticizing them because they do not seem to be interested in or enthusiastic about doing anything.
Example: Even the most apathetic students are beginning to sit up and listen.

Definition: You can use apathy to talk about someone's state of mind if you are criticizing them because they do not seem to be interested in or enthusiastic about anything.
Example: They told me about isolation and public apathy.

Definition: If someone is guilty of negligence, they have failed to do something which they ought to do.
Example: The soldiers were ordered to appear before a disciplinary council on charges of negligence.

Definition: A replica of something such as a statue, building, or weapon is an accurate copy of it.
Example: ...a human-sized replica of the Statue of Liberty.

Definition: If you say that there has been duplication of something, you mean that someone has done a task unnecessarily because it has already been done before.
Example: ...unnecessary duplication of resources.

Definition: If someone says that a person has breeding, they mean that they think the person is from a good social background and has good manners.
Example: It's a sign of good breeding to know the names of all your staff.

Definition: a propagating or being propagated
Example: `The propagation of life is the fundamental algorithm of life.

Definition: Fidelity is loyalty to a person, organization, or set of beliefs.
Example: I had to promise fidelity to the Queen.

Definition: Etiquette is a set of customs and rules for polite behaviour, especially among a particular class of people or in a particular profession.
Example: This was such a great breach of etiquette, he hardly knew what to do.

Definition: Protocol is a system of rules about the correct way to act in formal situations.
Example: He has become something of a stickler for the finer observances of royal protocol.

Definition: Someone's foresight is their ability to see what is likely to happen in the future and to take appropriate action.
Example: He was later criticised for his lack of foresight.

Definition: A tally is a record of amounts or numbers which you keep changing and adding to as the activity which affects it progresses.
Example: They do not keep a tally of visitors to the palace, but it is very popular.

Definition: If you  hit back when someone hits you, or hit them back, you hit them in return.
Example: Some violent men beat up their sons, until the boys are strong enough to hit back.

Definition: If you  strike back, you harm or criticize someone who has harmed or criticized you.
Example: Our instinctive reaction when someone causes us pain is to strike back.

Definition: Vengeance is the act of killing, injuring, or harming someone because they have harmed you.
Example: He swore vengeance on everyone involved in the murder.

Definition: If you do something to a person in reprisal, you hurt or punish them because they have done something violent or unpleasant to you.
Example: There were fears that some of the Western hostages might be killed in reprisal.

Definition: If you describe someone as effusive, you mean that they express pleasure, gratitude, or approval in a very enthusiastic way.
Example: He was effusive in his praise for the general.

Definition: If you describe expressions of praise, apology, or gratitude as fulsome, you disapprove of them because they are exaggerated and elaborate, so that they sound insincere.
Example: Newspapers have been fulsome in their praise of the former president.

Definition: a judge or magistrate sitting in court in a judicial capacity
Example: De Ruiter eased down onto the bench, wiping his neck with a handkerchief, still breathing heavily.

Definition: If an unpleasant event or feeling overshadows something, it makes it less happy or enjoyable.
Example: Fears for the President's safety could overshadow his peace-making mission.

Definition: Solace is a feeling of comfort that makes you feel less sad.
Example: I found solace in writing when my father died three years ago.

Definition: A refund is a sum of money which is returned to you, for example because you have paid too much or because you have returned goods to a shop.
Example: We guarantee to refund your money if you're not delighted with your purchase.

Definition: If you reimburse someone for something, you pay them back the money that they have spent or lost because of it.
