Example: I'll be happy to reimburse you for any expenses you might have incurred.

Definition: Journalism is the job of collecting news and writing about it for newspapers, magazines, television, or radio.
Example: He began a career in journalism, working for the North London Press Group.

Definition: Someone who feels intimidated feels frightened and lacks confidence because of the people they are with or the situation they are in.
Example: Women can come in here and not feel intimidated.

Definition: If something terrifies you, it makes you feel extremely frightened.
Example: Flying terrifies him.

Definition: A rift between people or countries is a serious quarrel or disagreement that stops them having a good relationship.
Example: The interview reflected a growing rift between the President and the government.

Definition: Balm is a sweet-smelling oil that is obtained from some tropical trees and used to make creams that heal wounds or reduce pain.
Example: The place is balm to the soul.

Definition: If you do something to salve your conscience, you do it in order to feel less guilty.
Example: I give myself treats and justify them to salve my conscience.

Definition: the union of male and female gametes, during sexual reproduction, to form a zygote
Example: fertilization of the ovum, the matter most on his mind that morning.

Definition: If you muse on something, you think about it, usually saying or writing what you are thinking at the same time.
Example: Many of the papers muse on the fate of the President.

Definition: If you describe someone as a lackey, you are critical of them because they follow someone's orders completely, without ever questioning them.
Example: I'm not staying as a paid lackey to act as your yes-man.

Definition: Applause is the noise made by a group of people clapping their hands to show approval.
Example: They greeted him with thunderous applause.

Definition: encouraging shouts from supporters, admirers etc
Example: The youths still hanging around on the stoop opposite began cheering, or jeering, he couldn't tell which.

Definition: When someone such as a priest blesses people or things, he or she asks for God's favour and protection for them.
Example:
...asking for all present to bless this couple and their loving commitment to one
another.

Definition: Misconduct is bad or unacceptable behaviour, especially by a professional person.
Example: He was dismissed from his job for gross misconduct.

Definition: Wrongdoing is behaviour that is illegal or immoral.
Example: The city attorney's office hasn't found any evidence of criminal wrongdoing.

Definition: Someone's assailant is a person who has physically attacked them.
Example: Other party-goers rescued the injured man from his assailant.

Definition: Raiders are people who enter a building or place by force in order to steal something.
Example: The raiders escaped with cash and jewellery.

Definition: An intruder is a person who goes into a place where they are not supposed to be.
Example: Welcome your guests and alarm potential intruders with this solar welcome light.

Definition: If someone expurgates a piece of writing, they remove parts of it before it is published because they think those parts will offend or shock people.
Example: He heavily expurgated the work in its second edition.

Definition: To bowdlerize a book or film means to take parts of it out before publishing it or showing it.
Example:
I'm bowdlerizing itjust slightly changing one or two words so listeners won't be
upset.

Definition: If you are contemptuous of someone or something, you do not like or respect them at all.
Example: He was contemptuous of private farmers.

Definition: causing a loss of confidence and determination
Example: The government was to interfere in the economy only by encouraging trusts and monopolies and discouraging competition.

Definition: If you have contempt for someone or something, you have no respect for them or think that they are unimportant.
Example: He has contempt for those beyond his immediate family circle.

Definition: If you ridicule someone or ridicule their ideas or beliefs, you make fun of them in an unkind way.
Example: I admired her all the more for allowing them to ridicule her and never striking back.

Definition: To discredit someone or something means to cause them to lose people's respect or trust.
Example: ...a secret unit within the company that had been set up to discredit its major rival.

Definition: An abrasion is an area on a person's body where the skin has been scraped.
Example: He had severe abrasions to his right cheek.

Definition: The populace of a country is its people.
Example: ...a large proportion of the populace.

Definition: If you describe a crowd of people as a horde, you mean that the crowd is very large and excited and, often, rather frightening or unpleasant.
Example: This attracts hordes of tourists to Las Vegas.

Definition: Drove is the past tense of drive.
Example: People invested in droves, longing to get rich quick.

Definition: If you say that a situation, problem, or feeling is festering, you disapprove of the fact that it is being allowed to grow more unpleasant or full of anger, because it is not being properly recognized or dealt with.
Example: Resentments are starting to fester.

Definition: (of a wound, sore, etc) to discharge pus; fester
Example: Inflammation spreads to the lymph nodes, which enlarge and may suppurate ( mimicking bubonic plague).

Definition: Blubber is the fat of whales, seals, and similar sea animals.
Example: The baby whale develops a thick layer of blubber to protect it from the cold sea.

Definition: If someone whimpers, they make quiet unhappy or frightened sounds, as if they are about to start crying.
Example: She lay at the bottom of the stairs, whimpering in pain.

Definition: If someone wails, they make long, loud, high-pitched cries which express sorrow or pain.
Example: The women began to wail in mourning.

Definition: If you have an inquiring mind, you have a great interest in learning new things.
Example: I have always had an enquiring mind where food is concerned.

Definition: A slug is a small slow-moving creature with a long soft body and no legs, like a snail without a shell.
Example: Edgar took a slug of his drink.

Definition: A mouthful of drink or food is the amount that you put or have in your mouth.
Example: She gulped down a mouthful of coffee.

Definition: When an artist sculpts something, they carve or shape it out of a material such as stone or clay.
Example: An artist sculpted a full-size replica of her head.

Definition: If a line or pattern is etched into a surface, it is cut into the surface by means of acid or a sharp tool. You can also say that a surface is etched with a line or pattern.
Example: Crosses were etched into the walls.

Definition: If you engrave something with a design or words, or if you engrave a design or words on it, you cut the design or words into its surface.
Example: Your wedding ring can be engraved with a personal inscription at no extra cost.

Definition: If you inscribe words on an object, you write or carve the words on the object.
Example: Some galleries commemorate donors by inscribing their names on the walls.

Definition: To shear a sheep means to cut its wool off.
Example: In the Hebrides they shear their sheep later than anywhere else.

Definition: Customs is the official organization responsible for collecting taxes on goods coming into a country and preventing illegal goods from being brought in.
Example: ...components similar to those seized by British customs.

Definition: If something is a blot on a person's or thing's reputation, it spoils their reputation.
Example: ...a blot on the reputation of the architectural profession.

Definition: If something discolours or if it is discoloured by something else, its original colour changes, so that it looks unattractive.
Example: A tooth which has been hit hard may discolour.

Definition: inflated amounts or prices are higher than they should be
Example: It was a big raft, two meters in diameter with an inflated side that was roughly knee-high.

Definition: Something that is shattering shocks and upsets you very much.
Example: The experience of their daughter's death had been absolutely shattering.

Definition: An escapade is an exciting and rather dangerous adventure.
Example: ...the scene of Robin Hood's escapades.

Definition: Mischief is playing harmless tricks on people or doing things you are not supposed to do. It can also refer to the desire to do this.
Example: The little lad was a real handful. He was always up to mischief.

Definition: If you use stealth when you do something, you do it quietly and carefully so that no one will notice what you are doing.
Example: Health policy is being changed by stealth without consultation.

Definition: the quality or state of being stupid
Example: The sheer stupidity of the bloke is beyond belief.

Definition: If you are secretive, you like to have secrets and to keep your knowledge, feelings, or intentions hidden.
Example: Billionaires are usually fairly secretive about the exact amount that they're worth.

Definition: Someone or something that is enigmatic is mysterious and difficult to understand.
Example: Haley studied her, an enigmatic smile on his face.

Definition: If you describe someone as evasive, you mean that they deliberately avoid giving clear direct answers to questions.
Example: He was evasive about the circumstances of his first meeting with Stanley Dean.

Definition: Someone who is sullen is bad-tempered and does not speak much.
Example: The offenders lapsed into a sullen silence.

Definition: If you describe someone as moody, you mean that their feelings and behaviour change frequently, and in particular that they often become depressed or angry without any warning.
Example: David's mother was unstable and moody.

Definition: If you say that someone is grumpy, you mean that they are bad-tempered and miserable.
Example: Some folk think I'm a grumpy old man.

Definition: If a person or animal is lifeless, they are dead, or are so still that they appear to be dead.
Example:
Their cold-blooded killers had then dragged their lifeless bodies upstairs to the
bathroom.

Definition: Someone or something that is inert does not move at all.
Example: He covered the inert body with a blanket.

Definition: A broker is a person whose job is to buy and sell shares, foreign money, or goods for other people.
Example: He has already brokered a peace treaty that will come into force on Friday.

Definition: A seller of a type of thing is a person or company that sells that type of thing.
Example: ...a flower seller.

Definition: A promoter is a person who helps organize and finance an event, especially a sports event.
Example: ...one of the top boxing promoters in Britain.

Definition: You use the going to talk about how easy or difficult it is to do something. You can also say that something is, for example,  hard going or  tough going.
Example: He has her support to fall back on when the going gets tough.

Definition: a variation in the strength of received radio signals due to variations in the conditions of the transmission medium
Example: I suggest she could do another remake in 30 years, with her as a fading star.

Definition: Fallen is the past participle of fall.
Example: Work began on establishing the cemeteries as permanent memorials to the fallen.

Definition: If someone is soundly defeated or beaten, they are severely defeated or beaten.
Example: Duke was soundly defeated in this month's Louisiana governor's race.

Definition: When you are conciliatory in your actions or behaviour, you show that you are willing to end a disagreement with someone.
Example: The next time he spoke he used a more conciliatory tone.

Definition: Someone who is peaceable tries to avoid quarrelling or fighting with other people.
Example: ...an attempt by ruthless people to impose their will on a peaceable majority.

Definition: A placatory remark or action is intended to make someone stop feeling angry.
Example: When next he spoke he was more placatory.

Definition: Someone or something that is serene is calm and quiet.
Example: She looked as calm and serene as she always did.

Definition: A placid person or animal is calm and does not easily become excited, angry, or upset.
Example: She was a placid child who rarely cried.

Definition: the act or an instance of penetrating
Example: His pace and penetration caused them a bit of bother.

Definition: If you refer to the rigours of an activity or job, you mean the difficult, demanding, or unpleasant things that are associated with it.
Example: He found the rigours of the tour too demanding.

Definition: If a person or their actions or comments are vehement, the person has very strong feelings or opinions and expresses them forcefully.
Example: She suddenly became very vehement and agitated, jumping around and shouting.

Definition: If you lament something, you express your sadness, regret, or disappointment about it.
Example: Ken began to lament the death of his only son.

Definition: A sonorous sound is deep and rich.
Example: 'Doctor McKee?' the man called in an even, sonorous voice.

Definition: If something demoralizes someone, it makes them lose so much confidence in what they are doing that they want to give up.
Example:
Clearly, one of the objectives is to demoralize the enemy troops in any way they
can.

Definition: If you overpower someone, you manage to take hold of and keep hold of them, although they struggle a lot.
Example: It took ten guardsmen to overpower him.

Definition: A swamp is an area of very wet land with wild plants growing in it.
Example: A rogue wave swamped the boat.

Definition: the act of seducing or the state of being seduced
Example: The seduction scene in the last episode?

Definition: A spiny plant or animal is covered with long sharp points.
Example: ...a spiny lobster.

Definition: A barbed remark or joke seems polite or humorous, but contains a cleverly hidden criticism.
Example: ...barbed comments.

Definition: Bristly hair is thick and rough.
Example: His bristly red hair was standing on end.

Definition: If someone is edgy, they are nervous and anxious, and seem likely to lose control of themselves.
Example: She was nervous and edgy.

Definition: You use strangely to emphasize that what you are saying is surprising.
Example: Strangely, the race didn't start until 8.15pm.

Definition: If you saunter somewhere, you walk there in a slow, casual way.
Example: We watched our fellow students saunter into the building.

Definition: A potter is someone who makes pottery.
Example: Could he potter around and enjoy life as much?

Definition: Your intonation is the way that your voice rises and falls as you speak.
Example: His voice had a very slight German intonation.

Definition: Self-determination is the right of a country to be independent, instead of being controlled by a foreign country, and to choose its own form of government.
Example: They died for the right of a group of people to self-determination.

Definition: If one thing negates another, it causes that other thing to lose the effect or value that it had.
Example: These weaknesses negated his otherwise progressive attitude towards the staff.

Definition: If you disclaim knowledge of something or disclaim responsibility for something, you say that you did not know about it or are not responsible for it.
Example: She disclaims any knowledge of her husband's business.

Definition: If something is disallowed, it is not allowed or accepted officially, because it has not been done correctly.
Example: England scored again, but the whistle had gone and the goal was disallowed.

Definition: If something is proscribed by people in authority, the existence or the use of that thing is forbidden.
Example: In some cultures surgery is proscribed.

Definition: A pessimist is someone who thinks that bad things are going to happen.
Example: I'm a natural pessimist; I usually expect the worst.

Definition: If you call someone a killjoy, you are critical of them because they stop other people from enjoying themselves, often by reminding them of something unpleasant.
Example: Don't be such a killjoy!

Definition: If you describe someone as cynical, you mean they believe that people always act selfishly.
Example: ...his cynical view of the world.

Definition: When archaeologists or other people excavate a piece of land, they remove earth carefully from it and look for things such as pots, bones, or buildings which are buried there, in order to discover information about the past.
Example: A new Danish expedition is again excavating the site in annual summer digs.

Definition: If you bathe in a sea, river, or lake, you swim, play, or wash yourself in it. Birds and animals can also bathe.
Example: The police have warned the city's inhabitants not to bathe in the polluted river.

Definition: A duck is a very common water bird with short legs, a short neck, and a large flat beak.
Example: Chickens and ducks scratch around the outbuildings.

Definition: If you say that someone has gravitas, you mean that you respect them because they seem serious and intelligent.
Example:
He is pale, dark, and authoritative, with the gravitas you might expect of a Booker
prize winner.

Definition: A complication is a problem or difficulty that makes a situation harder to deal with.
Example: The age difference was a complication to the relationship.

Definition: An entanglement is a complicated or difficult relationship or situation.
Example: ...romantic entanglements.

Definition: The cessation of something is the stopping of it.
Example: He would not agree to a cessation of hostilities.

Definition: Disloyalty is disloyal behaviour.
Example: Charges had already been made against certain officials suspected of disloyalty.

Definition: Treason is the crime of betraying your country, for example by helping its enemies or by trying to remove its government using violence.
Example: Others have been arrested by rebel colleagues on charges of treason.

Definition: The renunciation of a belief or a way of behaving is the public declaration that you reject it and have decided to stop having that belief or behaving in that way.
Example: The talks were dependent on a renunciation of violence.

Definition: Lechery is the behaviour of men who are only interested in other people sexually.
Example:
His lechery made him the enemy of every self-respecting husband and father in the
county.

Definition: Your palate is the top part of the inside of your mouth.
Example: ...fresh pasta sauces to tempt more demanding palates.

Definition: A butcher is a shopkeeper who cuts up and sells meat. Some butchers also kill animals for meat and make foods such as sausages and meat pies.
Example: All his meat is butchered on site before being sold in the farm shop.

Definition: If someone in authority abolishes a system or practice, they formally put an end to it.
Example: The following year Parliament voted to abolish the death penalty for murder.

Definition: a cheap ornament; trinket
Example: He is, after all, wearing a knick-knack festooned with their skeleton-and-roses logo.

Definition: An inscription is writing carved into something made of stone or metal, for example a gravestone or medal.
Example: Above its doors was a Latin inscription: Non omnia possumus omnes.

Definition: Abstention is a formal act of not voting either for or against a proposal.
Example: ...a vote of sixteen in favor, three against, and one abstention.

Definition: self-restraint; moderation
Example: `Give me chastity, Lord," Augustine had prayed, `Give me continence But not yet!

Definition: If you believe in temperance, you disapprove of drinking alcohol.
Example: ...a reformed alcoholic extolling the joys of temperance.

Definition: Self-denial is the habit of refusing to do or have things that you would like, either because you cannot afford them, or because you believe it is morally good for you not to do them or have them.
Example: Should motherhood necessarily mean sacrifice and self-denial?

Definition: If there is a discrepancy between two things that ought to be the same, there is a noticeable difference between them.
Example: ...the discrepancy between press and radio reports.

Definition: Someone or something that is annoying makes you feel fairly angry and impatient.
Example: You must have found my attitude annoying.

Definition: Something that is embarrassing makes you feel shy or ashamed.
Example: That was an embarrassing situation for me.

Definition: Something that is inconvenient causes problems or difficulties for someone.
Example: Can you come at 10.30? I know it's inconvenient for you, but I must see you.

Definition: Something that is cumbersome is large and heavy and therefore difficult to carry, wear, or handle.
Example: Although the machine looks cumbersome, it is actually easy to use.

Definition: Discomfort is a painful feeling in part of your body when you have been hurt slightly or when you have been uncomfortable for a long time.
Example: She carried her left arm at an awkward angle, as if it were causing her discomfort.

Definition:
If you describe someone as uncooperative, you mean that they make no effort at all to help other people or to make other people's lives
easier.
Example:
She became uncooperative: unwilling to do her homework or help with any household
chores.

Definition: A sieve is a tool used for separating solids from liquids or larger pieces of something from smaller pieces. It consists of a metal or plastic ring with a wire or plastic net underneath, which the liquid or smaller pieces pass through.
Example: Press the raspberries through a fine sieve to form a puree.

Definition:
To filter a substance means to pass it through a device which is designed to remove certain
particles contained in it.
Example:
The best prevention for cholera is to boil or filter water, and eat only well-cooked
food.

Definition: If you sift a powder such as flour or sand, you put it through a sieve in order to remove large pieces or lumps.
Example: Sift the flour and baking powder into a medium-sized mixing bowl.

Definition: A melody is a tune.
Example: Her voice was full of melody.

Definition: To jeer at someone means to say or shout rude and insulting things to them to show that you do not like or respect them.
Example: Marchers jeered at passers-by, but there was no violence, nor any arrests.

Definition: If you jab one thing into another, you push it there with a quick, sudden movement and with a lot of force.
Example: He saw her jab her thumb on a red buttona panic button.

Definition: If something juts out, it sticks out above or beyond a surface.
Example: The northern end of the island juts out like a long, thin finger into the sea.

Definition: Something that gives a process impetus or an impetus makes it happen or progress more quickly.
Example: This decision will give renewed impetus to the economic regeneration of east London.

Definition: If you jog, you run slowly, often as a form of exercise.
Example: I got up early the next morning to jog.

Definition: Enjoyment is the feeling of pleasure and satisfaction that you have when you do or experience something that you like.
Example: I apologise if your enjoyment of the movie was spoiled.

Definition: When you are candid about something or with someone, you speak honestly.
Example: Nat is candid about the problems she is having with Steve.

Definition: If you say or do something in public, you say or do it when a group of people are present.
Example: Many people are nervous about speaking in public.

Definition: If you describe something as misshapen, you think that it does not have a normal or natural shape.
Example: ...misshapen vegetables.

Definition: An arched roof, window, or doorway is curved at the top.
Example: ...a fortified arched bridge spanning the River Severn.

Definition: A situation that exists at present exists now, although it may change.
Example: There is no way at present of predicting which individuals will develop the disease.

Definition: Mud is a sticky mixture of earth and water.
Example: His uniform was crumpled, untidy, splashed with mud.

Definition: Manure is animal faeces, sometimes mixed with chemicals, that is spread on the ground in order to make plants grow healthy and strong.
Example: ...bags of manure.

Definition: Dung is faeces from animals, especially from large animals such as cattle and horses.
Hearsay is information which you have been told but do not know to be true.
Example: Much of what was reported to them was hearsay.

Definition: If you refer to something that a group of people talk about as tittle-tattle, you mean that you disapprove of it because it is not important, and there is no real evidence that it is true.
Example: ...tittle-tattle about the private lives of minor celebrities.

Definition: If someone is blathering on about something, they are talking for a long time about something that you consider boring or unimportant.
Example: The old men blather on and on.

Definition: If you refer to someone as a busybody, you are criticizing the way they interfere in other people's affairs.
Example: This government is full of interfering busybodies.

Definition: If something nauseates you, it makes you feel as if you are going to vomit.
Example: The smell of frying nauseated her.

Definition: When an army repels an attack, they successfully fight and drive back soldiers from another army who have attacked them.
Example: They have fifty thousand troops along the border ready to repel any attack.

Definition: If you  fall back, you move backwards a short distance away from someone or something.
Example: He fell back in embarrassment when he saw that Ross had no hair at all.

Definition: to withdraw; retreat
Example: It's understandable, this desire to draw back.

Definition: A calamity is an event that causes a great deal of damage, destruction, or personal distress.
Example: He described drugs as the greatest calamity of the age.

Definition: An admonition is a warning or criticism about someone's behaviour.
Example: She ignored the admonitions of her mother.

Definition: If you rebuke someone, you speak severely to them because they have said or done something that you do not approve of.
Example:
The company has been publicly rebuked by one of its largest shareholders over its
executive pay levels.

Definition: If you concoct an excuse or explanation, you invent one that is not true.
Example: Mr Ferguson said the prisoner concocted the story to get a lighter sentence.

Definition: If one person or institution forges an agreement or relationship with another, they create it with a lot of hard work, hoping that it will be strong or lasting.
Example:
The Prime Minister is determined to forge a good relationship with America's new
leader.

Definition: Colonists are the people who start a colony or the people who are among the first to live in a particular colony.
Example: The apple was brought over here by the colonists when they came.

Definition: If you say that something is an omen, you think it indicates what is likely to happen in the future and whether it will be good or bad.
Example: Her appearance at this moment is an omen of disaster.

Definition: A portent is something that indicates what is likely to happen in the future.
Example:
The savage civil war there could be a portent of what's to come in the rest of the
region.

Definition: If you treat someone or something with scorn, you show contempt for them.
Example: Researchers greeted the proposal with scorn.

Definition: A reversal of a process, policy, or trend is a complete change in it.
Example:
The Financial Times says the move represents a complete reversal of previous U.S.
policy.

Definition: If you defer an event or action, you arrange for it to happen at a later date, rather than immediately or at the previously planned time.
Example: Customers often defer payment for as long as possible.

Definition: When a thick or sticky liquid oozes from something or when something oozes it, the liquid flows slowly and in small quantities.
Example: Blood was still oozing from the cut on his arm.

Definition:
Secretion is the process by which certain liquid substances are produced by parts of plants
or from the bodies of people or animals.
Example: ...the secretion of adrenaline.

Definition: When you set off, you start a journey.
Example: Nichols set off for his remote farmhouse in Connecticut.

Definition: If something such as your imagination runs riot, it is not limited or controlled, and produces ideas that are new or exciting, rather than sensible.
Example:
She dressed strictly for comfort and economy, but let her imagination run riot with
costume jewelry.

Definition: A murky place or time of day is dark and rather unpleasant because there is not enough light.
Example: The large lamplit room was murky with woodsmoke.

Definition: If you are unsure of yourself, you lack confidence.
Example: He made her feel hot, and awkward, and unsure of herself.

Definition: If you describe someone or something as unpredictable, you mean that you cannot tell what they are going to do or how they are going to behave.
Example: He is utterly unpredictable.

Definition: A subsidiary or a subsidiary company is a company which is part of a larger and more important company.
Example: Offshore banks are often formed as a subsidiary of an international bank.

Definition: A circuitous route is long and complicated rather than simple and direct.
Example: The cabdriver took them on a circuitous route to the police station.

Definition: a curving or sinuous course or movement
Example: the winding on an electric coil

Definition: A roundabout is a circular structure in the road at a place where several roads meet. You drive round it until you come to the road that you want.
Example: The party took a roundabout route overland.

Definition: If you describe a statement as oblique, you mean that is not expressed directly or openly, making it difficult to understand.
Example: It was an oblique reference to his mother.

Definition:
A backhanded compliment is a remark which seems to be an insult but could also be understood as a compliment. A backhanded compliment is also a remark which seems to be a compliment but could also be understood
as an insult.
Example:
Then there are the backhanded compliments. For instance: That's an interesting dress.
Did you make it?

Definition: If you say that someone has a dreamy expression, you mean that they are not paying attention to things around them and look as if they are thinking about something pleasant.
Example: His face assumed a sort of dreamy expression.

Definition: A vacancy is a job or position which has not been filled.
Example: They had a short-term vacancy for a person on the foreign desk.

Definition: Dud means not working properly or not successful.
Example: He replaced a dud valve.

Definition: If you are preoccupied, you are thinking a lot about something or someone, and so you hardly notice other things.
Example:
Tom Banbury was preoccupied with the missing Shepherd child and did not want to devote
time to the new murder.

Definition: Someone who is assertive states their needs and opinions clearly, so that people take notice.
Example: Debating encourages children to be more assertive.

Definition: If you antagonize someone, you make them feel angry or hostile towards you.
Example: He didn't want to antagonize her.

Definition: Estrangement is the state of being estranged from someone or the length of time for which you are estranged.
Example: The trip will bring to an end years of estrangement between the two countries.

Definition: Farewell means the same as goodbye.
Example: They said their farewells there at the cafe.

Definition: You say 'Goodbye' to someone when you or they are leaving, or at the end of a phone conversation.
Example:
He said his goodbyes knowing that a long time would pass before he would see his
child again.

Definition: the act of departing; a farewell
Example: These were the formal front courts for greetings and leave-takings.

Definition: To substantiate a statement or a story means to supply evidence which proves that it is true.
Example: There is little scientific evidence to substantiate the claims.

Definition: attracting attention; striking
Example: There is no denying the visually arresting imagery.

Definition: If you are in a predicament, you are in an unpleasant situation that is difficult to get out of.
Example: Hank explained our predicament.

Definition: If you slink somewhere, you move there quietly because you do not want to be seen.
Example: He decided that he couldn't just slink away, so he went and sat next to his wife.

Definition: A sycophant is a person who behaves in a sycophantic way.
Example: ...a dictator surrounded by sycophants, frightened to tell him what he may not like.

Definition: Interim is used to describe something that is intended to be used until something permanent is done or established.
Example: She was sworn in as head of an interim government in March.

Definition: Something that is exaggerated is or seems larger, better, worse, or more important than it actually needs to be.
Example: They should be sceptical of exaggerated claims for what such courses can achieve.

Definition: Melodramatic behaviour is behaviour in which someone treats a situation as much more serious than it really is.
Example: 'Don't you think you're being rather melodramatic?' Jane asked.

Definition: If you refer to someone's behaviour as histrionic, you are critical of it because it is very dramatic, exaggerated, and insincere.
Example: Dorothea let out a histrionic groan.

Definition: If a liquid such as whisky or water is distilled, it is heated until it changes into steam or vapour and then cooled until it becomes liquid again. This is usually done in order to make it pure.
Example: The whisky had been distilled in 1926 and sat quietly maturing until 1987.

Definition: the act, process, or product of distilling
Example: This time the objects have undergone a process of distillation into primal forms.

Definition: If you elicit a response or a reaction, you do or say something which makes other people respond or react.
Example: He spoke for a long time, trying to elicit some comment or response from Hanuman.

Definition: A hallucination is the experience of seeing something that is not really there because you are ill or have taken a drug.
Example: The drug induces hallucinations at high doses.

Definition: A misconception is an idea that is not correct.
Example: It is a misconception that Peggy was fabulously wealthy.

Definition: A misapprehension is a wrong idea or impression that you have about something.
Example:
Men still appear to be labouring under the misapprehension that women want hairy,
muscular men.

Definition: Expenditure is the spending of money on something, or the money that is spent on something.
Example: Policies of tax reduction must lead to reduced public expenditure.

Definition: the body of ordinary people
Example: The ground had been churned to a fine dust by the masses in this mock city devoid of skeletal order.

Definition: A rabble is a crowd of noisy people who seem likely to cause trouble.
Example: He seems to attract a rabble of supporters more loyal to the man than to the cause.

Definition: If someone incites people to behave in a violent or illegal way, they encourage people to behave in that way, usually by making them excited or angry.
Example: He incited his fellow citizens to take their revenge.

Definition: the act of expelling an alien from a country; expulsion
Example: As a result, arrested people who had no right to be in the UK were able to avoid deportation.

Definition: If you bail someone out, you help them out of a difficult situation, often by giving them money.
Example: They will discuss how to bail the economy out of its slump.

Definition: If you  get out, you leave a place because you want to escape from it, or because you are made to leave it.
Example: They probably wanted to get out of the country.

Definition: A pearl is a hard round object which is shiny and usually creamy-white in colour. Pearls grow inside the shell of an oyster and are used for making expensive jewellery.
Example: She wore a string of pearls at her throat.

Definition: A particle of something is a very small piece or amount of it.
Example: ...a particle of hot metal.

Definition: A blister is a painful swelling on the surface of your skin. Blisters contain a clear liquid and are usually caused by heat or by something repeatedly rubbing your skin.
Example: The affected skin turns red and may blister.

Definition: When you simmer food or when it simmers, you cook it by keeping it at boiling point or just below boiling point.
Example: Make an infusion by boiling and simmering the rhubarb and camomile together.

Definition: When you are seething, you are very angry about something but do not express your feelings about it.
Example: She took it calmly at first but under the surface was seething.

Definition: A cataclysm is an event that causes great change or harm.
Example: Many other arrests were of people handing out pamphlets warning of impending cataclysm.

Definition: Tonic or tonic water is a colourless fizzy drink that has a slightly bitter flavour and is often mixed with alcoholic drinks, especially gin.
Example: Keeler sipped at his gin and tonic.

Definition: the quality or state of being dry
Example: Danlo swallowed against the dryness in his throat and said, `No, I am sorry.

Definition: A satirical drawing, piece of writing, or comedy show is one in which humour or exaggeration is used to criticize something.
Example: ...a satirical novel about city life in the late 80s.

Definition: To strew things somewhere, or to strew a place with things, means to scatter them there.
Example: The racoons knock over rubbish bins and strew the contents all over the ground.

Definition: Clutter is a lot of things in an untidy state, especially things that are not useful or necessary.
Example: Caroline prefers her worktops to be clear of clutter.

Definition: Starvation is extreme suffering or death, caused by lack of food.
Example: Over three hundred people have died of starvation since the beginning of the year.

Definition: Famine is a situation in which large numbers of people have little or no food, and many of them die.
Example: Thousands of refugees are trapped by war, drought and famine.

Definition: If someone is suffering from malnutrition, they are physically weak and extremely thin because they have not eaten enough food.
Example: Infections are more likely in those suffering from malnutrition.

Definition: Gratitude is the state of feeling grateful.
Example: ...a sense of gratitude.

Definition: If you do something ahead of time, you do it before a particular event or before you need to, in order to be well prepared.
Example: Find out ahead of time what regulations apply to your situation.

Definition: Your  spare time is the time during which you do not have to work and you can do whatever you like.
Example: In her spare time she read books on cooking.

Definition: to be a substitute for
Example: Then they would have to take the place of others due to return this next Wednesday.

Definition: An emollient is a liquid or cream which you put on your skin to make it softer or to reduce pain.
Example:
The central character is a deceptively emollient senior figure in a Conservative
Government.

Definition: A palliative is a drug or medical treatment that relieves suffering without treating the cause of the suffering.
Example: The loan was a palliative, not a cure, for ever-increasing financial troubles.

Definition: soothing; mollifying
If you are careless, you do not pay enough attention to what you are doing, and so you make mistakes, or cause harm or damage.
Example: I'm sorry. How careless of me.

Definition: If you describe something as unhurried, you approve of it because it is relaxed and slow, and is not rushed or anxious.
Example: ...an unhurried pace of life.

Definition: Something that is informative gives you useful information.
Example: The adverts are not very informative.

Definition: If you canvass for a particular person or political party, you go around an area trying to persuade people to vote for that person or party.
Example: I'm canvassing for the Conservative Party.

Definition: Dissension is disagreement and argument.
Example: The tax cut issue has caused dissension among administration officials.

Definition: The secession of a region or group from the country or larger group to which it belongs is the action of formally becoming separate.
Example: Quebecers voted against secession from Canada.

Definition: A disclaimer is a statement in which a person says that they did not know about something or that they are not responsible for something.
Example: The disclaimer asserts that the company won't be held responsible for any inaccuracies.

Definition: The upper class or the upper classes are the group of people in a society who own the most property and have the highest social status, and who may not need to work for money.
Example: ...goods specifically designed to appeal to the tastes of the upper class.

Definition: The gentry are people of high social status or high birth.
Example:
Most of the country estates were built by the landed gentry during the late 19th
century.

Definition: Someone who is insistent keeps insisting that a particular thing should be done or is the case.
Example: Stalin was insistent that the war would be won and lost in the machine shops.

Definition: the state, quality, or an instance of being sentimental
Example: And he does this without sentimentality or nostalgia.

Definition: If you say that someone has a  sixth sense, you mean that they seem to have a natural ability to know about things before other people, or to know things that other people do not know.
Example:
The interesting thing about O'Reilly is his sixth sense for finding people who have
good ideas.

Definition: with little weight, pressure, or motion; gently
Example: to spend lightly

Definition: A sickly person or animal is weak, unhealthy, and often ill.
Example: He had been a sickly child.

Definition: Nostalgia is an affectionate feeling you have for the past, especially for a particularly happy time.
Example: He might be influenced by nostalgia for his happy youth.

Definition: An inflection in someone's voice is a change in its tone or pitch as they are speaking.
Example: The man's voice was devoid of inflection.

Definition: If you find something or someone wanting, they are not of as high a standard as you think they should be.
Example: He analysed his game and found it wanting.

Definition: If you describe an action as senseless, you think it is wrong because it has no purpose and produces no benefit.
Example: ...people whose lives have been destroyed by acts of senseless violence.

Definition: To disembowel a person or animal means to remove their internal organs, especially their stomach, intestines, and bowels.
Example: It shows a fox being disembowelled by a pack of hounds.

Definition:
An inoperative rule, principle, or tax is one that does not work any more or that cannot be made
to work.
Example: Atanas picked up a small piece of wood and jammed it into the frame so that the safety valve was inoperative.

Definition: To invalidate something such as an argument, conclusion, or result means to prove that it is wrong or cause it to be wrong.
Example: Any form of physical activity will invalidate the results.

Definition: To nullify a legal decision or procedure means to declare that it is not legally valid.
Example: He used his broad executive powers to nullify decisions by local governments.

Definition: If someone in a position of authority authorizes something, they give their official permission for it to happen.
Example: It would certainly be within his power to authorize a police raid like that.

Definition: If two or more things are interwoven or interweave, they are very closely connected or are combined with each other.
Example: For these people, land is inextricably interwoven with life itself.

Definition: If two or more things are intertwined or intertwine, they are closely connected with each other in many ways.
Example: Their destinies are intertwined.

Definition: If you knit something, especially an article of clothing, you make it from wool or a similar thread by using two knitting needles or a machine.
Example: I had endless hours to knit and sew.

Definition: If you are fascinated by something, you find it very interesting and attractive, and your thoughts tend to concentrate on it.
Example: I sat on the stairs and watched, fascinated.

Definition: If someone is described as being possessed by an evil spirit, it is believed that their mind and body are controlled by an evil spirit.
Example: She even claimed the couple's daughter was possessed by the devil.

Definition: to speak or do in a clumsy, muddled, or inefficient way
Example: He can appear aloof and there's something bumbling about his character.

Definition: If you say that someone is a particular kind of person at heart, you mean that that is what they are really like, even though they may seem very different.
Example: He was a very gentle boy at heart.

Definition: A person or place that is renowned for something, usually something good, is well known because of it.
Example: The area is renowned for its Romanesque churches.

Definition: To be noted for something you do or have means to be well-known and admired for it.
Example: ...a television programme noted for its attacks on organised crime.

Definition: If someone's appearance, voice, or behaviour is strained, they seem worried and nervous.
Example: She looked a little pale and strained.

Definition: If you are stressed, you feel tense and anxious because of difficulties in your life.
Example: Work out what situations or people make you feel stressed and avoid them.

Definition: The daytime is the part of a day between the time when it gets light and the time when it gets dark.
Example: In the daytime he stayed up in his room, sleeping, or listening to music.

Definition: If you prod someone or something, you give them a quick push with your finger or with a pointed object.
Example: He prodded Murray with the shotgun.

Definition: Your resignation is a formal statement of your intention to leave a job or position.
Example: Mr Morgan has offered his resignation and it has been accepted.

Definition: An aberration is an incident or way of behaving that is not typical.
Example: It became very clear that the incident was not just an aberration.

Definition: the state or quality of being irregular
Example: Investigations found that financial irregularities had stretched back between'five and ten years '.

Definition: You describe something as uplifting when it makes you feel very cheerful and happy.
Example: ...a charming and uplifting love story.

Definition: If something or someone penetrates a physical object or an area, they succeed in getting into it or passing through it.
Example: X-rays can penetrate many objects.

Definition: Lush fields or gardens have a lot of very healthy grass or plants.
Example: ...the lush green meadows bordering the river.

Definition: A bountiful supply or amount of something pleasant is a large one.
Example: State aid is less bountiful than it was before.

Definition: Sallies are clever and amusing remarks.
Example: He had thus far succeeded in fending off my conversational sallies.

Definition: An inflammation is a painful redness or swelling of a part of your body that results from an infection, injury, or illness.
Example: The drug can cause inflammation of the liver.

Definition: If something such as war, fighting, or disease  breaks out, it begins suddenly.
Example: He was 29 when war broke out.

Definition: A lookout is a place from which you can see clearly in all directions.
Example: Troops tried to set up a lookout post inside a refugee camp.

Definition: A precursor of something is a similar thing that happened or existed before it, often something which led to the existence or development of that thing.
Example:
Real tennis, an ancient precursor of the modern game, originated in the eleventh
century.

Definition: Outriders are people such as police officers who ride on motorcycles or horses beside or in front of an official vehicle, in order to protect the people in the vehicle.
Example: ...a black Mercedes with motorcycle outriders provided by the city's police.

Definition: To reconnoitre an area means to obtain information about its geographical features or about the size and position of an army there.
Example: He was sent to Eritrea to reconnoitre the enemy position.

Definition: the act of dominating or state of being dominated
Example: I'm also hellbent on total domination of all life forms in the service of evil.

Definition: an exploiting or being exploited (in various senses)
Example: Most of them have risen to the top from the shop floor by treading on anybody who got in their way and by their exploitation of the workers.

Definition: A propensity to do something or a propensity for something is a natural tendency that you have to behave in a particular way.
Example: Mr Bint has a propensity to put off decisions to the last minute.

Definition: You use notably to specify an important or typical example of something that you are talking about.
Example: More important problems, notably the fate of the children, had to be decided.

Definition: If someone or something perpetuates a situation, system, or belief, especially a bad one, they cause it to continue.
Example: We must not perpetuate the religious divisions of the past.

Definition: A moratorium on a particular activity or process is the stopping of it for a fixed period of time, usually as a result of an official agreement.
Example: ...a moratorium on talking to the press until the dispute is settled.

Definition: A foreigner is someone who belongs to a country that is not your own.
Example: They are discouraged from becoming close friends with foreigners.

Definition: the industries concerned with the manufacture of cloth
Example: We've moved our textiles to the South, to save money, but we're watching the Far East, because they can do it much cheaper there.

Definition: If someone condones behaviour that is morally wrong, they accept it and allow it to happen.
Example: I have never encouraged nor condoned violence.

Definition: If you describe something as drab, you think that it is dull and boring to look at or experience.
Example: Mary was wearing the same drab grey dress.

Definition: Someone who is subdued is very quiet, often because they are sad or worried about something.
Example: He faced the press, initially, in a somewhat subdued mood.

Definition: If it is cloudy, there are a lot of clouds in the sky.
Example: ...a windy, cloudy day.

Definition: If you blanch, you suddenly become very pale.
Example: His face blanched as he looked at Sharpe's blood-drenched uniform.

Definition: When something whitens or when you whiten it, it becomes whiter or paler in colour.
Example: Her knuckles whiten as she clenches her hands harder.

Definition: If a plant wilts, it gradually bends downwards and becomes weak because it needs more water or is dying.
Example: The roses wilted the day after she bought them.

Definition: If cloth or clothing shrinks, it becomes smaller in size, usually as a result of being washed.
Example: All my jumpers have shrunk.

Definition: When something such as a contract, deadline, or visa expires, it comes to an end or is no longer valid.
Example:
He had lived illegally in the United States for five years after his visitor's visa
expired.

Definition: If someone does not shirk their responsibility or duty, they do what they have a responsibility to do.
Example: We in the Congress can't shirk our responsibility.

Definition: If a garden or other place is overgrown, it is covered with a lot of untidy plants because it has not been looked after.
Example: We hurried on until we reached a courtyard overgrown with weeds.

Definition: The underdog in a competition or situation is the person who seems least likely to succeed or win.
Example: Most of the crowd were cheering for the underdog to win just this one time.

Definition: When food, wood, or another substance rots, or when something rots it, it becomes softer and is gradually destroyed.
Example: If we don't unload it soon, the grain will start rotting in the silos.

Definition: rotting as a result of bacterial, fungal, or chemical action; decomposing
Example: Just a pile of decaying mulch around my desk.

Definition: A wasted action is one that is unnecessary.
Example: I'm sorry you had a wasted journey.

Definition: Equality is the same status, rights, and responsibilities for all the members of a society, group, or family.
Example: ...equality of the sexes.

Definition: Something that is equitable is fair and reasonable in a way that gives equal treatment to everyone.
Example:
We have an unsurpassed opportunity to transform the United States into a more prosperous,
sustainable and equitable country.

Definition: If someone or something topples somewhere or if you topple them, they become unsteady or unstable and fall over.
Example: He just released his hold and toppled slowly backwards.

Definition: Lying is the present participle of lie1.
Example: Of course, there was always the possibility that Mogget was lying.

Definition: If you are mistaken about something, you are wrong about it.
Example: I see I was mistaken about you.

Definition: Treachery is behaviour or an action in which someone betrays their country or betrays a person who trusts them.
Example: He was deeply wounded by the treachery of close aides and old friends.

Definition: Someone who is an impostor is dishonestly pretending to be someone else in order to gain an advantage.
Example: He was an imposter, who masqueraded as a doctor.

Definition: If you accuse someone of duplicity, you mean that they are deceitful.
Example: Malcolm believed he was guilty of duplicity in his private dealings.

Definition: the state of being false or untrue
Example: It was as though the impact of what she said, the sheer rotten falsity of it, had lifted me out of my seat like a powerful ramrod.

Definition: If you describe a person or their behaviour as cheeky, you think that they are slightly rude or disrespectful but in a charming or amusing way.
Example: The boy was cheeky and casual.

Definition: Dignitaries are people who are considered to be important because they have a high rank in government or in the Church.
Example: Businesses are being particularly cautious about inviting foreign dignitaries and public officials.

Definition: To revitalize something that has lost its activity or its health means to make it active or healthy again.
Example: This hair conditioner is excellent for revitalizing dry, lifeless hair.

Definition: If you replenish something, you make it full or complete again.
Example: Three hundred thousand tons of cereals are needed to replenish stocks.

Definition: If you renew an activity, you begin it again.
Example: He renewed his attack on government policy towards Europe.

Definition: To galvanize someone means to cause them to take action, for example by making them feel very excited, afraid, or angry.
Example: The aid appeal has galvanised the German business community.

Definition: that provokes; esp., annoying or vexing
Example: But Colette was not as insensitive as Christian believed to the reactions she was provoking in her husband.

Definition: If you say that someone is  thrilled to bits, you are emphasizing the fact that they are extremely pleased about something. You can also say thrilled to pieces, especially in American English.
Example: I'm thrilled to bits to have won the cash.

Definition: If someone is agitated, they are very worried or upset, and show this in their behaviour, movements, or voice.
Example: Susan seemed agitated about something.

Definition:
A  love affair is a romantic and usually sexual relationship between two people who love each other
but who are not married or living together.
Example: ...a stressful love affair with a married man.

Definition: Ingrained habits and beliefs are difficult to change or remove.
Example: Morals tend to be deeply ingrained.

Definition: A stout person is rather fat.
Example: He was a tall, stout man with gray hair.

Definition: A chubby person is rather fat.
Example: Do you think I'm too chubby?

Definition: If you disapprove of something or someone, you feel or show that you do not like them or do not approve of them.
Example: Most people disapprove of such violent tactics.

Definition: Pasture is land with grass growing on it for farm animals to eat.
Example: The cows are out now, grazing in the pasture.

Definition: If you strum a stringed instrument such as a guitar, you play it by moving your fingers backwards and forwards across the strings.
Example: In the corner, one youth sat alone, softly strumming a guitar.

Definition: If you smother a fire, you cover it with something in order to put it out.
Example: The girl's parents were also burned as they tried to smother the flames.

Definition: A procession is a group of people who are walking, riding, or driving in a line as part of a public event.
Example: ...a funeral procession.

Definition: A pageant is a colourful public procession, show, or ceremony. Pageants are usually held out of doors and often celebrate events or people from history.
Example: In August 1968 women held a demonstration at the Miss America Beauty Pageant.

Definition: To drench something or someone means to make them completely wet.
Example: They turned fire hoses on the people and drenched them.

Definition: If someone or something gets soaked or soaked through, water or some other liquid makes them extremely wet.
Example: I have to check my tentit got soaked last night in the storm.

Definition: Something that is sodden is extremely wet.
Example: We stripped off our sodden clothes.

Definition: If people infiltrate a place or organization, or infiltrate into it, they enter it secretly in order to spy on it or influence it.
Example: Activists had infiltrated the student movement.

Definition: If you say that someone overeats, you mean they eat more than they need to or more than is healthy.
Example:
40 percent of people said that stress had caused them to overeat or eat unhealthy
foods.

Definition: If you gobble food, you eat it quickly and greedily.
Example: Pete gobbled all the stew.

Definition: A plethora of something is a large amount of it, especially an amount of it that is greater than you need, want, or can cope with.
Example: A plethora of new operators will be allowed to enter the market.

Definition: When something clogs a hole or place, it blocks it so that nothing can pass through.
Example: Dirt clogs the pores, causing spots.

Definition: (older use). movies
Example: It's easy to see how their pictures might have some sort of religious significance.

Definition: If a change is irreversible, things cannot be changed back to the way they were before.
Example: She could suffer irreversible brain damage if she is not treated within seven days.

Definition: If a dead person's body is exhumed, it is taken out of the ground where it is buried, especially so that it can be examined in order to find out how the person died.
Example: His remains have been exhumed from a cemetery in Queens, New York City.

Definition: If you say that something is tasteful, you consider it to be attractive, elegant, and in good taste.
Example: The decor is tasteful and restrained.

Definition: If you say that something is praiseworthy, you mean that you approve of it and it deserves to be praised.
Example: ...the government's praiseworthy efforts to improve efficiency in health and education.

Definition: If you think that someone behaves or lives in a way that is morally good, you can say that they are righteous. People sometimes use righteous to express their disapproval when they think someone is only behaving in this way so that others will admire or support them.
Example: Aren't you afraid of being seen as a righteous crusader?

Definition: If you describe someone's behaviour as commendable, you approve of it or are praising it.
Example: Mr Sparrow has acted with commendable speed.

Definition: Something that is laudable deserves to be praised or admired.
Example: One of Emma's less laudable characteristics was her jealousy.

Definition: If you describe a person or their behaviour as cheery, you mean that they are cheerful and happy.
Example: She was cheery and talked to them about their problems.

Definition: Forfeiture is the action of forfeiting something.
Example: ...the forfeiture of illegally obtained profits.

Definition: Numerals are written symbols used to represent numbers.
Example: ...a flat, square wristwatch with classic Roman numerals.

Definition: A conflagration is a fire that burns over a large area and destroys property.
Example: The incident has raised fears of a new regional conflagration.

Definition: Denunciation of someone or something is severe public criticism of them.
Example: On September 24, he wrote a stinging denunciation of his critics.

Definition: If someone is steadfast in something that they are doing, they are convinced that what they are doing is right and they refuse to change it or to give up.
Example: He remained steadfast in his belief that he had done the right thing.

Definition: If you describe someone's actions as dogged, you mean that they are determined to continue with something even if it becomes difficult or dangerous.
Example: They have gained respect through sheer dogged determination.

Definition: If you say that someone has an inalienable right to something, you are emphasizing that they have a right to it which cannot be changed or taken away.
Example: He said the republic now had an inalienable right to self-determination.

Definition: incapable of being dissolved or broken; permanent
Example: These two aspects of the marriage ceremony establish an indissoluble matrimonial bond between the couple.

Definition: If someone or something is a rarity, they are interesting or valuable because they are so unusual.
Example: Motorized wheelchairs are a rarity here.

Definition: If you interject something, you say it and interrupt someone else who is speaking.
Example: 'Surely there's something we can do?' interjected Palin.

Definition: If someone has convulsions, they suffer uncontrollable movements of their muscles.
Example: ...the political convulsions that led to de Gaulle's return to power in May 1958.

Definition: the act of annexing, esp territory, or the condition of being annexed
Example: The two annexation ordinances will be considered at tonight's council meeting.

Definition: An appropriation is an amount of money that a government or organization reserves for a particular purpose.
Example: The government raised defence appropriations by 12 per cent.

Definition: When a woman who is about to give birth has contractions, she experiences a very strong, painful tightening of the muscles of her womb.
Example: 'It's' (with an apostrophe) should be used only as a contraction for 'it is'.

Definition: A paroxysm of emotion is a sudden, very strong occurrence of it.
Example: He exploded in a paroxysm of rage.

Definition: If something, especially a part of your body, twitches or if you twitch it, it makes a little jumping movement.
Example: When I stood up to her, her right cheek would begin to twitch.

Definition: a bursting forth or out, as of lava from a volcano
Example: An eruption of hate and fear vomited out in the hospital grounds.

Definition: When a broken bone or other injury heals or when something heals it, it becomes healthy and normal again.
Example: Within six weeks the bruising had gone, but it was six months before it all healed.

Definition: If something is done in an orderly fashion or manner, it is done in a well-organized and controlled way.
Example: The organizers guided them in orderly fashion out of the building.

Definition: If you straighten something, you make it tidy or put it in its proper position.
Example: She sipped her coffee and straightened a picture on the wall.

Definition: If something glints, it produces or reflects a quick flash of light.
Example: The sea glinted in the sun.

Definition: An atom is the smallest amount of a substance that can take part in a chemical reaction.
Example: A methane molecule is composed of one carbon atom attached to four hydrogens.

Definition: If you describe something or someone as uninteresting, you mean they have no special or exciting qualities.
Example: Their media has earned the reputation for being rather dull and uninteresting.

Definition: Desolation is a feeling of great unhappiness and hopelessness.
Example: The sense of loss and desolation we feel at her death is beyond description.

Definition: Destitution is the state of having no money or possessions.
Example: The chasm between privilege and utter destitution made me uncomfortable.

Definition: Boredom is the state of being bored.
Example: He had given up attending lectures out of sheer boredom.

Definition: Something that is repetitive involves actions or elements that are repeated many times and is therefore boring.
Example: ...factory workers who do repetitive jobs.

Definition: Zest is a feeling of pleasure and enthusiasm.
Example: He retired from professional chess because he had lost the zest for winning.

Definition: A tincture is a medicine consisting of alcohol and a small amount of a drug.
Example: ...a few drops of tincture of iodine.

Definition: Paste is a soft, wet, sticky mixture of a substance and a liquid, which can be spread easily. Some types of paste are used to stick things together.
Example: He then sticks it back together with flour paste.

Definition: If you mash food that is solid but soft, you crush it so that it forms a soft mass.
Example: Mash the bananas with a fork.

Definition: If you describe something such as information, writing, or entertainment as pap, you mean that you consider it to be of no worth, value, or serious interest.
Example: The big news this year was women stepping out of the pap shot and into our consciousness.

Definition: Mush is a thick, soft paste.
Example: The brown mush in the fridge is some veg soup left over.

Definition: A marrow is a long, thick, green vegetable with soft white flesh that is eaten cooked.
Example: The marrow donor is her 14-month-old sister.

Definition: To pulverize something means to do great damage to it or to destroy it completely.
Example: ...the economic policies which pulverised the economy during the 1980s.

Definition: A downpour is a sudden and unexpected heavy fall of rain.
Example: ...a sudden downpour of rain.

Definition: If a vehicle or its driver runs a person or animal over, it knocks them down or drives over them.
Example: You can always run him over and make it look like an accident.

Definition: If a liquid or a river overflows, it flows over the edges of the container or place it is in.
Example: Pour in some of the syrup, but not all of it, as it will probably overflow.

Definition: An avalanche is a large mass of snow that falls down the side of a mountain.
Example: an avalanche of publicity

Definition: Blooming is used by some people to emphasize what they are saying, especially when they are annoyed.
Example: It's a blooming nuisance because it frightens my dog to death.

Definition: If you brandish something, especially a weapon, you hold it in a threatening way.
Example: He appeared in the lounge brandishing a knife.

Definition: A perfunctory action is done quickly and carelessly, and shows a lack of interest in what you are doing.
Example: She gave the list only a perfunctory glance.

Definition: Something that is momentary lasts for a very short period of time, for example for a few seconds or less.
Example: ...a momentary lapse of concentration.

Definition: To deviate from something means to start doing something different or not planned, especially in a way that causes problems for others.
Example: They stopped you as soon as you deviated from the script.

Definition: Nutrition is the process of taking food into the body and absorbing the nutrients in those foods.
Example: There are alternative sources of nutrition to animal meat.

Definition: Sustenance is food or drink which a person, animal, or plant needs to remain alive and healthy.
Example: The state provided a basic quantity of food for daily sustenance, but little else.

Definition: any material providing nourishment
Example: So long as it did not actually make him ill, he thought, he would regard it as useful nutriment.

Definition: When something such as an emotion impels you to do something, it affects you so strongly that you feel forced to do it.
Example: ...the courage and competitiveness which impels him to take risks.

Definition: Woodland is land with a lot of trees.
Example: He says it's through his garden but there's a lake and a woodland path between his house and where we are walking.

Definition: Covert activities or situations are secret or hidden.
Example: They have been supplying covert military aid to the rebels.

Definition: embarrassed, unnatural, or forced
Example: a constrained laugh

Definition: An alcoholic is someone who cannot stop drinking large amounts of alcohol, even when this is making them ill.
Example: He showed great courage by admitting that he is an alcoholic.

Definition: When you are sober, you are not drunk.
Example: When Dad was sober he was a good father.

Definition: If you talk about the sanctity of something, you mean that it is very important and must be treated with respect.
Example: ...the sanctity of human life.

Definition: If one amount is proportional to another, the two amounts increase and decrease at the same rate so there is always the same relationship between them.
Example: Loss of weight is directly proportional to the rate at which the disease is progressing.

Definition: You use sometime to refer to a time in the future or the past that is unknown or that has not yet been decided.
Example: The sales figures won't be released until sometime next month.

Definition: Someone who is arrogant behaves in a proud, unpleasant way towards other people because they believe that they are more important than others.
Example: He was so arrogant.

Definition: A bulwark against something protects you against it. A bulwark of something protects it.
Example:
The abbeys were founded in the 12th century by King David as a bulwark against the
English.

Definition: made in low relief; embossed
Example: When Colonel Douglas Strickland raised his hand, people generally stopped short.

Definition: When someone drowns or is drowned, they die because they have gone or been pushed under water and cannot breathe.
Example: Forty-eight people have drowned after their boat capsized during a storm.

Definition: An approving reaction or remark shows support for something, or satisfaction with it.
Example: His mother leaned forward and gave him an approving look.

Definition: An appreciative reaction or comment shows the enjoyment that you are getting from something.
Example: There is a murmur of appreciative laughter.

Definition: Voluntary actions or activities are done because someone chooses to do them and not because they have been forced to do them.
Example: Attention is drawn to a special voluntary course in Commercial French.

Definition: An honorary title or membership of a group is given to someone without their needing to have the necessary qualifications, usually because of their public achievements.
Example: He will be awarded the honorary degree in a ceremony at Newcastle University.

Definition: If something harmful or undesirable is left unchecked, nobody controls it or prevents it from growing or developing.
Example: If left unchecked, weeds will flourish.

Definition: Someone who is out of work does not have a job.
Example: ...a town where half the men are usually out of work.

Definition: If you are made redundant, your employer tells you to leave because your job is no longer necessary or because your employer cannot afford to keep paying you.
Example: My husband was made redundant late last year.

Definition: Someone who is jobless does not have a job, although they would like one.
Example: One in four people are now jobless in inner city areas.

Definition: If someone is lazy, they do not want to work or make any effort to do anything.
Example: Lazy and incompetent police officers are letting the public down.

Definition: You can describe something as sluggish if it moves, works, or reacts much slower than you would like or is normal.
Example: The economy remains sluggish.

Definition: If you have a feeling of inertia, you feel very lazy and unwilling to move or be active.
Example: ...her inertia, her lack of energy.

Definition: Sloth is laziness, especially with regard to work.
Example: He admitted a lack of motivation and a feeling of sloth.

Definition: If you refer to someone's inaction, you disapprove of the fact that they are doing nothing.
Example: He is bitter about the inaction of the other political parties.

Definition: If you describe someone as frivolous, you mean they behave in a silly or light-hearted way, rather than being serious and sensible.
Example: I just decided I was a bit too frivolous to be a doctor.

Definition:
If an engine is ticking over, it is running at a low speed or rate, for example when it is switched on but you
are not actually using it.
Example: Very slowly he moved forward, the engine ticking over.

Definition: If you untangle something that is knotted or has become twisted around something, you undo the knots in it or free it.
Example: He was found desperately trying to untangle several reels of film.

Definition: If one group of people has supremacy over another group, they have more political or military power than the other group.
Example: The conservative old guard had re-established its political supremacy.

Definition: The primacy of something is the fact that it is the most important or most powerful thing in a particular situation.
Example: The political idea at the heart of this is the primacy of the individual.

Definition: When there are redundancies, an organization tells some of its employees to leave because their jobs are no longer necessary or because the organization can no longer afford to pay them.
Example: The ministry has said it hopes to avoid compulsory redundancies.

Definition: Something that is persistent continues to exist or happen for a long time; used especially about bad or undesirable states or situations.
Example:
Her position as national leader has been weakened by persistent fears of another
coup attempt.

Definition: Something bad that is relentless never stops or never becomes less intense.
Example: The pressure now was relentless.

Definition: An experience or action that is rewarding gives you satisfaction or brings you benefits.
Example: ...a career which she found stimulating and rewarding.

Definition: A lucrative activity, job, or business deal is very profitable.
Example: Thousands of ex-army officers have found lucrative jobs in private security firms.

Definition: of the colour rose or pink
Example: She thinks of jaguars, night herons, flamingos, ocelots, parakeets, lyrebirds, roseate terns.

Definition: A man's brotherly feelings are feelings of love and loyalty which you expect a brother to show.
Example: ...family loyalty and brotherly love.

Definition: the interval between two sounds of identical pitch
Example: The team swivel and dive in perfect unison.

Definition: The outer parts of something are the parts which contain or enclose the other parts, and which are furthest from the centre.
Example: He heard a voice in the outer room.

Definition: false; fictitious
Example: I finished with the part that I assumed would be of greatest interest to her.

Definition: Undercover work involves secretly obtaining information for the government or the police.
Example: ...an undercover operation designed to catch people smugglers.

Definition: If someone or something aggravates a situation, they make it worse.
Example: Stress and lack of sleep can aggravate the situation.

Definition: The enlargement of something is the process or result of making it bigger.
Example: There is insufficient space for enlargement of the buildings.

Definition: the quality or state of being full
Example: `And through touch," he said, `an artist brings depth, texture, fullness to his work.

Definition: In physics, the amplitude of a sound wave or electrical signal is its strength.
Example: As we fall asleep the amplitude of brain waves slowly becomes greater.

Definition: If you describe a woman as buxom, you mean that she has a rounded body and big breasts.
Example: The buxom Frau Bauer was visibly pleased to see her.

Definition: A veiled comment is expressed in a disguised form rather than directly and openly.
Example: He made only a veiled reference to international concerns over human rights issues.

Definition: The interment of a dead person is their burial.
Example: I understand that you want a short service here in the house and then straight to the churchyard for the interment.

Definition: funeral rites
Example: Seeing that you were in at the death, so to speak, you may wish to witness the obsequies before starting back to Sasquamahoc.

Definition: If you describe something as comic, you mean that it makes you laugh, and is often intended to make you laugh.
Example: The novel is comic and tragic.

Definition: If you say that something such as an idea or suggestion is laughable, you mean that it is so stupid as to be funny and not worth serious consideration.
Example: The idea that she didn't know anything is laughable.

Definition: If you are squeamish, you are easily upset by unpleasant sights or situations.
Example: I'm terribly squeamish. I can't bear gory films.

Definition: A riposte is a quick, clever reply to something that someone has said.
Example: Laura glanced at Grace, expecting a cheeky riposte.

Definition: A  double entendre is a word or phrase that has two meanings, one of which is rude and often sexual.
Example: He is a master of the pun and the double entendre.

Definition: The deflection of something means making it change direction.
Example: ...the deflection of light as it passes through the slits in the grating.

Definition: If you make a detour on a journey, you go by a route which is not the shortest way, because you want to avoid something such as a traffic jam, or because there is something you want to do on the way.
Example:
He did not take the direct route home, but made a detour around the outskirts of
the city.

Definition: An interlude is a short period of time when an activity or situation stops and something else happens.
Example: It was a happy interlude in the Kents' life.

Definition: An intermission is a short break between two parts of a film, concert, or show.
Example: ...during the intermission of the musical 'Steppin' Out'.

Definition: The closure of a place such as a business or factory is the permanent ending of the work or activity there.
Example: ...the closure of the Ravenscraig steelworks.
