Definition: If a meeting or trial is adjourned or if it adjourns, it is stopped for a short time.
Example: The proceedings have now been adjourned until next week.

Definition: An alcove is a small area of a room which is formed by one part of a wall being built further back than the rest of the wall.
Example: In the alcoves on either side of the fire were bookshelves.

Definition: A chasm is a very deep crack in rock, earth, or ice.
Example: ...the chasm that divides the worlds of university and industry.

Definition: If you marshal people or things, you gather them together and arrange them for a particular purpose.
Example: Richard was marshalling the doctors and nurses, showing them where to go.

Definition: You use in general to indicate that you are talking about something as a whole, rather than about part of it.
Example: I think we need to improve our educational system in general.

Definition: An inference is a conclusion that you draw about something by using information that you already have about it.
Example: There were two inferences to be drawn from her letter.

Definition: Fictitious is used to describe something that is false or does not exist, although some people claim that it is true or exists.
Example: We're interested in the source of these fictitious rumours.

Definition: If you describe something as illusory, you mean that although it seems true or possible, it is in fact false or impossible.
Example: His freedom is illusory.

Definition: A leviathan is something which is extremely large and difficult to control, and which you find rather frightening.
Example:
Democracy survived the Civil War and the developing industrial leviathan and struggled
on into the twentieth century.

Definition: A maiden is a young girl or woman.
Example: ...stories of noble princes and their brave deeds on behalf of beautiful maidens.

Definition: If you consult an expert or someone senior to you or consult with them, you ask them for their opinion and advice about what you should do or their permission to do something.
Example: Consult your doctor about how much exercise you should attempt.

Definition: in a state of strong emotional attachment and usually sexual attraction
Example: The concerts have also resulted in love affairs.

Definition: You add luckily to a statement to indicate that it is good that a particular thing happened or is the case because otherwise the situation would have been difficult or unpleasant.
Example: Luckily, we both love football.

Definition: Fortunately is used to introduce or indicate a statement about an event or situation that is good.
Example: Fortunately, the weather that winter was reasonably mild.

Definition: If something is abundantly clear, it is extremely obvious.
Example:
He made it abundantly clear that anybody who disagrees with his policies will not
last long.

Definition: The name God is given to the spirit or being who is worshipped as the creator and ruler of the world, especially by Jews, Christians, and Muslims.
Example: He believes in God.

Definition: A bureau is an office, organization, or government department that collects and distributes information.
Example: ...the Federal Bureau of Investigation.

Definition: If someone pounces on you, they come up towards you suddenly and take hold of you.
Example: He pounced on the photographer, beat him up and smashed his camera.

Definition: If you make a concession to someone, you agree to let them do or have something, especially in order to end an argument or conflict.
Example: The King made major concessions to end the confrontation with his people.

Definition: If someone calls another person or something such as a job a sod, they are expressing anger or annoyance towards that person or thing.
A clod of earth is a large lump of earth.
Example: What sort of a senseless clod was I, not even to have wondered if he could have been truly ill?

Definition:
Marijuana is a drug which is made from the dried leaves and flowers of the hemp plant, and which can
be smoked.
Example: But they also voted to legalise marijuana.

Definition: If you call someone a traitor, you mean that they have betrayed beliefs that they used to hold, or that their friends hold, by their words or actions.
Example: Some say he's a traitor to the working class.

Definition: An informer is a person who tells the police that someone has done something illegal.
Example: ...two men suspected of being police informers.

Definition: A renegade is a person who abandons the religious, political, or philosophical beliefs that he or she used to have, and accepts opposing or different beliefs.
Example: Three men were shot dead by a renegade policeman.

Definition: If you describe something as immoderate, you disapprove of it because it is too extreme.
Example: He launched an immoderate tirade on Turner.

Definition: If you say that something does not happen or is not done unduly, you mean that it does not happen or is not done to an excessive or unnecessary extent.
Example: 'But you're not unduly worried about doing this report?''No.'

Definition: Your self-esteem is how you feel about yourself. For example, if you have low self-esteem, you do not like yourself, you do not think that you are a valuable person, and therefore you do not behave confidently.
Example: Poor self-esteem is at the centre of many of the difficulties we experience.

Definition: generosity; bounty
Example: Barbara had pretensions to liberality which occasionally irked him.

Definition: You can refer to something that is provided in large amounts as bounty.
Example: ...autumn's bounty of fruits, seeds and berries.

Definition: A deft action is skilful and often quick.
Example: With a deft flick of his foot, Mr Worth tripped one of the raiders up.

Definition: People who are unskilled do not have any special training for a job.
Example: He went to Paris in search of work as an unskilled labourer.

Definition: You can refer to plants as flora, especially the plants growing in a particular area.
Example: ...the variety of food crops and flora which now exists in Dominica.

Definition: Plants that make a place look attractive are referred to as greenery.
Example: They have ordered a bit of greenery to brighten up the new wing at Guy's Hospital.

Definition:
When a group of people, usually trade union members, picket a place of work, they stand outside it in order to protest about something, to prevent
people from going in, or to persuade the workers to join a strike.
Example: The miners went on strike and picketed the power stations.

Definition: A jailer is a person who is in charge of a jail and the prisoners in it.
Example: The jailer locked them in the innermost prison.

Definition: A steward is someone who works on a ship, plane, or train, looking after passengers and serving meals to them.
Example:
The Earl didn't have the money or good judgement to employ a steward to manage the
place for him.

Definition: A tenant is someone who pays rent for the place they live in, or for land or buildings that they use.
Example: Regulations placed clear obligations on the landlord for the benefit of the tenant.

Definition: deserving disapproval or censure
Example: Further, deciding whether the requesting state's inaction was blameworthy created practical problems.

Definition: A handgun is a gun that you can hold, carry, and fire with one hand.
Example: The handguns were used in the shootings.

Definition: A quirk is something unusual or interesting that happens by chance.
Example: It was almost a quirk of fate he and Foy should have been in charge.

Definition: If you accuse someone of favouritism, you disapprove of them because they unfairly help or favour one person or group much more than another.
Example: Maria loved both the children. There was never a hint of favouritism.

Definition: Studs are small pieces of metal which are attached to a surface for decoration.
Example: You see studs on lots of London front doors.

Definition: The nub of a situation, problem, or argument is the central and most basic part of it.
Example: That, I think, is the nub of the problem.

Definition: A protuberance is a rounded part that sticks out from the surface of something.
Example: ...a protuberance on the upper jawbone.

Definition: If you are uncommitted, you have not yet decided to support a particular idea, belief, group, or person, or you are unwilling to show your support.
Example: The allegiance of uncommitted voters will be crucial.

Definition: Torn is the past participle of tear2.
Example: Robb is torn between becoming a doctor and a career in athletics.

Definition: If you are restless, you are bored, impatient, or dissatisfied, and you want to do something else.
Example: By 1982, she was restless and needed a new impetus for her talent.

Definition: not constant; variable
Example: It was this inconstant wind, he remembered, that had frozen Tamara's face and nearly killed her.

Definition: If you say that something or someone is trendy, you mean that they are very fashionable and modern.
Example: ...a trendy London night club.

Definition: If something fluctuates, it changes a lot in an irregular way.
Example: Body temperature can fluctuate if you are ill.

Definition: If something is done or happens in earnest, it happens to a much greater extent and more seriously than before.
Example: Campaigning will begin in earnest tomorrow.

Definition: Acrimony is bitter and angry words or quarrels.
Example: The council's first meeting ended in acrimony.

Definition: A raucous sound is loud, harsh, and rather unpleasant.
Example: They heard a bottle being smashed, then more raucous laughter.

Definition: A grating is a flat metal frame with rows of bars across it, which is fastened over a window or over a hole in a wall or the ground.
Example: ...an open grating in the sidewalk.

Definition: If you abhor something, you hate it very much, especially for moral reasons.
Example: He was a man who abhorred violence and was deeply committed to reconciliation.

Definition: If you feel disdain for someone or something, you dislike them because you think that they are inferior or unimportant.
Example: Janet looked at him with disdain.

Definition: A dean is an important official at a university or college.
Example: She was Dean of the Science faculty at Sophia University.

Definition: Foam consists of a mass of small bubbles that are formed when air and a liquid are mixed together.
Example: The water curved round the rocks in great bursts of foam.

Definition: A churn is a container which is used for making butter.
Example: The propeller churned the water and the ship was away.

Definition: Lethargy is the condition or state of being lethargic.
Example: Symptoms include tiredness, paleness, and lethargy.

Definition: If you describe a study, search, or list as exhaustive, you mean that it is very thorough and complete.
Example: This is not an exhaustive list but it shows how many projects are taking place.

Definition: An adhesive is a substance such as glue, which is used to make things stick firmly together.
Example: Glue the mirror in with a strong adhesive.

Definition: An adherent is someone who holds a particular belief or supports a particular person or group.
Example: This idea is gaining adherents.

Definition: Sultry weather is hot and damp.
Example: The climax came one sultry August evening.

Definition: Something that is moist is slightly wet.
Example: Wipe off any excess make-up with a clean, moist cotton flannel.

Definition: If you describe someone as tyrannical, you mean that they are severe or unfair towards the people that they have authority over.
Example: He killed his tyrannical father with a blow to the head.

Definition: If a quality emanates from you, or if you emanate a quality, you give people a strong sense that you have that quality.
Example: Intelligence and cunning emanated from him.

Definition: If someone exudes a quality or feeling, or if it exudes, they show that they have it to a great extent.
Example: The guerrillas exude confidence. Every town, they say, is under their control.

Definition: A precipitous slope or drop is very steep and often dangerous.
Example: The town is perched on the edge of a steep, precipitous cliff.

Definition: A perpendicular line or surface points straight up, rather than being sloping or horizontal.
Example: We made two slits for the eyes and a perpendicular line for the nose.

Definition: If you describe something such as a price or fee as exorbitant, you are emphasizing that it is much greater than it should be.
Example:
Exorbitant housing prices have created an acute shortage of affordable housing for
the poor.

Definition: Gusty winds are very strong and irregular.
Example: Weather forecasts predict more hot weather, gusty winds and lightning strikes.

Definition: If something buzzes or buzzes somewhere, it makes a long continuous sound, like the noise a bee makes when it is flying.
Example: The intercom buzzed and he pressed down the appropriate switch.

Definition: Someone who is drunk has drunk so much alcohol that they cannot speak clearly or behave sensibly.
Example: Stewart could not remember exactly why he had done it because he was so drunk.

Definition: If you are euphoric, you feel intense happiness and excitement.
Example: It had received euphoric support from the public.

Definition: a person who tells a story or gives an account of something
Example: The narrator of both films is the big, bad wolf - who has his own story to tell as well.

Definition: If you delve into something, you try to discover new information about it.
Example: Tormented by her ignorance, Jenny delves into her mother's past.

Definition: If you say that somewhere is a hotbed of an undesirable activity, you are emphasizing that a lot of the activity is going on there or being started there.
Example: This area has long been a hotbed of militant activity.

Definition: A shanty is a small rough hut which poor people live in, built from tin, cardboard, or other materials that are not very strong.
Example: ...one of my father's favourite sea-shanties.

Definition: fun, revelry, or festivity
Example: Aislinn laughed in obvious glee and the merrymaking continued until Wulfgar rose, clearing his throat for attention.

Definition: Someone who is pious is very religious and moral.
Example: He was brought up by pious female relatives.

Definition: If you are provided with lodging or lodgings, you are provided with a place to stay for a period of time. You can use lodgings to refer to one or more of these places.
Example: He was given free lodging in a three-room flat.

Definition: The motherland is the country in which you or your ancestors were born and to which you still feel emotionally linked, even if you live somewhere else.
Example: ...love for the motherland.

Definition: If someone is very proud of the country where they or their ancestors were born, they sometimes refer to it as the fatherland. The word fatherland is particularly associated with Germany.
Example: They were willing to serve the fatherland in its hour of need.

Definition: Someone who is penniless has hardly any money at all.
Example: They'd soon be penniless and homeless if she couldn't find suitable work.

Definition: Something that is vertical stands or points straight up.
Example: The climber inched up a vertical wall of rock.

Definition: If you say that someone overreacts to something, you mean that they have and show more of an emotion than is necessary or appropriate.
Example: Is the council right to be concerned, or is it overreacting?

Definition: Someone's revulsion at something is the strong feeling of disgust or disapproval they have towards it.
Example: ...their revulsion at the act of desecration.

Definition: If someone harasses you, they trouble or annoy you, for example by attacking you repeatedly or by causing you as many problems as they can.
Example: A woman reporter complained one of them sexually harassed her in the locker room.

Definition: A badger is a wild animal which has a white head with two wide black stripes on it. Badgers live underground and usually come up to feed at night.
Example: She badgered her doctor time and again, pleading with him to do something.

Definition: A sanatorium is an institution that provides medical treatment and rest, often in a healthy climate, for people who have been ill for a long time.
Example: I had tuberculosis and was told I'd be in the sanatorium for two years.

Definition: An announcer is someone who introduces programmes on radio or television or who reads the text of a radio or television advertisement.
Example: The radio announcer said it was nine o'clock.

Definition: If a place is airless, there is no fresh air in it.
Example: ...a dark, airless room.

Definition: If something is overwhelming, it affects you very strongly, and you do not know how to deal with it.
Example:
The task won't feel so overwhelming if you break it down into small, easy-to-accomplish
steps.

Definition: A repressive government is one that restricts people's freedom and controls them by using force.
Example: The military regime in power was unpopular and repressive.

Definition: If someone is  wound up, they are very tense and nervous or angry.
Example: He wound up in your emergency room just about this time last year.

Definition: If you are  keyed up, you are very excited or nervous before an important or dangerous event.
Example: I wasn't able to sleep that night; I was so keyed up.

Definition: If you talk about the transience of a situation, you mean that it lasts only a short time or is constantly changing.
Example: In an architectural setting flowers give a sense of transience.

Definition: A fatality is a death caused by an accident or by violence.
Example: Drunk driving fatalities have declined more than 10 percent over the past 10 years.

Definition: If you describe someone's behaviour as unrelenting, you mean that they are continuing to do something in a very determined way, often without caring whether they hurt or embarrass other people.
Example: She established her authority with unrelenting thoroughness.

Definition: If you describe a person, or their appetite for something, as voracious, you mean that they want a lot of something.
Example: Joseph Smith was a voracious book collector.

Definition: If you grieve over something, especially someone's death, you feel very sad about it.
Example: He's grieving over his dead wife and son.

Definition: If you hoard things such as food or money, you save or store them, often in secret, because they are valuable or important to you.
Example: They've begun to hoard food and gasoline and save their money.

Definition: A thesis is an idea or theory that is expressed as a statement and is discussed in a logical way.
Example: This thesis does not stand up to close inspection.

Definition: If you solicit money, help, support, or an opinion from someone, you ask them for it.
Example: He's already solicited their support on health care reform.

Definition: Icing is a sweet substance made from powdered sugar that is used to cover and decorate cakes.
Example: ...a birthday cake with yellow icing.

Definition: If you have a hunch about something, you are sure that it is correct or true, even though you do not have any proof.
Example: I had a hunch that Susan and I would work well together.

Definition: If you say that someone is the personification of a particular thing or quality, you mean that they are a perfect example of that thing or that they have a lot of that quality.
Example: Janis Joplin was the personification of the '60s female rock singer.

Definition: If you say that someone or something is the embodiment of a quality or idea, you mean that that is their most noticeable characteristic or the basis of all they do.
Example: A baby is the embodiment of vulnerability.

Definition: Fictional characters or events occur only in stories, plays, or films and never actually existed or happened.
Example: It is drama featuring fictional characters.

Definition: If you are made-up, you are wearing make-up such as powder or eye shadow.
Example: She was made-up and ready to go.

Definition: Someone who is spiteful does cruel things to hurt people they dislike.
Example: He could be spiteful.

Definition: A malevolent person deliberately tries to cause harm or evil.
Example: Her stare was malevolent, her mouth a thin line.

Definition: A malignant tumour or disease is out of control and likely to cause death.
Example: She developed a malignant breast tumour.

Definition: An illicit activity or substance is not allowed by law or the social customs of a country.
Example: Dante clearly condemns illicit love.

Definition: a breach of a law, etc; sin or crime
Example: Any sense of transgression she might have had was now inextricably fused with a sense of the inevitable naturalness of her actions.

Definition: Nausea is the condition of feeling sick and the feeling that you are going to vomit.
Example: I was overcome with a feeling of nausea.

Definition: If someone has a particular  turn of phrase, they have a particular way of expressing themselves in words.
Example: Rose's stories weren't bad; she had a nice turn of phrase.

Definition: A whim is a wish to do or have something which seems to have no serious reason or purpose behind it, and often occurs suddenly.
Example: We decided, more or less on a whim, to sail to Morocco.

Definition: Something that is decorative is intended to look pretty or attractive.
Example: The curtains are for purely decorative purposes and do not open or close.

Definition: If you describe someone or something as imposing, you mean that they have an impressive appearance or manner.
Example: He was an imposing man.

Definition: If you refer to someone's incompetence, you are criticizing them because they are unable to do their job or a task properly.
Example: The incompetence of government officials is appalling.

Definition: If you describe something as intolerable, you mean that it is so bad or extreme that no one can bear it or tolerate it.
Example: They felt this would put intolerable pressure on them.

Definition: If you say that someone is being unreasonable, you mean that they are behaving in a way that is not fair or sensible.
Example:
The strikers were being unreasonable in their demands, having rejected the deal two
weeks ago.

Definition: the act of consolidating or state of being consolidated
Example: But not all were different enough to survive and a wave of consolidation followed.

Definition: the action or process of amalgamating
Example: It was a rough amalgamation of two books.

Definition: If you describe something as inconceivable, you think it is very unlikely to happen or be true.
Example: It was inconceivable to me that Toby could have been my attacker.

Definition: If you describe something as unimaginable, you are emphasizing that it is difficult to imagine or understand properly, because it is not part of people's normal experience.
Example: The scale of the fighting is almost unimaginable.

Definition: You can describe someone or something as self-contained when they are complete and separate and do not need help or resources from outside.
Example: He seems completely self-contained and he doesn't miss you when you're not there.

Definition: If you are self-reliant, you are able to do things and make decisions by yourself, without needing other people to help you.
Example: She is intelligent and self-reliant, speaking her mind and not suffering fools gladly.

Definition: If you describe someone's behaviour, beliefs, or customs as unorthodox, you mean that they are different from what is generally accepted.
Example: She spent an unorthodox girlhood travelling with her father throughout Europe.

Definition: An estranged wife or husband is no longer living with their husband or wife.
Example: ...his estranged wife.

Definition: If you slit something, you make a long narrow cut in it.
Example: They say somebody slit her throat.

Definition: Journalists use heartland or heartlands to refer to the area or region where a particular set of activities or beliefs is most significant.
Example: ...his six-day bus tour around the industrial heartland of America.

Definition: The hinterland of a stretch of coast or a large river is the area of land behind it or around it.
Example: ...the French Mediterranean coast and its hinterland.

Definition: An incoming message or phone call is one that you receive.
Example: We keep a record of incoming calls.

Definition: If you refer to someone's inexperience, you mean that they have little knowledge or experience of a particular situation or activity.
Example: Critics attacked the youth and inexperience of his staff.

Definition: When you waken, or when someone or something wakens you, you wake from sleep.
Example: The noise of a door slamming wakened her.

Definition: An installation is a place that contains equipment and machinery which are being used for a particular purpose.
Example: The building was turned into a secret military installation.

Definition: A philosopher is a person who studies or writes about philosophy.
Example: ...the Greek philosopher Plato.

Definition: A ferocious animal, person, or action is very fierce and violent.
Example: ...a ferocious guard-dog.

Definition: Something that is boiling or boiling hot is very hot.
Example: 'It's boiling in here,' complained Miriam.

Definition: You can use baking to describe weather or a place that is very hot indeed.
Example: ...a baking July day.

Definition: A sideline is something that you do in addition to your main job in order to earn extra money.
Example: It was quite a lucrative sideline.

Definition: fanciful; make-believe; simulated
Example: At last we had a bit of evidence that suggested she was more than she pretended to be.

Definition: If you say that something someone says or does is contrived, you think it is false and deliberate, rather than natural and not planned.
Example: There was nothing contrived or calculated about what he said.

Definition: When you reword something that is spoken or written, you try to express it in a way that is more accurate, more acceptable, or more easily understood.
Example: All right, I'll reword my question.

Definition: A depiction of something is a picture or a written description of it.
Example:
The lecture will trace the depiction of horses from earliest times to the present
day.

Definition: When someone does a recitation, they say aloud a piece of poetry or other writing that they have learned.
Example: The transmission began with a recitation from the Koran.

Definition: The inception of an institution or activity is the start of it.
Example: Since its inception the company has produced 53 different aircraft designs.

Definition: to accustom; make used (to)
Example: to habituate oneself to the cold

Definition: Preliminary activities or discussions take place at the beginning of an event, often as a form of preparation.
Example: Preliminary results show the Republican party with 11 percent of the vote.

Definition: A preamble is an introduction that comes before something you say or write.
Example: The controversy has arisen over the text of the preamble to the unification treaty.

Definition: An interviewer is a person who is asking someone questions at an interview.
Example: In 83 per cent of such cases, the interviewer would ask a new question instead of repeating the original one.

Definition: If you feel you want to do something or have something, even though you know you really should avoid it, you can refer to this feeling as temptation. You can also refer to the thing you want to do or have as a temptation.
Example: Will they be able to resist the temptation to buy?

Definition: If you describe someone's hair as matted, you mean that it has become a thick untidy mass, often because it is wet or dirty.
Example: She had matted hair and torn dusty clothes.

Definition: A messy person or activity makes things dirty or untidy.
Example: She was a good, if messy, cook.

Definition: Teamwork is the ability a group of people have to work well together.
Example: Today's complex buildings require close teamwork between the architect and the builders.

Definition: If you describe someone as obstinate, you are being critical of them because they are very determined to do what they want, and refuse to change their mind or be persuaded to do something else.
Example: He is obstinate and determined and will not give up.

Definition: the state or quality of being obstinate
Example: Ignorance and obstinacy blocked his proposed reform.

Definition: If you have persistence, you continue to do something even though it is difficult or other people are against it.
Example: Skill comes only with practice, patience and persistence.

Definition: If you call someone an idiot, you are showing that you think they are very stupid or have done something very stupid.
Example: I knew I'd been an idiot to stay there.

Definition: If you call someone a simpleton, you think they are easily deceived or not very intelligent.
Example: 'But Ian's such a simpleton,' she laughed.

Definition: If you say that someone has misled you, you mean that they have made you believe something which is not true, either by telling you a lie or by giving you a wrong idea or impression.
Example: Jack was furious with his London doctors for having misled him.

Definition: If you delude yourself, you let yourself believe that something is true, even though it is not true.
Example: The President was deluding himself if he thought he was safe from such action.

Definition: An imitation of something is a copy of it.
Example: ...the most accurate imitation of Chinese architecture in Europe.

Definition: of or relating to metals that have been shaped by heating and hammering
Example: They could make a lot of waves with those two facts, plus the forged cheques.

Definition: If you say that a person or an organization has become a  laughing stock, you mean that they are supposed to be important or serious but have been made to seem ridiculous.
Example: The truth must never get out. If it did she would be a laughing-stock.

Definition: If someone mocks you, you can refer to their behaviour or attitude as mockery.
Example: Was there a glint of mockery in his eyes?

Definition: Satire is the use of humour or exaggeration in order to show how foolish or wicked some people's behaviour or ideas are.
Example: The commercial side of the Christmas season is an easy target for satire.

Definition: Slapstick is a simple type of comedy in which the actors behave in a rough and foolish way.
Example: ...slapstick comedy.

Definition: A burlesque is a performance or a piece of writing that makes fun of something by copying it in an exaggerated way. You can also use burlesque to refer to a situation in real life that is like this.
Example: The book read like a black comic burlesque.

Definition: If you refer to something that someone says as twaddle, you mean that it is silly or untrue.
Example: The letter read: Dear Partridge, What you say is absolute twaddle.

Definition: If you mimic the actions or voice of a person or animal, you imitate them, usually in a way that is meant to be amusing or entertaining.
Example: He could mimic anybody.

Definition: A caricature of someone is a drawing or description of them that exaggerates their appearance or behaviour in a humorous or critical way.
Example: The poster showed a caricature of him with a devil's horns and tail.

Definition: If you describe something as a travesty of another thing, you mean that it is a very bad representation of that other thing.
Example:
Her research suggests that Smith's reputation today is a travesty of what he really
stood for.

Definition: A hoax is a trick in which someone tells people a lie, for example that there is a bomb somewhere when there is not, or that a picture is genuine when it is not.
Example: A series of bomb hoaxes has disrupted Christmas shopping in the city centre.

Definition: When someone in authority arbitrates between two people or groups who are in dispute, they consider all the facts and make an official decision about who is right.
Example: He arbitrates between investors and members of the association.

Definition: If you intervene in a situation, you become involved in it and try to change it.
Example: The situation calmed down when police intervened.

Definition: If you intercede with someone, you try to persuade them to forgive someone or end their disagreement with them.
Example: They asked my father to intercede with the king on their behalf.

Definition: Arbitration is the judging of a dispute between people or groups by someone who is not involved.
Example: ...the independent arbitration service, ACAS.

Definition: Conciliation is willingness to end a disagreement or the process of ending a disagreement.
Example: Resolving the dispute will require a mood of conciliation on both sides.

Definition: Negotiators are people who take part in political or financial negotiations.
Example: ...the rebels' chief negotiator at the peace talks.

Definition: a person selected to judge a dispute; arbiter, esp. one, as in collective bargaining negotiations, named with the consent of both sides
Example: An arbitrator will rule on who actually gets to fly the planes.

Definition: The practicalities of a situation are the practical aspects of it, as opposed to its theoretical aspects.
Example: Decisions about your children should be based on the practicalities of everyday life.

Definition: A convertible is a car with a soft roof that can be folded down or removed.
Example: Her own car is a convertible Golf.

Definition: Something that is negotiable can be changed or agreed when people discuss it.
Example: He warned that his economic programme for the country was not negotiable.

Definition: A kickback is a sum of money that is paid to someone illegally, for example money which a company pays someone to arrange for the company to be chosen to do an important job.
Example: ...alleged kickbacks and illegal party financing.

Definition: You use of late to refer to an event or state of affairs that happened or began to exist a short time ago.
Example: His life has changed of late.

Definition: Subsistence is the condition of just having enough food or money to stay alive.
Example: ...below the subsistence level.

Definition: The overheads of a business are its regular and essential expenses, such as salaries, rent, electricity, and phone bills.
Example: We are having to cut our costs to reduce overheads and remain competitive.

Definition: If your skin prickles, it feels as if a lot of small sharp points are being stuck into it, either because of something touching it or because you feel a strong emotion.
Example: He paused, feeling his scalp prickling under his hat.

Definition: When a part of your body itches, you have an unpleasant feeling on your skin that makes you want to scratch.
Example: When someone has hayfever, the eyes and nose will stream and itch.

Definition: When you tickle someone, you move your fingers lightly over a sensitive part of their body, often in order to make them laugh.
Example: I was tickling him, and he was laughing and giggling.

Definition: Bait is food which you put on a hook or in a trap in order to catch fish or animals.
Example: He baited his hook with pie.

Definition: If someone or something tantalizes you, they make you feel hopeful and excited about getting what you want, usually before disappointing you by not letting you have what they appeared to offer.
Example: The boy would come into the room and tantalize the dog with his feed.

Definition: If something titillates someone, it pleases and excites them, especially in a sexual way.
Example: The pictures were not meant to titillate audiences.

Definition: If you describe something as preposterous, you mean that it is extremely unreasonable and foolish.
Example: The whole idea was preposterous.

Definition: A holocaust is an event in which there is a lot of destruction and many people are killed, especially one caused by war.
Example: A nuclear holocaust seemed a very real possibility in the '50s.

Definition: An assassin is a person who assassinates someone.
Example: He saw the shooting and memorised the number of the assassin's car.

Definition: If you describe someone or their behaviour as ingratiating, you mean that they try to make people like them.
Example: He said this with an ingratiating smile.

Definition: In former times, the tsar was the king of Russia.
Example: She was appointed as the government's first mental health tsar for schools.

Definition: A superstar is a very famous entertainer or sports player.
Example: He was more than a footballing superstar, he was a celebrity.

Definition:
A rake is a garden tool consisting of a row of metal or wooden teeth attached to a long handle. You can use a rake to make the earth smooth and level before you put plants in,
or to gather leaves together.
Example: Rake the soil, press the seed into it, then cover it lightly.

Definition: If someone is gored by an animal, they are badly wounded by its horns or tusks.
Example: Carruthers had been gored by a rhinoceros.

Definition: A twinge is a sudden sharp feeling or emotion, usually an unpleasant one.
Example: I would have twinges of guilt occasionally.

Definition: Aristocratic means belonging to or typical of the aristocracy.
Example: ...a wealthy, aristocratic family.

Definition: If you say that someone's behaviour is lordly, you are critical of them because they treat other people in a proud and arrogant way.
Example: ...their usual lordly indifference to patients.

Definition: Someone who is titled has a title such as ' Lord', ' Lady', ' Sir', or ' Princess' before their name, showing that they have a high rank in society.
Example: Her mother was a titled lady.

Definition: An aristocrat is someone whose family has a high social rank, especially someone who has a title.
Example: The American slang sounded odd coming from the Eton-educated Swiss aristocrat.

Definition: If something happens outdoors, it happens outside in the fresh air rather than in a building.
Example: It was warm enough to be outdoors all afternoon.

Definition: A heath is an area of open land covered with rough grass or heather and with very few trees or bushes.
Example: The paler brown small heath butterflies can be put up from rough grass when one walks through it.

Definition: If something or someone embarrasses you, they make you feel shy or ashamed.
Example: His clumsiness embarrassed him.

Definition: The lexicon of a particular subject is all the terms associated with it. The lexicon of a person or group is all the words they commonly use.
Example: ...the lexicon of management.

Definition: You use parlance when indicating that the expression you are using is normally used by a particular group of people.
Example: The phrase is common diplomatic parlance for spying.

Definition: Slang consists of words, expressions, and meanings that are informal and are used by people who know each other very well or who have the same interests.
Example: Archie liked to think he kept up with current slang.

Definition: A particular idiom is a particular style of something such as music, dance, or architecture.
Example: McCartney was also keen to write in a classical idiom, rather than a pop one.

Definition: If something patters on a surface, it hits it quickly several times, making quiet, tapping sounds.
Example: Rain pattered gently outside, dripping on to the roof from the pines.

Definition: If something is expressed using a particular type of phraseology, it is expressed in words and expressions of that type.
Example: This careful phraseology is clearly intended to appeal to various sides of the conflict.

Definition: If someone babbles, they talk in a confused or excited way.
Example: Momma babbled on and on about how he was ruining me.

Definition:
A paddle is a short pole with a wide flat part at one end or at both ends. You hold it in your hands and use it as an
oar to move a small boat through water.
Example: We might be able to push ourselves across with the paddle.

Definition: If you dabble in something, you take part in it but not very seriously.
Example: He dabbled in business.

Definition: A trumpet is a musical instrument of the brass family which plays quite high notes. You play the trumpet by blowing into it.
Example: The government has been trumpeting tourism as a growth industry.

Definition: If you dab something, you touch it several times using quick, light movements. If you dab a substance onto a surface, you put it there using quick, light movements.
Example: She arrived weeping, dabbing her eyes with a tissue.

Definition: To chortle means to laugh in a way that shows you are very pleased.
Example: There was silence for a moment, then Larry began chortling.

Definition: If you sneer at someone or something, you express your contempt for them by the expression on your face or by what you say.
Example: There is too great a readiness to sneer at anything the Opposition does.

Definition: If you snicker, you laugh quietly in a disrespectful way, for example at something rude or embarrassing.
Example: We all snickered at Mrs. Swenson.

Definition: If you do something with alacrity, you do it quickly and eagerly.
Example: As you can imagine, I accepted with alacrity.

Definition: Earthly means happening in the material world of our life on Earth and not in any spiritual life or life after death.
Example: ...the need to confront evil during the earthly life.

Definition: If you describe something as unconditional, you mean that the person doing or giving it does not require anything to be done by other people in exchange.
Example: Children need unconditional love.

Definition: A wad of something such as paper or cloth is a tight bundle or ball of it.
Example: ...a wad of banknotes.

Definition: Padding is soft material which is put on something or inside it in order to make it less hard, to protect it, or to give it a different shape.
Example: ...the foam rubber padding on the headphones.

Definition: A tablet is a small solid round mass of medicine which you swallow.
Example: It's time for your tablets, dear.

Definition: A notebook is a small book for writing notes in.
Example: He brought out a notebook and pen from his pocket.

Definition: If you  stretch out or stretch yourself out, you lie with your legs and body in a straight line.
Example: The jacuzzi was too small to stretch out in.

Definition: If you describe a person or animal as scrawny, you mean that they look unattractive because they are so thin.
Example: ...a scrawny woman with dyed black hair.

Definition: Skeletal means relating to the bones in your body.
Example: ...the skeletal remains of seven adults.

Definition: If you misplace something, you lose it, usually only temporarily.
Example: He misplaces his reading glasses with such regularity that aides carry extras.

Definition: A deputation is a small group of people who have been asked to speak to someone on behalf of a larger group of people, especially in order to make a complaint.
Example: A deputation of elders from the village arrived headed by its chief.

Definition: A contingent of police, soldiers, or military vehicles is a group of them.
Example: The university has a large contingent of teacher training students.

Definition: Devolution is the transfer of some authority or power from a central organization or government to smaller organizations or government departments.
Example: ...the devolution of power to the regions.

Definition: If someone or something is imbued with an idea, feeling, or quality, they become filled with it.
Example:
As you listen, you notice how every single word is imbued with a breathless sense
of wonder.

Definition: If something is legalized, a law is passed that makes it legal.
Example: Divorce was legalized in 1981.

Definition: If someone or something is deficient in a particular thing, they do not have the full amount of it that they need in order to function normally or work properly.
Example: ...a diet deficient in vitamin B.

Definition: If you describe someone as broad-minded, you approve of them because they are willing to accept types of behaviour which is different from their own.
Example: ...a fair and broad-minded man.

Definition: If you are indulgent, you treat a person with special kindness, often in a way that is not good for them.
Example: His indulgent mother was willing to let him do anything he wanted.

Definition: If a person or society has humanitarian ideas or behaviour, they try to avoid making people suffer or they help people who are suffering.
Example: The men were released on humanitarian grounds.

Definition: Someone who is good-looking has an attractive face.
Example: Cassandra noticed him because he was good-looking.

Definition: A princely sum of money is a large sum of money.
Example: It'll cost them the princely sum of seventy-five pounds.

Definition: If something is richly coloured, flavoured, or perfumed, it has a pleasantly strong colour, flavour, or perfume.
Example: ...an opulent display of richly coloured fabrics.

Definition: The living room in a house is the room where people sit and relax.
Example: We were sitting on the couch in the living room watching TV.

Definition: If someone falsifies something, they change it or add untrue details to it in order to deceive people.
Example: The charges against him include fraud, bribery, and falsifying business records.

Definition: Forgery is the crime of forging money, documents, or paintings.
Example: He was found guilty of forgery.

Definition: If one thing belies another, it hides the true situation and so creates a false idea or image of someone or something.
Example: His youthful face belies his 80 years.

Definition: If you say that a person or their behaviour is dishonest, you mean that they are not truthful or honest and that you cannot trust them.
Example: You have been dishonest with me.

Definition: Someone who is disloyal to their friends, family, or country does not support them or does things that could harm them.
Example: She was so disloyal to her deputy she made his position untenable.

Definition: If you say that someone is untrustworthy, you think they are unreliable and cannot be trusted.
Example: I think he is shallow, vain and untrustworthy.

Definition: Animals, especially the animals in a particular area, can be referred to as fauna.
Example: ...the flora and fauna of the African jungle.

Definition: A crane is a large machine that moves heavy things by lifting them in the air.
Example: The little prefabricated hut was lifted away by a huge crane.

Definition: An elevator is a device that carries people up and down inside buildings.
Example: take the ~

Definition: Rays of light are narrow beams of light.
Example: ...the first rays of light spread over the horizon.

Definition: Enlightenment means the act of enlightening or the state of being enlightened.
Example: Stella had a moment of enlightenment.

Definition: If you describe someone as a firebrand, especially someone who is very active in politics, you mean that they are always trying to make people take strong action.
Example: ...his reputation as a young firebrand.

Definition: If something tapers, or if you taper it, it becomes gradually thinner at one end.
Example: Unlike other trees, it doesn't taper very much. It stays fat all the way up.

Definition: If someone or something is irradiated, they are exposed to a large amount of radioactivity.
Example: Leukaemia in children was more common if the fathers had been heavily irradiated.

Definition: When you  cheer up or when something cheers you up, you stop feeling depressed and become more cheerful.
Example: I think he misses her terribly. You might cheer him up.

Definition: If you take heart from something, you are encouraged and made to feel optimistic by it.
Example: Yeovil will also take heart from how they played in the first half.

Definition: If something perks you up or if you  perk up, you become cheerful and lively, after feeling tired, bored, or depressed.
Example: He perks up and jokes with them.

Definition: If you alleviate pain, suffering, or an unpleasant condition, you make it less intense or severe.
Example: Nowadays, a great deal can be done to alleviate back pain.

Definition: If you allay someone's fears or doubts, you stop them feeling afraid or doubtful.
Example: He did what he could to allay his wife's fears.

Definition: to remove a load from (a person or animal)
Example: to disburden o.s. of

Definition: If you are ecstatic, you feel very happy and full of excitement.
Example: His wife gave birth to their first child, and he was ecstatic about it.

Definition: Compassion is a feeling of pity, sympathy, and understanding for someone who is suffering.
Example: Patients need time and compassion from their physicians.

Definition: A diploma is a qualification which may be awarded to a student by a university or college, or by a high school in the United States.
Example: ...a new two-year course leading to a diploma in social work.

Definition: A ruck is a situation where a group of people are fighting or struggling.
Example: There'll be a huge ruck with the cops as they try to take photographs.

Definition: If you rumple someone's hair, you move your hand backwards and forwards through it as your way of showing affection to them.
Example: I leaned forward to rumple his hair, but he jerked out of the way.

Definition: When a part of your face puckers or when you pucker it, it becomes tight or stretched, often because you are trying not to cry or are going to kiss someone.
Example: Toby's face puckered.

Definition: If something crinkles or if you crinkle it, it becomes slightly creased or folded.
Example: He shrugged whimsically, his eyes crinkling behind his glasses.

Definition: A  traffic jam is a long line of vehicles that cannot move forward because there is too much traffic, or because the road is blocked by something.
Example: The average traffic jam was six miles long.

Definition: The circumference of a circle, place, or round object is the distance around its edge.
Example: ...a scientist calculating the Earth's circumference.

Definition: Someone who is educated has a high standard of learning.
Example: He is an educated, amiable and decent man.

Definition:
A booklet is a small, thin book that has a paper cover and that gives you information about
something.
Example: If the accompanying booklet is a little on the flimsy side, the music has lost none of its energy.

Definition: If you hand things out to people, you give one or more to each person in a group.
Example: One of my jobs was to hand out the prizes.

Definition: If you say that someone is small-minded, you are critical of them because they have fixed opinions and are unwilling to change them or to think about more general subjects.
Example: ...their small-minded preoccupation with making money.

Definition: A grudging feeling or action is felt or done very unwillingly.
Example: He even earned his opponents' grudging respect.

Definition: A cottage is a small house, usually in the country.
Example: They used to have a cottage in N.W. Scotland.

Definition: If things abound, or if a place abounds with things, there are very large numbers of them.
Example: Stories abound about when he was in charge.

Definition:
If one type of person or thing predominates in a group, there is more of that type of person or thing in the group than of any
other.
Example: In older age groups women predominate because men tend to die younger.

Definition: Persecution is cruel and unfair treatment of a person or group, especially because of their religious or political beliefs, or their race.
Example: ...the persecution of minorities.

Definition: If you describe someone as narrow-minded, you are criticizing them because they are unwilling to consider new ideas or other people's opinions.
Example: ...a narrow-minded bigot.

Definition: Unsophisticated people do not have a wide range of experience or knowledge and have simple tastes.
Example:
It was music of a rather crude kind which unsophisticated audiences enjoyed listening
to.

Definition: A kink is a curve or twist in something which is otherwise or normally straight.
Example: ...a tiny black kitten with tufted ears and a kink in her tail.

Definition: If one thing is entwined with another thing, or if you entwine two things, the two things are twisted around each other.
Example: His dazed eyes stare at the eels, which still writhe and entwine.

Definition: Braid is a narrow piece of decorated cloth or twisted threads, which is used to decorate clothes or curtains.
Example: ...a plum-coloured uniform with lots of gold braid.

Definition: If people or animals scavenge for things, they collect them by searching among waste or unwanted objects.
Example: Many are orphans, their parents killed as they scavenged for food.

Definition: Fodder is food that is given to cows, horses, and other animals.
Example: ...fodder for horses.

Definition: If you mull something over, you think about it for a long time before deciding what to do.
Example: McLaren had been mulling over an idea to make a movie.

Definition: reflection
Example: His philosophical musings were a complete departure from the cynical lies of his predecessors.

Definition: If you describe a person, machine, or method as unreliable, you mean that you cannot trust them.
Example: Diplomats can be a notoriously unreliable and misleading source of information.

Definition: If your situation is precarious, you are not in complete control of events and might fail in what you are doing at any moment.
Example: Our financial situation had become precarious.

Definition: Instability is the quality of being unstable.
Example: ...unpopular policies, which resulted in social discontent and political instability.

Definition: If you describe someone's behaviour as uncontrolled, you mean they appear unable to stop it or to make it less extreme.
Example: His uncontrolled behaviour disturbed the entire class.

Definition: If someone is on the run, they are trying to escape or hide from someone such as the police or an enemy.
Example: Both times he had the world 's best team on the run.

Definition: A fugitive is someone who is running away or hiding, usually in order to avoid being caught by the police.
Example: The rebel leader was a fugitive from justice.

Definition: If someone in a position of responsibility is negligent, they do not do something which they ought to do.
Example:
The jury determined that the airline was negligent in training and supervising the
crew.

Definition: Curtains are large pieces of material which you hang from the top of a window.
Example: Her bedroom curtains were drawn.

Definition: If you drape a piece of cloth somewhere, you place it there so that it hangs down in a casual and graceful way.
Example: Natasha took the coat and draped it over her shoulders.

Definition: Something that is incorrect is wrong and untrue.
Example: He denied that his evidence about the phone call was incorrect.

Definition: If you describe something as untidy, you mean that it is not neat or well arranged.
Example: The place quickly became untidy.

Definition: If someone is muddled, they are confused about something.
Example: I'm afraid I'm a little muddled. I'm not exactly sure where to begin.

Definition: Theft is the crime of stealing.
Example: Art theft is now part of organised crime.

Definition: If you describe a feeling or action as misplaced, you are critical of it because you think it is inappropriate, or directed towards the wrong thing or person.
Example: Lenders rely on the misplaced loyalty of existing borrowers to make their profit.

Definition: shocked or astounded
Example: He seemed stunned that the Princess Adrina had even heard of him, let alone wanted him to design her trousseau.

Definition: At sea means on or under the sea, far away from land.
Example: The boats remain at sea for an average of ten days at a time.

Definition: If you are perplexed, you feel confused and slightly worried by something because you do not understand it.
Example: She is perplexed about what to do for her daughter.

Definition: If something is gaudy, it is very brightly-coloured and showy.
Example: ...her gaudy orange-and-purple floral hat.

Definition: A masterpiece is an extremely good painting, novel, film, or other work of art.
Example: His book, I must add, is a masterpiece.

Definition: A work of art is a painting or piece of sculpture which is of high quality.
Example: ...a collection of works of art of international significance.

Definition: Angels are spiritual beings that some people believe are God's servants in heaven.
Example: Thank you a thousand times, you're an angel.

Definition: Something that is incomplete is not yet finished, or does not have all the parts or details that it needs.
Example: The clearing of rubbish and drains is still incomplete.

Definition:
You use scant to indicate that there is very little of something or not as much of something as
there should be.
Example: She began to berate the police for paying scant attention to the theft from her car.

Definition: If you are downhearted, you are feeling sad and discouraged.
Example: Max sighed, sounding even more downhearted.

Definition: Supplementary things are added to something in order to improve it.
Example: ...the question of whether or not we need to take supplementary vitamins.

Definition: An auxiliary is a person who is employed to assist other people in their work. Auxiliaries are often medical workers or members of the armed forces.
Example: Nursing auxiliaries provide basic care, but are not qualified nurses.

Definition: The ancillary workers in an institution are the people such as cleaners and cooks whose work supports the main work of the institution.
Example: ...ancillary staff.

Definition: If something saddens you, it makes you feel sad.
Example: The cruelty in the world saddens me incredibly.

Definition: If you describe a person as meek, you think that they are gentle and quiet, and likely to do what other people say.
Example: He was a meek, mild-mannered fellow.

Definition: If you describe a person or their behaviour as unassuming, you approve of them because they are quiet and do not try to appear important.
Example: He's a man of few words, very polite and unassuming.

Definition: If you describe someone or something as lowly, you mean that they are low in rank, status, or importance.
Example: ...lowly bureaucrats pretending to be senators.

Definition: If something is commonplace, it happens often or is often found, and is therefore not surprising.
Example: Foreign vacations have become commonplace.

Definition: A providential event is lucky because it happens at exactly the right time.
Example:
He explained the yellow fever epidemic as a providential act to discourage urban
growth.

Definition: If you describe a remark or idea as felicitous, you approve of it because it seems particularly suitable in the circumstances.
Example: Her prose style is not always felicitous; she tends to repetition.

Definition: A well-timed action or comment is done or made at the most appropriate or suitable time.
Example: He built the company through a string of well-timed acquisitions.

Definition: You use fad to refer to an activity or topic of interest that is very popular for a short time, but which people become bored with very quickly.
Example: Hamnett does not believe environmental concern is a passing fad.

Definition: Trash consists of unwanted things or waste material such as used paper, empty containers and bottles, and waste food.
Example: The yards are overgrown and cluttered with trash.

Definition: insanity
Example: He was on the brink of madness.

Definition: If you say that a competition or contest is a walkover, you mean that it is won very easily.
Example: Rethinking of the walkover score will be considered for next season after it was changed from 350 to 150.

Definition: If one thing takes precedence over another, it is regarded as more important than the other thing.
Example: Have as much fun as possible at college, but don't let it take precedence over work.

Definition: If people in authority enforce a law or a rule, they make sure that it is obeyed, usually by punishing people who do not obey it.
Example: One of the beat officer's duties was to help the council to enforce the ban.

Definition: If you describe a woman's appearance or behaviour as mannish, you mean it is more like a man's appearance or behaviour than a woman's.
Example: She shook hands in a mannish way, her grip dry and firm.

Definition: If you describe a man as boyish, you mean that he is like a boy in his appearance or behaviour, and you find this characteristic quite attractive.
Example: She was relieved to see his face light up with a boyish grin.

Definition: A man's masculinity is the fact that he is a man.
Example: ...a project on the link between masculinity and violence.

Definition: Manhood is the state of being a man rather than a boy.
Example: They were failing lamentably to help their sons grow from boyhood to manhood.

Definition: You use machismo to refer to men's behaviour or attitudes when they are very conscious and proud of their masculinity.
Example: Hooky, naturally, has to prove his machismo by going on the scariest rides twice.

Definition: A shopping precinct is an area in the centre of a town in which cars are not allowed.
Example: The Centre was a pedestrian precinct with a bandstand in the middle.

Definition: In Britain, a superintendent is a senior police officer of the rank above an inspector. In the United States, a superintendent is the head of a police department.
Example: He was stopped at the airport by an assistant superintendent of police.

Definition: Innumerable means very many, or too many to be counted.
Example: He has invented innumerable excuses, told endless lies.

Definition: A legion is a large group of soldiers who form one section of an army.
Example: He joined the French Foreign Legion.

Definition: If you describe something as infinite, you are emphasizing that it is extremely great in amount or degree.
Example: ...an infinite variety of landscapes.

Definition: A myriad or myriads of people or things is a very large number or great variety of them.
Example: They face a myriad of problems bringing up children.

Definition: Flecks are small marks on a surface, or objects that look like small marks.
Example: He went to the men's room to wash flecks of blood from his shirt.

Definition: If someone is disfigured, their appearance is spoiled.
Example: Many of the wounded had been badly disfigured.

Definition: If someone is traumatized by an event or situation, it shocks or upsets them very much, and may cause them psychological damage.
Example: I was traumatized by the experience.

Definition: If you gouge something, you make a hole or a long cut in it, usually with a pointed object.
Example: Stiletto heels are gouging out chunks of the marble floor.

Definition: An indentation is the space at the beginning of a line of writing when it starts further away from the edge of the paper than all the other lines.
Example: Using a knife, make slight indentations around the edges of the pastry.

Definition: Conjugal means relating to marriage or a married couple's relationship , especially their sexual relationship.
Example: ...partners deprived of their conjugal rights.

Definition: Matrimonial means concerning marriage or married people.
Example: ...the matrimonial home.

Definition:
Bridal is used to describe something that belongs or relates to a bride, or to both a bride and the person she
is marrying.
Example: She wore a floor-length bridal gown.

Definition: A baron is a man who is a member of the lowest rank of the nobility.
Example: ...their stepfather, Baron Michael Distemple.

Definition: A tycoon is a person who is successful in business and so has become rich and powerful.
Example: ...a self-made Irish property tycoon.

Definition: If one animal or person copulates with another, they have sex. You can also say that two animals or people copulate.
Example:
During the time she is paired to a male, the female allows no other males to copulate
with her.

Definition: If you talk about the irrelevance of something, you mean that it is irrelevant.
Example: ...the utter irrelevance of the debate.

Definition: If you refer to something as a triviality, you think that it is unimportant and not serious.
Example: He accused me of making a great fuss about trivialities.

Definition: Enmity is a feeling of hatred towards someone that lasts for a long time.
Example: I think there is an historic enmity between them.

Definition: Someone who is ragged looks untidy and is wearing clothes that are old and torn.
Example: The five survivors eventually reached safety, ragged, half-starved and exhausted.

Definition: Someone or something that is scruffy is dirty and untidy.
Example: ...a young man, pale, scruffy and unshaven.

Definition: If something is hypothetical, it is based on possible ideas or situations rather than actual ones.
Example:
Ed poses a series of hypothetical situations to see what Mitch would be willing to
do if he knew no one would find out.

Definition: Something that is notional exists only in theory or as a suggestion or idea, but not in reality.
Example: ...the notional value of state assets.

Definition: If you gape, you look at someone or something in surprise, usually with an open mouth.
Example: His secretary stopped taking notes to gape at me.

Definition: If you grope for something that you cannot see, you try to find it by moving your hands around in order to feel it.
Example: With his left hand he groped for the knob, turned it, and pulled the door open.

Definition: If you scrabble for something, especially something that you cannot see, you move your hands or your feet about quickly and hurriedly in order to find it.
Example: He grabbed his jacket and scrabbled in his desk drawer for some loose change.

Definition: Fuzz is a mass of short, curly hairs.
Example: He had a baby fuzz round his jaw.

Definition: A legation is a group of government officials and diplomats who work in a foreign country and represent their government in that country.
Example: ...a member of the U.S. legation.

Definition: If you miscalculate, you make a mistake in judging a situation or in making a calculation.
Example: It's clear that he has badly miscalculated the mood of the people.

Definition: If you underestimate something, you do not realize how large or great it is or will be.
Example:
None of us should ever underestimate the degree of difficulty women face in career
advancement.

Definition: If you underrate someone or something, you do not recognize how clever, important, or significant they are.
Example: We women have a lot of good business skills, although we tend to underrate ourselves.

Definition: If things such as sounds, smells, or feelings mingle, they become mixed together but are usually still recognizable.
Example: Now the cheers and applause mingled in a single sustained roar.

Definition: Something that is minimal is very small in quantity, value, or degree.
Example: The co-operation between the two is minimal.

Definition: Temperate is used to describe a climate or a place which is never extremely hot or extremely cold.
Example: The Nile Valley keeps a temperate climate throughout the year.

Definition: the state or quality of being popular
Example: That was the foundation of his great popularity over here, something he had never attained in France.

Definition: If you describe something as ostentatious, you disapprove of it because it is expensive and is intended to impress people.
Example:
...his house, which, however elaborate, is less ostentatious than the preserves of
other Dallas tycoons.

Definition: If you describe someone or something as glamorous, you mean that they are more attractive, exciting, or interesting than ordinary people or things.
Example: ...some of the world's most beautiful and glamorous women.

Definition: A brood is a group of baby birds that were born at the same time to the same mother.
Example: ...a large brood of children.

Definition: If someone pouts, they stick out their lips, usually in order to show that they are annoyed or to make themselves sexually attractive.
Example: He whined and pouted when he did not get what he wanted.

Definition: To bestride something means to be the most powerful and important person or thing in it.
Example: America's media companies bestride the globe.

Definition: the act of substituting or state of being substituted
Example: Note that the income and substitution effects move work effort in opposite directions.

Definition: Dispersal is the spreading of things over a wide area.
Example: Plants have different mechanisms of dispersal for their spores.

Definition: A scattering of things or people is a small number of them spread over an area.
Example: ...the scattering of houses east of the village.

Definition: A slaying is a murder.
Example: ...a trail of motiveless slayings.

Definition: Something that is poetic is very beautiful and expresses emotions in a sensitive or moving way.
Example: The pianist gave an exciting yet poetic performance.

Definition: If you find something perplexing, you do not understand it or do not know how to deal with it.
Example: It took years to understand many perplexing diseases.

Definition: A bewildering thing or situation is very confusing and difficult to understand or to make a decision about.
Example: A glance along his bookshelves reveals a bewildering array of interests.

Definition: A riddle is a puzzle or joke in which you ask a question that seems to be nonsense but which has a clever or amusing answer.
Example: Hawking's equation is a clue to the riddle of black holes.

Definition: not sheltered
Example: There was a bitter north-easter cutting savagely across the unsheltered marshes, and her ungloved hands were blue, obviously numb.

Definition: A  pet name is a special name that you use for a close friend or a member of your family instead of using their real name.
Example: HALF of drivers give their cars pet names, says a survey.

Definition: A diminutive person or object is very small.
Example: She noticed a diminutive figure standing at the entrance.

Definition: An epithet is an adjective or short phrase which is used as a way of criticizing or praising someone.
Example: ...the religious issue which led to the epithet 'bible-basher'.

Definition: A closed group of people does not welcome new people or ideas from outside.
Example: It was to be a closed circle of no more than twelve women.

Definition: An Aboriginal is a member of one of the tribes living in Australia when Europeans arrived there.
Example:
The islands are considered by the west coast Aboriginals to be 'the place where time
began'.

Definition: Colloquial words and phrases are informal and are used mainly in conversation.
Example: ...a colloquial expression.

Definition: Inborn qualities are natural ones which you are born with.
Example: He had an inborn talent for languages.

Definition: If something is unchanged, it has stayed the same for a particular period of time.
Example: For many years prices have remained virtually unchanged.

Definition: Something that is untouched by something else is not affected by it.
Example: Few areas of life remain untouched by technology.

Definition: the quality or state of being authentic; reliability; genuineness
Example: Not that there was any intrinsic virtue in that, but it did give a certain underpinning of authenticity.

Definition: If someone or something has credibility, people believe in them and trust them.
Example: The police have lost their credibility.

Definition: If you describe a fact, situation, or activity as inescapable, you mean that it is difficult not to notice it or be affected by it.
Example: The economic logic of reform is inescapable.

Definition: You use inexorable to describe a process which cannot be prevented from continuing or progressing.
Example: ...the seemingly inexorable rise in unemployment.

Definition: Defiance is behaviour or an attitude which shows that you are not willing to obey someone.
Example: ...his courageous defiance of the government.

Definition: Scepticism is great doubt about whether something is true or useful.
Example: The report has inevitably been greeted with scepticism.

Definition: Sarcasm is speech or writing which actually means the opposite of what it seems to say. Sarcasm is usually intended to mock or insult someone.
Example: 'What a pity,' Graham said with a hint of sarcasm.

Definition: Misanthropy is a general dislike of people.
Example: In further releases, the band would focus even more on misanthropy and hatred themes.

Definition: If you describe someone as inconsistent, you are criticizing them for not behaving in the same way every time a similar situation occurs.
Example: You are inconsistent and unpredictable.

Definition: being in contact; connected or neighbouring
Example: Now, though, he sat on the other side of a desk from me in a bare room adjoining the cell block.
His network of spies extended, now, from Quetta, hundreds of miles to the south-west, to Chitral, abutting Afghan Nuristan.

Definition: Demonstrators are people who are marching or gathering somewhere to show their opposition to something or their support for something.
Example: I saw the police using tear gas to try and break up a crowd of demonstrators.

Definition: If you say that someone's way of life or opinions are nonconformist, you mean that they are different from those of most people.
Example: Their views are non-conformist and their political opinions are extreme.

Definition: Heterodox beliefs, opinions, or ideas are different from the accepted or official ones.
Example: His heterodox beliefs raised doubts about his fitness for high office.

Definition: A cipher is a secret system of writing that you use to send messages.
Example: ...converting their messages into ciphers.

Definition: A memorandum is a written report that is prepared for a person or committee in order to provide them with information about a particular matter.
Example: ...a memorandum from the Ministry of Defence on its role.

Definition: If you scrawl something, you write it in a careless and untidy way.
Example: He scrawled a hasty note to his daughter.

Definition: If you jot something short such as an address somewhere, you write it down so that you will remember it.
Example: Could you just jot his name on there?

Definition: A jumble of things is a lot of different things that are all mixed together in a disorganized or confused way.
Example: The shoreline was made up of a jumble of huge boulders.

Definition: Someone who is disinterested is not involved in a particular situation or not likely to benefit from it and is therefore able to act in a fair and unselfish way.
Example: The current sole superpower is far from being a disinterested observer.

Definition: If you describe someone's face as expressionless, you mean that they are not showing their feelings.
Example: We stopped a moment to gaze at the deer then looked into each other's expressionless faces.

Definition: Deadpan humour is when you appear to be serious and are hiding the fact that you are joking or teasing someone.
Example: ...her natural capacity for irony and deadpan humour.

Definition: A drawback is an aspect of something or someone that makes them less acceptable than they would otherwise be.
Example: He felt the apartment's only drawback was that it was too small.

Definition: If you make a foray into a new or unfamiliar type of activity, you start to become involved in it.
Example: The fashion house has made a discreet foray into furnishings.

Definition: If something is infrequent, it does not happen often.
Example: ...John's infrequent visits to London.

Definition: If something happens on and off, or off and on, it happens occasionally, or only for part of a period of time, not in a regular or continuous way.
Example: I was still working on and off as a waitress to support myself.

Definition: Someone who is unconscious is in a state similar to sleep, usually as the result of a serious injury or a lack of oxygen.
Example: By the time ambulancemen arrived he was unconscious.

Definition: A deduction is a conclusion that you have reached about something because of other things that you know to be true.
Example: It was a pretty astute deduction.

Definition: Grey is the colour of ashes or of clouds on a rainy day.
Example: ...a grey suit.

Definition: If someone loosens restrictions or laws, for example, they make them less strict or severe.
Example: Many business groups have been pressing the Federal Reserve to loosen interest rates.

Definition: A responsive person is quick to react to people or events and to show emotions such as pleasure and affection.
Example: Harriet was an easy, responsive little girl.

Definition: Someone who is receptive to new ideas or suggestions is prepared to consider them or accept them.
Example: The voters had seemed receptive to his ideas.

Definition: If something is expansive, it covers or includes a large area or many things.
Example: ...an expansive grassy play area.

Definition: The deployment of troops, resources, or equipment is the organization and positioning of them so that they are ready for quick action.
Example: ...the deployment of troops into townships.

Definition: given to making plots; cunning
Example: Could he have been pushed into bumping off his main rival by his scheming wife?

Definition: If you describe an aspect of a situation as a contradiction, you mean that it is completely different from other aspects, and so makes the situation confused or difficult to understand.
Example: ...the contradictions between her private life and the public persona.

Definition: hostile feeling; animosity
Example: Bad luck and ill feeling, for the most part.

Definition: Ill will is unfriendly or hostile feelings that you have towards someone.
Example: He didn't bear anyone any ill will.

Definition: Someone who is disciplined behaves or works in a controlled way.
Example: For me it meant being very disciplined about how I run my life.

Definition: If there is a precedent for an action or event, it has happened before, and this can be regarded as an argument for doing it again.
Example:
The trial could set an important precedent for dealing with large numbers of similar
cases.

Definition: If you describe something as outdated, you mean that you think it is old-fashioned and no longer useful or relevant to modern life.
Example: ...outdated and inefficient factories.

Definition: If someone or something is exempt from a particular rule, duty, or obligation, they do not have to follow it or do it.
Example: Men in college were exempt from military service.

Definition: A landowner is a person who owns land, especially a large amount of land.
Example: ...rural communities involved in conflicts with large landowners.

Definition: An abscess is a painful swelling containing pus.
Example: The guilt about going to bed with Scott Irving grew inside her like an abscess, getting bigger and more painful with every day.
