Definition: An ulcer is a sore area on the outside or inside of your body which is very painful and may bleed or produce an unpleasant poisonous substance.
Example: ...stomach ulcers.

Definition: in an unpleasant, bad, or reprehensible manner
Example: to behave awfully

Definition: A pigment is a substance that gives something a particular colour.
Example: The Romans used natural pigments on their fabrics and walls.

Definition: A vest is a piece of underwear which you can wear on the top half of your body in order to keep warm.
Example: All authority was vested in the woman, who discharged every kind of public duty.

Definition: If you describe someone as crafty, you mean that they achieve what they want in a clever way, often by deceiving people.
Example: ...a crafty, lying character who enjoys plotting against others.

Definition: If you describe someone as wan, you mean that they look pale and tired.
Example: He looked wan and tired.

Definition: A throwaway product is intended to be used only for a short time, and then to be thrown away.
Example: Now they are producing throwaway razors.

Definition: If you regard someone or something as expendable, you think it is acceptable to get rid of them, abandon them, or allow them to be destroyed when they are no longer needed.
Example: Once our services cease to be useful to them, we're expendable.

Definition: You use unusually to emphasize that someone or something has more of a particular quality than is usual.
Example: He was an unusually complex man.

Definition: If something seldom happens, it happens only occasionally.
Example: They seldom speak.

Definition: Someone who is discriminating has the ability to recognize things that are of good quality.
Example: More discriminating visitors now tend to shun the area.

Definition: filled with things or people in an untidy way
Example: Your bedroom is too messy An untidy bedroom can impact on sleep because a cluttered room means a cluttered mind.

Definition: Rococo is a decorative style that was popular in Europe in the eighteenth century. Rococo buildings, furniture, and works of art often include complicated curly decoration.
Example: At other times it was rococo mirrors.

Definition: You use in part to indicate that something exists or happens to some extent but not completely.
Example: The levels of blood glucose depend in part on what you eat and when you eat.

Definition: If you describe someone as a turncoat, you think they are disloyal or deceitful, because they have left their party or organization and joined an opposing one.
Example: His one-time admirers now accuse him of being a turncoat.

Definition: A quisling is someone who helps an enemy army that has taken control of their country.
Example: One forgets the power that comes with these quisling positions.

Definition: Convalescent means relating to convalescence.
Example: ...an officers' convalescent home.

Definition: a person who is or believes himself or herself to be chronically sick
Example: Less forward-looking ones had slipped into a more valetudinarian mode, forgetting to shave or apply make-up.

Definition: A fallacy is an idea which many people believe to be true, but which is in fact false because it is based on incorrect information or reasoning.
Example: It's a fallacy that the affluent give relatively more to charity than the less prosperous.

Definition: If you refer to someone's inconsistency, you are criticizing them for not behaving in the same way every time a similar situation occurs.
Example: His worst fault was his inconsistency.

Definition: If you describe a rumour, belief, or feeling as unfounded, you mean that it is wrong and is not based on facts or evidence.
Example: ...unfounded rumours that a police car had injured a young boy.

Definition: If you describe an action, feeling, or belief as illogical, you are critical of it because you think that it does not result from a logical and ordered way of thinking.
Example:
It is illogical to get rid of the very people who have the expertise to carry out
the job.

Definition: Clement weather is pleasantly mild and dry.
Example: Because of the clement May weather, they were optimistically wearing pastel summer dresses.

Definition: You use in theory to say that although something is supposed to be true or to happen in the way stated, it may not in fact be true or happen in that way.
Example:
A school dental service exists in theory, but in practice, there are few dentists
to work in it.

Definition: as a secret
Example: He declined to name his informants as he said the information was given in confidence.

Definition: Pastry is a food made from flour, fat, and water that is mixed together, rolled flat, and baked in the oven. It is used, for example, for making pies.
Example: The more decadent option is an enriched sweet pastry.

Definition: A treatise is a long, formal piece of writing about a particular subject.
Example: ...Locke's Treatise on Civil Government.

Definition: A siesta is a short sleep or rest which you have in the early afternoon, especially in hot countries.
Example: They have a siesta during the hottest part of the day.

Definition: If you are elated, you are extremely happy and excited because of something that has happened.
Example: I was elated that my second heart bypass had been successful.

Definition: When someone dithers, they hesitate because they are unable to make a quick decision about something.
Example: We're still dithering over whether to marry.

Definition: A graft is a piece of healthy skin or bone, or a healthy organ, which is attached to a damaged part of your body by a medical operation in order to replace it.
Example: The top layer of skin has to be grafted onto the burns.

Definition: If you uproot yourself or if you are uprooted, you leave, or are made to leave, a place where you have lived for a long time.
Example: ...the trauma of uprooting themselves from their homes.

Definition: Man-made things are created or caused by people, rather than occurring naturally.
Example: Man-made and natural disasters have disrupted the Government's economic plans.

Definition: If you describe something as bogus, you mean that it is not genuine.
Example: ...their bogus insurance claim.

Definition: If you describe someone as empty-headed, you mean that they are not very intelligent and often do silly things.
Example: After all, she was not unattractive; a bit empty-headed perhaps, but quite amusing at times.

Definition: Cosmetics are substances such as lipstick or powder, which people put on their face to make themselves look more attractive.
Example: It is a cosmetic measure which will do nothing to help the situation long term.

Definition: If you say that something is true or seems to be true at first glance, you mean that it seems to be true when you first see it or think about it, but that your first impression may be wrong.
Example: At first glance, organic farming looks much more expensive for the farmer.

Definition: Someone who is impressionable, usually a young person, is not very critical and is therefore easy to influence.
Example: The law is intended to protect young and impressionable viewers.

Definition: Something that is manageable is of a size, quantity, or level of difficulty that people are able to deal with.
Example: He will now try to cut down the task to a manageable size.

Definition: If you describe a person or animal as adaptable, you mean that they are able to change their ideas or behaviour in order to deal with new situations.
Example: ...a more adaptable and skilled workforce.

Definition: A lithe person is able to move and bend their body easily and gracefully.
Example: ...a lithe young gymnast.

Definition: Elastic is a rubber material that stretches when you pull it and returns to its original size and shape when you let it go. Elastic is often used in clothes to make them fit tightly, for example round the waist.
Example: ...a piece of elastic.

Definition: deference to the wishes of others; willing compliance
The elasticity of a material or substance is its ability to return to its original shape, size, and condition after it has been stretched.
Example: Daily facial exercises help her to retain the skin's elasticity.

Definition: If something is adjustable, it can be changed to different positions or sizes.
Example: The bags have adjustable shoulder straps.

Definition: capable of being easily bent or flexed; pliant
Example: to limber the fingers

Definition: Collusion is secret or illegal co-operation, especially between countries or organizations.
Example: He found no evidence of collusion between record companies and retailers.

Definition: A terminal illness or disease causes death, often slowly, and cannot be cured.
Example: ...terminal cancer.

Definition: A garrison is a group of soldiers whose task is to guard the town or building where they live.
Example: ...a five-hundred-man French army garrison.

Definition: A watchman is a person whose job is to guard a building or area.
Example: The watchman heard that none of the workmen, not even the oldest, had ever seen Abraham Sinclair, much less met him.

Definition: Administrative work involves organizing and supervising an organization or institution.
Example: Other industries have had to sack managers to reduce administrative costs.

Definition: Legislative means involving or relating to the process of making and passing laws.
Example: Today's hearing was just the first step in the legislative process.

Definition: If a government gives a person from another country asylum, they allow them to stay, usually because they are unable to return home safely for political reasons.
Example: He applied for asylum in 1987 after fleeing the police back home.

Definition: If a task, plan, or idea is practicable, people are able to carry it out.
Example: It is not reasonably practicable to offer her the original job back.

Definition: Expediency means doing what is convenient rather than what is morally right.
Example:
Political expediency, rather than economic need, will determine who gains from the
conflict.

Definition: Something that is attainable can be achieved.
Example: It is unrealistic to believe perfection is an attainable goal.

Definition: If something is obtainable, it is possible to get or achieve it.
Example: The dried herb is obtainable from health shops.

Definition: You use imaginable after a superlative such as ' best' or ' worst' to emphasize that something is extreme in some way.
Example: ...their imprisonment under some of the most horrible circumstances imaginable.

Definition: Something that is believable makes you think that it could be true or real.
Example: ...believable evidence.

Definition: If you describe what someone says as glib, you disapprove of it because it implies that something is simple or easy, or that there are no problems involved, when this is not the case.
Example: ...the glib talk of 'past misery'.

Definition: Something that is specious seems to exist or be true, but is not real or true.
Example: It is unlikely that the Duke was convinced by such specious arguments.

Definition: A smooth-talking person talks very confidently in a way that is likely to persuade people, but may not be sincere or honest.
Example: ...the smooth-talking conman who has wrecked their lives.

Definition: To drool over someone or something means to look at them with great pleasure, perhaps in an exaggerated or ridiculous way.
Example: Fashion editors drooled over every item.

Definition: If you describe something that is written or said as drivel, you are critical of it because you think it is very silly.
Example: What absolute drivel!

Definition: If an animal slavers, liquid comes from its mouth, for example because it is about to attack and eat something.
Example: Mad guard dogs slavered at the end of their chains.

Definition: If a person or an animal slobbers, they let liquid fall from their mouth.
Example: The dog tried to slobber all over me in the park.

Definition: Someone or something that is instrumental in a process or event helps to make it happen.
Example:
In his first years as chairman he was instrumental in raising the company's wider
profile.

Definition: If you describe an experience or feeling as exhilarating, you mean that it makes you feel very happy and excited.
Example: It was exhilarating to be on the road again and his spirits rose.

Definition: Utilitarian means based on the idea that the morally correct course of action is the one that produces benefit for the greatest number of people.
Example: It was James Mill who was the best publicist for utilitarian ideas on government.

Definition: If you describe something as serviceable, you mean that it is good enough to be used and to perform its function.
Example: His Arabic was not as good as his English, but serviceable enough.

Definition: A system or service that is operative is working or having an effect.
Example: The commercial telephone service was no longer operative.

Definition: A machine or piece of equipment that is operational is in use or is ready for use.
Example: The whole system will be fully operational by December.

Definition: You say in truth in order to indicate that you are giving your honest opinion about something.
Example: In truth, we were both unhappy.

Definition: Something that is lifelike has the appearance of being alive.
Example: ...a lifelike doll.

Definition: Naturalistic art or writing tries to show people and things in a realistic way.
Example: These drawings are among his most naturalistic.

Definition: If you prophesy that something will happen, you say that you strongly believe that it will happen.
Example: He prophesied that within five years his opponent would either be dead or in prison.

Definition: If something portends something, it indicates that it is likely to happen in the future.
Example: The change did not portend a basic improvement in social conditions.

Definition: Thrift is the quality and practice of being careful with money and not wasting things.
Example: They were rightly praised for their thrift and enterprise.

Definition: If you implore someone to do something, you ask them to do it in a forceful, emotional way.
Example: Opposition leaders this week implored the president to break the deadlock.

Definition: If you beseech someone to do something, you ask them very eagerly and anxiously.
Example: She beseeched him to cut his drinking and his smoking.

Definition: Vapour consists of tiny drops of water or other liquids in the air, which appear as mist.
Example: ...water vapour.

Definition: Condensation consists of small drops of water which form when warm water vapour or steam touches a cold surface such as a window.
Example: He used his sleeve to wipe the condensation off the glass.

Definition: If your senses, understanding, or skills sharpen or are sharpened, you become better at noticing things, thinking, or doing something.
Example: Her gaze sharpened, as if she had seen something unusual.

Definition: If you describe someone's actions as a charade, you mean that their actions are so obviously false that they do not convince anyone.
Example: I wondered why he had gone through the elaborate charade.

Definition: Expectancy is the feeling or hope that something exciting, interesting, or good is about to happen.
Example: The supporters had a tremendous air of expectancy.

Definition: Apprehension is a feeling of fear that something bad may happen.
Example: It reflects real anger and apprehension about the future.

Definition: Complacency is being complacent about a situation.
Example:
...a worrying level of complacency about the risks of infection from sexually transmitted
diseases.

Definition: affected manners intended to impress others (esp in the phrases give oneself airs, put on airs)
Example: She looks after the place for me, and gets it ready and airs it before I come down.

Definition: If you say that someone's attitude or behaviour is an affectation, you disapprove of the fact that it is not genuine or natural, but is intended to impress other people.
Example: I wore sunglasses all the time and people thought it was an affectation.

Definition: If you accuse someone of hypocrisy, you mean that they pretend to have qualities, beliefs, or feelings that they do not really have.
Example: He accused newspapers of hypocrisy in their treatment of the story.

Definition: A carving is an object or a design that has been cut out of a material such as stone or wood.
Example: ...a wood carving of a human hand.

Definition: If something is  confined to a particular place, it exists only in that place. If it is confined to a particular group, only members of that group have it.
Example: The problem is not confined to Germany.

Definition: Loneliness is the unhappiness that is felt by someone because they do not have any friends or do not have anyone to talk to.
Example: I have so many friends, but deep down, underneath, I have a fear of loneliness.

Definition: Segregation is the official practice of keeping people apart, usually people of different sexes, races, or religions.
Example: Racial segregation in schools was ruled unconstitutional.

Definition: Clerical jobs, skills, and workers are concerned with work that is done in an office.
Example: ...a strike by clerical staff in all government departments.

Definition: motion in a forward direction
Example: But it is hard to see much headway for anyone reliant on discretionary consumer spending.

Definition: If you update something, you make it more modern, usually by adding new parts to it or giving new information.
Example: He was back in the office, updating the work schedule on the computer.

Definition: Exaltation is an intense feeling of great happiness.
Example: The city was swept up in the mood of exaltation.

Definition: If someone or something is invulnerable, they cannot be harmed or damaged.
Example: Many daughters assume that their mothers are invulnerable.

Definition: If you are unwilling to do something, you do not want to do it and will not agree to do it.
Example: Initially the government was unwilling to accept the defeat.

Definition: well-mannered; polite; courteous
Example: He belonged to a time that was past in that he was gentle of speech, mannerly, concerned about the impressions he might convey.

Definition: Someone who is courteous is polite and respectful to other people.
Example: He was a kind and courteous man.

Definition: Someone who is affable is pleasant and friendly.
Example: Mr Brooke is an extremely affable and approachable man.

Definition: If you describe a society as civilized, you mean that it is advanced and has sensible laws and customs.
Example: I believed that in civilized countries, torture had ended long ago.

Definition: A borough is a town, or a district within a large town, which has its own council.
Example: ...the South London borough of Lambeth.

Definition: Municipal means associated with or belonging to a city or town that has its own local government.
Example: The municipal authorities gave the go-ahead for the march.

Definition: If you do something as an atonement for doing something wrong, you do it to show that you are sorry.
Example: He is working for the world's poor as a personal atonement for his part in the war.

Definition: Mistreatment of a person or animal is cruel behaviour towards them, especially by making them suffer physically.
Example: ...issues like police brutality and mistreatment of people in prisons.

Definition: If you describe something such as someone's behaviour or appearance as impeccable, you are emphasizing that it is perfect and has no faults.
Example: She had impeccable taste in clothes.

Definition: Something that is spotless is completely clean.
Example: Each morning cleaners make sure everything is spotless.

Definition: If you describe an event, action, or procedure as symbolic, you mean that it represents an important change, although it has little practical effect.
Example: A lot of Latin-American officials are stressing the symbolic importance of the trip.

Definition: If you use a word or expression in a figurative sense, you use it with a more abstract or imaginative meaning than its ordinary literal one.
Example: ...an event that will change your routein both the literal and figurative sense.

Definition: If something, such as an object in a picture, is emblematic of a particular quality or an idea, it symbolically represents the quality or idea.
Example: Dogs are emblematic of faithfulness.

Definition: If a vehicle rams something such as another vehicle, it crashes into it with a lot of force, usually deliberately.
Example: The thieves fled, ramming the police officer's car.

Definition: If you describe a person or what they say as tactful you approve of them because they are careful not to offend or upset another person.
Example: He had been extremely tactful in dealing with the financial question.

Definition: Diplomatic means relating to diplomacy and diplomats.
Example: ...before the two countries resume full diplomatic relations.

Definition: Timid people are shy, nervous, and have no courage or confidence in themselves.
Example: A timid child, Isabella had learned obedience at an early age.

Definition: Someone who is self-conscious is easily embarrassed and nervous because they feel that everyone is looking at them and judging them.
Example: I felt a bit self-conscious in my swimming costume.

Definition: Someone who is bashful is shy and easily embarrassed.
Example: He seemed bashful and awkward.

Definition: the quality of being gentle
Example: Approach your beloved with the gentleness and patience of a green turtle.

Definition: If something is edible, it is safe to eat and not poisonous.
Example: ...edible fungi.

Definition: Succulent food, especially meat or vegetables, is juicy and good to eat.
Example: Cook pieces of succulent chicken with ample garlic and a little sherry.

Definition: If you overload something such as a vehicle, you put more things or people into it than it was designed to carry.
Example: Don't overload the boat or it will sink.

Definition: A spate of things, especially unpleasant things, is a large number of them that happen or appear within a short period of time.
Example: ...the recent spate of attacks on horses.

Definition: very full; almost filled over capacity
Example: They threw the rind of their melons in the direction of an overflowing waste bin.

Definition: A torrent is a lot of water falling or flowing rapidly or violently.
Example: Torrents of water gushed into the reservoir.

Definition: The leader of the government of a country is sometimes referred to as the country's premier.
Example: ...the country's premier opera company.

Definition: If you describe something such as a work of art or a piece of work as unfinished, you mean that it is not complete, for example because it was abandoned or there was no time to complete it.
Example: ...Jane Austen's unfinished novel.

Definition: Impropriety is improper behaviour.
Example: He resigned amid allegations of financial impropriety.

Definition: If you are reluctant to do something, you are unwilling to do it and hesitate before doing it, or do it slowly and without enthusiasm.
Example: Mr Spero was reluctant to ask for help.

Definition: If you are loath to do something, you do not want to do it.
Example: She is loath to give up her hard-earned liberty.

Definition: A piece of music that is tuneful has a pleasant tune.
Example: A song to make them sound tuneful?

Definition: The validity of something such as a result or a piece of information is whether it can be trusted or believed.
Example:
Shocked by the results of the elections, they now want to challenge the validity
of the vote.

Definition: The verities of something are all the things that are believed to be true about it.
Example: ...some verities of human nature.

Definition: The attainment of an aim is the achieving of it.
Example: ...the attainment of independence.

Definition: If you reminisce about something from your past, you write or talk about it, often with pleasure.
Example: Ray and I ate our meal and reminisced about the trip.

Definition: Someone who is triumphant has gained a victory or succeeded in something and feels very happy about it.
Example: Duncan and his triumphant soldiers celebrate their military victory.

Definition: You use victorious to describe someone who has won a victory in a struggle, war, or competition.
Example: It has been a season in which he has been on the victorious side just three times.

Definition: If you describe something as unequalled, you mean that it is greater, better, or more extreme than anything else of the same kind.
Example: This record figure was unequalled for 13 years.

Definition: If something is unprecedented, it has never happened before.
Example: Such a move is rare, but not unprecedented.

Definition: If you regain something that you have lost, you get it back again.
Example: Troops have regained control of the city.

Definition: If your car or house is repossessed, the people who supplied it take it back because they are still owed money for it.
Example: His car was repossessed by the company.

Definition: If you redeem yourself or your reputation, you do something that makes people have a good opinion of you again after you have behaved or performed badly.
Example: He had realized the mistake he had made and wanted to redeem himself.

Definition: Junk is old and used goods that have little value and that you do not want any more.
Example: Rose finds her furniture in junk shops.

Definition: If there is a resurgence of an attitude or activity, it reappears and grows.
Example: Police say criminals are behind the resurgence of violence.

Definition: A left-winger is a person whose political beliefs are close to socialism, or closer to them than most of the other people in the same group or party.
Example: We were accused of being militant left-wingers.

Definition: Something that is demeaning makes people have less respect for the person who is treated in that way, or who does that thing.
Example: ...demeaning sexist comments.

Definition: If something is humiliating, it embarrasses you and makes you feel ashamed and stupid.
Example: The Party leader suffered a humiliating defeat.

Definition: If you say that someone or something degenerates, you mean that they become worse in some way, for example weaker, lower in quality, or more dangerous.
Example: Inactivity can make your joints stiff, and the bones may begin to degenerate.

Definition: If a muscle or other part of the body atrophies, it decreases in size or strength, often as a result of an illness.
Example: Scott's muscle atrophied, his leg became stunted, and he was left lame.

Definition: If milk or eggs curdle or if you curdle them, they separate into different bits.
Example: The sauce should not boil or the egg yolk will curdle.

Definition: If two or more things coalesce, they come together and form a larger group or system.
Example: Cities, if unrestricted, tend to coalesce into bigger and bigger conurbations.

Definition: Reverberations are serious effects that follow a sudden, dramatic event.
Example: The move by these two colleges is sending reverberations through higher education.

Definition: If you do something on purpose, you do it intentionally.
Example: Was it an accident or did David do it on purpose?

Definition: If you say something emphatically, you say it in a forceful way which shows that you feel very strongly about what you are saying.
Example: 'No fast food,' she said emphatically.

Definition: You use measured to describe something that is careful and deliberate.
Example: The men spoke in soft, measured tones.

Definition: If something has a stigma attached to it, people think it is something to be ashamed of.
Example: There's no stigma attached to being an unmarried mother any more.

Definition: If you stammer, you speak with difficulty, hesitating and repeating words or sounds.
Example: Five per cent of children stammer at some point.

Definition: Banishment is the act of banishing someone or the state of being banished.
Example: ...banishment to 'Devil's Island'.

Definition: Eviction is the act or process of officially forcing someone to leave a house or piece of land.
Example: He was facing eviction, along with his wife and family.

Definition: You use runaway to describe a situation in which something increases or develops very quickly and cannot be controlled.
Example: Our Grand Sale in June was a runaway success.

Definition: If you disparage someone or something, you speak about them in a way which shows that you do not have a good opinion of them.
Example: Many people will disparage what you are trying to achieve.

Definition: If an unpleasant experience brutalizes someone, it makes them cruel or violent.
Example: He was brutalized by the experience of being in prison.

Definition: If you say that one thing is tantamount to a second, more serious thing, you are emphasizing how bad, unacceptable, or unfortunate the first thing is by comparing it to the second.
Example: What Bracey is saying is tantamount to heresy.

Definition: When you unwind, you relax after you have done something that makes you tense or tired.
Example: It helps them to unwind after a busy day at work.

Definition: If someone who has been sentenced in a court is reprieved, their punishment is officially delayed or cancelled.
Example: Fourteen people on death row for murder have been reprieved.

Definition: Something that is long-lasting lasts for a long time.
Example: One of the long-lasting effects of the infection is damage to a valve in the heart.

Definition: The abolition of something such as a system or practice is its formal ending.
Example: ...the abolition of slavery in Brazil and the Caribbean.

Definition: admonishing; warning
Example: Helen entered in time to retrieve, wipe clean, and re-insert it - with an admonitory look - the instant before Nurse Manning turned.

Definition: The occupants of a building or room are the people who live or work there.
Example: Most of the occupants had left before the fire broke out.

Definition: If you are answerable to someone, you have to report to them and explain your actions.
Example: Councils should be answerable to the people who elect them.

Definition: If you are amenable to something, you are willing to do it or accept it.
Example: Mazarin had been amenable to the idea.

Definition: the act of resuming or beginning again
Example: Yemen's forgotten war is a resumption of a decades-old conflict between the north and south of the country.

Definition: If you edit a text such as an article or a book, you correct and adapt it so that it is suitable for publishing.
Example:
The majority of contracts give the publisher the right to edit a book after it's
done.

Definition: the act or process of narrating
Example: Their instantly recognisable voices make their own narration of their new books utterly irresistible.

Definition: When there is an uprising, a group of people start fighting against the people who are in power in their country, because they want to bring about a political change.
Example: ...a popular uprising against the authoritarian government.

Definition: A masterstroke is something you do which is unexpected but very clever and which helps you to achieve something.
Example: The company played a masterstroke in promoting her to be director of innovation.

Definition: If there is a profusion of something or if it occurs in profusion, there is a very large quantity or variety of it.
Example: The Dart is a delightful river with a profusion of wild flowers along its banks.

Definition: If you describe something, especially food or drink, as delectable, you mean that it is very pleasant.
Example: ...delectable desserts, cakes and puddings.

Definition: If you say that food, especially savoury food, is tasty, you mean that it has a fairly strong and pleasant flavour which makes it good to eat.
Example: Try this tasty dish for supper with a crispy salad.

Definition: If you describe a person or something about them as luscious, you mean that you find them or this thing sexually attractive.
Example: ...a luscious young blonde.

Definition: Land or soil that is fecund is able to support the growth of a large number of strong healthy plants.
Example: The pampas are still among the most fecund lands in the world.

Definition: The flowering of something such as an idea or artistic style is the development of its popularity and success.
Example: He is happy with the flowering of new thinking, but he hasn't contributed to it himself.

Definition: fertility; fruitfulness
Example: Not their beauty, not their particularity, just their smothering, deafening fecundity.

Definition: A ramp is a sloping surface between two places that are at different levels.
Example: Lillian was coming down the ramp from the museum.

Definition: In some religions, when someone goes to heaven, you can refer to their ascension to heaven.
Example: ...the crucifixion, resurrection and ascension of Jesus Christ.

Definition: If you describe someone as a maverick, you mean that they are unconventional and independent, and do not think or behave in the same way as other people.
Example: He was too much of a maverick ever to hold high office.

Definition: Dissent is strong disagreement or dissatisfaction with a decision or opinion, especially one that is supported by most people or by people in authority.
Example: He is the toughest military ruler yet and has responded harshly to any dissent.

Definition: An insurrection is violent action that is taken by a large group of people against the rulers of their country, usually in order to remove them from office.
Example: They were plotting to stage an armed insurrection.

Definition: If someone is dazed, they are confused and unable to think clearly, often because of shock or a blow to the head.
Example: At the end of the interview I was dazed and exhausted.

Definition: shocked, overwhelmed, or astounded
Example: And with the rugby union team you are left simply staggered.

Definition: If you are devastated by something, you are very shocked and upset by it.
Example: Bishop Daly said he was devastated by news of the Cardinal's death.

Definition: If something stupefies you, it shocks or surprises you so much that you cannot think properly for a while.
Example: ...a violent slap on the side of the head, which stunned and stupefied him.

Definition: Thumping is used to emphasize that something is very great or severe.
Example: The Right has a thumping majority.

Definition: A guffaw is a very loud laugh.
Example: He bursts into a loud guffaw.

Definition: If you hoot the horn on a vehicle or if it hoots, it makes a loud noise on one note.
Example: I never hoot my horn when I pick a girl up for a date.

Definition: Someone who is a perfectionist refuses to do or accept anything that is not as good as it could possibly be.
Example: He was a perfectionist: no other hand but his could be put to the tasks of nailing and planing and staining.

Definition: If you describe something such as a plan, law, or system as unworkable, you believe that it cannot be successful.
Example: There is the strong possibility that such cooperation will prove unworkable.

Definition: a person who cherishes or pursues high or noble principles, purposes, goals, etc
Example: He wasn't widely known among his pals as an idealist or a law enforcer, but he must have had something there.

Definition: If you describe someone as a dreamer, you mean that they spend a lot of time thinking about and planning for things that they would like to happen but which are improbable or impractical.
Example: Far from being a dreamer, she's a level-headed pragmatist.

Definition: If you say that someone or something is pretentious, you mean that they try to seem important or significant, but you do not think that they are.
Example: His response was full of pretentious nonsense.

Definition: A bumpy road or path has a lot of bumps on it.
Example: ...bumpy cobbled streets.

Definition: If you are unsteady, you have difficulty doing something, for example walking, because you cannot completely control your legs or your body.
Example: The boy was very unsteady and had staggered around when he got up.

Definition: Something that is fitful happens for irregular periods of time or occurs at irregular times, rather than being continuous.
Example: Colin drifted off into a fitful sleep.

Definition: An unequal system or situation is unfair because it gives more power or privileges to one person or group of people than to others.
Example: This country still had a deeply oppressive, unequal and divisive political system.

Definition: Stony ground is rough and contains a lot of stones.
Example: The steep, stony ground is well drained.

Definition: A craggy cliff or mountain is steep and rocky.
Example: ...tiny villages on craggy cliffs.

Definition: affected by exposure to the action of the weather
Example: His hair is slightly styled and swept back from his weathered face.

Definition: If you describe someone as uncompromising, you mean that they are determined not to change their opinions or aims in any way.
Example: She was a tough and uncompromising politician.

Definition: If you describe a situation or period as indefinite, you mean that people have not decided when it will end.
Example: The trial was adjourned for an indefinite period.

Definition: A globular object is shaped like a ball.
Example: The globular seed capsule contains numerous small seeds.

Definition: If someone is rotund, they are round and fat.
Example: A rotund, smiling, red-faced gentleman appeared.

Definition: If you are  accustomed to something, you know it so well or have experienced it so often that it seems natural, unsurprising, or easy to deal with.
Example: I was accustomed to being the only child at a table full of adults.

Definition: A habitual action, state, or way of behaving is one that someone usually does or has, especially one that is considered to be typical or characteristic of them.
Example: He soon recovered his habitual geniality.

Definition: If someone rasps, their voice or breathing is harsh and unpleasant to listen to.
Example: 'Where've you put it?' he rasped.

Definition: Mince is meat which has been cut into very small pieces using a machine.
Example: Brown the mince in a frying pan.

Definition: to grind or rub into a fine powder or pulp; masticate
You can refer to the subjects that are studied in a particular course as the syllabus.
Example: ...the GCSE history syllabus.

Definition: If you commute, you travel a long distance every day between your home and your place of work.
Example: Mike commutes to London every day.

Definition: If someone extorts money from you, they get it from you using force, threats, or other unfair or illegal means.
Example: Corrupt government officials were extorting money from him.

Definition: If you describe something such as a story or a piece of music as affecting, you think it is good because it makes you feel a strong emotion, especially sadness or pity.
Example: ...an affecting drama about a woman with a terminal illness.

Definition: If someone is told to make haste, they are told to do something quickly and not waste time.
Example: As Simon was under orders to make haste, some days they covered thirty miles.

Definition: If you hasten an event or process, often an unpleasant one, you make it happen faster or sooner.
Example: But if he does this, he may hasten the collapse of his own country.

Definition: If something is inviolate, it has not been or cannot be harmed or affected by anything.
Example: We believed our love was inviolate.

Definition: Woe is very great sadness.
Example: He listened to my tale of woe.

Definition: If someone or something is unharmed after an accident or violent incident, they are not hurt or damaged in any way.
Example: The car was a write-off, but everyone escaped unharmed.

Definition: If someone who has been attacked, or involved in an accident, is unhurt, they are not injured.
Example: The lorry driver escaped unhurt, but a pedestrian was injured.

Definition:
A comb is a flat piece of plastic or metal with narrow pointed teeth along one side, which
you use to tidy your hair.
Example: Salvatore combed his hair carefully.

Definition: If people ransack a building, they damage things in it or make it very untidy, often because they are looking for something in a quick and careless way.
Example: Demonstrators ransacked and burned the house where he was staying.

Definition: If someone is cosseted, everything possible is done for them and they are protected from anything unpleasant.
Example: Our kind of travel is definitely not suitable for people who expect to be cosseted.

Definition: Humiliation is the embarrassment and shame you feel when someone makes you appear stupid, or when you make a mistake in public.
Example: She faced the humiliation of discussing her husband's affair.

Definition: Ignominy is shame or public disgrace.
Example: ...the ignominy of being made redundant.

Definition: If you dishonour someone, you behave in a way that damages their good reputation.
Example: It would dishonour my family if I didn't wear the veil.

Definition: If you fret about something, you worry about it.
Example: I was working all hours and constantly fretting about everyone else's problems.

Definition: If someone has a roguish expression or manner, they look as though they are about to behave badly.
Example: She was a mature woman with red hair and a roguish grin.

Definition: If you describe someone as devious you do not like them because you think they are dishonest and like to keep things secret, often in a complicated way.
Example: Newman was devious, prepared to say one thing in print and another in private.

Definition: When a bird squawks, it makes a loud harsh noise.
Example: I threw pebbles at the hens, and that made them jump and squawk.

Definition:
A pencil is an object that you write or draw with. It consists of a thin piece of wood with
a rod of a black or coloured substance through the middle. If you write or draw something in pencil, you do it using a pencil.
Example: I found a pencil and some blank paper in her desk.

Definition: An enclosure is an area of land that is surrounded by a wall or fence and that is used for a particular purpose.
Example: This enclosure was so vast that the outermost wall could hardly be seen.

Definition: The word filigree is used to refer to delicate ornamental designs made with gold or silver wire.
Example: There were more serious nods to craft too, in fine filigree lace dresses and richly embroidered pieces.

Definition: If someone arrives or does something unannounced, they do it unexpectedly and without anyone having being told about it beforehand.
Example: He had just arrived unannounced from South America.

Definition: A microbe is a very small living thing, which you can only see if you use a microscope.
Example: Was it not the duty of the doctor to kill the microbes?

Definition: If someone hijacks a plane or other vehicle, they illegally take control of it by force while it is travelling from one place to another.
Example: ...a plot to hijack an airliner.

Definition: Liaison is co-operation and the exchange of information between different organizations or between different sections of an organization.
Example: Liaison between police forces and the art world is vital to combat art crime.

Definition: A bash is a party or celebration, especially a large one held by an official organization or attended by famous people.
Example: He threw one of the biggest showbiz bashes of the year.

Definition: If you say that someone is supercilious, you disapprove of them because they behave in a way that shows they think they are better than other people.
Example: His manner is supercilious and arrogant.

Definition: If someone is patronizing, they speak or behave towards you in a way that seems friendly, but which shows that they think they are superior to you.
Example: The tone of the interview was unnecessarily patronizing .

Definition: If you say that someone is condescending, you are showing your disapproval of the fact that they talk or behave in a way which shows that they think they are superior to other people.
Example: I'm fed up with your money and your whole condescending attitude.

Definition: You use haughty to describe someone's behaviour or appearance when you disapprove of the fact that they seem to be very proud and to think that they are better than other people.
Example: He spoke in a haughty tone.

Definition: a realizing or being realized
Example: His appalled realization that he was to some degree responsible for what had happened to his father was there in his face.

Definition: If you are reflective, you are thinking deeply about something.
Example: I walked on in a reflective mood to the car.

Definition: If you are pensive, you are thinking deeply about something, especially something that worries you slightly.
Example: He looked suddenly sombre, pensive.

Definition: Someone who is contemplative thinks deeply, or is thinking in a serious and calm way.
Example: Martin is a quiet, contemplative sort of chap.

Definition: Meditative describes things that are related to the act of meditating or the act of thinking very deeply about something.
Example: Music can induce a meditative state in the listener.

Definition: If you are fearful of something, you are afraid of it.
Example: Bankers were fearful of a world banking crisis.

Definition: Savoury food has a salty or spicy flavour rather than a sweet one.
Example: Italian cooking is best known for savoury dishes.

Definition: If you switch off a light or other electrical device, you stop it working by operating a switch.
Example: She switched off the coffee-machine.

Definition: A test, system, or procedure that is rigorous is very thorough and strict.
Example: The selection process is based on rigorous tests of competence and experience.

Definition: Steely is used to emphasize that a person is hard, strong, and determined.
Example: Their indecision has been replaced by confidence and steely determination.

Definition: The turnout at an event is the number of people who go to it or take part in it.
Example: On the big night there was a massive turnout.

Definition:
The people who are attending a church service or who regularly attend a church service
are referred to as the congregation.
Example: Most members of the congregation begin arriving a few minutes before services.

Definition: If something is obligatory, you must do it because of a rule or a law.
Example:
Most women will be offered an ultrasound scan during pregnancy, although it's not
obligatory.

Definition: to reduce the length of (a written work) by condensing or rewriting
Example: To abridge a little: I worried myself into a pretty state by the autumn.

Definition: a signal to go, esp a green traffic light
Example: Regulators could force the companies to sell assets before giving the green light.

Definition: The borderline between two different or opposite things is the division between them.
Example: ...a task which involves exploring the borderline between painting and photography.

Definition: Asceticism is a simple, strict way of life with no luxuries or physical pleasures.
Example: He fell to greedily, as the tastes and the toasts went up and down the table, in a manner alien to his usual asceticism.

Definition: An ascetic person has a way of life that is simple and strict, usually because of their religious beliefs.
Example: She has never been close to her ascetic, workaholic father.

Definition: A continent is a very large area of land, such as Africa or Asia, that consists of several countries.
Example: She loved the African continent.

Definition: Intercourse is the act of having sex.
Example: ...sexual intercourse.

Definition: Subtleties are very small details or differences which are not obvious.
Example: His fascination with the subtleties of human behaviour makes him a good storyteller.

Definition: If you gauge the speed or strength of something, or if you gauge an amount, you measure or calculate it, often by using a device of some kind.
Example: He gauged the wind at over thirty knots.

Definition: If you fidget, you keep moving your hands or feet slightly or changing your position slightly, for example because you are nervous, bored, or excited.
Example: Brenda fidgeted in her seat.

Definition: An earthquake is a shaking of the ground caused by movement of the Earth's crust.
Example: Sadly it was all destroyed by an earthquake 1,500 years ago and the rubble was carted off by Ottoman invaders to build houses.

Definition: If something quivers, it shakes with very small movements.
Example: Her bottom lip quivered and big tears rolled down her cheeks.

Definition: An allocation is an amount of something, especially money, that is given to a particular person or used for a particular purpose.
Example: There will be a closer review of funding allocations for future conferences.

Definition: In Britain, an allotment is a small area of land in a town which a person rents to grow plants and vegetables on.
Example: His meager allotment of gas had to be saved for emergencies.

Definition: The rind of a fruit such as a lemon or orange is its thick outer skin.
Example: ...grated lemon rind.

Definition: Someone who has humility is not proud and does not believe they are better than other people.
Example: ...a deep sense of humility.

Definition: A dam is a wall that is built across a river in order to stop the water flowing and to make a lake.
Example: ...plans to build a dam on the Danube River.

Definition: If a city or building is blitzed during a war, it is attacked by bombs dropped by enemy aircraft.
Example:
In the autumn of 1940, London was blitzed by an average of two hundred aircraft a
night.

Definition: A canopy is a decorated cover, often made of cloth, which is placed above something such as a bed or a seat.
Example: The trees formed such a dense canopy that all beneath was a deep carpet of pine-needles.

Definition: Fawn is a pale yellowish-brown colour.
Example: ...a light fawn coat.

Definition: If you have a tan, your skin has become darker than usual because you have been in the sun.
Example: She is tall and blonde, with a permanent tan.

Definition: Something that is beige is pale brown in colour.
Example: The walls are beige.

Definition: The downfall of a successful or powerful person or institution is their loss of success or power.
Example: His lack of experience had led to his downfall.

Definition: If someone has a  nervous breakdown, they become extremely depressed and cannot cope with their normal life.
Example: The stress of the situation led her to have a nervous breakdown.

Definition: a dissecting or being dissected
If someone totters somewhere, they walk there in an unsteady way, for example because they are ill or drunk.
Example: He tottered to the fridge, got a drink and slumped at the table.

Definition: To lurch means to make a sudden movement, especially forwards, in an uncontrolled way.
Example: As the car sped over a pothole she lurched forward.

Definition: If you are astounded by something, you are very shocked or surprised that it could exist or happen.
Example: I was astounded by its beauty.

Definition: If something that has happened was unforeseen, it was not expected to happen or known about beforehand.
Example: Radiation may damage cells in a way that was previously unforeseen.

Definition: If a seed germinates or if it is germinated, it starts to grow.
Example: Some seed varieties germinate fast, so check every day or so.

Definition: When crops ripen or when the sun ripens them, they become ripe.
Example: I'm waiting for the apples to ripen.

Definition: If you are oblivious to something or oblivious of it, you are not aware of it.
Example: She lay motionless where she was, oblivious to pain.

Definition: If you describe a person or their behaviour as brusque, you mean that they deal with things, or say things, quickly and shortly, so that they seem to be rude.
Example: The doctors are brusque and busy.

Definition: If you say that someone is regurgitating ideas or facts, you mean that they are repeating them without understanding them properly.
Example: You can get sick to death of a friend regurgitating her partner's opinions.

Definition: Something that is gruesome is extremely unpleasant and shocking.
Example: There has been a series of gruesome murders in the capital.

Definition: If you describe someone or something as ghastly, you mean that you find them very unpleasant.
Example: ...a mother accompanied by her ghastly unruly child.

Definition: If you groan, you make a long, low sound because you are in pain, or because you are upset or unhappy about something.
Example: Slowly, he opened his eyes. As he did so, he began to groan with pain.

Definition: If something or someone whines, they make a long, high-pitched noise, especially one which sounds sad or unpleasant.
Example: He could hear her dog barking and whining in the background.

Definition: If someone grumbles, they complain about something in a bad-tempered way.
Example: I shouldn't grumble about Mumshe's lovely really.

Definition: If something drones, it makes a low, continuous, dull noise.
Example: Above him an invisible plane droned through the night sky.

Definition: If something hums, it makes a low continuous noise.
Example: The birds sang, the bees hummed.

Definition: If you do something purposely, you do it intentionally.
Example: They are purposely withholding information.

Definition: If you retch, your stomach moves as if you are vomiting.
Example: The smell made me retch.

Definition: If someone is inarticulate, they are unable to express themselves easily or well in speech.
Example: Inarticulate and rather shy, he had always dreaded speaking in public.

Definition: If you are dumbfounded, you are extremely surprised by something.
Example: I stood there dumbfounded.

Definition: Someone who is reticent does not tell people about things.
Example: She is so reticent about her achievements.

Definition: If you  run out of something, you have no more of it left.
Example: They have run out of ideas.

Definition: A villain is someone who deliberately harms other people or breaks the law in order to get what he or she wants.
Example: The striker became the villain of the piece after a challenge that provoked a shoving match.

Definition: When you are talking about a crime or something wrong that has been done, you can refer to the person who did it as the culprit.
Example: The culprits in the robbery have not been identified.

Definition: A hymn is a religious song that Christians sing in church.
Example: I like singing hymns.

Definition: A chorus is a part of a song which is repeated after each verse.
Example: Caroline sang two verses and the chorus of her song.

Definition: If you intone something, you say it in a slow and serious way, with most of the words at one pitch.
Example: He quietly intoned several prayers.

Definition: When birds twitter, they make a lot of short high-pitched sounds.
Example: There were birds twittering in the eucalyptus trees.

Definition: A ridge is a long, narrow piece of raised land.
Example: ...the bony ridge of the eye socket.

Definition: If you preside over a meeting or an event, you are in charge.
Example: The PM presided over a meeting of his inner Cabinet.

Definition: If something affronts you, you feel insulted and hurt because of it.
Example: His reforms had so affronted many of his natural supporters in England.

Definition: You use lengthy to describe an event or process which lasts for a long time.
Example: ...a lengthy meeting.

Definition: Something that is irritating keeps annoying you.
Example: They also have the irritating habit of interrupting.

Definition: Something that is smelly has an unpleasant smell.
Example: He had extremely smelly feet.

Definition: Fetid water or air has a very strong unpleasant smell.
Example: ...the fetid river of waste.

Definition: When you sniff, you breathe in air through your nose hard enough to make a sound, for example when you are trying not to cry, or in order to show disapproval.
Example: She wiped her face and sniffed loudly.

Definition: When someone simpers, they smile in a rather silly way.
Example: The maid lowered her chin and simpered.

Definition: Something that is lustrous shines brightly and gently, because it has a smooth or shiny surface.
Example: ...a head of thick, lustrous, wavy brown hair.

Definition: If you describe someone's eyes as glazed, you mean that their expression is dull or dreamy, usually because they are tired or are having difficulty concentrating on something.
Example: Doctors with glazed eyes sat in front of a television set.

Definition: Something that is downy is filled or covered with small soft feathers.
Example: ...the warm downy quilt.

Definition: Spontaneous acts are not planned or arranged, but are done because someone suddenly wants to do them.
Example: Their spontaneous outbursts of song were accompanied by lively music.

Definition: A man who is debonair is confident, charming, and well-dressed.
Example: He was a handsome, debonair, death-defying racing-driver.

Definition: Someone who is adroit is quick and skilful in their thoughts, behaviour, or actions.
Example: She is a remarkably adroit and determined politician.

Definition: If a small dog yaps, it makes short loud sounds in an excited way.
Example: The little dog yapped frantically.

Definition: You use outgoing to describe a person in charge of something who is soon going to leave that position.
Example: ...the outgoing director of the Edinburgh International Festival.

Definition: Cordial means friendly.
Example: He had never known him to be so chatty and cordial.

Definition: If something is springy, it returns quickly to its original shape after you press it.
Example: Steam for about 12 mins until the cake is risen and springy to touch in the centre.

Definition: If you describe God or a person in a position of authority as merciful, you mean that they show kindness and forgiveness to people.
Example: ...a merciful God.

Definition: If a number of people do something with one accord, they do it together or at the same time, because they agree about what should be done.
Example: With one accord they turned and walked back over the grass.

Definition: Someone's successor is the person who takes their job after they have left.
Example: He set out several principles that he hopes will guide his successors.

Definition: A saga is a long story, account, or sequence of events.
Example: ...a 600-page saga about 18th-century slavery.

Definition: Remorse is a strong feeling of sadness and regret about something wrong that you have done.
Example: He was full of remorse.

Definition: If you show repentance for something wrong that you have done, you make it clear that you are sorry for doing it.
Example: They showed no repentance during their trial.

Definition: If you repeat something verbatim, you use exactly the same words as were used originally.
Example: The President's speeches are regularly reproduced verbatim in the state-run newspapers.

Definition: The literal sense of a word or phrase is its most basic sense.
Example: In many cases, the people there are fighting, in a literal sense, for their homes.

Definition: You use unearthly to describe something that seems very strange and unnatural.
Example: For a few seconds we watched the unearthly lights on the water.

Definition: If you describe something as sublime, you mean that it has a wonderful quality that affects you deeply.
Example: Sublime music floats on a scented summer breeze to the spot where you lie.

Definition: If something long and thin bisects an area or line, it divides the area or line in half.
Example: The main street bisects the town from end to end.

Definition: To quell opposition or violent behaviour means to stop it.
Example: Troops eventually quelled the unrest.

Definition: If you describe a person as level-headed, you mean that they are calm and sensible even in difficult situations.
Example: Simon is level-headed and practical.

Definition: In a company or other organization, the department of  human resources is the department with responsibility for the recruiting, training, and welfare of the staff. The abbreviation HR is often used.
Example: `But Mrs Oakley, she's the head of human resources, has already taken two indigestion tablets, Caron.

Definition: Your deportment is the way you behave, especially the way you walk and move.
Example: Contrariwise, her elders could have used a lesson or two in deportment.

Definition: To gawk at someone or something means to stare at them in a rude, stupid, or unthinking way.
Example: The youth continued to gawk at her and did not answer.

Definition: Endurance is the ability to continue with an unpleasant or difficult situation, experience, or activity over a long period of time.
Example: The exercise obviously will improve strength and endurance.

Definition: Something that is static does not move or change.
Example: The number of young people obtaining qualifications has remained static or decreased.

Definition: A sheep is a farm animal which is covered with thick curly hair called wool. Sheep are kept for their wool or for their meat.
Example: ...grassland on which a flock of sheep were grazing.

Definition: An arsenal is a large collection of weapons and military equipment held by a country, group, or person.
Example:
Russia and the other republics are committed to destroying most of their nuclear
arsenals.

Definition: A tornado is a violent wind storm consisting of a tall column of air which spins round very fast and causes a lot of damage.
Example: More storms and tornados are expected this weekend.

Definition: A cyclone is a violent tropical storm in which the air goes round and round.
Example: A cyclone in the Bay of Bengal is threatening the eastern Indian states.

Definition: the state or quality of being strange
Example: This production captures far too little of that richness and strangeness.

Definition: Eccentricity is unusual behaviour that other people consider strange.
Example: She is unusual to the point of eccentricity.

Definition: A studied action is deliberate or planned.
Example: The newsletter he sent to investors was full of studied understatement.

Definition: If you whack someone or something, you hit them hard.
Example: You really have to whack the ball.

Definition: If you weave cloth or a carpet, you make it by crossing threads over and under each other using a frame or machine called a loom.
Example: They would spin and weave cloth, cook and attend to the domestic side of life.

Definition: A pendant is an ornament on a chain that you wear round your neck.
Example: She keeps his ashes inside a pendant she wears around her neck.

Definition: If you harness something such as an emotion or natural source of energy, you bring it under your control and use it.
Example: We need to find new ways of harnessing that enthusiasm and commitment.

Definition: When you pare something, or pare part of it off or away, you cut off its skin or its outer layer.
Example: Pare the brown skin from the meat with a very sharp knife.

Definition: If you deprive someone of something that they want or need, you take it away from them, or you prevent them from having it.
Example:
The disintegration of the Soviet Union deprived western intelligence agencies of
their main enemies.

Definition: If you divest yourself of something that you own or are responsible for, you get rid of it or stop being responsible for it.
Example: The company divested itself of its oil interests.

Definition: If you describe something such as a desire or force as irresistible, you mean that it is so powerful that it makes you act in a certain way, and there is nothing you can do to prevent this.
Example: It proved an irresistible temptation to Hall to go back.

Definition: If you describe someone or something as enchanting, you mean that they are very attractive or charming.
Example: She's an absolutely enchanting child.

Definition: If you trek somewhere, you go on a journey across difficult country, usually on foot.
Example: ...trekking through the jungles.

Definition: If you slog through something, you work hard and steadily through it.
Example: They secure their degrees by slogging through an intensive 11-month course.

Definition: Insanity is the state of being insane.
Example: The defence pleaded insanity, but the defendant was found guilty and sentenced.

Definition: If you describe someone's behaviour as lunacy, you mean that it seems very strange or foolish.
Example: ...the lunacy of the tax system.

Definition: Tomfoolery is playful behaviour, usually of a rather silly, noisy, or rough kind.
Example: Were you serious, or was that a bit of tomfoolery?

Definition: If you say that someone is reckless, you mean that they act in a way which shows that they do not care about danger or the effect their behaviour will have on other people.
Example: She loved to ride; on horseback, she was reckless and utterly without fear.

Definition: If you describe someone as impulsive, you mean that they do things suddenly without thinking about them carefully first.
Example: He is too impulsive to be a responsible prime minister.

Definition: If you describe someone's behaviour as imprudent, you think it is not sensible or carefully thought out.
Example: ...an imprudent investment.

Definition: If you talk about someone's indiscretion, you mean that they have done or said something that is risky, careless, or likely to upset people.
Example: Occasionally they paid for their indiscretion with their lives.

Definition: Plants that are hardy are able to survive cold weather.
Example: The silver-leaved varieties of cyclamen are not quite as hardy.

Definition: A compliment is a polite remark that you say to someone to show that you like their appearance, appreciate their qualities, or approve of what they have done.
Example: He has never paid me a compliment.

Definition: A blockade of a place is an action that is taken to prevent goods or people from entering or leaving it.
Example: Striking lorry drivers agreed to lift their blockades of main roads.

Definition: If you tell someone to beware of a person or thing, you are warning them that the person or thing may harm them or be dangerous.
Example: Beware of being too impatient with others.

Definition: If someone or something is reviled, people hate them intensely or show their hatred of them.
Example: He was just as feared and reviled as his tyrannical parents.

Definition: Someone who struts walks in a proud way, with their head held high and their chest out, as if they are very important.
Example: He struts around town like he owns the place.

Definition: If you describe someone's attitude or their behaviour as nauseating, you mean that you find it extremely unpleasant and feel disgusted by it.
Example: The judge described the offences as nauseating and unspeakable.

Definition: If something or someone whirls around or if you whirl them around, they move around or turn around very quickly.
Example: Not receiving an answer, she whirled round.

Definition: To kidnap someone is to take them away illegally and by force, and usually to hold them prisoner in order to demand something from their family, employer, or government.
Example: Police in Brazil uncovered a plot to kidnap him.

Definition: When people natter, they talk casually for a long time about unimportant things.
Example: If something dramatic has happened during the day, we'll sit and natter about it.

Definition: If you say that someone prattles on about something, you are criticizing them because they are talking a great deal without saying anything important.
Example: Lou prattled on about various trivialities till I wanted to scream.

Definition: When liquid or fire spurts from somewhere, or when something spurts liquid or fire, it comes out quickly in a thin, powerful stream.
Example: They spurted blood all over me. I nearly passed out.

Definition: A hierarchy is a system of organizing people into different ranks or levels of importance, for example in society or in a company.
Example:
Like most other American companies with a rigid hierarchy, workers and managers had
strictly defined duties.

Definition: for the time being
Example: Take one day at a time for now and lean on friends and family.

Definition: the intervening time or period, as between events (esp in the phrase in the meantime)
Example: In the meantime, though, he hopes to see more work to bridge this scientific gap.

Definition: A rogue is someone who behaves in a dishonest or criminal way.
Example: Mr Ward wasn't a rogue at all.

Definition: If a road, path, or route is impassable, it is impossible to travel over because it is blocked or in bad condition.
Example: an impassable highway

Definition: If you describe someone as strapping, you mean that they are tall and strong, and look healthy.
Example: He was a bricklayera big, strapping fellow.

Definition: (esp of a noise) harsh or grating; rough
Example: The birds are thought to make rasping noises when they are coming down with a lung infection.

Definition: Sporadic occurrences of something happen at irregular intervals.
Example: ...a year of sporadic fighting over northern France.

Definition: Something that is skimpy is too small in size or quantity.
Example: ...skimpy underwear.

Definition: If you describe something as implausible, you believe that it is unlikely to be true.
Example: I had to admit it sounded like an implausible excuse.

Definition: Straggly hair or a straggly plant is thin and grows or spreads out untidily in different directions.
Example: Her long fair hair was knotted and straggly.

Definition:
An oppressor is a person or group of people that is treating another person or group of people
cruelly or unfairly.
Example: Lacking sovereignty, they could organise no defence against their oppressors.

Definition: If someone is persecuted, they are treated cruelly and unfairly, often because of their race or beliefs.
Example: Mr Weaver and his family have been persecuted by the authorities for their beliefs.

Definition: If you coerce someone into doing something, you make them do it, although they do not want to.
Example: Potter claimed he was coerced into pleading guilty.

Definition: If you describe something as a maw, you mean that it is like a big open mouth which swallows everything near it.
Example: ...helping to chop wood to feed the red maw of the stove.

Definition: the stomach of an animal
Example: `Because - because - "Because that was real and the others were make-believe, but the complaint stuck in Alice's craw.

Definition: If a ruler or political leader is deposed, they are forced to give up their position.
Example: Mr Ben Bella was deposed in a coup in 1965.

Definition: If you tug something or tug at it, you give it a quick and usually strong pull.
Example: A little boy came running up and tugged at his sleeve excitedly.

Definition: You use token to describe things or actions which are small or unimportant, but are meant to show particular intentions or feelings which may not be sincere.
Example: The announcement was widely seen as a token gesture.

Definition: An overcrowded place has too many things or people in it.
Example: ...one of the most overcrowded prisons in the country.

Definition: If someone is adamant about something, they are determined not to change their mind about it.
Example: The prime minister is adamant that he will not resign.

Definition: Something that is worn out is so old, damaged, or thin from use that it cannot be used any more.
Example: ...the car's worn out tyres.

Definition: Something that is musty smells old and damp.
Example: There are racks of musty clothing and piles of junk.

Definition: If something such as a business or society is stagnant, there is little activity or change.
Example: He is seeking advice on how to revive the stagnant economy.

Definition: If you describe something or someone as fusty, you disapprove of them because they are old-fashioned in attitudes or ideas.
Example: The fusty old establishment refused to recognise the demand for popular music.

Definition: If you are in possession of something, you have it, because you have obtained it or because it belongs to you.
Example: Those documents are now in the possession of the Guardian.

Definition: Tenure is the legal right to live in a particular building or to use a particular piece of land during a fixed period of time.
Example: Lack of security of tenure was a reason for many families becoming homeless.

Definition: If a part of your body is poised, it is completely still but ready to move at any moment.
Example: He studied the keyboard carefully, one finger poised.

Definition: Exceedingly means very or very much.
Example: We had an exceedingly good lunch.

Definition: An embellishment is a decoration added to something to make it seem more attractive or interesting.
Example: ...Renaissance embellishments.

Definition: If you turn something over, or if it turns over, it is moved so that the top part is now facing downwards.
Example: Liz picked up the blue envelope and turned it over curiously.

Definition: If something is done for your convenience, it is done in a way that is useful or suitable for you.
Example: He was happy to make a detour for her convenience.

Definition: Someone's accomplice is a person who helps them to commit a crime.
Example: The gunman escaped on a motorcycle being ridden by an accomplice.

Definition: The driving force or idea behind something that happens or is done is the main thing that has a strong effect on it and makes it happen or be done in a particular way.
Example: Consumer spending was the driving force behind the economic growth in the summer.

Definition: Depravity is very dishonest or immoral behaviour.
Example: ...the absolute depravity that can exist in war.

Definition: the quality or state of being malevolent; malice; spitefulness; ill will
Example: The sheer malevolence she saw there brought back memories she thought she had forgotten.

Definition: The ferocity of something is its fierce or violent nature.
Example: The armed forces seem to have been taken by surprise by the ferocity of the attack.

Definition: If you say that someone is vindictive, you are critical of them because they deliberately try to upset or cause trouble for someone who they think has done them harm.
Example: How can you be so vindictive?

Definition: If you describe someone as hardened, you mean that they have had so much experience of something bad or unpleasant that they are no longer affected by it in the way that other people would be.
Example: ...hardened criminals.

Definition: Someone who is sinewy has a lean body with strong muscles.
Example: A short, sinewy young man.

Definition: If someone's hair is lank, it is long and perhaps greasy and hangs in a dull and unattractive way.
Example: She ran her fingers through her hair; it felt lank and dirty.

Definition: exposure to air or warmth, as for drying or ventilation
Example: to give a scandal an airing

Definition: A famous or important person's entourage is the group of assistants, servants, or other people who travel with them.
Example:
Peter the Great shocked London by his wild behaviour and that of his entourage when
he visited England in 1698.

Definition: An itinerant worker travels around a region, working for short periods in different places.
Example: ...the author's experiences as an itinerant musician.

Definition: A travelling actor or musician, for example, is one who travels around an area or country performing in different places.
Example: ...troupes of travelling actors.

Definition: Undersized people or things are smaller than usual, or smaller than they should be.
Example: ...undersized and underweight babies.

Definition: The metro is the underground railway system in some cities, for example in Paris.
Example: metrology

Definition: A snake is a long, thin reptile without legs.
Example: The road snaked through forested mountains.

Definition: A zigzag is a line which has a series of angles in it like a continuous series of 'W's.
Example: They staggered in a zigzag across the tarmac.

Definition: If you say that someone or something is hideous, you mean that they are very ugly or unattractive.
Example: She saw a hideous face at the window and screamed.

Definition: If you describe something or someone as repulsive, you mean that they are horrible and disgusting and you want to avoid them.
Example: ...repulsive fat white slugs.

Definition: If something is out of shape, it is no longer in its proper or original shape, for example because it has been damaged or wrongly handled.
Example: Once most wires are bent out of shape, they don't return to the original position.

Definition: If you feel pity for someone, you feel very sorry for them.
Example: He felt a sudden tender pity for her.

Definition: If you describe something as unsurpassed, you are emphasizing that it is better or greater than anything else of its kind.
Example: The quality of Smallbone furniture is unsurpassed.

Definition: If you say that something is guaranteed to happen, you mean that you are certain that it will happen.
Example: Reports of this kind are guaranteed to cause anxiety.

Definition: You describe people or things as nameless when you do not know their name or when they do not have a name.
Example: They can have their cases rejected, without reasons being given, by nameless officials.

Definition: If you describe something or someone as nondescript, you mean that their appearance is rather dull, and not at all interesting or attractive.
Example: Europa House is one of those hundreds of nondescript buildings along the Bath Road.

Definition: If you describe a place, organization, or activity as impersonal, you mean that it is not very friendly and makes you feel unimportant because it involves or is used by a large number of people.
Example: Before then many children were cared for in large impersonal orphanages.

Definition: If you describe someone or something as faceless, you dislike them because they are uninteresting and have no character.
Example: Ordinary people are at the mercy of faceless bureaucrats.

Definition: Something that is colourless has no colour at all.
Example: ...a colourless, almost odourless liquid with a sharp, sweetish taste.

Definition: the state of being doubtful
Example: It's a real word, sir,' averred Hat, detecting a hint of dubiety.

Definition: To deploy troops, weapons, or resources means to make them ready to be used.
Example: The president said he had no intention of deploying ground troops.

Definition: If you say that something or someone is unwanted, you mean that you do not want them, or that nobody wants them.
Example: ...the misery of unwanted pregnancies.

Definition: You use mobile to describe something large that can be moved easily from place to place.
Example: ...the four hundred seat mobile theatre.

Definition: If you describe someone's feelings and behaviour as irrational, you mean they are not based on logical reasons or clear thinking.
Example: ...an irrational fear of science.
