Definition: The depredations of a person, animal, or force are their harmful actions, which usually involve taking or damaging something.
Example: Crops can be all too easily decimated by unchecked depredations by deer.

Definition: If you say that someone is intruding into a particular place or situation, you mean that they are not wanted or welcome there.
Example:
The press has been blamed for intruding into people's personal lives in an unacceptable
way.

Definition: If one thing encroaches on another, the first thing spreads or becomes stronger, and slowly begins to restrict the power, range, or effectiveness of the second thing.
Example: I knew that unless work encroached upon my family time, no work could get done.

Definition: a person who sins; wrongdoer
Example: Con Maynard, sitting at the head of the table, overheard and gave the sinner a warning look.

Definition: Someone, usually a young person, who is delinquent repeatedly commits minor crimes.
Example: ...remand homes for delinquent children.

Definition: Invaders are soldiers who are invading a country.
Example:
The invaders were only finally crushed when troops overcame them at Glenshiel in
June 1719.

Definition: You can describe something that shows disrespect for God or a religion as blasphemy.
Example: He was found guilty of blasphemy and sentenced to three years in jail.

Definition: Debasement is the action of reducing the value or quality of something.
Example: ...the debasement of popular culture.

Definition: Temporal powers or matters relate to ordinary institutions and activities rather than to religious or spiritual ones.
Example: ...their spiritual and temporal leader.

Definition: You use unholy to emphasize how unreasonable or unpleasant you think something is.
Example: She protested that it wasn't traditional jazz at all, but an unholy row.

Definition: Enfranchisement is the condition of someone being enfranchised.
Example: ...greater enfranchisement of ordinary citizens.

Definition: If a person or vehicle is unarmed, they are not carrying any weapons.
Example: The soldiers concerned were unarmed at the time.

Definition: A sleepless night is one during which you do not sleep.
Example: I have sleepless nights worrying about her.

Definition: When you amble, you walk slowly and in a relaxed manner.
Example: Slowly they ambled back to the car.

Definition: If you inflate something such as a balloon or tyre, or if it inflates, it becomes bigger as it is filled with air or a gas.
Example: Stuart jumped into the sea and inflated the liferaft.

Definition: A blockage in a pipe, tube, or tunnel is an object which blocks it, or the state of being blocked.
Example: The logical treatment is to remove this blockage.

Definition: An accidental event happens by chance or as the result of an accident, and is not deliberately intended.
Example: The jury returned a verdict of accidental death.

Definition: Something that is sinister seems evil or harmful.
Example: There was something sinister about him that she found disturbing.

Definition: Someone or something that is puny is very small or weak.
Example: ...a lanky, puny youth.

Definition: Something that is decrepit is old and in bad condition. Someone who is decrepit is old and weak.
Example: The film had been shot in a decrepit old police station.

Definition: If there is a dearth of something, there is not enough of it.
Example: ...the dearth of good fiction by English authors.

Definition: If you describe someone or their behaviour as faint-hearted, you mean that they are not very confident and do not take strong action because they are afraid of failing.
Example: This is no time to be faint-hearted.

Definition: If you say that someone is spineless, you mean that they are afraid to take action or oppose people when they should.
Example: ...bureaucrats and spineless politicians.

Definition: physically incapacitated
If you describe food or drink as insipid, you dislike it because it has very little taste.
Example: It tasted indescribably bland and insipid, like warmed cardboard.

Definition: To counterbalance something means to balance or correct it with something that has an equal but opposite effect.
Example: Add honey to counterbalance the acidity.

Definition: Something that is soggy is unpleasantly wet.
Example: ...soggy cheese sandwiches.

Definition: To moisten something means to make it slightly wet.
Example: She took a sip of water to moisten her dry throat.

Definition: Inclement weather is unpleasantly cold or stormy.
Example: inclement weather

Definition: A compass is an instrument that you use for finding directions. It has a dial and a magnetic needle that always points to the north.
Example: We had to rely on a compass and a lot of luck to get here.

Definition: If you twiddle something, you twist it or turn it quickly with your fingers.
Example: He twiddled a knob on the dashboard.

Definition: If you describe a place as roomy, you mean that you like it because it is large inside and you can move around freely and comfortably.
Example: The car is roomy and a good choice for anyone who needs to carry equipment.

Definition: If you describe something as atrocious, you are emphasizing that its quality is very bad.
Example: I remain to this day fluent in Hebrew, while my Arabic is atrocious.

Definition: A telegram is a message that is sent electronically and then printed and delivered to someone's home or office. In the past, telegrams were sent by telegraph.
Example: Scores of congratulatory telegrams and letters greeted Franklin on his return.

Definition: A guru is a person who some people regard as an expert or leader.
Example: Fashion gurus dictate crazy ideas such as squeezing oversized bodies into tight trousers.

Definition: If you disown someone or something, you say or show that you no longer want to have any connection with them or any responsibility for them.
Example: The man who murdered the girl is no son of mine. I disown him.

Definition: If you are harassed, you are anxious and tense because you have too much to do or too many problems to cope with.
Example: This morning, looking harassed and drawn, Lewis tendered his resignation.

Definition: If one thing envelops another, it covers or surrounds it completely.
Example: That lovely, rich fragrant smell of the forest enveloped us.

Definition: If you refer to someone as a toady, you disapprove of them because they flatter or are pleasant towards an important or powerful person in the hope of getting some advantage from them.
Example: They came backstage afterward, cooing and toadying to him.

Definition:
If you refer to someone as a flunky, you disapprove of the fact that they associate themselves with someone who is powerful and carry
out small, unimportant jobs for them in the hope of being rewarded.
Example: `Your flunky should have known smoking was hazardous to his health," Joe told Starkey.

Definition: A person who molests someone, especially a child, commits a sexual assault against them.
Example: It is alleged the girl was molested in her bedroom.

Definition: A quadrangle is an open square area with buildings round it, especially in a college or school.
Example: This sticky love quadrangle throws the camp into jeopardy.

Definition: If a person or dog yelps, they give a sudden short cry, often because of fear or pain.
Example: Her dog yelped and came to heel.

Definition: If you say that something is true up to a point, you mean that it is partly but not completely true.
Example: 'Was she good?''Mmm. Up to a point.'

Definition: To date means up until the present time.
Example: 'Dottie' is by far his best novel to date.

Definition: Repression is the use of force to restrict and control a society or other group of people.
Example: ...a society conditioned by violence and repression.

Definition: the act or process of suppressing or the condition of being suppressed
Example: The Director said, `They're saying Berlin has ordered the suppression of the Vlkischer Beobachter.

Definition: Camouflage consists of things such as leaves, branches, or brown and green paint, which are used to make it difficult for an enemy to see military forces and equipment.
Example: They were dressed in camouflage and carried automatic rifles.

Definition: A  hiding place is a place where someone or something can be hidden, or where they are hiding.
Example: Yet it seems it is doomed to be always one step behind greedy dictators adept at finding hiding places.

Definition: If you cover something or someone up, you put something over them in order to protect or hide them.
Example: He fell asleep in the front room so I covered him up with a duvet.

Definition: To disarm a person or group means to take away all their weapons.
Example: We will agree to disarming troops and leaving their weapons at military positions.

Definition: If someone misappropriates money which does not belong to them, they take it without permission and use it for their own purposes.
Example: I took no money for personal use and have not misappropriated any funds whatsoever.

Definition: If something crumbles, or if you crumble it, it breaks into a lot of small pieces.
Example: Under the pressure, the flint crumbled into fragments.

Definition: If something  falls apart, it breaks into pieces because it is old or badly made.
Example: The work was never finished and bit by bit the building fell apart.

Definition: A vagrant is someone who moves a lot from place to place because they have no permanent home or job, and have to ask for or steal things in order to live.
Example: He lived on the street as a vagrant.

Definition: An outcast is someone who is not accepted by a group of people or by society.
Example: He had always been an outcast, unwanted and alone.

Definition: If something is in a state of disorganization, it is disorganized.
Example: Results showed mitochondrial cristae disorganization in a dose dependent manner.

Definition: A deformity is a part of someone's body which is not the normal shape because of injury or illness, or because they were born this way.
Example: ...facial deformities in babies.

Definition: If you describe someone's behaviour as unethical, you think it is wrong and unacceptable according to a society's rules or people's beliefs.
Example: It's simply unethical to promote and advertise such a dangerous product.

Definition: If you accuse someone of malpractice, you are accusing them of breaking the law or the rules of their profession in order to gain some advantage for themselves.
Example: There were only one or two serious allegations of malpractice.

Definition: An unofficial action or statement is not organized or approved by a person or group in authority.
Example: Staff voted to continue an unofficial strike.

Definition: If someone's breathing is laboured, it is slow and seems to take a lot of effort.
Example: From his slow walk and laboured breathing, Ginny realized he was far from well.

Definition: An ornate building, piece of furniture, or object is decorated with complicated patterns or shapes.
Example: ...an ornate iron staircase.

Definition: If you refer to the way something is described is an overstatement, you mean it is described in a way that makes it seem more important or serious than it really is.
Example: This may have been an improvement, but 'breakthrough' was an overstatement.

Definition:
Someone who is practised at doing something is good at it because they have had experience and have developed
their skill at it.
Example: Once you are practised at this sort of relaxation you will feel quite refreshed afterwards.

Definition: If you avenge a wrong or harmful act, you hurt or punish the person who is responsible for it.
Example: He has devoted the past five years to avenging his daughter's death.

Definition: Babyish actions, feelings, or looks are like a baby's, or are immature.
Example: ...babyish behaviour.

Definition: A seditious act, speech, or piece of writing encourages people to fight against or oppose the government.
Example: He fell under suspicion for distributing seditious pamphlets.

Definition: If you accuse someone of saying or doing inflammatory things, you mean that what they say or do is likely to make people react very angrily.
Example: ...nationalist policies that are too drastic and inflammatory.

Definition: Incendiary weapons or attacks are ones that cause large fires.
Example: Five incendiary devices were found in her house.

Definition: A saboteur is a person who deliberately damages or destroys things such as machines, railway lines, and bridges in order to weaken an enemy or to make a protest. In Britain, people who try to stop blood sports such as fox hunting are also referred to as saboteurs.
Example: The saboteurs had planned to bomb buses and offices.

Definition: If someone, for example a sick child, is described as plucky, it means that although they are weak, they face their difficulties with courage.
Example: That mindset of being plucky underdogs against the giants runs through the team.

Definition: If you invert something, you turn it the other way up or back to front.
Example: Invert the cake onto a cooling rack.

Definition: If you have misgivings about something that is being suggested or done, you feel that it is not quite right, and are worried that it may have unwanted results.
Example: She had some misgivings about what she was about to do.

Definition: Teenage children are aged between thirteen and nineteen years old.
Example: I was on my way home when two teenage girls joined me at the bus stop.

Definition: If someone is at odds with someone else, or if two people are at odds, they are disagreeing or quarrelling with each other.
Example: He was at odds with his Prime Minister.

Definition: If one thing or person is incompatible with another, they are very different in important ways, and do not suit each other or agree with each other.
Example: They feel strongly that their religion is incompatible with the political system.

Definition: If something is distasteful to you, you think it is unpleasant, disgusting, or immoral.
Example: He found it distasteful to talk about money.

Definition: Mighty is used to describe something that is very large or powerful.
Example: There was a flash and a mighty bang.

Definition: If you say that something is indisputable, you are emphasizing that it is true and cannot be shown to be untrue.
Example: It is indisputable that birds in the U.K. are harbouring this illness.

Definition: Your countrymen are men from your own country.
Example:
Unlike Handel's fellow countryman and contemporary Johann Bach, Handel never had
a musical family.

Definition: If you say that someone has vivacity, you mean that they are lively, exciting, and attractive.
Example: ...her exceptional vitality, vivacity and wit.

Definition:
A monk is a member of a male religious community that is usually separated from the outside
world.
Example: ...saffron-robed Buddhist monks.

Definition: If you describe someone as unwary, you mean that they are not cautious or experienced and are therefore likely to be harmed or deceived.
Example: With its quicksands the river usually drowns a few unwary visitors every season.

Definition: If you describe behaviour as foolhardy, you disapprove of it because it is extremely risky.
Example: When he tested an early vaccine on himself, some described the act as foolhardy.

Definition: successive change from one condition or action to another and back again repeatedly
Example:
Histological analysis revealed stable, organized muscle fibers with alternation of
light and dark streaks, indicating transverse striation.

Definition: You use oddly to indicate that what you are saying is true, but that it is not what you expected.
Example: He said no and seemed oddly reluctant to talk about it.

Definition: An exponent of an idea, theory, or plan is a person who supports and explains it, and who tries to persuade other people that it is a good idea.
Example: ...a leading exponent of test-tube baby techniques.

Definition: If someone's body or a part of their body is bloated, it is much larger than normal, usually because it has a lot of liquid or gas inside it.
Example: ...the bloated body of a dead bullock.

Definition: If a part of someone's body, especially their face, is puffy, it has a round, swollen appearance.
Example: Her cheeks were puffy with crying.

Definition: Impurities are substances that are present in small quantities in another substance and make it dirty or of an unacceptable quality.
Example: The air in the factory is filtered to remove impurities.

Definition: Erotica means works of art that show or describe sexual activity, and which are intended to arouse sexual feelings.
If something is terrifying, it makes you very frightened.
Example: I still find it terrifying to find myself surrounded by large numbers of horses.

Definition:
If you say that someone is unthinking, you are critical of them because you consider that they do not think carefully about the effects of
their behaviour.
Example: He doesn't say those silly things that unthinking people say.

Definition: If you describe something as gratuitous, you mean that it is unnecessary, and often harmful or upsetting.
Example: There's too much crime and gratuitous violence on TV.

Definition: If you describe someone as thoughtless, you are critical of them because they forget or ignore other people's wants, needs, or feelings.
Example: ...a small minority of thoughtless and inconsiderate people.

Definition: A mechanical device has parts that move when it is working, often using power from an engine or from electricity.
Example: ...a small mechanical device that taps out the numbers.

Definition: An automatic machine or device is one which has controls that enable it to perform a task without needing to be constantly operated by a person. Automatic methods and processes involve the use of such machines.
Example: Modern trains have automatic doors.

Definition: In legends and fairy stories, a wizard is a man who has magic powers.
Example: ...a financial wizard.

Definition: A monument is a large structure, usually made of stone, which is built to remind people of an event in history or of a famous person.
Example: ...the ancient monuments of England

Definition: A plaque is a flat piece of metal or stone with writing on it which is fixed to a wall or other structure to remind people of an important person or event.
Example: After touring the hospital, the princess unveiled a commemorative plaque.

Definition: A commemorative object or event is intended to make people remember a particular event or person.
Example: The Queen unveiled a commemorative plaque.

Definition: You can use monumental to emphasize the size or extent of something.
Example: It had been a monumental blunder to give him the assignment.

Definition: Preventive actions are intended to help prevent things such as disease or crime.
Example: Too much is spent on expensive curative medicine and too little on preventive medicine.

Definition: Corrective measures or techniques are intended to put right something that is wrong.
Example: Scientific institutions have been reluctant to take corrective action.

Definition: You can refer to ideas or theories about how something should be done as nostrums, especially when you think they are old-fashioned or wrong in some way.
Example: ...yesterday's failed socialist nostrums.

Definition: A prophecy is a statement in which someone says they strongly believe that a particular thing will happen.
Example: The youth, too, fulfilled the prophecy.

Definition: Divination is the art or practice of discovering what will happen in the future using supernatural means.
Example: His sporadic contacts were surreal, and his reports were exercises in divination.

Definition: Diagnosis is the discovery and naming of what is wrong with someone who is ill or with something that is not working properly.
Example: I need to have a second test to confirm the diagnosis.

Definition: A gig is a live performance by someone such as a musician or a comedian.
Example: The two bands join forces for a gig at the Sheffield Arena on November 28.

Definition: A cupboard is a piece of furniture that has one or two doors, usually contains shelves, and is used to store things. In British English, cupboard refers to all kinds of furniture like this. In American English, closet is usually used instead to refer to larger pieces of furniture.
Example: The kitchen cupboard was stocked with tins of soup and food.

Definition: Stark choices or statements are harsh and unpleasant.
Example: U.K. companies face a stark choice if they want to stay competitive.

Definition: You can refer to a very clever achievement or piece of work as wizardry, especially when you do not understand how it is done.
Example: ...a piece of technical wizardry.

Definition: Witchcraft is the use of magic powers, especially evil ones.
Example: To practise witchcraft or to practise the old religion?

Definition: Supernatural creatures, forces, and events are believed by some people to exist or happen, although they are impossible according to scientific laws.
Example: The Nakani were evil spirits who looked like humans and possessed supernatural powers.

Definition: under a spell; bewitched; magical
Example: There were enough diversions and wonders to keep them enchanted for decades to come.

Definition: The occult is the knowledge and study of supernatural or magical forces.
Example: ...sinister experiments with the occult.

Definition: the performance of tricks that appear to defy natural laws
Example: In an instant the feeding birds all fled, vanishing into the mighty hedge like a conjuring trick.

Definition: magic used for evil purposes by invoking the power of the devil
Example: Judge Cyril DeMesne was one of the good guys, he believed in her brand of black magic.

Definition: Necromancy is magic that some people believe brings a dead person back to this world so that you can talk to them.
Example: What an impressive act of comedic necromancy this is.

Definition: If you fluster someone, you make them feel nervous and confused by rushing them and preventing them from concentrating on what they are doing.
Example: The General refused to be flustered.

Definition: An outlet is a shop or organization which sells the goods made by a particular manufacturer.
Example: ...the largest retail outlet in the city.

Definition: The crust on a loaf of bread is the outside part.
Example: As the water evaporates, a crust of salt is left on the surface of the soil.

Definition: Froth is a mass of small bubbles on the surface of a liquid.
Example: ...the froth of bubbles on the top of a glass of beer.

Definition: If you describe something as invisible, you mean that it cannot be seen, for example because it is transparent, hidden, or very small.
Example: The lines were so finely etched as to be invisible from a distance.

Definition: If you describe someone as passive, you mean that they do not take action but instead let things happen to them.
Example: His passive attitude made things easier for me.

Definition: A chivalrous man is polite, kind, and unselfish, especially towards women.
Example: He was handsome, upright and chivalrous.

Definition: intimidated
Example: They were men who failed to be daunted.

Definition: Something that is daunting makes you feel slightly afraid or worried about dealing with it.
Example: They were faced with the daunting task of restoring the house.

Definition: If you are dissatisfied with something, you are not contented or pleased with it.
Example: 82% of voters are dissatisfied with the way their country is being governed.

Definition: If you describe something as an irritant, you mean that it keeps annoying you.
Example: He said the issue was not a major irritant.

Definition:
An arrow is a long thin weapon which is sharp and pointed at one end and which often has feathers at the other end. An arrow is
shot from a bow.
Example: Warriors armed with bows and arrows and spears have invaded their villages.

Definition: Evasion means deliberately avoiding something that you are supposed to do or deal with.
Example: Many pepole were angered at what they saw as an evasion of responsibility.

Definition: A keepsake is a small present that someone gives you so that you will not forget them.
Example: There was nothing left of the force it had once owned so she pocketed it, as a keepsake.

Definition: A vestige of something is a very small part that still remains of something that was once much larger or more important.
Example: We represent the last vestige of what made this nation greathard work.

Definition: Scandalous behaviour or activity is considered immoral and shocking.
Example: They would be sacked for criminal or scandalous behaviour.

Definition: The annulment of a contract or marriage is an official declaration that it is invalid, so that legally it is considered never to have existed.
Example: ...the annulment of the elections.

Definition: If the government repeals a law, it officially ends it, so that it is no longer valid.
Example: The government has just repealed the law segregating public facilities.

Definition: Someone who is observant pays a lot of attention to things and notices more about them than most people do.
Example: That's a marvellous description, Mrs Drummond. You're unusually observant.

Definition: If you describe someone as discerning, you mean that they are able to judge which things of a particular kind are good and which are bad.
Example: ...tailor-made holidays to suit the more discerning traveller.

Definition: If someone or something seems out of place in a particular situation, they do not seem to belong there or to be suitable for that situation.
Example: I felt out of place in my suit and tie.

Definition: Slavery is the system by which people are owned by other people as slaves.
Example: My people have survived 400 years of slavery.

Definition: Bondage is the condition of being someone's property and having to work for them.
Example: Masters sometimes allowed their slaves to buy their way out of bondage.

Definition: Enslavement is the act of making someone into a slave or the state of being a slave.
Example: ...the enslavement of African people.

Definition: If you describe someone as a rascally person, you mean that they behave badly and are wicked or dishonest.
Example: They stumble across a ghost town inhabited by a rascally gold prospector.

Definition: If something seduces you, it is so attractive that it makes you do something that you would not otherwise do.
Example: The view of lake and plunging cliffs seduces visitors.

Definition: disgraced, debased, depraved, etc.
Example: But the pretty comment left her feeling ' humiliated and degraded'.

Definition: Something that is suggestive of something else is quite like it or may be a sign of it.
Example: The fingers were gnarled, lumpy, with long, curving nails suggestive of animal claws.

Definition: If you say that someone's behaviour is unseemly, you disapprove of it because it is not polite or not suitable for a particular situation or occasion.
Example: It would be unseemly for judges to receive pay increases when others are struggling.

Definition: Intractable people are very difficult to control or influence.
Example: What may be done to reduce the influence of intractable opponents?

Definition: If you describe a feeling or physical action as uncontrollable, you mean that you cannot control it or prevent yourself from feeling or doing it.
Example: It had been a time of almost uncontrollable excitement.

Definition: Something that is intentional is deliberate.
Example: How can I blame him? It wasn't intentional.

Definition: If you are conscious of something, you notice it or realize that it is happening.
Example: He was conscious of the faint, musky aroma of aftershave.

Definition: If you describe things such as clothes as unbecoming, you mean that they look unattractive.
Example: ...the unbecoming dress hurriedly stitched from cheap cloth.

Definition: When a dog or other animal growls, it makes a low noise in its throat, usually because it is angry.
Example: The dog was biting, growling and wagging its tail.

Definition: Unwholesome food or drink is not healthy or good for you.
Example: The fish were unwholesome and old.

Definition: A noxious gas or substance is poisonous or very harmful.
Example: Many household products give off noxious fumes.

Definition: If you say that someone is perverted, you mean that you consider their behaviour, especially their sexual behaviour, to be immoral or unacceptable.
Example: You've been protecting sick and perverted men.

Definition: Discourtesy is rude and bad-mannered behaviour.
Example: It could simply be a matter of callous discourtesy combined with ignorance of CID investigative methods.

Definition: causing humiliation; debasing
Example: The applicant alleged that his whole-life sentence amounted to inhuman and degrading treatment as he had no hope of release.

Definition: the state of being satiated
Example: His voice deliberately gentle, maintaining the same quiescent satiety their bodies were experiencing.

Definition: A hump is a small hill or raised area.
Example: The path goes over a large hump by a tree before running near a road.

Definition: If you say that someone or something is disreputable, you are critical of them because they are not respectable or cannot be trusted.
Example: ...the noisiest and most disreputable bars.

Definition: expressing scorn, disgrace, or contempt
Example: He was overheard making opprobrious remarks about the conduct of the campaign, and was arrested.

Definition: Pleasurable experiences or sensations are pleasant and enjoyable.
Example: The most pleasurable experience of the evening was the wonderful fireworks display.

Definition: A nail is a thin piece of metal with one pointed end and one flat end. You hit the flat end with a hammer in order to push the nail into something such as a wall.
Example: A mirror hung on a nail above the washstand.

Definition: A peg is a small hook or knob that is attached to a wall or door and is used for hanging things on.
Example: His work jacket hung on the peg in the kitchen.

Definition: A debtor is a country, organization, or person who owes money.
Example: ...the situation of debtor countries.

Definition: A person or organization that is insolvent does not have enough money to pay their debts.
Example: The bank was declared insolvent.

Definition: People in need do not have enough of essential things such as money, food, or good health.
Example: The education authorities have to provide for children in need.

Definition: A beggar is someone who lives by asking people for money or food.
Example: He warned that lifting copyright restrictions could beggar the industry.

Definition: reduced or exhausted
Example: The race became somewhat of a farce as the small field was depleted with four retirements along the way.

Definition: Needy people do not have enough food, medicine, or clothing, or adequate houses.
Example: ...a multinational force aimed at ensuring that food and medicine get to needy refugees.

Definition: If someone tries to flog something, they try to sell it.
Example: They are trying to flog their house.

Definition: If there is unrest in a particular place or society, people are expressing anger and dissatisfaction about something, often by demonstrating or rioting.
Example: The real danger is civil unrest in the east of the country.

Definition: Discretion is the quality of behaving in a quiet and controlled way without drawing attention to yourself or giving away personal or private information.
Example: Larsson sometimes joined in the fun, but with more discretion.

Definition: A stalwart is a loyal worker or supporter of an organization, especially a political party.
Example: His free-trade policies aroused suspicion among Tory stalwarts.

Definition: Comradeship is friendship between a number of people who are doing the same work or who share the same difficulties or dangers.
Example: ...the comradeship of his fellow soldiers.

Definition: Brotherhood is the affection and loyalty that you feel for people with whom you have something in common.
Example:
People threw flowers into the river between the two countries as a symbolic act of
brotherhood.

Definition: A spike is a long piece of metal with a sharp point.
Example: ...a 15-foot wall topped with iron spikes.

Definition: If you avert something unpleasant, you prevent it from happening.
Example: Talks with the teachers' union over the weekend have averted a strike.

Definition: If you deflect something such as criticism or attention, you act in a way that prevents it from being directed towards you or affecting you.
Example: He'd changed his name to deflect accusations of nepotism.

Definition: If something distracts you or your attention from something, it takes your attention away from it.
Example: Tom admits that playing video games sometimes distracts him from his homework.

Definition: If something warps or is warped, it becomes damaged by bending or curving, often because of the effect of heat or water.
Example: The firm makes floors that won't shrink or warp.

Definition: If a person or animal is mutilated, their body is severely damaged, usually by someone who physically attacks them.
Example: More than 30 horses have been mutilated in the last nine months.

Definition: To maim someone means to injure them so badly that part of their body is permanently damaged.
Example: Mines have been scattered in rice paddies and jungles, maiming and killing civilians.

Definition: If something deforms a person's body or something else, it causes it to have an unnatural shape. In technical English, you can also say that the second thing deforms.
Example: Bad rheumatoid arthritis deforms limbs.

Definition: You can describe a place as a hub of an activity when it is a very important centre for that activity.
Example: The island's social hub is the Cafe Sport.

Definition: An axis is an imaginary line through the middle of something.
Example: the axis of a planet

Definition: An axle is a rod connecting a pair of wheels on a car or other vehicle.
Example: front ~

Definition: A spindle is a rod in a machine, around which another part of the machine turns.
Example: He became aware of spindle limbs clinging to the tree-trunk, leafy rags of clothing.

Definition: If you dislocate a bone or joint in your body, or in someone else's body, it moves out of its proper position in relation to other bones, usually in an accident.
Example: Harrison dislocated a finger.

Definition: A thief is a person who steals something from another person.
Example: The thieves snatched the camera.

Definition: A raffle is a competition in which you buy tickets with numbers on them. Afterwards some numbers are chosen, and if your ticket has one of these numbers on it, you win a prize.
Example: Any more raffle tickets? Twenty-five pence each or five for a pound.

Definition: A conjecture is a conclusion that is based on information that is not certain or complete.
Example: That was a conjecture, not a fact.

Definition: Gambling is the act or activity of betting money, for example in card games or on horse racing.
Example: Gambling is a form of entertainment.

Definition: Counterfeit money, goods, or documents are not genuine, but have been made to look exactly like genuine ones in order to deceive people.
Example: He admitted possessing and delivering counterfeit currency.

Definition: Meant is the past tense and past participle of mean1.
Example: I can't say any more, it's meant to be a big secret.

Definition: If you say that something is predetermined, you mean that its form or nature was decided by previous events or by people rather than by chance.
Example: The Prince's destiny was predetermined from the moment of his birth.

Definition: Captivity is the state of being kept imprisoned or enclosed.
Example: The great majority of barn owls are reared in captivity.

Definition: When you masticate food, you chew it.
Example: Her mouth was working, as if she was masticating some tasty titbit.

Definition: If someone cons you, they persuade you to do something or believe something by telling you things that are not true.
Example: He claimed that the business director had conned him of 10,000.

Definition: If you describe a belief or action as unjustified, you think that there is no good reason for having it or doing it.
Example: Your report was based upon wholly unfounded and totally unjustified allegations.

Definition: If you describe an action, system, or law as unjust, you think that it treats a person or group badly in a way that they do not deserve.
Example: The attack on Charles was deeply unjust.

Definition: If you describe something as misleading, you mean that it gives you a wrong idea or impression.
Example: It would be misleading to say that we were friends.

Definition: Fuzzy hair sticks up in a soft, curly mass.
Example: He had fuzzy black hair and bright black eyes.

Definition: A flurry of something such as activity or excitement is a short intense period of it.
Example: ...a flurry of diplomatic activity aimed at ending the war.

Definition: to overtax one's strength, capacity, etc
Example: I didn't want to overdo it but I didn't want to sound callous either.

Definition: If you are gratified by something, it gives you pleasure or satisfaction.
Example: Mr. Dambar was gratified by his response.

Definition: People who are disadvantaged or live in disadvantaged areas live in bad conditions and tend not to get a good education or have a reasonable standard of living.
Example: ...the educational problems of disadvantaged children.

Definition: If something is submerged, it is below the surface of some water.
Example: My right toe struck against a submerged rock.

Definition: sunk or submerged
Example: Standing close to, they were immersed in each other's breath.
His Citron crawled through the heavy snow, back through the dark villages buried in silence.

Definition: Someone who looks haggard has a tired expression and shadows under their eyes, especially because they are ill or have not had enough sleep.
Example: He was pale and a bit haggard.

Definition: the business or trade of cutting, transporting, preparing, or selling timber
Example: The internet has undercut the lumbering movements of the fashion industry.

Definition: If you refer to someone's ineptitude, you are criticizing them because they do something with a complete lack of skill.
Example: ...the tactical ineptitude of the allied commander.

Definition: If you describe an object as unwieldy, you mean that it is difficult to move or carry because it is so big or heavy.
Example: They came panting up to his door with their unwieldy baggage.

Definition: not skilful with one's hands; clumsy; awkward
Example: Especially in any kind of wind, the barges had to be unhandy things to bring alongside.

Definition: You can use flagrant to describe an action, situation, or someone's behaviour that you find extremely bad or shocking in a very obvious way.
Example: The judge called the decision 'a flagrant violation of international law'.

Definition: If you describe a relationship or a situation as tempestuous, you mean that very strong and intense emotions, especially anger, are involved.
Example: For years, the couple's tempestuous relationship made the headlines.

Definition: If an unborn baby is aborted, the pregnancy is ended deliberately and the baby is not born alive.
Example: Her lover walked out on her after she had aborted their child.

Definition: A ruff is a stiff strip of cloth or other material with many small folds in it, which some people wore round their neck in former times.
Example: ...an Elizabethan ruff.

Definition: Enrichment is the act of enriching someone or something or the state of being enriched.
Example: ...the enrichment of society.

Definition: the act or process of contaminating or the state of being contaminated
Example: Fears were also increasing about food contamination.

Definition: Anguish is great mental suffering or physical pain.
Example: A cry of anguish burst from her lips.

Definition: A manger is a low open container which cows, horses, and other animals feed from when indoors.
Example: We leave the manger scene in its place.

Definition: A crib is a bed for a small baby.
Example: You have been cribbing from Bennett.

Definition: An emblem is a design representing a country or organization.
Example: ...the emblem of the Soviet Union.

Definition: If you say that something requires give and take, you mean that people must compromise or co-operate for it to be successful.
Example: It is supposed to be a process of give and take, of compromise and careful listening.

Definition: If someone suffocates or is suffocated, they die because there is no air for them to breathe.
Example: He either suffocated, or froze to death.

Definition: To strangle someone means to kill them by squeezing their throat tightly so that they cannot breathe.
Example: He tried to strangle a border policeman and steal his gun.

Definition: To throttle someone means to kill or injure them by squeezing their throat or tightening something around it and preventing them from breathing.
Example: The attacker then tried to throttle her with wire.

Definition: If someone is asphyxiated, they die or lose consciousness because they are unable to breathe properly.
Example: Three people were asphyxiated in the crush for last week's train.

Definition: If people or animals are immunized, they are made immune to a particular disease, often by being given an injection.
Example: We should require that every student is immunized against hepatitis B.

Definition: If you try to appease someone, you try to stop them from being angry by giving them what they want.
Example: Gandhi was accused by some of trying to appease both factions of the electorate.

Definition: Something that is dazzling is very impressive or beautiful.
Example: He gave Alberg a dazzling smile.

Definition: If you grimace, you twist your face in an ugly way because you are annoyed, disgusted, or in pain.
Example: She started to sit up, grimaced, and sank back weakly against the pillow.

Definition: to dazzle or confuse, as with brilliance
Example: `'Yes,'" Pitt said, smiling like a magician about to bedazzle an audience.

Definition: A beacon is a light or a fire, usually on a hill or tower, which acts as a signal or a warning.
Example: Our Parliament has been a beacon of hope to the peoples of Europe.

Definition: When something broadens, it becomes wider.
Example: The trails broadened into roads.

Definition: If people, animals, or vehicles  spread out, they move apart from each other.
Example: Felix watched his men move like soldiers, spreading out into two teams.

Definition: Banter is teasing or joking talk that is amusing and friendly.
Example: She heard Tom exchanging good-natured banter with Jane.

Definition: If one thing is indicative of another, it suggests what the other thing is likely to be.
Example: The result was indicative of a strong retail market.

Definition: Someone who is demonstrative shows affection freely and openly.
Example: We came from the English tradition of not being demonstrative.

Definition: Oratory is the art of making formal speeches which strongly affect people's feelings and beliefs.
Example: He displayed determination as well as powerful oratory.

Definition: A seductress is a woman who seduces someone.
Example: She was typecast as a self-confident seductress.

Definition: If a woman has a reputation as a  femme fatale, she is considered to be very attractive sexually, and likely to cause problems for anyone who is attracted to her.
Example: She even demonstrated the way a woman called a femme fatale would do it.

Definition: In fairy stories, a witch is a woman, usually an old woman, who has evil magic powers. Witches often wear a pointed black hat, and have a pet black cat.
Example: We're clearly looking at a witch hunt here.

Definition: If you describe someone as an illustrious person, you mean that they are extremely well known because they have a high position in society or they have done something impressive.
Example: ...the most illustrious scientists of the century.

Definition: A foamy liquid has a mass of small bubbles on its surface or consists of a mass of bubbles.
Example: ...foamy waves.

Definition: If you say that someone is selfless, you approve of them because they care about other people more than themselves.
Example: She was a wonderful companion and her generosity to me was entirely selfless.

Definition: A charitable organization or activity helps and supports people who are ill or very poor, or who have a disability.
Example: ...charitable work for cancer awareness.

Definition: If something happens  ad infinitum, it is repeated again and again in the same way.
Example: This cycle repeats itself ad infinitum.

Definition: Someone who is forgetful often forgets things.
Example: My mother has become very forgetful and confused recently.

Definition: An intrepid person acts in a brave way.
Example: ...an intrepid space traveller.

Definition: Someone who is resourceful is good at finding ways of dealing with problems.
Example: He was amazingly inventive and resourceful, and played a major role in my career.

Definition: A broken-down vehicle or machine no longer works because it has something wrong with it.
Example: ...a broken-down car.

Definition: Something that is battered is old and in poor condition because it has been used a lot.
Example: He drove up in a battered old car.

Definition: If you describe something as valueless, you mean that it is not at all useful.
Example: Such attitudes are valueless unless they reflect inner cognition and certainty.

Definition: If you say that someone suffers from indecision, you mean that they find it very difficult to make decisions.
Example: After months of indecision, the government gave the plan the go-ahead on Monday.

Definition: Sweat is the salty colourless liquid which comes through your skin when you are hot, ill, or afraid.
Example: Both horse and rider were dripping with sweat within five minutes.

Definition: A rambling building is big and old with an irregular shape.
Example: ...that rambling house and its bizarre contents.

Definition: If you refer to someone's speech or writing as verbiage, you are critical of them because they use too many words, which makes their speech or writing difficult to understand.
Example: Many mission statements are nothing but empty verbiage.

Definition: Things that are dispersed are situated in many different places, a long way apart from each other.
Example: ...his widely dispersed businesses.

Definition: If you intercept someone or something that is travelling from one place to another, you stop them before they get to their destination.
Example: Gunmen intercepted him on his way to the airport.

Definition: An aromatic plant or food has a strong, pleasant smell of herbs or spices.
Example: ...an evergreen shrub with deep green, aromatic leaves.

Definition: Pep is liveliness and energy.
Example:
Many say that, given a choice, they would opt for a holiday to put the pep back in
their lives.

Definition: Something that is crumbly is easily broken into a lot of little pieces.
Example: ...crumbly cheese.

Definition: If you describe someone or something as anarchic, you disapprove of them because they do not recognize or obey any rules or laws.
Example: ...anarchic attitudes and complete disrespect for authority.

Definition: If you describe someone or something as tiresome, you mean that you find them irritating or boring.
Example: ...the tiresome old lady next door.

Definition: A pretender to a position is someone who claims the right to that position, and whose claim is disputed by others.
Example: ...the Comte de Paris, pretender to the French throne.

Definition: If you are an admirer of someone, you like and respect them or their work very much.
Example: He was an admirer of her grandfather's paintings.

Definition: A bung is a round piece of wood, cork, or rubber which you use to close the hole in a container such as a barrel or flask.
Example: Pour a whole lot of cold water over the rice, and bung it in the oven.

Definition: A transitional period is one in which things are changing from one state to another.
Example: ...a transitional period following more than a decade of civil war.

Definition: A stopgap is something that serves a purpose for a short time, but is replaced as soon as possible.
Example:
Gone are the days when work was just a stopgap between leaving school and getting
married.

Definition: If you describe someone as meticulous, you mean that they do things very carefully and with great attention to detail.
Example: He was so meticulous about everything.

Definition: If you say that someone's behaviour shows moderation, you approve of them because they act in a way that you think is reasonable and not extreme.
Example: The United Nations Secretary General called on all parties to show moderation.

Definition: providing for future needs
Example: This strikes her as a provident idea, which she'll suggest when he's in a better mood.

Definition: A courier is a person who is paid to take letters and parcels direct from one place to another.
Example: He worked as a motorcycle courier.

Definition: A coop is a cage where you keep small animals or birds such as chickens and rabbits.
Example: They keep chickens in a coop on the roof and a sheep in the yard.

Definition: to make return to (a person for a kindness or injury); repay with a similar action
If people or things are in a muddle, they are in a state of confusion or disorder.
Example: My thoughts are all in a muddle.

Definition: If something exacerbates a problem or bad situation, it makes it worse.
Example: Longstanding poverty has been exacerbated by racial divisions.

Definition: If you writhe, your body twists and turns violently backwards and forwards, usually because you are in great pain or discomfort.
Example: He was writhing in agony.

Definition: If you describe something as interminable, you are emphasizing that it continues for a very long time and indicating that you wish it was shorter or would stop.
Example: ...an interminable meeting.

Definition: If you say that something is endless, you mean that it is very large or lasts for a very long time, and it seems as if it will never stop.
Example: They turned into an endless street.

Definition: Something that is durable is strong and lasts a long time without breaking or becoming weaker.
Example: Bone china is strong and durable.

Definition: Unbreakable objects cannot be broken, usually because they are made of a very strong material.
Example: Tableware for outdoor use should ideally be unbreakable.

Definition: Disinfectant is a substance that kills germs. It is used, for example, for cleaning kitchens and bathrooms.
Example:
Effluent from the sedimentation tank is dosed with disinfectant to kill any harmful
organisms.

Definition: barren, unproductive, or unprofitable
Example: It was proving a decidedly unfruitful day, and by the time they drew up at Greystones College, he had had enough of it.

Definition: If you do something in vain, you do not succeed in achieving what you intend.
Example: He stopped at the door, waiting in vain for her to acknowledge his presence.

Definition: If you describe something such as an industry or business as uneconomic, you mean that it does not produce enough profit.
Example: ...the closure of uneconomic factories.

Definition: Someone who is outspoken gives their opinions about things openly and honestly, even if they are likely to shock or offend people.
Example: Some church leaders have been outspoken in their support for political reform.

Definition: If you are blunt, you say exactly what you think without trying to be polite.
Example: She is blunt about her personal life.

Definition: If you describe someone as forthright, you admire them because they show clearly and strongly what they think and feel.
Example: We all agreed that we would give our forthright opinions and spurred each other on.

Definition: An action, situation, emotion, or idea that is justifiable is acceptable or correct because there is a good reason for it.
Example:
The violence of the revolutionary years was justifiable on the grounds of political
necessity.

Definition: agreement, harmony, or accord
Example: The goal was to make the name more in consonance with the ideas it represented.

Definition: Something that is intelligible can be understood.
Example: The language of Darwin was intelligible to experts and non-experts alike.

Definition: If you describe someone as nonchalant, you mean that they appear not to worry or care about things and that they seem very calm.
Example: Clark's mother is nonchalant about her role in her son's latest work.

Definition: If someone in authority shows mercy, they choose not to harm someone they have power over, or they forgive someone they have the right to punish.
Example: Neither side took prisoners or showed any mercy.

Definition: the ability of an organism to resist disease, either through the activities of specialized blood cells or antibodies produced by them in response to natural exposure or inoculation ( active immunity) or by the injection of antiserum or the transfer of antibodies from a mother to her baby via the placenta or breast milk ( passive immunity)
Example: Everyone... who is innocent, everyone without an immunity.

Definition: When passengers disembark from a ship, aeroplane, or bus, they leave it at the end of their journey.
Example: I looked towards the plane. Six passengers had already disembarked.

Definition: the state of being without normal sensory awareness; insensibility
Example: Then I adopted a horizontal position on the sofa and sank instantly into unconsciousness.

Definition: Ecstasy is a feeling of very great happiness.
Example: ...a state of almost religious ecstasy.

Definition: The extinction of a species of animal or plant is the death of all its remaining living members.
Example: An operation is beginning to try to save a species of crocodile from extinction.

Definition: total destruction
Example: The fear of nuclear annihilation overshadowed all others.

Definition: If a thick wet substance splatters on something or is splattered on it, it drops or is thrown over it.
Example: The rain splattered against the french windows.

Definition: A callous person or action is very cruel and shows no concern for other people or their feelings.
Example: ...his callous disregard for human life.

Definition: If you describe someone as heartless, you mean that they are cruel and unkind, and have no sympathy for anyone or anything.
Example: I couldn't believe they were so heartless.

Definition: If you describe a person, place, or thing as unsavoury, you mean that you find them unpleasant or morally unacceptable.
Example: The sport has long been associated with illegal wagers and unsavoury characters.

Definition: preserved in fossil form
Example: Until the 1980s, its main industry had been the mining of fossilized guano for fertilizers.

Definition: converted into bone
Example: The Order, grown rigid and ossified as old bone, in many ways has exacerbated the basic fault of human consciousness.

Definition: To immobilize something or someone means to stop them from moving or operating.
Example: ...a car alarm system that immobilises the engine.
For nigh on a month, my revenues have been cut off, my government hamstrung.

Definition: deprived of power, strength, or capacity
Example: "All that is really at issue is how quickly Dempsey becomes incapacitated.

Definition: If you describe someone as scatterbrained, you mean that they often forget things and are unable to organize their thoughts properly.
Example: He's a little scatterbrained and easily distracted, but has a first-rate deductive mind.

Definition: If you get vertigo when you look down from a high place, you feel unsteady and sick.
Example: If you have vertigo it seems as if the whole room is spinning round you.

Definition: Hazy weather conditions are those in which things are difficult to see, because of light mist, hot air, or dust.
Example: The air was thin and crisp, filled with hazy sunshine and frost.

Definition: charges, as for membership of a club or organization; fees
Example: We decided paying dues was not enough.

Definition: If you describe someone as, for example, a budding businessman or a budding artist, you mean that they are starting to succeed or become interested in business or art.
Example: The forum is now open to all budding entrepreneurs.

Definition: avowed or acknowledged
Example: a professed economist

Definition: Profligacy is the spending of too much money or the using of too much of something.
Example: ...the continuing profligacy of certain states.

Definition: If you describe a person or an organization as acquisitive, you do not approve of them because you think they are too concerned with getting new possessions.
Example: We live in an acquisitive society.

Definition: If you describe a person or their behaviour as rapacious, you disapprove of their greedy or selfish behaviour.
Example: He had a rapacious appetite for bird's nest soup.

Definition: An avaricious person is very greedy for money or possessions.
Example: He sacrificed his own career so that his avaricious brother could succeed.

Definition: If you say that someone is selfish, you mean that he or she cares only about himself or herself, and not about other people.
Example: I think I've been very selfish. I've been mainly concerned with myself.

Definition: If someone has an insatiable desire for something, they want as much of it as they can possibly get.
Example: The public has an insatiable appetite for stories about the famous.

Definition: Something that is showy is very noticeable because it is large, colourful, or bright.
Example: Since he was color blind, he favored large, showy flowers.

Definition: If you describe someone as loutish, you are critical of them because their behaviour is impolite and aggressive.
Example: I was appalled by the loutish behaviour.

Definition: Kinship is the relationship between members of the same family.
Example: The ties of kinship may have helped the young man find his way in life.

Definition: Compliance with something, for example a law, treaty, or agreement means doing what you are required or expected to do.
Example: Inspectors were sent to visit nuclear sites and verify compliance with the treaty.

Definition: An orthodoxy is an accepted view about something.
Example: These ideas rapidly became the new orthodoxy in linguistics.

Definition: The pitfalls involved in a particular activity or situation are the things that may go wrong or may cause problems.
Example: The pitfalls of working abroad are numerous.

Definition: If you are distrustful of someone or something, you think that they are not honest, reliable, or safe.
Example: Voters are deeply distrustful of all politicians.

Definition: If you are sceptical about something, you have doubts about it.
Example: Other archaeologists are sceptical about his findings.

Definition: If a musician or group of musicians appears in concert, they are giving a live performance.
Example: I want people to remember Elvis in concert.

Definition: If you describe someone as self-satisfied, you mean that they are too pleased with themselves about their achievements or their situation and they think that nothing better is possible.
Example: You're so bloody self-satisfied.

Definition: A complacent person is very pleased with themselves or feels that they do not need to do anything about a situation, even though the situation may be uncertain or dangerous.
Example: We cannot afford to be complacent about our health.

Definition: If you say that someone is conceited, you are showing your disapproval of the fact that they are far too proud of their abilities or achievements.
Example: I thought him conceited and arrogant.

Definition: A cursory glance or examination is a brief one in which you do not pay much attention to detail.
Example: Burke cast a cursory glance at the menu, then flapped it shut.

Definition: If you describe an action, rule, or decision as arbitrary, you think that it is not based on any principle, plan, or system. It often seems unfair because of this.
Example: Arbitrary arrests and detention without trial were common.

Definition: On-the-spot things are done at the place that you are in at the time that you are there.
Example: Rail travellers who try to avoid paying their fares could face on-the-spot fines.

Definition: If you wring something out of someone, you manage to make them give it to you even though they do not want to.
Example: Buyers use different ruses to wring free credit out of their suppliers.

Definition: Inequality is the difference in social status, wealth, or opportunity between people or groups.
Example: People are concerned about social inequality.

Definition: A eulogy is a speech or piece of writing that praises someone or something very much.
Example: Yet the interview now reads like the funeral eulogy that he could not entrust to anyone else.

Definition: A quarrelsome person often gets involved in arguments.
Example: Benedict had been a wild boy and a quarrelsome young man.

Definition: You can refer to a sexual desire or action that you consider to be abnormal and unacceptable as a perversion.
Example: He condemned the trade as morally repugnant and a perversion of natural justice.

Definition: An incumbent is someone who holds an official post at a particular time.
Example: In general, incumbents have a 94 per cent chance of being re-elected.

Definition: Dope is a drug, usually an illegal drug such as marijuana or cocaine.
Example: A man asked them if they wanted to buy some dope.

Definition: You can describe a car as sporty when it performs like a racing car but can be driven on normal roads.
Example: The steering and braking are exactly what you want from a sporty car.

Definition: If you act with forethought, you think carefully before you act about what will be needed, or about what the consequences will be.
Example: With a little forethought many accidents could be avoided.

Definition: Circumspection is cautious behaviour and a refusal to take risks.
Example: This is a region to be treated with circumspection.

Definition: You describe something as sickening when it gives you feelings of horror or disgust, or makes you feel sick in your stomach.
Example: This was a sickening attack on a pregnant and defenceless woman.

Definition: the act of consoling or state of being consoled; solace
Example: Let the sick and suffering find us real angels of comfort and consolation.

Definition: A rebate is an amount of money which is paid to you when you have paid more tax, rent, or rates than you needed to.
Example: ...a tax rebate.

Definition: If something petrifies you, it makes you feel very frightened.
Example: Prison petrifies me and I don't want to go there.

Definition: Meditation is the act of remaining in a silent and calm state for a period of time, as part of a religious training, or so that you are more able to deal with the problems of everyday life.
Example: Many busy executives have begun to practice yoga and meditation.

Definition: If you describe someone as a hanger-on, you are critical of them because they are trying to be friendly with a richer or more important person, especially in order to gain an advantage for themselves.
Example: This is where the young stars and their hangers-on come to party.

Definition: If something is sanctified by a priest or other holy person, the priest or holy person officially approves of it, or declares it to be holy.
Example: She is trying to make amends for her marriage not being sanctified.

Definition: When someone is ordained, they are made a member of the clergy in a religious ceremony.
Example: He was ordained a Catholic priest in 1982.

Definition: the quality, character, or state of being immoral
Example: Second, notice that it's gross immorality.

Definition: Someone's mismanagement of a system or organization is the bad way they have dealt with it or organized it.
Example: ...the Government's economic mismanagement.

Definition: Guilt is an unhappy feeling that you have because you have done something wrong or think that you have done something wrong.
Example: Her emotions had ranged from anger to guilt in the space of a few seconds.

Definition: The aggressor in a fight or battle is the person, group, or country that starts it.
Example: They have been the aggressors in this conflict.

Definition: A robber is someone who steals money or property from a bank, a shop, or a vehicle, often by using force or threats.
Example: Armed robbers broke into a jeweller's through a hole in the wall.

Definition: A burglar is a thief who enters a house or other building by force.
Example: Burglars broke into their home.

Definition: If you are scornful of someone or something, you show contempt for them.
Example: He is deeply scornful of politicians.

Definition: A withering look or remark is very critical, and is intended to make someone feel ashamed or stupid.
Example: Deborah Jane's mother gave her a withering look.

Definition: If you treat someone or something with derision, you express contempt for them.
Example: He tried to calm them, but was greeted with shouts of derision.

Definition: Laughter is the sound of people laughing, for example because they are amused or happy.
Example: Their laughter filled the corridor.

Definition: If you say that someone has the gall to do something, you are criticizing them for behaving in a rude or disrespectful way.
Example: I daresay he thought he was above the law. I can't get over the gall of the fellow.

Definition: If something smoulders, it burns slowly, producing smoke but not flames.
Example: A number of buildings around the Parliament were still smouldering today.

Definition: When something putrefies, it decays and produces a very unpleasant smell.
Example: The meat in all of the open flasks putrefied.

Definition: If metal or stone corrodes, or is corroded, it is gradually destroyed by a chemical or by rust.
Example: He has devised a process for making gold wires which neither corrode nor oxidise.

Definition: Rust is a brown substance that forms on iron or steel, for example when it comes into contact with water.
Example: ...a decaying tractor, red with rust.

Definition: Journalists use romp in expressions like romp home, romp in, or romp to victory, to say that a person or horse has won a race or competition very easily.
Example: Mr Foster romped home with 141 votes.

Definition: Misbehaviour is behaviour that is not acceptable to other people.
Example: If the toddler had been dealt with properly, his misbehaviour would have been avoided.

Definition: If something is deceptive, it encourages you to believe something which is not true.
Example: Appearances can be deceptive.

Definition: Someone who is morose is miserable, bad-tempered, and not willing to talk very much to other people.
Example: She was morose, pale, and reticent.

Definition: Someone who is sulky is sulking or is unwilling to enjoy themselves.
Example: I was quite sulky, so I didn't take part in much.

Definition: If someone is sombre, they are serious or sad.
Example: The pair were in sombre mood.

Definition: A species of animal or plant that is extinct no longer has any living members, either in the world or in a particular place.
Example: It is 250 years since the wolf became extinct in Britain.

Definition: A vendor is someone who sells things such as newspapers, cigarettes, or food from a small stall or cart.
Example: ...ice-cream vendors.

Definition: An entrepreneur is a person who sets up businesses and business deals.
Example: What advice did he give to young entrepreneurs?

Definition: An impresario is a person who arranges for plays, concerts, and other entertainments to be performed.
Example: The great impresario was recruiting a salesman.

Definition: A campaigner is a person who campaigns for social or political change.
Example: ...anti-hunting campaigners.

Definition: If you say that someone died peacefully, you mean that they suffered no pain or violence when they died.
Example: He died peacefully on 10th December after a short illness.

Definition: A pacific person, country, or course of action is peaceful or has the aim of bringing about peace.
Example: The Liberals were traditionally seen as the more pacific party.

Definition: If someone or something is disarming, they make you feel less angry or hostile.
Example: Leonard approached with a disarming smile.

Definition: If you bemoan something, you express sorrow or dissatisfaction about it.
Example: Universities and other research establishments bemoan their lack of funds.

Definition: If you mourn someone who has died or mourn for them, you are very sad that they have died and show your sorrow in the way that you behave.
Example: Joan still mourns her father.

Definition: A dirge is a slow, sad song or piece of music. Dirges are sometimes performed at funerals.
Example: ...the mournful dirge, 'Erin's Lament'.

Definition: An elegy is a sad poem, often about someone who has died.
Example: ...a touching elegy for a lost friend.

Definition:
If you are disheartened, you feel disappointed about something and have less confidence or less hope about it than
you did before.
Example: He was disheartened by their hostile reaction.

Definition: A bog is an area of land which is very wet and muddy.
A marsh is a wet, muddy area of land.
Example: They fly off to lakes and marshes where flying insects are more abundant.

Definition: A quagmire is a difficult, complicated, or unpleasant situation which is not easy to avoid or escape from.
Example: His people had fallen further and further into a quagmire of confusion.

Definition: The cadence of someone's voice is the way their voice gets higher and lower as they speak.
Example: He recognized the Polish cadences in her voice.

Definition: A defeatist is someone who thinks or talks in a way that suggests that they expect to be unsuccessful.
Example: There is no point going out there with a defeatist attitude.

Definition: A cynic is someone who believes that people always act selfishly.
Example: I have come to be very much of a cynic in these matters.

Definition: A damper is a small sheet of metal in a fire, boiler, or furnace that can be moved to increase or reduce the amount of air that enters.
Example: `Rather puts a damper on your theory doesn't it, Mr McKinnon?

Definition: A mocking expression or mocking behaviour indicates that you think someone or something is stupid or inferior.
Example: She gave a mocking smile.

Definition: When you make an ironic remark, you say something that you do not mean, as a joke.
Example: At the most solemn moments he will flash a mocking smile or make an ironic remark.

Definition: If you describe someone as unbelieving, you mean that they do not believe something that they have been told.
Example: He looked at me with unbelieving eyes.

Definition: If you are disillusioned with something, you are disappointed, because it is not as good as you had expected or thought.
Example: I've become very disillusioned with politics.

Definition: Someone who is pessimistic thinks that bad things are going to happen.
Example: Not everyone is so pessimistic about the future.

Definition: A ditch is a long narrow channel cut into the ground at the side of a road or field.
Example: I decided to ditch the sofa bed.

Definition: If you  mix up two things or people, you confuse them, so that you think that one of them is the other one.
Example: People often mix me up with other actors.

Definition: Infidelity occurs when a person who is married or in a long-term relationship has sex with another person.
Example: George ignored his partner's infidelities.

Definition: Double-dealing is behaviour which is deliberately deceitful.
Example: Marriages were broken and lives ruined by the revelation of double-dealing.

Definition: Subversion is the attempt to weaken or destroy a political system or a government.
Example: He was arrested in parliament on charges of subversion for organizing the demonstration.

Definition: A waiver is when a person, government, or organization agrees to give up a right or says that people do not have to obey a particular rule or law.
Example: ...a waiver of constitutional rights.

Definition: Avoidance of someone or something is the act of avoiding them.
Example: ...the avoidance of stress.

Definition: If you say that someone has shown forbearance, you admire them for behaving in a calm and sensible way about something that they have a right to be very upset or angry about.
Example: All the Greenpeace people behaved with impressive forbearance and dignity.

Definition: Self-sacrifice is the giving up of what you want so that other people can have what they need or want.
Example: I thanked my parents for all their self-sacrifice on my behalf.

Definition: Inefficient people, organizations, systems, or machines do not use time, energy, or other resources in the best way.
Example: Their communication systems are inefficient in the extreme.

Definition: A strainer is an object with holes which you pour a liquid through in order to separate the liquid from the solids in it.
Example: Pour the broth through a strainer.

Definition: If an idea, feeling, or piece of information percolates through a group of people or a thing, it spreads slowly through the group or thing.
Example: New fashions took a long time to percolate down.

Definition: If you deride someone or something, you say that they are stupid or have no value.
Example: Opposition MPs derided the Government's response to the crisis.

Definition: If people in an audience heckle public speakers or performers, they interrupt them, for example by making rude remarks.
Example: They heckled him and interrupted his address with angry questions.

Definition: A vaccine is a substance containing a harmless form of the germs that cause a particular disease. It is given to people, usually by injection, to prevent them getting that disease.
Example: Anti-malarial vaccines are now undergoing trials.

Definition: the act or process of inoculating
Example: Couldn't heartache work like an inoculation -- once suffered, always protected?

Definition: If you trot somewhere, you move fairly fast at a speed between walking and running, taking small quick steps.
Example: I trotted down the steps and out to the shed.

Definition: When a horse canters, it moves at a speed that is slower than a gallop but faster than a trot.
Example: The competitors cantered into the arena to conclude the closing ceremony.

Definition: If a person or animal lopes somewhere, they run in an easy and relaxed way, taking long steps.
Example: He was loping across the sand toward Nancy.

Definition: Silt is fine sand, soil, or mud which is carried along by a river.
Example: The lake was almost solid with silt and vegetation.

Definition: Compost is a mixture of decayed plants and vegetable waste which is added to the soil to help plants grow.
Example: ...a small compost heap.

Definition: Fertilizer is a substance such as solid animal waste or a chemical mixture that you spread on the ground in order to make plants grow more successfully.
Example: ...farming without any purchased chemical, fertilizer or pesticide.

Definition: Droppings are the faeces of birds and small animals.
Example: ...pigeon droppings.

Definition: A rumour is a story or piece of information that may or may not be true, but that people are talking about.
Example: We have been denying rumours of a split since the first week we got together.

Definition: If you refer to someone as a troublemaker, you mean that they cause unpleasantness, quarrels, or fights, especially by encouraging people to oppose authority.
Example: The regional governor has powers to expel suspected troublemakers.

Definition: If someone snoops around a place, they secretly look around it in order to find out things.
Example: Ricardo was the one she'd seen snooping around Kim's hotel room.

Definition: Sideways means from or towards the side of something or someone.
Example: Piercey glanced sideways at her.

Definition: If you give someone a sidelong look, you look at them out of the corner of your eyes.
Example: She gave him a quick sidelong glance.

Definition: a turning away; estrangement
Example: There are few films that deliver a more chilling portrait of urban alienation.

Definition: If you describe a man as a yes-man, you dislike the fact that he seems always to agree with people who have authority over him, in order to gain favour.
Example: To be sure, this skepticism of the yes-man mentality has advantages.

Definition: Makeshift things are temporary and usually of poor quality, but they are used because there is nothing better available.
Example: ...the cardboard boxes and makeshift shelters of the homeless.

Definition: A misunderstanding is a failure to understand something properly, for example a situation or a person's remarks.
Example: There has been some misunderstanding of our publishing aims.

Definition: Your outgoings are the regular amounts of money which you have to spend every week or every month, for example in order to pay your rent or bills.
Example: She suggests you first assess your income and outgoings.

Definition: A cyst is a growth containing liquid that appears inside your body or under your skin.
Example: He had a minor operation to remove a cyst.

Definition: A stew is a meal which you make by cooking meat and vegetables in liquid at a low temperature.
Example: She served him a bowl of lamb stew.

Definition: A moisturizer is a cream that you put on your skin to make it feel softer and smoother.
Example: These come in powders, sprays, mousse, gels, lotions and moisturizers.

Definition: If you describe someone as slapdash, you mean that they do things carelessly without much thinking or planning.
Example: ...a slapdash student.

Definition: If you describe someone as irresponsible, you are criticizing them because they do things without properly considering their possible consequences.
Example: It was clearly irresponsible to fly a drone close to an airport.

Definition: If you describe a person or their behaviour as cavalier, you are criticizing them because you think that they do not consider other people's feelings or take account of the seriousness of a situation.
Example: The Editor takes a cavalier attitude to the concept of fact checking.

Definition: An omission is something that has not been included or has not been done, either deliberately or accidentally.
Example: There is one striking omission from the plot.

Definition: If you say that someone is being offhand, you are critical of them for being unfriendly or impolite, and not showing any interest in what other people are doing or saying.
Example: He lapsed into long silences or became offensively off-hand.

Definition: If someone has a peerage, they have the rank of a peer.
Example: The Prime Minister offered him a peerage.

Definition: An emphatic response or statement is one made in a forceful way, because the speaker feels very strongly about what they are saying.
