Example: His response was immediate and emphatic.

Definition: To eviscerate a person or animal means to remove their internal organs, such as their heart, lungs, and stomach.
Example: Democrats say the petition will eviscerate state government.

Definition: If an election or a contract is annulled, it is declared invalid, so that legally it is considered never to have existed.
Example: Opposition party leaders are now pressing for the entire election to be annulled.

Definition: If a court or someone in authority quashes a decision or judgment, they officially reject it.
Example: The Appeal Court has quashed the convictions of all eleven people.

Definition: To counteract something means to reduce its effect by doing something that produces an opposite effect.
Example: My husband has to take several pills to counteract high blood pressure.

Definition: To neutralize something means to prevent it from having any effect or from working properly.
Example: The U.S. is trying to neutralize the resolution in the U.N. Security Council.

Definition: If you are entitled to something, you have the right to have it or do it.
Example: If the warranty is limited, the terms may entitle you to a replacement or refund.

Definition: Crazed people are wild and uncontrolled, and perhaps insane.
Example: A crazed gunman slaughtered five people last night.

Definition: A haunted building or other place is one where a ghost regularly appears.
Example: Tracy said the cabin was haunted.

Definition: If you are cursed with something, you are very unlucky in having it.
Example: Bulman was cursed with a poor memory for names.

Definition: If someone is obsessed with a person or thing, they keep thinking about them and find it difficult to think about anything else.
Example: He was obsessed with American gangster movies.

Definition: an invasion or hostile attack; raid or incursion
Example: Doctors and activists fear that they will be deserted as the regime troops make further inroads, and say they are awaiting retribution.

Definition: If something is soaking or soaking wet, it is very wet.
Example: My face and raincoat were soaking wet.

Definition: the act or process of diffusing or being diffused; dispersion
Example: `The T-shirts and the graffiti stuff are for a diffusion collection.

Definition: thriving; prospering; doing well
Example: Flourishing market conditions prompted the growth of artistic investment.

Definition: Your predecessor is the person who had your job before you.
Example: He maintained that he learned everything he knew from his predecessor.

Definition: Your forebears are your ancestors.
Example: I'll come back to the land of my forebears.

Definition: A psychiatrist is a doctor who treats people who are mentally ill.
Example: Alex will probably be seeing a psychiatrist for many months or even years.

Definition: If you describe someone as a slacker, you mean that they are lazy and do less work than they should.
Example: He's not a slacker; he's the best worker they've got.

Definition: A dodger is someone who avoids doing a duty or paying a charge, for example paying taxes or for train travel.
Example: ...tax dodgers who hide their interest earnings.

Definition: Decomposition is the process of decay that takes place when a living thing changes chemically after dying.
Example: Because of the composition of the soil underneath the Mouncy Street houses, decomposition of the bodies had been swift.

Definition: If you describe something as unnecessary, you mean that it is not needed or does not have to be done, and is undesirable.
Example: The slaughter of whales is unnecessary and inhuman.

Definition: Something that is needless is completely unnecessary.
Example: But his death was so needless.

Definition: If you describe someone as impudent, you mean they are rude or disrespectful, or do something they have no right to do.
Example: Some of them were impudent and insulting.

Definition: If you describe someone as fleshy, you mean that they are slightly too fat.
Example: He was well-built, but too fleshy to be impressive.

Definition: If you describe someone as tubby, you mean that they are rather fat.

Saturated fats are types of fat that are found in some foods, especially meat, eggs, and things such as butter and cheese. They are believed to cause heart disease and some other illnesses if eaten too often.
Example: ...foods rich in cholesterol and saturated fats.

Definition: If you guzzle something, you drink it or eat it quickly and greedily.
Example: Melissa had guzzled gin and tonics like they were lemonade.

Definition: If someone has an incurable disease, they cannot be cured of it.
Example: He is suffering from an incurable skin disease.

Definition: Irreparable damage or harm is so bad that it cannot be repaired or put right.
Example: The move would cause irreparable harm to the organization.

Definition: When a dead body is disinterred, it is dug up from out of the ground.
Example: The bones were disinterred and moved to a burial site.

Definition: A creditable performance or achievement is of a reasonably high standard.
Example: They turned out a quite creditable performance.

Definition: An admirable quality or action is one that deserves to be praised and admired.
Example: Beyton is an admirable character.

Definition: Someone who is stubborn or who behaves in a stubborn way is determined to do what they want and is very unwilling to change their mind.
Example: He is a stubborn character used to getting his own way.

Definition: If you have tenacity, you are very determined and do not give up easily.
Example: Talent, hard work and sheer tenacity are all crucial to career success.

Definition: If you describe something or someone as unassailable, you mean that nothing can alter, destroy, or challenge them.
Example: That was enough to give her an unassailable lead.

Definition: A curio is an object such as a small ornament which is unusual and fairly rare.
Example: ...Oriental curios.

Definition: If you interpose something between two people or things, you place it between them.
Example: Police had to interpose themselves between the two rival groups.

Definition: An abbreviation is a short form of a word or phrase, made by leaving out some of the letters or by using only the first letter of each word.
Example: The postal abbreviation for Kansas is KS.

Definition: the act of compressing or the condition of being compressed
Example: in ~

Definition: When you blink or when you blink your eyes, you shut your eyes and very quickly open them again.
Example: Kathryn blinked and forced a smile.

Definition: To regenerate something means to develop and improve it to make it more active, successful, or important, especially after a period when it has been getting worse.
Example: The government will continue to try to regenerate inner city areas.

Definition: If you describe someone, especially a child, as well-behaved, you mean that they behave in a way that adults generally like and think is correct.
Example: ...well-behaved little boys.

Definition: If you put or keep something in order, you make sure that it is tidy or properly organized.
Example: Now he has a chance to put his life back in order.

Definition: a depressed or bored state of mind
Example: The pound is in the doldrums and economic forecasts are gloomy.

Definition: the condition or quality of being weary; fatigue or tedium
Example: For the first time her face looked animated, the air of bored weariness dropping away.

Definition: Glue is a sticky substance used for joining things together, often for repairing broken things.
Example: ...a tube of glue.

Definition: Cement is a grey powder which is mixed with sand and water in order to make concrete.
Example: ...a mixture of wet sand and cement.

Definition: To annihilate something means to destroy it completely.
Example: There are lots of ways of annihilating the planet.

Definition: A thicket is a small group of trees or bushes which are growing closely together.
Example: ...a bamboo thicket.

Definition: If someone is a tea drinker or a beer drinker, for example, they regularly drink tea or beer.
Example: Are you a coffee drinker?

Definition: A drunkard is someone who frequently gets drunk.
Example: After nearly twenty years of being a drone, a drunkard and a boor, Stefan has become a philosopher.

Definition: You use assuming or assuming that when you are considering a possible situation or event, so that you can think about the consequences.
Example: 'Assuming you're right,' he said, 'there's not much I can do about it, is there?'

Definition: If you are respectful, you show respect for someone.
Example: He was always so polite and respectful.

Definition: If you are grateful for something that someone has given you or done for you, you have warm, friendly feelings towards them and wish to thank them.
Example: She was grateful to him for being so good to her.

Definition: When you are thankful, you are very happy and relieved that something has happened.
Example: Most of the time I'm just thankful that I've got a job.

Definition: If you say that you are indebted to someone for something, you mean that you are very grateful to them for something.
Example: I am deeply indebted to him for his help.

Definition: If something is optional, you can choose whether or not you do it or have it.
Example: A holiday isn't an optional extra. In this stressful, frantic world it's a must.

Definition: Discretionary things are not fixed by rules but are decided on by people in authority, who consider each individual case.
Example: Magistrates were given wider discretionary powers.

Definition: You use nominal to indicate that someone or something is supposed to have a particular identity or status, but in reality does not have it.
Example: As he was still not allowed to run a company, his partner became its nominal head.

Definition: A titular job or position has a name that makes it seem important, although the person who has it is not really important or powerful.
Example: He is titular head, and merely signs laws occasionally.

Definition: If you describe something bad, such as a crime or disease, as rampant, you mean that it is very common and is increasing in an uncontrolled way.
Example: Inflation is rampant and industry in decline.

Definition: Something that is superfluous is unnecessary or is no longer needed.
Example: My presence at the afternoon's proceedings was superfluous.

Definition: Someone who is indolent is lazy.
Example: ...indolent teenagers who won't lift a finger to help.

Definition: If you are lethargic, you do not have much energy or enthusiasm.
Example: He felt too miserable and lethargic to get dressed.

Definition: If you describe someone as languid, you mean that they show little energy or interest and are very slow and casual in their movements.
Example:
To his delight a familiar, tall, languid figure lowered itself down the steps of
a club.

Definition: Someone who is listless has no energy or enthusiasm.
Example: He was listless and pale and wouldn't eat much.

Definition: If you describe a person or what they say as flippant, you are criticizing them because you think they are not taking something as seriously as they should.
Example: Don't be flippant, damn it! This is serious!

Definition: If one group has ascendancy over another group, it has more power or influence than the other group.
Example:
Although geographically linked, the two provinces have long fought for political
ascendancy.

Definition: Something that is unremitting continues without stopping or becoming less intense.
Example: I was sent to boarding school, where I spent six years of unremitting misery.

Definition: A punishing schedule, activity, or experience requires a lot of physical effort and makes you very tired or weak.
Example: It was a punishing schedule for any man, but Fox was now fifty-seven.

Definition: If you describe someone as merciless, you mean that they are very cruel or determined and do not show any concern for the effect their actions have on other people.
Example: Whistler, as always, was merciless.

Definition: If you describe something as edifying, you mean that it benefits you in some way, for example by teaching you about something.
Example: In the 18th century art was seen, along with music and poetry, as something edifying.

Definition: Outlying places are far away from the main cities of a country.
Example: Tourists can visit outlying areas like the Napa Valley Wine Country.

Definition: Something that is clandestine is hidden or kept secret, often because it is illegal.
Example: ...their clandestine meetings.

Definition: Someone or something that is witty is amusing in a clever way.
Example: His plays were very good, very witty.

Definition: Innuendo is indirect reference to something rude or unpleasant.
Example: The report was based on rumours, speculation, and innuendo.

Definition: A niche in the market is a specific area of marketing which has its own particular requirements, customers, and products.
Example: I think we have found a niche in the toy market.

Definition: You use altogether to emphasize that something has stopped, been done, or finished completely.
Example: When Artie stopped calling altogether, Julie found a new man.

Definition: Whales are very large mammals that live in the sea.
Example: It was far too big but we had a whale of a time.

Definition: You can use mammoth to emphasize that a task or change is very large and needs a lot of effort to achieve.
Example: ...the mammoth task of relocating the library.

Definition: If you refer to a man as a scoundrel, you mean that he behaves very badly towards other people, especially by cheating them or deceiving them.
Example: He is a lying scoundrel!

Definition: A deserter is someone who leaves their job in the armed forces without permission.
Example: He felt like a deserter to be away from his own Divisional family, his own Staff comrades, his own commander at such a time.

Definition: If you use unprofessional to describe someone's behaviour at work, you are criticizing them for not behaving according to the standards that are expected of a person in their profession.
Example:
What she did was very unprofessional. She left abruptly about 90 minutes into the
show.

Definition: A caretaker is a person whose job it is to look after a large building such as a school or a block of flats or apartments, and deal with small repairs to it.
Example: The military intends to hand over power to a caretaker government.

Definition: A pistol is a small gun.
Nepotism is the unfair use of power in order to get jobs or other benefits for your family or friends.
Example:
Many will regard his appointment as the kind of nepotism British banking ought to
avoid.

Definition: Nonaligned countries did not support or were in no way linked to groups of countries headed by the United States or the former Soviet Union.
Example: ...a meeting of foreign ministers from nonaligned countries.

Definition: Someone who is wakeful finds it difficult to get to sleep and wakes up very often when they should be sleeping.
Example: Wakeful babies will often continue to need little sleep as they grow older.

Definition: Rancour is a feeling of bitterness and anger.
Example: 'That's too bad,' Teddy said without rancour.

Definition: A lattice is a pattern or structure made of strips of wood or another material which cross over each other diagonally leaving holes in between.
Example: We were crawling along the narrow steel lattice of the bridge.

Definition: A lather is a white mass of bubbles which is produced by mixing a substance such as soap or washing powder with water.
Example: ...the sort of water that easily makes a lather with soap.

Definition: If a drink fizzes, it produces lots of little bubbles of gas and makes a sound like a long 's'.
Example: After a while their mother was back, holding a tray of glasses that fizzed.

Definition: Gum is a substance, usually tasting of mint, which you chew for a long time but do not swallow.
Example: The toothbrush gently removes plaque without damaging the gums.

Definition: If you describe a person or an organization as authoritarian, you are critical of them controlling everything rather than letting people decide things for themselves.
Example: Senior officers could be considering a coup to restore authoritarian rule.

Definition: Dictatorial means controlled or used by a dictator.
Example: He suspended the constitution and assumed dictatorial powers.

Definition: If it is windy, the wind is blowing a lot.
Example: It was windy and Jake felt cold.

Definition: If you describe someone as breezy, you mean that they behave in a casual, cheerful, and confident manner.
Example: ...his bright and breezy personality.

Definition: If something whizzes somewhere, it moves there very fast.
Example: Stewart felt a bottle whizz past his head.

Definition: If you are jubilant, you feel extremely happy because of a success.
Example:
Ferdinand was jubilant after making an impressive comeback from a month on the injured
list.

Definition: If you feel distaste for someone or something, you dislike them and consider them to be unpleasant, disgusting, or immoral.
Example: Roger looked at her with distaste.

Definition: Stuffy people or institutions are formal and old-fashioned.
Example: Why were grown-ups always so stuffy and slow to recognize good ideas?

Definition: An overpowering feeling is so strong that you cannot resist it.
Example: ...hard, cold, overpowering anger.

Definition: The brevity of something is the fact that it is short or lasts for only a short time.
Example: The bonus of this homely soup is the brevity of its cooking time.

Definition: If you say that someone is a miser, you disapprove of them because they seem to hate spending money, and to spend as little as possible.
Example: I'm married to a miser.

Definition: A collector is a person who collects things of a particular type as a hobby.
Example: ...a stamp-collector.

Definition: A dissertation is a long formal piece of writing on a particular subject, especially for a university degree.
Example: He is currently writing a dissertation on the Somali civil war.

Definition: If you are crouching, your legs are bent under you so that you are close to the ground and leaning forward slightly.
Example: We were crouching in the bushes.

Definition: If you stoop, you stand or walk with your shoulders bent forwards.
Example: She was taller than he was and stooped slightly.

Definition: If you describe someone or something as legendary, you mean that they are very famous and that many stories are told about them.
Example: ...the legendary Jazz singer Adelaide Hall.

Definition: A caprice is an unexpected action or decision which has no strong reason or purpose.
Example: I lived in terror of her sudden caprices and moods.

Definition: Ornamental things have no practical function but are put in a place because they look attractive.
Example: ...ornamental trees.

Definition: Someone or something that is august is dignified and impressive.
Example: ...the august surroundings of the Liberal Club.

Definition: If you describe something as unbearable, you mean that it is so unpleasant, painful, or upsetting that you feel unable to accept it or deal with it.
Example: War has made life almost unbearable for the civilians remaining in the capital.

Definition: If you say that someone or something is insufferable, you are emphasizing that they are very unpleasant or annoying.
Example: He was an insufferable bore.

Definition: If you describe a bad situation as unendurable, you mean that it is so extremely unpleasant that you have to end it.
Example: Isaac had found the work unendurable and walked out of the job.

Definition: An incision is a sharp cut made in something, for example by a surgeon who is operating on a patient.
Example: The technique involves making a tiny incision in the skin.

Definition: A backwater is a place that is isolated.
Example: ...a quiet rural backwater.

Definition: In a house or other building, the landing is the area at the top of the staircase which has rooms leading off it.
Example: I ran out onto the landing.

Definition: Scorching or scorching hot weather or temperatures are very hot indeed.
Example: That race was run in scorching weather.

Definition: If you rephrase a question or statement, you ask it or say it again in a different way.
Example:
Holidays can be horrendous. All right, I'll rephrase that. The first few days are
always bad.

Definition: The foreword to a book is an introduction by the author or by someone else.
Example: He contributed articles, forewords, and photographs to a number of specialty magazines and books.

Definition: twisted together; messy or untidy
Example: Get tangled in her hair?

Definition: If you describe something or someone as unkempt, you mean that they are untidy, and not looked after carefully or kept neat.
Example: His hair was unkempt and filthy.

Definition: A knotty problem is complicated and difficult to solve.
Example: The new management team faces some knotty problems.

Definition: Something that is disorganized is in a confused state or is badly planned or managed.
Example: A report by the state prosecutor described the police action as confused and disorganised.

Definition: Slovenly people are careless, untidy, or inefficient.
Example: Lisa was irritated by the slovenly attitude of her boyfriend Sean.

Definition: Perseverance is the quality of continuing with something even though it is difficult.
Example: It took perseverance to discover where jobs were advertised.

Definition: Stamina is the physical or mental energy needed to do a tiring activity for a long time.
Example: You have to have a lot of stamina to be a top-class dancer.

Definition: If you describe someone as a halfwit, you think they have behaved in a stupid, silly, or irresponsible way.
A dummy is a model of a person, often used to display clothes.
Example: ...the bottom half of a shop-window dummy.

Definition: Horseplay is rough play in which people push and hit each other, or behave in a silly way.
Example: ...the childish splashing and horseplay Mark indulged in.

Definition: Buffoonery is foolish behaviour that makes you laugh.
Example: His amiable buffoonery was a hit with the children.

Definition: An imitator is someone who copies what someone else does, or copies the way they speak or behave.
Example: He doesn't take chances; that's why he's survived and most of his imitators haven't.

Definition: Distortion is the changing of something into something that is not true or not acceptable.
Example: It would be a distortion of reality to say that they were motivated by self-interest.

Definition: If you say that someone interferes in a situation, you mean they get involved in it although it does not concern them and their involvement is not wanted.
Example: I wish everyone would stop interfering and just leave me alone.

Definition: Appeasement means giving people what they want to prevent them from harming you or being angry with you.
Example: He denied there is a policy of appeasement.

Definition: Things that are interchangeable can be exchanged with each other without it making any difference.
Example: His greatest innovation was the use of interchangeable parts.

Definition: If you say that something is debatable, you mean that it is not certain.
Example: Whether we can stay in this situation is debatable.

Definition: A bribe is a sum of money or something valuable that one person offers or gives to another in order to persuade him or her to do something.
Example: He was being investigated for receiving bribes.

Definition: The payoff from an action is the advantage or benefit that you get from it.
Example: The payoffs from such a breakthrough would be enormous.

Definition: An enticement is something which makes people want to do a particular thing.
Example: We were seduced by the doorway enticement of hot cardamom buns.

Definition: When you chuck something somewhere, you throw it there in a casual or careless way.
Example: I took a great dislike to the clock, so I chucked it in the dustbin.

Definition: If something amuses you, it makes you want to laugh or smile.
Example: The thought seemed to amuse him.

Definition: Devastation is severe and widespread destruction or damage.
Example: A huge bomb blast brought chaos and devastation to the city yesterday.

Definition: Carnage is the violent killing of large numbers of people, especially in a war.
Example: ...a planned attempt to wreak carnage in a very busy town centre.

Definition: Genocide is the deliberate murder of a whole community or race.
Example: They have alleged that acts of genocide and torture were carried out.

Definition: If you describe someone as sycophantic, you disapprove of them because they flatter people who are more important and powerful than they are in order to gain an advantage for themselves.
Example: ...his clique of sycophantic friends.

Definition: If you say that someone is servile, you disapprove of them because they are too eager to obey someone or do things for them.
Example: He was subservient and servile.

Definition: If you describe someone as obsequious, you are criticizing them because they are too eager to help or agree with someone more important than them.
Example: Perhaps your mother was very obsequious to doctors.

Definition: If you refer to someone as a libertine, you mean that they are sexually immoral and do not care about the effect their behaviour has on other people.
Example: ...a self-confessed coward, libertine, and scoundrel.

Definition: You can refer to a rich man who spends most of his time enjoying himself as a playboy.
Example: Father was a rich playboy.

Definition: Someone who is profligate spends too much money or uses too much of something.
Example: ...the most profligate consumer of energy in the world.

Definition: Spit is the watery liquid produced in your mouth. You usually use spit to refer to an amount of it that has been forced out of someone's mouth.
Example: The gang thought of hitting him too, but decided just to spit.

Definition: If you tweak something, especially part of someone's body, you hold it between your finger and thumb and twist it or pull it.
Example: He tweaked Guy's ear roughly.

Definition: If you say that someone is griping, you mean they are annoying you because they keep on complaining about something.
Example: Why are football players griping when the average salary is half a million dollars?

Definition: Imperial is used to refer to things or people that are or were connected with an empire.
Example: ...the Imperial Palace in Tokyo.

Definition: A patrician is a person who comes from a family of high social rank.
Example: ...the patrician banker Sir Charles Villiers.

Definition: When you are out of doors, you are not inside a building, but in the open air.
Example: The weather was fine enough for working out of doors.

Definition: An argot is a special language used by a particular group of people, which other people find difficult to understand.
Example: ...the argot of teenagers.

Definition: a word, phrase, or expression
Example: Sherman ended with his customary locution: "The Blue Eye is open for business, ladies and gentlemen.

Definition: If you gabble, you say things so quickly that it is difficult for people to understand you.
Example: Marcello sat on his knee and gabbled excitedly.

Definition: Oars are long poles with a wide, flat blade at one end which are used for rowing a boat.
Example: Coaches often tell their rowers to use their weight at the end of the oars.

Definition: If you extol something or someone, you praise them enthusiastically.
Example: Now experts are extolling the virtues of the humble potato.

Definition: Pills are small solid round masses of medicine or vitamins that you swallow without chewing.
Example: Why do I have to take all these pills?

Definition: A capsule is a very small tube containing powdered or liquid medicine, which you swallow.
Example: ...cod liver oil capsules.

Definition: a small notebook
Example: I should have brought a second jotter.

Definition: Angular things have shapes that seem to contain a lot of straight lines and sharp points.
Example: He had an angular face with prominent cheekbones.

Definition: A person or animal that is emaciated is extremely thin and weak because of illness or lack of food.
Example: ...horrific television pictures of emaciated prisoners.

Definition: If someone looks gaunt, they look very thin, usually because they have been very ill or worried.
Example: Looking gaunt and tired, he denied there was anything to worry about.

Definition: If you describe something as regal, you mean that it is suitable for a king or queen, because it is very impressive or beautiful.
Example: He sat with such regal dignity.

Definition: Royal is used to indicate that something is connected with a king, queen, or emperor, or their family. A royal person is a king, queen, or emperor, or a member of their family.
Example: ...an invitation to a royal garden party.

Definition: To disprove an idea, belief, or theory means to show that it is not true.
Example: The statistics to prove or disprove his hypothesis will take years to collect.

Definition: If someone is unfaithful to their partner or to the person they are married to, they have a sexual relationship with someone else.
Example: James had been unfaithful to Christine for the entire four years they'd been together.

Definition:
A rabble-rouser is a clever speaker who can persuade a group of people to behave violently or aggressively, often for the speaker's own
political advantage.
Example: Certainly we never thought of him as a rabble-rouser - quite the reverse.

Definition: A rapturous feeling or reaction is one of extreme happiness or enthusiasm.
Example: The students gave him a rapturous welcome.

Definition: A purse is a very small bag that people, especially women, keep their money in.
Example: She reached in her purse for her phone.

Definition: If there is congestion in a place, the place is extremely crowded and blocked with traffic or people.
Example: The problems of traffic congestion will not disappear in a hurry.

Definition: Gridlock is the situation that exists when all the roads in a particular place are so full of vehicles that none of them can move.
Example: The streets are wedged solid with near-constant traffic gridlock.

Definition: A pamphlet is a very thin book, with a paper cover, which gives information about something.
Example: It was prompted by a friend who suggested that he should produce a plain English pamphlet on the subject.

Definition: If someone or something thrives, they do well and are successful, healthy, or strong.
Example: Today his company continues to thrive.

Definition: If you describe someone as intolerant, you mean that they do not accept behaviour and opinions that are different from their own.
Example: He was intolerant of both suggestions and criticisms.

Definition: If you describe someone as unworldly, you mean that they have not experienced many things in their life and do not know what sort of things usually happen to other people during their lives.
Example: She was so young, so unworldly.

Definition: A foible is a habit or characteristic that someone has which is considered rather strange, foolish, or bad but which is also considered unimportant.
Example: ...human foibles and weaknesses.

Definition: If you talk about the idiosyncrasies of someone or something, you are referring to their rather unusual habits or characteristics.
Example: Everyone has a few little idiosyncrasies.

Definition: If there is an imbalance in a situation, the things involved are not the same size, or are not the right size in proportion to each other.
Example: ...the imbalance between the two sides in this war.

Definition: If you describe someone's behaviour as unrestrained, you mean that it is extreme or intense, for example because they are expressing their feelings strongly or loudly.
Example: There was unrestrained joy on the faces of the people.

Definition: If you describe someone as undisciplined, you mean that they behave badly or in a disorganized way.
Example: ...a noisy and undisciplined group of students.

Definition: having suffered defeat; beaten
Example: The sky was clearing, and in the growing light the three of them looked sodden, dirty, and defeated.

Definition: When something is outlawed, it is made illegal.
Example: In 1975 gambling was outlawed.

Definition: A veil is a piece of thin soft cloth that women sometimes wear over their heads and which can also cover their face.
Example: She's got long fair hair, but she's got a veil over it.

Definition: A shroud is a cloth which is used for wrapping a dead body.
Example: ...a parked car huddled under a shroud of grey snow.

Definition: If something palls, it becomes less interesting or less enjoyable after a period of time.
Example: Already the allure of meals in restaurants had begun to pall.

Definition: If something is slipshod, it has been done in a careless way.
Example: The hotel had always been run in a slipshod way.

Definition: thieving
Example: Running cigarettes, stealing fresh vegetables, manufacturing vodka, enforcing protection.

Definition: Robbery is the crime of stealing money or property from a bank, shop, or vehicle, often by using force or threats.
Example: The gang members committed dozens of armed robberies.

Definition: Thieving is the act of stealing things from people.
Example: ...an ex-con who says he's given up thieving.

Definition: The pice de rsistance of a collection or series of things is the most impressive thing in it.
Example: The pice de rsistance, however, was a gold evening gown.

Definition: If you are submissive, you obey someone without arguing.
Example: Some doctors want their patients to be submissive.

Definition: A platitude is a statement which is considered meaningless and boring because it has been made many times before in similar situations.
Example: Why couldn't he say something original instead of spouting the same old platitudes?

Definition: A truism is a statement that is generally accepted as obviously true and is repeated so often that it has become boring.
Example: Orpington seems an example of the truism that nothing succeeds like success.

Definition: If you describe an action or decision as judicious, you approve of it because you think that it shows good judgment and sense.
Example: The President authorizes the judicious use of military force to protect our citizens.

Definition: If you describe something as immense, you mean that it is extremely large or great.
Example: ...an immense cloud of smoke.

Definition: If you describe something as limitless, you mean that there is or appears to be so much of it that it will never be exhausted.
Example: ...a cheap and potentially limitless supply of energy.

Definition: You can use untold to emphasize how bad or unpleasant something is.
Example:
The demise of the industry has caused untold misery to thousands of hard-working
tradesmen.

Definition: Something that is incalculable cannot be calculated or estimated because it is so great.
Example: He warned that the effects of any war would be incalculable.

Definition: A speck is a very small stain, mark, or shape.
Example: ...a speck of blood.

Definition: If you scoop a person or thing somewhere, you put your hands or arms under or round them and quickly move them there.
Example: Michael knelt next to her and scooped her into his arms.

Definition: A magnate is someone who has earned a lot of money from a particular business or industry.
Example: ...a multimillionaire shipping magnate.

Definition: An industrialist is a powerful businessman who owns or controls large industrial companies or factories.
Example: ...prominent Japanese industrialists.

Definition: If two people have sex, they perform the act of sex.
Example: Have you ever thought about having sex with someone other than your partner?

Definition: If you yawn, you open your mouth very wide and breathe in more air than usual, often when you are tired or when you are not interested in something.
Example: She yawned, and stretched lazily.

Definition: If you undervalue something or someone, you fail to recognize how valuable or important they are.
Example: We must never undervalue freedom.

Definition: If you understate something, you describe it in a way that suggests that it is less important or serious than it really is.
Example: The government chooses deliberately to understate the increase in prices.

Definition: If you belittle someone or something, you say or imply that they are unimportant or not very good.
Example: We mustn't belittle her outstanding achievement.

Definition: Balmy weather is fairly warm and pleasant.
Example: ...a balmy summer's evening.

Definition: Someone who is dispassionate is calm and reasonable, and not affected by emotions.
Example: We, as prosecutors, try to be dispassionate about the cases we bring.

Definition: If you mope, you feel miserable and do not feel interested in doing anything.
Example: Get on with life and don't sit back and mope.

Definition: A sprinkling of something is a small quantity or amount of it, especially if it is spread over a large area.
Example: ...a light sprinkling of snow.

Definition: A rhythmic movement or sound is repeated at regular intervals, forming a regular pattern or beat.
Example: Good breathing is slow, rhythmic and deep.

Definition: Something that is elegiac expresses or shows sadness.
Example: The music has a dreamy, elegiac quality.

Definition: A stunning person or thing is extremely beautiful or impressive.
Example: She was 55 and still a stunning woman.

Definition: To perforate something means to make a hole or holes in it.
Example: I refused to wear headphones because they can perforate your eardrums.

Definition: Aborigines are members of the tribes that were living in Australia when Europeans arrived there. This term could cause offence.
A hereditary characteristic or illness is passed on to a child from its parents before it is born.
Example: Cystic fibrosis is the commonest fatal hereditary disease.

Definition: Pristine things are extremely clean or new.
Example: Now the house is in pristine condition.

Definition: A virgin is someone who has never had sex.
Example: I was a virgin until I was thirty years old.

Definition: If you say that someone is implacable, you mean that they have very strong feelings of hostility or disapproval which nobody can change.
Example: ...the threat of invasion by a ruthless and implacable enemy.

Definition: Irony is a subtle form of humour which involves saying things that you do not mean.
Example: They find only irony in the narrator's concern.

Definition: You can describe extremely cruel actions as inhumanity.
Example: ...the inhumanity of war.

Definition: of, relating to, or promoting schism
Example: The job of a marketer is to cultivate this schismatic core, this broken soul, at the center of every product.

Definition: A belief or action that is heretical is one that most people think is wrong because it disagrees with beliefs that are generally accepted.
Example: I made the then heretical suggestion that it might be cheaper to design new machines.

Definition: A blackout is a period of time during a war in which towns and buildings are made dark so that they cannot be seen by enemy planes.
Example: ...blackout curtains.

Definition: Someone who is in a coma is in a state of deep unconsciousness.
Example: She was in a coma for seven weeks.

Definition: You can use unsuspecting to describe someone who is not at all aware of something that is happening or going to happen.
Example: They are charged with selling worthless junk bonds to unsuspecting depositors.

Definition: Something that is unintentional is not done deliberately, but happens by accident.
Example: Perhaps he had slightly misled them, but it was quite unintentional.

Definition: If you describe a person or their actions as unwitting, you mean that the person does something or is involved in something without realizing it.
Example: We're unwitting victims of the system.

Definition: An inadvertent action is one that you do without realizing what you are doing.
Example: The government has said it was an inadvertent error.

Definition: If something slackens or if you slacken it, it becomes slower, less active, or less intense.
Example: Inflationary pressures continued to slacken last month.

Definition: If you untie something that is tied to another thing or if you untie two things that are tied together, you remove the string or rope that holds them or that has been tied round them.
Example: Nicholas untied the boat from her mooring.

Definition: Someone who is talkative talks a lot.
Example: He suddenly became very talkative, his face slightly flushed, his eyes much brighter.

Definition: The incongruity of something is its strangeness when considered together with other aspects of a situation.
Example: She smiled at the incongruity of the question.

Definition: Dated things seem old-fashioned, although they may once have been fashionable or modern.
Example: ...people in dated dinner-jackets.

Definition: Something that is obsolete is no longer needed because something better has been invented.
Example: So much equipment becomes obsolete almost as soon as it's made.

Definition: If you are immune to a particular disease, you cannot be affected by it.
Example: This blood test will show whether or not you're immune to the disease.

Definition: If someone or something is dispensable they are not really needed.
Example: All those people in the middle are dispensable.

Definition: A defector is someone who leaves their country, political party, or other group, and joins an opposing country, party, or group.
Example: He was asked another question about defectors.

Definition: If a relationship or situation is on the mend after a difficult or unsuccessful period, it is improving.
Example: More evidence that the economy was on the mend was needed.

Definition: Incompatibility occurs where substances cannot act together or are antagonistic in their action.
Example: `And bearing in mind our temperamental incompatibility ," I said to Jon, ` even elaborate attempts to be

Definition: If you say that a fear, accusation, or story is groundless, you mean that it is not based on evidence and is unlikely to be true or valid.
Example: Fears that the world was about to run out of fuel proved groundless.

Definition: If you agree with something in principle, you agree in general terms to the idea of it, although you do not yet know the details or know if it will be possible.
Example: I agree with it in principle but I doubt if it will happen in practice.

Definition: If you put your thoughts down on paper, you write them down.
Example: It is important to get something down on paper.

Definition: Someone who is suggestible can be easily influenced by other people.
Example: ...highly suggestible and compliant individuals.

Definition: If you say that a person is versatile, you approve of them because they have many different skills.
Example: He had been one of the game's most versatile athletes.

Definition: Something that is resilient is strong and not easily damaged by being hit, stretched, or squeezed.
Example: Cotton is more resistant to being squashed and polyester is more resilient.

Definition: the state or quality of being resilient
Example: Official trade and manufacturing data yesterday underlined the resilience of the economy.

Definition: Someone who is agile can move quickly and easily.
Example: At 20 years old he was not as agile as he is now.

Definition: the quality of being plastic or able to be moulded
Example: The wretched features in front of her became sorrowful, something in their plasticity almost making a caricature of that emotion.

Definition: If you say that someone is malleable, you mean that they are easily influenced or controlled by other people.
Example: She was young enough to be malleable.

Definition: Complicity is involvement with other people in an illegal activity or plan.
Example:
Recently a number of policemen were sentenced to death for their complicity in the
murder.

Definition: A fort is a strong building or a place with a wall or fence around it where soldiers can stay and be safe from the enemy.
Example: Verdict: A solid man to hold the fort.

Definition: A fortress is a castle or other large strong building, or a well-protected place, which is intended to be difficult for enemies to enter.
Example: ...a 13th-century fortress.

Definition: Managerial means relating to the work of a manager.
Example: ...his managerial skills.

Definition: If an idea, argument, or reason is fallacious, it is wrong because it is based on a fallacy.
Example: Their main argument is fallacious.

Definition: If you say that something is breathtaking, you are emphasizing that it is extremely beautiful or amazing.
Example: The house has breathtaking views from every room.

Definition: A law, rule, or system that is in force exists or is being used.
Example: Under the law then in force he became a citizen of Jamaica but not a British citizen.

Definition: A mechanic is someone whose job is to repair and maintain machines and engines, especially car engines.
Example: If you smell gas fumes or burning, take the car to your mechanic.

Definition: You can use in reality to introduce a statement about the real nature of something, when it contrasts with something incorrect that has just been described.
Example: He came across as streetwise, but in reality he was not.

Definition: Photographic means connected with photographs or photography.
Example: ...photographic equipment.

Definition: If you entreat someone to do something, you ask them very politely and seriously to do it.
Example: Trevor entreated them to delay their departure.

Definition:
If you hone something, for example a skill, technique, idea, or product, you carefully develop it over a long period of time so that it
is exactly right for your purpose.
Example: Leading companies spend time and money on honing the skills of senior managers.

Definition: to sharpen, as by grinding or friction
Example: to whet the appetite

Definition: If an illness or a disease is catching, it is easily passed on or given to someone else.
Example: There are those who think eczema is catching.

Definition: the act of gratifying or the state of being gratified
Example: It was an early schooling in delayed gratification.

Definition: Contentment is a feeling of quiet happiness and satisfaction.
Example: I cannot describe the feeling of contentment that was with me at that time.

Definition: the quality of being insincere
Example: `You have it,' she said (a smiling vision of shameless insincerity ).

Definition: A sculpture is a work of art that is produced by carving or shaping stone, wood, clay, or other materials.
Example: ...stone sculptures of figures and animals.

Definition: A statue is a large sculpture of a person or an animal, made of stone or metal.
Example: The statues and the sculpture help to identify the sport.

Definition: Bureaucratic means involving complicated rules and procedures which can cause long delays.
Example: Diplomats believe that bureaucratic delays are inevitable.

Definition: Elation is a feeling of great happiness and excitement about something that has happened.
Example: His supporters have reacted to the news with elation.

Definition: If you describe an army or sports team as invincible, you believe that they cannot be defeated.
Example: When he is on form he is virtually invincible.

Definition: If you are disinclined to do something, you do not want to do it.
Example: He was disinclined to talk about himself, especially to his students.

Definition: If you say that you are not averse to something, you mean that you quite like it or quite want to do it.
Example: He's not averse to publicity, of the right kind.

Definition: Ill-treatment is harsh or cruel treatment.
Example: Penalties for ill-treatment of animals doubled in 2008.

Definition: Something that is faultless is perfect and has no mistakes at all.
Example: ...Mary Thomson's faultless and impressive performance on the show.

Definition: An allegorical story, poem, or painting uses allegory.
Example: Every Russian knows the allegorical novel The Master And Margarita.

Definition: If you use something as an illustrative example, or for illustrative purposes, you use it to show that what you are saying is true or to make your meaning clearer.
Example: A second illustrative example was taken from The Observer newspaper.

Definition: Something that is harmless does not have any bad effects, especially on people's health.
Example: Industry has been working at developing harmless substitutes for these gases.

Definition: If you describe food or drink as palatable, you mean that it tastes pleasant.
Example: ...flavourings and preservatives, designed to make the food look more palatable.

Definition: If food is juicy, it has a lot of juice in it and is very enjoyable to eat.
Example: ...a thick, juicy steak.

Definition: A backward movement or look is in the direction that your back is facing. Some people use backwards for this meaning.
Example: He turned and walked out without a backward glance.

Definition: If you talk about the legality of an action or situation, you are talking about whether it is legal or not.
Example: The auditor has questioned the legality of the contracts.

Definition: In Christian belief, the Resurrection is the event in which Jesus Christ came back to life after he had been killed.
Example: Old Cermit went frantic, set off a distress signal that brought a resurrection team from the Edge, and they brought her back.

Definition: Dissolution is the act of breaking up officially an organization or institution, or of formally ending a parliament.
Example: He stayed on until the dissolution of the firm in 1948.

Definition: Depraved actions, things, or people are morally bad or evil.
Example: ...a disturbing and depraved film.

Definition: Deviant behaviour or thinking is different from what people normally consider to be acceptable.
Example: ...the social reactions to deviant and criminal behaviour.

Definition: A resounding sound is loud and clear.
Example: There was a resounding slap as Andrew struck him violently across the face.

Definition: When you  wind down something such as the window of a car, you make it move downwards by turning a handle.
Example: Glass motioned to him to wind down the window.

Definition: If something  slows down or if something slows it down, it starts to move or happen more slowly.
Example: The car slowed down as they passed Customs.

Definition: The occupier of a house, flat, or piece of land is the person who lives or works there.
Example: There are more owner occupiers over here.

Definition: the ability to produce offspring, esp abundantly
Example: The results suggest that genetic problems which contribute to men seeking fertility treatment are passed on.

Definition: If you describe someone as an individualist, you mean that they like to think and do things in their own way, rather than imitating other people.
Example: Individualists say that you should be able to wear what you want.

Definition: If you demur, you say that you do not agree with something or will not do something that you have been asked to do.
Example: Hunt asked me to take over the whole operation. At first I demurred.

Definition: If you are shattered by something, you are extremely shocked and upset about it.
Example: It is desperately sad news and I am absolutely shattered to hear it.

Definition: If something such as a siren or radio blares or if you blare it, it makes a loud, unpleasant noise.
Example: The fire engines were just pulling up, sirens blaring.

Definition: If you are a stickler for something, you always demand or require it.
Example: I'm a bit of a stickler for accuracy.

Definition: A purist is a person who wants something to be totally correct or unchanged, especially something they know a lot about.
Example: The purists would prefer we played on grass, no matter the weather.

Definition: If something such as a course of action is impracticable, it is impossible to do.
Example: Such measures would be highly impracticable and almost impossible to apply.

Definition: If you describe someone's behaviour or a work of art as mannered, you dislike it because it is elaborate or formal, and therefore seems false or artificial.
Example: ...Naomi's mannered voice.

Definition: If you describe someone as pompous, you mean that they behave or speak in a very serious way because they think they are more important than they really are.
Example: He was somewhat pompous and had a high opinion of his own capabilities.

Definition: Pitted fruits have had their stones removed.
Example: ...green and black pitted olives.

Definition: Someone or something that is bouncy is very lively.
Example: She was bouncy and full of energy.

Definition: When water is choppy, there are a lot of small waves on it because there is a wind blowing.
Example: A gale was blowing and the sea was choppy.

Definition: Something that is disproportionate is surprising or unreasonable in amount or size, compared with something else.
Example: A disproportionate amount of time was devoted to one topic.

Definition: If you describe someone as unbalanced, you mean that they appear disturbed and upset or they seem to be slightly mad.
Example: I knew how unbalanced Paula had been since my uncle Peter died.

Definition: Something that is gritty contains grit, is covered with grit, or has a texture like that of grit.
Example: The sheets fell on the gritty floor, and she just let them lie.

Definition: A gravelly voice is low and rather rough and harsh.
Example: There's a triumphant note in his gravelly voice.

Definition: When a frog or bird croaks, it makes a harsh, low sound.
Example: Thousands of frogs croaked in the reeds by the riverbank.

Definition: A groom is the same as a bridegroom.
Example: ...the bride and groom.

Definition: If you agonize over something, you feel very anxious about it and spend a long time thinking about it.
Example: Perhaps he was agonizing over the moral issues involved.

Definition: A crow is a large black bird which makes a loud, harsh noise.
Example: The cock crows and the dawn chorus begins.

Definition: If you describe an artist or sports player as unheralded, you mean that people have not recognized their talent or ability.
Example:
They are inviting talented, but unheralded film-makers to submit examples of their
work.

Definition: An intermediary is a person who passes messages or proposals between two people or groups.
Example: She wanted him to act as an intermediary in the dispute with Moscow.

Definition: A go-between is a person who takes messages between people who are unable or unwilling to meet each other.
Example: He will act as a go-between to try and work out an agenda.

Definition: If you feel at home, you feel comfortable in the place or situation that you are in.
Example:
He spoke very good English and appeared pleased to see us, and we soon felt quite
at home.

Definition: To be disdainful means to dislike something or someone because you think they are unimportant or not worth your attention.
Example: He is highly disdainful of anything to do with the literary establishment.

Definition: Introspective people spend a lot of time examining their own thoughts, ideas, and feelings.
Example: He had been allowing himself to become gloomy and introspective.

Definition: If someone watches or listens with rapt attention, they are extremely interested or fascinated.
Example: I noticed that everyone was watching me with rapt attention.

Definition: Someone who is scrupulous takes great care to do what is fair, honest, or morally right.
Example: You're being very scrupulous, but to what end?

Definition: If you describe something as marginal, you mean that it is small or not very important.
Example: This is a marginal improvement on October.

Definition: A peripheral activity or issue is one which is not very important compared with other activities or issues.
Example: Companies are increasingly keen to contract out peripheral activities like training.

Definition: Celibacy is the state of being celibate.
The niceties of a situation are its details, especially with regard to good manners or the appropriate behaviour for that situation.
Example: By the end of term, girls will have learnt the niceties of dinner party conversation.

Definition: Acumen is the ability to make good judgments and quick decisions.
Example: His sharp business acumen meant he quickly rose to the top.

Definition: lack of confidence in oneself, marked by hesitation in asserting oneself; shyness
Example: For once his seeming diffidence was genuine, but quite unnecessary.

Definition: Bronze is a yellowish-brown metal which is a mixture of copper and tin.
Example:
The bronze statue of Mars is a copy of a famous statue found just outside Todi in
1837.

Definition: If you describe a physical attack, accident, or injury as horrific, you mean that it is very bad, so that people are shocked when they see it or think about it.
Example: I have never seen such horrific injuries.

Definition: A parasite is a small animal or plant that lives on or inside a larger animal or plant, and gets its food from it.
Example: They can also harbour a parasite that may cause a rare form of meningitis.

Definition: If you describe someone as an idler, you are criticizing them because you think they are lazy and should be working.
Example: The Duke resents being seen as a moneyed idler.

Definition: If someone is incoherent, they are talking in a confused and unclear way.
Example: As the evening progressed, he became increasingly incoherent.

Definition: Something that is incomprehensible is impossible to understand.
Example: Her speech was almost incomprehensible.

Definition: Unintelligible language is impossible to understand, for example because it is not written or pronounced clearly, or because its meaning is confused or complicated.
Example: He muttered something unintelligible.

Definition: An anthem is a song which is used to represent a particular nation, society, or group and which is sung on special occasions.
Example: The band played the Czech anthem.

Definition: A paean is a piece of music, writing, or film that expresses praise, admiration, or happiness.
Example: ...a paean to deep, passionate love.

Definition: upset or angry
Example: Lorelei considered for a couple of seconds, uttered a simple `No", and Felicity retired, dismissed but not apparently offended.

Definition: If you describe something that is written or said as long-winded, you are critical of it because it is longer than necessary.
Example: The manifesto is long-winded, repetitious and often ambiguous or poorly drafted.

Definition: Something that is infuriating annoys you very much.
Example: I was in the middle of typing when Robert rang. It was infuriating!

Definition: You use stinking to describe something that is unpleasant or bad.
Example: I had a stinking cold.

Definition: Snuff is powdered tobacco which people take by breathing it in quickly through their nose.
Example: He thought he was about to snuff it.

Definition: If you have an inkling of something, you have a vague idea about it.
Example: I had no inkling of his real purpose until much later.

Definition: If you describe something such as a towel or a toy animal as fluffy, you mean that it is very soft.
Example: ...fluffy white towels.

Definition: Something that is woolly is made of wool or looks like wool.
Example: She wore this woolly hat with pompoms.

Definition: Fleecy clothes, blankets, or other objects are made of a soft light material.
Example: ...fleecy walking jackets.

Definition: If something is feathery, it has an edge divided into a lot of thin parts so that it looks soft.
Example: The foliage was soft and feathery.

Definition: An impromptu action is one that you do without planning or organizing it in advance.
Example: This afternoon the Palestinians held an impromptu press conference.

Definition: wished for
Example: Feeling desired helps deal with the ravages of time.

Definition: An heir is someone who has the right to inherit a person's money, property, or title when that person dies.
Example: His heir, Lord Doune, cuts a bit of a dash in the city.

Definition: Someone who is a beneficiary of something is helped by it.
Example: There were many beneficiaries of this dramatic shift in Western politics.

Definition: The inheritors of something such as a tradition are the people who live or arrive after it has been established and are able to benefit from it.
Example: ...the proud inheritors of the Prussian military tradition.

Definition: An epic is a long book, poem, or film, whose story extends over a long period of time or tells of great events.
Example: ...the Middle High German epic, 'Nibelungenlied', written about 1200.

Definition: If you say that someone carries out instructions to the letter, you mean that they do exactly what they are told to do, paying great attention to every detail.
Example: She obeyed his instructions to the letter.

Definition: If you describe someone as unimaginative, you are criticizing them because they do not think of new methods or things to do.
Example: Her father was a steady, unimaginative, corporate lawyer.

Definition: If you say that someone is down-to-earth, you approve of the fact that they concern themselves with practical things and actions, rather than with abstract theories.
Example: Gloria is probably the most down to earth person I've ever met.

Definition: If you describe something as eerie, you mean that it seems strange and frightening, and makes you feel nervous.
Example: I walked down the eerie dark path.

Definition: Something that is ghostly seems unreal or unnatural and may be frightening because of this.
Example: The moon shone, shedding a ghostly light on the fields.

Definition: If one person is ogling another, they are continually staring at that person in a way that indicates a strong sexual interest.
Example: All she did was hang around ogling the men in the factory.

Definition: A country's armoury is all the weapons and military equipment that it has.
Example:
He threatened to open the country's armouries to loyal tribes in an attempt to hold
off the rebellion.

Definition: A whirlwind is a tall column of air which spins round and round very fast and moves across the land or sea.
Example: I had been running around southern England in a whirlwind of activity.

Definition: A typhoon is a very violent tropical storm.
Example: The wet season is also typhoon time.

Definition: If you narrate a story, you tell it from your own point of view.
Example: The three of them narrate the same events from three perspectives.

Definition: If you say that people are under the yoke of a bad thing or person, you mean they are forced to live in a difficult or unhappy state because of that thing or person.
Example: People are still suffering under the yoke of slavery.

Definition: If you are dispossessed of something that you own, especially land or buildings, it is taken away from you.
Example: ...people who were dispossessed of their land under apartheid.

Definition: If you congratulate someone, you say something to show you are pleased that something nice has happened to them.
Example: She congratulated him on the birth of his son.

Definition: If you malign someone, you say unpleasant and untrue things about them.
Example: We maligned him dreadfully when you come to think of it.

Definition: A well-built person has quite a big body and quite large muscles.
Example: Mitchell is well-built, of medium height, with a dark complexion.

Definition: Something that is intermittent happens occasionally rather than continuously.
Example: After three hours of intermittent rain, the game was abandoned.

Definition: You can use tyrant to refer to someone who treats the people they have authority over in a cruel and unfair way.
Example: Since 1804 the country has mostly been ruled by tyrants.

Definition: If someone is victimized, they are deliberately treated unfairly.
Example:
He felt the students had been victimized because they'd voiced opposition to the
government.

Definition: If you yank someone or something somewhere, you pull them there suddenly and with a lot of force.
Example: She yanked open the drawer.

Definition: Occupancy is the act of using a room, building, or area of land, usually for a fixed period of time.
Example: Hotel occupancy has been as low as 40%.

Definition: If you describe someone as vengeful, you are critical of them because they feel a great desire for revenge.
Example: The house is terrorised by vengeful ghosts.

Definition: If a person or animal limps, they walk with difficulty or in an uneven way because one of their legs or feet is hurt.
Example: I wasn't badly hurt, but I injured my thigh and had to limp.

Definition: An important person's retinue is the group of servants, friends, or assistants who go with them and look after their needs.
Example: Mind trainers are now part of a tennis star's retinue.

Definition: An underdeveloped country or region does not have modern industries and usually has a low standard of living. Some people prefer to use the term developing.
Example: Underdeveloped countries should be assisted by allowing them access to modern technology.

Definition: A serpent is a snake.
Example: ...the serpent in the Garden of Eden.

Definition: Wavy hair is not straight or curly, but curves slightly.
Example: She had short, wavy brown hair.

Definition: If you say that something or someone is revolting, you mean you think they are horrible and disgusting.
Example: The smell in the cell was revolting.

Definition: If you describe a situation or event as monstrous, you mean that it is extremely shocking or unfair.
Example: She endured the monstrous behaviour for years.

Definition: If you describe someone or something as undistinguished, you mean they are not attractive, interesting, or successful.
Example: ...his short and undistinguished career as an art student.

Definition: Someone who is ashen looks very pale, especially because they are ill, shocked, or frightened.
Example: He was ashen and trembling.

Definition: Something that is movable can be moved from one place or position to another.
Example: It's a vinyl doll with movable arms and legs.

Definition: lack of due respect or veneration; disrespect
Example: Norma was at first offended, irritated by his irreverence.

Definition: Someone who suffers from insomnia finds it difficult to sleep.
Example: And anyone suffering from chronic insomnia should avoid daytime naps.

Definition: A balloon is a small, thin, rubber bag that you blow air into so that it becomes larger and rounder or longer. Balloons are used as toys or decorations.
Example: She popped a balloon with her fork.

Definition: When you enlarge something or when it enlarges, it becomes bigger.
Example: ...the plan to enlarge Ewood Park into a 30,000 all-seater stadium.

Definition: If something such as clothing or cloth is embroidered with a design, the design is stitched into it.
Example: The collar was embroidered with very small red strawberries.

Definition: If one thing is incidental to another, it is less important than the other thing or is not a major part of it.
Example: The playing of music proved to be incidental to the main business of the evening.

Definition: You use incidentally to introduce a point which is not directly relevant to what you are saying, often a question or extra information that you have just thought of.
Example: 'I didn't ask you to come. Incidentally, why have you come?'

Definition: Someone who is diffident is rather shy and does not enjoy talking about themselves or being noticed by other people.
Example: Helen was diffident and reserved.

Definition: If you describe something or someone as horrible, you do not like them at all.
Example: The record sounds horrible.

Definition: If you say that someone grovels, you think they are behaving too respectfully towards another person, for example because they are frightened or because they want something.
Example: I don't grovel to anybody.

Definition: A hideaway is a place where you go to hide or to get away from other people.
Example: The bandits fled to a remote mountain hideaway.

Definition: If someone embezzles money that their organization or company has placed in their care, they take it and use it illegally for their own purposes.
Example: One former director embezzled $34 million in company funds.

Definition: Embezzlement is the crime of embezzling money.
Example: That doesn't include embezzlement and theft of public assets.

Definition: Crumbs are tiny pieces that fall from bread, biscuits, or cake when you cut it or eat it.
Example: I stood up, brushing crumbs from my trousers.

Definition: If you describe someone as a drifter, you mean that they do not stay in one place or in one job for very long.
Example: A drifter gets a job at a roadside diner, and soon embarks on an affair with the owner's wife.

Definition: A vagabond is someone who wanders from place to place and has no home or job.
Example: As far as he could see, there was no possible point of contact between the old importer and the young urban vagabond.

Definition: If you describe someone as a pariah, you mean that other people dislike them so much that they refuse to associate with them.
Example: His landlady had treated him like a dangerous criminal, a pariah.

Definition: If you describe something or someone as undesirable, you do not want them or you think they are harmful.
Example: We have come to view sweating as an undesirable and socially unacceptable activity.

Definition: A malformation in a person's body is a part which does not have the proper shape or form, especially when it has been like this since birth.
Example: ...babies with a high incidence of congenital malformations.

Definition: A disfigurement is something, for example a scar, that spoils a person's appearance.
Example: He had surgery to correct a facial disfigurement.

Definition: If you describe someone or their behaviour as immoral, you believe that their behaviour is morally wrong.
Example: ...those who think that birth control and abortion are immoral.

Definition: If something is unauthorized, it has been produced or is happening without official permission.
Example: ...a new unauthorized biography of the Russian President.

Definition: Embroidery consists of designs stitched into cloth.
Example: The shorts had blue embroidery over the pockets.

Definition: If someone uses hyperbole, they say or write things that make something sound much more impressive than it really is.
Example: ...the hyperbole that portrays him as one of the greatest visionaries in the world.

Definition: Magnification is the act or process of magnifying something.
Example: Pores are visible without magnification.

Definition: If you describe something as provocative, you mean that it is intended to make people react angrily or argue against it.
Example: He has made a string of outspoken and sometimes provocative speeches in recent years.

Definition: If you describe people, especially young people, as hooligans, you are critical of them because they behave in a noisy and violent way in a public place.
Example: ...riots involving football hooligans.

Definition: If you say that something is undeniable, you mean that it is definitely true.
Example: Her charm is undeniable.

Definition: A friar is a member of one of several Catholic religious orders.
Example: Spanish friars were called in to apply pressure.

Definition:
If you describe someone as puffed up, you disapprove of them because they are very proud of themselves and think that
they are very important.
Example: ...an insufferable woman so puffed up with her own importance.

Definition: If you describe someone as tactless, you think what they say or do is likely to offend other people.
Example: Throughout his school life Darius was tactless and egocentric.

Definition: An automated factory, office, or process uses machines to do the work instead of people.
Example: The equipment was made on highly automated production lines.

Definition: A robot is a machine which is programmed to move and perform certain tasks automatically.
Example: ...very lightweight robots that we could send to the moon for planetary exploration.

Definition: If you make an involuntary movement or exclamation, you make it suddenly and without intending to because you are unable to control yourself.
Example: Another surge of pain in my ankle caused me to give an involuntary shudder.

Definition: Precautionary actions are taken in order to prevent something dangerous or unpleasant from happening.
Example: The local administration says the curfew is a precautionary measure.

Definition: Protective means designed or intended to protect something or someone from harm.
Example: Protective gloves reduce the absorption of chemicals through the skin.

Definition: Remedial education is intended to improve a person's ability to read, write, or do mathematics, especially when they find these things difficult.
Example: ...children who required special remedial education.

Definition: If something is therapeutic, it helps you to relax or to feel better about things, especially about a situation that made you unhappy.
Example: Astanga Yoga is a therapeutic physical exercise that focuses on breathing and relaxation.

Definition: If you describe something as uncanny, you mean that it is strange and difficult to explain.
Example: ...proudly holding his new baby, who bears an uncanny resemblance to him.

Definition: Trivia is unimportant facts or details that are considered to be amusing rather than serious or useful.
Example: The two men chatted about such trivia as their favourite kinds of fast food.

Definition: If you describe something as unseen, you mean that it has not been seen for a long time.
Example: ...a spectacular ballroom, unseen by the public for over 30 years.

Definition: Something that is imperceptible is so small that it is not noticed or cannot be seen.
Example: Brian's hesitation was almost imperceptible.

Definition: incapable of being discerned
Example: Almost indiscernible on the bottom right hand corner of the stone were her initials: T. S.

Definition: If you are resigned to an unpleasant situation or fact, you accept it without complaining because you realize that you cannot change it.
Example: He is resigned to the noise and mess.

Definition: If you say that someone is compliant, you mean they willingly do what they are asked to do.
Example: She was much naughtier than her compliant brother.

Definition: of, relating to, resembling, or befitting a knight
Example: They were so insufferably sincere, these two, Septach Melayn in his elegant knightly way, Gialaurys in his own blunter style.

Definition: If you describe someone or something as intimidating, you mean that they are frightening and make people lose confidence.
Example: He was a huge, intimidating figure.

Definition: having feelings of dissatisfaction or lack of fulfilment
Example: His fingers are too stubby to get in the packet, and he gets all frustrated.

Definition: A pointer is a piece of advice or information which helps you to understand a situation or to find a way of making progress.
Example: I hope at least my daughter was able to offer you some useful pointers.

Definition: A spoken statement that is slanderous is untrue and intended to damage the reputation of the person that it refers to.
Example: He wanted an explanation for what he described as 'slanderous' remarks.

Definition: Scurrilous accusations or stories are untrue and unfair, and are likely to damage the reputation of the person that they relate to.
Example: Scurrilous and untrue stories were being invented.

Definition: Someone or something that is incongruous seems strange when considered together with other aspects of a situation.
Example: This seemed both incongruous and irritating against a background of severe poverty.

Definition: If you are  ill at ease, you feel rather uncomfortable, anxious, or worried.
Example:
He appeared embarrassed and ill at ease with the sustained applause that greeted
him.

Definition: A tyranny is a cruel, harsh, and unfair government in which a person or small group of people have power over everyone else.
Example: He described these regimes as tyrannies and dictatorships.

Definition: A villainous person is very bad and willing to harm other people or break the law in order to get what he or she wants.
Example: ...her villainous father.

Definition: An insoluble problem is so difficult that it is impossible to solve.
Example: I pushed the problem aside; at present it was insoluble.

Definition: If something happens or is done by design, someone does it deliberately, rather than by accident.
Example: The pair met oftenat first by chance but later by design.

Definition: A sentient being is capable of experiencing things through its senses.
Example: ...sentient creatures human and nonhuman alike.

Definition: If you describe something as unflattering, you mean that it makes a person or thing seem less attractive than they really are.
Example: He depicted the town's respectable families in an unflattering light.

Definition: Something that is poisonous will kill you or make you ill if you swallow or absorb it.
Example: All parts of the yew tree are poisonous, including the berries.

Definition: If you lug a heavy or awkward object somewhere, you carry it there with difficulty.
Example: Nobody wants to lug around huge suitcases full of clothes.

Definition: Discreditable behaviour is not acceptable because people consider it to be shameful and wrong.
Example: She had been suspended from her job for discreditable behaviour.

Definition: If you describe something as diverting, you mean that it is amusing or entertaining.
Example: It was a witty and diverting programme.

Definition: Your fingernails are the thin hard areas at the end of each of your fingers.
Example: Just imagine if your hair or fingernails grew that fast!

Definition: Your toenails are the thin hard areas at the end of each of your toes.
Example: One victim was strapped to a table while his fingernails and toenails were removed.

Definition: Your thumbnail is the nail on your thumb.
Example: a thumbnail sketch

Definition: A skewer is a long metal pin which is used to hold pieces of food together during cooking.
Example: She skewered the sardines through the mouth and put them onto the barbecue.

Definition: If a group of people show solidarity, they show support for each other or for another group, especially in political or international affairs.
Example: Supporters want to march tomorrow to show solidarity with their leaders.

Definition: If you are sidetracked by something, it makes you forget what you intended to do or say, and start instead doing or talking about a different thing.
Example: He'd managed to avoid being sidetracked by Schneider's problems.

Definition: Contortions are movements of your body or face into unusual shapes or positions.
Example: I had to admire the contortions of the gymnasts.
