Definition: If you surmise that something is true, you guess it from the available evidence, although you do not know for certain.
Example: There's so little to go on, we can only surmise what happened.

Definition: If you theorize that something is true or theorize about it, you develop an abstract idea or set of ideas about something in order to explain it.
Example: Police are theorizing that the killers may be posing as hitchhikers.

Definition: You use prearranged to indicate that something has been planned or arranged before the time when it actually happens.
Example:
Working to a prearranged plan, he rang the First Secretary and requested an appointment
with the Ambassador.

Definition: If you say that a statement, action, or idea is indefensible, you mean that it cannot be justified or supported because it is completely wrong or unacceptable.
Example: His action was indefensible.

Definition: If you say that something is inexcusable, you are emphasizing that it cannot be justified or tolerated because it is extremely bad.
Example: He said the killing of innocent people was inexcusable.

Definition: If you describe something as ambiguous, you mean that it is unclear or confusing because it can be understood in more than one way.
Example: This agreement is very ambiguous and open to various interpretations.

Definition: Sunk is the past participle of sink.
Example: Without him we'd be well and truly sunk.

Definition: Something that exists or happens underwater exists or happens below the surface of the sea, a river, or a lake.
Example: ...giant submarines able to travel at high speeds underwater.

Definition: Something that is bulky is large and heavy. Bulky things are often difficult to move or deal with.
Example: ...bulky items like lawn mowers.

Definition: Hefty means large in size, weight, or amount.
Example: She was quite a hefty woman.

Definition: If you describe something as burdensome, you mean it is worrying or hard to deal with.
Example: ...a burdensome debt.

Definition: Pirates are sailors who attack other ships and steal property from them.
Example: In the nineteenth century, pirates roamed the seas.

Definition: The crest of a hill or a wave is the top of it.
Example: The first wave of marchers crested the hill.

Definition: If you wince, the muscles of your face tighten suddenly because you have felt a pain or because you have just seen, heard, or remembered something unpleasant.
Example: Every time he put any weight on his left leg, he winced in pain.

Definition: If something is symptomatic of something else, especially something bad, it is a sign of it.
Example:
The city's problems are symptomatic of the crisis that is spreading throughout the
country.

Definition: If you describe someone as unselfish, you approve of the fact that they regard other people's wishes and interests as more important than their own.
Example: She started to get a reputation as an unselfish girl with a heart of gold.

Definition: If your behaviour or motives are altruistic, you show concern for the happiness and welfare of other people rather than for yourself.
Example: ...motives and ambitions that are not entirely altruistic.

Definition: If you describe someone as neglectful, you think they fail to do everything they should do to look after someone or something properly.
Example: ...neglectful parents.

Definition: A person's inattention is their lack of attention.
Example: Vital evidence had been lost through a moment's inattention.

Definition: Perspiration is the liquid which comes out on the surface of your skin when you are hot or frightened.
Example: His hands were wet with perspiration.

Definition: When you perspire, a liquid comes out on the surface of your skin, because you are hot or frightened.
Example: He began to perspire heavily.

Definition: Tautology is the use of different words to say the same thing twice in the same statement. 'The money should be adequate enough' is an example of tautology.
Example: But was not a theory of which all the elements were provably true a simple tautology ?

Definition: Something that is fragrant has a pleasant, sweet smell.
Example: ...fragrant oils and perfumes.

Definition: Something such as fruit or flowers that are perfumed have a sweet pleasant smell.
Example: ...perfumed English strawberries.

Definition: Something that is powdery looks or feels like powder.
Example: A couple of inches of dry, powdery snow had fallen.

Definition: easily broken up; crumbly
Example: He could not get over the notion that his body was made of some friable material, like Diane's hollow crystal cats.

Definition: Lawless actions break the law, especially in a wild and violent way.
Example: ...lawless behaviour.

Definition: Someone who is an aspirant to political power or to an important job has a strong desire to achieve it.
Example: ...the young aspirant to power.

Definition: An intermediate stage, level, or position is one that occurs between two other stages, levels, or positions.
Example: You should consider breaking the journey with intermediate stopovers at airport hotels.

Definition: the act or an instance of improvising
Example: There follows an extended improvisation on the theme of being at sea.

Definition: A messenger takes a message to someone, or takes messages regularly as their job.
Example: There will be a messenger at the airport to collect the photographs from our courier.

Definition: A runner is a person who runs, especially for sport or pleasure.
Example: ...a marathon runner.

Definition: If you squirm, you move your body from side to side, usually because you are nervous or uncomfortable.
Example: He had squirmed and wriggled and screeched when his father had washed his face.

Definition: If you describe something bad or unpleasant as never-ending, you are emphasizing that it seems to last a very long time.
Example: ...a never-ending series of scandals.

Definition: Something that is hard-wearing is strong and well-made so that it lasts for a long time and stays in good condition even though it is used a lot.
Example: ...hard-wearing cotton shirts.

Definition: Insouciance is lack of concern shown by someone about something which they might be expected to take more seriously.
Example: He replied with characteristic insouciance: 'So what?'

Definition: A person's unconcern is their lack of interest in or anxiety about something, often something that most people would be concerned about.
Example: She'd mentioned it casually once, surprising him by her unconcern.

Definition: If you ask for forgiveness, you ask to be forgiven for something wrong that you have done.
Example: I offered up a short prayer for forgiveness.

Definition: You can describe something as a boon when it makes life better or easier for someone.
Example: It is for this reason that television proves such a boon to so many people.

Definition: If you describe something as a godsend, you are emphasizing that it helps you very much.
Example: Pharmacists are a godsend when you don't feel sick enough to call the doctor.

Definition: Rapture is a feeling of extreme happiness or pleasure.
Example: The film was shown to gasps of rapture at the Democratic Convention.

Definition: If a liquid spatters a surface or you spatter a liquid over a surface, drops of the liquid fall on an area of the surface.
Example: He stared at the rain spattering on the glass.

Definition: If you describe someone as obnoxious, you think that they are very unpleasant.
Example: One of the parents was a most obnoxious character. No-one liked him.

Definition: On a misty day, there is a lot of mist in the air.
Example: It's a bit misty this morning.

Definition: Greed is the desire to have more of something, such as food or money, than is necessary or fair.
Example: ...an insatiable greed for personal power.

Definition: Avarice is extremely strong desire for money and possessions.
Example: He paid a month's rent in advance, just enough to satisfy the landlord's avarice.

Definition: Rapacity is very greedy or selfish behaviour.
Example: Overcrowded cities were the product of a system based on selfishness and rapacity.

Definition: Someone who is self-centred is only concerned with their own wants and needs and never thinks about other people.
Example: He was self-centred, but he wasn't cruel.

Definition: If you describe someone as self-interested, you disapprove of them because they always want to do what is best for themselves rather than for other people.
Example: ...self-interested behaviour.

Definition: Egotism is the quality of being egotistic.
Example: Obviously arrogance and egotism can get involved.

Definition: If you accuse someone of self-interest, you disapprove of them because they always want to do what is best for themselves rather than for anyone else.
Example: Their current protests are motivated purely by self-interest.

Definition: If you describe someone as oafish, you disapprove of their behaviour because you think that it is impolite, clumsy, or aggressive.
Example: The bodyguards, as usual, were brave but oafish.

Definition: If you say that someone is self-important, you disapprove of them because they behave as if they are more important than they really are.
Example: He was self-important, vain and ignorant.

Definition: Despotism is cruel and unfair government by a ruler or rulers who have a lot of power.
Example: We could use the power of enlightened despotism to crash women through the glass ceiling.

Definition: If you refer to an opinion as dogmatism, you are criticizing it for being strongly stated without considering all the relevant facts or other people's opinions.
Example: We cannot allow dogmatism to stand in the way of progress.

Definition: Someone who is pugnacious is always ready to quarrel or start a fight.
Example:
...the pugnacious little Scouse striker who terrorised defences across the North
West in a prolific playing career.

Definition: Caution is great care which you take in order to avoid possible danger.
Example: Extreme caution should be exercised when buying part-worn tyres.

Definition: A bonus is an extra amount of money that is added to someone's pay, usually because they have worked very hard.
Example: Workers receive a large part of their pay in the form of bonuses and overtime.

Definition: A leech is a small animal which looks like a worm and lives in water. Leeches feed by attaching themselves to other animals and sucking their blood.
Example: They're just a bunch of leeches cadging off others!

Definition: Maladministration is the act or process of running a system or organization incorrectly.
Example: ...a request to investigate a claim about maladministration.

Definition: deeply felt remorse; penitence
Example: Nothing could save him, for there was no contrition in his heart.

Definition: Glee is a feeling of happiness and excitement, often caused by someone else's misfortune.
Example: His victory was greeted with glee by his fellow American golfers.

Definition: When people or animals frolic, they play or move in a lively, happy way.
Example: Tourists sunbathe and frolic in the ocean.

Definition: Someone who is huffy is obviously annoyed or offended about something.
Example: I, in my turn, became embarrassed and huffy and told her to take the money back.

Definition: Someone who is petulant is unreasonably angry and upset in a childish way.
Example: His critics say he's just being silly and petulant.

Definition: If you say that you deplore something, you think it is very wrong or immoral.
Example: He's a judo black belt but he says he deplores violence.

Definition: If you bewail something, you express great sorrow about it.
Example: ...songs that bewail his dissatisfaction in love.

Definition: A sceptic is a person who has doubts about things that other people believe.
Example: He was a born sceptic.

Definition: If you refer to people as doubters, you mean that they have doubts about something, especially their religious or political system.
Example: Some doubters fear this news may not be as good as it appears.

Definition: A misanthrope is a person who does not like other people.
Example: One myth is that he was a grumbling misanthrope.

Definition: If something is paradoxical, it involves two facts or qualities which seem to contradict each other.
Example: Some sedatives produce the paradoxical effect of making the person more anxious.

Definition: If you are disenchanted with something, you are disappointed with it and no longer believe that it is good or worthwhile.
Example: I'm disenchanted with the state of British theatre at the moment.

Definition: marked by or resulting from despair; hopeless or desperate
Example: It is a world of fleeting and haunting memories, despairing hopes and uncanny epiphanies.

Definition: A trench is a long narrow channel that is cut into the ground, for example in order to lay pipes or get rid of water.
Example: We fought with them in the trenches.

Definition: The gutter is the edge of a road next to the pavement, where rain water collects and flows away.
Example: It is supposed to be washed down the gutter and into the city's vast sewerage system.

Definition: If someone who has had a serious disease such as cancer is in remission or if the disease is in remission, the disease has been controlled so that they are not as ill as they were.
Example: Brain scans have confirmed that the disease is in remission.

Definition: Altruism is unselfish concern for other people's happiness and welfare.
Example: This work is not just a show of altruism.

Definition: When people or small animals scamper somewhere, they move there quickly with small, light steps.
Example: Children scampered off the yellow school bus and into the playground.

Definition:
When a horse gallops, it runs very fast so that all four legs are off the ground at the same time. If
you gallop a horse, you make it gallop.
Example: The horses galloped away.

Definition: Sediment is solid material that settles at the bottom of a liquid, especially earth and pieces of rock that have been carried along and then left somewhere by water, ice, or wind.
Example: Many organisms that die in the sea are soon buried by sediment.

Definition: A residue of something is a small amount that remains after most of it has gone.
Example: Always using the same shampoo means that a residue can build up on the hair.

Definition: The instigator of an event is the person who causes it to happen.
Example: He was accused of being the main instigator of the coup.

Definition: If you describe someone involved in politics as an agitator, you disapprove of them because of the trouble they cause in organizing campaigns and protests.
Example: ...a famous filmmaker who was accused of being a political agitator.

Definition: A lubricant is a substance which you put on the surfaces or parts of something, especially something mechanical, to make the parts move smoothly.
Example: Its nozzle was smeared with some kind of lubricant.

Definition: If someone has a paunch, they have a fat stomach.
Example: He finished his dessert and patted his paunch.

Definition: Damned is used by some people to emphasize what they are saying, especially when they are angry or frustrated.
Example: The damned meeting seemed endless.

Definition: An antecedent of something happened or existed before it and was similar to it in some way.
Example: We shall first look briefly at the historical antecedents of this theory.

Definition: Your ancestors are the people from whom you are descended.
Example: ...our daily lives, so different from those of our ancestors.

Definition: A therapist is a person who is skilled in a particular type of therapy.
Example: My therapist helped me feel my anger.

Definition: If you say that someone is a layabout, you disapprove of them because they do not work and you think they are lazy.
Example: The plaintiff's sole witness, a gambler and layabout, was easily discredited.

Definition: a person who avoids work
Example: I am not a shirker, a scrounger, a beggar, nor a thief.

Definition: Loafers are flat leather shoes with no straps or laces.
Example: Just add flat loafers and a cute bag.

Definition: If you describe something as unwarranted, you are critical of it because there is no need or reason for it.
Example: Any attempt to discuss human rights was rejected as unwarranted interference.

Definition: If someone is obese, they are extremely fat.
Example: The tendency to become obese is at least in part hereditary.

Definition: not able to be recovered or regained
Example: This moment was marked as the beginning of an irrecoverable dive.

Definition: If you talk about irretrievable damage or an irretrievable situation, you mean that the damage or situation is so bad that there is no possibility of putting it right.
Example: What a tragedy if the sport suffers irretrievable damage because this issue is ducked.

Definition: If you are tenacious, you are very determined and do not give up easily.
Example: She is very tenacious and will work hard and long to achieve objectives.

Definition: If you describe a building or other place as impregnable, you mean that it cannot be broken into or captured.
Example: The old Dutch fort with its thick high walls looks virtually impregnable.

Definition: An antique is an old object such as a piece of china or furniture which is valuable because of its beauty or rarity.
Example: ...a genuine antique.

Definition: If you step in, you get involved in a difficult situation because you think you can or should help with it.
Example: If no agreement was reached, the army would step in.

Definition:
When you wink at someone, you look towards them and close one eye very briefly, usually as a signal that something is
a joke or a secret.
Example: Brian winked at his bride-to-be.

Definition: If someone renovates an old building, they repair and improve it and get it back into good condition.
Example: The couple spent thousands renovating the house.

Definition: A person or animal who is obedient does what they are told to do.
Example: He was very respectful at home and obedient to his parents.

Definition: Someone who is restrained is very calm and unemotional.
Example: In the circumstances he felt he'd been very restrained.

Definition: Brakes are devices in a vehicle that make it go slower or stop.
Example: The brakes began locking.

Definition: If you say that something will happen providing or providing that something else happens, you mean that the first thing will happen only if the second thing also happens.
Example: You can wear cut-off denim shorts, providing they are not too tight.

Definition: If you are relieved, you feel happy because something unpleasant has not happened or is no longer happening.
Example: We are all relieved to be back home.

Definition: If you are in debt or  get into debt, you owe money. If you are out of debt or get out of debt, you succeed in paying all the money that you owe.
Example: He was already deeply in debt through gambling losses.

Definition: If you feel obligated to do something, you feel that it is your duty to do it. If you are obligated to someone, you feel that it is your duty to look after them.
Example: I felt obligated to let him read the letter.

Definition: A condition, practice, or belief that is prevalent is common.
Example: This condition is more prevalent in women than in men.

Definition: If you are sleepy, you are very tired and are almost asleep.
Example: I was beginning to feel amazingly sleepy.

Definition: If you describe someone as irreverent, you mean that they do not show respect for people or things that are generally respected.
Example: She's irreverent, fun and hugely popular.

Definition: You use on the whole to indicate that what you are saying is true in general but may not be true in every case, or that you are giving a general opinion or summary of something.
Example: On the whole, people miss the opportunity to enjoy leisure.

Definition: If you describe something as colossal, you are emphasizing that it is very large.
Example: There has been a colossal waste of public money.

Definition: If something fizzles, it ends in a weak or disappointing way after starting off strongly.
Example: Our relationship fizzled into nothing.

Definition: (of a liquid) to give off bubbles of gas
Example: Moreover, the calcite alabaster, being a carbonate, effervesces upon being touched with hydrochloric acid, whereas the gypsum alabaster, when thus treated, remains practically unaffected.

Definition: To hiss means to make a sound like a long 's'.
Example: The tires of Lenny's bike hissed over the wet pavement as he slowed down.

Definition:
A totalitarian political system is one in which there is only one political party which controls
everything and does not allow any opposition parties.
Example: They feared that totalitarians might yet conquer the entire world.

Definition: An autocratic person or organization has complete power and makes decisions without asking anyone else's advice.
Example: The people have grown intolerant in recent weeks of the King's autocratic ways.

Definition: If you say that someone is domineering, you disapprove of them because you feel that they try to control other people without any consideration for their feelings or opinions.
Example: Mick was stubborn and domineering with a very bad temper.

Definition: If a building or room is airy, it has a lot of fresh air inside, usually because it is large.
Example: The bathroom has a light and airy feel.

Definition: If you are overjoyed, you are extremely pleased about something.
Example: Shelley was overjoyed to see me.

Definition: A congested road or area is extremely crowded and blocked with traffic or people.
Example: He first promised two weeks ago to clear Britain's congested roads.

Definition: congested
If you call someone a Scrooge, you disapprove of them because they are very mean and hate spending money.
Example: What a bunch of Scrooges.

Definition: If someone slouches, they sit or stand with their shoulders and head bent so they look lazy and unattractive.
Example: Try not to slouch when you are sitting down.

Definition: Something or someone that is mythical exists only in myths and is therefore imaginary.
Example: ...the Hydra, the mythical beast that had seven or more heads.

Definition: If you describe a person or thing as fabled, especially someone or something remarkable, you mean that they are well known because they are often talked about or a lot of stories are told about them.
Example: You cannot go home without visiting the fabled art collections of the Prado.

Definition: Kingly means like a king, or related to the duties of a king.
Example: ...a noble man, kingly in stature.

Definition: If you refer to an area as the backwoods, you mean that it is a long way from large towns and is isolated from modern life.
Example: ...the backwoods of Louisiana.

Definition: If you have tousled hair, it is untidy and looks as if it has not been brushed or combed.
Example: I imagined her springy muscles stretching and flexing, her hair tousled, her bedclothes rumpled.

Definition: Shaggy hair or fur is long and untidy.
Example: Tim has longish, shaggy hair.

Definition: If you have  staying power, you have the strength or determination to keep going until you reach the end of what you are doing.
Example: Someone who lacks staying power and persistence is unlikely to make a good researcher.

Definition: If you say that someone meddles in something, you are criticizing the fact that they try to influence or change it without being asked.
Example:
Already some people are asking whether scientists have any right to meddle in such
matters.

Definition: If you say that someone is butting in, you are criticizing the fact that they are joining in a conversation or activity without being asked to.
Example: Sorry, I don't mean to butt in.

Definition: Havoc is great disorder, and confusion.
Example: Rioters caused havoc in the centre of the town.

Definition: If you are subservient, you do whatever someone wants you to do.
Example: She is expected to be subservient to her uncle.

Definition: If you describe someone as a reprobate, you mean that they behave in a way that is not respectable or morally correct.
Example: ...a drunken reprobate.

Definition: A seducer is someone who seduces someone else.
Example: He has a bad reputation as a seducer of both men and women.

Definition: If you describe a man as a womanizer, you disapprove of him because he likes to have many short sexual relationships with women.
If you say that a man is a philanderer, you mean that he has a lot of casual sexual relationships.
Action that is wasteful uses too much of something valuable such as time, money, or energy.
Example: This kind of training is ineffective, and wasteful of scarce resources.

Definition: If something such as hot oil or fat sizzles, it makes hissing sounds.
Example: The sausages and burgers sizzled on the barbecue.

Definition: You use queenly to describe a woman's appearance or behaviour if she looks very dignified or behaves as if she is very important.
Example: She was a queenly, organizing type.

Definition: If you say that someone is gibbering, you mean that they are talking very fast and in a confused manner.
Example: Everyone is gibbering insanely, nerves frayed as showtime approaches.

Definition: Lozenges are sweets which you can suck to make a cough or sore throat better.
Example: ...throat lozenges.

Definition: If you describe something or someone as majestic, you think they are very beautiful, dignified, and impressive.
Example: ...a majestic country home that once belonged to the Astor family.

Definition: If you refute an argument, accusation, or theory, you prove that it is wrong or untrue.
Example: It was the kind of rumour that it is impossible to refute.

Definition: A handbag is a small bag which a woman uses to carry things such as her money and keys in when she goes out.
Example: Nature also affects the way you dress, the make-up you wear and the handbag you carry.

Definition: If a dispute or series of negotiations reaches deadlock, neither side is willing to give in at all and no agreement can be made.
Example:
They called for a compromise on all sides to break the deadlock in the world trade
talks.

Definition: Stalemate is a situation in which neither side in an argument or contest can win or in which no progress is possible.
Example: The President has ended the stalemate over cutting the country's budget deficit.

Definition: If people are in a difficult position in which it is impossible to make any progress, you can refer to the situation as an impasse.
Example: The company says it has reached an impasse in negotiations with the union.

Definition: Something that is circular is shaped like a circle.
Example: ...a circular hole twelve feet wide and two feet deep.

Definition: If people or businesses prosper, they are successful and do well.
Example: The high street banks continue to prosper.

Definition: If you describe a person or their behaviour as uninhibited, you mean that they express their opinions and feelings openly, and behave as they want to, without worrying what other people think.
Example: ...a commanding and uninhibited entertainer.

Definition: If you describe behaviour or feelings as unbridled, you mean that they are not controlled or limited in any way.
Example: ...the unbridled greed of the 1980s.

Definition: Robbers are sometimes called bandits, especially if they are found in areas where the rule of law has broken down.
Example: This is real bandit country.

Definition: A cloak is a long, loose, sleeveless piece of clothing which people used to wear over their other clothes when they went out.
Example: Today most of England will be under a cloak of thick mist.

Definition: If someone commits a burglary, they enter a building by force and steal things. Burglary is the act of doing this.
Example: An 11-year-old boy committed a burglary.

Definition: If you say that someone is light-fingered, you mean that they steal things.
Example: "But I do have designs on your... shall we say, light-fingered talents?

Definition: A showpiece is something that is admired because it is the best thing of its type, especially something that is intended to be impressive.
Example: The factory was to be a showpiece of Western investment in the East.

Definition: An axiom is a statement or idea which people accept as being true.
Example: ...the long-held axiom that education leads to higher income.

Definition: You use indescribable to emphasize that a quality or condition is very intense or extreme, and therefore cannot be properly described.
Example: ...her indescribable joy when it was confirmed her son was alive.

Definition: If you describe something as unspeakable, you are emphasizing that it is extremely unpleasant.
Example: ...the unspeakable horrors of chemical weapons.

Definition: A ladle is a large, round, deep spoon with a long handle, used for serving soup, stew, or sauce.
Example: Barry held the bowls while Liz ladled soup into them.

Definition: If you minimize a risk, problem, or unpleasant situation, you reduce it to the lowest possible level, or prevent it increasing beyond that level.
Example: Concerned people want to minimize the risk of developing cancer.

Definition: Periodic events or situations happen occasionally, at fairly regular intervals.
Example: Periodic checks are taken to ensure that high standards are maintained.

Definition: Nostalgic things cause you to think affectionately about the past.
Example:
Although we still depict nostalgic snow scenes on Christmas cards, winters are now
very much warmer.

Definition: Something that is staggering is very surprising.
Example: ...a three-year contract reputed to be worth a staggering 25,000-a-week.

Definition: Inbred means the same as inborn.
Example: She had that inbred politeness, it was a part of her.

Definition: If you describe someone or their words or ideas as iconoclastic, you mean that they contradict established beliefs.
Example: Is it utopian to hope that such iconoclastic ideas will gain ground?

Definition: If you describe someone as gullible, you mean they are easily tricked because they are too trusting.
Example:
What point is there in admitting that the stories fed to the gullible public were
false?

Definition: If you describe someone as loquacious, you mean that they talk a lot.
Example: The normally loquacious Mr O'Reilly has said little.

Definition: Someone who is chatty talks a lot in a friendly, informal way.
Example: She's quite a chatty person.

Definition: If you describe someone as garrulous, you mean that they talk a great deal, especially about unimportant things.
Example: ...a garrulous old woman.

Definition: If something provides indemnity, it provides insurance or protection against damage or loss.
Example: They were charged with failing to have professional indemnity cover.

Definition: An apostate is someone who has abandoned their religious faith, political loyalties, or principles.
Example: It says that by coming forward in public, it represents countless other apostates who fear coming out in public due to death threats.

Definition: If you describe an accusation, rumour, or report as baseless, you mean that it is not true and is not based on facts.
Example: The charges against her are baseless.

Definition: If you appear in print, or get into print, what you say or write is published in a book, newspaper, or magazine.
Example: Many of these poets appeared in print only long after their deaths.

Definition: the state or quality of being hardy
Example: The tasty flavour is more akin to spring greens and it has great winter hardiness.

Definition: Someone who is nimble is able to move their fingers, hands, or legs quickly and easily.
Example: Everything had been stitched by Molly's nimble fingers.

Definition: Connivance is a willingness to allow or assist something to happen even though you know it is wrong.
Example: The deficit had grown with the connivance of the banks.

Definition: If you say that a place or region is a stronghold of a particular attitude or belief, you mean that most people there share this attitude or belief.
Example: The western-most part of north Wales is a stronghold of Welsh-speakers.

Definition: In the past, a citadel was a strong building in or near a city, where people could shelter for safety.
Example: The citadel at Besanon towered above the river.

Definition: Supervisory means involved in supervising people, activities, or places.
Example: Most supervisory boards meet only twice a year.

Definition: Pictorial means using or relating to pictures.
Example: ...a pictorial history of the Special Air Service.

Definition: If you say that a description or account of something unpleasant is graphic, you are emphasizing that it is clear and detailed.
Example: The descriptions of sexual abuse are graphic.

Definition: A disease that is infectious can be caught by being near a person who has it. Compare contagious.
Example: ...infectious diseases such as measles.

Definition: A disease that is contagious can be caught by touching people or things that are infected with it. Compare infectious.
Example: ...a highly contagious disease of the lungs.

Definition: A communicable disease is one that can be passed on to other people.
Example: I feared that you might be going to tell me that the little upset had turned into something communicable.

Definition: If you bust something, you break it or damage it so badly that it cannot be used.
Example: They will have to bust the door to get him out.

Definition: If you describe something as unbeatable, you mean that it is the best thing of its kind.
Example: These resorts remain unbeatable in terms of price.

Definition: If you say that someone has an indomitable spirit, you admire them because they never give up or admit that they have been defeated.
Example: ...a woman of indomitable will.

Definition: You describe someone as unyielding when they have very strong, fixed ideas about something and are unlikely to change their mind.
Example: The authorities proved unyielding on one crucial opposition demand.

Definition: Descriptive language or writing indicates what someone or something is like.
Example: ...his descriptive way of writing.

Definition: Explanatory statements or theories are intended to make people understand something by describing it or giving the reasons for it.
Example: These statements are accompanied by a series of explanatory notes.

Definition: You use benign to describe someone who is kind, gentle, and harmless.
Example: They are normally a more benign audience.

Definition: Something that is innocuous is not at all harmful or offensive.
Example: Both mushrooms look innocuous but are in fact deadly.

Definition: If you describe someone or something as inoffensive, you mean that they are not unpleasant or unacceptable in any way, but are perhaps rather dull.
Example: He's a mild inoffensive man.

Definition: Something that is colourful has bright colours or a lot of different colours.
Example: The flowers were colourful and the scenery magnificent.

Definition: A sensational result, event, or situation is so remarkable that it causes great excitement and interest.
Example: The world champions suffered a sensational defeat.

Definition: A downward movement or look is directed towards a lower place or a lower level.
Example: ...a firm downward movement of the hands.

Definition: Primitive means belonging to a society in which people live in a very simple way, usually without industries or a writing system.
Example: ...studies of primitive societies.

Definition: Aberrant means unusual and not socially acceptable.
Example: Ian's rages and aberrant behavior worsened.

Definition:
A misfit is a person who is not easily accepted by other people, often because their behaviour is very different from that of everyone
else.
Example: I have been made to feel a social and psychological misfit for not wanting children.

Definition: If you say that something is out of the question, you are emphasizing that it is completely impossible or unacceptable.
Example: For the homeless, private medical care is simply out of the question.

Definition: If someone wheezes, they breathe with difficulty and make a whistling sound.
Example: He had quite serious problems with his chest and wheezed and coughed all the time.

Definition: A bridegroom is a man who is getting married or who has just got married.
Example: We and he are transformed from debtor and creditor into bride and bridegroom.

Definition: If someone is gloating, they are showing pleasure at their own success or at other people's failure in an arrogant and unpleasant way.
Example:
He had never been a malicious man, certainly not one to gloat over the tragedies
of others.

Definition: Unsung is used to describe people, things, or places that are not appreciated or praised, although you think they deserve to be.
Example: They are among the unsung heroes of our time.

Definition: If something happens or passes unnoticed, it is not seen or noticed by anyone.
Example: I tried to slip up the stairs unnoticed.

Definition: A middleman is a person or company which buys things from the people who produce them and sells them to the people who want to buy them.
Example: Why don't they cut out the middleman and let us do it ourselves?

Definition: Introverted people are quiet and shy and find it difficult to talk to other people.
Example: Machen was a lonely, introverted child.

Definition: Brooding is used to describe an atmosphere or feeling that makes you feel anxious or slightly afraid.
Example: The same heavy, brooding silence descended on them.

Definition: If you are spellbound by something or someone, you are so fascinated that you cannot think about anything else.
Example: His audience had listened like children, spellbound by his words.

Definition: Chastity is the state of not having sex with anyone, or of only having sex with your husband or wife.
Example: He took a vow of chastity and celibacy.

Definition: Virginity is the state of never having had sex.
Example: She lost her virginity when she was 20.

Definition: If writing or speech is indecipherable, you cannot understand what the words are.
Example: Maggie's writing was virtually indecipherable.

Definition: The recipient of something is the person who receives it.
Example: ...the largest recipient of American foreign aid.

Definition: Something that is prosaic is dull and uninteresting.
Example: His instructor offered a more prosaic explanation for the surge in interest.

Definition: If you describe something as banal, you do not like it because you think that it is so ordinary that it is not at all effective or interesting.
Example: The text is banal.

Definition: If you describe something or someone as uninspired, you are criticizing them because they do not seem to have any original or exciting qualities.
Example: The script was singularly uninspired.

Definition: A storyteller is someone who tells or writes stories.
Example: He was the one who first set down the stories of the Celtic storytellers.

Definition: to wish joy to; congratulate
Example: Time to time the organizers also felicitate young and famous talents from different places.

Definition: Libel is a written statement which wrongly accuses someone of something, and which is therefore against the law. Compare slander.
Example: Warren sued him for libel over the remarks.

Definition: A burly man has a broad body and strong muscles.
Example: He was a big, burly man.

Definition: A dictator is a ruler who has complete power in a country, especially power which was obtained by force and is used unfairly or cruelly.
Example: He would bring the same kind of economic stagnation, internal turmoil and discord to our country that other dictators bring to theirs.

Definition: If you hobble, you walk in an awkward way with small steps, for example because your foot is injured.
Example: He got up slowly and hobbled over to the coffee table.

Definition: If you shuffle somewhere, you walk there without lifting your feet properly off the ground.
Example: Moira shuffled across the kitchen.

Definition: Something that is floppy is loose rather than stiff, and tends to hang downwards.
Example: ...the girl with the floppy hat and glasses.

Definition: Curly hair is full of curls.
Example: I've got naturally curly hair.

Definition: If you describe something as unnatural, you mean that it is strange and often frightening, because it is different from what you normally expect.
Example: The aircraft rose with unnatural speed on take-off.

Definition: A portable machine or device is designed to be easily carried or moved.
Example: There was a little portable television switched on behind the bar.

Definition: An airship is an aircraft that consists of a large balloon which is filled with gas and is powered by an engine. It has a section underneath for passengers.
Example: The airship's skeleton remained sufficiently intact for engineers to use the design in British airships.

Definition: You say by the way when you add something to what you are saying, especially something that you have just thought of.
Example: The name Latifah, by the way, means 'delicate'.

Definition: If you mention something in passing, you mention it briefly while you are talking or writing about something else.
Example: In passing, it should be noted that.

Definition:
in passing: in chess, said of capturing a pawn that has made an initial move of two squares to its fourth rank, bypassing the square where an enemy pawn on its own fifth rank could capture it. The capture is made as if the captured pawn had moved one
square instead of two
Example: En passant, he spoke about the deaths of Caporelli and the others.

Definition: A wanderer is a person who travels around rather than settling in one place.
Example: Wanderers boss to get automatic promotion for the club.

Definition: An unwelcome experience is one that you do not like and did not want.
Example: The media has brought more unwelcome attention to the Royal Family.

Definition: Something that is disagreeable is rather unpleasant.
Example: ...a disagreeable odour.

Definition: If you describe someone or something as objectionable, you consider them to be extremely offensive and unacceptable.
Example: I don't like your tone young woman, in fact I find it highly objectionable.

Definition: Sewing is the activity of making or mending clothes or other things using a needle and thread.
Example: Her mother had always done all the sewing.

Definition: Needlework is sewing or stitching that is done by hand.
Example: She did beautiful needlework and she embroidered table napkins.

Definition: A vandal is someone who deliberately damages things, especially public property.
Example:
All information systems that have been fitted at Ashford station have now been destroyed
by vandals.

Definition: You can use undoubted to emphasize that something exists or is true.
Example: The event was an undoubted success.

Definition: conceited
If you accuse someone of being inconsiderate, you mean that they do not take enough care over how their words or actions will affect other people.
Example: Motorists were criticised for being inconsiderate to pedestrians.

Definition: In science fiction books and films, an android is a robot that looks like a human being.
Example: Most of the tweets that have made headlines are from the Android device.

Definition: Motherly feelings or actions are like those of a kind mother.
Example: It was an incredible display of motherly love and forgiveness.

Definition: Fatherly feelings or actions are like those of a kind father.
Example: His voice filled with fatherly concern.

Definition: Something that has curative properties can cure people's illnesses.
Example: Ancient civilizations believed in the curative powers of fresh air and sunlight.

Definition: Something that is reactive is able to react chemically with a lot of different substances.
Example: Ozone is a highly reactive form of oxygen gas.

Definition: The minutiae of something such as someone's job or life are the very small details of it.
Example: Much of his early work is concerned with the minutiae of rural life.

Definition: If something happens little by little, it happens very gradually.
Example: In the beginning he had felt well, but little by little he was becoming weaker.

Definition: If you say that someone behaves in a stoical way, you approve of them because they do not complain or show they are upset in bad situations.
Example: He never made excuses, maintaining a stoical silence.

Definition: Someone who is long-suffering patiently puts up with a lot of trouble or unhappiness, especially when it is caused by someone else.
Example: He went back to Yorkshire to join his loyal, long-suffering wife.

Definition: Speech or writing that is defamatory is likely to damage someone's good reputation by saying something bad and untrue about them.
Example: The article was highly defamatory.

Definition: If a statement in a book, newspaper, or magazine is libellous, it wrongly accuses someone of something, and is therefore against the law.
Example: He claimed the articles were libellous and damaging to the interests of the team.

Definition: Dictatorship is government by a dictator.
Example: ...a new era of democracy after a long period of military dictatorship in the country.

Definition: If something is inexplicable, you cannot explain why it happens or why it is true.
Example: His behaviour was extraordinary and inexplicable.

Definition: If you describe someone or something as unprepossessing, you mean that they look rather plain or ordinary, although they may have good or special qualities that are hidden.
Example: We found the tastiest food in the most unprepossessing bars and cafs.

Definition: A toxic substance is poisonous.
Example: ...the cost of cleaning up toxic waste.

Definition: To impale something on a pointed object means to cause the point to go into it or through it.
Example: Researchers observed one bird impale a rodent on a cactus.

Definition: Convolutions are curves on an object or design that has a lot of curves.
Example: ...the thorny convolutions of love.

Definition: If you say that something is unforgivable, you mean that it is very bad, cruel, or socially unacceptable.
Example: What they did was unforgivable.

Definition: If you describe an action, especially one that harms someone, as unjustifiable, you mean there is no good reason for it.
Example: Using these missiles to down civilian aircraft is simply immoral and totally unjustifiable.

Definition: A buccaneer was a pirate. Buccaneers often attacked and stole from Spanish ships in the 17th and 18th centuries.
Example: Perhaps the deals did not suit the buccaneering English style.

Definition: a person who roves; wanderer
Example: The wild rover, indeed, of song and legend.

Definition: A filibuster is a long slow speech made to use up time so that a vote cannot be taken and a law cannot be passed.
Example: The senator has threatened a filibuster to block the bill.

Definition: Bootleg is used to describe something that is made secretly and sold illegally.
Example: ...a bootleg recording of the band's tour of Scandinavia.

Definition: A plume of smoke, dust, fire, or water is a large quantity of it that rises into the air in a column.
Example: The rising plume of black smoke could be seen all over Kabul.

Definition: An insignia is a design or symbol which shows that a person or object belongs to a particular organization, often a military one.
Example: The red star was the national insignia of the USSR.

Definition: If something is redolent of something else, it has features that make you think of that other thing.
Example: ...percussion instruments, redolent of Far Eastern cultures.

Definition: Scented things have a pleasant smell, either naturally or because perfume has been added to them.
Example: The white flowers are pleasantly scented.

Definition: If places, roads, or other things outside are dusty, they are covered with tiny bits of earth or sand, usually because it has not rained for a long time.
Example: They started strolling down the dusty road in the moonlight.

Definition: If you describe a situation as anarchy, you mean that nobody seems to be paying any attention to rules or laws.
Example: Civil war and famine sent the nation plunging into anarchy.

Definition:
Halfway means in the middle of a place or between two points, at an equal distance from each
of them.
Example: Half-way across the car-park, he noticed she was walking with her eyes closed.

Definition: If you wriggle or wriggle part of your body, you twist and turn with quick movements, for example because you are uncomfortable.
Example: The babies are wriggling on their tummies.

Definition: the state or quality of being nonchalant
Example: Adrina rode up beside Damin, assuming an air of nonchalance.

Definition: the quality or condition of being fresh, light, or breezy
Example: I'd used a pale celadon glaze, trying to match with color the airiness and delicacy of the pieces.

Definition: If someone is given absolution, they are forgiven for something wrong that they have done.
Example: She felt as if his words had granted her absolution.

Definition: If you describe someone or something as loathsome, you are indicating how much you dislike them or how much they disgust you.
Example: ...the loathsome spectacle we were obliged to witness.

Definition: When it is foggy, there is fog.
Example: It's quite foggy now.

Definition: Penny-pinching is the practice of trying to spend as little money as possible.
Example: Government penny-pinching is blamed for the decline in food standards.

Definition: If you describe someone as narcissistic, you disapprove of them because they think about themselves a lot and admire themselves too much.
Example: He was insufferable at timesself-centred and narcissistic.

Definition: If you admonish someone, you tell them very seriously that they have done something wrong.
Example: They admonished me for taking risks with my health.

Definition: If you refer to someone's government of a country as misrule, you are critical of them for governing their country badly or unfairly.
Example: He was arrested last December, accused of corruption and misrule.

Definition: A lark is a small brown bird which makes a pleasant sound.
Example: The children thought it was a great lark.

Definition: An agnostic believes that it is not possible to know whether God exists or not. Compare atheist.
Example:
You grew up in an agnostic household and have never been able to bring yourself to
believe in God.

Definition: A grouch is someone who is always complaining in a bad-tempered way.
Example: He's an old grouch but she puts up with him.

Definition: The dregs of a liquid are the last drops left at the bottom of a container, together with any solid bits that have sunk to the bottom.
Example: Colum drained the dregs from his cup.

Definition: the sediment from an alcoholic drink
Example: In the dining-hall, much the same applied to the patients, male and female: the lees of summer were clearly read on their countenances.

Definition: Your forefathers are your ancestors, especially your male ancestors.
Example: They were determined to go back to the land of their forefathers.

Definition: If a star or a light twinkles, it shines with an unsteady light which rapidly and constantly changes from bright to faint.
Example: At night, lights twinkle in distant villages across the valleys.

Definition: To refurbish a building or room means to clean it and decorate it and make it more attractive or better equipped.
Example: We have spent money on refurbishing the offices.

Definition: If you describe something or someone as unobtrusive, you mean that they are not easily noticed or do not draw attention to themselves.
Example: The coffee table is glass, to be as unobtrusive as possible.

Definition: When a vehicle or machine decelerates or when someone in a vehicle decelerates, the speed of the vehicle or machine is reduced.
Example: ...the sensation of the train decelerating.

Definition: If there is a predominance of one type of person or thing, there are many more of that type than of any other type.
Example: Another interesting note was the predominance of London club players.

Definition: If you feel drowsy, you feel sleepy and cannot think clearly.
Example: He felt pleasantly drowsy and had to fight off the urge to sleep.

Definition: If someone talks or behaves in a rather impolite and disrespectful way, you can say that they are being impertinent.
Example: Would it be impertinent to ask where exactly you were?

Definition: An all-powerful person or organization has the power to do anything they want.
Example: ...the all-powerful labour unions.

Definition: An overbearing person tries to make other people do what he or she wants in an unpleasant and forceful way.
Example: He can be quite overbearing with his staff.

Definition: If you do something gaily, you do it in a lively, happy way.
Example: Magda laughed gaily.

Definition: If you describe someone as a skinflint, you are saying that they are a mean person who hates spending money.
If you sprawl somewhere, you sit or lie down with your legs and arms spread out in a careless way.
Example: She sprawled on the bed as he had left her, not even moving to cover herself up.

Definition: If you describe something as fabulous, you are emphasizing that you like it a lot or think that it is very good.
Example: This is a fabulous album. It's fresh, varied, fun.

Definition: If people, places, or things are famed for a particular thing, they are very well known for it.
Example: The city is famed for its outdoor restaurants.

Definition: If you describe someone's hair, clothes, or appearance as dishevelled, you mean that it is very untidy.
Example: She arrived flushed and dishevelled.

Definition: Someone or something that is hairy is covered with hairs.
Example: He was wearing shorts which showed his long, muscular, hairy legs.

Definition: If someone tampers with something, they interfere with it or try to change it when they have no right to do so.
Example: I don't want to be accused of tampering with the evidence.

Definition: Someone who is deferential is polite and respectful towards someone else.
Example: They like five-star hotels and deferential treatment.

Definition: If you describe a man as a  Don Juan, you mean he has had sex with many women.
Example: I'm sorry I'm not a professional Don Juan but I'm not normally that bad.

Definition: You can describe someone as a prodigal son or daughter if they leave their family or friends, often after a period of behaving badly, and then return at a later time as a better person.
Example: ...the parable of the prodigal son.

Definition: If a street is a dead end, there is no way out at one end of it.
Example: Waitressing was a dead-end job.

Definition: A showcase is a glass container with valuable objects inside it, for example at an exhibition or in a museum.
Example: The festival remains a valuable showcase for new talent.

Definition: A maxim is a rule for good or sensible behaviour, especially one in the form of a saying.
Example: I believe in the maxim 'if it ain't broke, don't fix it'.

Definition: You can use unutterable to emphasize that something, especially a bad quality, is great in degree or intensity.
Example: I am at the beginning of a new and unutterable loneliness.

Definition: An indefinable quality or feeling cannot easily be described.
Example: There was something indefinable in her eyes.

Definition: You use ineffable to say that something is so great or extreme that it cannot be described in words.
Example: ...the ineffable sadness of many of the portraits.

Definition: A recurrent event or feeling happens or is experienced more than once.
Example: Race is a recurrent theme in the work.

Definition: Credulity is a willingness to believe that something is real or true.
Example: The plot does stretch credulity.

Definition: If a system or organization is described as a bastion of a particular way of life, it is seen as being important and effective in defending that way of life. Bastion can be used both when you think that this way of life should be ended and when you think it should be defended.
Example: ...a town which had been a bastion of White prejudice.

Definition: (of a book, text, etc) decorated with or making use of pictures
Example: Within the week these photographs would appear in various illustrated magazines.

Definition: A woman's breasts are sometimes referred to as her bosom or her bosoms.
Example: ...a large young mother with a baby resting against her ample bosom.

Definition: You can use matchless to emphasize that you think something is extremely good.
Example: A timeless comic actorhis simplicity and his apparent ease are matchless.

Definition: not able to be overcome or defeated
Example: Their names mean he who wards off war and the unconquerable one respectively.

Definition: A picturesque place is attractive and interesting, and has no ugly or modern buildings.
Example: Alte, in the hills northwest of Loule, is the Algarve's most picturesque village.

Definition: If you describe someone's behaviour as uncivilized, you find it unacceptable, for example because it is very cruel or very rude.
Example: The campaign has abounded in mutual accusations of uncivilised behaviour.

Definition: If you describe someone's behaviour as barbaric, you strongly disapprove of it because you think that it is extremely cruel or uncivilized.
Example: This barbaric treatment of animals has no place in any decent society.

Definition: When you cough, you force air out of your throat with a sudden, harsh noise. You often cough when you are ill, or when you are nervous or want to attract someone's attention.
Example: Graham began to cough violently.

Definition: Writing that is illegible is so unclear that you cannot read it.
Example: Halfway down the second page, my handwriting becomes illegible.

Definition: If one thing is indistinguishable from another, the two things are so similar that it is difficult to know which is which.
Example: Replica weapons are indistinguishable from the real thing.

Definition: If you use unreadable to describe a book or other piece of writing, you are criticizing it because it is very boring, complicated, or difficult to understand.
Example: For some this is the greatest novel in the world. For others it is unreadable.

Definition: a person to whom a legacy is bequeathed
Example: Well, half to me and half to Dane, but of course I was Dane's sole legatee.

Definition: A raconteur is someone who can tell stories in an interesting or amusing way.
Example: He spoke eight languages and was a noted raconteur.

Definition: Defamation is the damaging of someone's good reputation by saying something bad and untrue about them.
Example: He sued for defamation.

Definition: Slander is an untrue spoken statement about someone which is intended to damage their reputation. Compare libel.
Example: Dr. Bach is now suing the company for slander.

Definition: If someone defames another person or thing, they say bad and untrue things about them.
Example: Sgt Norwood complained that the article defamed him.

Definition: Someone who is brawny is strong and has big muscles.
Example: ...a brawny young man.

Definition: A despot is a ruler or other person who has a lot of power and who uses it unfairly or cruelly.
Example: I mentioned earlier their hopes of influencing enlightened despots.

Definition: If you shamble somewhere, you walk clumsily, pulling your feet along the ground.
Example: The conductor shambled to the next carriage.

Definition: Lumber consists of trees and large pieces of wood that have been roughly cut up.
Example: It was made of soft lumber, spruce by the look of it.

Definition: If you describe something as droopy, you mean that it hangs down with no strength or firmness.
Example: ...a tall man with a droopy moustache.

Definition: A nomad is a member of a group of people who travel from place to place rather than living in one place all the time.
Example: ...a country of nomads who raise cattle and camels.

Definition: If something or someone is unpopular, most people do not like them.
Example: It was a painful and unpopular decision.

Definition: naturally unpleasant and mean
Example: When he smiled, which was surprisingly often, he succeeded only in looking conspiratorial and ill-natured.

Definition: When people are rowdy, they are noisy, rough, and likely to cause trouble.
Example: He has complained to the police about rowdy neighbours.

Definition: Maternal is used to describe feelings or actions which are typical of those of a kind mother towards her child.
Example: She had little maternal instinct.

Definition: Paternal is used to describe feelings or actions which are typical of those of a kind father towards his child.
Example: ...paternal love for his children.

Definition: If you do something  step by step, you do it by progressing gradually from one stage to the next.
Example: I am not rushing things and I'm taking it step by step.

Definition: Someone who is phlegmatic stays calm even when upsetting or exciting things happen.
Example: ...a most phlegmatic man, steadily working on as the rain splashed down.

Definition: Autocracy is government or control by one person who has complete power.
Example: Many poor countries are abandoning autocracy.

Definition: Something that is unaccountable does not seem to have any sensible explanation.
Example: For some unaccountable reason, it struck me as extremely funny.

Definition: If you say that someone's behaviour is unpardonable, you mean that it is very wrong or offensive, and completely unacceptable.
Example: ...an unpardonable lack of discipline.

Definition: A bird's feathers are the soft covering on its body. Each feather consists of a lot of smooth hairs on each side of a thin stiff centre.
Example: ...a hat that she had made herself from black ostrich feathers.

Definition: If you are pinioned, someone prevents you from moving or escaping, especially by holding or tying your arms.
Example: His wrists were pinioned tightly behind his back.

Definition: If you say that one thing is reminiscent of another, you mean that it reminds you of it.
Example: The decor was reminiscent of a municipal arts-and-leisure centre.

Definition: If you describe something as evocative, you mean that it is good or interesting because it produces pleasant memories, ideas, emotions, and responses in people.
Example: Her story is sharply evocative of Italian provincial life.

Definition: A grubby person or object is rather dirty.
Example: His white coat was grubby and stained.

Definition: Something that is unclean is dirty and likely to cause disease.
Example: ...the Western attitude to insects as being dirty and unclean.

Definition: If something is midway between two places, it is between them and the same distance from each of them.
Example: The studio is midway between his aunt's old home and his cottage.

Definition: If you wiggle something or if it wiggles, it moves up and down or from side to side in small quick movements.
Example: She wiggled her finger.

Definition: When a dog wags its tail, it repeatedly waves its tail from side to side.
Example: The dog was biting, growling and wagging its tail.

Definition: Someone or something that is hateful is extremely bad or unpleasant.
Example: I'm sorry. That was a hateful thing to say.

Definition: A prank is a childish trick.
Example: It's a prank gone wrong'.

Definition: Someone who is inconspicuous does not attract attention to themselves.
Example: I'll try to be as inconspicuous as possible.

Definition: a sleepy quality or state
Example: Helen tried to remember, fighting off the dizzy sleepiness.

Definition: Someone or something that is omnipotent has complete power over things or people.
Example: Doug lived in the shadow of his seemingly omnipotent father.

Definition: If you loll somewhere, you sit or lie in a very relaxed position.
Example: He was lolling on the sofa in the shadows near the fire.

Definition: A saying is a sentence that people often say and that gives advice or information about human life and experience.
Example: We also realize the truth of that old saying: Charity begins at home.

Definition: A motto is a short sentence or phrase that expresses a rule for sensible behaviour, especially a way of behaving in a particular situation.
Example: Our motto is 'Plan for the worst and hope for the best'.

Definition: An adage is something which people often say and which expresses a general truth about some aspect of life.
Example: ...the old adage, 'Every baby brings its own love'.

Definition: A proverb is a short sentence that people often quote, which gives advice or tells you something about life.
Example: An old Arab proverb says, 'The enemy of my enemy is my friend.'

Definition: An inexpressible feeling cannot be expressed in words because it is so strong.
Example: He felt a sudden inexpressible loneliness.

Definition: A hawk is a large bird with a short, hooked beak, sharp claws, and very good eyesight. Hawks catch and eat small birds and animals.
Example: Both hawks and doves have expanded their conditions for ending the war.

Definition: surly; irritable; perverse
Example: crabbed handwriting

Definition: A migrant is a person who moves from one place to another, especially in order to find work.
Example: The government divides asylum-seekers into economic migrants and genuine refugees.

Definition: A rambler is a person whose hobby is going on long walks in the countryside, often as part of an organized group.
Example: It might wear off, of course, but until it does, it's silly to leave all my gear lying around for some passing rambler to nick.

Definition: If something happens  bit by bit, it happens in stages.
Example: Bit by bit I began to understand what they were trying to do.

Definition: If you describe someone as unemotional, you mean that they do not show any feelings.
Example: British men are often seen as being reserved and unemotional.

Definition: Absolutism is a political system in which one ruler or leader has complete power and authority over a country.
Example: ...royal absolutism.

Definition: Something that is filthy is very dirty indeed.
Example: He never washed, and always wore a filthy old jacket.

Definition: A squalid place is dirty, untidy, and in bad condition.
Example: He followed her up a rickety staircase to a squalid bedsit.

Definition: made impure by the addition of a harmful or undesirable substance
Example: She could sense the contaminated spot where it touched her thigh.

Definition: If you waggle something, or if something waggles, it moves up and down or from side to side with short quick movements.
Example: He was waggling his toes in his socks.

Definition: Someone who is a joker likes making jokes or doing amusing things.
Example: He is, by nature, a joker, a witty man with a sense of fun.

Definition: A comedian is an entertainer whose job is to make people laugh, by telling jokes or funny stories.
Example: It was my ambition to be a stand-up comedian.

Definition: The Almighty is another name for God. You can also refer to Almighty God.
Example: Adam sought guidance from the Almighty.

Definition: A slogan is a short phrase that is easy to remember. Slogans are used in advertisements and by political parties and other organizations who want people to remember what they are saying or selling.
Example: They could campaign on the slogan 'We'll take less of your money'.

Definition: A walker is a person who walks, especially in the countryside for pleasure or in order to keep healthy.
Example: She eventually used a cane, then a walker, and finally was confined to the house.

Definition: If someone is impassive or their face is impassive, they are not showing any emotion.
Example: He searched Hill's impassive face for some indication that he understood.

Definition: Something that is grimy is very dirty.
Example: ...a grimy industrial city.

Definition: Something that is muddy contains mud or is covered in mud.
Example: ...a muddy track.

Definition: A place that is smoky has a lot of smoke in the air.
Example: His main problem was the extremely smoky atmosphere at work.

Definition: If you describe a person or place as seedy, you disapprove of them because they look dirty and untidy, or they have a bad reputation.
Example: Frank ran dodgy errands for a seedy local villain.

Definition: If you describe a place as sleazy, you dislike it because it looks dirty and badly cared for, and not respectable.
Example: ...sleazy bars.

Definition: If you describe someone's behaviour as sordid, you mean that it is immoral or dishonest.
Example: He sat with his head buried in his hands as his sordid double life was revealed.

Definition: A clown is a performer in a circus who wears funny clothes and bright make-up, and does silly things in order to make people laugh.
Example: Bruno clowned and won affection everywhere.

Definition: When something jingles or when you jingle it, it makes a gentle ringing noise, like small bells.
Example: Brian put his hands in his pockets and jingled some change.

Definition: If you are unmoved by something, you are not emotionally affected by it.
Example: Mr Bird remained unmoved by the corruption allegations.

Definition: If you describe someone as emotionless, you mean that they do not show any feelings or emotions.
Example: He stood emotionless as he heard the judge pass sentence.

Definition: Boggy land is very wet and muddy land.
Example: They will grow on any soil once established, apart from boggy permanently wet sites.

Definition: A swampy area of land is always very wet.
Example: As he watched, one jumped across what was clearly a swampy patch round a small spring.

Definition: Marshy land is always wet and muddy.
Example: ...the broad, marshy plain of the River Spey.

Definition: Something such as soil or land that is waterlogged is so wet that it cannot absorb any more water, so that a layer of water remains on its surface.
Example: The match is off because of a waterlogged pitch.

Definition: Something that is spongy is soft and can be pressed in, like a sponge.
Example: We liked the bike's spongy handgrip for keeping our hands away from cold metal.

Definition: Something that is porous has many small holes in it, which water and air can pass through.
Example: The local limestone is very porous.

Definition: Absorbent material soaks up liquid easily.
Example: The towels are highly absorbent.

Definition: If a substance is permeable, something such as water or gas can pass through it or soak into it.
Example: A number of products have been developed which are permeable to air and water.

Definition: that can be penetrated
Example: The gatehouse was built over a narrow way, penetrable by only one car at a time and regulated by an incongruous traffic light.
